Reviews.Title: “Our favorite in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Sharon F
Reviews.Content: Wailea Beach Marriott is simply the best value in Maui -- located in the heart of beautiful Wailea Beach, I watched whales playing in the ocean from my lanai. The staff is friendly & helpful, the sales team is top notch. Loved the many pools, good restaurants, and proximity to Wailea shopping village.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beachfront location”
Reviews.Author: Hennipenny
Reviews.Content: We go to Maui every year and stay in Kaanapali Beach area however, we decided we should try the Wailea side to see how we liked it. This hotel couldn't be more beautifully situated. We had an oceanfront room that overlooked the walking trails and surf. If I had a concern it is the size of this resort. We were in building 7 and from the lobby, it was probably a quarter mile to our room. Would suggest trying to get as close to the main pool as possible to try and avoid this unless you don't mind walking. The rooms were nice but not overly large/bath products were nice. There is a grille and bar open pool side during the day and for breakfast and dinner, Ma'la is open (same as the one in Lahaina). In summary, this is a lovely hotel and is right next to a shopping center with restaurants and shops and has great walking trails along the beach. Since we were only there one night we didn't do much except late lunch, breakfast and Starbuck's in the morning. Still was able to run up a $300 plus bill (not including room).

Reviews.Title: “15 year anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Tom A
Reviews.Content: Fitness Center was great. The best one I have seen one a Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: trish41_11
Reviews.Content: Located on the ocean with a nice view of smaller islands across the water. The landscaping is beautiful, especially the tree lined entrance.... and the resort's common area is nice. There is also a nice size infinity pool. Rooms are clean and cozy but nothing extordinary. The property is located near a nice shopping area and some great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok nothing special here!”
Reviews.Author: JRN1313
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights for our honeymoon. We were not that impressed with this property. It does have a great location but that's about it. When we checked in our room was not ready so we had to store our bags and wait hours until the room was ready. The lady at checkin was quite rude, we are Elitd Marriott members and we felt like she belittled us. The room was ok, all tile floors, low uncomfortable bed, no plugs anywhere, weird places for light switches, only good thing was great view from our balcony. Pools were small and very cold. One day I was at the pool and waited 45 minutes for a 15 dollar piÃ±a coloda!!! I went up to bar twice to ask for a waitress so I could order a drink. Finally they took my order then told me to come back in ten minutes to get the drinks and food! What horrible customer service, it cost 68 dollars for two piÃ±a colodas, fish sandwich and a greasy quesadilla. My recommendation is to get sandwiches at the General Store right next to the hotel at Wailea Shops. The food was good and a lot cheaper. You can also get snacks, alchohol, and just about anything you need at thd ABC store which is a less than 5 minute walk from the resort. From the Marriott you can walk to the Grand Wailea which is where we spent most of our time and had a great time at the luau. For a little more money stay at thd Grand Wailea, the property is absolutely gorgeous and stunning pools and outdoor area. By far one of our favorite hotels, with a gorgeous beach! Marriott had a small beach to the side of the hotel. Overall we were really disappointed with the horrible customer service at Marriott. Look at your bill closely they charged us 25 dollars a day for self parking when we didn't even rent a car!!! Stay at Grand Wailea of the Fairmont, much better choices!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing place to be”
Reviews.Author: gaume01
Reviews.Content: We stayed once again at the Marriott Wailea, This is a nice hotel in a great location. The ocean facing view rooms are great. For the rice, you get a good place to stay and extra funds to upgrade on meals, rent a cabana, or take a few snorkel trips. Self service parking is included in the resort fee. The parking structure is handy and no waiting for your car. I am not sure that this is a great place for kids, but for adults there is an adults only infinity pool. Food is great at lunchtime, but for dinner we went to the shopping area right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: BC-Westcoaster
Reviews.Content: Though we usually stay in Kaanapali, the places we wanted to stay were all booked so we decided to try this property in Wailea, and are so glad we did. The grounds are huge and beautiful, and though the hotel was built in the 1970s the rooms and inside of the hotel are completely modern. Rooms are a good size, and there is a decent-sized balcony. We were upgraded to a partial ocean-view room, which was nice for free but probably not worth paying extra for as it also overlooked the service entrance. The bed was soft, but not uncomfortable. Tile floors were nice. There was a large seating area in the room as well as a mini-fridge, which was a nice touch. The bathroom had a large counter around the sink, and the toilet and shower were separated from the sink area by a door, so more than one person could use the bathroom at a time. We didn't hear any noise from other guest rooms. The property has three separate pool areas, including an adults-only infinity pool facing the ocean which was amazing; I would stay here again just for this pool. There were always chairs available, and the staff do ensure that children are politely directed to one of the two other more appropriate pool areas. There is a full Starbucks on site, and a well-equipped fitness centre; I never had to wait for a machine. The Ma La Restaurant is expensive, but worth it - we had great meals there. There is also a poolside grill that serves more casual food during the day, and which was also very good. Location is excellent, less than a 5 minute walk to the Shops at Wailea, and a short drive to Kihei restaurants and shops. The value you get for the money you spend, especially compared to the hotels in Kaanapali, is exceptional. I would definitely stay here again, and am looking forward to doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Viewsâ€”Poor Luggage Service”
Reviews.Author: TX-BJ81
Reviews.Content: Relaxing location and superb ocean view. Our ocean front room on the third floor was no more than 100 feet from the water with a beautiful view of the water and nightly sunsets. The best part is we could sit on our lanai and watch whales swimming and breaching in the distance. The only negative with the room was the lack of a T-Mobile signal. To use our phone we had to sit on the lanai. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. The only exception was the bell captain and his team. We arrived at @ 6pm on a Saturday night and the hotel was hosting an event in their ballroom. I pulled up and tried to unload my luggage so they could deliver it to my room. This was acceptable to them IF I was using their valet service. I prefer to park the car myself so I was told I could not unload my luggage and would have to carry it from the garage. At departure time I scheduled luggage pickup and they arrived 15 minutes late after I called to see if they were coming.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: kferg9
Reviews.Content: We could not wait to escape the noise and busyness of Honolulu when we arrived here for the second leg of our vacation...we were here on points and declined the upgrade, which we would have been charged for...(I am always bothered when I read on this site that others were given their upgrade at N/C)...anyway, we were very unhappy with our room and its view, or lack there of, so returned to the desk to request the original upgrade...that room was no longer available,but they did manage to find us an ocean view room in Hale Seven..they provided help with our move and could not have made it easier...it was well worth the expense and I would highly recommend having a room you will want to relax in!! Our view was spectacular...the odor in the room was less than fresh and the tile floors were slippery...also, the light switches were in peculiar places...and I will agree with some here who have complained about the mattresses...I did not sleep well here...BUT...I did enjoy many other things...Starbucks is a great place to have a light breakfast and enjoy some free internet...we were there every morning...the Spa was enjoyable, tho pricey...but it was something we wanted to do...my only complaint is that the products they use contain parabens...(at least the ones they wanted me to purchase)...we enjoyed some good appetizers at the Poolside Bar...and we absolutely loved the Serenity Pool..we rented a Casabella for a day at 1/2 off ($50) becuase they told us there was a private dinner that evening and they needed to set up at 4 p.m. Our server, Anita, who provided excellent service, allowed us to saty until they really showed up to get it ready...it was more like 6 p.m. If you have the chance and are able to rent one of these, I would highly recommend it...yes, the pools are icy...but we still had a great day! The whales were especially active while we were there. We loved being close to the Grand Wailea, where we walked for other meals and drinks, something we did frequently. We enjoyed the Luau...the food was really good, and there was an open bar...we would probably not do it again, but it was our first and I am glad we did it...this resort is not the nicest I have ever stayed at, but for the money, I would say it is adequate with decent customer service...I do think Marriott should take notice and make some improvements however, if they want this property to be considered for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel overall - BEAUTIFUL place, not so great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: asmartscreenname
Reviews.Content: Pros: - I found this to be a very nice property, well kept. - The staff has been very nice and helpful. I though the service was great! - The room (a junior suite) was very nice, very roomy, with nice amenities and I slept like a baby. - Beautiful views of the sunset and the whales. Cons: - Very expensive. Good hotel but perhaps a bit overpriced. - As a consequence of the place being expensive the atmosphere is dire. It was mostly middle aged to older couples... a pretty snobbish kind of atmosphere. Most would dress up for the evening and parade around the hotel... not exactly a warm or fun kind of atmosphere, but if you're into just showing off your expensive clothes and jewelery, then this is the place for you! - Location is ok, but not all that great. You really need a car. When you count that and the cost of parking... it makes the place seem even more expensive. On the other hand, if you're a SCUBA diver like myself you are conveniently located to Kihei boat ramp. I don't know if I'd stay here again. Given an opportunity, I might look for a more quaint place, but it is beautiful and luxurious and some things are hard not to enjoy. :-) On the other hand, I would have no reason to say "don't stay here".

Reviews.Title: “The ocean view was breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: jbl4445
Reviews.Content: The best part about this resort was the view from our balcony. It was breathtaking. If your thinking about upgrading your room for an ocean view it is well worth it. Rooms - The room itself was nothing to brag about. Our room was clean enough upon arrival but during our stay, the maidstaff came very late in the day and did not clean up very well. Our floor was sticky the entire time and our bedspread was dirty. They do not provide enough towels either. The pools were nice but the staff was very picky at them and it took about 45 minutes to get anything you ordered from them including change. The hotel staff, including front desk and concerige service was not good. They were quite snotty and not very helpful. Exercise facility was quite good and large and had plenty of cardio equipment. I give this hotel 3 stars simply for its location and view. Both were absolutely fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Wailea Beach Marriott Resort and Spa Feb 2012”
Reviews.Author: my3gems
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled on member points and enjoyed our stay (first visit to Hawaii) with one major exception - the beds. The mattress was so soft that we did not sleep well and woke with achy hips and shoulders. After days full with swimming and hiking, it was extremely disappointing to not get a good night's sleep. We stayed on the fifth floor of Haleakala Hale with a distant view of the ocean. The hotel's open lobby/registration area was right below us, so it helped to keep the fan on to keep annoying sounds at bay. Preferring an ocean swim, I only spent one afternoon at the serenity pool. It lived up to its name and has a gorgeous view to the ocean. The other pools were busier with families. It was convenient to hit up the on-site Starbucks each morning and then take a walk on the Wailea Beach beachwalk - a bit of a 'super-highway' of early morning walkers and joggers. We were surprised to find you had to rent ($10 each) a chaise lounge and umbrella on the Wailea Beach. We loved the gentle waves on the beach and the temperature was perfect and the water clear. Whales were visible each day from the shore, as were a number of sea turtles. You need to get to the shore early (about 5:30 pm) in order to get a chaise to view the sunset (about 6:30 pm) which is spectacular - nice to see that so many people share the same delight in watching the sunset over the ocean. We rented a car at the airport and that came in handy for trips on the island (including the ride up Haleakala National Park). We used the car to visit a small, but very nice, famer's market where we picked up some fantastic native fruit. Parking was $25.00 per night. The $18.00 per person buffet was probably the best meal we had at the resort. The Shops at Wailea (3 minute walk) had a nice convenience store (liquor available) where you could purchase supplies for the in-room refrigerator. Loved Hawaii, the people and the beach...just wish we had a decent mattress for a good night's sleep! For all that was nice about the resort, we won't consider going back until the hotel upgrades those mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: DSMtravel
Reviews.Content: The best features of this hotel are the pools. The infinity pool is especially cool. Unfortunately our room balcony overlooked the kids pool and water slide. It was very noisy during the day and the sun was in our eyes in the morning so we couldn't breakfast on the porch. Try to avoid the rooms by the kids pool unless you have kids you want to watch. The rooms were large and comfortable. The services were typical of a resort facility. Restaurants are expensive on site but the hotel is very close to a mall with shops and services. The hotel is very spread out and hard to navigate. The beach is not on the property, but very close and easy to walk to. The bedding is high quality Marriott issue.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy service and no follow-up”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is very lousy in comparison to other Marriott resorts. First off, as a Marriott Elite member you are usually granted free breakfast or free lunch or something of value at no charge to compensate for the lack of a concierge lounge. They give you nothing at this resort except a discount at the over-inflated restaurant at the resort. The service is also very lousy and slow. The front desk couldn't care less. I filed a complaint about the above and no one followed up with me at all, after waiting a good 15 minutes to actually speak with someone. After informing the front desk that this was not acceptable they said an operations manager would call the next day. No one bothered to call or even resolve the issue, which was that they didn't deliver a water we ordered upon check-in. Another woman next to me was also complaining about rude service next to me and got no resolution whatsoever either. The facilities are substandard in comparison with every other directly adjacent hotel. Overall, a 2/10 and I'm being generous given the outrageous cost.

Reviews.Title: “goood luau”
Reviews.Author: MauiRegular
Reviews.Content: Probably the best luau on the South side. food decent, show very good. Best part is that they had 3 bartenders working. (Some of the other luaus limit your free drinks by only having one or two bartenders.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: MAamyp
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great stay in Hawaii. We visited Wakiki, the Big Island, Wailea and Kaanapali. We loved the views and tranquility in Wailea the best (and we were with kids). We stayed on points so I'm not sure how it compares to the nearby hotels but we had a great view. The first day we relaxed by the pool with our "welcome mai tai's" that came with the resort package. These were the best mai tai's we had that week. While sipping our mai tai's in the ocean front pool we just were amazed at the whales jumping right in front of the resort. Yes, there wasn't a beach directly in front of the hotel but we walked 5 mins to the beach to the right where they had some great snorkeling by the rocks - many fish. We saw a turtle swimming by some of the other rocks. The elite desk was nice and helpful and check-in was quick. We also received a late check-out of 2 pm. This resort was adjacent to the Wailea mall with shops and restaurants and ice cream for the kids. We didn't love the tile floors (felt a little weird with wet feet - maybe the cleaning chemicals). We did love the screen door on the lanai so we could sleep with the door open listening to the waves. There was also a coin operated washer/dryer at the bottom of our building which was handy. The refrigerator was pretty big for storing water and snacks. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: GPR21
Reviews.Content: Stayed third week of Feb 2012 for 4 nights as a female traveling alone .I had booked and paid for an Oceanfront room . Upon arrival given a room directly under the bar by a sullen check in agent named Brandi who proceeded to tell me that my rate of 400 dollars per night was heavily discounted. So I guess that is why she gave me one of the noisiest rooms in the hotel directly under the bar. The room was tired and sterile and I thought unsafe for a single woman because of its location. The serenity pool was the only saving grace for this property. The food was not good throughout the property and they served the white wine on tap ( this was a first and not a good one for me ! ) at the bar. Staff attitudes varied from terrible to very pleasant. Having stayed at most of the properties in Wailea over the past 5 years I would suggest there are much better choices to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: PedroJames
Reviews.Content: Great Resort, Did not rent a car so we used cabs to and from airport and out to dinner most nights. Easy to walk to the shops at Wailea and grab a sandwich for lunch or a nice dinner. Upon check in, they tried to upgrade for fee then waived the fee and gave us an amazing room with a balcony over the pool in the main building. Wonderful soft bed, only problem is we were directly underneath a hotel restaurant and could hear chairs sliding every morning. Infinity Pool was great but seemed to have more of a crowd than the main pool. Spa was amazing for an expensive couple massage. Luau was OK, would not go again and I had priority seating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort for Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lvshack
Reviews.Content: My 15-year-old son, 12-year-old daughter, husband and me spent two nights at the Marriott Resort at Wailea Beach in mid February. We used our Marriott Rewards points and were impressed with the location, room and especially the hospitality of the employees at this resort. We had a room with two queen beds that had an ocean view. The room was clean, large, and had it's own balcony which we used for dining. I was most impressed with the attention the staff gives guests. Each time we ordered room service, we received a phone call about 20 minutes later asking if everything was in order. I've NEVER had a hotel do this, and quite frankly I've become accustom to something being wrong with room service food. Not only was the room service perfect, but if you ordered dinner you received 25% off coupons for breakfast, making it more affordable. They also had "specials" for each night of room service, which was also appreciated. The food was good, the portions were excellent. The pools at this resort are salt water type, not chlorine, which I also enjoyed. We reserved two casabellas at the pool ahead of time for only $25 each, which is a steal. The resort was not over crowded while we were there, but I could see the weekend quickly filling seats at the pool. For beach access, you'll need to travel a short walk down the path (5 minutes) toward the Grand Wailea resort. The beach was nice, clean, and had ample chairs. There are also chairs located near the grass overlooking the ocean if you prefer to soak in the sun and views. Just a short walk away is a mall with several eating options, in case you crave something other than the hotel dining. There is also a paved path near the ocean that runs next to three of the hotels for all the runners out there. Our family stayed 2 nights at this resort, and 4 nights at the Grand Wailea next door. I will say that the Grand has more of a resort feel to it, and the kids enjoyed the pools more at the there. They have water slides and a lazy river. However, the price difference of the room and food make the Marriott Wailea Beach a better choice if you are looking for saving money.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad... but spend a little more and stay at the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: yello815
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott one night before transferring to the Grand Wailea. While the Marriott was not bad, it truly paled in comparison to its neighbors up the road. The room smelled odd (I assume because of the soap used to clean the tile floors) and the towels were old and dingy. The grounds were peaceful but there was not much to do in the resort. The area was calm but a little on the dark side but as soon as you walked up the beach walk, it was like the cloud lifted when you reached the bright and grandiose Grand Wailea. We ordered room service which was ridiculously priced (as is expected of resort food). All in all, it was not a bad hotel as the room was spacious and bed very comfortable but when it comes to value for the dollar, spend a little more and stay at the Grand Wailea as the pool and beach at that property puts Marriott's to shame.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation at its best”
Reviews.Author: cmurderer
Reviews.Content: This wasnâ€™t a bad hotel at all. We got upgraded for free since it was our 5th wedding anniversary and the room was nice enough. We stayed the â€œHale 7â€� and the hotel crew was nice enough to take us via golf cart directly to our door on the first day. The room was of an adequate size (frankly, it was more than I expected) and was very clean. The staff working in the hotel was more than friendly and there was never an â€œAlohaâ€� missed when you passed a staff member in the hallways. We had the breakfast package included and boy was it worth it. We made use of this a couple of days and the selection of food during the breakfast hour was dizzying. Filled our stomachs nicely there. Their lunch selection however was quite overpriced for what they were offering â€“ I would suggest you consider â€œCheeseburger Islandâ€� at the local mall right outside the hotel for lunches. Dinners were priced at an acceptable level but as with lunch, it was much cheaper to get something outside the hotel and with much more food on your plate. The pool area looked nice enough but we didnâ€™t use it. Weâ€™re on the beach â€“ why would we go into the pool. There were 2 major beaches to choose from and neither disappointed. Big suggestion though, the â€œPool Activitiesâ€� desk offer a Tommy Bahama set consisting of 2 chairs and an umbrella. You pay USD $25 and you get it for a full 24 hours. Definitely worth the money if you plan on spending a lot of time on the beach. There is a car rental desk on site but I would suggest that you pre-book your car online as the car rental desk charge a ridiculous amount for same day bookings. Overall, a solid 3.5/5 for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly accommodating for all!”
Reviews.Author: Roadtripfamly
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! At check in we were upgraded to an ocean view room which also overlooked the luau. Room was updated and very clean. The pool layout here is great....there are like 5 pools spread among the property. Kid pool with lots of fun slides, etc. and a snack shack located right there. Adult pool for those who so desire and then another area with two more pools, bar and food right there. There is no beach access, but they do have several chairs on grassy knolls overlooking the beach- it's perfect. And beach access is super close by...even if you have kids and gear to carry...you'll be happy to not gave to carry all your gear to far. Room service and restaurant food was great and service was great everywhere as well. Weve stayed at the four seasons before and thought about the Grand Wailea, but are so happy we stayed here. Save your money and stay here-you'll be happy! Another thing, it never seemed crowded anywhere on the resort! Very relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “A true escape to paradise”
Reviews.Author: Pat A
Reviews.Content: This resort is spread out and as such you are never a "part of the crowd". Wailea is certainly less congested than Kaanapali and the serenity and overall amenities at the Marriott gave us more a feeling of being on a island than being at a hotel. The food and the staff complimented the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you can ask for in a Marriott Property”
Reviews.Author: dukeklaus
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times without a problem. Beautiful check in lobby which is so important for 1st time trips to Hawaii. If your traveling with small children the children's pool here is by far the best in Maui. Even if its packed you dont feel too crowded plus I loved that I could see my kids from any of the lounge chairs. 2 slides. a sand beach and fun splash pad area. They also have an adult pool where one of you can run off to have a mai tai and enjoy looking out at the infinity pool and watch whales jump in the air. I came in the afternoon and gasped ..wow when one whale jumped.. and no one else seemed to care which told me they had been jumping all morning and had lost its splender:) When you check in your're offered the resort package which gives you free self park, normally 25, discounts at the restaurants and activities and more for 25usd a day. If your parking your car it really a no brainer. Its 25 to self park and 30 for valet. You can also add 2 Mai Tais for coupons for 10 dollars. If your going to have a Mai Tai get them because they are 15.00 a piece at the bar. Plus we think we are experts on Mai Tai's and they are good here. If your on your honeymoon or just want to get away from the kids this property is excellent for you too because they have made areas for adults only and they are beautiful! The areas they have set aside for adults reminded me of beautiful Tahiti. Very 1st class. The staff was wonderful. We dragged our feet checking out and were behind by an hour ..and when the phone rang .. I knew they were calling to tell me to hurry up .. I knew the hotel was at capacity that evening ... a very kind lady on the other end with not a hint of passive aggressivness.. asked if we needed help with anything.. Thank you:) There is plenty of shopping in the resort but also right across the street is the beautiful Wailea mall where they have hula shows and plenty of dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Diana94
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for our last vacation before our baby is born. We were looking for a relaxing location and a really nice hotel. And the Marriott in Wailea did not disappoint! Room - our room was classified as OceanView which was perfect for us. We had a gorgeous view of the ocean and West Maui from our hotel balcony. Plus the room was extremely clean and had plenty of room for the two of us. Grounds - the hotel grounds were gorgeous. Although the Marriott does not have a beach directly in front of it you can easily walk down the beach path in either direction and within 5 minutes be at the beach. The benefit of not having a beach is that the hotel is set extremely close to the water (especially the beach path). Plus the grounds are well kept and very clean. Pools - the Marriott has 3 pools. We spent the majority of our time at the adults only Infinity Pool. It was quiet and had an amazing view of the ocean. When you are at the pool you feel like you are right at the edge of the ocean. There is a clear view directly to the water. My husband and I would definitely visit this hotel again and would highly recommend it to family and friends. And I would stay there again with children!

Reviews.Title: “So near, yet so far.....”
Reviews.Author: LillyAnn7
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property, but it fell short in some key ways. They have an utterly gorgeous location, and an infinity pool that is just drop-dead perfect! But it is SO lovely that many guests want to be at this adults-only pool (aka the "serenity" pool). As a result, guests trek out to the pool at 6 AM - I am NOT kidding - to place their towels on lounge chairs to "reserve" a space to hang out at the pool when they are ready. This means that if YOU want to hang out at the pool, you too have to play this game. The hotel has a 30-minute rule (lounge chairs will be liberated if they are not occupied for 30 minutes) that they do NOT enforce. Competing for lounge chairs is just not my idea of a relaxing vacation, so I won't return. But then, perhaps this style of leisure will help prepare folks to go back to work and be more effectively competitive:-)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel. Incredible ocean view”
Reviews.Author: python8140
Reviews.Content: we spent 6 nights at this hotel and loved every minute of it. The view from the pool out over the ocean is just amazing. We relaxed all day and watched whales swim on by with their offspring. It was incredible. The open atrium is just wonderful and the location was excellent. Right next to some nice restaurants and open shopping. The concierge provided excellent advice and discounts to some of the islands amenities like Helicopter rides and zip-lining. The room was ok as we faced the back, so that was a bit of a bummer. We tried to upgrade, but it was sold out. The restaurants were ok. Starbucks on the premises helps and was a welcome retreat during the day. The path outside the hotel was awesome to exercise on. It went beach side along all the hotels on this strip of Maui. We were not overly impressed with the Luau, although how can you go to Hawaii and not do one. Great spot. I don't think I will ever forget the views as the whales swam on past. Amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Marriot”
Reviews.Author: LaurieR58
Reviews.Content: Great service all around. The beds were very comfy & in minutes the pillows were replaced to our liking. Yes the property is older but well maintained. The view from the pool is wonderful & the hotel is on the walking, running path along the ocean.There are great beaches on either side of the Marriot. Terry is an amazing server @ the infinity pool & takes care of guests like royalty- kudos to her.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing”
Reviews.Author: jbb777
Reviews.Content: Nice place to just relax...no car...but you can get one on the grounds. I would stay here again. Shopping close by and extremely pleasant. We had a nice room close to the water and went to sleep by the sound of waves. Make sure you rent a cabanna at the pool... It's a hundred bucks, but worth it. Very nice...More an older crowd, might just be Maui in general. Very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JudgeTravel
Reviews.Content: First, this is my second time in Maui with my husband. The first time we stayed at the Ritz but found it was a far out of the way when we stayed during our first visit. We decided to stay in the Wailea area because we found it the most beautiful of all in Maui. I was a little iffy about this Marriott hotel because of the reviews I read before, but I was pleasantly surprised. First of all, it's Maui and it's paradise. The check-in was quick and efficient (they had a special line for Marriott Elite members. The room: We got a room with an ocean view and it was absolutely amazing. I read some reviews with complaints about the tile floors -- it's off a beach and there we certainly brought in our share of sand--the only way to get the floors clean is to have the tile! The room has a little refrigerator and we used it to store water, soda and snacks we bought from Wal-mart. There is internet, but only available via a cable and for a $ (If I recall correctly) and there is no wi-fi. The resort: The resort is beautiful--there are hammocks in random places where you can settle and watch the sunset or close your eyes and listen to the water. The resort provides you with beach towels you can use and trade at your leisure. We actually went to two of the pools (1 was the adult-only, salt water endless view pool) and they were both nice. Also if you go on the path to the right there is a public beach that is wonderful for snorkeling. We saw many fish, octupus, turtles and more! There is a restaurant on the grounds which is excellent--get the kobe beef burger--absolutely the best burger we have ever had!! The resort is within walking distance to the shops of wailea where you can do some shopping eat at other restaurants or grab some ice creams or even food. Also, we did use the washers and dryers and they worked great, did the job and were quick! I will definitely stay here again when I come back to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 'unstuffy' well maintained resort”
Reviews.Author: DillyScarlet
Reviews.Content: Full Disclosure: Platinum member of Marriott and paid with points. Received an upgrade on top of my 'paid-for' upgrade to an ocean-front that I would consider ocean-view. Be aware that ocean-view may be less than what it seems. Other then that this was a terrific place to spend 6 days, plus rooms are for sleeping. They have three pools and though we are an adult couple didn't spend any time at the adult only Infinity one - other 2 were just outside our room and were less crowded, plus closer to the very good poolside bar/restaurant. Marriott location is wonderful - our room was 15 STEPS from the ocean, though no beach, just some rocks with crashing waves and truly outstanding views. Two excellent beaches were a 3 or 5 minute walk and they were beautiful, great wave action on one side, calmer on the other. Marriott didn't have the beach side facilities it's neighbors did but you could also waslk down to the Grand Wailea and use any of the options there: snorkel, canoe, kayak, surf. A 4-5 minute walk. So you could have relatively quieter, closer to the ocean relaxation at the Marriott yet be minutes from great beaches and ocean options. We wnet whale watching one day and had some terrific experiences, from mothers and calves to a 'competitive pod' of males that we folloed for 30 minutes. Hotel concierge arranged with Pacific Whalr]e Foundation - excellent. Yet, next day we could see what seemed like dozens of whales about 200 yarde from beachside/poolside at the hotel! Hotel has a typical Starbucks and a couple restaurants and was mostly quiet and peaceful - yet if you wanted to within a 5 minute walk are the Wailea shops - shops from Tiffany, Gucci Ruth Crist, and some nice galleries, to more affordable stores, plus an ABC store and a 'General Store' where you can stock up on basics like suntan lotions, clothes, snacks and drinks and sandwiches if you want to save a few bucks. Rooms all have refrigerators and coffee makers.

Reviews.Title: “Icy cold swim pools here....”
Reviews.Author: Bill G
Reviews.Content: Nice clean on-the-beach hotel. Predictable. Beautiful grounds, good food, accommodating staff, ok rooms, etc. BUT!.........all three pools are not heated! Our group of four adults had to spend the days of our week stay at a nearby public beach where the Pacific Ocean was our pool of choice as it was much warmer than Marriott's icy swim pools. This blue group won't ever be coming back here. A few bucks extra gets you in next door to a nicer place and heated pools in paradise. What else would one expect, anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Nice destination resort”
Reviews.Author: jtooley
Reviews.Content: This is our first stay at one of the Wailea resorts. We have stayed at other places in Hawaii. The good - nice location. Beaches are nearby and first class. We rented chairs and boards, and walked to the sand. Great beach - great sunset views. The views everyday are stunning - food. First class and very good. Of course you pay for it too - services. Top notch. Everything is available The bad - the pools. Everyone reserves chairs with towels at 6:30am, so you can't get a seat by any of the pools. - its has a corporate conference feeling since they do have a conference center at the resort. - Internet service. You have to pay of it. Its a crime that you have to pay $14/day Our preference is stay at someplace with less services since we find we don't use all of them, but end up getting charged for it.

Reviews.Title: “Open air...”
Reviews.Author: DuffyLeB
Reviews.Content: The whole place seems like it goes on forever because it's so open air. That's a good thing. It's elegant and casual at the same time. And yes, again I recommend using the valet parking. You really need it this time. If you valet can't help you with something he'll find someone or something that can. I went to a meeting there. Afterward they suggested a restaurant at the Shops at Wailea. They had their little golf cart give me a ride both ways even though I wasn't even staying there. Class...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveler65
Reviews.Content: Nice quality room, good views and good service. Good location "Beach" is a little inaccurate,, since the nearest beaches are at the adjacent resort properties..

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: imAngelfish
Reviews.Content: We were in Maui for 9 days. We snorkeled, whale watched, drove up to see the sun rise over the volcanic crater, went to Hana and flew back by helicopter, and done a hundred things you have never dreamed of. The hotel was great. We had a large, ocean front room and we could see whales breeching and turtles swimming from our balcony. Don't miss Mama's Fish House. We went for my birthday and go a free ice cream sundae. Believe me, nothing else was free. This restaurant is VERY expensive, but the food is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Property, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: FPepoon
Reviews.Content: This property is NOT directly on the beach, it is on cliffs overlooking the ocean. It is, however, on the Wailea Beachwalk, and there are several beaches in walking distance. We were able to get a great rate on very short notice for an ocean-view room, and indeed the gorgeous view from the room was of Ulua Beach. WIth a kiddie water park, there are few children at the other pools, and there is a separate, astonishing infinity-edge adult pool in the center of the resort. So lovely! Rooms are spacious and nicely appointed, although I was not a fan of the modern decor. The other bonus is the nearby Shops at Wailea, which give you some options other than the one restaurant, pool bar, and Starbucks on the property. Our biggest complaint was the mattress, which was way too soft and oddly low to the ground. This was our first time in Wailea, we usually stay at the Westin in Ka'anapali. This resort is comparable in terms of price and amenities. Overall, we prefer Ka'anapali over Wailea, it is less expensive and has many more choices in terms of restaurants and activities.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Close to Ulua Beach”
Reviews.Author: Brandon G
Reviews.Content: If you're a beach goer, stay closer to Ulua beach. It's a huge property and the walk to the beach takes too long. After requesting a room with a king bed they put us right over the loading dock with no ocean view. Super annoying to listen to the trucks pulling in and out, the workers talking loud, etc.. The rooms are actually really nice and Ulua Beach is amazing. I surfed every day and was out early, but my wife woke to sounds of trucks and locals arguing.

Reviews.Title: “ROOMIEST RESORT on Wailea Beach by far”
Reviews.Author: italygoodness
Reviews.Content: Beat out the Four Seasons & Fairmont, forget the Grand Wailea...all of these places are crammed into small lots for their size. Pools are central focus, with lots of kids & noise. The Four Seasons even has a huge fountain as the main central core between the rooms & the ocean, so you cannot even hear the waves at all - just the loud fountain. So strange! Marriott has amazing grounds, 5 pools - including the winning SERENITY (vanishing) POOL FOR ADULTS and a fabulous kids' pool w/slides & super fun stuff & lots of space. What a difference this makes to relax! Service poolside (get a casabella, such a nice way to enjoy the pool) is awesome - Anita is fast & lovely if she's working. They upgraded us to a Jr. Suite - #302 - it had limited view of ocean but was not only enormous but beautiful & comfortable. Bed was NOT great - slouchy mattress - but that was our only complaint...and there were no robes (huh?), which may have just been an oversight for such a fine place otherwise. Common areas are stunningly simple but elegant & modern. We will go back there before any other Maui property.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest dissappointment at a Marriott property”
Reviews.Author: Keith J
Reviews.Content: The site is stunningly beautiful and staff friendly and helpful. That said, I would never recommend this facility to anyone. 1. Air conditioning vent fell off of the wall on onto the bed at about 2:00AM. Needless to say, this was a bit of a surprise. 2. Toilet was not securely fastened to the floor giving a new meaning to au de toilette. 3. Booked a room with one king size bed and got 2 double beds. Minor yes, but at these prices I want what I reserved. Especially booking the room more than 10 months in advance. 4. Pools were cold. This was uniform feedback from anyone who entered - once. Even the adults only pool was FRIDGID. 5. Room had a view - "of the operations area of the building" - the dumpsters, loading dock, ect. As I mentioned in my title, this ranks with one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. When most of this feedback was provided to a manager, the feedback was cheerfully taken and apology offered, but I fully expected that once my issues were confirmed (given the unbelievable nature) I fully expected a more satisfying interaction with the General Manager and more of a peace offering than the gift basket that was left in the room. It just gave the impression that the management was way too busy to worry about one dissatisfied customer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Cathylynn06
Reviews.Content: There is not a more picture-perfect location in South Maui. Right on the water, away from the busyness of Wailea Beach, this is truly a gorgeous location. There is no sandy beach, just lava rocks, which is what makes it all the more perfect. You feel like you are truly in Hawaii, not just another beach resort. It's a beautiful resort, the pools are wonderful with fantastic views, everything is very clean. The service we found to be exceptional; the true "aloha" spirit came through! We loved talked with the bellmen, who are all local Hawaiians and full of information about the islands. The concierge was very helpful in planning our drive to Hana. The front desk was so helpful and considerate when we checked in after traveling 18 hours! We were upgraded even though we used our Marriott Rewards points. My 2 teenage sons loved the resort as well. Restaurants are all great. We highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “been twice and wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Stephdb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now. And one of the stays was for my wedding and honeymoon. It is absolutely perfect! The rooms are spacious, clean and beautiful; the staff is friendly and very professional. The views and location are great, and they have their own Luau show. It's worth going to, it tells the story of the Hawaiian people through dance and song, the food is good and the fire guy is crazy :) Its good fun, especially for a group. The hotel is easy to find and not a long drive from the airport. It is a great location for exploring Maui, nothing felt like too far of a drive. Since the little, charming mall is next door, you can walk over for some fun shopping, or for Breakfast, lunch or dinner. Longhi's has the BEST breakfast, once we found it we didn't go anywhere else. The Tommy Bahama Cafe is one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at, it's a must go, especially for the loki loki tuna poki. mhhhhh still dreaming about it. Best part you can enjoy drinks and stroll back over to your room afterwards, no driving ;) The 'scheduling staff' can help you book great activities. The "ultra lite" experience from the Hana airport was one of our favorite things. Also the HANG GLIDING off of Volcano Haleakala was so cool. Heads upp: you have to get up early to make it to the "flight destination" as they do their flight eary morning before the weather rolls in. I think we got up at 5 am to make the drive up the volcano. But soooo worth it :) The hands down BEST ACTIVITY that we did in Maui was the stargazing from Haleakala. I did this with my husband and my sister. You drive up Haleakala about 2 hours to the top from hotel. Schedule to be there just before sunset, BRING YOUR CAMERA AND DRESS WARM. You will not believe the colors you will see in that sunset, donâ€™t know if itâ€™s the altitude that makes the colors so intense but it was breathtaking. The guy who you book with Tom (I think was his name) he brings big comfy jackets and he brings dinner, pasta salad and sandwiches, they were really delicious. We ate our dinner sitting on our car watching the sunset. Then when the night fell the stargazing began, I canâ€™t even explain all of the awesome things we saw, we saw 2 planets, star clusters, supernovas etc. Tom explains everything to you, he gave us so much information and he is very nice. There are restrooms up there and they are open that late. The drive back down is interesting it is pitch black up there and obviously it was very late, but it was worth it. Lahaina is a cute fishing village which is fun to visit and grab some lunch out there. We did the submarine tour from there which I don't think is worth it at all. You take a boat out to a submarine board the sub and go down for maybe 1 hour. Maybe I am spoiled from living in the Bahama waters but the sealife and corals that we saw were not worth the money or time spend for this activity. A fun water activity is to go on a snorkel tour of molokini (a small crescent shaped island which is a partially submerged volcanic crater) there was more to see there than on the submarine, be sure to book the tour that also stops at turtle town. Turtle Town is where sea turtles tend to gather, when we went there must have been about 12-15 in the water and they were huge. We swam with them although you are not allowed to touch them. The water wasn't to deep so this is a good activity for everyone. Road to Hana is a must do, leave a lot of time for the stops along the way because they are amazing, and don't stop at Hana keep driving until you get to the Seven Sacred Pools. It's quite a sight. Pack a lunch unless you're adventurous and feel like trying some of the roadside food out there, its not bad but its also not great ;) We also did an ATV tour on Haleakala which was just okay. Not really worth it. Hope this helps. Enjoy Maui :)

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: cobeachluv
Reviews.Content: We stayed for ten days at the Marriot Wailea Beach last June and it was the best vacation we have ever had. We stayed in a bautiful oceanfront room overlooking the Infinity pool which overlooks the ocean. Amazing! We snorkeled right in front of the hotel and saw beautiful sea turtles and many different species of fish every day. From the oceanfront pool, we could sit and see the sea turtles in the ocean! Breathtaking! There is also a lovely approximately two-three mile ocean front path that stretches in front of the hotel and is a lovely walk or run every morning. They have a nice (basic) fitness center as well. The staff was fantastic and very friendly. Our room was cleaned well every day and very comfortable. We had a mini fridge in the room for cold drinks and snacks during the day which was nice. Our eleven year old daughter loved the hotel as well. They have a great childrens pool with something fun for all kids. They have water slides and a tube slide and a great snack bar for kids. You can rent snorkel gear and boogie boards...whatever you need. The Location in Wailea is great. So beautiful and also close to the "Shops at Wailea" mall, a 5 minute or less walk. There are restaurants and a ABC convenience store for all the little things. Wailea is a very quiet and upscale spot on south Maui away from the craziness so very relaxing. We rented a care so that we could see the Island and every afternoon we went to different places. We love Wailea and would definitely stay here again. Thank you to the lovely staff at the Wailea Beach Marriot!

Reviews.Title: “An Ideal Waterfront Resort in Maui”
Reviews.Author: ycart0616
Reviews.Content: This Marriott Resort locates at waterfront in the quiet side of Maui. During our stay in December, it was windy and sometimes drizzly in other parts of Maui. But it was nice and sunshine in Wailea. The resort is within walking distance to The Shops at Wailea. The infinity pool is adult only and really nice and extremely beautiful during sunset time. We liked the on site restaurant Mala and the open lobby area. The luau has a small performance crew but very engaging with the audience. There is a nice trail along the coast that could lead you to the beach nearby. The only complain would be that it charges $25 for daily parking. You can spend $30 per day instead as activity fee to cover the parking and get some discount on other activities within the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and outstanding poolside service”
Reviews.Author: Daytrippers99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in a central area of Wailea within walking distance to The Shops at Wailea (which has 4 or 5) places to dine. We enjoyed being able to have some wine with dinner without the worry of driving back to the hotel. (Longhi's had great breakfasts and friendly service but just ok dinners). Everything in Wailea is expensive and we were usually slightly disappointed with the quality of the food in relation to the prices. In addition to Longhi's, we ate ate at Mala (in the hotel), and "Cheeseburger"... Nothing bad, but nothing memorable. The resort had great service: staff everywhere was friendly and helpful, but we have to single out Terry who provided exceptional service at the Serenity Pool. We enjoyed going to the pool for a couple of drinks most afternoons and Terry provided plenty of fun and entertainment. She took the time to get to know a bit about each of her guests and made everyone feel welcome. The resort is oceanfront, but there is no beach directly in front of the resort. We fealt that was a plus as we still enjoyed the view and sounds of the ocean without the noise from the beach activies. The beach is within a close walk and we enjoyed snorkeling several times at the beach directly north of the resort. The room was spacious and had a mini fridge to store drinks and all rooms seemed to have patios or balconies to enjoy the great outdoors. You can here some activity from other rooms (a toilet flushing, or someone moving a chair across the floor) but we seemed to be in a section where everyone was quiet after 8 or 9:00 and we enjoyed a great sleep every night on the comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your Segway and try the Mandara Spa!”
Reviews.Author: Masato I
Reviews.Content: The property is quite modern, well kept and pretty expansive (I think they claimed 22 acres). The catalyst for the trip was an awesome TravelZoo (like groupon) promotion for the Mandara Spa. I was able to get a room here on 3-weeks notice using AAdvantage miles (53,800 miles for 2 nights off peak in the most budget room). That deal didn't require the resort fee ($30/day), but the rental car needed to be parked and they milked me for $25/day for self parking (add another $30/day for someone to park it for you). This kind of irked me since there is plenty of space and the parking lot has small spaces and was not the most pristine. The check-in was fast and we did get an early check in (at about 1:00pm vice the 4:00pm check in). Service from the bell and reception were great, no delays, and courteous. The property is pretty expansive though and there are a lot of small hills and stairs if your mobility is less than perfect... hence, bring your segway... Rooms were nice and clean, but the view and amenities are lacking for the cheaper rooms. Our room had a mini fridge that wasn't stocked (I prefer it unstocked so I can put stuff in there). There were no bathrobes which was a bummer, but the TV was nice and modern and the beds were clean and comfy. There are about 10 buildings on the property, most of them 2-3 stories, with one or two 8-story buildings. The property butts-up to the beach, and they've done a nice job of manicuring the walk ways and strewing some hammocks and beach chairs right by the water. The beach adjacent to the property is mostly rocky, so you'll need to stroll to the North or South about 300 meters to get to a sandy beach. You can rent kayaks, snorkel gear and such at one of the pool concierges and the rates are reasonable. If you have a car though, I'd recommend checking out the gear from one of the many aquatic shops out in Kihei and travel the island to some of the better snorkel/dive/kayak spots. If you want to keep it low-stress though, it's reasonable and you can bill it to your parents' room, haha. There are more pools than I could count (I think 5), one of which is an adults-only infinity pool that was just gorgeous. You can rent one of the "islands" or cabanas that they seem quite proud of and adorning most of the marketing materials... The dinner at the cabana looks awesome, but I heard it was like $400, so I will not be reviewing that.... The drink-girls at the pools are friendly and efficient. Stick with the beers though since they are $5.50 and the cocktails are north of $12. Besides a side of fries at the pool and a coffee cake at starbucks, I didn't eat much at the hotel since I didn't hear great things about MaLa. But the hotel is within walking distance of Shops at Wailea that has some familiar names (i.e. Ruth's and Tommy Bahama's). If you've got a ride, I would recommend heading into Kihei though for some more reasonable prices and local grinds. If you're into good sushi, check out Koiso by Chef Kudo in Kihei, that was easily the best meal on this trip. Even as a Marriott Rewards Member, all I got were some coupons and they wanted $15 for hard-line internet in the rooms... Since I think internet these days is no-more a luxury than tap water and extra towels, I can't give any $200+/night hotel 5 stars that doesn't have free internet. If you have status, I think it's free. Overall, if you like the resort feeling without splurging for some of the pricier neighbor hotels, I recommend this place. Without a rental car, it's got everything you need on site or within walking distance, if you've got a car, it's a good home base, but consider Lahaina as well. If you want to get pampered, the Mandara spa here was exceptional-- very professional and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation club has ruined the Marrotts in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Dec7William
Reviews.Content: They charge you as if it is a 5 star Hotel. You find out that the grounds are 5 star but the rooms and service are "Fairfield Inn" at Marriott 5 star prices. Tile floors, bed on the floor and an absolutely awful restaurant. You find out that the Marriott does not run the property, it's the vacation club. They will tell you pretty quick that they do not answer to Marriott, they have their own board, I'm sure they are all accountants trying to make a quick buck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: ellen0206
Reviews.Content: Overall, a nice resort. Love the open lobby area (great view) ... high marks for Mala (restaurant on site) ... very spacious room & balcony with great views ... nice adult pool ... great parking situation (especially compared to properties I'd stayed at in Lahaina/Kaanapali area). Property is adjacent to the Shops at Wailea, which is a nice bonus (though it has mostly "typical" mall stores). Good restaurants nearby though options are limited. Concierge staff was very helpful in arranging outings around the island.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kVinay
Reviews.Content: This place is just awesome and so beautiful.Feel like visiting Maui again and again. Service was top class. The restaurants were great. Breakfast could have been much better but no complaints. View from marriott is spectacular. The sea shore/beach is right behind the hotel.Room were neat, tidy and well kept.The only thing painful was a 30$ daily resort fee (which I guess is there atleast @ every marriott resort) and 25$ daily parking fees.There is a mall right next to Marriott . You have good restaurants and also a food store where you can get good cheap food and liquor for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but very BIG”
Reviews.Author: vlust
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it looked online to be very nice and spacious, but I did not realize this property was so large, maybe I should have read more of the details. Fact is this property is 22 acres!! We were in Hale 6, very confusing and easy to get lost. You will spend the first two days just learning your way around. Although the size is big the property is nice, clean, and has everything one needs on an Hawaii vacation. The room was large, we had a standard room with oceanview, but I did not like the soft cushy bed that was so low to the ground it made feel like I was a child. The maid serivces don't wait around either, they are on top of things, so if you want to sleep in make sure to use your do not disturb sign. I really disliked the fact that my showever curtain had mildew on it. I figured if I asked for it to be changed or washed I take another huge risk. So I dealt. I was impressed that the maid service was able to get my hair off the tile floor daily. Oh yea... tile floor and they do not provide slippers, thank goodness I brought my own. I do like that they have a self serivce washing room. That turned out to be a +++! Overall would I stay here again, probably not! Its to many other nice place in Wailea I would like to stay at too

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: chicago072
Reviews.Content: We were there for 6 nights. Location is great. Beaches on both sides and both less than 5 mins walk. you can see both beaches from room ( we had ocean view junior suite ). Lobby is great with open view. We preferred wailea area way more than kanapali in Lahaina. veiws are much better and hotels are upscale. The town of Kihei is less than 10 mins drive where you have more beaches and local markets. Back to Marriott, worst beds we have experienced all over the world. Requested to change kid's sofa bed to roll over, but the front desk denied and instead they wanted to charge for it. They put hard board underneath to make it better! King bed in room was not acceptable as well. Staff has that " do not care attitude ". They are trained to smile using their face muscles but no emotions or willingness to resolve issue without getting more deeper into your pocket. That said, due to the area itself and nice view from the resort ( if you take ocean view ), we might return. ask for higher floor ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice first night in Maui.”
Reviews.Author: gopherhiker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on Marriott rewards points until we could get into our room at the Marriott Ocean Club. This is an older resort in South Maui in an area where we had never stayed before. When we arrived late at night we found that we had been upgraded to an ocean view room which was nice. The room was well-kept and up to date. We we woke we saw the beautiful view we had right above the reflecting pool. We also found a Starbucks in the resort that we used we we were awake at 5am due to jet lag. The grounds of the resort are very nice although there is no beach. The elevators look a little dated and I don't think Wailea is as nice as the Kaanapali area but it is a nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott needs to invest some money to keep this a place worth coming back to”
Reviews.Author: makmalmac
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas and New Years in beautiful Maui. This was a trip that was completely points- 12 days. We have been to this resort before going all the way back to 20 years ago when it was an Intercontinenal and Wailea was much less built up. I read somewhere that this is the top redemption hotel for Marriott. That may explain why they haven't even attempted to keep up with the neighboring luxury properties. They probably know that when something is "free" people will be more forgiving. They have no where near enough pool chairs. We mostly hit the beautiful beaches, but the few times we went to the pool we literally saw people fight over chairs- not terribly relaxing. I really like where the hotel is and even appreciate that they have kept things low key. I personally think the Grand Wailea is a little too "Vegas", but they need to step it up a little if they want to be thought of in the same league as the rest of the hotels here. I just hope Marriott doesn't just treat this as a dumping ground for points. We really prefer Wailea to Kaanapali and we might have to try something different than Marriott next time around if they continue to neglect this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent resort”
Reviews.Author: AJK82
Reviews.Content: The location is incredible, amazing views and a sunset that you will never tire of looking at. As mentioned by others there is no beach in front of the resort but the walk to the beach on both sides is minimal. I never used the pools as the ocean water is of such high quality. My only observation from walking through the other resorts (especially the Grand Wailea) was that the pools are superior at the other resorts both in terms of size and quality. It really depends on how important pool facilities are in choosing a resort. The grounds of the resort are expansive and well looked after, and in that regard its a relaxing place to be and walk around. The Wailea shops are a 5 minute walk away which has an array of restaurants and shops to explore. Wailea is not a budget travellers destination and you have to accept that everything is expensive. If staying for more than a few days renting a car is essential to explore more of the area as public transport is minimal. Whilst I enjoyed my stay it doesn't appear to be of the same standard as the other resorts in Wailea which seemed more modern and appeared to offer more amenities. I concur with other comments that the breakfast at the restaurant is disappointing and not worth the price. You would expect a far higher quality buffet breakfast than what was offered. It does feel like everything has a fee attached at this resort, and whilst I understand the resort is a business, it still destracted slightly from the experience. I thought the room was very good. It was a decent size, the bed was comfortable and the air conditioning worked well. It was also very well cleaned by the staff. Overall I did enjoy my stay but probably expected more. Next time I would try one of the other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Bruce S
Reviews.Content: We stayed this property for one night before moving to our primary location at the Westin Ka'anapali Resort and Spa. When we arrived we were told we had no reservation, and that the property was overbooked. We indeed had a reservation and had to provide proof by opening up a laptop and showing it to them! As a Platinum Marriott member, I was not impressed. They finally found the reservation and could not explain why they could not find it earlier. After apologizing profusely, we were told they would provide us with an ocean front suite. Overbooked??? We were driven to the building containing our suite in a golf cart. It was our first night, and the sun was just setting. Our driver stopped at a picturesque spot and offered to take a sunset photo with us, which was a very nice touch! The Hotel is on a hill with lots of stairs and steep grades which can be a burden for mobility challenged individuals. I would not want to have to carry lots of luggage around this property, hence the reason for golf carts to ferry guests to rooms. Our room was a second floor king suite in the building closest to the ocean. It was a clean tiny room with a nice Lanai...adequate for a one night stay. The property's waterfront is mostly rough lava rock, but there is a shared beach a short walk away which was not at all crowded when we visited. There was lots of whale activity viewable from our Lanai which was pretty cool, more so that what we saw at the Ka'anapali Westin. The food was good but expensive. There is an onsite Starbucks and gift shop. The property is within walking distance of the Shops at Wailea which is a very nice up scale outdoor mall. One thing worth noting is that it is a very peaceful location. We slept with our patio door ajar and slept to the sound of the breaking surf on the rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: sullyryno
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently had our honeymoon in Hawaii. We stayed at several locations and this was our favorite! The grounds, the pools, the restaurants are all top quality. There is beach access just a short walk from the hotel with great snorkeling right off the beach (with sea turtles). Lay by the pool and watch Hump Back whales breaching and splashing just a short distance away. For runners, there is a running or walking path along the beach which is very active in the morning. We loved it here.

Reviews.Title: “Un(match)ed Location”
Reviews.Author: Greg H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I absolutely loved this hotel. Maui has the most stunning sunsets I have ever witnessed and the view from this spot was special. Lanai and Kahoolawe serve as backdrops as the sun meets the ocean. It was quite interesting to notice how the guests watched in reverent silence as God showed out with His magnificent colors. The Marriott itself is the oldest hotel in this stretch of beach and the rooms may not be as luxurious as some of the competition, but the grounds are great and the hotel has a Starbucks, poolside cafe and a very nice dining room. There is a very nice adult infinity pool, a couple of family pools and beach access to about 4 different beach spots. One highlight is the concrete path that goes beside the beach offering great views and it is also nice for evening strolls and light jogging. The path is a good 20-25 minute walk one way....it is nice. The Marriott has great views from the many outdoor sitting areas. The shops at Wailea is an open air mall with many nice stores. You can find snack and picnic items if needed. Clothing stores, art and several nice places to eat make it a daily destination and it is right next door to the Marriott. My wife and I love tennis and we walked each of the 5 days of our stay to the Wailea Tennis Club for our daily match. The pros there will try and set you up a match or you can rent court time on your own. The fees are around $16.00 per person, but we really enjoyed playing there. There is also a nice looking golf course meandering through the area. Since we were repeat visitors to Maui and had seen Hana, Haleakala and many other must see destinations, we chose not to rent a car and to enjoy all this location had to offer. This saved us the daily parking fee that is charged by the Hotel. They do charge for internet which I do not appreciate, so I wound up taking my laptop to the Shops and Wailea and got online outside some of the coffee shops. There is plenty of seating. If you are in the mood for steak, Ruth's Chris steak house is in the shops and it is simply amazing.....if you get there before 6:00 pm they have reasonable specials and you will not leave hungry. Enjoy your trip. It is a great spot!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Maui vacation”
Reviews.Author: ecjr
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Maui. Our stay was perfect. When we did not care for the original room assigned to us, the manager, Moses, went out of his way to find us a great room (3310) overlooking the ocean and infinity pool. The room was well appointed but the mattresses are REALLY soft! Unless youn have kids yiu do not want to stay bythe kids pool ( we callit the unzen center). Food at the adult pool was generous anddelicious and priced as expected for a resort hotel. Grounds are very pretty and well kept. Even with 3G I couldn't get internet on grounds but hey it's vacation so that was priobably a good thing. Starbucks on site was a morning god send. Excellent but crowded gym facilities. Hotel perfect location close to many foods spots and things to do too! I would definitely stay again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and nice location”
Reviews.Author: Coco M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and has it all. A serenity pool that is saltwater, no cell phones or loud talking aloud, and no children. If you do have kids, there is a kids area, and multiple pools where families can swim and cell phone talking is aloud. The beach directly in front of the hotel is mostly lava rock but there is a nice sandy beach right next to the hotel and a shopping center a short walk inland from the hotel. The mall is pretty high end but has an ABS store, and a Whalers General Store to pick up some supplies. The ABC store has a lot of odds and ends, and there are some very good restaurants in the mall. Even being within walking distance of the mall, the hotel still has a very private secluded feel. Rooms are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Chef_Miki
Reviews.Content: The Marriott pulled through again. Very smart location, wonderful property, amazing views. The Marriott Wailea is laid out in a way that everything is convenient. And ashamed to admit it, but as a (sshhhh) smoker, the Marriott, adhering to the Laws of Hawaii, still kept designated smoking areas 'convenient', but out of the way of general public areas. I have to say though, that the "Best burger in the World" at MA LA fell FAR short of expectations. They claim it to be Kobe beef...I think it was beef with bacon ground in the mix. We were far from impressed. Over all, a beautiful property. Rooms are nice, but NOISY! Don't expect to be able to sleep in. Though the doors are heavy, the large gaps at the bottom allow every sound to come though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: R H
Reviews.Content: After spending 5 nights at the crappy HIlton on the big island this place felt like heaven. The hotel staff is amazing. The room was exceptional and VERY CLEAN and there is a BEACH with TURTLES. Right where the sand breaks to rock, watch out they are right there. We did not even know it till we put our masks on. MALA food is awesome!! and so is breakfast. The sunset is amazing and the mia Tais are yummy. The staff helped us with our boating snorkel trip and we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: jadubya
Reviews.Content: 20th anniversary trip and South Maui Triathlon. We had a room overlooking the family pool on the backside of the property on the first floor. This would not have been my first choice.....but I wasn't too worried about it. The grounds are amazing and we had no problems with our AC but I did insist that they provide us a fan our entire trip. The fridge came in handy. The adult pool is awesome....be prepared to play the towel game every morning.....and laugh in amazement at some idiots who blatantly refuse to NOT excuse themselves from the area while carrying on a loud cell phone conversation. NO beach ON the property....but nice areas on either side. Would definitely go back...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views!”
Reviews.Author: C P
Reviews.Content: This place has an amazing infinity pool looking out into the ocean. The people working the pool were also very friendly. My husband and I enjoyed the most fantastic sunrises and sunsets just steps from the room. The hotel room was just OK, but the grounds made up for the room. Great restaurants easy to get to simply walking down the beach front path.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad,but its not good either”
Reviews.Author: GPeto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not bad but sadly its not good either. It seems Marriott has a complete different set of quality control standards when it comes to their resort's. First off I must say that Wailea is one of the most prettiest towns on Maui. Next door to Marriott there are two other hotels. The Wailea Grand and the four seasons...and also the fairmont a bit further down. This Marriott was built over 30 years ago. It has been an Outrigger in old times and also an Intercontinental. The lobby area is very very gorgeous. At check-in they told me that i received an upgrade and still ended up in the main building with crappy views of the sea. After some complaining i got a better room. The rooms are fine. Toilet not to big but its ok. We had issues with the cleaning of the tile floors. That was the only area the cleaning could have improved. The pools are fairly small for the amount of people the hotel can hold. One very important thing to note is that this hotel has NO BEACH!!!!! while all the others do. One other item that i found very concerning is that you will find nice cabanas and beach beds along side the pools, but those you are not allowed to use only if you dish out 50 or a 100 dollars a day just to use it. When somebody ends up paying 300 to 400 dollars a night for this Marriott....i think charging extra for the nicer beds is just plane wrong. We only had breakfast once in the Mala restaurant. All i can say that this breakfast is a DISGRACE to the Marriott chain (sadly i had the same experience on Waikiki) As a result we ended up taking an early morning walk along the coast (absolutely gorgeous) to the four seasons and had breakfast there. It was only 10 dollars more but a 100 times better. In the mentioned Mala restaurant they have a cocktail bar that served the most awful cocktails we ever tasted. Sad. Just a minute walk from the Marriott Wailea is a very elegant outdoor shopping mall. This complex has good options to dine. We ended up dining there every night. Not cheap but nothing is cheap in Maui. ......and good news is Starbucks has a big outlet next to the lobby. Since most people will rent a car the hotel sees a steady revenue stream coming from the parking business. The parking fee is 30USD per night. We parked our car in the shopping malls parking lot FOR FREE and as a result saved 150 dollars. At check-in they tried to pressure us into buying parking and they even told us that cars left overnight at the mall will be towed. Nobody towed us. My opinion is that this hotel even with its gorgeous landscape and nice serenity pool is a let down when you compare it to the other hotels located next door. On this trip i used my points but based on the prices i found on the web there was only around 130USD difference per night in comparison to the four seasons. Its a no brainer that i would choose the four seasons over the Wailea Marriott if the difference is not bigger. I could not tell if the problems with the hotel stems from financial issues or bad managment but clearly there is a lot to improve especially on the food and beverage side.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches and Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: LM2134
Reviews.Content: Our first room had cockroaches. They offered to spray with can spray but we chose to move to another room. The second room in a second building had cockroaches running around when we opened the door, so we finally settled on a third room in a third building that had ants all over it, but at least they weren't roaches. When we spoke to the front desk and housekeeping they said that it is a tropical location and they try their best to elimate bugs but that it is a problem. I have been to a number of tropical locations (mostly staying at hostels) and this hasn't been an issue. Overall, the resort has a nice location and the infinity pool is really nice if you don't mind waking up at 6:30 to reserve a chair with your towel (You can only be away from a chair for 30 minutes or they open up the chair for someone else). The two hot tubs are filled with kids and are pretty dirty. We stayed on points and even with it being free would not return. Everything is pretty dated, the staff is not very friendly or helpful, and they charge for every little thing, which is probably how they make their money considering everyone we spoke to was staying on points.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barclayboys
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at this hotel and thouroughly enjoyed it. Our room and building needed some updating, but we were using points so didn't make a fuss. Still, we were down by the water and had a nice quiet restful time.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for families with small kids”
Reviews.Author: pedro s
Reviews.Content: Family with 2 small kids - 3 and 4 years old - my wife and mother in law stayed for a week. We definitively recommend it. Great kiddy pool but the water in it was a little cold, the water on the beach was warmer. Don't get into the $30/daily resort fee, you have the option of accepting or not, it includes a bunch of things you don't end up using it. When I thought I was going to be able to use it on a kaiaque rental, I was told It wasn't valid with that type of rental. Just pay the $25 for the parking lot. If you don't have a rental then one more reason for not get into it. Breakfast is expensive but good, but not excellent - have had better ones. What is great is the landscaping, it is truly, truly extremely beautiful, there is path walk by the sea that is awesome.
