The cool thing about the resort is that you can enjoy with little kids, with teenagers and with your wife/husband, since they have separate polls for each one of them. The food they serve by the kiddy pool is ok and not super expensive, the lunch by the family pool is also good, but as in any resort a little expensive. Staff did everything they could to make my stay enjoyable, I am a Marriot platinum member so I am not sure if they treat everyone the same way. Said it all, we do recommend the resort. Come and enjoy the beach (it is not right in front of the hotel, but there are beaches on the left and right of the hotel), the pool, the great landscape, the awesome view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place on Earth!!!”
Reviews.Author: PamelaBall
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this resort! So many extra little things! The staff was super polite and attentive... the front desk, bell service, housekeepers, wait-staff, pool- staff... everyone went out of their way to make guests happy. The serenity pool was true serenity. The staff made sure the rules were followed so everyone was allowed serenity. There were also swimming pools and a really cool kid's area. The hotel was laid out so that the families with children had an area for them separate from the area for adults without children. The food was top notch... not weird or over-done... just perfect with a great selection, however would like to see regular sandwiches as part of the lunch menu for those who eat a lighter lunch. Room service was prompt and had a flower in a vase! Ocean and Beach Front!!! he grounds were kept very clean everything was very well maintained and up to date!. The view was amazing. Ocean sunsets Great walking paths along the ocean. Excellent location. Safe and classy! Lots of activities, great Luau! Easy parking. On New Year's Eve the resort had a party with Steven Tyler, Alice Cooper, Doobie Brothers, etc... The only complaint I would have is the designated smoking area was at the top of the staircase leading to the beautiful open air lobby. This is terrible placement because everyone walking up the staircase is forced to breath the smoke. My husband has COPD and the stairs pose a struggle on their own, but coupled with second hand smoke, my hubby had to take the staff/freight elevator. We went for our anniversary and New Years. We will return soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Anahita H
Reviews.Content: i have been there 2times( Aug 2010 and Aug 2011) this place is very clean , location is good but if you want to do beach activities such as jet ski or sub marine, you should have a car to drive to Lahaina(30 to 40 min). they have 3 pools + one for kids, pools are not heated (bad point). If you want to swim in the ocean, you should walk to the neighbor hotel (Grand Wailea) . i wouldn't eat in the hotel restaurant ( Mala) next time, food is extremely expensive and BAD. if you want better food, drive to Paia (20 to 25 min), you could find better restaurant and of course cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but that's it”
Reviews.Author: marcus81
Reviews.Content: Situated between two beaches, nice view of molokini, but really short on pool space and as a result people get rude. Location is very good, but some might find it alittle isolated. The shops are a welcome diversion, and include a couple of good restaurants. You will need a car if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful large property, good service, food not great”
Reviews.Author: suzanochka
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a lovely vacation over the holidays. The hotel was very busy but we did not notice any problems in connection with getting into the pools, restaurants or services. They managed the crowds very well. In general the service was very good. The grounds are beautifully scaped with a lot of pools, spas, a large relaxation pool, beaches to either side and places to just sit and enjoy the wonderful views. I think I liked the grounds most of all. The hotel room was fine for us. It was spacious and quiet. We stayed in a double queen bed room, terrace view. The only disappointment for me was the food in the main restaurant. I am sure that many people would find the food to be of good quality. I had a reaction to some of the chili dip and tortillas or possibly the coconut shrimp. There is some oil used in cooking called-- I think -rapeseed oil, especially in China, that may be included in some recipes served in US restaurants. That bothers me but there could also have been some other ingredients that I don't know about. I thought maybe there was a high oil content in some dishes that we tried. We were able to walk to the nearby and very lovely shopping mall where plenty of restaurants are located. However this may be my particular allergies and tastes. The buffets had plenty to choose from. I did not find them to be the lavash affair of a 5 star hotel, however offering a good variety of dishes. I have to say that the restaurant service was excellent and the views from the restauant terrace were stunning. We saw whales! This is the start of the migration and I was told in January there are a lot of whales in the area near Maui. There are two beaches by the hotel where you can see colorful fish by the rocks. The snorkeling was fine and we went to a few places by boat. The Alli Nui boating operation was just excellent. I have seen more sea life in other places such as Isla Mujeres in Mexico. However there were a good variety of fish to see both swimming from shore and from the boat trips. There was a lot of wind which may be seasonal. We hired a driver to take us to Hana which was a good decision. The drive is taxing and rains can come down hard. The water falls were flowing from recent rains and were beautiful. Hana is not a destination. It is the route that offers beautiful scenery but it is long. We also drove up to the lavender farm and got there too late for entry but that drive was beautiful. The hotel concierge arranged all our trips before we departed for Maui so all was easy. The concierges are very competent. A last word about the spa - very nice, good service, clean, fairly expensive and a tip of 20% is added to your bill. However I liked the massage. In general an easy trip with little worries and a beautiful property to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Marriott”
Reviews.Author: AKK K
Reviews.Content: Avoid Mariott. Avoid Maui. Horrible place. People are stuck up and carry loads of attitude. Downright rude in many cases. "Paradise" has got in their head. Many other cheaper places to go and have better experience for your money. Only good experience was Pacific Whale Foundation. Non-profit. Go figure!

Reviews.Title: “This made a vacation”
Reviews.Author: K P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I never had a honeymoon when we got married five years ago due to a military deployment...so when we decided to book our long overdue honeymoon, we were very mindful of where to stay. As a Marriott loyal member...I was sure this would be a good choice and booked it right away...however, when we were on our way to Maui and I took time to read some of the mix reviews on here...we were a little apprehensive about our stay at the Wailea Beach Resort. That fear soon was wiped away...the staff was so pleasant and nice when we arrived...we were upgraded to a beautiful room with a spectacular view of the ocean. It was quite and serene. The staff (including the maid staff) couldn't have been nicer. Our room was clean, comfortable, and beautiful. We did notice that the air conditioning wouldn't work unless you closed the sliding glass door - which makes perfect sense (and very eco-friendly...not to waste energy). The proximity to the beaches was great. The ammenities were nice. Overall...my husband and I enjoyed our well overdue honeymoon. Two suggestions though...make sure to get the discount coupons on breakfast...and we highly recommend eating dinner elsewhere...there are so many less expensive options (and better food) such as the Monkey Pod; and lastly, pay the resort fee...it pays for your daily parking and gives you discounts on other things around the resort. Another tip too: During our visit...it was a great time to go for couples...there were not a lot of kids around and it was very quite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Couples and Families Alike”
Reviews.Author: MRuben01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Wailea Beach Resort and Spa for 3 nights and had a great experience. Our room overlooked the ocean and the infinity (I think they call it the "Serenity" Pool) and the view was beautiful. The room was not fancy but tastefully done and very comfortable. The beds are very soft and very comfortable, despite the fact I usually prefer a firmer mattress. The Serenity pool is an adults only pool and in a totally separate area from the other pool. The pool was quiet, relaxing, and had beautiful views of the ocean. It was great to have a separate pool for adults and families and it gave the resort a very romantic feel. The grounds of the hotel are gorgeous with finely cut, golf course-like lawns spanning the oceanfront. There are hammocks hung between palm trees that were great for laying in under the stars at night or while looking at the beautiful sunset. The beach is technically next door but is very close. It is not a huge beach but it is nice and there's a nice reef for snorkeling/scuba diving right off the beach towards the right side. We saw a whole bunch of huge sea turtles right off the shore. We did not eat at the restaurant (Mala) on the property but we did eat at Mala's other location in Lahaina and the meal was fantastic. Definitely get the Ahi bruschetta. The hotel is also within walking distance to the Shops at Wailea Shopping Center which has some nice shops and restaurants. Overall we thought the hotel was great. Its a huge property but the layout makes the hotel not feel crowded. The adults only pool is great and makes this hotel good for couples looking for a quiet romantic getaway. The other kid-friendly pool and beach make this resort good for families as well. Its not a fancy resort but it feels very clean, comfortable, and the grounds are beautiful. The resort is a great value. I can't give it a full 5 rating because its not a luxury property but if I could give it a 4.5 I would. I would certainly come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, friendly staff, great beaches and pools.”
Reviews.Author: Kazdog
Reviews.Content: Seems better oriented for adult couples even tho' there is a kid pool area. Relaxing pools, love the infinity pool with a great view. Easy access to 2 great beaches, one with all the activities - kayaking, snorkeling, stand up paddle boarding and boogie boarding all available. Staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Maui. The trip was quickly scheduled and done on a budget. We procurred the hotel through Price Line and got an affordable rate. Our room was nice and the staff were very good. For every request we made, Bethany at the front desk came through with a smile. Bartenders Joe by the pool and Charles at the Mala restaurant took great care of us and made the stay memerable. I have been to Maui many times and have stayed at most of the resorts there, I would stay at the Marriot next time and be excited to do so. Our only down sides to the stay were that the adult pool was closed the entire time we were there for maintenance, and the housekeeping staff were a little unflexible. Everyone and everything else was what you would expect from a 4 star resort.was provided. Mark

Reviews.Title: “A great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: saleschick87
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful with a large open air lobby area. The room we had was spacious with a great view and a large walk in closet which was handy for storing all of our beach toys. The room came with a refridgerator and coffee pot but no free wifi. There are several pools, the serenity infinity pool was a great place to spend a very relaxing day. We rented a private cabana for the day, be sure and take the resort package ($30) when you check in because you save 20% on the cabana. There was self parking, for $25 a day (included as part of the aforementioned resort package) and was convenient to our room. They have access to a beach but it's about a 8 minute walk from the property. It's a nice beach with some of the best snorkeling on the island. But no chairs or umbreallas available on the beach, you have to bring your own. All in all a nice property and some place we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “There is a reason why this hotel has "bad" or "just good" reviews”
Reviews.Author: Traveler20100
Reviews.Content: Complete review of Wailea Marriott Over the past several years, I stayed at over 50 marriotts across the world with over 1000 nights, I have decided to spend some time to go over this property's features since I can compare and Hawaii is far away for most of you and it is hard to know from pictures what you are getting yourself into. Although i had mostly bad experience, i tried to stay objective. Location Wailea is a pleasant place - nice resorts and condos, clean beaches(no lifeguards), very expensive mall, several good restaurants, Â nice people. I just have to warn you - the area is not cheap, so if you do come here and have a budget, I suggest getting a rental at the airport, buying groceries(fruits, water, etc) on your way here. Average plate around here is $40/person, bottle of water goes for $5, car rentals are twice as expensive at the hotels. One important factor to point out - Marriott doesn't have its own beach, it's not a huge deal since the beaches are walking distance but you don't have a seat waiting for you like other hotels provide you with, so you need to get towels at the pool and carry them to the beach . Area is good for runners and walkers: Â people from other resorts enjoyed coming to Marriott for a walk or even swim at the pool - there are no gates and nobody ever asks for a pass. Rooms I got a deluxe ocean view room away from the pools and it was spacious, clean with nice furniture. I think most rooms have some kind of view of the ocean. If you have a choice, don't get rooms overlooking the pool / since the pools are always crowded you would be tempted to stay inside. Room service was good. Pools Unfortunately the pools turned out to be a big disappointment so if pool is important part of your vacation - you should check elsewhere. Pools are fairly small, water colder than in ocean, crowded and roughly a third of sits you have to pay for - Â be prepared to get up early and fight for free sits or pay between $25 and $100 for a spot - those seats are nicer but this is my first time at the hotel where some spots you have to pay for. Â The picture that you see - the front cover is an optical illusion, the pools areÂ Â good 100 feet away from the ocean. Lastly, without any warning during my stay - administration shut down adult pool for a week- should I have known that I would have stayed somewhere else - paradoxically I called a few days prior to arrival to ask if the pool will be open and was told that it would only be closed for 2 days - I thought 2 days - that's not a big deal, how silly I was. The property is going through renovations so this happen again I suspect. Other public areas Nice lobby, laundry is available(don't use it though - we had to throw away some cloth after using it) and they tend shut down laundry room at random - one time we couldn't get out cloth out during normal hours, breakfast area is nice and buffet price is reasonable, lots of showers and bathrooms around the property. Summary: good place if area's cost and pools are not part of your equation.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: HappyRetirees92662
Reviews.Content: This resort in Wailea is an excellent choice for couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: jlcarp
Reviews.Content: Tucked away behind the Shops at Wailea, the Marriott Waileaâ€™s entrance is a perfect example of hotel grandeur. The lobby is large, open-air, and all accents are in perfect symmetry. You definitely get the feeling you are in Wailea and not West Maui. The staff is incredibly helpful and accommodating, from the receptionists to the bell hops. In terms of the property, it is clean and very well maintained. There are two pools, the main pool with Jacuzzis where children are allowed and the infinity pool which is to the left of the Kumu and Mala restaurants. We spent most of our time at the infinity pool, it was nice and relaxing and beautiful. Chairs do get reserved and taken early so keep that in mind if you plan on being at the pool all day. The infinity pool plays annoying resort music, so bring your earbuds. Cocktail waitresses are friendly and come around fairly often, although sometimes it did take a bit longer for the drink to arrive. I highly recommend the Mai Tai from Kumuâ€™s â€“ I was surprised at how well made they were. Usually resort drinks are pretty weak, but these were well balanced and fresh; one of the best I had on Maui actually. The Marriott Wailea is not adjacent to a sandy beach, so if you want to swim in the ocean or lay on the sand you have to take the walkway to the Grand Wailea which is not a far walk (about 5-10 minutes); it is a nice beach and the ocean is pretty calm and feels amazing! The Starbucks gets really crowded early in the AM so keep that in mind, but the friendly staff makes up for the long wait. As for the rooms, the rooms are clean but pretty bare bones. We had an ocean view, which was nice, but we were positioned pretty far back from the water so a lot of our view was the roof of the lobby overhang below. But we could also see Molokini from our room and enjoy the amazing sunsets so that made up for it. My only huge complaint is how thin the walls are â€“ we could hear the domestic bliss going on in the room adjacent to us from the hallway (on multiple occasions at different times throughout the day) and it was so loud we might as well have been standing in their bedroom. It was very uncomfortable when walking by.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: amy_cerny
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui and to Hawaii for that matter. This resort was located on the water next to the Grand Wailea and although it is called the Wailea Beach Marriott, there is only a small beach located on the property. However, all the beaches here are public, so within walking distance, you can use the beach in front of the Grand Wailea and Ulua Beach just to the north. This did not discourage us as the property did have 5 pools that were all fantastic. The property itself was well maintained and was very beautiful. The rooms were pretty simple but for as much as you are actually in the room, it didn't matter. The location was great because it was within walking distance from the Wailea shops and only about 20 mins from the airport. The location also was very beautiful and the waters were pretty calm so, it offered a great place to swim and snorkel. There is a daily resort fee (which applies to all resorts) and the hotel did offer up parking and other discounts for $30 a day including the resort fee which was a plus. We rented a car and definately needed to park and we were expecting an additional $25 a day to park in the parking garage. The staff was very friendly and accomodating and this made our stay more enjoyable. If you go to this resort, you definately should have the onion rings at Kumu Bar and Grill, they are fantastic and at 4pm they only cost $4 (happy hour).

Reviews.Title: “What a great resort...”
Reviews.Author: TinyBubblesScuba
Reviews.Content: It started with the drive thru the lush lands of Wailea. Arriving at the Marriott, we were given the option to upgrade to a Ocean front room. Totally worth it, our room was literally 50' from the water lapping on the lava rocks. Several pools to choose from gave us the option to change our settings if we liked and pool service was friendly and fun. Dinner was at Mala which is on property, and it was very good with lots of "vegetarian" options. Very comfortable king size beds and a 50 inch flat screen TV, which helped talking the wife into the fact that we need a bigger TV at home. Great breakfast buffet to get your day of snorkel and playing in Maui off in the right direction. Maui NoKaOi and Wailea Marriott helps prove this !! Mahalo...

Reviews.Title: “Great Wailea location and family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: cgbroderick
Reviews.Content: Terrific location near some of Wailea's best beaches right along the popular walking path, the Marriott is a low-rise complex spread over a large area right on the waterfront (it was built before the other Wailea resorts when Maui allowed that kind of resort zoning). Pluses: affordable, friendly, relaxed, beautiful adult infinity pool, fun slide and kid pool, Ulua beach a few minutes walking distance, walk to the upscale Wailea shops, next door to the Grand Wailea (a Vegas experience compared to the more human scaled Marriott), spectacular sunsets. Minuses: $30 resort fee doesn't include Internet or any amenities (best I could tell is that it includes self parking in the garage and long-distance calls -- does anybody make long-distance calls from a hotel phone these days?), some of the rooms are in lousy locations near the noisy kid pool or below ground, can be noisy if you are on the ground floor, the pool restaurant is great for lunch for closes (including the bar) at sunset and only the high-end restaurant is open at night.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing & peaceful”
Reviews.Author: furnitureruss
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Maui after years of going to Waikiki for vacation. If any of you are familiar with Waikiki and are thinking about Maui, here is what to expect if you stay in Wailea ... 1. Don't expect to be pestered by timeshare or activity sales people in Wailea 2. Don't expect to have all the conveniences of inexpensive options for food like in Waikiki ... that isn't the case in Wailea. If peace and quiet are what you want .... Wailea is it. As for the Wailea Marriott Resort and Spa, many people have written about things that some take as positives and some as negatives. I'm a pretty straight forward guy who is pretty indifferent to most things so here's my person view. The rooms are all the same. Beds are soft and they are low (no box springs) & yes the floors are all tile. Both of these things my wife and I liked. There is no wi-fi in the room .. so what you are on vacation - take a vacation and forget about facebook for a week. If you can't live without it, there is free wi-fi up at the Starbucks. No direct beach in front of the hotel, yes, but you are oceanfront. The beach is rocky. You want sand? walk 5 minutes in either direction and you got it. The property is big and your room may not be a short walk from the lobby. So what ... tip the bell hop a buck and have him ride you in the golf cart (they'll do that). There are about 4 or 5 pools on the property. The infinity pool is adults only. Most pools do NOT have a lot of lounge seating so be prepared to get to a pool early or wing it with finding a lounge chair. The water (in all the pools) is cold, so be prepared for that. Room service is very expensive. Two 8" pizzas and a cup of onion soup was about $58 ... that was the one and only time we ate room service. There is a resort fee of $30 per day. if you have a rental car (you should - you really should) - the parking is included in the daily fee. People have complained about the parking. I never had a problem. Even if you park on the far end of the parking structure, it's a 3 minute walk. No big deal brah. The shops at Wailea (an outdoor mall if you will) are open daily from about 9 to 9 & a 5 minute walk... bring your wallet - the shopping in Wailea is pricey as well. If you did rent a car, Kihei is only 5 miles up the road where you can buy groceries, or alcohol for beach drinks in your room that won't cost you $12 each like they do at the resort. Hey, I don't blame the resort ... they can charge whatever they want. This is America .... we have options. Pay $12 for a drink, or buy your own booze and mix your own in your room. My wife and I stayed in room 2324 in Hale 2 which was top floor (3rd floor) deluxe ocean view. Full sweeping views of the ocean. One review stated the bottom floor near the ocean & the people walking on the path which wasn't too private for them.. that is true ... if you can, ask for a 2nd or 3rd floor room ..... you can leave the glass door open at night and listen to the waves. Some reviews talked about sugar ants. We had a few & they were always in the bathroom sink. These things were needle point small, and we saw a few a day in the bathroom sink ... not a big deal to us, we just rinsed them down the drain. We were careful not to leave pop cans or beer cans anywhere near the bathroom sink. There are some public beaches within a 5 to 10 minute drive from the property over in Makena. Very swank area, but these are public beaches and our time spent there, the beaches were practically deserted. All in all we loved our stay. Very relaxing. We did miss some of the conveniences of Waikiki, but we certainly didn't miss the constant pestering of activity salespeople. This was pure relaxation. The staff was very nice. I am platinum Marriott rewards member, so I don't know if that is the reason, but we asked for a late check out since we had a red-eye back to the mainland, they couldn't let us stay in our room we were in all week, but they moved us to a more modest room and let us check out at 7pm. This was really cool of them. They didn't charge us a penny to do it either. We were able to relax in an air conditioned room before our long flight home. We would stay there again. It's not inexpensive ... but it sure is relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great hotel, alright service”
Reviews.Author: Dan C
Reviews.Content: Note: I stayed here when I *was* a Marriott reservations employee. The location was amazing; I loved the shops at Wailea. The location isn't "beachfront", but it is oceanfront and that was sufficient for me. The resort is huge and there's plenty of space for all the guests. I never found it crowded and had little difficulty finding a chair facing the ocean. I did not rent a car, but I did take the local bus to Lahaina because I had stayed there previously on a family vacation. The bus was only $2 for a day pass and totally worthwhile. Took the tour to Hana that goes fully around the south coast (bring an airsickness bag for the road TO Hana, and an extra cushion for the rough trip back). There are beautiful beaches easily within walking distance, and I was able to see the whales from the property. I didn't have an "oceanview" room, but you could still see the ocean from the balcony. I don't know what was wrong with the thermostat... it always seemed to cut off the A/C. That was difficult to deal with when coming to a hot, humid climate from a cold Canadian winter.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Non-Luxurious Family Hotel With Some Drawbacks (and Choose Your Room Carefully!)”
Reviews.Author: Tapnmel23
Reviews.Content: As a frequent Maui visitor, I have stayed at numerous hotels in the Wailea area. The Marriott occupies an expansive piece of rocky coastline in gorgeous Wailea. The property is very long and the rooms are widespread. There is no beach per se - just little stretches of sand amongst all of the rocks. The Marriott has hundreds of rooms on various parts of the property. We were first given a room in the Tower. It is NOT a place you want to be. It is a very tall building that feels more like a holiday inn from the 80's then a Hawaiian beachfront hotel. Many of the rooms have views of the parking lot. While the rooms are nice inside, the Tower Rooms are not fit for a beachside vacation. Upon agreeing to pay $50 more per night, we were upgraded to a ground level beachfront room with expansive ocean views. This room was exactly the same inside as the Tower room, but had a wonderful ocean view. The down side, however, is that the public walkway that goes through the entire hotel was right outside our room so there was no privacy from dawn to dask. As a result, we couldn't keep our blinds or sliding glass door open to hear the ocean as we slept because people would be able to see in our room very easily! One issue was that although the hotel charges a $30/day resort fee, this fee doesn't give you anything you want. It grants you free phone usage and faxes - who wants faxes on vacation? It also DOES NOT INCLUDE INTERNET ACCESS. If you want to access the internet from your room, you only have one option - TO PAY FOR WIRED INTERNET! So even though we paid $30/day for a resort fee, we had to pay another $20/day to get in room wired internet. And the wire only extended a few feet so we had to sit at the in room desk to use our computer. The only wireless internet on the property is located at the Starbucks on site, but it closes at 5:30 p.m. and it was packed with people using the free wireless so seating was tough to get. Another issue is the tile floors in the rooms. They felt dirty and not luxurious at all. I know this hotel was just renovated, and I'm shocked that they didn't do something better to the floors. Also, room service is not available at all hours - shocking for a major hotel of this size. However, the hotel is a short walk to the Shops at Wailea so you can easily walk over there to get food. This was a nice feature. The main pool has not been renovated, although there is a swanky adult only pool that looks great. If you have kids, this is a decent place to stay because they have a nice kid pool with toys, etc. But if you are an adult looking for a romantic vacation, I highly suggest the Fairmont or Four Seasons instead - both far superior to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii Wedding - Michael and Kay”
Reviews.Author: KoziolMichael
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful resort. It is the oldest resort on that strip but it was beautiful and the landscape was mature. The view from our balcony was just breathtaking and the staff was always helpful and courteous. It was not overcrowded at all, even though I believe they were full for the holiday. We were there for our Wedding and Honeymoon, and loved every minute. They have a luau that takes place right on the property and the sand beach with activities was within walking distance. We would defiantly recommend this property. Water was calm and clear, able to snorkel and kayak.

Reviews.Title: “This Resort Has It All”
Reviews.Author: Julia S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Marriott platinum members and have stayed at this resort twice in the past three years. We came back....and will continue to come back for several reasons. The staff here is friendly and very accommodating. After checking into our partial ocean view room, we did not like the location so we asked to move to another room. No problem! We were given a room with a full view of the ocean and one that was much closer to the lobby area and restaurants. The infinity pool is our favorite place to spend the day. Children are not allowed there so it's a peaceful place for adults (nothing against kids....we just like a quiet place to hang out). The poolside staff are great and there is something about having a lava flow near water that makes you forget about life back on the mainland! The restaurants on site are good but pricey.... About what you would expect at a resort. Since there is a shopping center within walking distance, we went to Longhi's several mornings for breakfast. If you do go for the buffet at the resort, be sure to tell them if you are a rewards member so you can get your discount. The only real problem we had was with the in room Internet. As a platinum member it is free but we had trouble connecting almost every day. We brought a switch and Ethernet cables with us which was a good thing since there was no wireless Internet in the room. Other than this our stay was very enjoyable and we will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “average overall experience”
Reviews.Author: ready29
Reviews.Content: Great location but experience depends on the room you receive. There is an extra charge for for parking and internet, Right along walking path for the whole Wailea beach area. Nice pool area but beach for Marriott guests is limited. Gym is adequate and always open. No real option for breakfast except Starbucks in the lobby. I have stayed here twice with Marriott points.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some serious updating”
Reviews.Author: ToddMH70
Reviews.Content: Although the resort is nice they are in serious need of an update. Im a platinum level in Marriott rewards program. This is a decent hotel but for the number of points it cost, I would rather stay at a JW resort. Felt small and lacked the amenities of a higher end resort which the price indicated. And seriously. They don't have wireless Internet throughout the property and in the room! Haven't they heard of an iPad, smartphone or any other wireless device? I can't even plug my iPad into a wired port. And they actually charge people for the internet!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for desirable location”
Reviews.Author: arobin
Reviews.Content: For the Wailea area, this is a great value. The room I had was about $199 per night and it was spacious and comfortable. I would have given the resort a 5 rating if there were better noise barrier between the room and the hallway- the first night there, I heard some loud noises that sounded like vacuuming coming from the hallway after I was in bed. The infinity adult pool was a wonderful place to relax during the sunny days and there was some good quality snorkeling right off the beach. Its just a short walk to the shops at Wailea and the neighboring hotels offer some additional quality dining options. No, its not the service of the four seasons BUT at a fraction of the cost, you get to be in a beautiful setting and enjoy a quality resort. I am likely to consider staying here again on my next trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “7 days of R&R”
Reviews.Author: 35ColJan
Reviews.Content: We needed a week's break and really enjoyed the hotel. Infinity pool area was great (adults only no cell phones permitted), room overlooked the ocean and it was very quiet as Hotel is sited away from any roads. While food was fine for breakfast (included in our price) and poolside lunch snack we would have been disappointed in the evening had it not been for closeness of the Shops with Tommy Bahamas and Chris Steak House - about 5 minute walk away. 10 minutes walk away on ocean path was the 4 seasons hotel with its top end restaurants. So in practice we ended up with a 5 star stay but didn't have to pay an exorbitant price - a win win.

Reviews.Title: “Not Even Close to What We Thought!”
Reviews.Author: vannigirl
Reviews.Content: After doing weeks of research for a hotel on Maui...we went with the Marriott in Wailea. What a mistake! I have traveled all over the world and stayed in many Marriott locations and this is at the bottom. To start our trip off, they began calling us a week in advance about their time share up in Lahina. We were already on vacation in Hawaii so the phone call was all the more annoying! Then they asked us to use more points in order to "guarentee" an upgrade. My husband is a Platinum Premier member...no additional points should be needed. Our room was dated, small and the bathroom light was located over by the front door! A 10 minute walk from the lobby....and cockroaches to boot. There is NO BEACH....you can go right or left...but no chairs and no umbrellas....unless you RENT THEM from another company! We booked a Zipline tour with the hotel, only to find out that it had been booked 2 weeks after what we wanted. We found this out after we got up at the crack of dawn and drove up to the site. It ruined our day. The restaurant for breakfast was FILTHY! There is litterally no where to go for a "nice drink" during sunset at this hotel. The towles were old and the maid service turned our name in because we carried a glass bottle back to our room that had a cigarette butt in it...instead of throwing it in a trash bin. I HAVE NEVER had a more horrible experience in Hawaii than at this hotel. I have been traveling to the islands for 30+yrs and this was by far THE WORST!!! Never never again. Every property around the MArriott has a beach, beach service and accesibility. If you want a dated room, 2 pools with limited shade and crappy service....this hotel is for you! What a bad ending to our 10th wedding anniversary...which BTW we were married on MAui. Oh forgot, brought a couple to the island for the first time.....not good having a roach crawl out of her make up bag when she reached for her mascara! BAD BAD BAD!

Reviews.Title: “Did they have to "nickel and dime" us on everything?”
Reviews.Author: olliedixie
Reviews.Content: We were originally supposed to stayed at the Hyatt Regency on Kanaapali Beach. One week prior to our departure, Costco informed us of the unexpected commencement of major renovations to some of the common areas at that resort, so we moved our accomodations to the Wailea Beach Marriott Resort & Spa for the week. The resort was very nice and our room was spacious and very clean. Compared to the other resorts in Wailea, the grounds and amenities were somewhat ordinary. For example, the other resorts had lush and interesting landscaping and pools, while the Marriott's pool area was very underwhelming. The week prior to our stay in Maui, we had stayed for 5 days at the Grand Hyatt in Poipu on Kauai and had spent a considerable amount of time lounging around their pool area. We never felt compelled to do the same at the Marriott. We were charged a $30 resort fee per day. We did not have a problem with the charge, as we had been charged $25 per day at the Hyatt and realize that resort fees are commonplace in Hawaii. At the Hyatt, the fee included free parking, discounts on all kinds on services and amenities, free internet usage, free laundry facilities and 2 bottles of water left in our room each day. At the Marriott, the parking was free but, other than some token non-useful discounts, they charged for the internet and for the laundry services. When we first arrived, we asked for a lunch recommendation. Of course, they referred us to their poolside grill. Their lunch was extremely expensive for the quantity and quality of the food we were served. If you wanted to substitute salad, fries or onion rings for the potato chips served with the sandwich, the upcharge was $5-$6. Then, we found out later that we were entitled to a discount card (Aloha Card) that would give us discounts at certain restaurants, including the lunch place. When we told the concierge that we had already eaten there, unbeknowst to us that there could be a discount of 20%, he refused to make any adjustment, even though we had charged the meal to our room. Moral of our story: if you are staying at the Marriott, be sure to ask for the discount card before you eat anything there. Our room was very clean, so no complaint there. One day we were shorted the usual supply of bath towels, so the next morning we asked housekeeping to provide a couple of extra towels. By the next day, our request had been forgotten and our towels were shorted again. At the Hyatt, when we had a minor probem in the room, not only did they fix it, but, they sent us a food basket and a handwritten apology. On the positive side, the breakfast buffet, included in our package, was ample and delicious. I am sure that, had we stayed at the Marriott first, we would have found it to be expensive, yet very comfortable, despite the lapses in their curstomer service. However, we were treated so well at the Hyatt in Kauai, I guess our expectations were raised by that experience. Next time, we will likely try the renovated Hyatt Regency, as we were orignally supposed to do, with the expectation that we will be treated as well as we were in Kauai.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms, nice decor but the front deck service and parking are lacking”
Reviews.Author: veloche
Reviews.Content: The place is well designed, bewly rennovated. The restaurant is very overpriced even for Maui. The front deck people are difficult to work with and not very accomodating. The parking garage has constant problems. The key cards stop working all the time. 4 times in one week

Reviews.Title: “Great Service !!!”
Reviews.Author: brungardtx
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity to stay in many establishments all over the world, and this resort, by far is the best for service. Everyone employed there seems to "bend over backwards" to help anyway possible. I would recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Just not that great!”
Reviews.Author: te6000
Reviews.Content: When you pull in to the property you will be very impressed with the entry lobby area. Unfortunatelly this is where it ends. Once you leave this area you will find a clean property, but just not that great. Having stayed at a few other properties in Hawaii we were dissappointed to see the old buildings and the pool areas. The room we had was renovated and nice enough but the property overall is decorated in a cold silver/gray blue colors. The rooms are in a bunch of different buildings no more than a few floors tall and feel very old. I must say this is my personal view of the property and you may like it but it just was not for us.

Reviews.Title: “nice resort but bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: 711hayes1711
Reviews.Content: The resort has really pretty grounds and pool areas, but I was not pleased with the service. I reserved a room with a king size bed and confirmed this a few days before arrival, only to be put in a room with two queen beds. The front desk told me they were out of rooms with king beds that night, but would call me the next day about moving to another room, since we were staying a full 7 nights there. They never called me, and when I called them they just told me that my reservation did not guarantee me a king bed and there was nothing they could do. Not a huge deal, but when I'm paying almost $300 a night, I expect better service.

Reviews.Title: “A nice week in quiet Wailea at a very good resort ...”
Reviews.Author: MarriottGuySanDiego
Reviews.Content: I'll preface my review by saying that my wife and I stayed here for a week using points, meaning the room was free other than the $30 a day resort fee (which included free parking, which I can certainly understand). Very nice resort in quiet Wailea, located away from the condo-madness of Kiehi and the tourist trap that is Lahaina. You're greeted by well-manicured landscaping and clean streets on the drive that drops you down into Wailea. Make note of the restaurant 'Monkeypod' as you make your way down the hill. You should go there -- a lot. We went four times in seven days. Great happy hour, good food, 32 beers that are on tap. The resort is nice,clean and laid out pretty well. I'm Platinum so we received an oceanfront room. Can't complain at all there. Room was nice, spacious. Bed, as noted elsewhere, was soft, very soft. The bath towels were a little rough. Yes, these are about my only complaints. Again, the room was free. There's a small fridge in the room. Make sure you stop at a real grocery store (Safeway and Foodland are in Kiehi) to get a case of water, booze, beer, whatever. You can thank me later. Resort food/drink, expensive, as you might guess. Full-service Starbucks in the hotel, opens at 5:30 a.m. Free Wi-Fi there (not in room). The shops at Wailea, within walking distance, is great for anything you forgot, ice cream at Lappert's and that's about it. Longhi's has a decent happy hour. Avoid the Cheeseburger place and Tommy Bahama. Get downtown Kiehi to Kiehi Caffe (yes, two F's) or Sansei for sushi. Tip:There's a small pool out back behind the south end of the resort, above the kid pool. It's very quiet there in the morning. You can swim and get sun and not be bothered much. Had the breakfast buffet a few times. It was good and $17 for Marriott Rewards members instead of $28. Had drinks at the lower bar, Kumu, once. You can catch a game there on TV if that's your thing but if you HAVE TO watch a game, head down the road to Mulligan's, which has DirectTV and a good happy hour. There's a great walking trail along the water that stretches about 1.3 miles, most of it going south. That was a great walk for us after breakfast each day. In closing ... nice resort, few complaints, eat off property, get to the grocery store first, stop at 'Monkeypod' happy hour is 3-5 p.m. and there's a later one. Don't sweat Wi-Fi, use the Starbucks, don't sweat the resort fee, this is Hawaii and it includes parking. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel...beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: RDS71
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort. No complaints at all. Rooms are roomy, people are friendly, grounds are taken care of. Very clean. No beach directly out front, but that wasn't a problem at all. There are beaches within 10 min of both sides and there are beaches all over the island you can go to. Pools are great and that was all we needed. I saw reviews on this as a negative, but it's no big deal really. Great walking path for long walks at night or in the morning if your into that kind of thing. Small fridge in the room. Buy your own drinks on the way to the hotel. Restaurants are expensive to buy drinks at. Never ate at them the whole week. Too many options elsewhere. I don't like eating at any hotel I go to. I'd go back in a heartbeat, didn't want to leave. I hope to get back there sometime again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but didn't like our basement room”
Reviews.Author: Nat9Toronto
Reviews.Content: The pools were beautiful and it's very close to the beach. We loved the locations to restaurants and the mall. We didn't love the fact that our room was in a half basement. I would recommend this hotel and would stay again. We booked on priceline so worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - splurge for the ocean facing view!”
Reviews.Author: Whitney D
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful time on the 1st part of honeymoon in maui in nov. '10. we opted for an ocean facing view room at the marriott and it was definitely worth it (pricey though - $600+/night). i am not sure i would rate the hotel as high with a room not facing the ocean, but the cost would have been less so maybe its worth it. 'ocean facing view' means you are guaranteed a room in one of the buildings closest to the water, not the highrise in the back of the property. our room was on the ground floor and you literally walked right out to the water. there is no sand in front of hotel, but the view is still gorgeous. we actually enjoyed it more without the beach in front of hotel because it was less crowded directly outside our room. the property is not as luxurious as the 4 seasons, but our room view definitely out shined it and we would definitely return and request the same room! there is a path that runs along the water and connects the hotels in wailea. you can easily walk to have dinner at the 4 seasons or grand wailea. we did not eat at any of the restaurants on the marriott property - so i cant rate them - but we did spend a couple days at the infinity pool and the service there was great for a low key lunch by the pool. the pool is small and can get crowded, but its an adults only pool. the hotel is walking distance to shops where you can get lunch or a cheaper dinner. i do recommend renting a car (there is a self parking garage on the property - $25/day) and exploring the island. travel to the beaches (big beach is gorgeous!), eat dinner at mamas fish house!! - reservation required - request to sit so you can view the ocean. take a surf lesson in kihei and chat with the locals who are so nice and will give you recommendations on where to have a "locals lunch." the staff was extremely friendly and met every need.

Reviews.Title: “So Convenient and Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Alberto N
Reviews.Content: Absolutely coming back. The beach is so close. The pools are really nice. We loved the serenity pool. The Wailea shops have everything you need so you don't add tons of miles to the rental car. The room was really nice and the balcony view was a highlight for sure. They have a starbucks and a little gift shop with basics as well. Coming back next year for sure!

Reviews.Title: “excellent property, a few too many fees”
Reviews.Author: ReichenbachManor
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a "babymoon" on Maui and enjoyed our stay at the Wailea Beach Mariott. The grounds are beautiful; open-air lobby particularly impressive. Found our room to be quite lovely - contrary to others' reviews, I liked the tile floors. The bed was perhaps the most comfy I've ever slept in (but beware - it is very soft and mushy...appropriate for my tastes, but heard other guests complaining that it hurt their backs). Wish the bathroom were a bit bigger (a full-size tub would have been appreciated). Slightly disappointed by the view; reserved a "partial ocean-view" - which we received...however, the part that was NOT ocean view as, in fact, a parking lot (boo). Pictures of the infinity pool do it justice. The lovely beach-walk that stretches the 1.3 miles in front of the Wailea hotel properties leads you (obviously) to two immaculate, beautiful beaches (do not worry that the hotel isn't immediately in front of a swimmable beach). Only two serious complaints: I find the $30 per day resort fee outrageous, particularly because it does not include internet services. Finally, the price of the poolside bar food was offensive - take a 5 minute drive and pick up great sandwiches at the 808 deli instead. I would certainly return to this property - thanks to Marriott for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations in some respects”
Reviews.Author: HVB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Marriott points, my husband is elite with Marriott so we did not have to pay for Internet, which colors my review. This was our third trip to Maui and the first to Wailea. This resort seemed more reasonably priced than nearby hotels and the beach is just steps away. The ocean views were great. We booked an oceanview room and were given an oceanview room, although at check in, I had to ask for a better view. Our anniversary was not acknowledged and we were not upgraded at all. We normally are but I understand points, and the hotel seemed jam-packed to me, so perhaps one was not available. I did not get a vibe of "lets wow the customer" here. Some aspects of the hotel were very good. When we requested extra coffee, towels, etc. they complied right away. I missed having turndown service but you get what you pay for. They do have a "freshen up" service upon request to bring clean towels and remove your trash which they remembered to do every night but once. We mostly ate at the Cheeseburger Island for breakfast. They have a $6 special for eggs, hashbrowns, toast, coffee, although they had other items too, and mimosas for $5. We had an early tee time one day and ate at the hotel buffet b/c they were open at 630 AM. (Cheeseburger opened at 8). If you are a Marriott Rewards member you get a discount on breakfast so sign up before you go if you are not already one. The buffet was plentiful and included an omlette station. The internet was not good, and we had to call their technical support people to get the wired highspeed to work in the room. They have wifi only in the lobby and also at Starbucks. For the price they charge for internet, it should at least be wifi property-wide. We opted for the valet at $30 daily instead of the resort fee for $25 since I had foot surgery and limited my walking. The valets were prompt although they felt a little robotic. The do have a shuttle service to other Wailea resorts if you are having dinner at another property. We appreciated that so we did not have to worry about driving back, although most other resorts are a lovely beach walk away. The adults only serenity infinity pool was anything but serene with folks getting up at 630 to claim their spaces for the day. If you waited until 9 to get a chair you were out of luck. It was annoying and we watched this happen every morning from our balcony overlooking the pool. There was bar service at the pool and folks thought nothing of yelling back and forth. We went to another pool in the afternoon and were given an oval-shaped cushion with a shade that normally goes for $25 a day. We got drinks from the bar so they comped our cushion. it was late in the day and this pool was quieter than the adults only pool. Poolside drink service from Lori was great. There is a separate pool for children, which was great as we were traveling without. I think they have 4 pools total. The infinity pool is freezing cold. We saw one couple who had bought the $500+ private dinner for two in the cabana over the pool and I would recommend a later dinner hour than they had, which was before sunset as there were still people splashing and hollering around in the pool. It could not have been romantic at that time. There are 2 hammocks on the property in case you love swaying to them by the coean, although they are both near guest rooms, so if you are lucky, you get that room :). The hotel has a pretty good happy hour and they have some food specials as well. The room exceeded my expectations as I had read some negative reviews here. Our room was very large, with a flat-screen tv we never turned on. There was a sofabed and another large chair in addition to the desk. We had ample storage space and I liked the tile floors. Their AC system does not work with the patio door open, which is common and better for the environment. The hair dryer was 1600 watt but surprisingly powerful. The bathroom area was clean and nice. The decor was also pleasant with muted, calm, pastel colors. The bed was comfortable but we own a Marriott bed so it was exactly what we expected. The linens were nice and very snuggly too. The self laundry was a nice touch and not too expensive. We ate at Mala and I will review that separately as we had a rather unusual experience, although the food was good and the views were great. Matteo's pizza just up the road was terrific and their casual environment made a nice antidote to the fancy tropical dinners that got to be a bit much after 8 days. Their pizza is really really good. They were also a great value. We ate lunch once at Bistro Molokini at the Grand Wailea as part of a spa package from the Grand Wailea and it was pretty good too with portions large enough for sharing. We ate at Nick's Fish Market at the Fairmont and it was incredible. Some staff members at the Marriott were very cheerful and helpful. Some were not. Part of our problem is that we came here after the Koa Kea in Kauai and the service levels are not on the same parallel at all. All in all it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Kellyjeanbean
Reviews.Content: We planned our wedding in Maui and wanted a place where all of our guests could stay. We decided on the Marriot because we had our rehearsal dinner at their luau, which everyone loved. The rooms were large and very clean, the beds were amazingly comfortable, and the location was perfect. Super close to shopping and a few restaurants, and lovely beaches. There was a starbucks on site, and local artists and vendors set up in the mornings so you could peruse their goods. It was a bit expensive, but I'm sure most places in Maui are. The hotel staff was easy to work with, when one of our guests missed their flight they had no hassles changing their reservations. Overall, very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in MAUI-Wowee”
Reviews.Author: SusaF
Reviews.Content: So we decided to spend our honeymoon in Maui and opted for the Marriot. Lets me start by saying it was a pleasant stay all the way. There wasn't that many people, so check in was a breeze. We were offered an upgrade to ocean view, but decided to save the $50 a night on food or activities. We stayed in the Terrance view room, it had a okay view, but mostly of the parking lot. We were not planning on staying in the room all day so we didn't mind it. The rooms were clean and air conditioned. The bed was super comfty too. We ordered room service for breakfast and let me say..it was pricey, but good. And your on vacation so why not splurge a little. For $22 you get what you pay for. The grounds are very green and well kept. There are 2 beaches to choose from and they are both good choices. The ocean water was perfect; clear, calm and not freezing. They have 2 pools, which were decent, but if i had to choose between the beach and a pool, i pick beach. You can book all your activities and rent a car at the hotel, which was fast and easy. We rented a car, which i recommend and toured the island. They have Luaus and other activities so you dont have to leave. The Restaurant Mala, was alright. If you get a chance, go out and try the local spots, food is way better. Overall it was a great stay and wouldn't mind stayig here again. Bad part was the $30 resort fee per day...but a perfect romantic spot for anyone who wishes to spark a fire.

Reviews.Title: “I would not pay full price for this room”
Reviews.Author: yorway
Reviews.Content: We got an internet special for the room @ $200 per night plus the $30 a day resort fee. I think that the normal fee is somewhere around $400. Before all the add ons. The hotel grounds and outside decor are very nice. The room itself was clean but just an average hotel room. My first surprise was the ceramic tile floors I had previously only seen this type if flooring in Mexico and some parts of Europe. The bathrooms had been recently remodeled with marble countertops and new faucets. The tub stopper did now work and required pulling out of the tub every morning. The dressers looked tired with wear around the handles. The maid service was good with the exception of my new found friend "Penny". I found her on the floor under the computer station on the night we arrived. That Lincoln coin was still there the day we left. I found the staff courteous but not overly friendly with the exception of one desk clerk who got very upset when we disputed a charge that we did not incur. He told us to take it to the management and that he would not change the bill. The Mala Restaurant (which is not run by the hotel.) is not the place to eat dinner. We found the food to be terrible and the cost high. The waitress was very rude and treated us as if we had just come crawling out of the sewer.The breakfast buffet was small compared to others but the food was fresh and replenished in a timely fashion. Again the cost is to high for what you get. Full price with no coupons was $35 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay here - but the little ants in the room really grossed me out...”
Reviews.Author: jsl_00
Reviews.Content: The Wailea area is a very high end area of Maui, with some very nice houses and some gated communities. All the hotels here are very pricey, and the Marriott is the cheapest one (though after taxes and hotel resort fees, it really isn't THAT cheap) so I guess you "get what you pay for". That being said, I would rate this hotel as average. We stayed in the Haleakala villa, on the 5th floor. Our room was right at the elevator but we were not bothered by noise. The elevators smelled like crap all 4 days that we stayed there. The carpet was disgusting and probably the cause of the stink. It was actually awful. Our room was just average, we were lucky enough to have one of the rooms w/ the flat screen lcd tvs...we noticed that many of the ocean/pool view rooms had the older box TVs which would have been a big disappointment for us. When we got to the room, there was a dead fly on the ground. Did housecleaning forget to sweep? We also saw little ants all around the room - in the bathroom, on the dresser, everywhere. It was to the point that I had to keep my luggage zipped up the whole time, and I was actually concerned about ants in the bed and checked the bed before sleeping. This made the stay pretty uncomfortable. There were ants all over the resort which is understandable as it is lush and green - but I would expect that for what you're paying the rooms would be ant free. We also saw ants in the hospitality room we used. The hotel's saving grace is the adults only infinity pool - it is ABSOLUTELY gorgeous. The many other pools at the hotel were nothing to write home about. As mentioned, we were able to use a hospitality room to shower before our 10pm flight back to Canada...we were really glad that it was available for our use. The hotel is next to the Shops at Wailea which has some pretty decent shopping. Not as good as Waikiki though ;) There are two beaches on either side of the hotel, the one to the right has great snorkeling though the beach is really small. The one to the left (wailea beach) also had some snorkeling but for the most part the waves were too strong to snorkel. The beaches are ok - not white sand but the sand is soft... the water is okay as well though there are nicer beaches around Maui to visit if you have a car. Also, there is a $25 resort fee per day. It does include self parking though so I don't think it's unreasonable since some hotels would charge for parking anyway - but just be aware of this. The service at this hotel is ok - I didn't think housecleaning was that great but the woman that checked us out was awesome - she was the one who told us about the hospitality room and also updated our key cards so that we could have access to the parking garage until our flight (otherwise our in out privileges would have terminated). I don't think I would stay at this hotel again. Had there not been ants in our room, I would consider booking here again if the price were right.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Pleasant Hawaian Vacations”
Reviews.Author: Daniel G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for over two weeks in a two room suite with a partial ocean view. The stay was pleasant and the location of our room was quiet. The staff, from bell staff, to front desk, concierge, pool concierge, restaurant, etc were all outstanding and made our stay enjoyable. The beds are comfortable, the room decor is a bit dated. While we were there, they changed out the televisions to LG flat screens. The TV service was terrible. The sets would go out due to LodgeNet problems, the remotes would suddenly stop working. The Hotel was very responsive and the contractor (Matt) in charge of the conversion practically lived in our room and did the best he could. He even gave us his cell and asked to call him as soon as we experienced any problems. The problem though was with LodgeNet the service provider for the Hotel. They constantly had to download the channel line-up. We also had several spa treatments. They were good but overpriced. We ended up canceling services during our second week and had them done at a place in Kihei. One of the pluses we enjoyed greatly is the Starbucks. Good for a quick breakfast of good oatmeal. The pineapple sold at Starbucks (1/4 or1/2) was the sweetest we had on the island. Overall, we had a great time. The Hotel is not super luxurious but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Emiliano L
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great staff, great location at a very low price! The hotel offers 5 amazing pools, 2 of which are located in front of the ocean. There are no private beaches, but a few nice ones are can be reached in a few minutes walk from the hotel. Concerning dining, the restaurant serves great food... Do not miss the breakfast, which is simply AMAZING! Do not miss this hotel if you are in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “A LITTLE SLICE OF HEAVEN :)”
Reviews.Author: philbert09
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for our honeymoon and we had such a blast! It was truly a magical experience for us!!! Firstly, the hotel is simply gorgeous. The grounds are well kept and the beach is a short walk away. The pools are amazing - we especially appreciated the separating of the adult and childrens pools (makes a huge difference). The staff are amazing and are all very helpful. The rooms are lovely! I recommend a room looking at our over the beach, the views are breathtaking. I could go on and on but please believe me when i say its worth every dollar you spend. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “On the water, but not ON the beach”
Reviews.Author: mazmom
Reviews.Content: This resort is lovely. Strangely laid out and a long walk to everything. It is ON the ocean but it does not have a beach... there is a beach on either side, so you can definitely walk easily. They have several pools including a kids pool with great looking slide and an adult-only infinity pool (with no cell phones allowed). I LOVE the look and feel of the lobby and entrance to this place... simply glorious! Wailea is a lovely area - lush and green and upscale, next to several very high-brow resorts - but it is far from Lahaina, which a lot of people feel is synonymous with Maui, so keep this in mind. As with all hotels, they nickel and dime you for everything. (Why is it that low-end hotels and condos give you free internet yet at nicer, more expensive places, they want to gouge you for an additional $15 a day for internet?) $25 a day for parking but they want you to upgrade to $30 a day for some discounts etc. Movies in the room are $16 each. We were promised free internet and then denied it when we got here and I forgot to write down the name of the person that assured me as marriott members, we would have it. The manager here would NOT budge. She did not want to honor what I was told. In the end, she ended up giving us 3 days free... but I REALLY had to persist, strongly. Our TV did not work almost our whole stay. Apparently there was a problem with the whole hotel. This was a bummer because we are not party people and like to lay low and watch in-room (still in theaters) movies every night and we couldn't do that. The staff was VERY helpful, friendly, patient, and apologetic. What more can we expect? These beds are S U P E R soft. So if you like that, you will be DELIGHTED! *We* like a moderately firm mattress... Hubs even tried sleeping on couch pull-out bed one night because the bed was harming his back. The pillows are also super squishy. Feather or foam only and all very soft. Non-fitted sheets on mattress are constantly coming off because you sink so deeply in to ulta soft mattress. The towel situation is a little strange with towel cards, but oh well, no big deal. We liked Connie at the activity desk by the infinity pool. She helped us book our adventure rafting trip... one of the best we have done. Would we stay here again? I think so, if the price was right. Overall, it was a nice property with mostly friendly staff in a lovely location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but everything is an extra fee, not right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: yankeetravels27
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, several pools, but almost every activity including body boarding and snorkeling was an additional fee. While it is not right on the beach, you can walk about 5 minutes and be on the beach. They have many activities that you can book at the hotel, but the price adds up after awhile. It is right next store to the Grand Wailea. There is a mall of sorts within walking distance that has a few restaurants, but beyond that you need to cab it into town to have other non resort food options, which again get very expensive after awhile. If I had it to do over again I would pick something right on the beach that had some eating options within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: travelintheusa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 30th anniversary and absolutely loved it. Had an ocean front room that was wonderful. Found the bed to be very comfortable and left the sliding door open every night so that we could hear the waves. The staff was very nice and loved the fact that the resort was designed to take full advantage of being on the ocean (didn't have to worry about tracking sand and your wet bathing suit back in because of all tile floors.) The beaches on either end of the resort are sand and this makes for some nice r and r time, but there is also some rocky points to snorkle near and catch sight of some honu. Food prices are high, so plan on bringing in some of your own to help offset.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Pool, but high prices and bad mattress”
Reviews.Author: SemanticZen
Reviews.Content: Our room here was nothing fancy and the mattress appeared to be from the 1980s. Also, they rape you on food. When we first arrived my girlfriend ordered a chicken salad from the little restaurant: $30 + tax and tip! A burger and fries at the pool cost about $20. Oh, but the pool is well how should I say.... awesome! We did Hana drive during the 5 days we stayed here and while the drive is awesome renting a car from the onsite Hertz was over $100 for the day. Also, every restaurant in walking distance is outrageously priced. So if you're on a budget I'd suggest skipping this hotel, but if you want an awesome pool - this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome with the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Victor909
Reviews.Content: Booked on priceline for 90 and then added 50 for 100 percent unobstructed ocean view upgrade on check in , turns this into a fantastic value. Great facility, next to wailea beach and the grand wailea. We loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Danny D
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Wailea and had an amazing time. My wife and I were there on our honeymoon and were treated so well. We got upgraded to an oceanview room overlooking Ulua Beach that was nice, orderly, and quiet. The Serenity Pool is freakin awesome. The unique layout of the resort allows for the spectacular views of the infinity pool (due to rocky coasts) and two great beaches just a short walk away (when I say short, it may as well be on the resort grounds). The employees treated us so so well, giving us local advice on sights (Zeptember was a great experience) and restaurants. I had such a great time there, and cannot wait to return. Thank you for the great honeymoon and experience, Marriott Wailea!!

Reviews.Title: “Sore back”
Reviews.Author: TazzyCat16
Reviews.Content: We just stayed as a group of 6 in 3 separate rooms. The resort is nice because of it's location but unfortunately we all agreed we wouldn't return (we plan on visiting maui every year) because of the really uncomfortable beds. Maybe we just weren't given the best rooms as far as the bedding goes as others have said they liked their "soft" beds. My bed gave no support at all and after spending 3 weeks prior to visiting the resort at many hotels across the USA and Honolulu I came to the conclusion that Wailea Marriott really didn't match anything else we stayed in. I was so happy to finally leave knowing that I could have a good night's sleep in a decent bed with pillows that actually supported my head and neck. I stayed in room 4435 so I'd recommend anyone planning on visiting this resort to not request that room.

Reviews.Title: “An Incredible Luau that Should Be Booked if One Is Near Wailea.”
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: My partner and I really, really enjoyed this luau, even though it is not considered to be the most "traditional" Hawaiian in terms of the dancing and show. The drinks were fairly excellent, and there was no line for drinks the whole evening. The bartenders were excellent. Moreover, we didn't have to wait long for anything, the food, dessert, or drinks. We paid for the upgrade to premium seating, and the premium seats definitely justified the extra expenditure. Additionally, the setting was supremely beautiful, and the sunset was superlative. The only negative was the $20 cost for the professional photo of the two of us. Yet, the picture was so excellent that we bought it anyway. And did I mention the food? It was fantastic, delicious, and about perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amymooney
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here in September for our honeymoon and we fell in love with this hotel. We got up graded to an ocean view and watching the sunset at night was one of the most beautiful things we have ever seen. Not to mention the infinity pool is amazing, the grounds are absolutely beautiful, and the location is great (near 2 really nice beaches good for swimming and snorkeling). The beds here were like sleeping on pillow clouds - i slept so well! We had a great time staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: ErinVanTiem
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here in May for our honeymoon. Breakfast was delicious - loved sitting on the patio in the morning. Also enjoyed the food for Dinner - excellent Ahi Tuna. The adult pool area was very relaxing and clean. There is a nice walkway along the ocean. Saw the most amazing sunset ever here!!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott ruined this hotel! It used to be an Outrigger.”
Reviews.Author: lana90025
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in dec 2003 and it was perfect and beautiful. It was a traditional Hawaiian feel hotel and was absolutely perfect. Marriott bought it and absolutely ruined it. We are staying here now - September 2011. Marriott redid the hotel and tossed out the traditional Hawaiian feel and replaced it with ugly modern furnishings, unfriendly staff, a dirty adult infinity pool that they don't do proper upkeep on, and gauge their hotel guests with $30 a day resort fee which if you want a lounge chair on their lawn you will be charged $62 a day extra! They have only high priced restaurants and a starbucks. As I. Am writing this I am being bitten by tiny spider ants that are all over the room. Mind you we paid $380 a night for our not so clean oceanfront room with bugs. Thanks Marriott for destroying a beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “How about one word... Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Sondra1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple came for New Years. Loved the resort. Our room was awesome. Very clean and all areas were well maintained. Got to see whales several mornings. Enjoyed eating breakfast in the restaurant with an ocean view each morning. Only downside was you have to walk to the beach. However, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Oooo - that infinity pool”
Reviews.Author: Mike11201
Reviews.Content: This Marriott sits right on the water in the beautiful southwest coast of Maui. My wife and I enjoyed the numerous pools (some of which are adult only) and the peaceful and breathtaking views from our 3rd floor ocean view room. The accommodations are a bit worn but they are also quiet, pleasant and modern. Our king size bed was soft and the maid service was excellent. The faucet in our tub wasn't securely fastened behind the wall, so it would vibrate loudly as we tried to take a shower (only at certain water temperatures...weird). As most resorts in this locale, prices for meals and activities can get expensive, but they weren't out of line with similar properties. I have a big shout-out to the pool concierges who were extremely friendly and helpful in recommending our snorkel, dining and driving excursions. The Marriott hosts a lovely luau, with all the expected food and activities. The public beaches are within a few minutes' walk from the compound, and you can rent umbrellas, chairs, boogeyboards and more. It would be nice if the beach was part of the compound - considering the price. But there's only so much beach to go around, I guess. Shopping is super convenient but you might want to rent a car to venture a bit farther away. The Shops at Wailea are on the expensive side. This is a good resort, and the staff here does an excellent job. My primary reason for the downgrade was the noisy shower and the scratched/dinged furniture in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort with beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSZ
Reviews.Content: The resort grounds are incredible! the infinity pool is a great touch and very realxing. The rooms could be a little more udpated.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views ... great resort!”
Reviews.Author: ngozi23
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVED this resort and was extremely sad to leave. From the beginning of my stay, the staff was nice, courteous and made me feel special. My room had a view of the children's pool, luau, and the Ocean. I ate in the dining room nightly and enjoyed the sunset views. This resort is over a mile long and i especially enjoyed running the beachfront trail every morning which is actually over a mile long because it connects with other properties. STING performed a live concert at another resort but the staff told us we could watch the concert from the beach and we did!!!! It was awesome. The bedroom was spacious but slightly dated (old furniture, box TV)... no worries, didn't spend much time in the room at all. Most nights I relaxed in the hammock and listened to the Ocean. We rented a car and parking was included in our resort fee, free Starbucks every morning along with discounts for breakfast and dinner. The laundry facility was clean and the times for washing/drying was posted clearly. I can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “a nice and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: dex2971
Reviews.Content: The hotel campus is HUGE, right in front of the beach. The location is very convenient, can walk into shopping few steps away. The room is clean and quite. check-in is fast. staffs are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely South Maui Resort”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl T
Reviews.Content: We stay at Wailea Beach Marriott, located on the south Maui coast, every year for business/pleasure. Major renovations inside and out have created a lovely esthetic to both rooms and grounds. Front staff and concierge service are top notch. Many rooms and pool areas have a million dollar view of the ocean. The ocean front suites are separate from the main hotel and are worth the splurge. It is reasonably geared for families with a dedicated pool site. The infinity pool area is adults only - a plus for guests seeking a serene setting. Pool-side servers are friendly and attentive, and the pool menu for drinks and food is predictable but very good. Dining options are limited at the Marriott. Mala Restaurant is on site, and our couple of meals there found it lacking the "Wow" factor that the original location in Lahaina has. There's an excellent morning breakfast buffet. It comes with serious sticker shock, but that's true at every other resort too. Other fine dining options are available at nearby resorts; with Pacific Grill at the Four Seasons and Nicks Fish Market at the Fairmont topping our list. Wailea in general lends itself to couples with relaxation or golf as prime objectives. The Shops at Wailea next door cater to high end shopping (Louis Vuitton, Gucci, Tiffany & Co, Fendi, etc) for the Fairmont/Four Seasons crowd down the road, as well as a nice selection of stores for mere mortals. Restaurant choices there include Cheeseburger in Paradise and Longi's. While good they lack the charm of their Lahaina locations. To explore outside of Wailea you'll need a rental car.
