Kihei to the north is a great spot for family eating and hanging out, with wide beaches at public parks and assorted recreation opportunities (surfing, scuba, snorkeling, swimming, paddle-boarding). Family dining in Kihei won't break the budget at Senor Frogs, Kihei Caffe, or a number of other moderately priced restaurants. Families will love Kalama Village Marketplace for Island 'stuff' (Don't be shy - bargain with vendors! If you go early you'll hear "You're my first customer today so I give you special price". They will!) You'll find the Wailea Marriott a lovely vacation home base, nice resort amenities, and lots to do and see in surrounding areas as long as your have your trusty car rental. Book it, Dano ;)

Reviews.Title: “good service but why I need to pay for parking?”
Reviews.Author: peggy_teo
Reviews.Content: We can only checked in the hotel at 4pm, but that's ok, since we spend much time travelling around. The location of the hotel is just perfect, with the shopping complex just next to it. But it is quite secluded, so if you wanna eat local food at local restaurant, you will need to drive out. We got an ocean view room and it's just perfect view, unlike what Ritz Carlton offered us - partial ocean view with all the trees blocking. I like the beach path along marriott to other adjacent hotels. Very romantic path to walk on evening. Service is standard but drinking water is not provided for free. No breakfast included also. What's incredible, we had to pay for parking 25bucks a day! The hotel structure is confusing and we got lost a few times. The elevator only available at 4th floor and imagine, we have to carry our luggage from 3rd to 4th floor by stairs when checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, relaxing, great for honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Simone029
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff friendly and helpful. Beautiful location, clean, relaxing. Facilities were great, close to the shopping centre. Romantic, loved the adults only pool - peaceful with stunning views.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly and fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Brit48
Reviews.Content: From the moment I checked in the staff were very accommodating, friendly and helpful. My room overlooked the children's very safe play area and through to the ocean. The adult pools (infinity) were staffed with great poolside servers who catered to any needs required. The dining room opened to the ocean where the best view of Hawaii's spectacular sunset could be observed while at the same time enjoying a very good meal My whole stay was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely area, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Increasing-Velocity
Reviews.Content: The Marriott in Wailea is among a plethora of gorgeous hotels, such as the Four Seasons, Fairmont and the Grand Wailea, and in our opinion holds its own. There are, perhaps, some nicer high end touches at the Four Seasons et al, but the grounds of the Marriott are spectacular, with a prime spot around a curve and within easy walking distance to beach in both directions (note this hotel has no beach of its own, which disappoints some travelers who have not done their research). There are walking paths meandering all around, through the most lush and beautiful scenery...Wailea is just gorgeous, although not as lush as the northern side where it rains a LOT. Our first morning, upon waking and looking out the window, the scene that greeted us looked like a technicolor dream...unreal. From the ice water with pineapple and sugar cane (see pics) to the waterfall and huge, gorgeous trees flanking the drive and foyer area, to the spectacular views, this place is heaven. The rooms are OK - spacious enough and simple, with VERY comfortable beds. I suspect some other hotels have fancier rooms from pics I've seen, so as always your choices will depend on your priorities. There is certainly nothing wrong with the rooms, they are just simple, letting the scenery do the talking. Sigh!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Awful Service”
Reviews.Author: JimJ3
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Wailea Marriott. The first experience five years ago was wonderful, and it definitely left a favorable impression. Unfortunately, my latest visit left a lot to be desired, service-wise. The staff seemed to have difficulty understanding the needs of their guests. Checking into the hotel was probably the only time we did not encounter poor service. Our first morning there, we went down for the breakfast buffet, and when we went up to get food, we would come back to find the table had been cleared of everything, even though personal items had been left on the table. Our waitress apologized and said it was due to new bus and clean up staff. OK, everyone is entitled to a mistake, and it is nice that the restaurant is kept clean. Our second morning, the same tthing occurred, this time with a "seasoned" busboy. We got profuse apologies and were told that it was "unacceptable" that our table had been cleared early. When I told him the same thing had happened the day before, he was rather embarassed. What was worse was that our table was near the bus/cleaning station, and we could hear the bus staff loudly discussing how much they "F-ing hated this job". Probably the last thing a customer wants to hear when being served food is that they have a disgruntled staff waiting on them. I approached the manager with my concerns, and was basically given lip service. She was very nice, but stated that she only worked two mornings a week, which apparently translated to the concept that nothing would be done. That was the last time we ate at the hotel. We were on the island for a family event, and would often return to the hotel between 10 and 11 PM. Generally, Self Parking would be closed at that time, and all hotel guests would have to go to Valet to gain admittance to the parking area. Late one evening we returned to find no one available at Valet, and no one to assist in gaining access to park the car. After 15 minutes, someone from the front desk wandered by, and told us that "someone will be with you shortly". When I stated that it had already been a 15 minute wait, she proceeded to basically offer excuses but no assistance. When she finally decided to help, she gave the excuse that she couldn't see us waiting from the front desk, and they weren't really checking that closely. The final problem was on check out. The bill included several charges that didn't belong on my bill, including meals and movies that were listed to another room number on the bill. When I brought this to the attention of the clerk, she asked if I had changed rooms, because the system had me in several rooms during my stay. When I told her that we hadn't moved, it took some research before we could resolve the incorrect charges, and the only explanation I received was that the system showed I had been in several rooms during our stay. Overall, it just basically seemed that the staff always had an excuse for bad service, but did nothing to improve. Physically the hotel is beautiful and relaxing. But the service is enough to make you want to switch hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Take the good with the bad....(nice property, but not very Hawaian in feel)”
Reviews.Author: txgerman1
Reviews.Content: A recent stay at the Mariott in Wailea had some definite positives; as well as some negatives.... On the plus side; beautifully manicured grounds, expensive but decent food, and one of the more spectacular views in Maui certainly make this a worthy destination; particularly when using Marriott rewards points as I did...... However; for those looking for an authentic Hawaii experience; this is not the hotel for you.It could have been a Marriott in San Antonio, San Diego or anywhere for that matter. Didnt really get the sense that there was anything distinctly Hawaian here; the place almost felt sterile. Another gripe; a beautiful main pool surrounded by individual pool front cabanas that primarily sat empty due to the rather exorbitant daily rental rates associated with them. Perhaps rethinking this strategy and making them available for an hour or two at a time, rather than having them roped off and sitting empty.... (having a pool front bar wouldnt be a bad thing either, especially since during one 3 hour stretch at this pool, I only saw a waitress once) Overall; the property was very typical of Marriott; clean, well manicured, nice rooms.... but exceptionally sterile and dull!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: KbbOc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice. Rooms are clean, not huge but big enough. Skip Mala restaurant for dinner, too pricy- food not good enough. Mala for breakfast buffet was great. Water-slides and pools are fantastic. Would for sure stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: MainePeter
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to this property. We had an oceanfront room which was about 50 yards from the water. The sunsets were remarkable every evening. The room was decent sized, certainly adequate for our needs. The room decor and furnishings reflected the local area. The lanai was spacious. The property itself is meandering. The landscaping is tropical and well maintained. The lobby area is open air and inviting. We were particularly pleased with the solitude of the infinity pool. Children are not permitted in this particular area, so it was very relaxing. For families traveling with children, there are other pools that appeared to be well suited to family style vacationing. We read prior reviews which lamented the fact that the hotel is not technically "beachfront." Pay no attention to this. There are nice beaches immediately adjacent to the hotel on either side, no more than a 1 minute walk. We only ate one meal in the hotel restaurant. It was very good. The hotel is located along a beach walk which fronts many other hotels and eateries. There is also a very upscale shoppng center with restaurants within walking distance. The on site store (it is much more than a "gift shop") is well stocked with anything and everything that could be needed. The fitness center was well equipped. Overall a very nice and well situated property. We'll be back...but not soon enough!

Reviews.Title: “Beaitful Island!!! Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Onthefly3
Reviews.Content: So pretty! The air condition in our room wasn't working and they failed to resolve the problem, so the service wasn't very great and our room wasn't ocean front when we paid for ocean front.... but the staff later apoligized and they ending up putting us in a two bedroom suite with a beaitful ocean veiw. But if I return to Hawaii I would like to stay on another island. There was 2 beaches on both sides of the hotel but directly in front of the hotel its kind of like a cliff and its rocky and you can't swim in it. There are 3 pools and one of the pools is an adult pool, and there are 2 water slides, But there more for young children.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Tyler R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. We loved every minute of it. The resort was immaculate. Our room was beautiful and clean. We really have no complaints. Hotel staff was always nice and helpful. The resort had a beautiful open air lobby that was just breath taking. It was our first trip to Hawaii, so stepping out of the car and seeing this open air lobby and the ocean right behind it really made it seem like we were in paradise. While we didn't swim in the infinity pool (come on, the ocean is right there!) it was gorgeous. The property was beautiful and connected with the ocean gardens that run next to the ocean through Wailea. Through the ocean gardens walkway you have access to some of the best beaches in Maui just minutes away from your room. We saw a sea turtle while snorkeling. Watching the sunset from the property was beautiful- everyone would stop what they were doing to watch. Definitely would stay here again if we come back. It really was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Less is More”
Reviews.Author: bs21403
Reviews.Content: Traveling as a couple with no kids, we loved the Marriott Wailea. We checked out the other hotels along the path and we were so glad we chose the Marriott. The other hotels, Grand Wailea, 4 Seasons, etc were too big, lavish, concrete, Las Vegas for us. While that may be great in Vegas, we prefer the natural beauty of Maui and the Marriott does a good job at blending the resort and the natural beauty of ocean, grounds and scenery. We loved the simplicity of the resort that allowed the natural beauty shine.

Reviews.Title: “great stay better than expected”
Reviews.Author: waltermichael
Reviews.Content: this is a good property and service is nice vvas so so. the check in took 20 minutes after a 9 hour trip this is not the way to start beautiful location the big surprise is the resteraunt, beyond expectations for dinner, so so for breakfast. concierge's are awesome and turned us on to some fun experiences. bottom line i would return, not quite the four seasons but not far away either. weight room needs some heavier weights for serious work out

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room for honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Slvrscoobie
Reviews.Content: Cannot praise this resort enough! Fantastic! Stayed for 7 days but spent one night on the big island, which stinks because the room was so nice. Honeymoon package was cheap and got you an upgrade to ocean view, but when we checked in, we got further upgraded to ocean front. Water was ~30ft from our balcony. Listened to the waves all night. Quite and luxurious. The only doors in the entire resort were on the rooms and everything flowed and felt very open. The 'adult' pool was fantastic. If I could stay there again tomorrow, I would! Only downside was since we were near the water, the car garage was a bit of a walk, but not terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location!”
Reviews.Author: sweetnneka
Reviews.Content: The hotel and grounds were extremely well kept, we were upgraded to a room with an ocean view within walking distance of the pool. The only downside is that there really wasn't any beach on property, you have to walk down to Wailea Beach on the trail. Overall, it is a nice property. We will likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Wailea Mariott!”
Reviews.Author: PatQ_11
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the negative reviews of this hotel and I'd just like to say that we really enjoyed our recent stay here. The pools were very nice, the beaches were great, the hotel staff was very friendly, and the food at the restaurants was excellent. The breakfast buffet was above average, in my opinion. The hotel is very quiet, peaceful, and laid back. It seemed that a lot of people were staying there, but the place never seemed crowded. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Brian W
Reviews.Content: Aloha! There's been several reviews of this Marriott that were negative. My wife and I just came back from 5 nights in Maui, at this resort, and I couldn't find the problems people were reporting. Here's the facts from our stay; -We stayed on points, I'm an Elite or Platinum member if that matters. -I was emailing Rachel, their Virtual Concierge, and told them it was our 15th wedding anniversary. When we arrived we were upgraded to an Ocean front room - it was front and center over the infinity pool. -All the staff, from the landscapers to the front desk, were very nice and friendly. -Our room was clean, no issues with housecleaning. - The infinity pool is cold...but you get used it, you are in Hawaii -The pictures of the resort are professionaly done, if you look at some that people have posted it's more realistic. -The beach is very easy to access, we liked the one on the right (north) side better, Ulua I think is what it's called. -Rent your snorkel gear and what else in Kihei, it's 10 minutes away and half the price. -We spent one day - our anniversary - as "Resort Day." We never left the resort, we had a few beverages by the pool and then did the couples massage thing. As I guy, I could have done without that as it was VERY expensive. We also had dinner at the the Malla Wailea at the hotel, it was good. Overall, it was a fantastic experience. I don't understand what all the complainers were talking about in previous reviews. Even staying on points, we are accustomed to being 'second class' to those that paid, which I sort of understand. But in this case it was not like that at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!! Perfect for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Kelster58
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous hotel. We were on our honeymoon and couldn't have asked for more welcoming and pleasant service and facilities. On arrival we immediately received a room upgrade - perfect location and shortly after arriving in our room, we received champagne on ice, courtesy of the hotel. Rooms were cleaned thorougly every day with notes left to mind the wet floor. The decor and furniture were new, fresh and clean. All the staff were friendly, approachable and accommodating. We had use of a guest room to shower and change before leaving for the airport at 6pm after checking out at 12pm. I couldn't disagree more with the two or three people who have written negative comments about this hotel. We visited the Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons next door for dinner and whilst having nice restaurants, the complexes gave the impression of being far bigger and busier with sun loungers and cabanas crammed in - we had plenty of space, an eternity pool for over 18s only and no cell phones - what more could you want?? It wasquite expensive but not in comparison for what you are getting - this is an island where near enough eveything has to be shipped in and the main income is through tourism. Honestly... We used the spa too - very good also. Go and see for yoursefl - we couldn't fault this hotel in any way!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, fine rooms, superb staff!”
Reviews.Author: doffill
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from 10 wonderful days in Maui. We stayed in a lovely beachfront studio condo in West Maui, where we were scheduled to check out at 11:00am on Saturday and then have to occupy ourselves and our luggage until our 10:30pm redeye took off. We have been to Maui many times and have had this problem before - one which makes the last day on the island rather antclimatic. This trip, my wife found a great room rate for Friday night at the Wailea Beach Marriott Resort and Spa, so we left the condo early on Friday to spend our last Maui night at the Marriott. What an incredibly great choice! My wife had negotiated a 2pm checkout Saturday and we were able to check our bags with the bellhops until we were ready to leave around six. We spent the rest of the afternoon snorkeling at the beach to the right of the resort (5-10 minute walk) and lounging around the infiniti pool and hot tub. We had been told that the hotel had courtesy rooms where we could shower late in the day and change clothes for the flight. A wonderful young woman named Toni at the desk provided us an even better plan. She informed us that we could get a $5 a person day pass to the lovely spa in the hotel and could have access to a secure locker, steam room and shower before we left for the airport. The spa facilites were fabulous, and my wife and I were the only ones in our respective locker rooms during the period we used them. The showers and dressing area had high-end amenities - rich shampoo, conditioner and body wash, an abundance of clean fluffy towells, individual robes and shaving supplies, etc. Our room was clean and spacious, with a nice patio; we passed on the $75 dollar upgrade to ocean view. The bathroom and bed were both excellent. We had had dinner earlier in our stay at the Four Season in Wailea, and the public areas in the Marriott were, if not quite as high-end, quite open, comfortable and breezy. The guests at the Marriott also seemed a bit more mainstream (at least to us). Besides Toni at the front desk, we had great service from Larry and Trent in the bell area. We got on that redeye refreshed and comfortable, thanks to our experience at the Wailea Marriott. It was the perfect end to a wonderful trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, would come back anytime.”
Reviews.Author: atima
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in August 2011 and had a great time. The staff was excellent; friendly, helpful and fast. We needed transportation to nearby golf courses and restaurants several times and they couldn't have been more accomodating. The grounds are beautiful. Hotel itself is one of the older ones in the area, but in a great spot. Short walk to beach, but no need to even go there when we could stay and enjoy the great infinity pool. Since it's a "serenity pool" (no one under 18) it was a great spot to just relax, enjoy the view and soak up the whole atmosphere. I do recommend upgrading to an oceanfront room, as we did. For the extra $75, we were about 30 yards from the ocean. We sat on our lanai and watched the sunset each night, listened to the ocean and just loved it. Short walk to shopping center where there are a few general stores if you want to buy snacks, wine, etc. Within 15 minutes along the beach are the Four Seasons, Fairmont and Grand Wailea for other great restaurant options as well. Our only complaint was that temperature contol in the room was erratic. Tough to get it cool enough during the day. Otherwise, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit did not disappoint - Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: KMme
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel once before on our first trip to Hawaii and loved it. We had such fond memories and wanted to return during our second trip to Hawaii. We booked it again and were hoping that the hotel would live up to our memories. It not only lived up to our fantastic memories, it exceeded them! We stayed for 9 nights with our 2 children, ages 8 and 10. We were in the Hale building with a view of the ocean, West Maui mountains, and a distant view of Mt. Haleakala. The room was large, decorated in an Asian motif, with a large balcony. Everything was in working condition and the beds were dreamy. The hotel grounds are exceptionally maintained. Landscaping is beautiful, everything is clean, and the hotel staff definitely have the aloha spirit. There are 5 pools here and we visited 4. The 2 children's pools were great - wonderful ocean views, lots of slides to keep the kids busy, lots of sun and shade and views to keep the parents busy. The other 2 pools were good as well. One is average, by the bar and not too crowded. The other is the infinity pool with two hot tubs that has unbeatable views. The last pool is the adults only pool that we did not visit but it looked very nice with great views also. There are 2 beaches nearby - Ulua and Wailea. Both are a short walk from the hotel. I have read mixed reviews about the walk to the beach(es) and I can tell you that the walk is not strenuous, long, or inconvenient in the least. There is a paved path along the ocean to both beaches. You can make Wailea beach in about 2 minutes and Ulua beach in about 3 minutes. I have stayed at beachfront resorts that took a longer walk to reach the beach. The Wailea beach has chairs, golden sands, and a nice swimming cove. The beach is shared with the hotel next door, so can be a bit crowded, but relaxing and a great beach nonetheless. The Ulua beach does not have chairs, so you'll have to bring some towels and "rough it" on the sand. The bonus here though is the coral reef within swimming distance. We went out multiple times (morning is the best since winds kick up in the afternoon in the winter) and saw lots of fish and coral. We ran into many snorkelers that saw sea turtles. It may not be the best coral reef in Hawaii, but it is nice and right in front of the hotel. The water is calm and the reef was within a short swimming distance even for kids. We ate in the hotel restaurant (separate review) a few times and visited the hotel gift shop many times. We couldn't have asked for more from this hotel. The pools, beaches, rooms, and aloha spirit were all top-notch. I know there are lots of hotels in Maui, but we haven't experienced any except this one. Now that we have been back twice, the Wailea Marriott has not given us any reason to try another hotel, so we will likely be back again on our next visit to Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 10sgolflover
Reviews.Content: We just finished a 10 day stay at the hotel and here are the positives: 1. The views everywhere were fantastic. Even the afternoon cloudy and windy views. 2. Staff was excellent - all very friendly. 3. Grounds were beautiful. Now the negatives: 1. Hotel rooms did seem a bit dated. We had an old style TV not a flat screen. 2. Carpeting in hall ways were worn out. 3. Roaches or some kind of little bugs in the room. 4. Thank goodness breakfast was included in our packages. Buffet not worth $25. 5. No beach directly in front - either north or south are excellent beaches. Just have to drag your chairs over. 6. The driveway to the hotel is extremely hard to find from the main highway. 7. Parking in the lot is for mini-cars - or just take up 2 spaces. 8. VERY expensive to do any excursions or trips. $400 for horseback riding for 2 people!!! The the area is beautiful and if you just concentrate on the beautiful surroundings and just enjoy it, you will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay very much”
Reviews.Author: MrsT21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used rewards points for a stay at this hotel and were definitely satisfied with our stay. While the resort isn't "fancy" and is a bit dated (though our room did appear to have been updated since some of the pictures that are currently posted on the site were taken), things were nice enough and were always clean. (Plus, you're in Hawaii -- go enjoy the wonderful weather and scenery outside!) The hallways are open-air, which is really nice, but it does mean that some leaves and flowers are going to make their way into the halls. The location -- Wailea -- was also perfect for us since it didn't feel like we were terribly far from anything, but it was in a quiet enough area that it didn't feel too "busy." We didn't try any of the restaurants, so I can't speak to the quality of the food. The grounds were really nice, which made for a great outdoor atmosphere, but our favorite thing about this resort was the service -- every person we came into contact with from the bellman to the pool attendant was extremely nice and happy to help us however he or she could with tours of the grounds, directions, or their favorite restaurant suggestions. The adult infinity pool was a great option for a little relaxation, and there's really great snorkeling if you make your way out in front of that pool from the neighboring beaches. (We saw at least two sea turtles in that area each day we went out!) As a side note, the parking spots in the deck are really small -- you can fit in them, but there could be trouble if anyone beside you pulls in crooked.

Reviews.Title: “If I return to hawaii will not stay there”
Reviews.Author: bank1234
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the morning and our room was not available, we were already discouraged. Then we had to upgrade our room and the floor was dirty. Bed was way to soft no support. Beautiful beaches and the food was fabulous but way to expensive. This resort needs to be updated it looks like it was built in the 70's and some upgraded is needed. Staff was ok, but could work on management to please there customers when departing from there trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great views and service”
Reviews.Author: Love2vacationpa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott for 6 nights with our 11 year old son. The hotel grounds are beautiful. Our room had an ocean view which was amazing. The staff here was very friendly and attentive . I do not know how anyone could write any bad reviews of this place, I can not think of one negative thing. One tip: get to pool early to reserve a seat with umbrella, at 12 the sun gets so hot you need shade. Had great dinners every evening most favorites were Tommy bahamas and Joe's Bar and Grill at the Wailea tennis courts.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel & Best Oceanview EVER”
Reviews.Author: Alexa8776
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two islands and two Marriott properties; Wailea Beach Marriott was far superior to the Kauai resort in Lihue. While the room was updated in Lihue, the oceanfront view we had just CAN NOT BE BEAT! Amazing infinity pools for adults and beautiful cabanas that could compete with Tahiti or Bora Bora. We arrived early after an all night flight and immediate check in made the big difference. Thank you Wailea Marriott for your consideration and compassion for the exhausted traveler. Restaurant at the hotel was wonderful; wonderful food, setting and service. Not cheap, the Wailea property made you feel welcomed and you got the big bang for your buck compared to the Kauai Marriott in Lihue.

Reviews.Title: “A VERY disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheryl M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not worthy of 4 diamonds. Our first room had a mattress that squeaked when you sat down on it. Our second room was not clean (footprints on the headboard, dirty curtains and dirty tile floors that left our feet filthy). The room was very damp and smelled of mildew. The staff did not have any polish. The grounds and pool were o.k...nothing special. We left after one night and spent the next 5 nights elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but not as good as a lot of other Marriotts”
Reviews.Author: pamalam
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Oahu for the first part of our trip and loved Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club. I was not as pleased with our stay on Maui and it's hard to put a finger on exactly what I didn't like. The open-air lobby was beautiful with the Pacific as the backdrop when we first arrived and I thought the food at the on-site Mala was very good. We had two great meals there. I would agree with other reviewers that the rooms are a bit tired and not up to Marriott standards. We stayed with points so cannot attest to the value. We did have a great view from our balcony but I was not crazy about the tile floors in the room. I know it's a beach but they can vacuum a carpet. We were also disappointed at the lack of wifi in the room. My husband is a Marriott platinum member and was able to get it free in the lobby, but I would think they could do better. We spent most of our pool time at the more kid-friendly pool and it was ok. The pool itself is nothing special, but the view of the ocean is spectacular, which makes up for a lot of negatives. We had food and beverage service out there and it was great. Nothing was served in styrofoam, they had nice baskets. I'm not sure why there wouldn't be service at the adult pool. I loved the area of Wailea. Our friends in Kaanapali said that was much busier and more crowded. We found some good places to eat, staying close a couple times and driving a bit to others. All in all, it's a nice place. But I think with a bit a money and updating it could be a really extraordinary place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location right on the Wailea boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: kaicavalier
Reviews.Content: Clean room with amazing comforter and amenities. This hotel is right on the Wailea boardwalk. Lovely infinity pool for adults only, a separate kids pool area too and a large family pool area with jacuzzi tub and lots of beach chairs. Directly in front of the hotel is grass, and there's a great beach within a couple minutes walk. Easy to park, although it cost $25/night plus tax. It rained briefly and no issue getting to the car in the rain since it was close to the hotel. Also, quick walk to the Wailea Mall which has high-end shops.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: dan62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights prior to a week stay at the Four Season's in Wilea. While this hotel can't compare to luxury properties like the 4S, for the price it was a very good option. The location is great, right on the beach in Wailea, and the hotel has a very nice pool overlooking the ocean. The rooms were ok, spacious, and clean. For the price it was a very good value, and a great option for someone who does not want to spend $400+ per night at the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Quite disappointed with this tired Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Tammy P
Reviews.Content: The location of this resort is beautiful but unfortunately the resort itself is tired and in need of a long overdue "freshen up", especially when you take into account that the room rates here are quite expensive. Our one bedroom oceanview suite had a nice view, but was out dated. We had another room beside us which could have been used as an interconecting to ours. We could here every noise coming from that room. There are no tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. The hallways are very outdated as far as decor, carpet, furnishings and wallpapers are concerned and are smelly and musty. The carpets are grubby. There is no wifi in the resort, which is incredible...even $30 a night backpacker accommodation have wifi. If Starbucks in the hotel has it why not the hotel? There is no service poolside unless you pay an extra $25 per day for a cabana. You have to go up to the bar yourself everytime you want to order a drink or food. There are not enough staff and even the staff and their uniforms are tired and wornout. The food poolside is absolutely dreadful! We ordered a nachos one evening, it was inedible made with the cheese out of a can,served in polystyrofoam container! The food and drinks are also overpriced. The restaurant was satisfactory but nothing to write home about and the decor and furnishings are also tired. The hotel charges an extra $30 per day plus tax "resort fee". I would really like to know what that fee is actually for! All in all we were very disappointed with our stay at the Marriott Wailea and feel we certainly did not get value for our money and the holiday we were very much looking forward too in a luxury resort. We certainly will not be staying there next year when we return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: Mitch16
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spend the Maui portion of our honeymoon at the Wailea Beach Marriott. We had a wonderful time here. The infinity pool is amazing with such wonderful views of the ocean. Very relaxing. The beach next to the resort is also great and has a reef just offshore where we snorkeled and saw tons of fish and several sea turtles. The rooms were nice and the beds were very comfortable. The on-site restaurant is pretty expensive however, so you might want to eat off-site. We attended one of the luau's which was good, but overpriced (which I suspect most are). Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Meh001
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at the Wailea Marriott. Beautiful grounds and buildings. Kids loved the water slides, pools, and the lovely beaches--Ulua and Wailea. Pricelined for $125 (so +/- $170/day with tax and resort fee), which--for the area--is more than fair. Expensive resort food options, but a short trip to MonkeyPod Cafe for 1/2 price happy hour Mai Tais, appetizers and pizzas, and we were good. Kihei has great food options, too. Overall, just a beautiful resort with a pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Ceeebee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly fine. Rooms and pool OK. Be warned though this hotel is NOT beachfront. A short walk either direction will get you to the beach. For Wilea this is a good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Maui Retreat”
Reviews.Author: TonyTimeShare
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Marriott at Wailea in late July. The hotel consists of several buildings with multiple pools and beautiful grounds. It sits on a small promontory with beaches adjacent to each side of the property. Beach access to either side is easy by footpath. There are lounge chairs along the lawn overlooking the water. The view is spectacular with views of Kahoolawe and the West Maui mountains across the water. The sunsets are amazing. The two beaches are very good for swimming, boogie boarding and skim boarding along the shore break. The sand is golden and smooth. Beach rentals are available on one of the beaches that is shared by other hotels. The water is very clear and not too rough, at least in summer. There are several pools located among the buildings. One area has two pools, an upper infinity pool and a lower pool. A pool side restaurant serves lunch and drinks throughout the day. Another pool is more of a tranquility pool with infinity edges overlooking the ocean and peninsulas into the pool with covered lounges. There is also a kids' area with a small water park including two water slides. There were lots of kids, and bigger kids taking advantage of the water slides. Up from the water slides was a saltwater pool and another snack bar. Never felt crowded at the pool areas and chairs were easy to come by. Activity desks were also located near each pool. Guests could check out or rent equipment as well as make reservations for activities on the island. My son booked a surfing lesson from the shack and got hooked up with a good outfit. Price was the same as the online price and we could charge it to the room. Rooms were nice, with larger queen beds. Tile floors throughout and a moderate balcony with chairs and a small table. A mini-fridge was included. Closet space and drawer space were adequate for our family of three. Parking was conveniently located in a covered structure and the price was included in the daily resort fee. We did not valet park. Only problem was that the parking spots were VERY narrow. The hotel is nicely located next to the Shops at Wailea where you can find just about anything from an ABC Store to high end shops. There were several restaurants, too. The Wailea area of Maui is one of the loveliest with spacious homes, lush golf courses and hotels and condos. The Marriott is located very close to Kihei which is a strip of a town with many hotels, restaurants, bars and services. There are some nice beach parks along the Kihei strip. The staff was warm and friendly, check in was easy at the Elite desk and bell service was prompt and efficient. On some days, they have local artists/ merchants set up off the lobby area. There is a Starbuck's right on site in the lobby and there is another that operates only in the morning in the Luau area. The hotel has a luau three or four nights a week. We did not check it out, but it appeared to be popular.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for Honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: Nmbt211
Reviews.Content: This is a Great Hotel for Honeymooners, Wailea is very classy & elegant area! The location is beautiful, the Luau was great, we had an Ocean front bedroom!! Amazing! Service was good, the Infinity Pool is one of a kind, much better than the Grand Wailea & the Four seasons where there is lots of kids. Wailea Shopping mall is next door, very high end. Kihei is a drive away where you can find good restaurants, Dont foget to go to Makena Beach, very romantic & calm.... Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Wailea for the Money”
Reviews.Author: HawaiianStyle808
Reviews.Content: Located between several of Wailea best beaches the Wailea Marrott is a great property and the best hotel in the area for the money. With Mulitple pools and excellent surrounding beaches this is a great place to wind down. Tons of dining and shopping options within walking distance and the food at the resort is quite good. Pros Multiple pools - the adult pool is specatular and makes the resort Location Value Service Cons Front Desk understaffed - always a wait Resort fee - unfortunately every hotel seems to have adopted this one

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and has everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: Rrbader
Reviews.Content: Had a regular room that had a terrace view. Upon arrival I asked about ocean views, and it was a $75/night upgrade. Wasn't going to do it at first but last minute I changed my mind. We were 4 hrs early for checkin so "Zellie" said she'd call and let me know when an ocean room was available. Checkin is at 4, she called us at 2:30. When we got to our room we were surprised at the upgrade she gave us - the Honeymoon Suite on the 2nd floor! AWESOME! Has a living room area with a big flat screen tv, 1/2 bath, and the bedroom was a nice size with a large full bath attached. Best part we had three belcony decks with furniture that all pointed at the ocean! Very sweet!!! We were able to sleep with the slider doors open and fall asleep and awake to the ocean waves. I like that they have 4 pools - one for kids (small wild waves-like pool), two pools by each other for families, and then a beautiful infinity pool for adults only (where I hung out most of the time). The more formal diner had great food, but cost was $$$. Service was great. You cant get past most of the staff without an "Aloha," or a smile at least. Odd to have a Starbucks in Hawaii, but there is one in the hotel - guess that's cool, but I'm from Seattle and really wanted some of hawaii's awesome kona coffee. Liked that it is in very close walking distance to the shops. Appreciated it when I had to buy a shirt for a wedding, buy some junk to bring back home, and there are some good restaurants there too. This is my 3rd vacation to HI, my first to Maui, and my first at a beach resort. I loved it! Great place to stay... I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice property, but well short of Marriott stanadards”
Reviews.Author: van_der_loost
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is that it's on the beach, and it has a secluded little beach for kids to play and swim in. We paid a hefty upgrade fee for an ocean view room, and what we ended up getting was a typical garden view room with a window that you could get a glimpse of the beach from if you craned your neck sideways 180 degrees. We asked for a different room and were told the place was full. We asked to be changed after a couple of days as rooms became available, but the request was never honored. The restaurant was terrible - the breakfast never changed once the entire week that we were there. They made us pay some daily fee that was supposed to give us a discount at the restaurant, but it was never applied and we had to waste valuable time going back and forth between the front desk and the restaurant to sort this out. Apparently, the two don't talk to each other - very bizarre! Luckily there's an upscale shopping plaza across the way, so that was where we headed after a couple of days of mechanized Marriott food. The Marriott Luau is tolerable, head over to Lahaina if you want to get your money's worth. There's a very nice walk that runs along the ocean and you pass all the other swish hotels next door - so the views are gorgeous towards both sea and shore, and it makes for a great morning or evening run.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the property”
Reviews.Author: libba
Reviews.Content: Husband, 16 year old daughter and I stayed here for the last two nights of our 9 night Hawaiian vacation. I am a platinum member and paid points for the stay and ocean front view so I can't speak much to price obviously. If you can get a deal though, take it! We stayed in Hale two and like it's proximity to the lobby and one of the pools. Excellent and helpful staff. No problem finding chaises under a lovely umbrella one morning. The food is expensive so we chose other options. The Whalers General Store at the Wailea shops (walking distance next door) have a nice little deli that includes choices of cold or warm food. We were very pleased with our choices there. There are laundry facilities on site though we didn't use them. The beach to the right and the left are wonderful and my daughter enjoyed the rocky shore line and little tide pools right in front of the hotel. I am only giving it 4 stars due to the rates I've seen for the rooms. Again if you can get a deal or use points, it is very worth it.

Reviews.Title: “No beach, great pools, nice rooms, easy self-park, great housekeeper, will be back.”
Reviews.Author: saavytravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very hawaii. A very welcoming open-air lobby with beautiful banyan trees and great sunset ocean-views. My husband and I greatly enjoyed the inifinty pool and would return for that alone. We rented a cabana by the pool that was luxurious and well worth it. The pool attendant, Ana, was very friendly. We enjoyed the on-site starbucks each morning, too. The room was clean and comfortable. The tv is old, but who comes to hawaii for tv? Stay home for tv. Nice vanity in the bathroom, too. Great steak at Mala - the on-site restaurant with great sunset views. Get a table by the window - well worth it. Wake up early and walk the oceanside path. Be careful of aggressive, non-athletic joggers who act like they work out when they are on vacation. The path is rather narrow, especially with some of the aforementioned athletes. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmhauser2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for in September 2010. This hotel was great, the hotel is nice an relaxing, a romantic adult getaway. There are not many kids, especially around the infinity pool. The pool staff was great, did not make us lift a finger for anything. I would definitively stay at this hotel the next time we are in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous pools and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bronnerea
Reviews.Content: We were uncertain where we wanted to stay in Maui but ultimately decided to focus on location - we knew we wanted to drive to Hana and get up to Haleakala and this seemed like a better spot vs. the more remote West Maui. We were extraordinarily lucky to end up at this Marriott. Not only was the location perfect, but the resort was situated along a stretch of beach that included a number of great resorts, which gave us the opportunity to take nice walks along the ocean to get away for a bit for lunch and/or dinner. The rooms were very nice - clean and comfortable with a great balcony. Some of the technology in the room was a bit dated - the phones in particular seemed old, and the wireless connectivity was only available from the lobby. But the real highlight for us was the two pools. We preferred the quieter infinity pool, which had a gorgeous view of the ocean and offered spectacular sunsets. The cabanas were well worth the $25 daily rate, especially considering the poolside concierge was the best service we had on our four-island vacation. The service was prompt, engaging, and very attentive to our needs - they even booked dinner accommodations for us! It was fun to be there with the hustle and bustle of the Maui Film Festival too - some of the parties were even hosted at the resort. Overall, this resort was a spectacular value and we feel very fortunate that we chose this resort. Should the opportunity present itself again, we would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Marriott-style”
Reviews.Author: Mrsemr
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel in the last 2 years. The rooms are great! We spend more time out than in, but it's a nice bed to come back to after a long day of activities. Service at the hotel was great. We had an issue with the manager at the on-property restaurant, MALA, and addressed it to the hotel manager, who was very responsive, knowing this situation reflected on Marriott. Overall, we will continue to choose this resort over others on the island due to the service, accommodations and proximity to great beaches and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, but didnt honor our hotel reservation confirmation.”
Reviews.Author: oliviadavid
Reviews.Content: The place was nice but, My husband made the reservation on line with his points for 8 days. We got a hotel confirmation reservation email. It said 8 days for $100 a night. The email was the hotel's official reservation confirmation email, BUT when we got to the hotel we were denied our reservation. They said our 8 day stay price was really only for 2 days. We tried to stay calm. The manager would not talk to us, no one helped us. We were stuck, either pay for the two days and spend most of our vacation looking for another place to stay. It took several days trying to get someone to talk to us. Instead we just got yelled at. This was not our fault. The Marriott sent the official reservation email to us. We didnt think twice about this being a possible bait and switch type of scam. No one helped us, we didnt want to spend our vacation trying to find another place in the middle of June. We already spent 2 days trying to get what we honestly deserved plus, we had a wedding our daughter was in, there in Waliea. We didnt have time or the energy to fight the system. So we stayed and paid 4 times more than we should.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning setting, beautiful hotel and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: ArnzT100
Reviews.Content: Placed along South Maui's coast line among high priced hotels and condominiums, Marriott's hotel feels like a resort island unto itself. The facility's open architecture features manicured gardens, koi ponds, swimming pools, terraces and staircases with unobstructed views of the ocean and surrounding islands, all swept by the afternoon Trade Winds. Public beaches are a short barefoot walk to the North or South and are calm enough for kids - but keep an eye on them! No life guards! Snorkeling among the fish and turtles is great on the reef jutting from the northern beach. The hotel has several pools, including one for adults only. The hotel staff is exemplary and friendly to boot. The breakfast buffet ($25!) came with our package but was worth it to us - breakfast each morning on the terrace overlooking Lana'i and the Pacific, planning the day. Poolside drink & food service is first rate. The pool concierge helped us navigate the island, inking our map to indicate shortcuts to Upcountry Maui and recommended several stopping points along the back way to Hana. The staff was always eager to help us and we never heard an unkind word. The nearby luau is a must for first-time visitors. The food is better than average, including the imu pit roasted pork. The show is very well done - live music, graceful dancing and Cliff's story-telling. Eating and drinking at the hotel is fine, but too much of a good thing is too much. Try the local fare around the island, like Mambo's in Paia. We also went to Foodland (grocery store) in Kihei to stock up on snacks and drinks for our hotel room, then did the guilty-walk-of-shame through the lobby with our soggy paper grocery bags. Later, we noticed other couples doing the same thing. The hotel's $12 cocktails are tasty and exotic but one can buy a six pack of guava nectar and a pint o' rum for the same price. You'll pay a $22/day resort fee and, if you like, $30/day for valet parking. Self-parking in a secured lot is included in the resort fee. The hotel rents snorkeling gear for $18/day and some days they won't rent the equipment because of ocean swells. Tired of being refused the rental, I bought my own mask & snorkel and didn't have any problems snorkeling the reef. Our hotel stay was very relaxing and I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a top-notch stay on the islands. After a couple of days in of being pampered in Wailea, you won't feel like ever going home. And leave your cell phone & laptop in the room safe. You're on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to experience the beauty of Hawaii!”
Reviews.Author: dstoudt80
Reviews.Content: My wife (who was still my girlfriend at the time) and I experienced the beauty of Maui at the Wailea Beach Marriott Resort & Spa back in September 2009. I just set up a TripAdvisor profile and wanted to share my thoughts :) Everything about this resort is top notch! We found a great deal to stay here via Priceline.com and were so glad we went. First of all, the infinity pool is the very definition of relaxing. It is an adult only pool with an infinity edge that blends in with a beautiful view of the ocean. Servers come around often to bring you food and drinks. The drinks are delicious and they don't skimp on the alcohol. I highly recommend the Mai Tai! There is quick access to a very large beach, and lots of beautiful coast line to walk along and enjoy. The food at the resort is great as well. The Mala restaurant is superb. I believe it is jointly owned by Clint Eastwood and Alice Cooper (quite the combination). I had one of the best steaks that I've ever had at this restaurant. There is a lot of nice local shops and restaurants that are in walking distance of the resort as well. The room was very nice and comfortable. Very up to date in style. The whole property is beautiful and very well maintained. I seriously cannot say enough good things about this resort, and really hope to make it back there some day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: GrlTrvlr
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome! Cashed in Marriott points for a week stay here and have no complaints since money was freed up for other things! If you want to relax from a stressful job, this is the place to go. The property is beautiful and the staff was very nice. The pools are great and a cabana rental is worth the price for a day of just sitting and de-stressing. You will need a car because there is not much else to do in the area other than sitting on the beach or by the pool which is great but after two days, you may want to do other things. The restaurant is typically over priced with decent food. Nothing I would call award winning. If you understand how resorts work, you should no coming in that you will get charged and over charged for everything so be prepared! Meals will cost you about $20-25 per person. Breakfast is the best option but overpriced and I ate there only once. Fruity, tropical drinks will run you about $9-10 each. You are actually better choosing basic mixed drinks like rum and cokes, etc... about $5-6 each. There are good eating options outside of the hotel area. Rooms are nice and clean and live up to Marriott standards. The AC seemed to work fine but always kept the balcony door open. No wifi in rooms which sucks but they offer in the lobby and pool areas, not worth it to be on a computer at that point. Would have been to have it on the balcony. The wired connection is okay so I would not depend on it if you have work to do. Gym is okay with older equipment and the business center is nice and smelled like lavender. Very expensive to use computer and copy. Overall, this s a great resort and helps you relax instantly. Expect to dish out some cash on a daily basis just to stay here but Maui is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort and great service.”
Reviews.Author: JessHat
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay and we got a room with a sitting area and it was very spacious. Room had a fridge and a coffee maker. Starbucks downstairs give you 2 hours free wifi, there was a water slide us adults were allowed to get on, walking access to a couple public beaches, beautiful infinity pool, with quite a few umbrellas around the pool area (first come first serve) and the Pool restaurant Kumi had happy hour everyday from 3-6. It was a beautiful resort, concierge booked our activities, walking distance to the mall and other places to eat, and the location was in a quiet part. We loved it and will return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and largest oceanfron in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: lovehvar
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. We upgraded to the Oceanfront suite on the ground level of building 7 which was simply amazing. We had a huge lawn and then the walking path right in front of our room and 180 degrees of unobstructed ocean views. It was spectacular. We toured other hotels and they are even more beautiful, but you could not get a room this close to the ocean, and you would pay double or triple. We simply got on the Ocean walk and enjoyed the restaurants and scenery at Four Seasons, Grand Wailea etc. The breakfast buffet at Marriot was fabulous, and MALA had a great burger with views to die for. Marriot has a luxurious adult only inifinity pool with cabanas. The Kids pool scared me as there were no washrooms anywhere near! Ughhh So we walked 3 minutes to Elua beach from our room and enjoyed the kid friendly cove there, it was magical. The service was great, the room was very modern and clean, I would go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “The Beverly Hills of Maui”
Reviews.Author: ALERTDIVER
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Marriott Wailea for two nights before moving on to the Marriott Beach Club in Kaanapali. The hotel was very nice and the setting was beautiful. The positives are the beatiful and well kept pools (which I believe are four) and the beautiful gardens. The hotel room itself was a very large room with two queen beds and was very clean and new. Quite enough room for us to be comfortable. The only complaint we had, and it was the largest, was the exorbitant prices for dining and parking. Obviously they don't know there's a recession going on charging guest $15.50 for a Mai Tai and $5.50 for a small draft bud light. Let's say that after we all ate a mediocre lunch for $105 we decided this wasn't the place we would spend our time eating at. Expect to pay $25. for parking a night also. Don't get me wrong...we LOVE eating and drinking out, but we should have packed our money tree before coming to stay at the Marriott Wailea. If you are somewhat watching what you spend on dining out than go to Matteo's across the street and have lunch and dinner elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay, but there are better out there”
Reviews.Author: Heather H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, along with family and friends for our wedding. While we weren't having the wedding on the property, upon check-in, they congratulated us, and promptly upgraded us to an amazingly beautiful room, steps from the ocean! The rooms were nice, but we really didn't spend much time in them. We did have a nice little patio, which we took advantage of every single morning as the sun came up and slept with the door open to hear the waves all night. Bliss! This is a really beautifully kept property, which had some of the most amazing landscaping I've ever seen, with hammocks interspersed between trees which we definitely took advantage of. The pool area had an infinity pool and was nice, but I never swam, the beach is RIGHT THERE! Boo chlorine, Yay salty ocean! My favorite part, which I did take part in about 25 times in a row after the I Do's (have a knack for injuring myself on vacation, figured this had better wait), are some kick butt water slides on the end of the property! I may have been rushing up the stairs to push past some kids but hey, I wanted some fun too! If you walk north to the next beach over, there is an amazing reef for snorkeling. We tried to do that as much as possible, almost each morning (well, not the hungover mornings...) Also, this property doesn't have an actual sandy beach. This didn't bother us, as a bit of a walk in either direction fixed that. Plus, I liked the sound of the waves hitting the rocks just below us. A couple of things which made this not a 5 star review: -The hotel keys would always stop working! It was getting really annoying, as we were really far from the front desk and had to keep taking the 10 - 15 minute hike back to get a new key. This happened about 10 times, which is way too many in my book. -Everything closed so early! The pool area, the restaurant, and the bar! It made us a bit disappointed that we didn't stay at one of the neighboring properties, as that was where we had to go to find anything open. -Variety. Not many places to grab a bite or drink (considering the bar was hardly ever open), luckily, there is the Wailea Mall right behind, and they had several restaurants as well. All in all we had a splendid time, but I'm not sure we'd go back if we didn't have that amazing room steps from the ocean, and secluded from most of the hotel. That really was heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly place to see Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Jbman_7
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort right on the Ocean. Calm without the resort hustle. Pleasant pool area with an excellent restaurant on property. Short walk to a tropical sand beach with reef snorkeling right in-front of the property. Be sure to make a reservation for the veranda and enjoy a cocktail in the bar. Rooms were nice, very much in the Marriott mode. Staff very friendly and helpful. This is the place to take an older family if your interested in a mix of relaxation and day trips. Mattress alert- our room had memory foam which is very soft. If you need a firm bed, request this before arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Was nice but wont be going back”
Reviews.Author: moshe88
Reviews.Content: I booked 6 nights here for the second part of my honeymoon. When i booked the room i was not told about a "resort fee" that was an additional $30 dollars per night that included stuff that we didnt even use (i.e. parking). i told the lady at the front desk that i have no use for all this but she insisted that it is a mandatory fee. anyway i just paid it and checked in because i was exhausted. just as i was leaving the front desk i hear another customer ask to waive the the resort fee and the other lady at the front desk agreed! thats not great customer service. i decided to just forget it and enjoy the rest of my vacation. the rooms where nothing special and the food wasnt that great. the only real bright spot of this hotel is the infinity pool and waitresses by the pool, they where very accommodating. we did like the location and strolled by the beach walk almost every night at sunset. the resort is literally down the block from the wailea shops which is where we had alot of our meals (the hotel was expensive and food was not great). we had a good time but if we will be going back to maui we will be staying at another resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our two nights here”
Reviews.Author: AndreaTBend
Reviews.Content: We ended a 13-night trip to Maui with 2 nights on points at this hotel. Our room overlooked the infinity pool and straight out to the ocean. We didn't ask for or pay for any upgrade, so it was a pleasant surprise. No wifi is the main complaint. We went into Kehei to find an internet cafe, and we stayed online quite a bit without needing more than one dollar. That must have been an error, but the posted price was pretty good. The business center at the hotel had computers with expensive charges. After staying 11 nights at an inexpensive condo on Napili Bay, we were impressed with the room. We stay at a lot of lower-priced accommodations, so this was nice enough for us. The room was large and comfortable, and the bathroom was terrific! Not as impressed as others with MaLa; be sure to get reservations. We went without them and sat inside--all alone--instead of on the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous location, great service”
Reviews.Author: misty12n
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried after reading reviews that this was not a 4 star resort. Four of us stayed in one room using points. We were upgraded to ocean front, and the room was really large, even with 2 teens. The location was central to all driving spots point of interest..It sits right next to grand Wailea and 4 seasons. T Scenery and sunsets were beautiful get up early and walk the beaches- beautiful way to start the morning The beaches right next to the hotel were wonderful, the infinity pool was great- but who stays in the room in Hawaii?? We discovered new beaches daily and visited the needle, the volcano, hana etc eat out in Kihei - wonderful Ono and Mahi Mahi

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel. Beautiful Views. Luxurious Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: crazyzeus1
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is perfect. The rooms: beds are amazing & comfy. Bathrooms are well appointed, with soft towels. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite & had another half bath off the living area. Couch in the living area was kind of funky & uncomfortable, but it folded out into a nice bed for our son. TV is bedroom & in living area. Mini fridge. Plenty of storage space in the rooms. Staff is extremely helpful & friendly. The views...oh my, the views! We always visit in February or March, & from our balcony we could watch endless whales. Bring your binoculars! Part of the hotel sits on a lava-rock edge, so there is no beach immediately in front. But, a lovely sidewalk winds along the water's edge, & you are only about a 3 minute stroll to beautiful sandy beaches at either end of the hotel. There are multiple pools. The kiddy pool is at one far end of the hotel property, & it was pretty chilly (no heated water), but my son didn't care! It had a beach entry with sand, a playscape with water everywhere, & he was happy. There is a quiet adult-only pool which looked beautiful, but we didn't visit because we were with my son. The third pool is a beautiful simple pool with a killer view of the ocean. On property, there is a set of shops. Nice to walk through, but as expected, prices were higher for similar items you can find elsewhere on the island for less. Room service is yummy! Parking was expensive (I believe it was $17/day when we were there), but it was in a covered garage right next to the hotel. There's a beautiful water fall & koi pond right next to the garage, on your way into the hotel, that is a perfect photo spot. We always use our Marriott Points when staying & feel this is a superb value for the points charged.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort in a great area”
Reviews.Author: lawrencemon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, with good service, and plenty of restaurants/shops in the area. No beach, but multiple big pools, with the infinity pools being very relaxing and well maintained. Definitely would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4th time here - love the sunsets!”
Reviews.Author: LuanaRubin
Reviews.Content: My first time to this property was when it was Outrigger. Now it is Marriott - they have kept up the property and done some nice upgrades. I returned for the great kids pools, the fabulous views and breakfast buffet at MaLa, the incredible sunset views from the hotel's beach. It is next door to the Grand Wailea which is where the movie "Just Go With It" was recently filmed. You can access the pink sand beach in front of the Grand Wailea, by following the beachside path that runs through the Marriott property. On one visit here in the winter, we saw two mama whales right off shore, with their two babies jumping out of the water repeatedly. The "adults only" new infinity pool would be nice if I was traveling without kids. I know there is an annual writers conference here - wish I could go! Staff very friendly and helpful, food is great, beautiful scenic location.

Reviews.Title: “Infinity Pool was the only highlight..”
Reviews.Author: adchim25
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really not what we expected for what we paid, its not as luxurious as other 4-star hotels we've stayed at it looked like a 3-star hotel. Breakfast wasn't included and customer service wasn't the friendliest either. The only thing memorable was the adult infinity/serenity pool which has the best ocean and sunset view but.... you have to pay to use/rent the covered lounge chairs and or private cabanas by the edge of the pool. No WiFi and internet access, they will tell you to go to Starbucks and get a 2 hour WiFi code, Starbucks by the way is pricey compared to the one's at Oahu or Kauai. The hotel is right beside Shops at Wailea with only 2 restaurants and there really are a limited number of places to eat at, you have to drive a few blocks to Kihei. Needless to say, we wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: alysiakc
Reviews.Content: Wailea was breathtaking! The hotel is in a beautiful spot by a few other great hotels. Unfortunately everything else is a good driving distance away (like everywhere else on the island) and other than the mall next door there are no restaurants close but the grounds are absolutely beautiful. Renting a car is a must. The actual hotel is okay. The pools are good the rooms nice and the staff is friendly. Not the best Marriott but good for a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay - but not luxury”
Reviews.Author: frau_roo
Reviews.Content: I didn't really expect 'luxury' as it is a Marriott. It's a nice place though. Older... basic... spread out, but well maintained and beautifully landscaped. We booked using points and only paid a small amount to upgrade our room. I would not have wanted to pay the going rate for the room we had. It was clean, comfortable, and nice enough, but I've seen better for the price. I think you are really paying for the location. It's a lovely area, and there are a few beaches to choose from within a 2-3 minute walk. The staff was very friendly. The restaurant "Ma La" was much better than I had expected. Parking is $25 (not unusual, really). For $5 more we got a bunch of coupons, including one that saved us about $80 at the spa, so it paid for itself. I'd recommend this place for couples traveling on a vacation, but I would have been a bit disappointed had it been our honeymoon. (I was spoiled in Bora Bora) I do think it's ridiculous for any hotel in this day and age to charge for internet use. This place did not even have wireless in the rooms. Thankfully, my iphone doesn't need it. :) Probably a good value for the location. I might try staying in Kihei if we go back to Maui. Also a night in Hana would have saved us a long, dark, curvy ride home. Ha!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking ocean view and grand resort”
Reviews.Author: stellarsheen
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, with spectacular ocean view and was perfect for us to celebrate our third wedding anniversary. We got a room in one of their towers, that did not have ocean view, but the room was big, extremely clean and luxurious. The infinity pool and the pool-side area are very well-maintained and relaxing, though water is a bit cold in this adults-only pool. Pool-side service was very good, very prompt in serving food and drinks. Mala restaurant at the resort has wonderful breakfast buffet and a great ocean view. No direct access to the beach, but a short walk from the resort. Can even spot some whales from there. The luau at the resort was quite good (we were told that this is not the best on the island, but since it was my first time in Maui, I loved it). The food and drinks were average but the desserts were delicious. The fire dance was phenomenal. Rest of the performance was also exceptionally good. The best thing was the amazing view of sunset, ocean, and moon from the luau ground and the beautiful lei (garland) that they gave us. The beaches on the other side of the island, Kaanapali, look better for snorkeling or scuba diving than the one close to Wailea. There is a huge shopping outlet mall next to the resort. Would strongly recommend this resort for a relaxing beach vacation.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat - want to go back”
Reviews.Author: illyBritishColumbia
Reviews.Content: We came here for one night - the last night of our trip - after the vacation rental apartment we were staying in was found to be infested with biting bugs (not bed bugs). We pricelined it that day. The rate was amazing, and we received, at the front desk, an astonishing upgrade to a stunning oceanview room a stone's throw from the water. I couldn't believe it. Room was huge and pretty. The service we reveived was impeccable. The pools are beautiful and the place had a nice, laid-back vibe. Finally, room service ordered for dinner so that we could sit and listen to the ocean was really good. I'd stay here again in a minute and in fact, plan to go back for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back again!”
Reviews.Author: mauibecs
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 night with my husband. Had amazing tome. Staff was anazing, especially by the pools and poolside restaurant. I don't the I couldn't believe how hard these people work in heat and sometimes wind, still manage to smile while hading me a drink. The room was perfect, quiet with nice view. We were on our honeymoon, and I didn't expect an "upgrade' like a lot of people seem to. If they gave everyone an upgrade for wedding/anniversaries/ honeymoons well that would be quite a lot given Hawaii is a very popular place for all these celebrations. I think people need to stop expecting to be upgraded, if youwant a bottleof champagne sent to your room for nothing it just may not happen here, but you will get the best service and atmosphere I have experienced in a long time. We will be back. As for the rats and roaches review, hmm..not true at all. if you've spent any time in Hawaii, you know that roaches are like flues there, not a sign of dirt. As for rats I did not see any and didnt talk to anyone who

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience for our wedding & wedding party.”
Reviews.Author: jbrown1525
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married in Maui and we decided to stay at the Wailea Beach Marriott the week of our wedding. We also booked a block of rooms for our guest who could book rooms on their own. We arrived to a great experience for everybody. My husband and I had a beautiful ocean side room and the guest all loved their rooms. Terrace view rooms were great and some guest upgraded to ocean view rooms for a little extra cost. The hotel was amazing and wonderfully kept grounds. Staff was very accommodatiing and even paid attention to our wedding day, the day after our wedding switching from my maiden name to my married name. We felt so special and all our guest felt the same way. The Mala restaurant on site is amazing with a great view. As a Marriott rewards member you can receive a discount at the breakfast buffet which I highly recommend. The bed was very comfortable and as a nervouse bride I had wonderful sleep. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and anyone who is planning a wedding in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: josiegirl97
Reviews.Content: We just came back from staying at the Wailea Beach Marriott & will definitely stay again! We were able to upgrade to an amazing ocean view room at check-in. So, we head a beautiful view of the serenity pool & the ocean. We could hear the waves crashing from our bed! Our room was great & the grounds & ocean views are just gorgeous! I loved the beautiful ocean path & the hammocks & lounge chairs sprinkled around the property. The property doesn't have it's own beach - but beautiful Wailea Beach is literally a one minute walk from the rooms. The only negative that I could see is that most of the pools & the pool bar close at sunset. It would have been nice to enjoy these amenities a little later into the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort to go back to”
Reviews.Author: tuckerboi
Reviews.Content: We took our adult daughters (25 & 29) on their 1st trip to Maui & couldn't have selected a better place. We had connecting, 1st floor, oceanfront & with the way the resort is laid out we felt like we were alone. I can't say enough about the service from the moment we arrived. Greeted at the bell station by name & every encounter we had for the week was positive. The luau was picture perfect, enjoyed the band & the well told story. The food was very good & was amazed that they gave everyone a fresh Lei upon arrival. The restuarants were enjoyable & went back for the best $20 hamburger I've ever had more than once. I also do believe between the 4 of us we tried every tropical concoction available from the bar! Frozen Mango Margarita is hard to beat. The pool was wonderful & never had a problem finding a place to stretch out but would enjoy finding the morons that think it's cool to run towels & books down ahead of time to stake a claim! I read many reviews ahead of the trip & can't say that any were a problem. Check in smooth..it pays to be kind, tile floors...asked the girls after we returned home if the tile bothered them & they said "what tile", the beds were heaven after a day of keeping up, $30 a day to park....a bargain to park close to heaven, milk $10 a gallon...drink beer it's cheaper & easier to carry, no beach front....thank God it's less crowded! Can't say enough about the entire experience & anxious to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: lytlea
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott for our honeymoon and loved it! We had a great view of the ocean, the service was awesome when ever we needed something, everything looked clean and amazing! It was a great stay overall. There's really nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation in a lovely and peaceful setting”
Reviews.Author: smotley
Reviews.Content: The best part of our stay was the location of our room - ground floor ocean view. We cashed in rewards points for the weekend we spent there and I am glad I cashed in extra to get the upgrade. We also went there after having spent five action packed days in Paia so we were ready to relax. The grounds and public space of the hotel are lovely and the bell staff go out of their way to assist. Loved the infinity pool but agree more shade would be great. Minor quibble as check in was pleasant and I was told free wifi due to my platinum status. When I returned to get access code I was told by different staff no dice - had to pay. I wouldn't have minded but doesn't work in guest rooms only public space. So I went the Starbucks route. This is a beef I have with many older hotels and wifi not just this resort. Lounge staff seemed a little overwhelmed at times probably due to happy hour specials but they were very nice. I could see that the location of your room could highly impact the quality of your stay so do your reservations due dilligence. Would gladly return!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service. Fee you to death.”
Reviews.Author: jonstandish
Reviews.Content: I have been to Maui in the past, and I have never run across the lack of service/care/attitude. Staff only cares about the extra dollar they can earn. You want to park? That will be $30.00 a day extra, plus tax. You want internet? That will be $20.00 a day, plus tax. You want to sit in a nice chair by the pool?..That will be a charge as well. You want a room upgrade for a wedding? I don't think so, even though the hotel was not even close to fully occupied. There are many other hotels that know how to treat guests. I don't even remember the staff welcoming me with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Joncab5
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort....the pool was beautiful. More adult friendly rather than kid friendly. Actually all of Wailea is more adult oriented compaired to Kanapali which is more kid friendly. Beach was okay too....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, relaxing stay but not 100% satisfied...”
Reviews.Author: JHaz1978
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Wailea Marriott for our Honeymoon. The hotel itself was very nice and well kept. The grounds are beautiful and also very well maintained. It is true that the Marriott doesnâ€™t have a beach on the property but the neighboring beaches are a short walk away if you would like some beach time.
