We were more than satisfied with lounging around the Marriott pools, particularly the Infinity pool. The Marriott was perfect for us as we were looking for a relaxing get away for our Honeymoon. If youâ€™re traveling to Wailea with children, the Marriott probably isnâ€™t the ideal place for you. It doesnâ€™t cater to children like other hotels in the area seem to do. The Grand Wailea for example has a large water park and kids area which would better accommodate families with younger children. We noticed because we have 5 kids in our house, but we were happy to be at the quieter Marriott this trip. We did eat breakfast at the Marriott most of the days we were there and the $30/person is accurate for the buffet. You could save some money not eating at the Marriott, but we didnâ€™t mind. The hotel has a handful of shops on the property and The Shops at Wailea are right across the street, easy accessible for those wanting to do some additional shopping during their visit. There were a few things about the Marriott that we werenâ€™t pleased with however. The first thing was that our Honeymoon wasnâ€™t recognized by the hotel. Upon checking in I mentioned that we were there for our Honeymoon and got a friendly â€œcongratulationsâ€� from the desk. We had heard that mentioning the Honeymoon may get us a bottle of wine, a room upgrade, somethingâ€¦but we received nothing. My wife is a former Marriott GM and mentioned her disappointment later during our stay when we stopped by the desk to request a late check-out as our return flight was at 10:30pm. At that time we were told that we could get a room upgrade for the remainder of our stay, but that we couldnâ€™t have a late check-out in the upgraded room. In order to have the later check-out we had to stay in the original room. We were also charged an additional $100 for the half extra day, for the late check-out. I think we wouldâ€™ve been happy if the hotel had at least waived that additional half day fee for our Honeymoon, but they did not. The second thing we werenâ€™t happy with was the daily resort fee of $30. Itâ€™s been mentioned here before but it does add up. An additional $180 for our six night stay at the Marriott. I think it would be better for the Marriott to simply add that to their daily room rates and not have the additional charge to quests. The third thing is that the in room internet access wasnâ€™t included. The desk did advise me that if I went to the on property Starbucks, that I could get 2 hours (per day) of net access for free and I did. If youâ€™re staying at the Marriott and need to access the net, donâ€™t pay the additional fee for in room unless you need it for a long period of time. Just walk down to the Starbucks and log on for free. Overall, if youâ€™re looking for a relaxing stay in Wailea the Marriott is a good choice. The hotel is in great shape and the property is beautiful. Although we felt somewhat slighted by the Marriott, we did enjoy the quieter atmosphere and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for romance and fun!”
Reviews.Author: zip773
Reviews.Content: The room was amazing and the location was perfect! The breakfast buffet included in our package was the best one we have ever had. The food at this hotel was the best we had throughout Hawaii and the pools were gorgeous. Best part - not a lot of kids and families so very romantic. Incredible hotel, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingKatie11
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. The grounds were gorgeous, there were awesome pools, and the location was amazing. This hotel is right on the water, and just steps away from beaches where you can swim and snorkel. You can also walk to the Shops at Wailea from this hotel, and it was nice to have easy access to the convenience stores there. We didn't eat at any of the hotel's restaurants, but there are a few to choose from. Our room was great - clean, and plenty of room. We didn't technically have an ocean view room, but you could still see the ocean from our lanai which was a nice bonus. The buildings are older, but you can only tell this from the outside. You do have to pay for parking (a daily resort fee includes the parking), and the parking spaces in the garage were tiny! But other than this, we had no complaints. We loved our stay here and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort in a Beautiful Setting”
Reviews.Author: LakersFan
Reviews.Content: April 26 to May 1st 2011 â€“ we traveled to Maui to attend our nieces wedding and spend six nights at the Wailea Beach Marriott Resort. We used Marriott Rewards points to â€œpayâ€� for our room and then decided to use dollars to upgrade to an ocean front room. Rachel DeCoite, in the concierge department, arranged for a wonderful room for us with a full ocean view, even from the bed! Our room was #4616 and was on the same level as the reception and lobby. It was very convenient and yet very quiet, being on the top floor of building (Hale) #4. The view from our balcony was great, directly facing the setting sun. The resort is beautiful and very well maintained. Our room was spotless on checking in and was kept that way by the housekeeper. The hallways were clean and I never saw a single piece of trash anywhere. The resort does not have its own beach. The ocean in front of the Marriott is all lava rocks. But, there are beautiful public beaches just a short walk on both sides of the Marriott. Ulua beach is to the north in front of the Ekahi Village and Wailea beach is to the south in front of the Grand Wailea Resort. The Marriot has five pools, I think. We used the Maluhia Serenity pool which is for adults only and my wife and I appreciated that. Our room was very comfortable with a king size platform bed. The TV was a flat-screen tube type, which kind of surprised me. This is the only Marriott that I have been to in several years that did not have a flat screen HD TV. There were 40 channels, not counting the various hotel info channels. There were also pay-per-view movies, but we did not look at what was available. Besides the bed, there was a queen size sofa bed, a coffee table and on the opposite side of the room a comfortable chair. Lighting in the room was very good. The desk had a wired high-speed internet connection that was $14.95 per day if you are not a Marriott Rewards gold or platinum member. Internet speed was very good at just under 5 MBS download and about 1.75 MBS upload clocked using the Speakeasy Speed Test. The room had a small refrigerator which we used extensively and a four-pot drip-type coffee maker. There were two phones; a cordless one on the desk and another on one of the night stands. Except for a single outlet on the desk, the other electrical outlets were behind furniture. The room had a large double-door closet with plenty of wooden hangers. A save large enough to hold a laptop was in the closet as well as iron and ironing board. There were three drawers under the TV and two more in each night stand. There was plenty of storage. The vanity area had a single sink with good lighting, a magnifying mirror and a full length mirror. Bath amenities included shampoo, conditioner, lotion and two kinds of soap. There were four good-size bath towels. The bath area had a large soaking tub and the toilet. Water pressure was great. Balconies at the resort have glass panels so the view is virtually unobstructed. Our balcony had two chairs, a table and a side table. I spent most mornings drinking coffee and enjoying the view. The sun did not hit the balcony for our room until late afternoon. Facing west, the sunsets were beautiful. I was somewhat surprised that there was no nightly â€œturn downâ€� service. We did not need our beds turned down or mints on the pillows, but missed having our room freshened-up and towels changed each evening. After some initial confusion, we accepted the $30 per day resort fee. Self parking is $25 per day so the resort fee wound up being only $5 more than parking. The resort fee gives a variety of discounts, include 20% discount at Mala, the hotelâ€™s restaurant and for the cabana rentals. Parking and the discounts saved us way more than the cost of the resort fee. The resort fee also includes two Mai Tais at Kuma which are $12 each and our server said we were not limited to Mai Tais. When we checked in we received four â€œtowel cards.â€� Each card can be exchanged for a blue and white stripped pool towel. When you turn in a towel, you get either a fresh towel or get a towel card back. During our stay, to get a lounge under an umbrella at the adult pool meant that you needed to stake out your spot by about 8:30 by putting your pool towels on one or more lounges. When all of the lounges with shade are taken you have the option of renting either a â€œCasabellaâ€� covered lounge for two ($25 per day) or one of the six â€œfloating cabanasâ€� ($100). The floating cabanas do not float, but have two well shaded lounges on part of the deck that sticks out into the pool. Prices are discounted 20% if you opt in for the daily resort fee. We had lunch two days at the resort, once sitting in the Kumu Bar and Grill and once poolside. Service was excellent and the food was very good. The Marriott Burger with Maui potato chips was $15.50. Most of the tropical drinks were $12. We used self parking which was included as part of the resort fee. Room keys allow entry and exit to the two-level parking structure which is just steps from the front of the hotel. We never had a problem finding a parking space. We had the breakfast buffet in the Mala Wailea restaurant. As a Marriott Rewards member the buffet was discounted to $17 per adult which seemed like an excellent value. Besides an omelet station, the buffet offered just about anything else you might want, including eggs Benedict. Everything about our stay was wonderful! We loved our room, service was friendly and excellent and the resort is truly beautiful. We hope to return someday!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL WITH RATS”
Reviews.Author: EMSMAN911
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay. I arrived May 4 and checked out May 10. At the serenity pool (which is beautiful), the server screamed- and yes- RATS were running. Later, twice, in the evening, rats were running from bush to bush. The grounds are beautifully landscaped. In addition, several guests were complaining of heavy cockroach infestations in their rooms (I saw the video!). ICK. Such a lovely place, clean it UP!!! There is no excuse for roaches and rats! The hotel was very blase when reported and just said "Thanks".

Reviews.Title: “Paradise made better”
Reviews.Author: Triptaker3355
Reviews.Content: I knew we were staying in an exclusive area and would enjoy the sites, but this hotel made it even better. The room was ready upon early arrival, even upgraded to an ocean deluxe...what a view!!! We relaxed in the hot tub the first night, enjoyed the best snorkeling in the area at Uliua Beach adjacent to the hotel each morning, after having a light breakfast on our balcony overlooking the ocean. Enjoyed their relaxing Infinity Pool, for adults only, ate a couple of time at the poolside grill...it was very good. There is a great fitness center free to guests and a Starbucks on location. We used Hertz car rental right on site, too...very convenient. I was really pleased that they had a kiosk to print out your airline boarding passes, too. The downsides were the beds were on the soft side, and thin blanket and sheet would have been more comfortable than the quilt...I was either too cold or too hot. The A/C was pointed directly at the bed, also. What was strange, too..was when the maid left or an engineer came in to look at our internet connection (we had trouble staying connected), they would take it upon themselves to turn the A/C down to 63 degrees instead of the 72 -74 degrees we had it set on, like who cares what the guests like it to be. The Luau got rained out and they moved us inside without compensating us with something extra for the letdown. It just was not worth the money to be put indoors and also smelling the fuel from the fire dancer's torches. The hotel has a parking structure that a compact car would barely fit in one of the stalls...that was tough when it got crowded. The suggestions that worked great for us were to pick up breakfast and snack items at the ABC store or Whalers General Store in the next door shopping center "the Shops at Wailea", which by the way, is a great outdoor mall! There is an empty small refridgerator in each hotel room. We ate at the mall's Hamburger Islander restaurant a few times, which was good and also north of us in Kehei, Fred's Mexican Cafe who has a great Taco Tuesday. We took day trips to Maui's Ocean Center, Tropical Plantation Tour, and also Lao Park...all very worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Serene Hotel and natural beauty”
Reviews.Author: karen r
Reviews.Content: I heard somewhat mixed things about this hotel but I liked the location and got a nice deal through my travel agent (Liberty travel) which gave me the breakfast buffet, a free night and an upgrade to an ocean view room. There was a nice mix of people couples, families with young children, older people, it was always very quiet and never felt crowded. The bed was the most comfortable bed I ever had in a hotel, the rooms spacious and with a lanai. I LOVED it!!!! It was in a gorgeous surrounding, but thats a given, where it was, but it just blended in with the natural beauty around it, which made for a really peaceful and serene atmosphere. It was beyond clean, it was pristine! The staff were all really nice and attentive, I felt like I was the only guest there. The food at the restaurants was very good and given the location, I felt the prices were reasonable. There is a lovely coastal nature trail (paved ) that runs along the back of the hotel which is linked to the other properties along the shoreline, its great for a walk or run and the views, amazing. This also allowed me to see some of the other hotels and I have to say, it just really showed how well this hotel works with the natural surroundings so well. I was really satisfied and happy with my choice. Another plus is that you can walk to The Shops at Wailea, there is a nice gift shop-deli, Whalers and an ABC store, plus restaurants and shops. For dining you are also very close to Matteos and other restaurants at Wailea Gateway Center which is where I chose to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: littlesheree
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Maui. The location was great, everything you need is very close. Its right on the ocean and they have many places for you to relax and sit by the ocean. The staff were extremely pleasant and nice. I have zero complaints about our staff there. They place is so beautiful and the staff are really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: eatondog
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline for our anniversary. We were nervous for the negative reviews but once we got there we had the most fantastic time. #1 is the location. Mid-island, close the a mall with shops and restaurants, good sized rooms, easy parking (yes the spots are small but we had no trouble parking our Jeep). The Mala restaurant was good value and our best meal was at Tommy Bahama at the mall but the hotel restaurants aren't bad. Great to have a nice size lanai and a bar fridge for cold drinks. Don't hesitate to book here...if we had paid full rack rate we would have felt we got good value for our money. Infinaty pool with (especially at happy hour) was unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but they do boy know how to treat frequent travelers”
Reviews.Author: Jordan7T
Reviews.Content: Nice pool, clean rooms, friendly folks. Disappointed at restaurant choices at hotel but thank god for shops at wailea and four seasons - all walking distance. They do have starbucks on site!!! However, both my wife and I are Marriott platinum and we generally get better service during our work travels

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!! So much to do”
Reviews.Author: KNick8
Reviews.Content: We were here for the first week of our honeymoon and loved it. We had breakfast a few times at the buffet which was good. We loved the serenity pool and my husband was able to watch playoff hockey at the pool bar. I discovered the water slide wasn't just for kids on the last day and had a blast. We took Stand Up Paddle lessons from JT and that was a lot of fun. JT was a great instructor and the fee was reasonable. Our room was nice and the bed was comfortable. There is a nice walking/jogging path, too. We also went snorkeling right outside the hotel at the beach. We didn't go to the luau at the hotel but instead went to Old Lahaina, which was excellent, though about 45 minutes away. Also, we went to the Four Seasons for a couples massage, which was nice, but I don't think it was worth the price and we regretted not going to the Madera Spa at the Marriott instead. Finally, we were also close to Kai Kanani Sailing and took the morning express trip to Molokini Crater for some great snorkeling. We highly recommend them as well. The concierge was helpful in directing us to a Haleakala bike tour after the one we had sign up with cancelled on us the day before (we went with Bike Maui - great - on your own bike ride after crater tour). Finally, we left at 7 am and drive to Hana. We had no problems with to many people on the road. The road is not nearly as bad as we were expecting! Just know that if you decide to go all the way around like we did, that you have to go back up to Paia, as the road does not connect to Wailea. This adds an extra hour to the drive. We both loved this Marriott so much more than we liked the Marriott we stayed at in Lihue, Kauai. (Though Kauai itself was amazing!)

Reviews.Title: “The paradise island”
Reviews.Author: Cobaea
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this resort for 8days and had a wonderful time. Honestly, we don't get impressed easily but we absolutely loved this place. The people were very friendly. The infinity poor was amazing. The view from the poor was unbelievably beautiful. We never had a problem finding chairs at the poor and they were never really crowded. The food was good too. Our room didn't include the breakfast so we had to pay the breakfast separately. But my boyfriend is a reward member so we got a discount everyday. The breakfast buffet was good and it was so convenient. We did a lot of activities and the person who works at the activity desk near the infinity poor (her name is Tanea) was super nice and helpful. She basically scheduled our entire week of vacation. She told us what's worth and not worth doing. We strongly suggest talking to her if you want to do activities. The location of the hotel is fantastic. It is located in a very nice part of the island. There is a mall in 5 min. walking distance. The mall has some good stores and restaurants. We really liked the cheese burger place. The italian place right next to the cheese burger place is good too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: turtlegirl
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Marriott. We knew we wanted to stay in Wailea but since we have 5 people in our family, we needed 2 rooms which made staying at the 4S or Kea Lani too expensive. We were able to book a 2 bedroom suite for $385/night.at the WBM. Service was great, Judy at the front desk was very accommodating when we asked to move to a higher floor and a slightly better view. I didn't really care for the room decor-tile floors made it seem sterile and the bland interior was not at all Hawaiian, but the view, pools, grounds and beaches on either side of the hotel made up for the room style. We had 3 lanai and they were all large so we spent time there when we were in our room. The Marriott is much more spread out than the 4S or Kea Lani and was much quieter and less crowded than the other hotels, which you walk by on the path. Unfortunately, it rained quite a bit on our trip, which is unusual for Wailea, and one night it was raining so hard we canceled our dinner ressies in Lahaina and went over to Ruth's Chris, which was fabulous but pricey. We started to walk over in the rain and either the valet or bellman offered to drive us over in a large golf cart, which we really appreciated. Mala was delicious and we went there 2 nights. The first we got the whole fried fish which they serve with wonderfully cooked vegetables (definitely a unique meal). The second time we tried Alice Cooper's burger which was delicious as well. I highly recommend staying at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property”
Reviews.Author: kel3420
Reviews.Content: We recently returned home from a seven night vacation at this resort. Booked two room using points. One room we upgraded with cash to ensure an ocean view, the second one we did not. A week before leaving, I contacted the hotel and requested the two rooms be connecting or at least opposite each other. After researching the resort, I requested Hale 2. Upon arrival, we were told to go to the concierge desk not the check in. Our check in envelope was all ready for us, both rooms. We had rooms 2-308 and 2-307 in the requested building. Our second room, which was for my mother, my 22 yr old daughter and my 14 year old daughter did have an ocean view, albeit from only 1/3 of the balcony, but still very nice. y room, which was hubbie, myself and our 23 yr old son overlooked the main pool and had an incredible view of the ocean. It doesn't get any better than this. We quickly unpacked and tried to take a tour of the resort before it got too dark. Checked out the beach we would be going to. When facing the ocean, to the right. The walkway, the different pools, etc. I think we were all in bed by 9 pm. Of course, with the time change from Chicago, I was up the next morning at 3 am. lol. After picking up our van from Enterprise, which was completely uneventful, we did stop at Safeway to buy pop, water, wine, breakfast and lunch making. With a party of six, we figured to cut some costs. I was shocked, SHOCKED (LOL) at the prices in the store. Except for one thing. Pineapple's were $.47. Picked one up, the only problem was how to cut it? Should I buy the knife at the store for $12 or try and get a knife later? We did borrow a knife later :) We wanted to stop at a recommended restaurant before shopping (mamma's) but it wasn't open, so we stopped into another small place in the same, a little mexican place that was very good. The first morning I went and sat on chairs by the lava rocks and walkway as the sun was coming up and saw HUGE turtles right off the rocks, three of them, and then as the sun got higher, I could see whales. Watching whales all week is a mystical experience. I hope to witness that again. We ate dinner at several of the restaurants at the shopping center, all were great. Starbucks at the Marriott was very good in the morning! Drink service around the pool was speradic, but not sure how they could fix that, either there were a million people or just a few and there was usually just one waitress. It was easier to just go and get your drinks from the bar. We did have breakfast at the restaurant overlooking the pool, which was fine, expensive at $17pp for the buffet, but fine. We did a Trilogy tour which was the highlight of our trip. I can't recommend them highly enough! Hubbie and the kids did a ziplining tour which they had a great time at. We spent a day sightseeing and ended up in Lahaina for shopping and dinner. All in all, this trip was incredible. However, I think the Marriott in Kaui is much nicer than the one in Wialea. There are just so many stairs in Wailea. Two flights down to our room, another flight down to the pool, another flight down to the beach, etc. ALOT of walking to get anywhere, whereas in Kuai the pool is right along the beach which is awesome. We did spend half our time at the beach and half at the pool, so while that was nice, I would much rather prefer an oceanfront swimmable beach right there instead of even a short walk away. Several days the waves were pretty high making the actual beach pretty small. Feel free to message me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “The best trip ever for an east coast girl!”
Reviews.Author: jberry24
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews before I went, but I have to say this was the best vacation (honeymoon) ever. We had a wonderful time.....despite the tsunami! The hotel is the best location. Yes the room may be a little outdated compared to other Marriotts but who goes to Hawaii to stay in the room. We had no complaints having to walk the 20 yards to the beaches. We were glad there was no sandy beach in front of us cause we could sit in the lounge chairs under the trees in the grass and enjoy the gorgeous view. We sat and watches the whales from our chairs. And did I mention the adult only infinity pool.....it was amazing! Will definitely go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Up4aGetAway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five days and nights at this lovely resort. We had an easy check-in experience. We enjoyed our room - ocean view on the adult pool side of the resort. The infinity pool is fantastic, but we do agree that there are not enough chairs around the pool, and they are 'staked-out' early in the morning. However, since our room had awalk-out lanai, we just took our towels over to the room when we left the pool area. The breakfast buffet was included in our room, and we enjoyed it every day! The fresh fruit is amazing and the breakfast omelets were wonderful. We did not object to having a short walk to the beach, and enjoyed walking several miles along the shore and beach each morning. Our greatest surprise was that the internet was not included with the room. We got a two-hour pass code from Starbucks in the resort a couple of times, but we were very disappointed in the add-on cost for internet service in the room. All in all, it was a restful time away in a beautiful setting.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place with kids”
Reviews.Author: Vincku
Reviews.Content: We had booked an ocean front room, but got upgraded to an ocean-front executive suite... thanks to my husband's frequent stays at the mariott! The suite was excellent- clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly. The hotel has 3 different pools, even a little water play pool for lil kids. The ocean front view is superb! The hotel does not have its own beach, but there is a beach nearby- its at walking distance. The hotel is on the water though, but the beach is rocky, so no sands... The grill had good food and drinks, a little over-priced, but c'mon, it has to be at any place like this. The breakfast buffet was awesome! I had so much fruit that i had not eaten for a long time! The sidewalks at the beach were great for walks and jogs. The hotel also has its own luau- on the water... All in all, a great experience in every way. I will definitely go here again.

Reviews.Title: “It didn't suck but I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Cave66man
Reviews.Content: Pretty much everyone was accurate as far as the negatives. Negatives: Check in. Expensive watery drinks. They also told me not to bring my own can of corona to the pool. I asked why I could bring Starbucks but not corona. They rude waitress said it was because of the liquor license or something. I said I guess I can't drink my own beer at ownroom either. She walked away! Another negative...having to walk to Grand Wailea to swim in the ocean. Short walk so it was OK. Service was great or horrible and sometimes just rude. The towel cards are just ridiculous and my wife had to fight the towel lady for a second towel. She said 'one towel per person only!!! ', The rooms were old and the floor was some crappy old boring tiles, the room wasn't very clean either. The TV is from 1980 and the kids pool was sad looking compared to other resorts. Thanks god I have teenagers now. Positives: Great adult pool with great views and sunsets. The best food at the poolside restaurant. Tina at the front desk area (she was very helpful and very nice). Spend the money and go elsewhere. I stayed with points but next time I will use my points elsewhere. Not great but OK! Don't expect paradise!

Reviews.Title: “As advertised. Solid resort. Will suit most travelers.”
Reviews.Author: rwjudy
Reviews.Content: We didn't think it was top of the line nor bottom. A bit older, but the rooms are decently upgraded. Obviously in the high end area of the island with Four Seasons near by. Small re-fridge, but no microwave. That was a negative. Some have complained about the tiled room floors. Personally, we had no issue and I liked that I wasn't walking on dirt & mite infested carpet. We avoided buying any food here. "Marriott Burger" is $18. Ridiculous. I know Maui is expensive, but no burger is worth that. Prices went up from there. We tried avoiding buying the overpriced drinks as well. Drank our own most of the time discreetly at the pools. Check in was efficient. Maybe we caught them at a good time. Got a free upgrade to ocean view room. It was over the side area where you could hear workers & trucks coming in, but it wasn't that bad. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room. Great views from the adult infinity pool. We saw plenty of whales from the pool and chairs while there (March). We had one issue with the drink waitress at the pool. Guests play the towel game by getting up early and putting towels on their chairs. Then showing up later or never. Thus hogging chairs. I was down there at 9:00 am and sat their till about noon. Then left to go to our room to take small break and come back with my wife. When coming back, within 1 hr, our chairs were taken. Towels and stuff moved to the little employee area. When I asked about this, they said they have a 30 minute leave policy and will give the chairs to others. I was there for 5 days and never once saw a waitress move anybody's stuff. In fact they were way too busy to know who left when and for long. I complained to the manager who apologized, said it was their policy, but also admitted that maybe it doesn't get followed and which I said that unless they can track and do that regulary, then they can't single out a guest, which this waitress did and the policy is worthless. He pretty much agreed. He gave us complimentary lunch, which I thought was fair. Overall, we enjoyed the stay and didn't have any other issues than what I mentioned. Express checkout was efficient & correct.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, but there is no beach In front of hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RhondaHensel
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. The grounds, trees, pools and ocean are all so very beautiful. There are not enough chairs and there is no beach for the hotel. Both sides of this hotel had nice beaches you could go to but they had the umbrellas sectioned off for their hotel guests only. Marriott should have somewhere for their guests to be welcomed with the same on one of the two beaches. The breakfast we had included with our room and it was great. The pineapple/coconut bread was excellent! The room was very nice, but the tile floor was not clean. The room was very clean excepttrot the floor. I was in my bare feet and they were very dirty from the floors. The entrance sign can not be seen from the direction we were entering and we missed it and had to turn around. We wanted to stay in the room for a late check out because our flight was at 10:00 pm, and they charged an extra $100.00 for seven hours. I thought that was pretty high. The parking fee was very high also ($30.00 a day). The most of our stay was very nice except for these issues and I would definitely go back again. It is really a beautiful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The scenery is AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: Tominator31874
Reviews.Content: It's good, but the rooms are full of gnats and the meals next to the pools are good and the service is great, but the prices are bad, but overall the restarunts next to the pool are 4 stars. The beds are pretty small but has an awesome view from the balcony of the ocean. The ocean is just yards away from the pool. The ocean has a lot of fish and you might see a sea turtle like I did! And theres a good waterpark with good slides and a warm hot tub. When I was leaving, I was sad to leave the gorgeous scenery. Great vacation spot but the rooms are not that great.

Reviews.Title: “don't plan to sleep in”
Reviews.Author: BarclayB
Reviews.Content: My husband brought me here for my birthday, as a special surprise. This is our 2nd-to-last night, and we're both quite disappointed. The staff are pretty nice ... but ... 1. The rooms have tile floors, so for several days, for at least 3 hours a day (seriously), we heard the people upstairs rearranging their furniture ("scrape, scrape, scrape"). 2. Starting at 8:30 in the morning, a few doors away, we hear someone knocking and literally *yelling*, "Housekeeping!!" every hour until about noon. 3. The food is disappointing, especially compared with the restaurant at the Marriott in Ka'anapali. There's just not nearly as much variety or good flavor as we'd come to expect. 4. The rooms look dingy, given the "resort" atmosphere and the proximity to some very upscale hotels. It's not just the furniture or the tile floors ... they don't look as good as average Sheraton rooms to me. And the color scheme is dismal. 5. The beds - oh dear. I'd called ahead to ask if we could get a firm mattress since I've been having significant back pain for 6 months - there is no such thing here. The fold-out couch is firmer than the bed ... but it's not at all comfortable. 6. On at least one day, there was someone mowing grass beside our lanai by 9 AM. 7. Noise echoes ... cement, tile, doors with no sound-inhibition (there's space between door and lentil). On the other hand... The spa does have some excellent masseuses, and the view and the serenity pool are very pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: JanetA000
Reviews.Content: First trip to Maui and we some how were able to get an Awesome Deal $60 a night!! this Place is Beautiful from the moment we drove up we were greeted with lais. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. Since My husband and I were on our honeymoon they upgraded our room for free! Once we were inside of our room it wasn't as nice as they made it seem. We called the front desk and they moved us to a new room the next day. The 2nd room had the most amazing view!! we will deffinetly be coming back! The location is great right next to Shopping, we didnt even rent a car the bus was really close by we paid about $2 dollars a day!

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the Road”
Reviews.Author: BlueskyzUpstateNY
Reviews.Content: Check in took forever! I dont know if it's because we were part of a group of 10 people, but I dont care for how they do your bill. They start with the amount you have already paid and subtract the amount of the room, resort fees, etc., from your account each day. Well, if I had $200 in "extras" you'd think we'd owe $200 at the end and that wasnt the case. The amounts didnt match up. I dont mind if they do it that way, just dont try to scam people with extra charges at a so-called "resort". We were there during the tsunami scare and I think they handled it as well as they could. We were not evacuated to the ballroom but other people from our group were. Security came around, knocked on doors and slipped a note under your door making you aware of the situation and general guidelines on what to do. I saw a lot of scared and upset people because they couldnt get firm answers from the staff, but the thing is, they had no idea what was coming either, so what else could they do? We were told we could not have a beer we bought on premise from the store at the hot tub pool because it's technically a "restaurant" so we had to move from the pool area out to the chairs beyond. Hey, fine, we get it, but it was only enforced every once in a while. We cant drink that beer, but yet they saw people smoking at the hot tub and didnt say a word. Either enforce the rules or dont. Picking and choosing is not right considering we all paid pretty close to the same over inflated price. The room was fine. We knew we were getting a resort view but having the delivery driveway right out our patio and hearing the trucks wasnt fun but we could deal. Beware of the so-called ocean view suites. Two in our party paid for an ocean view room and were put in a smelly room on the 2nd floor that overlooks a noisy pool and bar area with the ocean off in the distance. After complaining they were moved but told they must understand the difference between an ocean view and a "deluxe" ocean view. Wow, is this the Motel 6 or the Marriott?? Overall, nope, would never spend my hard earned money there again. It was okay,but just that okay. We'd find another place for sure. However, Maui is the most beautiful place I've ever been and I would highly recommend a trip there!!!

Reviews.Title: “funny how many reviews share the same negative experience”
Reviews.Author: hehdu
Reviews.Content: Since many reviews already write in great detail about the general issues (location, etc.), I will be succinct and not repeat myself. We were also there during the tsunami warning and I only can applaud the hotel's response. Half of the hotel was evacuated to the ball room where most folks spent their night, guests were constantly informed and even really short on staff (roads closed) the hotel put up free breakfast (hot!) for all guests. I am working in emergency and disaster preparedness and this was an outstanding performance. Because of this experience I decided to shut up and not complain about anything to the hotel management. However, the rest of the stay was not that great. We chose this hotel to celebrate our 10th anniversary and Maui has a special place in our hearts since we spent our honeymoon there and wanted to make this a really special trip. I called in advance to inform them about our special event and hoped the hotel would somehow recognize it. Wrong assumption! We got into one of the worst rooms facing the "garden" and the entrance to the parking garage. After this huge disappointment - nothing! You would expect that they may do some small, but nice things to create this special feeling but forget about it. They just did not care. So we spent 7 nights in this average, no frills room overlooking the parking garage. The beds are simply bad (super soft mattresses) that give you lower back pain after one night. Old equipment and very basic amenities. Internet 15-20$/day and - oh I forgot - on top a nice "resort fee" for just 30$/day which covers parking. The hotel tries to nickle and dime you all the way so we simply went to outside places for food. Pools are quite OK, our kids loved the kiddie pool (2 slides and a great water tower area). We did not mind at all the 5 minute walk to 2 beaches and snorkeling at Ulua beach is also decent (although crowded). All in all just an average resort that just did not seem to care about making this a memorable special stay for us. Taking into account the high price tag, I would say it's not worth staying there. For this price you will find better hotels. Too bad, we really looked forward to our 10th anniversary trip.

Reviews.Title: “Tsunami!”
Reviews.Author: dclhomes
Reviews.Content: We had walked thru this resort last year and it looked boring? We usually stay at the Marriott Ocean club. I use c.c points and fly & stay for free, but could only get 3 free nites here and had to pay at the Ocean Club. First off check in sucked, wasn't buy but very slow check in! Of course no free upgrades and I really felt like an ugly cousin when we got our room, the view location wasn't great, but what do I expect for free! The room was nice, I don't like the tile floors but they're probably cleaner than carpet. The resort is very nice and we found the kids pool which was never crowded and you could drink & eat your own food, hadn't seen it on our walk-thru last year. Overall it was nice, I didn't mind parking fee of $25 a day, never spent a penny at the bars but did blow $200 at MaLa was decent meal & the kids 2-10yo,17yo, liked it and even had sashimi. Our 2nd to last nite sucked as we were put in the ballroom from 2am til 8 for a tsunami, the kids slept on the floor and I \watched the coverage on tv. Luckily it was not much of an event and my heart goes out to the people of Japan. For an affordable meal drive to Kihei, I had prime rib & lobster for $25 @ Moose Mcgillicuddys! Kids voted the Ocean club over here and the Marriott Beach Club on Kauai. Oh- the beach right next door at the Grand Wielea was great for snorkling.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been nice without the theft...”
Reviews.Author: pubadm76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in late at night, only to find out that there was a resort fee of $25.00 per day to park our car (not the valet parking). I thought it was a tad ridiculous that it actually cost more to self-park our car than the rental car itself. Intenet access is also $20.00/day at this resort. The room itself was nice; however, I called on the phone to see if there was a refridgerator and microwave and was told there was; there was only a fridge. We were told that we could use a room to shower in the day of checkout since our flight didn't leave until 9PM. When I went to get the room to shower in, I was told it would be at least a two hour wait (which the guy at the front desk didn't bother to tell me ahead of time), which we did not have to get to the airport. Our choice was to remain slimy with sunscreen or pay to use the spa's showers; we chose the latter but were not happy. The worst part of our trip was when I got to the airport to get some pain medicine (vicodin) out of my suitcase since I have Crohn's disease. I put around 8 pills in my pillbox at the start of my vacation (out of 60 pills), only to see that there were 4 left instead of 50! Since they were locked in the trunk of our car after checkout, the ONLY access peoole had to them was in our room. My wife checked and her rx of xanax had about 15 pils gone. I put my valuables in the safe but didn't think I would need to have my medicine locked up....guess I was wrong. You shouldn't have to file a police report on vacation but we did 11-012496.

Reviews.Title: “Long way from 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Matthieu25
Reviews.Content: As I start all reviews, please take a look and see how many hotels I've reviewed, I'm not a jaded one time traveler. I travel often and feel I have a good base to write a good overall review. With that said this also was not the first time at this resort. Iâ€™d been there many years ago when it was an intercontinental and have been back since its changed hands. I wish prior to this trip I would have taken the TA reviews more serious. Sadly it appears that the current management really doesn't care about the â€œguest experienceâ€� Most of my issues deal with the staff and it started with check in. This is a resort with over 500 rooms and had only 2 people working the front desk. Once reaching Daniel (who was very welcoming) he could not find out reservation. I provided him with a printout with the confirmation number yet he still couldnâ€™t find it. We stood at the front desk for over 35 min while he called, talked with other employees then got on the phone again and was put on hold ( after a 10 hour flight it wasn't much fun standing there) I told Daniel that I had called the hotel the day prior and explained we were celebrating our anniversary and wanted to make sure there was a request for a king bed and if available a ocean view. The woman on the phone also friendly said she would add the request to my reservation and she was happy I was a return guest. Well come to find out the person was just humoring me because no request was ever added and we ended up with 2 queen beds facing the road on the ground floor. I think overall the guest was not put first. If we were just going to assigned one of the worst rooms why didnt he just give us the room after 10 min and sort out the reservation issues later? Why make the guest stand waiting and it wasn't until I called on the reservation that we got someone on the phone who gave him permission to give us a room.. As stated in the end we were given our bad room and an â€œ Iâ€™m sorryâ€� The resort itself is in good shape. It is older (70â€™s - ish) but updated in 2007 I believe. Being updated isnt the same as being clean, the shower head was covered in calcium deposits and the overall clean was not there. We even found a caprisun in the other bed. The beds are by far the most uncomfortable beds Iâ€™ve encountered in my travels (and that includes europe) The linens were very nice and it was great having a fridge in the room. We didnâ€™t have any issues with the walls being thin (it may depend on the building / floor but we could hear people screaming in the halls very early in the morning . As I said this was not our first time to Maui and weâ€™ve done the major Tourist things in past visits. This trip was to lay by the pool and listen to the waves.... The new adult only pool is nice but very few chairs and they cant be moved to stay in the shade. So we were at the main pool the entire time and there weren't many children. Iâ€™m also sorry to say they allow guests to play the â€œtowel gameâ€� which is something youâ€™d never encounter in a real 4 / 5 star hotel. If youâ€™re unaware of how its played its when a guest gets up at dawn to put towels on chairs. We basically were always in the same area and I take no issue if I find a chair with towels and no person / book / evidence they are really there to move the towels so I can take advantage of the resort Iâ€™m paying for. We on advantage would lay by the pool from 10am - 5 pm (5 out of 7 days) and there was not a day that there weren't MANY chairs saved by people that would come and put a beach bag on the chair and lay by the pool or would sit in the chair for 20 min to then just leave. Yet the entire day that chair was unavailable to other guests. There is a pool concierge that could very much monitor the towels on chairs situation. But she just sat under her little hut. (also the pool cards are a total joke, you can put one card in the basket and take 10 if you wanted) There was pool service and it was just ok. The women working the pool seemed spread very thin. Many times we would just get our own drinks. Lori is nice but service was slow and you always had to flag her down. Rebecca kicked butt she really is a true gem but as I said she was spread far to thin but always made sure we were very well taken care of. The bartender Carl was one of the rudest people Iâ€™ve encountered in customer service. He refused to honor the â€œhappy hourâ€� specials and was just out and out rude. For that reason I then refused to spend another dime in that bar my entire trip. The food prices within the resort are outrageous (yes its Maui and expensive) but crazy. After seeing a menu we didn't eat more than one breakfast. We went to Stella Blues every other morning its OUTSTANDING and much more reasonably priced. We happened to be guests during the Tsunami scare. We felt the hotel handled the situation very well and kept all the guests informed. Luckily we weren't one of the rooms that had to be evacuated but we heard they accommodated the guests well. Check out was almost as painful as check in. Again not nearly enough staff and we had to wait over 15 while the front desk clerks give the rundown of the entire resort to guest checking in. Yes thats nice but they should somehow streamline this process or having an area for guests checking out. Our intentions for this trip to Maui was to listen to the ocean at night and get some sun and celebrate our anniversary. Its a shame they were unable to make this trip special in any way. But its still Maui and hey if you get the chance to go to Maui..... GO!!! All in all would I stay here again.. NO we were at the Makena Beach Resort last April and weâ€™d go back there before coming back here..

Reviews.Title: “Too many problems, would never go back”
Reviews.Author: gotgoodkarma
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. Everything looked fine when we checked in, they told us to use the porterage service to bring our bags to the room because it was included in the group rate, yet when I checked out there was a porterage fee on my bill and the reception would not even discuss removing that charge. I was told it was included then charge. I was also under the assumption that there was free internet at the hotel (I called ahead of time to ask this). But they wanted to charge $14+ a day to use it (and only in the lobby!). The room was supposed to be an Ocean View but the only view you could see was when you stood all the way out on the balcony. Late at night we could hear the waves but all the rest of the time we heard delivery trucks idoling and the "beep, beep, beep" of them backing up. I also spilled some lotion while there and when I use the towel to clean it up I also cleaned up a lot of dirt from the floor. I was wondering how often the mopped the rooms and it made me concerned about the rest of the room's cleanliness. The last night we went to the bar to use some coupons for complimentary mai tai coupons but we were "greeted" by a rude obnoxious bartender. We had misunderstood that the hotel coupons for drinks were not redeemable at this bar and the bartender never bothered to make eye contact and muttered something unintelligible before walking off. It was only when another customer at the bar explained what he had said, that we realized the issue. It's too bad because we would have stayed for drinks regardless of the coupons, but the bartender's obnoxious behavior motivated us to leave. This kind of crappy customer service is particularly noticeable in a place like Hawaii where most everyone in tourism industry is friendly and helpful. I don't plan to return there. My conference was great but will certainly not sign up for it again if it is held there.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: mljgilliamswim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and it was an amazing holiday! We were originally placed in a suite that had NO VIEW whatsoever... but it turns out that was ok because it rained the first two entire days we were there and that is when we had the room with no view. Once they had an ocean view room available they moved us. We were overlooking the serenity pool [adults only] and the ocean and were on the bottom floor so we were able to walk right out, which was a huge plus for us! The kiddo pool is great too and that is where the only hot tubs are... which we used more than we normally do on tropical holidays because it was so rainy at first. Highly recommend driving a few miles south to Big Beach and grab lunch at Makena Grille first. Also, get the book Top Maui Restaurants - it helped us BIG TIME. . BEST restaurant we dined in [but VERY expensive] is Capische?. absolutely the BEST meal I have ever eaten. The shops at wailea is within walking distance and that is a big plus. the sushi place Kai is good, but not as good as Sansei in Kihei. Pretty much every [good] restaurant requires reservations, even Mala in the Marriott... so keep that in mind. Visit Kihei [10mn away driving] and Paia [about 30mn away] - those were the best little towns on the island, outside of Wailea. And the public beaches we visited were not great, but if you watch for signs for shoreline or beach access there are some amazing little beaches that are pretty private. If you want to do a lot of excursions but don't have enough money to do them all... go to Boss Frogs in Kihei and they will send you to a timeshare presentation. I know, not fun, but we went when it was raining and we saved $300 plus 20% off of every adventure we did. It made our helicopter tour $163 for 2 of us! If you go to the presentation, DO NOT ask questions because you will be there for a long time. If you don't want to do the timeshare deal, still go to Boss Frogs, they are great to work with Kyle the manager is great! ENJOY your time here! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was so good that even the whales were jumping for joy”
Reviews.Author: Waterman57
Reviews.Content: The pace at check-in felt slow but when we we opened the door to the room, my blood pressure dropped and all was well. Maria gave us a ground floor room opening to the infinity pool and an unobstructed west-facing view of the Pacific. Sunsets were stunning but being surprised to by a whale arcing gracefully on the horizon is the memory I'll keep. Lounge chairs shaded by anything are in high demand. Guests start marking "their" chairs with towels at first light! The advice from Connie McAboy, a poolside concierge, was unexpected- and valuable. Connie noticed that I was looking at sunglasses and that my Maui Jim's were in a state of disrepair. Instead of selling me a new pair, she directed me to the Maui Jim corporate office for repair or a replacement credit. She was confident that they would take care of me, and they did; it saved me $250. I asked Connie to line me up for a snorkeling trip. The big catamaran was almost empty (only 30 passengers; capacity for 80) and we were the first to dive into the early dawn water on Molokini. The water was crystal clear and the sea life was brilliant on the reef: we were in an aquarium. Before heading back, the Captain dropped us in a cove where one of the ship's mermaids directed us to sea turtles on a reef. Maui is not a cheap date. We went to Joe's for dinner at the nearby tennis club. It was expensive and quite unremarkable. A "find" was Matteo's Pizza, walking distance from the Marriott. The pizza quality was exceptional, the tirumisu homemade, and the check-- very small. Matteo's has great casual food, an engaging staff and a relaxed, a welcoming feel. We hope to return to the Marriott, Connie McAboy and Matteo's.

Reviews.Title: “incredible location! Will come back”
Reviews.Author: charlo01
Reviews.Content: Several beaches easy walking distance. Excellant snorkeling opportunities right off beach. Other water activites (paddle board, kayak) onsite, but a bit cheaper in front of the Grand at Ocean Adventure booth. Turtles, whales and more. Luau was o.k. good food, below average show. Lousy restaraunts, overpriced (everything in Maui is pricey) and average food. Infinity pool (adults only) could have used a hot tub or two. Only two on property were taken over by kids at night. Jogging path out front packed! with people. Room nice, clean. Staff friendly. Spa seemed unused and very expensive (could explain "unused"). Business center basic, expensive rates, old printers. Lobby area nice, but not amazing. Great valets. Helpful concierge. Used points and had deluxe oceanview room which actually had a stellar ocean view! Thank goodness for Starbucks....

Reviews.Title: “Wailea best spot in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: IrishFan-80
Reviews.Content: If you go to Maui I'd strongly recommend staying in Wailea. The nicest, most upscale resort area on Maui. We stayed for a week and wish we had a month. Yes we would stay at the Marriott here again. Most negative comments are way overblown. The rooms are large and well maintained. The resort amenities & grounds are terrific. Views of the whales & channel are perfect. Beaches are easily accessed. The walkway in Wailea is beautifully landscaped. The Shops at Wailea are right next door and convenient. I'd only change these things--they ask guests to hand in cards to obtain pool towels--the only Marriott that does not trust its guests!?; and, of course they need to offer elite customers a concierge level breakfast. Marriott needs to recognize that most guests do not want a $20 breakfast buffet every day--just cereal, fruit & juice--which needs included even at these resorts. We do not patronize any restaurants at Marriott hotels that do not offer some breakfast option, which costs them hundreds of dollars in lost profits for a week's stay. The nearby Four Seasons & Fairmont got our restaurant business instead.

Reviews.Title: “What? No beach?”
Reviews.Author: magnolia_nyc
Reviews.Content: I would say one of the major letdowns of this hotel was the absence of beach on its premises. They do have a couple of pools and jacuzzis, including a nice looking infinity pool (although the water there was terribly cold, I could only tolerate it for a few seconds to take pictures and then had to run out), and everything is overlooking the ocean, but then there are just rocks... In order to get to the Wailea beach you have to walk to the neighboring Grand Wailea resort. It is about a 5-7 min walk, you take a walking path that actually runs a couple of miles along the oceanfront, and is very nice for walking/running. Although not a long walk to the beach, getting beach beds and umbrellas will cost you (about $40 per day to rent those), while they are free for Grand Wailea guests. So you do feel like a stepchild going there. And after seeing the beauty and grandeur of Grand Wailea, going back to the Marriott is tough. Of course, Grand Wailea is more expensive, so you get what you pay for... Wailea beach was also disappointing, despite great reviews in all the travel books. The sand was brown (very far from white), and the waves made it uncomfortable to go in, people even tried surfing there. So, at least when we were there, it did not seem like a great beach for leisurely swimming. Of course, we did have some stormy weather a few days prior, so that could've been a factor... If you walk the other way from the Marriott, there is a small beach called Ulua beach which is less croweded and has some decent snorkeling next to the rocks at the end of the beach. Otherwise, the hotel was ok, decent lobby, restaurant, bar. They also had a few gift shops and a conference hall. Parking is extra (you can get a resort passport for $20 a day which includes self parking). Parking garage was not very convenient (have to take stairs to upper levels) but there was always some space available. They also have a luau on the front lawn, I only had a glance at it, so can't comment on the quality of the show, but overall environment did not feel special at all - they just put up plastic chairs on the lawn. The quality of the building came to the test when we got stormy weather. Although we were on the second floor only, this was the highest floor in our building, so we got some major flooding from the roof. The water came dripping down from everywhere - walls, spotlights on the ceiling, etc. The entire bathroom and half of the room were flooded, and we barely had enough time to save our belongings. When we called for help, we were told that this was a problem with the entire hotel and they are working on it. Basically, a few hours later someone came to "estimate the damage" and said that we should move to a different room. They did offer us another room about 3-4 hours later. By that time the rain had stopped, and we opted to stay in the same room after it was cleaned. The rest of the hotel was flooded, too, including parts of the lobby, hallways, etc. It was surprising that a rain can do some much damage. I guess, a testament to the age of the building... Overall, a mediocre hotel. Could be better, could be worse. I guess, it all depends on your expectations...

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: Claudia1971
Reviews.Content: The grounds at this Marriott are beautiful with a long walkway by the beach. Rooms are clean and comfortable. If attending a Luau in Hawaii, the one held on their grounds is great ($). This hotel is near Big and Small Beach (short car drive away). Parking is expensive. We did not try restaurants on resort, but opted to drive 15 minutes to nearest town to eat or buy small grocery (fridge in room). This hotel is located at least a 45 minute scenic drive from small airport. Enjoyed our 4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “My formerly high opinion of Marriott has dropped quite a bit.”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian99
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Marriott Wailea was a very mixed experience. The physical setting is beautiful, as it's located on Wailea Beach on the Island of Maui in Hawaii. The lobby is also very impressive, as it overlooks the beautiful Hawaiian scene. The hotel restaurant was also very good. Everything else was very mediocre. This hotel was constructed in 1976 as the Intercontinental. It became a Marriott a few years ago. The rooms look tired, as if they haven't been remodeled since then. The furniture looks old and is in bad condition with dents on the coffee table and seat cushions on the couches that don't fit well. There's no rug or mat on the floors, so there's a cold, sterile appearance when you enter..Overall, the rooms look run-down. The air-conditioning did not work in the first room we checked into, so we asked for a change. Although we didn't watch the television, it was a very old model unlike the flat-screen models in nice hotels. The staff was very nice, but they did not seem very efficient. The hotel seemed to be understaffed, as there were long lines at the reception desk. Walking around the grounds, I noticed peeling paint on the sides of the building. This added to the run-down feeling of the place. The hotel has no wi-fi in the rooms, but uses a hard wire. The Internet did not work the whole time we were there. We called techical support, but they couldn't do anything. Valet parking will cost you $30 extra, but you can park in the garage by yourself. The garage was crowded and the stalls are very narrow, so it's a hassle to park your car. Many years ago, it seemed as if Marriott was a first-classs hotel chain, but they have clearly let their standards drop. For the price asked, the hotel is not a good value despite the beautiful location. I advise choosing another hotel if you want to go to Wailea. The Grand Wailea looks very nice, so you may want to try that hotel. I do not recommend the Marriott Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Pasty9
Reviews.Content: We spent the last four days of our two week holiday in Maui treating ourselves to four nights in a four star hotel. From beginning to end the staff were friendly, obliging and among the best we have ever experienced. The food, while expensive but no more than anywhere else on Maui, was first class in quality and quantity. We booked a "cheap" room without a sea view but actually could see the beach from our balcony. the room was spacious, clean and had a first class bathroom. It was modern and bright and the range of channels on the TV was good. The infinity pool was exceptional (no one one under 18 allowed and no mobile phones, bliss), no shortage of loungers and fanastic all day service from Rita and Terry the friendliest waitresses ever. Free wi fi at the onsite Starbucks. The proximity to the Shopping Center at Wailea and the excellent Matteos restaurant opposite the Center was a bonus. We were delighted at the Resort and would return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Resort that met all our needs for relaxation”
Reviews.Author: WCOttav
Reviews.Content: Our first time at this resort. 5 years ago we stayed at the Renaissance "up the road" and this property is much nicer. The rooms are quit modern, but still comfortable. We had a top floor room in Hale 4 which overlooks the serenity pool and was close to the lobby and fitness center. We took advantage of the activity pass which includes daily parking, 2 free Mai Tais and other discounts such as for the spa and cabana. The cabana rentals are $100, but nice if you feel like being pampered, which we were by Susan who took great care of us. There's a walking path directly in front along the ocean & is great for constant people watching, but is far enough away to keep a sense of quiet as you relax poolside. You're just steps away from the Shops at Wailea and minutes from Kihei which has lots of moderately priced lunch & dinner spots.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: charli3601
Reviews.Content: Arrived for six nights using Marriott Rewards points. The open air lobby is gorgeous and check in was prompt. We were given an ocean facing room as reserved but had significant trouble finding it. The resort is large and a bit confusing so using a bellman to get to your room is probably a better idea, especially if you have large luggage, as there are stairs throughout the property (and avoiding them can be a maze). We were given a room with a patio on the ground floor about 50 feet from the ocean. As other reviews have stated there is no beach attached to the property but there are two within a ten minute walk. Wanting a higher floor room, we were moved the second day and ended up about 30 feet from the ocean perfectly lined up with where the sun set. We only ended up hanging out on the beach for one day. Beach chair rentals were $20 or $25 per day, per chair. Like we did, you may want to go to Wal-Mart or K-Mart and buy some chairs when you're leaving the airport and heading to the hotel. Instead of the beach we made our daily home the adults only infinity pool. Saw several to many whales every day, a few were quite close. Pool servers were super nice and one gave us a free cabana when she learned it was our last day. Get to know them; they're fun and friendly. The Shops at Wailea are a very quick walk from the hotel and we dined there often. Additionally, the beach path made for nice long walks. After exploring other hotels I would not stay anywhere else on Walea. You cannot get any closer to the ocean and its views while staying at any other hotel. The Four Seasons looked very nice but was a hike from the shops. The Grand Wailea was over the top and would be a complete zoo with kids during the busiest times. For value, comfort, service and convenience you cannot go wrong with the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: stew24
Reviews.Content: If you are a Marriot Rewards Member don't stay here hoping for any of the benefits you are used to as a reward member. No preferred line at guest check-in No room upgrade No concierge lounge No (2) breakfast vouchers for cont. breakfast (as is customary when no lounge is avail.) No newspaper each morning No robe and slippers in your room Not even upgraded bath toiletries as is customary We couldn't even get a King bed for our week in Maui together. I think most gues are using points as we did for our stay so the hotel nickels and dimes you for everything else. Plan on spending $40-$60 a meal minimum. Beautiful grounds if all you want to do is lay by the pool and watch whales for a week or if you're a big golfer. Wailea actually doesn't have a town to speak of or anything to do, it's really just a strip of resorts an hotels. Stick to Keiha or Lahaina if you want any activities. Oh and you must rent a car to get around Wailea, we couldn't even find a place to rent bikes that wasn't 30 miles away w/delivery and pick-up fee.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want in a resort.”
Reviews.Author: NolaGal_2
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Wailea Marriott. Stayed on points so can't speak really to the rates but did pay for upgrade to ocean view. Got a room where you could only see the ocean if you cranked your head around the corner, so we complained. They found us another room - with two queens instead of the one king we had asked for but no worries. We were ultimately quite happy with our room! The grounds are gorgeous - whether you choose to hang by the infinity pool or the family pools or the beach. We started to register for the Luau on the Marriott property and the concierge suggested instead the Luau next door at the Grand Wailea, which turned out to be fantastic (although the Cirque-du-Soliel-ish stunts from coconut trees seemed a bit of stretch for a luau...). The Grand Wailea luau even had some booths with local jewelry for shopping. (One of our party liked a necklace but it was too long; the jeweler shortened it and used the extra pieces to make earrings and we picked it up a couple days later!) The Starbucks on the Marriott property is open EARLY (5:30 am) which was nice for those of us with "four-hours-ahead" mental clocks. If you wanted a pretty cheap quick bite for breakfast, they had a breakfast egg sandwich, bagel or oatmeal with dried fruit which certainly worked for us. If you wanted a bigger breakfast and have a car, recommend driving down to Stella Blues. Sat outside on the patio there and it was quite lovely. We had a couple folks who had trouble with stairs and the property was very helpful with this - e.g. a cart ride to the Luau, elevators to get down to pool level. The business room with available computers was pricey (at least in my book) at 65 cents per minute. If you have a computer, you can get the hotel code and sit either in the lobby or in Starbucks for free. I believe it cost to use the internet from your hotel room. The long path by the beach was fantastic for jogging, fast walking or even strolling, tho it does get a bit crowded if you are out there past, say, 8:30 am. The shops within walking distance include some very nice (read: pricey) stores - Coach, Tiffany's, Louis Vuitton - but there are a handful of more reasonably priced stores as well - Chico's, GAP, Banana Republic, and even an "ABC" store (you find them everywhere!) where you can find the basics. All in all, a wonderful vacation! Didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre accommodations, good service”
Reviews.Author: philc128
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort however this property is not on the beach. You have to walk next door to the Grand Wailea to use their beach. The hotel is very quiet and very clean. We paid for deluxe waterfront accommodations on an upper floor. Although we did get an oceafront room, we were put on the ground floor and therefore ended up with a patio instead of a lanai. More about this later. The property has a beautiful infinity pool area with some umbrellas and cabanas. Not enough sun coverage for those not wanting direct sun. We rented a cabana for one day and although it provided some sun coverage, it was not enough and I got badly sunburned. The pool itself is beautiful however it is not heated and the water is ICE COLD! Too cold to enjoy. Each patio or lanai is equipped with a table and two wicker chairs which are extremely uncomfortable. There are no lounge chairs. For lounge chairs, you have to lay in the sun by the pool, or get up very early and grab the few lounge chairs placed under several trees by the waterfront. We asked if two longe chairs could be broughto our room and at first we were told "no". After pushing the issue and speaking to a manager, the manager conceded to having one chair delivered to our room but not two. This was better than nothing I guess, although there were two of us in the room. The bed in the room is too soft so if you have back problems, beware. The onsite restaurant is excellent! Get whole fried fish!! It's amazing! Next time, its back to the Ritz Carlton or i would like to try the Grand Wailea. I don't think i will stay at the Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Turned our trip around. In a good way!”
Reviews.Author: coco0522
Reviews.Content: We stayed at another hotel and had very bad problems there. We checked around to see where else we could go last minute. We called the Marriott and they have room but it would be a room with a bad view. We said we would take anything at this point. When we arrived to check in they were very sorry to hear about our trouble and upgraded our room so we ended up with a part ocean view. Every one was so friendly and helpful and we really liked this hotel a lot better then where we were.

Reviews.Title: “total relaxation”
Reviews.Author: bear2336
Reviews.Content: We used marriott rewards and were upgraded to ocean view room above adult pool.. Room 1502 is a perfect spot to watch the whales.. Had dinner in lounge first night, went to Mulligans, 4 seasons, Cafe O'lei, Matteo's, 808 Bistro. The beaches are very very close to the hotel thou not in front of pools, a good reason to get away from pools.. The poolside afternoon specials were a good value.. A perfect relaxing get away.. The lobby has a tremendous view!!!! No free wifi in rooms/pool

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: luv2vacation14
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on reward points so probably wouldn't have paid the rate they were asking without them. Stayed at a great condo for the rest of the vacation. That being said our stay was great. The room was right on the ocean on the second floor allowing us to leave our sliding glass door open all night to hear the ocean. The beach was only a short walk from the room, pool area nice and not crowded. Pool staff, bell staff and front desk staff all friendly and helpful. Close to shopping center that had good restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Nancy43323
Reviews.Content: My husband, 19 yr old daughter, and I stayed here for our Christmas Holiday. The first and maybe the only disappointment was our room. We booked through Orbitz and upgraded to an Ocean View. The view was pretty much blocked with a huge tree in front of our balconey. That didn't really bother me but it irked my husband to no end. The most disappointing thing was they gave us a room with a King size bed when we explicitly wanted 2 Queen beds. It's not like the 3 adults were going to "sleep together." They didn't think it was a big deal and said to use our sofa roll out bed - - not what we were paying $10.0000 for! My husband asked at least 3 times if we could have a room change and he just got a "We'll see" response. He actually slept in the roll out because I have had back surgery and my daughter also has a back problems. Nice 10 days for him, ha ha! We did, however, like the location and the walking path. What we most liked was going to all the other hotels - the Grand, the Four Seasons, and the Fairmont to have drinks and meals, We ate at the Marriott MALA twice for breakfast. We absolutely lived at the Infinity Pool when we were not out and about snorkeling, shopping, helicopter rides, etc. The staff was amazing and the concierges tremendous in booking all of our desires. We rented a cabana the first day - fantastic! I loved not hearing children screaming! We are beyond that stage in our lives. The service was fantastic. I would absolutely LOVE to go back to Maui and would definitely want to stay in the Wailea area because it's warmer than up north. Next time, we'd try to do a rental with an owner of a timeshare. I would hate to give up that walking path! Overall, the location is what makes the Marriott a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Setting for Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: travelprosNJ
Reviews.Content: We loved the Marriott Wailea . A perfect mix of understated elegance in interior and exterior spaces, with a location on the Wailea coast that is near perfect. Someone here understands that it's all about the spectacular views that this location on the beach affords.............all enhanced by beautifully kept grounds and lawns sloping down to the rocky coastline. We'd return in a heartbeat. Distractions here are few ..............which we loved most about the resort. No pounding music at the pools (the sounds of the ocean and the birds prevail).......... many great places to dream (how about the oceanfront hammocks?) ...........the very comfortable lobby on a rainy day, and attentive and responsive staff. Nothing beats relaxing on the chaises at the edge of the lawn, overlooking that rocky shore. The pools are very nice and offer many options for finding a quiet place........... with service at the pools being attentive but not at all intrusive .(thanks to "Nita in particular for her great service during out 8 days at the resort.) A few things might keep reviewers in general from giving the Marriott an "excellent" review. A few amenities are lacking (pools are not heated; no brand name toiletries to enjoy; older tvs; no robes unless you call down to request..........and a location (Wailea in general) which some might find a little too quiet for those who love a big nightlife scene. Also, if you love being right on a sandy beach each day ..........this might not be your resort, since as other reviewers have pointed out............the Marriott oceanfront is all rocky (Spectacular!) so the 5 minute walk to the beach on either side of the property may bother some.................... .particularly when you realize there are no chaises waiting there once you walk over which are available for Marriott guests to use.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: muppins
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Christmas Day with the intention of staying for a week. The staff's attitude was either depressed or uncaring. I relocated after two days. When I checked out early, they didn't even bother asking why. This was not up to Marriott standard.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Outdoors, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Minnie655
Reviews.Content: Great location right on the beach. Wailea is one of the least windy and rainy places on Maui, protected from the Trade Winds. Easy access to the highway and close to nearby towns. The pools are great, spacious, and not as crowded as other resorts. The hotel grounds fall in the middle of an expansive coastline, offering plenty of options for beach walkers. Be sure to visit the ice cream store in the shopping center next door for great homemade treats! The rooms are not what we expected for $400/night-- they are clean and nice enough, but nothing terribly fancy. Suggestions: Find local luaus beyond the hotel-- the hotel's luau pales in comparison to other offerings. Also, the ocean view rooms aren't worth the price-- save yourself the extra $70 a night and use it for something more worthwhile!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful open resort”
Reviews.Author: kathady
Reviews.Content: We wanted the location, but could not find anything in the area below $400 per night. We booked this hotel on Priceline and got a garden room for $229 per night. It had a slider with a table and chairs outside the room. It was beautiful and located convenient to the parking, registration, lobby and just steps from restaurant and up steps from pool. The resort is open and has multiple pools, infinity, 2 side by side and children's pool. The food was good at the restaurant and reasonably priced, more expensive at the pools. The spa was good, particularly the massage. The location couldn't be better. Walk up the beach to the other resorts, Four Seasons, Fairmont, Grand Wailea, walk to mall with shopping and additional restaurants. Parking (nonvalet) was included in spa fee and was closeby and convenient. I would definitely stay there again, much nicer and less crowded than neighboring resorts. You have to put your table out to hold a chair, only downside. You can rent cabanas, which were reasonable and I would do this if we returned.

Reviews.Title: “SCAMMING HOTEL WILL NOT CREDIT MARRIOTT REWARD POINTS”
Reviews.Author: alitalia
Reviews.Content: on my past stay at this property and being Platinum status my check out Bill Totaled 914.00 which was for In -Room dining .
