Spa Visits parking and Restaurants on site checking my account I only see i received credit for 216.00 charges, Called the Hotel and was giving the run around the Hotel Spa is owned by someone else the Restaurant in there building belongs to someone else etc etc. Marriott rewards CLEARLY STATES 10 points for every DOLLAR spend I understand taxes are not Included. I found out that the more points a Hotel send to you account they must pay a commission. Totally a Enemy to the Marriott reward program. BE AWARE

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and beautiful sunsets”
Reviews.Author: chocdreamer
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Marriott Wailea. Stayed on points and our room was on an end with a partial view of the water. Rooms are large but the beds are too soft for our liking. The grounds are pretty but our favorite part was the adult infinity pool. Quiet and relaxing with the best poolside service I have ever had. Lunch menu was great, but you are going to pay a premium to be served at the pool. Vietnamese lettuce wraps, yum! I would have loved to have a jacuzzi pool at the adult side. The infinity pool is salt water and a bit cold. It would be nice to be able to get out and sit in the jacuzzi but you had to walk to the family pool to do that. Service all around was attentive. The lobby area is great to sit and people watch. They have tasty pineapple/sugarcane water in the lobby...don't miss it! You can also just walk to the Shops at Wailea across the street or take a long walk along the beach path passing the other luxurious hotels. There is no beach, per se, but the views are spectacular. Take a walk one mile to Pita Paradise for a great meal and try their baklava ice cream pie. This is a nice place to stay. It is not as fancy as it's neighbors, but probably a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Great anniversary stay!”
Reviews.Author: SteveEagar
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review... Stayed here for a anniversary 4 day weekend trip. Had a beautiful "beachfront" room. The beachfront rooms are the rooms on the ends of the "oceanfront" buildings, that are closest to the water. I thought our room was fantastic. I think this property is beautiful. Particularly for adults. If we had been traveling with kids I may have picked a place with a more elaborate pool and slide system. We loved the infinity pool. It is just a beautiful resort. It is now our perfect mom and dad escape place!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: RedSoxWorldChamps
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) Great location - shopping next door and a short drive to groceries, restaurants, and other attractions in Kihei. There is a wonderful walking path in front of the hotel that we enjoyed a few times for a morning walk. It's also easy to walk to the other hotels nearby. The views from this hotel are so pretty. 2) Quiet - our room was near the newer infinity pool and we were never disturbed. 3) Well maintained grounds 4) Rooms - quite functional with comfortable beds 5) Gym - Adequate and functional Cons: 1) Parking fees - I thought the $20/day parking fee was steep 2) Hotel layout seemed a bit disjoined - This wasn't a big deal, however it was obvious that some buildings were added to the hotel at a later date. Overall this hotel met our needs quite well. It's not as fancy as the Grand Wailea or others next door, however I was quite comfortable and hated to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: kellycm2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to this Marriott in October. We stayed in a Ocean View Balcony room which was nice but not up to modern standards. There is no in room wifi and the bathrooms are rather small. We stayed on points which is definitely not the best use of them. The new adult pool is very nice. We would have liked to have had an overwater cabana but they were all booked. We did not eat at the Marriott at all so I cannot say much about their food. The resort location is very good. It is right next to a shopping center and is along the beach walk connecting to all of the other Wailea resorts. One night we walked to the Four Seasons and had dinner at Ferraro's which was spectacular. Overall, a great trip (mileage run).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location.”
Reviews.Author: esoxtony
Reviews.Content: The family spent a week at the Marriott Wailea. We were skeptical based on the reviews. However, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. We were in Hale 7 which is the farthest away from the lobby. However, it was close to the the beach. Kind of a good news bad news. We were on the second floor with an ocean view which was awesome. Would have love to have more pool staff for drinks and food. Did not pay for the resort fee because the self parking ($20 a day) was very close. Walking distance to shops/restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations and great service”
Reviews.Author: 1bossymom
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the spacious and modern styling of the room. There are several pools for families, though the nicest is reserved for adults only. The kids (6 & 8) loved the slides. It's a big resort but not overwhelming like some of the neighboring properties. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Love Wailea & the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: mahalowannabe
Reviews.Content: 2nd trip to Maui, have stayed in Wailea & at Ka' annapali both times, Wailea is best by far for couples. The service at the Marriott is awesome, thought so while we were there and even more when we went to next hotel. The adult serenity pool is really wonderful. Beautiful setting, our room overlooked it and the ocean. The servers & pool staff are great & they take polite but immediate action to make sure this remains a tranquil adults only space, by asking people with children & cell phones to step away from this area. Also met enjoyable adult guests who were interesting to talk with. The bartenders at the pool bar next door are also great. Being a Starbuck's junkie it was wonderful to have a full Starbucks on site. It is a great option for a light salad or sandwich too, if you don't want a big lunch poolside. Saw whales & turtles everyday from pool and ocean area in front of the pool. True, there is no sandy beach directly in front of the hotel, but if you can't appreciate this view & setting, there is something seriously wrong. Great snorkleing in at Ulua Beach & also in front of old Rennaisance Hotel. Saw more fish at Black Rock but this is especially beautiful healthy looking coral reef. Not a huge fan of the tile floors in the room but other than that, perfect, personally I thought the beds were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Parts of hotel very nice.”
Reviews.Author: jbmWyoming
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a last minute trip to Hawaii and found a good rate at Marriott. Most of this has already been said. The lobby is nice but the resort itself is not lush or high end. The welcome from front desk was excellent and we were given a room with a good view. The room itself was basic but nice and a VERY comfortable bed and bedding, which is very important to us. We were checking out the hotel as a possible place to come back to with our children. I would NOT stay here with children and would rate it 3stars if I had. The adult infinity pool and service there is excellent. The other pool is really nothing special and small. We did check out the Four Seasons and Grand Wailea. I would not pay to stay there as they are both crammed on the small beach, but are excellent places to eat, especially Four Seasons for lunch. We spent most days travelling the entire island/beaches and found a couple nice condo resorts we would prefer to stay at with kids but for the price and location and a quick get-away this is a good option. The restaurant had excellent food but the servers were VERY snobby. We ate at Nick's and several other high end restuarants and were treated very well. Considering the rate we paid and the customer service (front desk, valet, pool) we liked the Marriott. Don't go expecting a good beach -- travel other areas of the island for that. Marriott does have a decent gift shop/store with good prices on beer and snacks and the Starbucks was nice. Shopping nearby was also good and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “TE AU MOANA LUAU REVIEW...AVERAGE AT BEST”
Reviews.Author: marilynepc
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good and go from there Staff - extremely friendly! Band/narrator - both were excellent! Show - very entertain-ing! Ambiance - beautiful beachside setting and free lei, but plastic chairs and tables :( on site photographer took a beachside picture and it was $20 to purchase :( Food - We're no foodies and we can say that the food was not prepared well...no flavor at all. The grilled veggies were good and the pork was decent. Mahi Mahi, chicken, macoroni salad, all bland and I almost choked on the steak and actually had to spit it out. Drinks - The WORST part about this...the cheap alcohol was a slap in the face afer paying $200 to eat there. We could have gone to mama's fish house and spent the same amount for an amazing meal and suberb drinks, so really the fact that the show was good made this exeperience less of a waste of time. Our advice is......if you can get discount tickets, cheap alcohol doesn't bother you, and you like under flavored food, then this is a way to spend an evening in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!! we loved it”
Reviews.Author: PD014
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Wailea in dec 2010. The hotel grounds were beautiful. we loved the open-air lobby with the view of the ocean. Since we booked via priceline bidding, we knew we were not going to get an ocean view room, which was fine for us. but the actual room had partial ocean view and looked updated. My hubby was gold member so we got an upgrade for ocean front room..amazing view. Room was always clean when we returned. good service provided by the staff. The infinity pool was gorgeous! We actually loved the peaceful beachesof the Wailea area. short drive to Kihei had lot of food option. Wailea is also close to airport, hana drive and lot of other activities like snorkeling etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay....depending on your interests”
Reviews.Author: linasegar
Reviews.Content: I came to Wailea for a wedding that was at the Four Seasons..Four Seasons prices were too steep for me so I decided to stay at the nearby marriot...We were a group of 14 30-somethings. The Good... -Hotel is oceanfront but not beach front, so the ocean is there you just have to walk a couple of minutes to get to the beach. -Staff is great and very helpful -Clean rooms, soft bed( I dont know why people are saying the beds were uncomfortable) -I got an upgrade to ocean view from ocean front..I ended up right in front of the pool and close to the lobby -very relaxing atmosphere -Beautiful Grounds -Hotel bell boy will take you to the Shops at Wailea The Bad (for a group of 30 somethings) -As soon as we got to the hotel it was 9:30 pm hawaii time, we all went to the oceanfront area and were just cutting up and having a good time...5 minutes later an employee arrived on a golf cart and told us this a resort and they like quiet..therefore we were being to loud..so if you are staying here SHHHH!!! -Nothing is open passed like 9...you have to walk to longhi's which is open till 12am...they have a happy hour that starts at 10pm -Basically the resort is for people who want to get away and relax..there is no party or fun going on, and honestly I dont hold the marriott accountable, I think its the whole island..with that being said if you wanna party or hang out and want to go to Hawaii..go to Honolulu TIps Rent a car!! Food is so much cheaper outside the resort..$30 per person for a buffet is ridiculous. We ate in Kihei everyday, its only 5 mins away..Stella blues is fabulous..Kihei Cafe is a dive..but the food is fabulous. WE eat for 2 under $20.00. Dinner same thing.. get out of the resort we order 2 drinks and wings and the total was 40.00 -Right now is whale season so you have to go to Lahania for any water sports -The luau is mediocre..if you want to go to say you went then go. Its 98.00 per person

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for a non-resort atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: petlad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient if you do not want to pay top dollar to stay at a resort in Wailea. The hotel room was fine and since it was simple, it gave you more incentive to go out and explore Maui which is why we flew many hours to reach there. The location of the hotel is convenient to the town of Kihei which has many shops and restaurants, to other attractions and also to the highway. The Wailea beaches are great. You may need to walk a bit to reach the beach depending on where your room is located. The pool was nice and not over-crowded. You could also relax on the lounge chairs which are located at the top of the small cliffs and watch the sunset and ocean. iThe shopping center including Whaler's General Store was within walking-distance. The hotel also has a washer and dryer which seems unique for any hotels in Wailea. This was very convenient. Overall the stay at the hotel was very good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A nice way to relax and destress”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoDudeRancher
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews prior to my travels and found this to be the right mix of positives and price. I was not disappointed. I did not pay for an ocean view room, however when I checked in I asked if I could get a complementary upgrade. They gave me a partial view on the ground level (which I liked because I could walk out form there). I also told them that I wanted to be near the adults-only pool (there are 3 pools). That pool was fantastic - quiet, excellent views, beautiful layout, great service staff. The drinks are nice, I ate dinner once at thre main restaurant (tasty!), and the staff arranged boating trips for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience- hotel worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: traveler77096
Reviews.Content: I have to say that we carefully monitored Trip Advisor before our Wailea trip and were surprised to see some of the past guests' comments about the Marriott. Our experience was wonderful from beginning to end! We were given a room in Hale 6 with ocean front and it was superb! The hotel staff was courteous, friendly and accommodating. Skip valets & self park- they are not interested in you. The beach access was great, the jogging path made the trip- watching the sunrise in a perfect setting! The Shops of Wailea were a plus and part of the reason we chose this area of Maui. Tip: the water slides close promptly at 5 so make sure you are there early! Loved the cabana- worth the $$ and so peaceful with the adults only rule. Tip: If you reserve cabana same day after 1- it is half price. Waitresses friendly! Starbucks great & access to printing boarding passes very nice. No nightlife, but when in paradise you need to get up early to enjoy! Hotel/jogging path/pools are fill up very early- by 7 am so be sure to get up early. Cheeseburger Island has best breakfast & an early bird special. Tommy Bahama's has great vegeterian menu. Be sure to hit the surrounding local beaches like Paia for best waves and prettiest sand! Worth every penny, Marriott was great :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable location, nice property”
Reviews.Author: boomerz
Reviews.Content: A rather low key hotel, pleasant but not pretentious. We got an excellent (discount) rate in the off-season, so we were thrilled to get an ocean-view upgrade. Our corner room was large, clean, quiet, and comfortable. Overall service was good, not great. Very good location for walks on ocean front trail past other big resort properties and short walk to upscale mall. Small, but pleasant swimming pools- the infinity pool is particularly attractive. Nearby beaches within easy walking distance were great. Snorkeling at other great beaches very short drive.Wailea is a quiet, upscale neighborhood, nicer than the hustle-bustle of Kihei.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hackers2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on last night of vacation. Nice room except it was part of connecting rooms and we heard a lot of noise from the room next door. Would not have expected that at a 5 star hotel. Great location with a beautiful beachwalk. Parking was expensive as others have noted. I was talked into upgrading for another $5 and received two drinks and various discounts for other things I did not use. The Starbucks on site offered two hours of free internet but most of us trying to use it had issues. We had to call the help desk number provided by Starbucks to connect. Nice areas for snorkeling in this area. Beautiful serenity pool here. Hard to find approaching the hotel as the sign for the hotel is facing the opposite direction. Enjoyed sitting in our lounge chairs next to the ocean. Very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: jericangle
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel if you are paying $100 per night. We paid $300 per night and it is not worth it. The pools are nice, except for the fact that they are literally 55 degrees. All of the bars close at 7:30pm.... and the tv channels are horrible. I am glad to get oxygen and lifetime, but could I get some espn maybe? No.... will spend the extra money for the grand wailea next time.

Reviews.Title: “Made Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: poooh4
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing. Each day you wake up in a picture post card setting. The bed was so comfortable that we had to take off the sheets to see who the manufacturer was. The pool is beautiful, spotless and has a view of the Pacific. Dinner at the Marriott's Mana restaurant was excellent, although the service was a bit unattentive. The rooms were beautiful, clean and spacious. The view from the lanai overlooking the ocean and the pools was awe inspiring. The staff was so attentive and concerned for our well-being (we had been booked in a deplorable timeshare condo and needed to seek more hospitable surroundings spur of the moment, when the first 5-6 cheaper hotels in Kihei were fully booked. It was a blessing in disguise as we planned on staying for two days and looking for a cheaper hotel, then loving it so much we stayed at the Marriott the entire week). While it cost a few dollars more, I can honestly say it was well worth it and would stay there again in a heartbeat. Should we be lucky enough to visit Maui again, we will certainly be staying at the Wailea Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the property is looking a little tired.”
Reviews.Author: treilly2003
Reviews.Content: Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Wailea Marriott but a few things really bothered me. 1) Recent renovations were soft goods only - exterior still looks dated 2) THE SERENITY POOL WAS FREEZING. It was 80+ degrees out and yet it was still painful to get in the pool! Beautiful to look at but seriously, they need to heat that pool a little! 3) Because we booked on priceline we didn't get any kind of an ocean view. On the plus side, our room was near the Grand Wailea end so we had easy access to real sand beach. 4) Lame $20 per day charge for self parking. 5) Food at MALA is totally over-priced. 6) Toiletries were really sub-par (I know that sounds v shallow but honestly, it was gross) 7) No wifi - hard line internet connection for $15 per day in the room. Lame. What I did like: 1) Bar service poolside - those ladies really do take care of you. 2) The Te Au Moana luau was awesome. 3) The view from the serenity pool really is gorgeous - totally unobstructed ocean view. 4) Location was awesome - ocean front walk every morning, right in front of the Shops at Wailea, etc. Depending on what you pay per night, this place is not a bad deal. Beware that if you bid on Resort in Wailea (priceline), you will probably get this property and not the Four Seasons/Grand Wailea/Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Late review but must add”
Reviews.Author: Escapefromthedesert
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed September 2008, but noticed, I never wrote a review. I want to praise the great vacation that I had. The checkin was great and easy. The rooms are comfortable. We had a partial ocean view which was bonus. The rooms are nicley decorated and the cleaning was impecable. We even had a room near the elevators and it still was quiet. The grounds are excellent, there are serveral pools and one is an adult only which is great for a resort property. The gym was large, crowded at times, but getting equipment wasn't a long wait. We had a car, since we wanted the car to explore the Island, we found that there is a fee for parking, There are a couple of places to eat breakfast, lunch and dinner within walking distance at the mall adjacent to the hotel. Wailea is the quiet area of the Island, I believe it is an area ideal for golfers. We ate breakfast once at the hotel and the meal was expensive, but the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferal
Reviews.Content: When I travel, I like pleasant surroundings, good service and as seamless an experience as possible. The Wailea Marriott provided all of this. The grounds were beautiful, with 2 main adult pools and one children's area. The resort fronts on a rocky shoreline, which is very beautiful and allows for a pleasant lounging experience, on a deck chair overlooking the rocks and water. Some have complained that the resort is not right on the beach, but I didn't see this as a problem since the beach was just a few minutes' walk in either direction. I think it made the resort seem a bit more secluded than the ones that front the beach. There is excellent snorkeling and body surfing/boogie boarding at both beaches. I reserved an ocean-view room and believe I got a nice deal for the money. I was at the beach end of Hale 2, facing north, and because of the way the building is angled it was more like an ocean-front room. The furnishings in the room were minimalist, with a slight Asian influence. If you like a lot of goop in your room, this is not the hotel for you, but if you like a bright, airy space without a lot of clutter, it's perfect. The only complaints I had about the room were; the sofa wasn't comfortable as configured because the seat cushions wanted to sink down into the sleeper mechanism, and the shower was dark because there was no light in the shower and the shower curtain blocked the light from the overhead fixture. I fixed the sofa problem by putting a throw pillow under the seat cushion and it was fine. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and there was a fridge provided. The service at the hotel was attentive without being intrusive. Check in and check out went smoothly; the one time I ordered room service it was fast, friendly and of good quality. I ate in the restaurant once and while it was overpriced (it was Hawaii) the food was pretty good and the service was excellent. I also used the spa for a mani-pedi and arm wax and had a good time - skilled staff, clean and beautiful facilities and a small discount with the resort coupons you get for your $25 resort fee. The spa charges were not cheap but were on par with other resort spas. There is a shopping center just next door to the resort - I rented good-quality snorkel gear from Maui Dive Shop and was able to stock up on yogurt, fruit and cheese at the Whalers' General Store, which saved me from crazy restaurant breakfast prices. I came to Maui to relax, read books by the water, go for walks in beautiful surroundings and have a home base for a couple of motorcycle adventures. Wailea Marriott was perfect in all regards. Regarding the resort fee - it's annoying but most of the resorts charge it, or factor it in by charging more for their rooms. I would prefer to just pay it upfront in the room price, but it is what it is and even with it added to my room rate, the Marriott was a good value. Also with the two free Mai Tais (I got both since I was traveling solo) and the discount on my pedicure, one day of the extra fee was paid for. I wish the resort fee had included free internet, but alas, WIRED internet was another $15 a day. Since it was wired, it wasn't even that useful because it didn't allow for watching a movie in bed or any other relaxing scenario. I paid for it for one day to do some research and then put my laptop in the safe for the rest of the trip. The Starbucks in the lobby has free 2-hour internet with purchase, which I would have used it I had known about it before I paid my $15 for the one day. And, lastly, I got a car/hotel package on Expedia. I actually paid $17 a night LESS for the car/hotel than I would have paid for the hotel by itself. Definitely look into the package deals if you decide to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Heaven”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvl35244
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this hotel!!!! This was the highlight of our honeymoon/trip to Hawaii. Our trip started off with a 4 day stay in Honolulu, and ended with 5 days at this resort. I can honestly say, when traveling back to Hawaii...I would much rather go straight to the Wailea Beach Resort. The overall experience was very relaxing. We had a little mis-hap with the hotel loosing our reservation which was done through a travel agent..but once we got the travel agent on the phone to confirm and fax our paper work over, the hotel was quick to compensate for 2 hours of time wasted to straighten thiings out. They comped our $25 per day fee, as well as upgraded us to an oceanview room. And when we arrived in the room, there was a bottle of wine waiting on ice. The only downside to our experience was the breakfast was ridiculously overpriced. But that as well as everything else in Hawaii :-) We will definitely be returning to this hotel in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “HONEYMOON BLISS..... AHHHHH”
Reviews.Author: adman_10
Reviews.Content: What an ideal location for your honeymoon. We went a spend half of our honeymoon at this absolutely beautiful hotel. The adult only infinity pool was an amazing addition which really made our stay a pleasure. The cost to rent a floating cabana was well worth it as the view, chairs and atmosphere were heavenly. We didn't rent the cabana more than twice because the free chairs were so great as well. it is nice to have so much selection around the hotel as well with the childrens pool and water slides hidden off around the side of the hotel it keeps any screaming kids at a minimum. Our recommendation would be to alternate tour/travel days and leisure days. This location is ideal for hitting up every attraction on the island, whether you want to drive to Hana and back, visit lahaina (the fisherman village), or go snorkeling just off shore at any maui beach. There isn't a beach on the property, BUT DON'T WORRY, you can walk a few hundred feet in either direction on the shorefront sidewalk and you will find a nice secluded spot to relax and enjoy the sun, or the beautiful ocean water. The Rooms were beautifully appointed, and while we had to switch rooms once because they didn't have the oceanview room available when we arrived the staff were unbelievable helpful in making the room change seem effortless. The only downfall i can imagine at this hotel, is the complicated halls and finding you way back to the hotel room. THIS HOTEL IS 6-STAR IN MY BOOKS..

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KLD88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled here for our first wedding anniversary. We were unsure of what to expect due to the mixed reviews, but we both enjoyed our stay here very much. Rooms: We booked an "ocean front room" thru Expedia, and our first room was in Hale 3. It was a beautiful room, with an amazing view. Our only complaint was it was on the 2nd floor, right next to the walkway to the pool and sports bar. The location of this room was nice as it was very close to both pools, restaurants, and lobby. We would have just prefered a bit more privacy. We called the next day to see if we were able to switch rooms, and they said it may take a day due to the hotel being at full capacity. They called us back later that night, with an option to take a room in the tower. We switched to a room on the 6th floor, which seemed a bit smaller, but still with an amazing view. We felt more comfortable sleeping with our window open there. However, the housekeeping seemed a little lax in the tower. We had to ask for new soap/toiltries, and our floor was not swept. This was not the case with our first room. Beds: Yes, they are very soft, and by the end of the week we started to get achy, but not terribly uncomfortable. Pillows were super soft, so if that's something you don't prefer, I'd look into bringing your own pillow. Service: Great. Our check in was smooth, which is what we wanted after a 9 hour flight, and complications @ the airport. (delayed, luggage on different flight..) Concierge was helpful in dealing with my husbands golf club rental, and also local restaurant advice. Pool service was friendly, along with the service @ the pool cafe. Pools: Both pools were very nice, and both had amazing views! We spent most of our time at the adult pool. Had no issues getting chairs, and the waitresses were super friendly. Service was a tad slow here, but we were in no rush. Restaurants: We only ate at the pool cafe and Starbucks. Pool cafe is a bit pricey, but not unreasonable. We did not eat @ Mala. If you drive up to Kihei (5-10min), there is a great breakfast joint called the Kihei Cafe. Total dive, but great food! We also ate at Fred's Mexican Cafe and Cafe O'lei which were very good and had drinks @ Moose McGillycuddys. Stay away from Spices. It's a breakfast/lunch restaruant on that main strip (I believe part of the Maui Coast Hotel)... Terrible food!!! We went for breakfast and although service was ok, the food was almost unedible. We drove up to Kapaula one night to have dinner at the Pinapple Grill. Great food. Our last night we had dinner @ Ferraro's in the Four Seasons. Amazing! Tips: We did pay the $25/day resort fee. It includes 2 free mai tais, or Starbucks drinks and parking. We also received an "aloha card". This card allowed discounts at certain restaurants @ the hotel and throughout the island. The employees at the pool/restaurant do not ask if you have this card, so you must give it to them for your discount, but it definitely helped out with the bill! Although this hotel is not "beachfront", it still has amazing views of the ocean, west Maui, and Lanai. There is a small beach to the north of the hotel, and another one just to the south. It is not a long walk at all, so do not let the negative comments of "no beachfront" deter you. We did not experience a lot of kids during our stay. There is a "kid pool" toward the south end of the resort which was nice that they had their own space. The resort was very serene, and had a mellow vibe. We enjoyed our stay here. Unlike some of the other people who left reviews, we realize we were not staying at the Four Seasons, therefore did not expect 5 star quality. If that's what people want, then maybe they should stay there next time! This is a Marroitt! I thought service was above average, and overall the resort was very nice! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed this hotel and glad we didnt heed the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: hadensdad
Reviews.Content: There were four of us (late 30's/early 40's). No kids.... Hotel (Marriott Beach Resort, Wailea) We loved this hotel. I read the reviews where people complained it was too quiet but that actually appealed to us. The place is pretty quiet after 9 PM and they do not play music by the pool during the day. We stayed in Hale 2 which was close to one of the pools, bar, parking lot and a beach with great snorkeling. The room was nice, the bed a little too soft but probably my only complaint. At first we were disappointed we were on the first floor because of the view, but actually we had a sliding glass door that was perfect for us since our room had a fridge and we were able to get beer, drinks, snacks, etc. Other traveler reviews said the staff at this hotel was rude but we were extremely impressed. Make sure you reach out to the staff for suggestions because they were dead on with every one. Joe the bartender loaned us a Maui Guidebook which we used at great length. Car rental I am starting here as to me this is critical. If you are doing the Road to Hana I suggest the 4 door Jeep, especially if there are four of you and your passengers want to see. This Jeep was great and we had plenty of room. Get the soft top too as the hard top is only T-tops. Rental Warnings: If you book through Travelocity they show you a picture of a 4 door jeep but they donâ€™t have them. I cancelled when my confirmation noted "2 door Jeep or like vehicle." I stumbled upon a company called HawaiiDrive-O through google. They have a facebook page also and they were $200 cheaper than anywhere else and guaranteed I got the 4 door jeep. They are a third party vendor that have deals through other rental companies, but I used them to book in Maui and Kauai and it was easy. Gas Offer --- though I booked with Hawaii Drive O, my contract was through Budget. Budget will offer you to fill up with them at .20 cents cheaper than the outside rate. Sounds great, but they hit you up for a full tank charge in advance and donâ€™t refund what you donâ€™t use. They didnâ€™t point this out as I was so amped to get out of there it sounded like a great deal, but I found it later in the fine print. Fill up at an outside service station and only get what you need. Most peopleâ€™s insurance will cover their car rental so you can probably decline that also. Supplies Stop by a grocery store or wherever and load up on adult beverages, snack and even a cooler. Your room has a fridge so we drank what we brought in. You could probably buy a cheap cooler and use that. Meals --- We like to eat and I will spend whatever to enjoy a good meal. Keep in mind we also enjoy some adult cocktails during dinner too. Fortunately, we were there during restaurant week and got some deals. We never ate at our hotel other than lunch by the pool/ocean. Advice: If you eat at a hotel restaurant expect to pay twice as much for the food. Meals with drinks elsewhere were around $140 per couple and same type meal was $240 at hotel restaurant. Longhiâ€™s in Shops at Wailea -- beside our hotel and readers had raved about it. I didnâ€™t think the dinner was that great but I made a bad menu choice. My wife ordered a lobster pasta dish that was excellent. We did go to Longhiâ€™s for breakfast one day and it was pretty good. It is convenient to the hotel and you can walk there. Kihei CafÃ©â€¦.best breakfast I have ever had and we ate there three or four days. Seems like a hole in the wall but food was awesome --- Do not miss this place!!!. 5 minute drive from hotel. Mai Taiâ€™s ( Lahaina) --- We heard about Royâ€™s and should have stuck with that. But we were hungry and the sign said, â€œBest New restaurant.â€� The meal wasnâ€™t very good but we were seated waterfront and the server did a good job so not a terrible experience, just not worth the 45 minute drive. Sansei (Kihei) --- We had read about the 5-6 PM Sushi half price special on Sundays and Monday. Donâ€™t expect to get there later than 4:45 to take advantage of this because both days we never made it in the door. One day there was no seating and the other day there was a line out the door so we passed. Kai Sushi in Shops at Wailea --- The food was pretty good and in walking distance to our hotel. Spago (Four Seasons hotel) --- this was probably one of our best meals. The staff was awesome and so good we remember them by name (Josh bartender and Tim our server). The food was excellent and the servers are probably the best i have ever seen in action. Place was pricey though and we spent $240 per couple at discounted prices due to restaurant week. Hotel Wailea --- We wanted to eat here but they had a wedding that booked the whole place. It sits on a hill and the views looked unreal so it may be worth checking out. Humuhumunukunukuapua'a (Grand Wailea) â€“ The restaurant week special was Filet and lobster so we all got that. The bill was $250 per couple so for that I probably expect to be wowed and instead to me it was okay. Luau (Marriott) --- Luaus are not our thing but we debated it and passed. We were able to observe a few minutes of the show from the beach but looked like a luau. Go figure! Marcoâ€™s Italian (next to airport) --- We had a layover and went here based on reviews. The place is a little pricey but my wifeâ€™s Ravioli was amazing. Resort Fees We kept reading about this $25 per day mandatory fee but it is Not mandatory. Self parking is also free and from all the whining by reviewers it was a 2 minute walk from our room. I imagine if i was in one of the other Hales the walk would be more but too many whiners. Suck it up and move on. Snorkeling We booked a trip on the Kai Kanani Catamaran to Molokini Crater and also swim with turtles. The crew was great and a good experience for $49. The winds pick up in the afternoon so the best dives are in the morning. We had to be there by 6:30 AM but that wasnt so bad. Best value: the next day we paid $6 at a dive shop to rent snorkel gear and snorkeled at our hotel and we swam with turtles each time. Glad we did the first but enjoyed the second more. Hotel Pool --- We kept reading about $100 cabana rentals from reviewers at the adult pool. We walked by the adult pool and the cabanas are more like big sofas with a cover, not a cabana. We never hung out at the adult pool or any pool and i never got in a pool. Instead we found lounge chairs along the ocean on this little nook and hung out there several days. It was awesome! Road to Hana (our best photos came from this day trip) Do not pass this up ---- but understand it takes a whole day to do this trip. We left at 6:30 Am which didnâ€™t bother us since we were still on East Coast time. We didnâ€™t get home until 5:30 PM. We didnâ€™t tour all the stops but this little trek is awesome. Buy the CD that tells you what you are seeing. The views from one side of the island (Jungle) to the other side (dessert/lava rock) are pretty amazing. If it rains at all I recommend the jeep. Just understand if you do the dessert or south side of the island that you think you are almost home but there is no road into Wailea. We had to drive another hour plus to get back home. You would think they would figure out how to make a road down the mountain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect way to experience Maui”
Reviews.Author: jen928
Reviews.Content: We would return in a heartbeat. The rooms were clean, the staff was super friendly, the adults only infinity pool was luxurious. The onsite restaurant, Mala, was superb. We went snorkeling right off the beach between our hotel and the Grand Wailea. It just could not have been any better.

Reviews.Title: “Purse/wallet & phones stolen from our room, car was stolen too! Security rude & unhelpful, 3hrs. for police response.”
Reviews.Author: Mauimomof4
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, beautiful location, great rooms and pools...but there are thieves watching you and the hotel security is a joke. Our room was broken into and our car was stolen while we ate dinner in the hotels own, Malu Restaurant. When reentering our room, we could smell heavy cigarette smoke and could see our belongings had been riffled through, they had JUST LEFT! We called security immediately, she was seen talking story on her slow walk to our room...was genuinely unconcerned and rude about our situation. The hotel has no security cameras and it took the police 3 hours to respond, the station is less than 10 minutes away. The security guard made it seem minor, she even said, "I don't think anyone came in this room." Thanks Wailea Marriott, we'll never forget it! Hmmm....wonder if their security guard has a new car? Just a thought. Careful folks, Hawaii is beautiful, but there is a lot of crime.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Davidmoss54
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and reasonably priced for Wailea area. David Moss and Associates had our meeting there and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Flyerno.one
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been updated, and the rooms are large and functional, the bathrooms are on the small side, but again very functional. The location of the hotel is very good,however, there is no beach in front of the hotel. In order to get to a beach you must walk to another area. From what we saw we did not see any amenities (chairs etc.) set up for the Marriott at any beach. The hotel staff was great, and very friendly and helpful. The nice part of the hotels' location was its proximity to the Shops at Wailea, there were several resturants and shops to purchase food supplies so that you were not forced to purchase everything, or even eat at the hotel (which we did not) not that the hotel food wasn't good, but it was very limited and seemed overpriced. The hotel resort fee did include parking and telephone use, so it wasn't a bad deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Fishmonster
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here and wished we had more time to spend here. We Pricelined our room here. The customer service was fantastic....they allowed us to check in early, were very friendly etc. Our room was large, clean and very nice. It had a nice tile floor and nice furniture. And the bathroom was very large, clean and stylish. We had a very comfortable bed, small couch with table, and a lanai with some chairs and a table. The resort is beautiful with an amazing location and facilities. The resort grounds are large, and you have great beaches at either end with awesome swimming and snorkeling. There are four pools, including a great one for kids with slide etc. There is a also a nice paved running path that goes for a couple of miles along the beach through this resort district.....great for your morning/evening run. There are a couple of bars, grill/cafe and a very nice restaurant on the grounds. But you can also drive into south Kihei less than 10 minutes away for many more restaurant/price options. My wife and I are low-maintenance travellers and have had great experiences in accommodations of all types and star levels. This was definitely a great bargain for the room price....very high quality in all areas. We'll definitely come to this part of the island again and stay here...we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: veggiedancerjess
Reviews.Content: This was the most relaxing, beautiful, serene, friendly, and quality hotel. It is simple yet a luxury. It is not tacky or overdone like neighboring hotels. Its simple and elegant decor makes you focus on the elements of the nature there which makes it so much more beautiful than any other hotel in Wailea. The rooms are perfect, with lanais and comfortable beds. I would specifically ask for a room with privacy. The front desk let us check 3 different rooms before we picked ours which was with a view of the end of the hotel's ocean area rather than a room right off the luau grounds which was more busy and more appropriate for a family with kids in my opinion. It was private and so beautiful to look at as well as to hear the ocean every morning. The sunset is stunning especially when sitting at the adult infinity pool. The best time of day at the pool is between 5-6 pm in my opinion. This brings me to the best feature of the hotel which is the adult infinity pool. It is great to rent a cabana right on the pool for the whole day ($100 with 20 % off) and comes with a fruit platter and water. Or you can get a blue soft cabana for $25 or the lounge chairs are just a perfect and free. There is amazing waiter service at every seat by this pool. They will wait on you all day long and are not pushy yet can always be easily seen if you want something from them. This was my husband's and my honeymoon and we spent a bunch of days just lounging by this pool. Food and Drinks were all great and the pool itself is serene and stunning The days that we didn't lounge by the pool we traveled to Kihei which is a little bohemian and fun, seemed local to us. We also went on Road to Hana, (halfway anyway which made it easier and worth it to us.) This way there was no pressure and we could go back to our lovely hotel and enjoy ourselves there most of the day. We ordered room service that night and other nights which was always delicious, well-portioned and quick. One thing I will warn you about hawaii is if you are a new yorker like me and are used to ordering food all the time, any time -- you can not order delivery in hawaii. You have to pick up, which is why we utilized room service often. We were lucky the room service was very good quality. The restaurant was incredible. We are vegetarians and the chef specifically altered some of the menu items for us i.e. he made the coconut shrimp into coconut tofu for us. They were so accommodating. This was our favorite restaurant in Wailea. We also had the breakfast buffet included in our package every morning which was superb. Eggs, omlettes, fresh fruit, baked goods, waffles, etc. it was also a little different each morning which was kept it interesting. If you want a drink "to go" after your meal the waiter will bring it to you in a plastic cup with a straw. I would usually get an iced tea or water to go. The best way to buy water is actually at the gift shop which sells liter bottles of 99 cent water. We felt that this hotel was even nicer than the more expensive ones nearby and that it is well worth its price which is not high compared to most hawaii prices. This is a perfect honeymoon spot or family spot. It all depends on the location of your room and what you want to do. The beach "not being on the property" as some have said is really a silly complaint since it is only maybe 10 steps away form the edge of the hotel and feels like it is on the hotel property. There is one to you left which is by the grand wailea and you can rent chairs from (it is annoying to pay for chairs, but it is hawaii) and that water is calm which is very nice. The beach area to the right is more of a local beach and much more rough. There was a pretty strong current when my husband and I went in and had to get out of there. It was okay though because we just went back to our infinity pool. Most of the beaches in Hawaii have pretty strong currents unless they are in a cove which is why I would rather be at a more public beach that is a little more calm like the one to the left of the hotel. You can see the water from most of the hotel and it is so blue and beautiful. You can see the island of Lanai across the water and also part of Maui (Lahaina area) in the distance. Actually, one night we drove to Lahaina and ate at "The Maui Brewing Company" which had great beer and very good food. They have a bar with a strip of ice to put your beer down on. Overall our service in Hawaii was very nice. I am someone who is from a big city and doesn't like to drive but driving around Hawaii is very nice and beautiful and was actually a relaxing and special part of our trip. We enjoyed navigating around the island together and taking in the scenery. We went to Kauai after Maui and while Kauai was beautiful I like Wailea in Maui because it wasn't as populated as Lahaina but was more central than Kauai. It had a feeling of remoteness by the resort area but you could still go to stop n shop or a shopping center if you needed one. The gym was nice and so was the spa. The spa was expensive but for our honeymoon was worth the splurge. We did the couples lomi lomi massage in a room with a view of the ocean and the hot tub in it for after the massages. It was very relaxing and the spa was very tranquil with everything you could need. It was funny because we actually exercised every morning here (which is not like us when on vacation) because the grounds are so beautiful and the trail to run on is so breathtaking. I ran more than I had run a long time just because i was so thankful for being able to run while enjoying such a great view, breathing clean air/watery scents and seeing people smiling all around. I would run starting from the condominiums to the right of the hotel to a little ways past the four seasons which gets a little steep but has a good path. I wouldn't run up there at night though because it gets dark and you'd want to see where you are going since you are so close to the rocks and water. Walking and lounging by the water at night though was fine. My husband and I actually got food "to go" one night from the restaurant and had a picnic under the big banyan tree by the water under the stars which was super romantic. By the way, the stars are incredible. We could see Mercury so clearly from our room every night! All in all, the hotel was incredible. best vacation ever and we have been to places like Atlantis in the bahamas, etc. I hope to come back to this resort again sometime soon. It was truly heaven in hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, not so Great service”
Reviews.Author: starfish0269
Reviews.Content: We booked with points. We probably spend 50,000 a year on business travel with Marriott hotels, year after year, and are definitely loyal customers. We have a family of 5, and we were guaranteed a rollaway bed on arrival. However, when we arrived after a long trip (flight problems delayed our arrival by one day, that is a whole other story) to check in, we were given a hard time by the front desk staff about the rollaway bed. They refused to give us one, and told us that we would have to upgrade our room to a suite (which still really sleeps 4) at cost to us of over 100 a night. However, the mandatory upgrade would not be available until the following day, so for the first night we slept three on one queen bed, sideways so as to fit but our feet were hanging off, and two on the other. this was hardly what we expected for our first night in such a pricey hotel. The following day we were awake by 3am and decided to pack all of our stuff and check it at the front desk and drive to Hana. When we returned around 4pm the mandatory upgraded room was still not available. When we finally moved in, we were not thrilled that the new room had a view of a large hedge, period. And there were grounds maintenance workers out early in the morning to trim those hedges, as well as trucks driving an unseen service road on the other side of the hedge. Bad news is that trucks beep loudly when backing, and we were regularly subjected to this noise. The suite had one King bed and one full size pullout sofa. we have teenage boys so sleeping in the bed with mom and dad was not their idea of fun, so two crammed onto the pullout and one made a makeshift bed on the floor with couch cushions. SERIOUSLY!!! To make matters worse, while looking through the guest services folder it clearly stated "Rollaway bed provided upon request". My husband complained to Marriott corporate directly and only then did management call to try to make things right. No other suites were available, of course, so we were stuck with the noise and hedge. Fortunately we found other places to be most of the time so we spent little time in the room. Housekeeping was adequate but they were never done with the room before late afternoon. Extra towels and linens provided on request, there were none in the room to make the sofa bed with. Resort fee was excessive, 25 dollars a day, and the only real benefit was parking and a bottle of water every day. we got a coupon for two free drinks, total value 20 dollars. at eight nights and 200 dollars, the two drinks were not really free...and the resort fee doesnt provide internet, that is extra. If you purchase anything at Starbucks they will give you two hours free internet, but you have to be in their business to get the signal. Concierge booked our family for dinner at Mala, the hotel restaurant, and we waited 20 minutes and the only person that acknowledged us at the table was the water boy. If we are going to spend nearly 300 dollars on a meal we don't expect to be ignored by the wait staff. We walked out and went to a different restaurant. The hotel did notice our departure and offered us a breakfast buffet to make things right. Rooms are decorated in earth tones and white, king bed was comfortable but the kids on the sofa bed said it was not. the one on the floor said it was better than sleeping with us. the floor was tile, slippery when wet. We ordered room service breakfast for one of the kids that was not feeling well and "hard fried eggs, cooked all the way" somehow translated to "over easy". Nearly forty dollars for two uncooked eggs, two strips of bacon, half a cup of hashbrowns, a piece of soggy toast, and a glass of chocolate milk. I would skip room service unless necessary. I did see a small cockroach on our last full day. On checkout day one of the kids opened the door to the adjoining room (closed on the other side) and found a large, two inch long cockroach inbetween the doors. yikes. Overall, the resort gets points for a comfy bed and awesome location. The grounds and pools were beautiful. Loses points for customer service, the hassle over the room/rollaway bed, and the bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort in Wailea!”
Reviews.Author: emily174
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary with a trip to Maui, and stayed at the Marriott in Wailea. The rooms here are quite simple (floors, walls and bedding are all white), but the beds are super comfy, and the views outside are fantastic, including the beautiful grounds. We had an ocean view room overlooking the infinity pool, and there are beaches on either side of the hotel. A sidewalk runs through the resorts in this area, so it is really easy getting to the beaches and other hotels. The rooms have comfy beds, in-room safes, and a small refrigerator. Only thing extra that would have been nice was a microwave. We ordered lunch poolside from the bar and grill on site, and it was very good. Also had dinner at Mala one night, and it was one of the best meals on our trip. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff was always friendly and accommodating, and we loved the location. The mall next door was also very convenient, great for dinner (definitely try Tommy Bahamas for dinner one night) and picking up some nice souvenirs. Mandara spa on site was also wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Not on Par with other Marriotts, service needs work”
Reviews.Author: Mauibabe1012
Reviews.Content: Used our Marriott rewards points and they asked us if we were celebrating anything special, stated we were on our honeymoon and they assured us of a nice room. Received a room outside the elevator and over the valet parking in the front. All night heard people getting out of there cars or talking outside the elevator. Asked to change rooms the next day and they seemed extremely put out. Asked for the room change at 530 a.m. before leaving for the road to hana and returned at 5:00 p.m. and the room was still not ready. That wouldn't have been so bad but talked with a couple at the bar and they just happened to mention that the last two times they stayed with their reward points they were put in a room by the loading docks or had the view of the street. Marriott, if folks are using their reward points then I'm pretty certain they are your "loyal" customers, and have been for quite some time. Why do you stick your "loyal" customers in the back alley? Also, pool workers push their "maui jims" sunglasses to hard. They booked a helicopter tour for us and we went back to the room and later found if we had booked it on line it was $80.00 cheaper....really, do you feel the need to rip off your guests that bad? When we went to cancel Connie gave us the third degree about why we were canceling. Don't need to be hasseled like that from the staff. Valet also charged us $ 25 valet parking and $ 20 self parking each day. We stated we had self parked from the first day and have our car keys as well. Told us they would review their records before issuing a credit. Also need to check out your air conditioners, room are way too humid even rooming the air on all night. Glad we checked out and went to Napili Kia for the rest of the trip. What a shame that they are not on par with other Marriotts I've stayed at. Would not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: KSUProud
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hale 6 with a view of the ocean. Loved that we had a great view, no pools, luau, etc. Our son loved his ukelele lesson & Rachel let him borrow a ukelele for the rest of the week. Grounds are beautiful. Starbucks every morning was yummy. Smoothies at the coffee hut were really good. The bellman were a great source of information. Ask about the hospitality room for your last day if you need to freshen up. Housekeeping was very responsive to our requests. Cons: The conceirge was not very helpful! In fact, it really seemed like we were bothering him to ask questions. Would have used him more and tipped him appropriately if we hadn't gotten attitude from him. The elliptical equipment in the fitness room was not what you would expect for a high end hotel. Pretty poor quality. Ended up running on the walk along the beach and it was pretty crowded. The Wailea beach is on the left and Ulua on the right. Ulua had great snorkeling and Wailea was great for people watching. Wish we had known earlier in the week that we could rent beach chairs/umbrella set for $30 a day right behind Wailea beach at the second blue umbrella (not with Marriott). They will set them up on beach for you. Resort fee is excessive. I think they should just add the cost into the room rate and be done with it. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location... Hotel Average”
Reviews.Author: hayleedwd
Reviews.Content: This location of this hotel is great and the ocean/mountain views are amazing! It's very accessible to other hotels with good beach access, etc. However, one should know that the Marriott does not have beach access or beach chairs/umbrellas provided. You have to go down to one of the other hotels (beaches are public so this is completely acceptable) and rent your own chairs/beach umbrellas (which can be done at off-site locations, aka Snorkel Bob's, etc). The rooms are all tile and very noisy - we got up early each morning to see the sunrise and spent very little time in the room so this was not an issue for us. However, if you are one to sleep in or enjoy an afternoon nap you will not like the noisy nature of this facility. The infinity edge pool is nice but the service is just okay. We watched the sunset from the pool one night and it was beautiful! Also, each morning we sat near the water and drank coffee/read books... this was one of our favorite part of the trip but again, the chairs provided by the Marriot are NOT cozy and are wet every morning because of the water sprinklers. Overall - nice place but if you are looking for over the top comfort and amenities, you are better off down the beach at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Te Au Moana Luau was really great!!!”
Reviews.Author: BlueHereon
Reviews.Content: We were guided to this luau by our Pleasant conceige at the Maui Banyan. It was great because it was much closer to our hotel than some of the others. The food was awesome. The drinks were included, but the Mai Tai's were not the tastiest. (Made in bulk so understandable) The luau music, dancing, seating(we got there early & had great seats) were awesome. It was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Updated, clean resort in a great location with beautiful infinity pool!”
Reviews.Author: m4rcla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Wailea over the labor day holiday using hotel points. The hotel grounds were beautiful. We loved the open-air lobby with the view of the ocean. The hotel looked like it had been recently renovated. Since we booked via points, we knew we were not going to get an ocean view room, which was fine for us. The room was a good size and looked nicely updated. I did notice that the TV was not the usual flat screen TV, but it was good enough. The one thing I did not like about the hotel room was the bed. It was way too soft! I felt that I sunk in (and I'm pretty light). Other than that, we loved the hotel. The infinity pool was gorgeous! I wished that we had spent more time there! The first time we tried to go to the pool it was overly crowded (labor day weekend). The second time we tried was the Tuesday after labor day, and the pool was not crowded at all! The hotel is beach front but it was on the rocky side. However, it's a short couple minutes walk to the beach. There was also walkways that connected the various resorts. We walked over to the Grand Wailea for our spa appointment, and it was nice not having to drive. We really didn't mind the location of the hotel in Wailea (as opposed to Kaanapali where most of the other resorts are). We actually loved the peace & tranquility of the Wailea area. It's also a short drive to Kihei where we ate a lot of our meals. Overall it was a great resort and we wouldn't mind coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort--Great Luau!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuruCapeCod_MA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this resort for our honeymoon and it provided us with much needed relaxation. The resort itself was stunning--the infinity pool was breath-taking, the lobby was like something in a movie, and even though there were a few families staying at the resort, it had a very quiet and tranquil ambiance. This part of Maui is a resort-area so if that's what you are looking for this is your place. It is surrounded by other hotels, including the Four Seasons. I found our room to be wonderful--clean, great view, very large, great a/c (but we preferred the breeze most nights), and very up-to-date. We might have preferred to stay in a different area of the Island, just because we generally like to really get a feel for the locale. We spent most days out of Wailea and visited Lahaina, drove the Hana Highway and went hiking. Nights were spent enjoying the view from our room, walking to the nearby shopping mall (although we didn't shop much....we did have dinner there a few nights...overpriced but fine), and one night we did a Luau at the Marriott. This is not to be missed! It's new and the woman at the front desk didn't know much about it but I thought it was awesome! The performers were incredible. They did demonstrations and sold crafts and tickets prior to the event. Then there was a great buffet and open bar. We were able to watch the sunset from our table and as soon as it went down the show started and it was outstanding. I would highly recommend this to anyone staying in Wailea (its open to the public--not just resort guests). Tickets were about $100 each but again, well worth it. We enjoyed drinking local beers and watching the sunset from our lanai (a suggestion of the very friendly bell-boy!). The bed was very comfortable and the adults-only pool was great. The breakfast was pretty good although I wouldn't have paid the high price to eat at the restaurant (our room came with complimentary breakfast buffet). As with most resorts in Maui, the restaurant prices were high. We also were disappointed that there was not free wifi, but we got an amazing room for a pretty reasonable price so I can't really complain!

Reviews.Title: “Resort Fee, complete rip off”
Reviews.Author: becsmile
Reviews.Content: $25 a day compulsary resort fee is a complete rip off, when your paying $300 a night for a room!! The pools were gorgeous and so were the views! The adult only pool was quite busy. Eating is very expensive even at the Wailea shops, although Longhis and Tony Berhamas were good. The rooms were adequate but Ive stayed in nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....terrible food and service...”
Reviews.Author: dawn1r
Reviews.Content: Came here expecting the quality afforded a $400/night resort. Our room was literally 50 yards from the ocean with beautiful views of the other islands and the ocean. The room was nice and fairly basic (the price was really for the view as the room was nothing special). As we both have been working so hard, we took the opportunity to come for 12 days to relax and be pampered a bit. The rooms were noisy, the serenity pool was anything but serene. The "no cell phones" didn't seem to apply and the resort staff didn't enforce the rules. The wait staff that did come out to the pool seemed to be more of activity directors from club med from their bubbly, loud talk, vs. the serene, relaxing environment you'd think would go along with the term "serenity" pool. Agree with an earlier reviewer about the hard sell from the towel hut on the activities and maui jim sunglasses....exactly what we're trying to get away from! We tried the restaurant twice and ended up eating at the other hotels (excellent food at the Fairmont at Nicks Seafood). The food was so-so and not worth the price. Interestingly, we were told the food service, the spa, the activities were all contracted out and not owned by Marriott....it shows. The bar upstairs in the air conditioned part of the hotel didn't open until 5:00 so we had to go to the bar downstairs next to the pool. I felt like we were at a church fellowship hall with the sterility of the room and the tables....we were told this was the sports bar. Interesting..... In short, if you want close proximity to the water and shoreline from your hotel room (assuming you pay for the few close rooms), choose this resort. If you want the whole package and be able to eat and drink at the resort in a couple of locations within the resort, move on to the other hotels. This definitely has the feel of a 3.5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: ashrivas
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine. Clean and comfortable hotel. Only regret I had was that other hotels neighbouring to this Hotel had facility on the beach, like complimentary lounge chair. There was no such facility provided. But overall we had fun.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful HOTEL right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: DivineNuBiEnNe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful it is right on the beach. You can snorkel or paddle board before breakfast. I enjoyed breakfast while overlooking the ocean. The is also a serenity pool to cell phones aloud!!! I would definitely suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We had an amazing stay there”
Reviews.Author: snowazure
Reviews.Content: The best thing I heard about this hotel is that because it has a relatively longer history, so the hotel buildings are closer to the seashore than other hotels, which means you can hear the ocean waves (in a soothing,not annoying way) when you are asleep at night. I did hear sound like waves at night, but not sure whether it's really waves:). The best thing that I feel about this hotel is that you can appreciate the sunset lounging in the beach chairs at the water front. It's very beautiful. Besides, it's a few steps away from Ulua Beach where the sand is most fine-grained and a good place for a lot of activities. Big Beach is quite close too. The staff are very professional and polite. The room itself is very spacious with a terrace. The bed is very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my entire stay here”
Reviews.Author: Surf-Chick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 10 nights with my husband, celebrating our second wedding anniversary. I absolutely loved my stay here, our room was upgraded to ocean view as we were on a special trip - what a fantastic view. It was felt very quiet during our stay, despite there being a large conference being held. On several occassions we had a pool all to ourselves! The location also can't be beaten - I can't believe that some other reviewers have grumbled about not having a beach, when there are 2 fantastic beaches either side of the property - depending on where your room is it will only take 1 minute to walk to! After our stay here we moved on to 3 nights at the Grand Wailea next door, which has a beach. It took us longer to get to the hotel's beach there than at the Marriott (although please note, still only a few minutes walk which I cannot believe anybody would complain about!). Comparing the Marriott and the Grand Wailea, I prefered my stay at the Marriott - staff were far more friendly, the hotel seemed quieter and generally I got a far more chilled out vibe from the Marriott. Please note that I used hotel points for both stays, but if I had paid the premium to stay at the Grand Wailea, I would have been quite disappointed after the Marriott. If you are paying for your stay, definately go for the Marriott!Having the shops of Wailea on your doorstep was also a great bonus for the location. One tip though - if you are thinking to rent a stand up paddle board, mask and snorkle or kayak, go to the Grand Wailea's beach club (open to non residents) - you can get 7 days unlimited rental of any "toy" for $99, playing around with whatever may take your fancy that day. Other places, including the Marriott, charge $49 for 2 hours rental of a standup so if you are thinking of going out more than once the Grand Wailea Beach club is a much better option (they also have the better equipment!). All in all, I LOVED the Marriott, and cannot wait to get the opportunity to go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cannenballmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights in this hotel. The kids pool is fantastic. The penguins are so cool. The atrium is like nothing I'd ever seen before. The grounds keeper gave my son food to feed the Koi. You could never leave the hotel and have an amazing time. I would have to say the luau that the hotel has is hands down the best around. I appreciates the friendliness of the staff every morning at breakfast. Wonderful view in morning to start your day and the buffet is yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with the service on my last trip”
Reviews.Author: BeachGuy1960
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this hotel for the past 6 or 7 years. This last time, the service was very poor. My first day, when I went to the pool to get some towels, the woman at the pool hut came on with the hard sell for Maui Jim sunglasses, telling me she could tell the ones I had on were very poor quality. This was before I even got my towels! Housekeeping left soap and shampoo only on the first day. I had to chase them down for the rest of my stay. One day she only left towels for one person, even though it was my wife and I. I stay at Marriott's over 50 nights a year for business travel and almost always have a great experience. One thing i have come to expect and enjoy is getting a paper outside my door at every Marriott hotel. Not so at Wailea! I was told that papers were only available Mon - Fri and I had to get to the lobby early as they went fast. Lastly, and this really frosted me: Upon check-in I opted for "Resort Package" which included parking, 2 free drinks and a 20% discount at the restaurant. When my wife and I went to the restaurant, we showed the waitress the 20% discount card. She proceeded to suggest an entree, which my wife ordered. When the check came, my wife's entree did not show the discount. When I asked, the waitress told me that my wife's entree was NOT discount eligible. When I complained to the front desk manager the next day, I was assured that someone would look into and get back to me. I never heard from anyone again. I won't be going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location of some ocean view room and overall accoustics were terrible.”
Reviews.Author: 2sanmar
Reviews.Content: Reserved an "oceanfront" room. Yes, you could see the ocean, but the room was right behind swimming pool area. It was supposedly the first hotel built in Wailea area. That makes it very old. The main buildings were only 3 floors high. Our second florr room was right behind the pool. you could sit on your balcony and talk to people sitting at the pool. You likewise could hear all the noise and conversations from people at the pool. If that were not enough, the accoustics in the building were horrific! You could hear people above our room walking back and forth, screen door to balcony opening/closing and hear toilets flushing as well as what they were doing that necessitated flushing. Being an old hotel, they obviously did not take any measures to reduce sound between floors as they do today. The grounds are pretty and staff nice. The on site restaurant called Ma-La was rated as the best on Maui. Very dissappointing. As a comparison, we also stayed at Hilton Hawaiian Village Resort and Spa on Waikiki Beach on Oahu in their rainbow tower. It is right on the beach, gorgreous oceanfront corner room on 21st floor. Had one balcony that looked right up beach to Diamond head and the ocean. other balcony looked over other hotels and shops (inland). You will never see a more beautiful sight at night from either balcony. It compared to the top of Eiffel tower overlooking Paris at night! This room was 35% cheaper than Marriott on Maui! Fortunately at the Marriott hotel, we were out exploring during most of the day, but time in the room and late at night, it was very unpleasant. Apparently all the reviewers who raved about the quality of the hotel do not travel a lot and experience really good facilities to make a fair comparison. Would never recommend this hotel to anyone. If th

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Really we really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice. The adult inifinity pool area is great and relaxing and the view is perfect. Be warned, there is no beach in front of the hotel but its just around the corner on the walking path and is fantastic almost like a private beach with great snorkeling. So many turtles out swimming it was the best experience everyday while Kayaking and stand up boarding, don't miss this, its easy and from 8am-11am the ocean is always calm. The snorkeling is also great too. Three pools, the only draw back here is one is also the outdoor restaurant so no real privacy except at night. The beds are really soft but we loved it! If you like a hard mattress you will not like this bed, we seem to adjust but with this bed we was out and slept great. With Mala on property, which is great, and the mall out front, the choices for food made it easy to not have to drive around. It was truly and enjoyable place to stay. We did not like paying $20.00 for parking every night, that was the only draw back, even the other hotels in the area offered free self parking.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel disappoints in an area of luxury hotels”
Reviews.Author: mauimom3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel every year for the last 7 of 8 years. The property was formerly owned by Outrigger prior to Marriott. I go to Maui withy my spouse who attends a yearly conference at this hotel. Since Marriott took over ownership the hotel has gone down hill. With the exception of the renovations to rooms and the addition of a pool area several years ago nothing changes from year to year, except to say we get less amenities. We are Marriott reward members and out of all of our group we were the only ones who were. Everyone else had ocean front rooms (I am guessing the hotel was not full so they gave these rather than the garden view which was the conference rate) with flat panel TV's. We got a garden view with an ancient box tv. Make up smeared the the bathroom wall which could have been wiped up. Even the budget Marriotts have flat panel tv's now. They used to supply robes, slippers, cotton balls etc., not now. We didn't even have a pen in our room to write housekeeping a note asking for a sufficient number of towels. They used to give you a free drink daily as part of your resort fee benefits. Now you get one bottle of water per room, and one drink per person for the entire stay even though you still pay the same fee. No beach chairs provided any longer. We were wondering if next year there would be a fee for the pool or to look at the ocean. The bottom line is this hotel is in the Beverly Hills section of Maui next to the Grand Wailea and The Four Seasons. To compete they need to stop cutting corners and step up their game. The satff was nice and helpful, but I would bet housekeeping is given very strict guidelines about getting rooms done fast and at a minimum. They sweep with a broom and replace towels that's it. I had to ask that they use a vacume. The bed sheets are only changed every third day unless you ask. I repeatedly had to ask for enough towels. This is a place where people are going to shower twice a day once in thenorning before breakfast and again in the evening after being out in the ocean and pool before dinner. There is one towel bar so you can't nicely hang up your towels and they repeatedly only gave us three towels even though my Marriott profile asks for more. I don't think they even look at that or care. The bathroom counter was never wiped during our stay. FYI the other hotels in the area give the conference rate and we will be staying at the Grand Wailea next year. Some of the attendees actually switched half way through the week. If anyone can tell you this place has consistently gone down hill it is someone who has stayed there so many times. Even the bath products that are provides seem to be a very low quality. You would expect some very tropical spa like products in Maui. You won't get that here. The food is also very pricey. Around the pool Terri was the only bright spot! They charge 4.50 extra if you choose fries instead of the chips. God help you if you choose the fruit. That was 6 bucks extra and it was a small amount. The food is so pricey in fact that you are better off to go next door to the shops of Wailea and eat breakfast at the best breakfast place in Maui Longhi's. It's cheaper than breakfast at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: CorpCop
Reviews.Content: From the moment Daniel so cordially met us at the Front Desk and promptly checked us in it was a dream stay. Amazing sunset views. Flawless Front Desk, bell stand, and housekeeping service. Karl at the Kumu poolside pool was accommodating and professional. The lobby was beautiful, and the restaurants were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: TinaLouiseA
Reviews.Content: I liked the location and overall modern, clean design. The staff, especially the valets, were always helpful and smiling without over doing it. The room was modern and comfortable in yellows, whites and blues. We enjoyed being cozy on the couch with our view of the ocean. The one thing that detracted from my view of the service was that we were told we could swim and enjoy the infinity pool after checking out because our flight wasn't until that afternoon. They would hold our luggage and give us a cabana to change in and clean up after swimming. Wonderful, so I thought! When we finished it turned out there was a waiting list over an hour long for a cabana! We didn't have time to wait and they did not offer a room or private place to change. Overall it is a great property if you want to stay put and relax. There is shopping and dining right there and more at the mall which is within walking distance.
