The paths that wind along the ocean take you from resort to resort. The overall feel was exclusive.

Reviews.Title: “Marriot Wailea No Ka Oi (The best)”
Reviews.Author: bospat
Reviews.Content: Traveled here for business with my son. Absolutely wonderful stay, nice beds, convenient shops nearby, great snorkeling and beach next door. Beds were wonderful and the staff was great..Only complaint was the availabilty of value food choices nearby, but then again if you are staying here you probably can afford a nice meal...Convenient to Kihei town for quick bites, snorkeling tours, surf lessons..etc...Would stay here agin tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic-Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: jowegihi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking to spend the last three days of our honeymoon in leisure at a beautiful Maui resort. We planned to stay at the Makena Beach Resort, and within 1 hour of checking in, I had arranged a refund of our stay at Makena and booked the Marriott Wailea. I travel literally every week for work, and often choose Marriott due to their consistent quality. This resort did not disappoint. They were very accommodating and this resort truly is beautiful! Even though we didn't go here for it, the kid pool looked like a great place for the little ones. There were legit water slides and a very neat water park area. This resort also offered additional pools, our favorite was the adult only serenity pool overlooking the ocean; talk about a great pool with a great view built for ultimate relaxation! The grounds were immaculate. We tried the casual restaurant near the other pool (not mentioned above) and had a very nice lunch for a reasonable price. We wish we would have had another couple of days at the Marriott! The only drawback, is the resort is not on the beach. It is on the coast, with beautiful ocean views, but you must walk to the beach. There are two beaches, one to the north and the other to the south. Both are beautiful, but are a few minutes of a walk from the resort. It didn't bother us at all, but may be a negative for some people.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wailea Beach Marriott Resort & Spa! Fantastic End to Our Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: SK
Reviews.Content: We were in Hawaii for 12 nights/13 days for our honeymoon. We stayed at Wyndham properties for 1 week - which we split between Waikiki Beach, Oahu (4 nights) and Princeville, Kauai (3 nights) and then stayed at the Wailea Beach Marriott Resort for the last 5 nights. We had an oceanview room overlooking the pool and ocean. We were right below the restaurant Mala (they said we could switch rooms if we wanted), but it was just fine. Loved the look and feel of the Marriott - so open, breezy, and tranquil! Loved our room - great maid service, nice size room, liked having a mini fridge, great balcony, etc. The bathrooms (tub/toilet) are really small though, but not a problem. The adult infinity pool was great - it's like you're laying out by the ocean (because it's right beyond the pool), but without the wind blowing sand all over you! We got there between 9 and 10 every day and got great chairs. Cabanas and large loungers (rental fee $) are nice, but the regular free loungers are just fine! Relaxing in one of the hot tubs was amazing in early evening! Some reviews make it seem like you can't even see the ocean from the Marriott - it is literally right in front of you, just with reef rather than sand. The short walk to either beach is easy and beautiful. Service was EXCELLENT at the Marriott - didn't eat in the restaurants, but the pool waitresses were awesome and friendly, check-in was easy and attendant was very nice, porters were extremely friendly, were able to use the courtesy room before we left to shower, etc. The Marriott seems a lot quieter and calmer than the Grand Wailea or Four Seasons (maybe because of the beaches in front of these hotels)...lots of kids at/around those properties. Ran on the beach path 3 times - most beautiful run ever! Did go snorkeling in the area on the beach to the right - got stung by a jellyfish, so be careful. Didn't hurt though and bumps were gone after a few hours. Would definitely recommend the Wailea Beach Marriott and would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has beautiful grounds, and the worst beds we have ever slept on.”
Reviews.Author: 14barry
Reviews.Content: We had been looking forward to our first vacation in over a year. We were so dissapointed after we got ,to our room. The beds were on a low platform with no box spring , and the matress was very soft with zero support. The room had a gorgeous ocean view and was very spacious. The tile floor was very slippery. The room was very clean and housekeeping was done early and well. Getting in and out of the bed was almost impossible especially in the middle of the night. I felt like we sunk almost to the floor. We are very well traveled and have never experienced this type of bed anywhere including Japan, Thailand, Hong Kong and Malaysia. We would NEVER return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel-Not Much Goin On in Area”
Reviews.Author: edsatty
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Aug. 29-Sept. 3 with my son (24) and daughter (15). The hotel is immense - spread out over many acres of property that front the ocean. The hotel grounds are gorgeous. There are several pools (none particularly large) and one infinity pool reserved for adults only. We stayed on points, but were upgraded to an ocean view room. As stated in other reviews, there are really no "oceanfront" rooms here in the traditional sense, in that there is no beach right by this hotel. The ocean is some distance away, and it is a rocky coast right around the hotel. You have to walk 4 or 5 minutes up or down the beach path that runs along the coast to get to either Wailea beach or the other beach (Ulea sp.) - both of which are quite small. The rooms were fine, although the bathroom was somewhat small. We ate at one of the Marriott restaurants one night (Mala), which had gotten good reviews. The food was good, but as is typical for Hawaii, and a hotel, way overpriced. Also annoying is the fact that they charge you a $25 per day resort fee at this hotel - that DOES NOT include internet. If you are a Platinum member of Marriott's rewards program, you get free internet. The rest of you have to pay extra on top of the resort fee. A word to the wise - if you are looking for any action, this is not the place to stay. Although it is beautiful, there is nothing around this hotel at all (except for other hotels/condos/golf courses, and the Shops at Wailea that are a 5 minute walk through the parking lots). We ended up going into the next town over (Kihei) to eat every night, go to shops, go to the 3 very pretty beaches along the road in Kihei, and to get a better sense of true Maui. The entire Wailea area is extremely "upscale" and country club/exclusive feeling. If you want to just lay by the pool and do nothing, great. If you need something more, I would recommend staying along the west coast of Maui or another town. Even the activities/water sports desk at this Marriott essentially sends you up the west coast to actually do any parasailing, jet skiing, snorkeling, etc. If you do stay here, there is a Whaler's General Store and ABC Store (which is not a liquor store) in the Shops at Wailea where you can get basic breakfast items, sandwiches, water, soda, snacks, coffee and other items so you can save a ton of money over food at the hotels. Did not try the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Excellento ....is the word :) ....”
Reviews.Author: akoundal
Reviews.Content: Excellento.... is the first thing that comes to my mind. I booked this place from price line and was little specticle as wasnt sure what to get during the bidding, once i arrived here i was like wow..priceline did the job for me. Checkin was breeze and lady @ reception gave us some sort of upgraded room with partial view of the ocean room, i wasnt that keen for the ocean view and most of the day we were out doing some activity. The new infiniy pool is awesome and once you are inside it you wont feel like coming out, it feels you are in the vast ocean as its hard to find the never ending water. There are many other pools in the resort but this takes thr #1 spot and i dont think any other resort in the area has such pool. The rooms are very spacious with comfy beds. Every room has a mini fridge so that you can keep your beverages. All the rooms has been updated recently so its worth every $ I spent. The reason i didnt gave this place 5 star is due to the lifts, they need surelu upgrade. Also the rooms has CRT, upgrading to LCD will be worth $ spent:) The shops @ waliea has all the things that you will need for day to day food or other stuff. If you have forgot the waterproof cameras, dont worry you will find plenty of them @ ABC store. Unfortunately when i asked one of the clerk @ shop she couldnt understand what i was asking and never told me that they sell those cameras for mere 12$:P, next trip i wont miss the molikini snorkeling filming with my digital camera, did i tell you that you are like 10 min away from the beaches where snorkleing boats depart :). The staff around the resort is friendly and you have free printer to print your boarding pass. I will say i am really happy that i chose waliea to stay then kanapali :). Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: SeeJeffTravel
Reviews.Content: We used Priceline to look for "resorts" in the Wailea area for $100/nt. We knew all the hotels that it could be so we were fine with any of them. Generally, we're not the hang-out-at-the-hotel type. But it is good to be someplace that has nice pools and good views for the down time between activities. The nice part about this place: 1. It was quiet. 2. There's an adult only pool area if screaming kids bother you. 3. There's a kids water slide area if you want to scream like a kid. It isn't like the Grand's next door, but it is good for some fun and to cool off. I liked the slide that shoots you down almost vertically for a deep landing. 4. We stayed on the south side of the resort, so the we could watch the luau from our room and we were very close to the big beach in front of the Grand Wailea. 5. The room had a good size fridge. 6. We especially liked sharing an early bird lobster at the bar next door at the Grand's Humu-Humus. "Scott" makes yummy drinks. Tell him you heard it from me and you'll get absolutely nothing except for a confused look. The things we didn't like: 1. There were no Marriott beach chairs down at the sandy beach.

Reviews.Title: “The Wailea Beach Marriott is a beautiful hotel where you can completely forget about work....”
Reviews.Author: readnsurf
Reviews.Content: The location is spectacular...Although it does not have its own beach, there are two public beaches on either side that are about a 3 minute walk away. You can snorkel right off the rocks of Ulua Beach and see a ton of beautiful fish and coral by walking in about 20 feet. We also saw a sea turtle surface right near our kayak...He poked his head right out of the water - a memorable experience...Definitely take a guided tour of Hana if you want to really enjoy the scenery since the drive is a bear....We used Mahalo Tours through Marriott. The infinity pool area has a splendid view and is extremely quiet despite the many people who stay at poolside. Most people just read or stare at the beauty of the ocean and surrounding landscaping. The sunsets here were unforgettable. There are excellent restaurants in this immediate area (Ma La, Joes...). If you want to get away a bit further for a somewhat less expensive breakfast or lunch, I would recommend 5 Palms in Kihei - just about a 5 minute drive - where you can eat oceanside. You can also buy some delicious pineapple nearby at the Safeway and keep it in your room refrigerator. Shopping in Lanai was great and I suggest eating lunch at Ma La oceanside... Finally on the way home, stop at Broka the Mouth for butter cookies for the plane ride home...The place is about a mile from the airport and looks like a factory...but the cookies are amazing...I read about these in Frommer's and have to agree with the reviewer that they are great...Try the cookie samples to pick your favorite kind.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location,nice property and...possible bedbugs?”
Reviews.Author: thiragreece
Reviews.Content: The location is beautiful and the employees are nice here. The rooms seem very clean and decent enough, but I give them a poor rating as I suspect there may be a bedbug problem there. We had to be moved 3 times. We are part-time New Yorkers which has made us very alert to bedbugs. We check every room we stay in by lifting the sheets and checking the seams of the mattress for signs of bedbugs. This is the first time in dozens of vacations where we forced to ask for another room. They were nice enough to move us 3 times, and our last room seemed to be bedbug free. However 2 out of 3 is scary. They said they had no other complaints, don't know why, maybe people think they have mosquito bites? We were not taking any chances. Seriously, maids need to know how to spot them and hotels need to invest in bug proof mattress covers. Also, guests need to learn to look for them...PLEASE check the mattress when you get to any hotel room. If you see what looks like bad flea dust in the mattress seams (can be mix of blackish-brown and/or red spots, like dirt, and in bad cases what looks like old skin-their old shells) this is evidence of bedbugs. They feed on you late at night then run down the seems and poop out your blood on the way back to their homes inside the mattress. Also, infestations that have been "cleaned up" may look like smudged black spots, kind of like old mold or mildew stains. Our second room had this. Beware as you don't want to take these home with you, it will cost you your sanity and thousands of dollars to get rid of them. Please be smart, if people know how to recognize them hotels will be forced to deal with them. FYI-Bites are itchy and get red and bumpy like mosquito bites, I think this is why people don't recognize it. If you get such bites 2 or 3 in in a line, this is most likely bedbugs. No, we did not get bitten, because we moved immediately. By the time we got to our "clean " room, we were so paranoid we could not sleep. So basically, check before you sleep, the surfaces of this hotel are very clean, but beware the mattresses. Hopefully Marriott will address the affected rooms as it is a nice place otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, even better location”
Reviews.Author: LaughingLab
Reviews.Content: First off, congratulations. If you are reading this, that means you are likely doing your homework and researching things for you vacation. Like many others (I suspect) I also read the reviews frequently for this Marriot, and while they mostly trend positive, a few negative reviews had me a tad concerned. I can confidently say there was nothing at all for me and my family to be concerned about, this was a great place to stay and a great location. So, about those negative reviews then?? Well, I think the best review I can give is to both combine my overall review, with what I see as the majority of issues that result in negative reviews. Hopefully this will provide you, the reader of this review, with the information you need to make a good decision if this hotel is right for you. So here we go.. 1) The resort is not on a beach. Technically this is correct. If you walk directly west from anywhere on the resort you run into lava rock, then ocean. However, consider 2 things here: A) the resort is located between 2 fantastic beaches, both a short walk (distance depends greatly on your room location, as it is a big place). To the north is Ulua beach, a nice quiet beach (good snorkeling on north end of it) and to south is the far more crowded/happening beach of Wailea. Both are great, but definitely different vibe at each B) the lava rock area this beach fronts is actually pretty awesome, and there are several areas with lounge chairs where you can sit and relax, and listen to waves crashing. I truly find this complaint to be the most amusing and honestly the most sad... do we really live in a world were a 5 minute walk is too much?? Obviously if you have physical limitations that makes walking a challenge, you may want to consider somewhere else. Otherwise, if this is an issue, then honestly I'm just gonna call you out as being lazy. 2) There is a $20 or $25 daily fee. Yes there is a fee, if this is news to you then you didn't read the fine print. I have no sympathy for anyone who complains about this. Sorry if that's harsh, but it drives me nuts when people act like this is a surprise. 3) I'm on my honeymoon and they didn't shower me with rose petals and carry me around the resort on a chariot. Bridezillas.... yeah, they exist, they also like to join tripadvisor just to complain about the hotel, restaurant, etc. that failed to worship them (look how many negative reviews are from posters of only say 1-2 contributions) 4) It's expensive. Yes, it is pretty expensive. You are staying in one of the most upscale areas of one of the most upscale islands (I'd say only Lanai could be considered higher end). It's going to be expensive, be ready for that. Also, just because it's expensive doesn't always mean you get your moneys worth (you usually don't, but that's the price for staying in a "captive" resort area like Wailea). I think those are the 4 things I most commonly see on negative reviews, all 4 are non-issues in my opinion. Other tips/notes about the Marriot: 1) You can watch the Luau show w/o paying, you just don't get food. 2) the beachfront path in Wailea is amazing, definitely do the full path at least 1x 3) Onsite Mala place is good, views are incredible 4) Whalers general store in the Shops nearby has $4 take and go sandwhichs, decent sandwhich and good value for lunch 5) Cheeseburger Island Style place is about the cheapest walkable place to eat. The cheeseburgers are... not memorable (this seems to be a common theme on Maui from what I've seen). They did have a $5.99 breakfast special though (eggs, toast, hashbrowns, coffee) that I think is a pretty solid deal for the area. Also decent beer prices during happy hour, and they did have good fries. 6) As mentioned, we called the Wailea Beach the "happening" beach. it's crowded, but is a very nice beach. Norther Ulua beach was more "private" as crowds were low. Later in the day you stayed the less people, so we packed a lunch and ate on beach. 7) rent chairs, umbrella, cooler from Snorkel bobs 8) Infinity pool is awesome. yes you do have to pay for cabanas.. but there are plenty of chairs all around (and they aren't on top of each other like at the Grand Wailea... what an abomination that place is). 9) You can check in early, but your room won't be ready until close to 4. You can get a key to hospitality room to change in. Just head to pool or beach for a few hours and relax off that airport funk. 10) You can check out late, but you won't get any later than 1pm w/o paying.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: sherrie212
Reviews.Content: The flight, hotel, weather, everything was perfect. The hotel is located on the beach and within easy walking distance to beautiful snorkling beaches. Great walking paths and beautiful hotel complex. Several swimming pools, hot tubs, restaurants and shopping. A wonderful shopping mall directly next to the hotel with several shops and restaurants makes it really nice. Ocean front room made our morning coffee even more special. We traveled with another couple and we had a great trip. Will be back! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice building but rude staff and Very Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: ScubaDiver1976
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a nice vacation in Maui, beautiful island, nice hotel building but really poor service. - Lets start from the checkin...even though we had clearly mentioned that we were on honeymoon, and clearly selected and paid for an oceanfront, King beds room...our receptionist asked " two queen beds sir?" which we simultaneously and instantly replied NO! this was fixed quickly and we moved into our nice room with King Sized Bed (once we showed documented proof for a King Bed request). we received a complementary bottle of champagne. - After a few nights, there was a big fight going on in the room above us and we could not sleep (mind you in hawaii, if you are into scuba diving, you have to be at the docks to leave at 5:45 AM). The guys above were screaming and shouting and swearing, ...so we called the front desk, they said they would deal with the issue and will call us back with an update, they never did...... - Next day we changed our room, - We went to the serenity pool....really really nice place. We sat down in one of those Cabanas you can see on the hotel's website and after a little while the server with an unpleasant message, "please move, this Cabana is reserved. They are to be reserved for $100 a day..." there were no signs, what so ever on this particular cabana, there was a few with a reserved sign, but this one didn't have anything on it...when i complained, she replied, they have already " KICKED OUT other guests from other cabanas", this was enough for me to blow the fuse and really get upset, after raising this to the duty manager, they offered us a complementary Cabana, but too little, too late, too rude. Not cool...the apology was not enough i'm afraid...we paid A LOT for this trip and they failed to provide the very basics of customer service. I was surprised to have to pay to sit by the pool in such an expensive hotel and when there is no beachfront (just lava rock) at this resort (despite all other hotels nearby having beaches) - We asked for a late check out on our last day, they confirmed it was fine to leave at 13:00, but when we went back to our room to pack at 12:00, within the agreed extended time, our room keys didn't work anymore. We contacted the front desk and they said they would send the security person to unlock the door, this was fine...BUT...it took them exactly 20 minutes (yes, you read it right, 20 minutes waiting outside our rooms in our swimwear - we'd just come back from a last swim in the pool). My wife went to the lobby in her bikini and asked for the key eventually, standing in front of guests at the reception in what is tatamount to her underwear) There were a few other problems worth mentioning below: - mattress was too soft, if you have a sensitive back, you will pay back the next day - room was dirty on a couple of occasions, but they addressed it and problem didn't happen again (although was not great overall). Throughout the stay we loved the scenery and view and landscaping of our hotel, there is no beach in front at this hotel, but you can walk to the Grand Wailea beach resort, which is a few minutes walking to the south of Marriott and another smaller beach to the north. They charge for everything, internet is around $15 a day, or get a 2 hour voucher from Starbucks with any purchase. Long story short, Guests are nice big greenbacks to the eyes of Marriott staff, i felt lots of Aloha's and Mahala's were fake and only for your tip....I have no problem paying and tipping but I demand a service, which Marriott Wailea failed to deliver....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cy91clone
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little hesitant of my selection of this hotel; however, it turned out to be terrific. Rooms are adequate, clean - pools are great, not crowded, and steps away from a beach in either direction. This is a diamond in the rough. Wailea location is great, 40-45 minute drive to Kannapali, 30 minutes from airport, 30 minutes to far south side of island. Kids loved being able to do beach activities and then spend the evening in the pool. Activity personnel assisted us tremendously and helped us utilize our 4 days to perfection. We did snorkeling in Kannapali - which was voted #1 activity by the family - unanimously. I would recommend getting the breakfast with the hotel room - otherwise, a breakfast for 4 was a standard $100 each day... or go to the Whalers store and pick up some breakfast foods and have it in your room. My kids just love the overpriced buffet - and hey, we were on vacation... People, service was great - we opted for a oceanview room - steps from the pools and few yards from the ocean - PERFECT! Oceanfront might be an improvement, but only slighly in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous but BORING”
Reviews.Author: Dinfire
Reviews.Content: This resort is for three types of folks. Old alcoholics, people with kids, and boring couples. This place completely shuts down about an hour before sunset. There is absolutely nothing to do. There's one bar that stays open until around 11 and I never saw more than four people there. The rooms are moderately nice, the service is fine, and the resort is well-maintained. People complaining about the distance to the beach completely shock me because no one here is in a hurry to do anything--including smile or laugh. It's like a morgue. The property is absolutely gorgeous, but after 24 hours the awe is gone and you're left in the middle of nowhere with nothing to do after the sun goes down. They will even kick you out of the pools. There is an extra $25 resort fee PER DAY in addition to whatever you paid to book on Orbitz, Travelocity, etc, but that basically pays for the parking. You also get a discount on food at one of the restaurants, but watch it. They won't tell you about the discount so we had to go back and get the card reimbursed. The way they reacted when we walked up with our credit card receipt it's obvious that it's just the way they do business. We stayed here because we thought there would be things to do a little south and we could save a little money on lodging, but unless you booked activities weeks before coming to Maui there isn't. Lanai is a 40-minute drive away and that's the closest thing resembling civilization. We were soooo bored and found ourselves back in the room by 9PM and then the room has the oddest selection of TV stations and no wireless internet. It doesn't even have ESPN. It's like it's trapped in the '70s. This place also nickels and dimes you for everything, except the nickel is $50 and the dime is $100. Basically nothing worth having/doing is included. If you're a smoker do not stay here. There are three designated places to smoke on the entire resort and they're puny. You literally have to walk half a mile to get to any of them. It makes you feel like you're in quarantine with leprosy. You aren't even allowed to smoke on your private deck outside your room. It's insane. I felt like I was in some kind of military state. If you're in your 20s or 30s and enjoy any semblance of nitelife or socializing with other fun human beings stay far away. If you're one of the three types of people I mentioned in the first sentence you've just found heaven. I'd rather stay at a Days Inn where you at least have the chance of meeting some interesting people worth hanging out with. If you want to sit by a pool all day with a bunch of old people or kids screaming their heads off, get wasted drunk, and go to bed at 9 to do it all over again, have at it. The fact that I've found time to type all this on my VACATION should speak volumes about how boring and lifeless this place is.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Wailea Marriott”
Reviews.Author: MeredithF4
Reviews.Content: We have styaed at this property almost every summer for the last 8 years and each time we go it seems to get better and better. It is definitely not the Four Seasons or the Grand Wailea, but the prices reflect that point too. It is MUCH more reasonable than the other two, has the same beach as the other two and the grounds, the staff & the rooms were amazing. We arrived early, and while our room was not ready until 4pm (check in time), we were happy to wait as they were going to upgrade us to an ocean view suite. Thanks Maricelle! Our kids love the kids pool & water slides, we love the pool side restaurant so the kids can swim while we waited and while we couldn't enjoy the amazing adults only infinity pool (must be 18 yrs old), someday we will:) The only downside to this property is that they don't have ESPN in the rooms (my husband still can't believe this is true), and there is no poolside service at the childrens pools. Imagine how much money they would make if they had a bar over there! Can't quite figure out hy there isn't one. Overall, a great place to stay wether you're honeymooning or traveling with kids or teens...we love the Wailea Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful friendly resort - with only one problem”
Reviews.Author: Momthatlovestravel
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were greeted with friendly smiles and excellent service. The grounds are amazing. Lush and spotless. Be sure to try the excellent food at the Mala restaurant. Both the restaurants on the property had the most friendly servers we have ever encountered on a vacation.The pools, views and beaches nearby are great. As much as I hate to say anything negative, I do have to mention the one downside which was the air conditioning. It ran 24/7 and is still warm and humid in our ocean front room. I read this on other reviews and found it a common complaint. I can't understand why such a beautiful resort wouldn't upgrade the air condtioning units like all the other Marriotts on the other Hawaiian islands we have stayed. Still I give the resort a big thumbs up for making our vacation so memorable. The people who work their including groundskeepers, valets,reception, servers, housekeepers all made for a true Aloha experience.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the beach?”
Reviews.Author: bobgto65
Reviews.Content: We have not been to Maui for 10 years and at that time we enjoyed staying in the Marriott owned Renissance in Wailea. Since then, Marriott moved a couple doors down to the former Inter continental hotel. When we checked in, we received a free upgrade from a garden view to a loading dock view. You could also see a small sliver of the ocean. But starting at 6AM a procession of delivery trucks kept up awake when they had to open and slam the roll-up doors at the back of the bed and the annoying beeping when they backed up, When the trucks weren't there, the howling wind noise from the sliding doors to the balcony that did not seal properly provided an eerie background noise. The manager moved us to an 'oceanfront' room. which was actually an ocean view room but much quieter. If you like rooms with tile floors that turn your bare feet black because they have not been mopped in a while, this is the place for you. In addition, we look forward to sitting on the beach. However, there is no beach in front of the hotel, which is situated in a rocky area between two beaches, each a five to seven minute walk away. If you go to the beach, rent some chairs and an umbrella at Snorkel Bobs because you can't get them from the Marriott. Otherwise, you are left to relax at one of the pools in the sun, as a shady place is hard to come by as are lounge chairs Parking is 20 dollars a day and you have to use your room card to get in and out although that was a crapshoot beacuse half the time it didn't work.. We finally checked out and went to the Grand Wailea, which was a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very courteous and patient manager and staff - especially Moses and Jeremey!”
Reviews.Author: UMLAILA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a few days with our kids. We had a long rough flight in and we arrived at the hotel early so our room was not ready. We took the kids to change in the bathroom so they could at least swim while we were getting set up but we remained in our travel clothes. Needless to say we were tired, hungry and hot. When we finally got our room, we realized one of our bags was missing - of course the one that had all of the children's clothing. Both having a touch of OCD, we were certain that it was lost by the hotel. We knew we unloaded everything out of the taxi. We threw a fit over it, insisting that it must have been sent to someone else's room. To make a long story short, it ended up being our mistake. We left the bag behind at the airport. EMBARRASSING!!! We felt awful and after we recovered it we went straight to the manager and told him that we found it and aplogized profusely for jumping to conclusions. He and his staff could not have been more gracious and nice about it. Moses and Jeremey - if you are reading this, thanks again and please accept our aplogies. Overall the hotel is a good value for Wailea and has great access to shops and restaurants. The beach is a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: BeachandPalmTrees
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property in July 1985 when it was the Intercontinental Hotel. We returned to Maui for the second time July 2010 and wanted to stay at this same property because we remembered it was so beautiful. We were not disappointed. This was the first hotel built on the beach in Wailea and the developers picked the best spot in front of the lava rocks. Because of this when they say ocean front room, they really mean ocean front room. Your view isnâ€™t blocked by hoards of people on the beach like the Grand Wailea next door. I was going to say a few words about the Grand Wailea but the post under that property titled â€˜Brokedown Palaceâ€™ by musicmafia on 8/2/2010 pretty much sums it up. It was Disneyland on steroids but probably a good place if you have small children. The beach to the north is a very short walk from the Marriott and there are several beaches a little bit further. The beaches to the north were never crowded. The adult infinity pool was great and the three ladies who worked there were very friendly and provided great service. My husband and I have to give much praise to James the bartender at the restaurant bar. We enjoyed great conversation and my husband enjoyed his Manhattan and Sazerac cocktails. I would definitely recommend staying here just for the location. Good places to eat are the hotel restaurant and in Kihei the South Shore Tiki Lounge, Threeâ€™s and for sushi try Koiso.

Reviews.Title: “"Paradise"”
Reviews.Author: Canuck4454
Reviews.Content: Our family spent three wonderful days at the Marriott Wailea. The grounds were extraordinary with three pools; two family and one adult pool. Our 10 and 12 year old boys loved the water side dropping into a deep pool. Room was very clean and comfortable with one king bed, pull out sofa and a roll away. Front desk check in was smooth. We did not use the food services other than pool side which was excellent. Small beach was available to use although we chose to park ourselves by the pool. Free Wi Fi service at the on site Starbucks Coffee house. We stayed at the Hyatt Regency in the latter part of our holiday continually noting we should have remained at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location even though a short walk to the beach.”
Reviews.Author: wade17
Reviews.Content: Several different pools and a pool for folks over 18 that truly was serene and had a fantastic view of ocean and beyond. Lots to do within an easy drive from hotel. Others had mentioned the walk to the beach, but it is easily managed even with little kids. Snorkeling off front of hotel rocks is good, but much better near rock jetty at far end of beach to the north. Rooms were very nice and housekeeping very accommodating. Their is a variety of pools and the kids did really enjoy the kids area with 2 slides and play area - constantly asking to go back (ages 5, 7, 11.) A sidewalk connects most of hotels on Wailea oceanfront so that you for a nice walk or jogging path. Mall within very easy walking distance has some good dining options. No parking available within reasonable distance of hotel. The hotel charges you $20/day for you to park your own car or $25/day for valet service.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Explorers377
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Marriott Wailea and Maui in general. My boyfriend is a platinum rewards member so we were upgraded to an ocean front room and received internet for free. The room was nice - large, clean, and had a great view from the balcony. It was a pleasure to wake up to that every morning. We stayed 3 nights after a 7 night stay in Waikiki. While at the resort, we spent a lot of time at the infinity pool and never had a problem getting seats. The pool was fantastic and very relaxing. We found the staff to be very friendly and accomodating. We ate at the pool bar twice and at Mala once, which was delicious if indeed a bit pricey. We also had a massage at the spa and really enjoyed that aswell. This resort was also in a good location. It was close to a number of golf courses, which was very convenient for us, not a far drive from the airport, and right behind the resort was a shopping center. We ate at the Tommy Bahama cafe for dinner one night. The food and live entertainment was outstanding. We took a stroll down the beach front walkway and saw that the Marriott is right next to the Grand Wailea and then the Four Seasons Resort. Compared to the Grand Wailea, we were really glad that we chose the Marriott. That hotel seemed super crowded with people all over the front of the hotel jarring for space in the sun. Overall, we can't wait to get back to Maui and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll most definitely come back for our anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: beharmony
Reviews.Content: What a great experience! I arrived in Wailea with my parents and older sister to prepare for my wedding. Later my husband's family came in right before the wedding. The hotel was very kind to help us prepare for the wedding, especially since my husband and I are deaf. They helped my mother plan a Spa Day at the Mandara, a luncheon at the Kumu's Bar and Grill, and a small reception in the Buddha room at the Mala restaurant. The staff was wonderful and very informative. I especially loved the hotel room and their tile flooring! It was very cool to walk on. I would've like the keepers to spend more time washing the flooring, since it wasn't clean enough. Also our view of the oceanfront was gorgeous and we even saw a sunset while enjoying our champagne on the balcony. It was also so nice to enjoy the breeze and the view of other islands while having room service breakfast out there one morning. I wish the oceanfront room wasn't too expensive though. I would save money next time and get a garden view. My parents had a garden view and they still had a great view of the two mountains! My husband said he was really happy to have the oceanfront view regardless of the price for our two nights of honeymoon there before going to another island. What my husband loved about the hotel was its space, architecture design, and the infinity pool. The infinity pool has a list of strict rules and doesn't allow kids. The hotel has plenty other pools for kids to dip into though. The infinity pool has some cabana style docks which is for reservation only. My husband's brother rented one for $100 and got some free snacks and drinks. Once in a while, the pool may close at 6pm for special dinner for two (reservation only). One night I saw a couple eating out in the middle of the pool on their wedding night- how romantic! The hotel also has two nearby beaches for people to go to. I didn't spend a day at the beach but my sister did and she enjoyed it very much. She raved about how she saw some sea turtles and a frog (or toad). Right by the hotel, you can see all the lava rocks and ocean waves, which is an unique view. That's where I had my wedding- right out on the lawn with ocean waves crashing into the lava rocks and the sun setting down. The hotel also has some nice breakfasts but I wish bagels were more available since I'm not big on having expensive big breakfast. However, my husband's family are big on breakfast and they enjoyed their meal at the Mala in the hotel. I wish the business room had free internet for the guests to use. That part was pretty disappointing for me. I would have liked to check something on an internet and be allowed to do so for a time limit (say maybe up to 15 minutes). Beside that, we also had to pay for using the internet in our room or through wifi. It would be nice if it was free like some other Marriott hotels I've stayed at in other states. Across the hall from the 24 hours business/mailing center, there is a 24 hours fitness center. They have really nice equipments. My husband said that he wants to come back to Maui (maybe in five to ten years) and stay at this very hotel. It may be expensive but we prefer this hotel over other much more expensive hotels on the coast. This is because the design of the hotel fits our taste. It's also very quiet and peaceful, which we love! There is one more thing that guests should be aware of, the parking is free with the resort fee. You should ask the staff what the resort fee includes (such as two mai tais or coffee, parking, etc). The hotel also use "towel cards" which mean you hand in a card to get a towel for the pool and when you return it, you'd get a card back.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: wabect
Reviews.Content: My family tends to stay at Marriott properties when we travel. This resort just blew us away! The pools, grounds, restaurants, spa, and staff were wonderful. It was a perfect place for my daughter's destination wedding. The staff was so helpful with the planning process and communicated easily with us via e-mail or telephone. The wedding planner who is associated with this Marriott exceeded our expectaions. I have only one complaint concerning our stay. The room has ceramic tile instead of carpeting. The tile was very dirty. I would suggest that the housekeeping staff take the time and wash the floor each day.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Three (3) Diamond Hotel - beware”
Reviews.Author: filmtheory
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Beach Wailea is frustrating. This is a$200 dollar a night hotel (Three Diamond) masquerading as a $300 (Four Diamond) hotel. They strive really hard to be a 4 Star/Diamond rated resort/hotel (as does the entire Marriot chain) but falls short but an entire star/diamond. Almost like Target trying to be a Macy's. At best, this is a 3 Star Resort NOT a 4 Star Resort, contrary to whatever claim they may make. I've had similar problems at other Marriotts. The staff is super nice and tries really hard but it's like they don't have enough resources or something. First problem: at check-in. Not enough employees. I had to wait 15 minutes. Compare this to the Grand Hyatt (walk right up to counter - no wait whatsoever). After checking into room, we discovered the bed was broken (platform squeeked) and we had to move to another room in the middle of the night (absolutely frustrating) courtesy of the manager. In the second room, there were clothes left in the drawers and dust in the bathroom, suggesting poor maid service. We also saw moldy strawberries outside the room next door (gross). Also, the property does not have a beach/water sports. You need to walk down about 100 yards to reach it. The pools were also kinda small and crowded with kids. These things just DO NOT happen at similar Four Diamond AAA Resorts like the Grand Hyatt. The Spa was super nice as was the restaraunt, Mala. We used our Marriott Points so we only paid about 50% of the rate of $299. In the future, I don't think I would stay here. I would pay the extra $100 and stay at the Four Seasons, Fairmont or Grand Wailea and get a real Five Diamond experience.

Reviews.Title: “Love the infinity pool!”
Reviews.Author: nwlywd10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and had a great experience! The staff was very friendly. Our room was very nice, recently updated, and the grounds were well kept up. There are several pools, I think 5?, so there is plenty of room for the guests to space out. We loved the adults-only infinity pool, you don't get a view better than that! They have the best cabanas we've seen at any hotel. The daily resort fee is a little high ($25), but then you don't have to pay extra for parking, and it also includes and liter of water per day. We had a gorgeous ocean view, and there were spectacular sunsets every night. We didn't hear people in the rooms around us, except it was very loud when the people above us opened and closed the door to the lanai. Another great feature was the bathtub; the sides are really wide so there's room for all your toiletries. Wailea is a great location to stay on Maui! There are lots of great restaurants close by. And the Shops at Wailea are great and within walking distance of the hotel! We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and staff”
Reviews.Author: ScottFamily30712
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night before spending a week in our vacation ownership villa, but we would recommend this hotel. Hotel had lovely grounds, great restaurant, pool bar, and comfortable rooms. After the quick check-in, we were met in the front lobby by a very nice gentleman with a golf cart. He loaded our bags, drove us around the property explaining the available facilities and what options were close by for shopping, dining, etc. He personally showed us to our oceanfront room, brought our bags inside, filled our ice bucket, and asked if we needed any additional assistance before leaving. When we left the next morning, someone again met us at the door with the golf cart but this time he brought us straight to our car and loaded our bags in the trunk! That kind of service is hard to find and we were very pleased. The 2nd floor room had a beautiful oceanfront view and nice size balcony. The bartender at the pool side bar was so friendly. He offered a few great recommendations for breakfast and outtings. The first night of our trip after the long flight , we just wanted to sit and relax. We ordered drinks, seared ahi tuna, lettuce wraps and just chilled to watch the sunset. My husband enjoyed the Maui drafts and the price was reasonable, but the Maui Tai was a bit pricey at 12.50. We spent $75 bucks for dinner/drinks but we would have spent just as much elsewhere and we didn't have to drive or get dressed for a night out on the town. It was a wonderful beginning to our trip and we would recommend the hotel for superb customer service, location, and hotel grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not up to standards”
Reviews.Author: ardire591
Reviews.Content: I felt the need to leave an honest review of this hotel since their are either those who hate it or think very highly of it. Now mind you I traveled with my wife and 16 mo. old so my perspective might be different than most. I practically live in Marriott Hotels for work so I have a certain expectation when I travel to a so called full service Marriott. I had the lucky notion of booking my room with points so I can't complain all that much about a free stay. When you check in the front entrance to the hotel and reception area is first rate, what I expect from Marriott. Little note that the $25 resort fee is optional if you book with points. We were offered the free internet for my Gold Status again expected when you travel like i do. After check in you are taken to your room which is where we learned how confusing this place can be. We stayed in building 3 which is right in the center which worked to our benefit due to the size of this hotel and the walking that is required. We had a stroller most of the time which was kinda a burden since this hotel is not really meant for that or great wheelchair access. Ramps were very few and far between so quite a challenge for us. We found ourselves all over the property just trying to find access back to our room. Beware that the property is more that 30 years old and Marriott just took it over a few years back. I hope to see that Marriott adds its own touches since the majority of it is quite run down. I have to say that for location and views not many hotels will compare to it outstanding location right between two great beaches. The pictures on the website really don't do it justice especially at dusk. The rooms are quite roomy but dated, the beds are very comfortable but very cushy not the best if you have a bad back. We did not mind the dated room since we look at it as a place to sleep and change. Again the rooms were not of Marriott standard way off the mark, but I was okay since not spending a lot of time in the room. Tile floors were a nice change from carpet cool on the feet after a long day in the sun, but beware slippery when wet. Rooms have mini fridges good for drinks from the store, we are used to paying for drinks at the pool but soon after got sticker shock from the Marriott their happy hour prices were where the Westin's regular prices are stayed there earlier in the week. Also found out the Marriott did not have cribs like the Westin but very dated low pack in plays so our little one kept climbing out kinda annoying don't promote cribs if you do not have them. The sofa was a pull out in the room so that was our alternate. The Adult infinity pool is first rate but we just walked by since we were not allowed with our baby. I will say the kids area probably the best I have ever seen at a hotel, for both the little ones like we had and the older ones. Two great slides and a water playground feature with a mini beach access for the kids. One slide plunged into a 9 foot pool not for the faint heart and a regular double swirl slide. The other pools are quite old nothing fancy at all almost like they are old apartment style pools. Two of them are 8 foot deep good to know for the kids running around there. The restaurants MALA and the pool bar could not be more different. The pool bar don't waste your money and time. Very slow service and prices are almost laughable for what you get. Quality terrible and kids menu start at $10. My wife and I are not very picky for food but at least we want to not be ripped off. Spent more on lunch than dinner. Now for MALA we had eaten there before up in Lahina area and enjoyed it but again it had mixed reviews so felt inclined to give it a whirl. If you are not used to paying for good food then this may not be for you but we like are food so we did not mind. Combination's of flavors were quite good. They claim to have the best Kobe burger so I felt inclined worth the money yes, the best I have had that is arguable. My son enjoyed his pasta dish and the staff was great with him, My wife had pizza and coconut shrimp which she enjoyed as well. They're desserts were out of this world. Needless to say we ate there more than once. Would I stay here again yes but only on points or a really good rate. If I am to pay $200-$300 a night I expect way more. I hope to return and see Marriott put it's stamp on this place as it needs it. Marriott in Lahina is lights out compared to this place.

Reviews.Title: “a Whole lot of NOTHING”
Reviews.Author: sfhulagirl12
Reviews.Content: Really? So had we known (but how could we have?) we would have just paid the extra and stayed at the Fairmont Wailea or the Four Seasons. We thought well can't go wrong with the Marriott, but actually.....you CAN go wrong! Here's why: -Couldn't find ice machine, called front desk, they told me nearest one was in the 4th building, well oops I am staying in the first building....so then I asked can hospitality just bring me a bucket....the woman replies "that will be a $4 charge"...seriously? -next.....searching for healthy breakfast items like fresh fruit, etc.....no such luck anywhere on the resort.....only options were unhealthy stuff in room service, a lunch salad at starbucks, yogurt at the gift shop.....so our beach breakfast consisted of a starbucks salad, mozarella cheese sticks and trail mix....again REALLY? -next...my man was trying to hook up our iPad to the tv so we could watch a movie and well....let's just say 5 phone calls later and even being asked to test our cable in another room, the end result was them just saying "well our tv's are from 2006 when we renovated the hotel, they are probably not compatible" -next, our ocean view room has about a 1/5 ocean view out of the right side. We mostly see the other hotel guests walking to the pool and can definitely hear them -next, the beautiful infinity pool on the website pictures closes at 5:30 PM so that they can serve their "$500 per couple poolside dinners" -mandatory $25 resort fee does not include wifi, that will be another $14.95........seriously? should have just stayed at four seasons -also FYI the beach access is way way way to the right of the resort, actually not even on the resort property....so no beach chairs or umbrellas....if you want that go to the Grand Wailea ( I saw them there when i was walking by) Done, Done and Done with the Marriott hotels of any kind lesson learned= if you are not a marriott platinum something member, do not stay here, you WILL not be upgraded nor have a wonderful hawaiian out of this world stay at our so-called resort

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel But Too Many High End Restaurants & Malls Nearby”
Reviews.Author: TigerKatt
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very charming. The lobby is an indoor/outdoor open concept, which is really pretty, except when it rained. We had to run from the lobby to the elevator and got wet. There is a beach nearby (within walking distance). The valets are all very friendly. When we checked into our room the receiptionist walked us over to the valet area to get our checked bags. We found this little "extra" was a bit strange for a resort. She should have called over to the valet desk with our luggage numbers or we could have walked the 20 feet by ourselves. It felt like you were being escorted to the desk and being watched. The room was immaculate, as was the bathroom, although the shower head needed some serious mildew cleaning. While we were there they were doing regular pest control on a Friday sometime as per the note that was left in our room. It would have been nice to see a coupon or discount from the hotel to one of their restaurants for this unsightly maintenance letter. We never saw them do our room however as we opted to stay out most of the day because of this. The downside to this hotel is that there needs to be signs posted in the hallways reminding parents with children that other guests are looking for peace and quiet vacations. At 8am our hallway sounded like a daycare centre . This plus the lobby music (which sounded like elevator music) that was extremely loud woke us up on several occasions. For the price of this hotel parking should be included and should not cost $20 for self parking. Internet should also be included and not cost. The serenity pool was very nice and no children were allowed there which made for a peaceful environment. The drinks were $10 for a small plastic cup mostly filled with ice. The hotel is definately upscale and the restaurants reflected this. There was nowhere in the hotel, or in the nearby mall, to get a quick cheap eat. The mall is a mixture of high and low end stores; everything from Tiffany's to the Whaler General Store. We ended up going into town to the Outback Steakhouse for a nice meal. Taxi and food included, it was still cheaper to do this than stay at the resort. All in all, a wonderfully clean and comfortable hotel but I wish they had more affordable amenities and inclusions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, friendly service, but no direct beach access.”
Reviews.Author: RustyCleveland_Ohio
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at theis hotel for 6 days. Our room was nicely decorated and very clean. The beds are very comfortable. The resort grounds are very beautiful, however there are few trees directly by the pools for shade. We spent most of our time at the two family pools. They were never over crowded and there were always plenty of lounge chairs, There is also and Adult only pool, and a great kids pool with slide etc. The staff was very friendly and willing to help. You can book excursions at several locations around the resort for all the popular attractions. We attended the luau next door, and it was great! The only down side to this hotel is that they have no beach access directly in front of their hotel. You must walk to either side of the Resort for beach access. Even that would be no big deal if you could relax once there. Neither side has chairs for use. At the Grand Wailea you can you pay for them. On the other side, the beach is smaller with no chairs at all. The beaches are beautiful though. All in all we would go back there again for sure, and we had a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS HOTEL! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: ilovehawaiiredlands
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Maui and our stay at the Wailea Marriot. We loved the hotel, the location, the service and the people. The location is amazing - looking out on 22 acres of oceanfron property. Unlike the neighboring Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons, the Marriot, is spread out and uncrowded. No one waits in line for a beach chair here (I saw people start lining up for a beach chair at 6 am at the Grand Wailea!) Even at 100% capacity, the hotel does not feel crowded. No problems getting a chair at the pool. There are five pools and none of them feel crowded. The hotel is located between two great beaches that have fantastic snorkeling - a five minute walk in either direction. The restaurant for breakfast is fantastic. Yes, the $27 buffet is expensive, but if you order off the menu the prices are good and the view is great. I think the best part of the hotel is the service and the people. They even have a button on the phone "at your service." When you push it, someone at the front desk calls you by name and asks how they can serve you. Nice. Janet, the hostess at the breakfast was so friendly, She called us by name and thanked us for coming back every morning. Judy at the front desk helped us the first night. The room we were in was in the view of the bright hallway light. Even though the hotel was at capacity, somehow she was able to get us another room that had a fabulous view of the ocean. When I needed to mail something home, the front desk called Fed Ex for me - twice- to help me since I do not have an account with Fed Ex. I have stayed in many nice hotels and I must say that this hotel is great! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at Wailea Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Jake143
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a very nice stay at the Wailea Marriott on Maui. I will try to supply some info that will be important to families. Had a room that included 2 doubles plus foldout sofa. Plenty of room. Oceanfront, large sliding glass door with lanai. Frig in room good for drinks for breakfast. Tile floors in most or all rooms that we saw. Bed were very soft, so if you are used to a very firm mattress you may have an issue. We were okay but expected problems. Pools were great! One was an infinity pool with changing depths. Another a normal pool again with changing depths. Both located in front of main bldg with access to bar drinks and food. Average food item from bar was from 10 to 17 bucks. Bring a soft side cooler and buy canned or bottled drinks that can be chilled in frig, ice machine available. Works well. Favorite pools for my family were on the south side of property. Another pool that went form 3 feet to 9 feet in depth. Nice size and very warm. Also in this area are two water slides that are independent of pools. One is the normal curvy slide, the other is a short and drop into a deep 10 foot pool that my kids called the bullet. Rode it many times. Very unique. The large pool where most pictures are supplied from is the adults only infinity pool. No kids under 18, fyi. Property is on the ocean, but has rocky waterfront. Must walk north or south to beach areas. North is to Ulua Beach which is great for snorkeling. Many fish to view. Go in morning, wind gets up in afternoon and water gets rough. South is the beach in front of Grand Wailea. Crowded, but nicer beach. Very clear water. Regarding food and eating, there are several businesses in Kihei including a Safeway grocery store which was excellent, an Outback which was okay, and several fast food joints that are closer to town. Closer to the hotel is a Subway 2 minutes away as well as a "Cheeseburger" restaurant in the shops at Wailea. Good stuff. Did not eat at Mala, very expensive for a family with 3 kids that might not eat much of their 25 to 35 dollar meal. Would have easily spent $200 for a very conservative dinner. Chose to do other things. The luau at the hotel was pretty good, but expensive and questionable on whether to do or not. 95 for adults, 50 for kids under 12. Food was good and so was the show, but not 400 bucks worth. Your choice. We did it, glad we did, but still.... Just so everyone doesn't think I am cheap, our favorite activity on Maui was the Blue Hawaiian helicopter tour. One hour ride. Saw many things and was very memorable. No motion sickness, very smooth, fun for all. Highly recommend!!! Save your money. Overall, we really enjoyed the Marriott and hope to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: MissouriBen
Reviews.Content: I'm an avid TripAdvisor.com user, so based on the up's and down's of the previous reviews, I was very trepidatious about staying here. However, since we got the "Friends and Family" rate (a relative works for Marriott), we decided to "chance it." I'm so glad we did. While we were only there a relatively short time (3 nights, with off-site daily activities planned every day), the resort clearly met our expectations/needs. Room was large, clean and had a great view of ocean. Had a fabulous July 4th dinner at on-site restaurant (with incredible view of ocean, Maui coast, Lanai, etc.). Kids had great time at kids pool area and beach. Wife enjoyed abundant shopping next door and I enjoyed on-site Starbucks. Wailea is a terrific area of Maui and very convenient to other areas of the island (Lahaina, Road to Hana, Haleakana, etc.). Had a great time and had no complaints - beautiful property! Oh yes - one other thing - the beds are incredibly comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Secrets to a Gr8 Stay at Marriott Wailea”
Reviews.Author: ScottD58
Reviews.Content: Learned a little during the 6 nights I was here It's a 22 acre property and therfore never seems crowded. But it's all about getting the right room. The 1st 2 nites we were in 813 - view of service area and truck. After 2 nites there they moved us to Hale #2 with a pool ocean view - much better. Although I shouldn't complain either way as I was staying free on points. Here are some tips: 1) Check in: It's standard procedure that when you check in early they tell you your rooms not ready til 4pm- so have a bathing suit handy - and don't complain too much or they give you a lousy room. like 813. But if they do, ask to move until they do, and they will! 2) Best breakfast is a 20 mintue walk up the beach (Right North)to 5 palms. It's a beachfront gem, kinda retro, $4 bloody Mary's or Mimosas. Went there twice, great service. 3) Best lunch is Ferraros at the 4 Seasons - a 15 minute walk left, south - Gr8 views of beach - Pizza for $20, fantastic salads with fresh fish for $22- beers for $6, Kid meno and teen menu - something for everyone including the view. 4) Choice of Luau. The Marriott and the Hyatt both have Luaus on their properties, you really don't need a ticket to watch the shows, (you can get so close) but you do to eat the food and drink the rum. The Marriott uses Hana Bay rum, the Hyatt, Whalers. The Mai Tia's suck. The Marriott stage faces the ocean, the Hyatt faces the stone wall. All the dancers are good and the fire dancers, awards not withstanding, are equals. The pork and Mahi Mahi is better at the Marriott. 5) Best Beach - the southern Hyatt Wailea beach is a zoo and the snorkling sucks there. You can rent a lounge chair, but why bother, its too crowded and not the south of France. The northern beach has better snorkling, better Boogie boarding. less crowded and is full of turtles. If you walk further north the beaches are desserted, empty - no one there and close to $4 Bloody Mary's. You decide. 6) Best Pool: That depends if your a kid or adult, the infinity pool is spectacular after dark, just you the stars and a few discerning adults. The kids pool water slide is fun regardless of age. The pools in between are never crowded even when the hotel is sold out. But the drinks are a rip, Bring a bottle of good rum and POG save your dough for food. 7) Starbucks is a savior. Reasonable Coffee and regular Starbucks fair with a 20% premium, but that's cheap by Maui standards. Free WiFi - and fun to hang out. 8) Health Club is pretty good, I'm not a spa guy so I can;t comment, but the Hammoacks which are free ar the best deal on the property!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the Upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: rmuna02
Reviews.Content: After staying at various Marriott properties throughout the country, it was time to redeem my points for the first time... what better place to do that than in Maui?! As a platinum member, I did not have to ask for an upgrade. Upon check-in, I was advised of the upgrade and offered a ride on a golf cart straight to our door. It was a mini-suite oceanfront room. Our room had a lanai with great ocean views as wells as views of Lanai, Molokai and West Maui. The maid provided complimentary bottles of water daily (may only apply to elite members, not sure). The resort is right next to a high end mall with great restaurants. The whales were still around when we were there... they had a scenic scope that we used to view the whales jumping around. Downsides are the $20 parking, no free internet for elites (and you have to pay to use the business center). Overall, we enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Can't stop talking about our amazing trip to Maui!”
Reviews.Author: aloha719
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our honeymoon two years ago in Jamaica and decided it was time to take another tropical vacation together. Wailea was a great place to do just that! First of all, my husband is a platinum member and we used points for our stay. Upon arrival we were immediately upgraded to an ocean front room that over looked the serenity pool and the ocean. We saw gorgeous sunsets and had little noise to deal with. There was one night when a particularly rowdy group decided to take a late night swim, but they were quieted down quickly. We also had a smoker staying near us making our deck a little smelly once in a while. Also, parking was $20 per day in the ramp. This didn't bother us because we knew it was coming after reading people's information on this site. But my complaints stop there. The serentiy pool was awesome because no kids were allowed and cell phones were prohibited. As a couple without children, we really enjoyed the peace and quiet of an adults only pool. For those complaining about the kids pool area, I don't think Maui is the ideal vacation destination for young children... think Disney World. In the afternoon we walked down the path to the beach to enjoy the ocean. Tip: Go down after lunch 1-2:00 and you can get chairs from people who have bought them and then left instead of paying $30. It worked for us every day! We knew that many restaurants were expensive in the area (typical of Hawaii, no surprise) so we decided to save on breakfast and lunch. The Shops located just behind the hotel have a general store where we purchased many breakfast items very cheap and several bottles of wine for a great price. We also visited Safeway (short drive down the road) and bought food for lunch. This saved us a lot of money and we went out for some nice dinners throughout the week. The hotel restaurant, Mala, was good! We also liked eating at many places located in the shops. Ask the hotel staff for tips on where to go as well as other guests. We always went to eat around 6:30 so that we could see the sunset at 7:15. I went surfing in Lahaina one morning and LOVED it! Highly recommend this! We also went on a boat excursion one day to Molokini and snorkeled. They provided breakfast and lunch and an experience we'll always remember. On our last full day, we decided to do the Road to Hana which we enjoyed, but said we probably wouldn't do again. There were great views, but the road was tight and windy making me a little queazy. Be sure you get out and see as much of Maui as possible to get the full experience. Finally, go to the hotel luau. I had heard mixed reviews but was very happy with it. Take advantage of the open bar and enjoy every morsel of the declicious pig. It was worth the money and so convenient to walk right up to our room following the event instead of driving down winding roads. We had such a great trip to Maui and loved our stay at the Marriott. The staff was kind and other guests were just as friendly. The views were amazing and we had no problems. To those who have written horrible reviews about this hotel, I'm sorry that you missed a once in a lifetime experience. I can't help but smile when I think back to our trip in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: CookiesMomPA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect! Our family of 4 stayed here for one week and loved it. The grounds are beautiful and having a Starbucks on site is a bonus! The location right behind the Shops at Wailea is fantastic-you can just walk over any time of day or night for lunch, snacks or shopping. Mala restaurant has a fabulous breakfast(don't leave your fod unattended or the birds will swipe it-seriously-we saw it happen more than once). The kids pool is small and doesn't really seem like much of a kids pool since there is very little shallow space. But our kids are a little older and this was not a problem. We all loved the water slides and the kids really enjoyed the water play area. This area of Maui got extremely windy in the afternoon and the other pools were almost unusable-the wind is extreme. However the kids area felt a little more protected from the wind. It seems as if there used to be a snack shop right at the kids pool, but it was closed the entire time we were there-how nice it'd be if it were in operation and if there were some type of pool service offering food and drinks. The walking trail is fabulous and we used it every morning. What a view! Also looks like a wonderful luau although we did not attend. All in all we would stay here again in a heartbeat. Wailea is beautiful and has become our favorite part of the island.

Reviews.Title: “This was my second time visiting the...”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler428
Reviews.Content: This was my second time visiting the Wailea Beach Marriott and I was disappointed this time around from the moment we arrived. Our room was not ready when we arrived but we were ok with waiting until 4pm when we were told our room would be ready. We indicated to the front desk that this was our second time at the hotel. She immediately told us our room number from our last stay and noticed that I was a Marriott gold elite member. None of this should've been a surprise since I had called the hotel to request an upgrade or at least stay in the same building as last time. Once 4pm rolled around I returned to the front desk to get our room key. After a 20 minute wait I was told the room was not yet ready. However they did give me the keys and asked dat I wait another 10 minutes. We waited 15 minutes before we went to the room and it still was not ready. By the time we did get to the room (5pm) we saw that the room was right over the hotel's delivery entrance. Needless to say we returned to the front desk for a room change. During my initial 2 visits to the front desk I was told the hotel was sold out and there were no upgrades available. Nevertheless on my third visit to the front desk we somehow were upgraded to oceanfront. Once in our room I noticed that the room seemed dirty. The white grout was more like brown, there was mildew in the bathroom, etc. Our visit two years ago was great. This time they made me questioned why I was there at all. The staff just did their job nothing more. I didn't feel welcomed at any point and service was sporadic at best. The only exception was Anita at the pool. She made sure we were ok the entire time. I've worked in the hotel business for many years and as a rule of thumb staff is trained to greet guests and make eye contact. This is not the case at the Marriott. Employees not once ackowledged us as we walked throughout the property. Before arriving at the Marriott we had stayed at the Hyatt Regency. This was a first time stay for me. I'm both a gold elite marriott member and a platinum member and I must say the Hyatt did a much better job. At the Marriott you only get an option to pay $20 for parking or a $25 resort fee. A the Hyatt you are exempt from any fees and you still have access to the regency club with continental bkfst, appetizers in the afternoon and desserts and after dinner drinks in the evening. Guess where Ill be staying next time? By the way the Marriott now has a Starbucks in the lobby but don't bother. We gave them several tries in the mornings but they never had bagels, yogurt parfaits, etc. They seemed to have more items that cater to lunch rather than breakfast. Just drive to Kihei (10 minutes) to a true Starbucks and you'll find what you are looking for. The best thing the Marriott has going is the location. There are some great restaurants such as Cuatro or Bistro 808 located just 10 minutes away. If you find another hotel in Wailea for about the same price as the Marriott go there.

Reviews.Title: “Where do I start....ugh!”
Reviews.Author: CAWoman09
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if you want a pleasurable, relaxed stay...the adult pool feels like a cruise ship, dead bugs in my room, dirty tile floors, housekeeping waking you up even though "do not disturb" was on door, front desk calling at 8am on a Sunday morning, no regard to their loyal business travelers returning for leisure....why bother having a rewards program if you are put in a room above the service entrance....this has been a terrible experience and I am only two days into a six night stay...,....never again!! Just because you are a high volume property does not excuse poor everything!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not really a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: travelkm
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week with our 2 young children. It's our 3rd trip to Maui. We last stayed at the Westin when our older one was a toddler. We decided to try the Wailea side this time. The resort was nice. The entrance lobby was like a 4 star hotel. But the kids pool area and the service was more of a 3 star. The pools are all pretty separated from each other. The kids pool is more like a small waterpark for the kids. They do have 2 really cool big slides that my older one loved. The kids of course wanted to play in the kids pool, so the adults are stuck around the 1 and 1/2 foot pool area. There is no pool side service in the kids pool. There is a separate pool up from the kids pool but the snack bar was closed the whole week we were there. I am not sure if it was ever open. The kids pool and the slides close at 4:45pm sharp. The service was not that great. We had a problem with our fridge in the room and had to call twice before they did something about it. There are only 2 restaurants. There are also not that many activities for kids. No kids club. They've eliminated the lei greeting upon arrival. I am assuming it's due to the economy. This is probably a better resort for people without kids. We would recommend the Westin instead.

Reviews.Title: “I was concerned - but WOW, what a trip!!!!”
Reviews.Author: No_shoes_shirt_prob
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've ever written a review but after reading the mixed results on here I admit I was concerned. However after returning I felt compelled to share my experience. First I travel a LOT so I believe I'm pretty discerning (some say a travel bigot...but I won't go that far), but I feel I have a pretty fair perspective to draw from. My family and I just returned from 10 nights at the Marriott in Wailea and we had an AWESOME time. Now we did get upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite in HALE 7 and it was great. Three (yes Three) balconies all ocean front. I could toss a baseball underhanded into the ocean if I wanted. The room itself is fine - nothing super special but a great location, comfortable, clean and the views were spectacular. Our location was close to the beach, close to the shops at Waliea and close to the pools - what more could you want??? I'm not sure how someone could complain about the location, the grounds or the pools. The sunsets from the balconies were awesome as were my sunrise jogs along the path that runs between the resorts. As with Maui, everything is expensive - drinks and food by the pool was fine - expensive but again, you're in Maui. I can't comment on the value of the resort itself as I used Marriot rewards points for our entire stay (I did say I travel a lot, right?). The resort fee is pretty standard today and I guess our timing was perfect as we had no problem with parking like others apparently have. The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful or more friendly including the folks at check-in; the gentlemen who handled our luggage; the wonderful waitresses at the pool along with the lovely lady who serviced our room. Particularly noteworthy was the concierge (Sarah) who bent over backwards helping us plan our time there - and she was spot on. For those golfers reading this - I played the Plantation course at Kapalua and the Gold course at Wailea. Both had million dollar views, were player friendly, was first class and a great time. My only complaint is they're putting in an irrigation system at Kapaula so it wasn't in very good shape. Next time I'll definitely play the Wailea courses as they are on par (no pun intended) with any I've played. Overall, we love the Wailea area. The shops at Wailea were very convenient for shopping or eating, most nights we just walked to dinner. The beaches, grounds and people all met or exceeded our expectations and this will definitely be one of our first options upon returning.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: goddess2230
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon in June 2010 for a week. For a highly rated resort, it was not worth the price. It took us three times to check in and get our room, the first time it wasn't ready. The next try we were put in a ground floor room right outside the pool. When you're on your honeymoon, a little privacy is expected and we didn't appreciate anyone at the pool being able to walk onto our patio. We finally got a room on try #3, but it was nothing extraordinary and somewhat dated. We were given a room upgrade from city to partial ocean view, which seemed like a nice gesture at the time. However, we were redeeming a night of our stay with Marriott points and were charged more points for the room. The staff at the hotel were not the friendliest people by any means and most of them seemed unhappy, which projected when interacting with them.
