They are at a complete disconnect with the people at the Marriott Rewards department so they will both tell you conflicting things until you become irritated and waste your vacation trying to sort it out for a few hours. For a widely known hotel chain, they should get their act together on this. Our biggest complaint overall was feeling nickel and dimed for everything at the hotel. They picture comfy lounge chairs and cabanas near the pools in their promotional pictures, but even though you pay a resort fee of $25 per day plus tax, you still had to pay extra to rent the chairs if you wanted to use them. The regular chairs didn't even have cushions on them by the pools, which is a pretty standard thing. And when ordering a drink at Ruth's Chris is cheaper than the hotel, you know something is wrong. Also, there is no ocean front at the hotel, it is either to the left or to the right of the hotel in front of other hotels/condos. Want a beach chair instead of laying on the sand? Yep, you're paying again to rent it from another hotel. The location is nowhere near markets or restaurants too, so best to rent a car. Overall, its a decent place, nothing spectacular. Certainly not worth the extreme cost of staying there for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Not very special”
Reviews.Author: Chels311
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Marriott for 4 nights during our 6 night stay on Maui for our honeymoon. We stayed at the Inn at Mama's Fish House our first night and were amazed at the value and personalized touches. It was very secluded and the room had everything we needed. We regret not staying their our entire honeymoon. After the Inn at Mama's Fish House, we came to the Wailea Marriott expecting an equivalent experience and we were very disappointed. They have nickeled and dimed us from the moment we stepped onto the resort. In addition, the hotel isn't even on the beach and the pools are sub par. The serenity pool is nice but that gets old after a while. DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU HAVE KIDS! The nicest pool only allows guest 18 and up. The other pools are small and dated. The kids pool is cute but small. We also had a couples message which we spent $400 on, thinking it was a 75 minute message. No... actually it was a 45 minute message with 30 minutes of sitting in a bath tub (which we could have done for free in our room). On top of that, they charged us 20% gratuity and an extra $20 because we upgraded our message oil. We had the choice of choosing the house oils, which all smelled terrible, or spending extra to get a better smelling oil. You would think when you spend $400 on a 45 minute message, everything would be included. Then upon paying for the message, they told us if we wanted to leave additional gratuity, we could do so. I had to laugh at that one! The restaurants were way over priced, the luau was overpriced, internet was not free, even the upgrade for a ocean view room was overpriced. FYI on the luau, if you get premium seating, you will be one of about half the other people attending the luau, don't waste your money. If you want to get ripped off over and over again and feel like you are one of the masses, then i recommend staying at the Wailea Marriott. They are in the business of ripping you off. We will definitely not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Maui no ka oi!”
Reviews.Author: lemoncello
Reviews.Content: When I booked this reservation through Marriott they asked if we were celebrating a special occasion, I said yes it's our 20th anniversary. When we got there they had upgraded us to an ocean view rather than a partial ocean view. Nice! We happened to be there during the Maui Film Festival. Since there's not a lot of night life in Wailea we saw movies under the stars at night and it was beautiful! We had breakfast at Mala everyday and had drinks by the pool a couple of times and the service was great. There's a restaurant called Gannon's on the golf course in Wailea that's amazing! Happy hour at Tommy Bahama's is also really good. If you're looking out at the ocean, the little beach to the right is good for snorkeling in the morning. Go toward the rocks on the right, really pretty coral! We've also stayed at the Fairmont in Wailea and it is very luxurious, we had kids with us so the suite was nice. It's also very expensive compared to the Marriott. We would stay here again but we didn't have kids with us this time. Yippee!

Reviews.Title: “relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Tyjor
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this Marriott for the most part. The scenery was beautiful. Everyday around 2pm it got extremely windy. The hotel staff were very accommodating and friendly. However, I was not impressed with the bar staff working the pool areas. The service was horrible, they rarely came to us so we could place an order, one waitress got a little "snippy" when my husband asked for ice water. She directed him to the towel cabana to get a drink. The food was tasty, but expensive. This side of the island is very quiet, not the place to be if you are looking for a little nightlife. It takes approx. 40 mins to get to the other side, Lahaina, which is great for shopping/eating. If we return, we'll stay on the Lahaina side.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MJWitt
Reviews.Content: My first time to Hawaii period. Loved the nice sized room with king bed and the fantastic view of the ocean from our balcony. Cleaning service always hospitable and thorough. Make sure to get a room where you can see the gorgeous sunsets. Wonderful adult infinity pool as well as others for those that have kiddos. Luau was awesome, great food, but even more so a fantastic performance by all. Location was great to Lahaina, the Maui Ocean Center (a must see) the Heliport and Haleakea Crater plus the shops at Wailea. We had a truly awesome experience. Landscaping, koi ponds, etc. Just can't say enough great things.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sctrojanmo
Reviews.Content: I was so pleased with the Wailea Marriott. This is a very beautiful hotel. The grounds are wonderfully maintained, and everything is gorgeous. The room was spacious, and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The staff was wonderful, and I had a great massage in the Mandara Spa, which is terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but hotel not so great”
Reviews.Author: cakes2212
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just took our first trip to Maui, HI. We decided to stay at the Marriott because of the beautiful pictures & the house hold name. The location is wonderful and the hotel is beautiful. When we first arrive, we were handed a resort activity card that gives you discounts on rentals etc..It is 25.00 dollars a day and you have no choice but to pay for it. We did not use anything on that card, but was required to pay for it. Also, we brought our xbox 360 to watch movies on late at night to relax. We soon realized that we can not get the AV channel to use the xbox because the hotel has blocked it, so you have to buy the movies through the hotel. Our room was in Hale 7 Oceanfront great view!! We noticed that the air in the room would not go below 70, so we called the front desk. They sent a guy up with a device he checked all corners of the room and they all read 70. He said he had like 10 complaints from that section because of the temperature. The ac unit is on the other side of the hotel so by the time it gets to our unit it doesn't put out much. Our choice was to give up our oceanfront room or get a fan. We opted for the fan. If the hotel knows this a problem why not put in another unit on that side of the hotel or install ceiling fans in all the rooms?? I must say for a 4 star hotel we were not impressed with the hotel. I will say the beach was beautiful and the pools. When we go back to Hawaii, we will not being staying at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: SoloGirlTravels
Reviews.Content: I am the type of person that likes to absorb local cultures/peoples when I travel and I'm not too fond of a huge crowd. This hotel was perfect for me! It is located in secluded Wailea, away from the more crowded areas of Maui. The staff was very friendly upon reception and I was lucky to have a room available even though I arrived early. The room was very clean and fresh and overlooked the adult pool which made the area nice and quiet. The grounds wery very clean and beautiful as well. The only real issue I had was in finding my room. I know this sounds silly, but the layout of the hotel seemed "maze- like" to me, with elevators in certain areas only, otherwise I had to maneuver my huge bag up and down stairs. (After getting lost, I decided the stairs would be easier in the long run). I will say the staff did do their best to explain the "maze" to me, and of course offered to help. Other than that, I would recommend this hotel to just about anyone, except for those who like a large croud, because they will be disappointed. It seemed to me like it would be best for couples and romantic getaways and those who enjoy the serenity of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price ($150)”
Reviews.Author: rnguyen22
Reviews.Content: My family stay here for 4 nights and it was a great experience. My boys love the pools and the ground was beautiful. The staff was very nice and friendly. I got this through Priceline for $125 plus $25 for parking. My room was nice, no ocean view but it is still nice. They still have a tube TV in the room but everything else seems to be updated recently. The room could be a tad bigger but for the price it worth. I recommended for this price. They also have a very nice and free exercise facility. We moved to the ResortQuest at the Maui Banyan condo recently and wish I could go back to the Marriot. This condo is ok but nothing compare to Marriot. I am paying $180/night and regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Some great parts”
Reviews.Author: traveler32_2009
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is in a great location and the grounds are beautiful. The bed was sooo comfortable that i slept better then I had in months. LOVED IT! The rest of the room was not so great. The hotel supposedly underwent a multi million dollar reconstruction but I think they skipped the rooms. The TV's are pretty old, who doesnt have flat screens in this day and age? The overall decor of the room was nothing special and there were tons of wires behind the dresser. Like I said, the bed was ultra comfortable, and the grounds were beautiful. Everyone complains about the internet charge but honestly, you are in Maui, sit on a beach, relax, and at least for a couple days put down the computer and cell phone and let yout brain relax! The food was not great. The Grand Wailea next door is good if you like monster hotels that are huge. I did not liek it and am glad I did not stay there...its just too much. There are dozens of swimming pools and lawn chairs that there is like thousands of poeple everywhere. Not my idea of relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Kid friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: MauiMommyof2
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with clean, open grounds, many pool options and a great water park in a pool with attached sandy beach play area for our 3 year old! The beach access is less than a one minute walk, we had read other reviews that said it was as far away as 10 minutes, it's very close and one of the nicest (big wave) beaches for floating in a tube and catching a wave. We had a great meal at the Mala restaurant, a few vegetarian options and lots of organic selection on the menu, even the mini glass bottle of Heinz ketchup was organic. The Jasmine tea is incredible, so fragrant and the "free" desert that comes with your Aloha card (mandatory $25 dollar a day resort fee card) was a decadent chocolate brownie with caramel sauce, so delicious! Even if you don't have room for it after your large meal (big portions) take it back to your room and keep it in your bar fridge. Endless beach and pool towel returns with your towel cards and the rooms themselves have a lot of towels that are replaced daily if you chose. The beds are quite soft, we suspect it is just a mattress topper that makes it so mushy, but with my 7 months pregnant belly, it was a little too soft and caused some back pain on the trip. The grounds are very well maintained, there is a safe in the room that is free, a new full service Starbucks and free pineapple water at the front entrance and one of the pools. They were not very good about allowing us an early check in, my parents were in the room next to ours and had been there a few days and we could see our room was ready and they would not let us check in until 4pm, telling us the room wasn't ready yet. There is parking, it is a hike to your room, but they have "padi wagons" (golf carts) run by staff to help you haul your things up and down, they operate by tip ($5-$10) Overall, a great place to stay. We got an amazing deal ($135 a night on Priceline) We met some people who had booked it as low as $99 on Priceline, our advice, book early! We booked back in January for late May stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: skamikirn
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time staying at this hotel. Last time we stayed in Hale 7. This time in Hale Haleakala - newly remodeled rooms which was great. The bed was so comfortable. Flat screen TV would have been nice. The rooms were so quiet that you couldn't hear showers or people on the other floors. Lobby area open and airy which overlooks the ocean. Shopping center is right across the street which makes it very convenient so no need to drive. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Ariel9073
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May during visit to Maui. Found Wailea beach better than Kanaapali. Won this hotel in priceline bid for less than 140$ (+ resort fee of $25) (garden view) Wonderful infinity pool. View of 3 islands from pool (fantastic) beach is 2 min walk away (infront of waldorf astoria and four seasons) This hotel is the best value on Wailea beach. Book through priceline . Loved our stay. Excellent and highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW, true paradise”
Reviews.Author: mbking99
Reviews.Content: Ok have to say I had read many reviews before I went and have mixed feelings on what to expect. I'm happy to say not only was the hotel fantastic but the staff were very kind, helpful and freindly. Parking is a adventure, do the 20 dollar a day self park not the 25 dollar a day resort pass. The resort pass is north it. Also places to eat around there are exp. Go into town by Costco and eat at this place called Da Kitchen. Very good food for a great place. Also stop by Costco or Walmart and get snacks, water and anything else you can think of. It will be well worth it. The rooms are awesome, the beds are so comfortable. Only draw back was we had somkers all around us. We had to call security. There is no smoking in the rooms or balconys. I can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with a Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: MWorth79
Reviews.Content: After a very long day of travel from the mainland we arrived at this beautiful hotel. The bell staff was very welcoming and held our luggage while we self-parked the car and checked-in. The front desk staff were very friendly and explained everything to us and showed us a map of the grounds to get us situated. The bellman who helped us to our room was very informative, giving us information about the hotel, restaurants, and the Wailea area in general. I was a little concerned from reading other reviews about the mandatory resort fee, however, we were asked if we wanted to add this fee on to the already $20 Self-Parking fee to include some extra perks. The resort fee was only an extra $5 more and we received 2 free drinks at the Kumu Bar & Grill or 2 drinks at Starbucks. Now already that's a savings because 1 Mai Tai at the bar is $11!! So 1 drink equated to 2 days of the resort fee! We also recieved 20% off at the Mala restaruant where we dined twice and had the most wonderful waiter, thanks Kimo! He was awesome. We also received a discount at the Spa and several other perks that we did not use such as a discount on snorkel equiptment rental. There was also a 1 litter bottle of water delievered to our room each day, which was nice because it was very hot! Our room was great, we had an Ocean View, so it was not direct, however there were only a few palm trees in our way, which I think enhanced the view of the ocean and the West Maui mountains. Our Hale (building) was situated between the adults only infinity pool and the two general pools, also where the Kumu Bar & Grill is located. For you beach lovers, the hotel is situated between two beautiful beaches. One on each side of the property, just a short walk. We like to look at the beach and maybe take a walk on it, but I'm not a huge fan of sand, so we mostly stuck with the pools. They were never crowded, you could always get a chair and of course at the pools there was food and drink service. All of the pools were nice, but the adult only infinity pool was beautiful. Wailea seems to be a less crowded in general and a bit less touristy than the Lahaina /Kaanapali Area. We appreciated the more serene feeling we had in this area of the island. Plus the views from the lush hotel grounds were spectacular. We had views of west Maui, the island of Lanai and the crater Molikini, which is a popular snorkel spot. There were many restaurants in the area to choose from and like another reviewer mentioned it is close to Kihei, which has a ton of shopping and restaurants at every price point. Plus, the Mala restaurant at this hotel is wonderful and of course the other resorts just up the beach path have several restaruants to choose from as well. We did use Marriott rewards points for our stay, but did pay for the upgrade to ocean view. We did feel that if we had paid full price for our stay that it would have been well worth the price. Overall, we loved this place and would definitely stay here again when we return to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “just one word ..superb”
Reviews.Author: redbeard01
Reviews.Content: great hotel and location and service, try the adult pool..that is relaxing,,(cabana !!) within walking distance (2-5 min) shopping centre with shops and restaurants if you want to try something else. Has all the facilities. For maui great.. would i recommend it YES

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lhwhizz
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hawaii,but it won't be our last. My wife & I were very happy with our stay at Marriott Waliea.The room was some what dated but big and nice. The pillows were to soft. We had an ocean front room and the view was great. The grounds were clean and very well maintained. The staff was friendly and helpful.Most of the food at the hotel is overpriced. The Shops at Wailea is a five min walk and has several places to eat'. The Whalers General Store has coffee for 1.29 compared to 3.50 at the Marriott. The beach is a five min. walk.I will be happy to stay here again .They charge 20.00 a day for parking.but lots of places are doing that now. The spaces in the parking lot are to small when two cars park next to each other it's hard to get out of your car.So guest end up parking in two spots and sometimes a spot can be hard to find. The Laua at Marriott was good and the food was delicious even the desserts were good. A great place cain't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 451Traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the family during spring break 2009. Hotel was amazing! Staff were always friendly, grounds were beautiful, and the decor was very modern. Pools were excellent for just laying around and relaxing. The hotel had 5 pools! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and grounds, Rooms just okay”
Reviews.Author: Travels57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Wailea for the last 4 nights of our honeymoon. The grounds are beautiful! The pools are fantastic with stellar oceanfront views and infinity edges, the restaurant is nice, the poolside bar with chair service is great. Our only complaint is the rooms. If you are looking for plush or fancy, these are not the rooms for you. We stayed in a Deluxe Oceanfront Room, and while the view was wonderful, the room left much to be desired. The tile floors are cold and hard - carpet would have been nice. The beds are comfortable, but the linens are not soft. The bathroom is tiny!! Hard marble tub/shower combo that is so tall you whack your knees on it each time you get in. The concierge is not the best, either - they seemed bothered by requests for restaurant suggestions. The poolside restaurant/bar staff are great - Terry by the pool is a fantastic waitress!! Food is overpriced, but good. I would say that the hotel is very nice, in a great area, but the rooms are not up to Marriott standards. If you want luxury, you need to stay down the road just a bit at the Grand Wailea. We enjoyed our stay here and loved the pool and grounds, but it would be nice if the rooms were are nice as the rest of the property. I would recommend this hotel, but go into it knowing that the rooms are not the nicest. We did ask to see the "suites" for a possible upgrade, but once we toured them, we realized that it was not worth the extra $$$ because the suites were not much nicer than the regular Deluxe rooms. We had breakfast included in our package - make sure you do this - the buffet is $50 for 2 people if it's not included in your room! Only 2 restaurants on the property - the poolside bar/grill and the MaLa restaurant. Wish there had been more options. The Deluxe oceanfront rooms have the best views - fantastic and close to the beach. Just make sure to ask for a 3rd floor room! Overall, a nice play to stay and we enjoyed our time, but again, we were expecting more from a Marriott in regards to the rooms and bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: lawyerkelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wailea Marriott for 7 nights with our 19-mo toddler. It was fantastic! The Wailea Marriott is prime location - right in the "resorts" area of Wailea. There is a path that from the the hotel that goes for 2 miles, which takes you to other luxurious resorts such as Grand Wailea, Four Seasons, and Fairmont. We made a bid on Priceline and got a pretty good deal. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to ocean front for an additional $75 a night. The Ocean front rooms on the ground floor are optimal with a small baby because you can leave the hotel room through the balcony door (without waking a sleeping baby!) The ocean is literally within walking distance (takes about 1 minute to WALK there). We were located right in front of the luau area, and a short distance to their baby pool. The baby pool is wonderful! Shallow water, with a TON of stimulating activity for your little ones. There is also an "adult" infinity pool - gorgeous views! Even though it's not as glam as the Four Seasons or the Grand Wailea, this hotel is actually the closest you can get to the beach, and in my opinion, the best hotel to stay if you have little ones. There is a lot to do, including fish-feeding, arts and crafts, luau, etc. (The LUAU here was great, btw! Food and entertainment were awesome). The food here is a bit pricey, but expected for an all-inclusive resort. We ended up eating a lot at the Shops at Wailea (again, walking distance). The Tommy Bahamas Cafe there has the BEST food and great happy hour drinks. There is a Hertz on-site - great for rentals for trips to Lahaina and the Aquarium, etc. Oh one thing - the Wi-Fi sucks here, so just leave your laptop at home. Enjoy your vacation! We had a wonderful stay here, and would definitely stay here again! Baby loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Home Base While in Maui”
Reviews.Author: limajt91279
Reviews.Content: The Wailea Beach Marriott Resort & Spa was a comfortable home for four nights in April but the icing on the cake was one staffer who made relaxing at the serenity pool heavenly â€“ Ms. Anita. Anita joked and smiled each time she delivered some of the best lava flows I have ever had in my life. I miss you Anita! The Wailea Beach Marriot Resort & Spa is located next door to the Shops at Wailea and a few other high-end resorts. Upon arrival, we werenâ€™t warmly greeted by the bellhops who seemed determined to get us out the way but we brushed aside their attitudes and checked in semi-smoothly. The hotel upgraded us to a junior suite after some coaxing and thank goodness because our new room was in the tower and we had a great view of Molokini (dive spot) from our balcony. The suite was spacious and had a little refrigerator for us to cool our drinks and food. The grounds of the hotel are really nice. The faÃ§ade of the hotel is a bit dated but the interior rooms have been updated nicely. I thoroughly enjoyed the serenity pool and the two waterslides on the property. I always found a lounge chair to relax and enjoy a drink. Room service was prompt and the food was delicious. My only issue with this hotel is some of the staff was not that friendly. The hotel is located in great part of Maui and was accessible to all the major attractions. I would definitely stay at Wailea Beach Marriot again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - This place is spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: phrogfrau
Reviews.Content: I could not be happier with our stay at the Marriott. This location is simply perfect - better than the website describes. The hotel is situated on rocky coral reefs, right between two world class beaches, which are both a VERY short walk away. Some people have complained about the distance, but seriously, it is like 1 minute of walking - I did it barefoot every time! The hotel is right on the water too - you get better waterfront access than the other higher-priced hotels in the same area. Seriously - the lounge chairs are set up right on the absolute EDGE! It doesn't get closer than that- not at the Ritz, not at the Four Seasons. The snorkeling is outstanding - I saw plenty of fish, coral sponges and even turtles every time I went, right off the hotel. There is a shopping mall right next door, again, a VERY short walk away. We have a 9 month old baby, so we got a suite, and that was a life-saver, because we could put him to bed, then still be up and eat dinner and talk and stuff in the other room. The views are stunning - we opted to have room service on the balcony every night (we couldn't go out anyway with a sleeping baby). Our room was beautiful - understated designs and a comfortable big bed, flat screen TV, which we hardly turned on, and very nice sheets and towels. Nice big bathroom with a marble tub and separate shower, and an extra half bath. For the money, this hotel is definitely a gem! But, if you are hell-bent on paying 3 times as much for the same beaches and views, and less waterfront access, to get nicer soap in your shower, stay at one of the other hotels in the area. And you are going to have to (God forbid) WALK to the beach at those hotels too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: the_proms
Reviews.Content: We just got back this weekend from Maui! We always stay in Kaanapali, so this was new for us. A GREAT new! Wailea is very calm and relaxing with not much to do, which is what we love. Check in was fast and easy. When we pulled up, we were mauled by bell boys, who were either very friendly and helpful, or all wanting tips, not too sure. Either way, nice. Our room was in the tower to the right, Haleakale, floor 3. We won our stay on priceline, so we weren't surprised to have a view to the back of the hotel where deliveries are done and staff goes to work through there. If you leaned, you could see the ocean, and definently hear it. If this is the worst set of rooms, there aren't any bad rooms! The room itself was pretty spacious, king bed and sleeper couch. Loved that the toilet and shower were separate from the vanity, which had drawers! So nice to kinda feel at home, putting stuff away. Stock up your fridge from Costco and Walmart by the airport and save BIG BUCKS! And the beds...if I could pack that up and bring it home! Wow...you will sleep well. The facility was very nice. All open air, friendly, friendly staff who always say hello and good morning and go out of their way to let you step by, use the elevator. We even had a few ask if it was okay if they rode with us on the elevator! It is VERY spread out, so you'll get your walking done for the day! The pools are amazing. We would play at the beach in the morning, then go to the lower pool for awhile, then to the kid area. The lower pool, which has a lip around the outer ledge of the pool that my 5 year old loved to walk around on, has a serenity pool side, and 2 hot tubs. The upper pool is deeper, and a plain normal pool. The adult only pool is amazing looking, but being we have 2 young kids, didn't get to use that. We did, however, walk through to get to the kid area, only to get scowls and glares from the other guests because we had our very well mannered/quiet children with us to walk through...we are paying guests too. Get real. The kid's area was AMAZING! It kept our kids busy for hours each day! The sand/rocks aren't too hard on the feet, as I've previously read. The kids have fun rolling on the 'beach' and then jumping in the water. There is a hot tub there also. And then the 3 slides which were actually VERY fun. And above the kid's area is yet ANOTHER kind of forgotten pool that not many use - it is also a deep pool, just for swimming. And I will tell you, there will never ever be a shortage of pool chairs at all of these pools. The kid's area has the least of chairs offered, so you may not get one there, but you could with the upper area, and still use the kid's area. This hotel is not beach accessible, but to the right, you can walk, 2 minutes to the beach. To the left, Grand Wailea Hotel, is a 5 minute walk to the beach. The right beach has crabs, which didn't bother us, but they are there, and harmless. The other beach, to the left is pretty packed during the day. An amazing place to eat is Mixed Plate next to the Old Lahaina Luau - whole plates of food for $7! Great, honest, original Hawaiian food...yum! We never ate at the hotel, so no comments there. The smoothies are pretty good, $8, but good. We will stay here again if we can win on priceline...loved it and cannot praise it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, service and facilities--the best place to stay on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: buddysophia
Reviews.Content: We usually stay on the west side of Maui but used our Marriott Rewards to stay at the Marriott Wailea. We stayed in an ocean front hotel for 8 days. It was perfectly located with the waves crashing against the volcanic rocks just outside our lanai. We travel frequently for business and pleasure and frequently stay in five star hotels. We had done much research on where to stay on Maui, and we made the right decision staying here! The Marriott Wailea is a series of primarily low-rise buildings situatied closed to the ocean. The infinity pool is wonderful, and the chairs and hammocks spread out along the ocean front make for perfect lounging. The gym was adequate for a Maui resort with cardio equipment, machines and free weights. The Starbucks being built next to the gym will be a welcome addition. The hotel is conveniently located across from the Shops at Wailea with a wide range of boutiques, restaurants and a place for groceries and sundries. Our favorite aspect of the Marriott Wailea was the hotel restaurant, Mala. We did the breakfast buffet most morning, and while delicious, Mala always surprised with amazing dinners. The restaurant manager, Mary Anne, was absolutely fantastic--always attentive to all of the tables, surprising guests with special treats from the chef, and incredibly knowledgable about the impressive wine selection. We ate two dinners elsewhere at more expensive resorts nearby, butthe food at Mala was far superior! Mary Anne has created something special in the restaurant, and anyone visiting Maui should definitely check it out. We will be back later in the year, and we'll definitely be staying at the Marriott Wailea again! The room was well appointede

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, lot's to do”
Reviews.Author: NEProp
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for my wife, two daughters (ages 9 and 11) and myself through Marriott rewards points and paid for the upgrade to a ocean view suite. We stayed for 8 nights April, 2010. I have been to Wailea before and I think it combines the best of all elements - nice beaches, shops if you want them, easy access to Kihei for groceries, restaurants, shops etc. Some of the other reviews seem to have overly petty criticisms. The Shops At Wailea next door is a very nice mall with high end boutiques, to trendy t-shirt shops, to a good general store where you can buy sandwiches and drinks. I don't know why people complain about it, as it's a benefit to have it within 2 minutes walking distance from the hotel. The hotel itself is very large and as Marriott's go it is one of the nicest ones that I have ever stayed at (I travel extensively on a global basis). If you are looking for over-the-top service then you should stay at a Ritz or Four Seasons, but if you are looking for a world-class resort with plenty of pools (5 of them) and a great kids pool area with two really good water slides, then this is a great choice. The views from the resort out over the ocean are remarkable at any time of day or night. The two beaches, one to the left and one to the right, are very nice and the walk from the hotel to either of them is 2 minutes, whereas the walk from the Four Seasons or Grand Wailea (next door) is about the same as these properties are set back from the ocean anyhow. The spa and gym are both very good by hotel standards. Parking is $20 per day, but I consider this reasonable given that you are going to pay to park directly or indirectly and for those that feel that they are being nickel and dimed, then you are probably over your budget or you should go for it and use priceline.com and feel good about whatever you score. My kids had plenty to do - swiming in the pools, on the water slides constantly, in the ocean, necklace and lei making classes etc. For grown ups if you want to bring you own sandwiches and cocktails then you can go next door to the Shops at Wailea and buy what you want and bring it poolside and avoid the pricey menu / drink list. Lastly the weather in Wailea is usually good and we have had every day be just top notch. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: mrsjdm
Reviews.Content: I visit Hawaii 2~3 times a year and usually stay in Kaanapali area. But this time, we decided to stay in Wailea and Marriott seemed reasonable so we picked this hotel. It is definately more quiet than any hotels in Kaanapali area (less kids around). In the bathroom, shower and tub were not separated. (I like the one it's separated.) That was the only downfall for me. Otherwise, room was clean and comfortable. Flooring was nice, too. Location is very good in Wailea - right by the mall. Compare to other luxuary hotels in Wailea, I think price is okay and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Serene”
Reviews.Author: joycefnp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a medical conference for nine nights. The rooms are large with minimal decor. The beds are very comfortable. I was impressed before we got there because the concierge emailed and asked if I wanted extra towels, pillows or hangers. The pllows were waiting for us, although we had to call for the towels in the end. They also asked if we wanted a high floor. We were in an oceanview room in Hale 4. I highly recommend upgrading to ocean view and asking for this building, especially if you don't have kids with you. It overlooks the adult pool and the ocean and the view is spectacular. We watched whales and sunsets from our lanai. The only thing we didn't like about the room is that it was a handicap room, and the shower was very low and handheld. My sister is tall, and had some difficulty with it. The adult pool is wonderful. We did cancell our floating cabana reservation after sitting on the lounges,they're really hard. The egg shaped lounges are very comfortable and hold 2 people, and only cost $25 per day. The pool staff does a pretty good job of enforcing the adults only rule. It amazed me how many people would stop to read the rules, then still try to settle in with toddlers and infants. There is a really nice pool for younger children on the property, so there is no excuse. There isn't a hot tub at the adult pool, but there are 2 at the main pool. The pool service is good, and staff really friendly. There are a lot of charges such as resort fees. The fee includes parking, so there isn't a separate fee for that. Parking does get a little tight when the hotel is full. But if the self park is full, the valets just let you park yourself in the valet area for no charge. Be aware that the hotel charges a daily $3 fee for housekeeping gratuity. We always leave money every day for the cleaning staff, so this was unexpected. I called to ask about it, and the front desk staff offered to take it off the bill. There is also an automatic porter fee, so use them. We didn't know and the porter actually tried to turn down our tip. One negative is that not all the buildings have elevator service to the uppermost floors. There is an elevator in Hale 4 and in the newer taller tower. If you don't want to walk steps all the time, let the concierge know that you need elevator access. Getting to the beaches was easy. There is good snorkeling at either end. There is a little coffee place on the Grand Wailea end with good coffee,smoothies and breakfast sandwiches. There are some really attractive home decor items in the gift shop. Other posters have compared the Marriott negatively to the Grand Wailea. I was so glad we weren't staying there. Both hotels were full for spring break, and when I walked by the Grand Wailea many mornings at 6 am, there were people already lined up to get a beach chair when they pools opened at 7:30. Waiting 1 1/2 hours for a pool chair isn't my idea of a relaxing vacation. Everytime I walked by the Grand Wailea it was chaos!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Great rooms. Good area.”
Reviews.Author: Kairbear
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby area is open air giving you the feeling of the islands right away. Expansive grounds - nice evening walk is a loop through the pools and back down along the ocean front. Resort is "ocean front." Not beach front. So if you're looking for light sand beaches to dig your toes into and warm Pacific waters - you do have to walk away from the resort. It's a short walk in either direction to small beach areas. There's a paved path to get you there. Infinity pool was nice. As we were two adults traveling - we really enjoyed having an "adult's only" pool area. Lots of seating each time we were there. And the sunsets from the pool areas - beautiful. Take your camera to the pool at sunset. Room had tile floor which was cool - maybe too cold for some. Nice shower area with seperate soaking tub. We had a non-ocean view room and were asked if we wanted an upgrade upon checking in. We declined and was suprised to see the beautiful gardens outside our room. And we still had a "peak-a-view" glimps of the ocean. Resort is short walk to shopping area. Cheeseburger in Paradise has a great Happy Hour and good breakfast. Live music Thursday -Sunday. Try the LocoMoco- my husband LOVES this dish. Also Ruth Chris's in there for a nice early dinner. Great prices if you go early - plan ahead they are fabulous. The downfall of the resort is that is felt isolated. We like to walk away from our resorts and explore the town. This area is really spread out and would require a lot of walking for not much exploration. We drove to Kihei and walked around that area. And also drove to Lahaina to walk around. And parking is not free -you pay $20 -$25 per day for it. Some nights it was difficult to find a spot. If it's busy when you go -spring for vallet. They had a lot of spaces available to them. You will need a car if you want to really see the island.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller, but with some advantages”
Reviews.Author: donnamcd
Reviews.Content: We travelled with a group, and most of the others stayed at the Grand Wailea. This hotel is definitely older, smaller, and way less impressive than anything at the Grand. Bathrooms were standard hotel-type, and so were the rooms. The beach is a 5 minute walk away. Shopping and dining options are very limited, and there are only 3 pools that we could see: an adults only, a kids pool, and another all-purpose pool that was your standard rectangular pool with deck chairs around it - no attempt to fancy it up. HOWEVER, while the Grand is a visual feast, with waterfalls, a lobby to die for, and pools and grounds that should be featured in a magazine, the rest of our group who stayed there had to get up at 7:00 to reserve a deck chair, and waited in line for breakfast for 45 minutes. We did not have those issues at the Marriott. Check the prices at each of the hotels, and you'll see a significant difference. There is a reason for that. You get less of the "wow" factor at the Marriott, but being able to get breakfast quickly, and being able to go down to the pool at a civilized hour and find a chair were big advantages.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon @ the Wailea Beach Marriott”
Reviews.Author: pukeycow
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice modern resort. Like some people have mentioned, the signages around the grounds wasn't so clear so it we did take a few wrong turns trying to find the lobby from the room. Parking sometimes was a pain, the lot would get full and we'd have to park in an auxiliary lot but the staff was great and they golf carted us back to our room. Infinity pool was nice but you have to rent the cabanas. No free wifi. Overall it was a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wailea Marriott - Would Definitely Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Whalewatcher-Jan
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend the resort to others. The Marriott is smaller than some of the other Wailea resorts and never felt crowded. You're a quick walk away from the restaurants and shopping at the Shops at Wailea as well as the other resorts in the area. Like all the other resorts, there's a daily 'resort fee' - the Marriott's is $25/day and covers your parking and a liter of bottled water in your room each day. Not sure why they don't all just roll it into the room rate and be done with it, but that's the way they all seem to do it. Room: We had an oceanfront room (7302) that looked out over the lawn between two other 'wings' of the buildings. Because of the location, it was very quiet and we had a wonderful view of the ocean both from our lanai and in the room. If you had kids, the kids pool was just outside our building, but on the other side so it would be convenient without getting all the noise. The room itself was very nice. It may sound a little odd, but one of my favorite things was the bathroom vanity. Like in many hotels, the toilet and bathtub were in a separate room and the vanity itself was basically in the hotel room. But the way the room was set up, the bathroom and closet were inbetween the beds and the vanity area so it was like having a dressing area that gave a little more privacy. But the absolute BEST thing was that the vanity was a freestanding piece of furniture and had two deep drawers - one on either side of the sink. For 2 women traveling together, it was great for each of us to have a space to stash all of our toiletries, cosmetics, etc. instead of having everything all over the countertop. Pool: The infinity pool (for adults only) was fabulous. All of the lounge chairs face the ocean and you look out over the edge of the pool which just seems to run into the ocean and listen to the sound of the waves. We were always able to get a chair no matter when we went to the pool. There's an oceanfront path that we walked on in the morning and when we'd go past the Grand Wailea at 7am, it seemed like 90% of the chairs already had towels on them with people staking out their chairs. At the Marriott, if there are towels on a chair but no one's been there for 30 minutes or more and someone is looking for a chair, the staff will remove the towels and tell you to take the chair. Marriott Restaurant - Mala: We had sandwiches and snacks poolside several times from the Kula Grill, but only ate at the hotel restaurant the first night I got there - not because of any issue with the food but because there are too many other restaurants in the area to try. Unless your room rate includes breakfast, you're not going to want to eat at the hotel restaurant for breakfast - you'll be looking at $20+ per person. There was a restaurant over in the Shops at Wailea that's only a 5 minute walk away (might have been Cheeseburger in Paradise) that had a reasonable priced breakfast (around $6 or $7), but we just bought cereal, milk, bagels and cream cheese and ate breakfast out on our lanai each morning (there's a small refrigerator in the room). Parking: There is self-parking available in a parking garage (the daily rate of $20 is included in your resort fee). In other reviews of various hotels I saw that a number of people commented on how small parking spaces were ... they're not kidding. The spaces are really narrow and as a result, if one person doesn't park perfectly, you end up with spots that can't be used. One day we went to our car to find someone had parked so close to us that I couldn't get in the driver's side door - I had to get in on the passenger side and climb over the center console to get behind the wheel! A few nights we got back later in the evening to find the structure was full - they then allow you to park in the area normally reserved for valet parking (valet parking is available for an additional $25/day). Spa: They have a spa on the property - rather pricey, but in line with spas at other resorts in the area. Could probably find bettter prices in Kihei or Lahaina. They were offering a discounted price for a massage and facial that we took advantage of. Had an amazing massage with Mike - wasn't as impressed with the facial I had (can't remember her name). Other restaurants: We had several great dinners while we were there: Tommy Bahama's (at the Shops in Wailea), Joe's (next to the Wailea tennis courts), Hali'imaile General Store (off Haleakala Highway on the way to Makawao), Humuhumunukunukuapua'a (at the Grand Wailea), and Capishe? (at the Hotel Wailea). If you're up on the north shore near Paia, I'd highly recommend stopping at Flatbread for either lunch or dinner. As usual, the trip was over entirely too soon - can't wait for the next trip back! Jan

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: newyorker88
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a very nice stay at the Marriott. It's probably not the newest resort, but they have clearly spend lots of money renovating it recently. The rooms were perfectly fine. They are sparse and modern, but have everything you need. Don't worry about the tile floors...they are necessary because people track in so much sand. Rooms are great and beds comfortable. Lobby area is stunning. Pros: great location, good rooms, uncrowded, some nice pools. Cons: Resort charge to park; no real sand beach on property, but next store is a GREAT sand beach; older than some other resorts, but renovated. Bottom line: If you can get a decent deal on this property, you will have a nice time. If you are a big spender and want the best, go to the Grand Wailea next door.

Reviews.Title: “Best trip to hawaii-Our eighth”
Reviews.Author: Opcal
Reviews.Content: This was our 8th trip to the Hawaiin Islands, yet it was our best. The Marriott was perfectly located for snorkeling, boogie-boarding, fishing, shopping and enjoying a great meal. The staff is exceptional. Nuna serviced our room everyday and truly embodied the Aloha spirit. We had big hugs with her when we left. Such a warm gentle spirit! We enjoyed so many excursions (bike down Haleakala with Cruiser Bobs, Sail to Lana'i with Safari Boat excursions, Goofy Foot Surf lessons for our two 17 year old, fishing & boogie boarding on Big Beach & on the resort, Ahi Tuna Tacos at Big Beach BBQ, hiking the bamboo forest, Road to Hana, Mamas Fish House) AWESOME! Great property. Exceptional staff. Made our trip!!!! Even room service. YUM!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: ADJS
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay - close to several great quanit beaches, waterfront walk. Pools on site are great - not overly crowded - I especially liked the serenity pool for adults only - staff was so friendly. The resort fee is $25 a day - that was unexpected but we soon learned that most hotels have this. We got upgraded to an oceanview king room and it was spacious and had a big lanai - great for watching sunsets. We were in the tower building. It was everything we expected and more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, close to the ocean”
Reviews.Author: SFOF/A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Wailea for 5 nights in March. We usually stay in Kaanapali, this time we decided to stay in Wailea because of a wedding. It took us a day to get used to the absolute quiet of this side of the island. Now we aren't sure we want to return to Kaanapali! We checked in early and were assigned a tower room above the lobby. The room was spacious and clean, however, no view and very loud with arriving guests. I asked politely if we could be moved to a more quiet area. Fortunately, they had a room that would be available in a couple of hours that was very far from the lobby. This was what we were looking for! Being far away from the lobby and parking lot was perfect for us. A bellman drove us to our room in a golf cart. Pointing out various sites along the way. The childrens pool was teaming with children, it was spring break for some. We ended up in a far away "hale", a building 2-3 stories high, near the adults only infinity pool. Our room looked out on the resort grassy lawn, the trees, and the ocean. We had a room on the ground floor with a nice lanai, with 2 chairs and a table, where we had coffee every morning. There is a coffee maker in the room. 4 packets of coffee are restocked daily. There is also a mini refridgerator where you can store fruit, water, milk, wine, beer, etc. Right behind the Marriott is a mall, where you can buy what you need for drinks and snacks. There are also many high end shops located there, as well as a few dining options. There is a path along the water's edge, we went walking every morning. You will see all kinds of people doing this, serious joggers, sightseers, people pushing baby strollers and folks like us, going for a brisk morning walk. The path is about 2 miles along the beach. This is one of the most relaxing vacations we had. Although we were in Wailea for a wedding, we had a few days to sit by the waters edge, read a book, take a nap, or look through our binoculars for whales spouting off in the distance. We saw large sea turtle grazing on the lava rocks right in front of us. There are 2 beaches on both sides of the hotel, none right in front. It is very close to walk to either of these beaches. We preferred the grassy lawn outside our room. The sunsets are spectacular. There is a $20 daily fee for self parking your car in a small parking lot, with even smaller parking spaces! Watch out if you rent a large car, or better yet, have the valet park it for you, they have larger spaces! Internet connection in the room is around $15 per 24 hours. We used it twice. I would return to this hotel in a minute. The rooms are clean, the beds comfortable, the setting amazing. Since it is an older hotel, it is one of the closest ones to the waters edge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful first visit to Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: PeggyPMequon_WI
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is a great hotel close to the ocean. We used Marriott points for our stay and paid an extra $175 a night for the ocean view upgrade. We loved our room location in the Haleakala Tower (room 508) right near the lobby. Tile floors- no carpetting. Low beds, almost too soft. Our view was over the next door condos and nearby beach. (see photos) Nice room set up with storage in the vanity area so you don't have to leave stuff piled next to the sink. We could not see the sunset from our room, but enjoyed them from the hotel bar/restaurant. They have 4 pools to choose from, 3 adult and 1 kid pool with slides, etc. We spent early morning in the sun and went sightseeing the rest of the day, so it was never crowded. You may want to keep your towel from the day before and put it on a chair with a book to reserve it early the following am. There were always empty chairs available when we were there. The beach is adjacent to the property with a reef if you like to snorkel. If you like to walk, there is a terrific public ocean walkway in front of all the resorts that is almost 2 miles long. It sometimes gets a bit busy mid morning, You may want to bring a flashlight at night. We ate at the main restaurant several times and was never disappointed. They serve a great Kobe Burger, that is really reasonable. My husband loved the lamb. There are 4 great restaurants in the Shops of Wailea- a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Hamburgers in Paradise serves a great $5.99 breakfast! There is also a General Store in the shops with a Deli, soda, etc. but expensive. Even has a Red Box DVD rental. If you have a car it is worth the trip to the Safeway, less than a 10 min. drive off the main highway and Pi'Ikea road. There are empty refrigerators you can use in every room. We brought our Garmin GPS with us and used it a lot! We were also glad we rented a smaller SUV because the parking spaces were so small. If you want a lei- sign up for the free lei-making class right when you check in. It fills up fast. This was a perfect location and always sunny even with rain in the forecast. You can take boat trips out of Ma'alaea Harbor. We recommend the catamaran " Alii Nui" for a snorkel or sunset cruise. Book it yourself and save the concierge extra fee. This is more expensive than the Eco tours but it is a much newer boat and you don't have to stay in your seat. Compare boats online. We actually spent the first 5 days here and the next 5 days at the Grand Wailea right down the road. That resort was huge and more plush but not that much more enjoyable for us since we are older and came without any kids.

Reviews.Title: “OLD OLD OLD”
Reviews.Author: dolcean
Reviews.Content: The property is quite old and it shows in almost every regard. The rooms are very outdated with no tropical or resort feel. It almost feels like a hospital room. The White tile floors are the kicker. White tile floors,offwhite walls, and white bedding. Well you get the picture. The elevators are cramped, outdated, and very old. And if you are a Platinum member of Marriott, don't expect any recognition whatsover of your status. Absolutley nothing offerred, not a better view, fitness center, internet, parking, or even the standard we thank you for your loyalty. As a member with over 100 nights a year continiously, and having stayed at almost all Marriott resorts of which I am usuallly quite delighted, this one truly ranks near the bottom. I love Marriott , but dont see myself ever coming back here. If you cant get in at the Ocean Club your better of going to the big island or trying to go to Ko Olina near HNL. It is sad that Marriott has completley abandonded Maui as a resort location unless you own a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Great Homebase to Explore Maui”
Reviews.Author: vpfreedude
Reviews.Content: My wife, 3 year old and I just returned from a week long stay at the Marriott Wailea. I have to agree with most posts here - location & grounds are beautiful, kiddie pool was a huge hit with my daughter, and MALA was good food although I found $18 for bacon & eggs pricey. I too would have preferred the $25/day resort fee to be included but we knew it was coming so weren't that upset about it. Again I find having to pay for internet access in hotels in this day & age a bit of a shocker so I didn't bother doing it. Overall the rooms were very clean, spacious and quite likely the most comfy I've had in a hotel in years. We overlooked the adult only infinity pool with an ocean view room. It was quite and the view was nice. I didn't spend much time at the adult pool but the one afternoon I did was very good. Can't complain about the waitress service and the 2 Corona's for $12.50. You have to pay about $100/day for the " floating cabana" and you also have to rent the padded day beds but i'm not sure the costs. I would disagee with most posters of the expenses & nickle & diming. Other than breakfast, I found the drinks and dinners were no more than what I have to pay living in Calgary. The other thing to keep in mind is this is a "high end" resort in the ritziest area of the island - they charge for services accordingly as most hotels do. Staff was friendly & very efficient in a hotel of almost 600 rooms. They weren't intrusive but when we asked for help they were exceptional. The only real negative I see with this property is you have to walk to another hotel or condo complex on either side of the Marriott to get to a beach but the walk is only 5-10 minutes with a toddler - less if I was on my own. I would highly recommend this hotel but definately not to travelers who are on a tight budget as you will spend quite a bit extra by being here and litterally beside the Shops at Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: MM055
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to the island of Maui. Wailea is our favorite area to stay in Maui because of the better chance of sunshine when other parts of the island are getting rain. The scenery is breathtaking and there is plenty to do without ever leaving Wailea if you are so-inclined. (However, the whole island is worth seeing at least once.) We used to stay at the Renaissance, but since it is now closed we had to look elsewhere. We always enjoy Marriott hotels, so this time we tried Wailea Beach Marriott Resort and Spa and were NOT disappointed! We had always been hesitant to stay there because it did not have a beach fronting the property, but we found out that it was no big deal to walk a block or two in either direction for some fantastic beaches! (We also like to visit Big Beach, which is only about a mile's drive south of Wailea.) The pools were fabulous, especially the new infinity pool. We enjoyed walking up to the edge of it and watching for whales out in the ocean! The location for us was perfect. We could walk to the Shops at Wailea (just behind this hotel) and eat and shop to our heart's content. Also, the Maalea Harbor is close-by to catch a boat for snorkeling or whale-watching. Marriott always has excellent service, in our opinion, and this hotel was no exception. The added $25. resort fee was reasonable, we thought, to cover parking, bottled water, a couple of Mai Tais, and some discounts in the restaurant. I would definetly recommend staying here if you visit Maui. We plan to return, hopefully, soon! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: pushin60Dallas
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is closer to the ocean than any other hotel in Wailea. It used to be an Outrigger and was built prior to restrictions on proximity to the "beach." Some rooms are within 60 feet of the ocean. There is no beach here, but there are two on either side within a 5 minute walk along the ocean walkway that links all the Wailea resorts. Rooms are very nice and housekeeping is excellent. The best feature we found is the infinity pool. Just veg out there all day. No children under 18 are allowed --- they have there own pools. Anita or Susan (your're gonna get a hug) will start coming by at 10:30 for drink orders and they will also bring you lunch from the nearby Kumu grill. You can rent a cabana (they have 6) for a full ($100) or half day. These desparately need new THICKER cushiors for their wooden recliners which become very hard on the backside after only a short time. If you don't do the cabana there are many regular chairs, some with umbrella shade, that are first come first serve. These are spoken for by about 9:30. Additionally there are several lounges-for-two for $25. Get the resort pass which gets you free self parking, bottled water, and some discounts (although you don't come here to save money). Finding the place can be a little tricky to the new visitor. Take the 31 highway all the way down to Wailea until it ends at a right 90 degree bend. Go all the way down to the left-or-right traffic light. Go right but don't turn at the first chance. That's the Wailea shops. The next left is Marriott and the sign doesn't jump out at you. The hotel restaurant is very good, and there are many good places to eat in the area. Our favorites were Nick's at the Fairmont and Gannon's (formerly SeaWatch) on the gold golf course. A Starbuck's is coming to the hotel proper, but there is a little ocean walk shack that does some Starbuck's basics on the south end of the property. It's a hike for most island activities. Most of them originate out of Lahaina or Kaanapali area on the upper west side. Lahaina traffic is a nightmare and will take you an hour from the Marriott to get through to Kaanapali. If your tour runs out of Kaanapali park in the Whalers Village facility off Kaanapali Parkway and get your ticket validated at any shop or restaurant (Hula Girl is good). The Marriott is not the biggest or newest resort in Wailea, but neither did it seem as congested. There are families but the no-kids couples won't be disturbed in most cases. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “stunning location with beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: srvAlaska
Reviews.Content: watched whales spout from our bed. Infinity pool rocked. rooms were sweet with balcony above pool. dinners in Kihei were amazing (sushi at Sansei, Indian by the Sea, Greek place in Kihei). short walk along bike path to small beaches. rent a vehicle and explore maui.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money if you have to pay more than $150/night”
Reviews.Author: mardnise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our very first visit to Hawaii. We can both honestly say that our trip to Hawaii was wonderful, except for our hotel stay. We booked through Priceline and ended up getting this place for over $200/night. We found out later it was probably due to the fact that there were a couple weddings and a big conference going on that weekend. We checked in a little before 3pm and it took forever to even find our room! The whole design of the different Hales in this place is so crazy that we had to ask several different people how to find ou room. It just didn't make sense, but after about 10 minutes of walking up and down stairs, rolling our luggage everywhere, we finally found it. I had called to request a king bed but we find out that not only did they give us two queen beds but they gave us a handicapped room! That means it's a low shower head and my 6'2 husband literally had to get on his knees to wash his hair every morning. We asked the front desk for a king bed and they said they were totally booked up and could put us on a waiting list. We checked in before the standard check-in time! Did they not have any available king beds for anyone who checked in that day? Also, our TV wasn't even working properly. Sure, we don't go to Hawaii to watch TV but at night, we did watch TV only to find out that every 15 minutes, the station would automatically switch to their menu of Pay-Per-View movies available for purchase. Sooooo annoying... It's disappointing that after paying so much at this place, the Wailea Marriott doesn't even have their own beach! We had to walk to the Grand Wailea, where we were told that we couldn't have any chairs and to rent an umbrella it would be $20. We just hung out at the pool back at the Marriott intsead. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants on site because after spending $51 for some greasy nachos, a basket of sweet potato fries and two alcoholic drinks (which were so weak, that they might as well have been $11 smoothies) at the pool, we were done eating at the Marriott. The service at this place was not up to par with a resort. My husband asked the "pool concierge" if they rented goggles and he was answered with a short "no". You would think the "pool concierge" would've been able to direct my husband to a place he could've rented goggles. That's not going above and beyond. The waitress at the Infinity Pool was very nice and friendly but the Front Desk was borderline annoying. Whenever I called to ask something, they asked for my room number, looked it up in their system and always started with "oh, you're Priceline. Hold on". We were treated like second class people because we booked our hotel through Priceline. You would think they'd treat us all the same since we're STILL a paying customer and I'm sure they're making major profit off each guest! We used the spa just for the steam room and I was disappointed to find that they didn't even have a sauna or some whirlpools! Luckily we were able to bypass the $25/night resort fee, since they asked us at check-in, but we ended up paying the $15/night fee for self-parking anyways. What a rip! It's definitely true what other reviewers have said when they talked about this place "nickel-and-diming" you, because the Wailea Marriott definitely delivers on that part.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: Mommy-who-loves-Maui
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here, the room was perfect and I think I could have thrown a rock off my lanai into the ocean. We were upgraded from an oceanfront room to a deluxe oceanfront room upon arrival(I'm guessing because we were using Marriott Platinum Points.) Not sure what the difference was, but our view was great. We were able to watch the Luau from our Lanai and saw many whales from there was well. The staff was very nice. The beaches are a very short walk, I think it would take much longer to get to the beach if staying in Grand Wailea as it is so big and farther from ocean than it would take to get to the beach from the Marriott. The pools were great and even used the kiddy waterslides. :)

Reviews.Title: “best honeymoon spot ever!”
Reviews.Author: stina785
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel very convenient and accommodating. The front desk staff was awesome and always had a suggestion for somewhere to visit and dine. The rooms were spectacular and had to die for open floor plans. The pool design was very unique and made you feel like you were swimming in the ocean; although if you did want to swim in the ocean it was only a SHORT walk to the beach. There are a ton of shopping plazas and plenty of restaurants close by for your enjoyment. It is a great place for families and couples; we can wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A bit expensive but nothing wrong with the place”
Reviews.Author: CHATBoston
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night in route to other places. No issues and would go back. The grounds are beautiful and the fact there is no beach isn't a big issue as you can walk a few hundred yeards to the left and there is a great beach. All the beaches in Wailea are public and are not controlled by the hotels so you can go in front of any hotel including the Four Seasons. I would recommend the hotel but advise a friend to be cautious on the restaurants as the quality wasn't on par with a $350 room. Make sure you add the $25per day "resort fee" to your cost considerations as this seems to get added to every bill.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful what you bid for”
Reviews.Author: ReeKeRikardo
Reviews.Content: We were trying to bid for a 4 star on Priceline and wound up with the Marriott a â€œresort levelâ€� The room was Marriott quality with a view of the loading dock and the wonderful backup noises starting at 7am. The room would not cool down and the Internet did not work, wired or wireless. Of course no other rooms were available. The staff was rude, the scripted lines were pretty unconvincing as they were delivered with such disregard. $25 resort fee includes parking $13.95 for internet that didnâ€™t work. Checked in the next day at the 4 star down the road, paid a bit more with parking and Internet included but were treated much better with an ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Fairmont or the Hyatt!! Cockroaches! Low-end feel, high-end pricing!”
Reviews.Author: familyfunseeker
Reviews.Content: Stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani or Hyatt instead! The Fairmont had better service, gorgeous suites, housekeeping at the Fairmont moved furniture to vacuum & twice thanked us for their tips, the ambience is luxurious/ welcoming, CLEAN, hospitable, the buffet was terrific value! But the nicest beach for swimming & strolling is still Kaanaapali beach where we stayed on a prior visit. Letters/e-mails to the GM of the Wailea Marriott for which no reply was ever received during our stay (got a call from a Front Desk Manager 2 days AFTER checkout!): Dear Mr. Countryman/ Mr. Kenui & Ms. Cortez, After Michelle, Housekeeping Manager, had our room cleaned thoroughly yesterday, I opened a night table drawer this morning only to find a one-inch long, live cockroach running around in it!!! This is in addition to the ones we left for you last Friday! I never saw a single bug, dead or alive in our rooms, during our entire stay @ the Fairmont Kea Lani, Beaches Negril, Club Med Yucatan, etc. Pls. upgrade your pest control & cleaning processes & make sure staff is doing the turndown service! You may not have received our earlier e-mail below because Michelle in Housekeeping gave us the wrong e-mail address. Further to my husband's note to you the other day with the "unauthorized" room guests (2 small cockroaches caught after housekeeping had supposedly cleaned our room on Jan.14/10), I want to make you aware of other issues that we feel are not appropriate for a 4-star hotel such as yours, @ the price we are paying per night for a suite + 1 room: 1) Day 1: Requested extra clean, oceanfront room on top floor. Only got a very dusty room with sticky floor areas, patio doors that have animal feces residue dried on the inside! We requested that housekeeping damp wipe all tabletops, vacuum floors & wash tile floors with bleach since I found sticky residue on the kids' bathroom floor the night we arrived. They took the $5. tip I left them but only did the bare minimum: beds, fresh towels. 2) We find this location extremely noisy due to all the service vehicles coming in/out of the service bays below. 3) Jan. 15/10: found a live silverfish @ 4 pm in our ensuite bath. Found another crawling bug on our bed. Once again after housekeeping had supposedly cleaned. 4) Day 3, Jan.15/10: left another tip, asked housekeeping to damp wipe tabletops/ bath countertops, vacuum floors & mop tiles with bleach/ soap/ water solution (sticky residue was still on kids' bath floor since check-in). Once again, they took the tip & did not do as I requested. I finally took a facecloth & soap & washed all the tabletops & bath counters myself. Had to dust TV's, lamps, etc. myself. They also did not clean the kids' bathtub which had sand in it still. 5) Jan.15/10 turndown service was missed on kids' room # 530. They do sooo little around here! 6) At every buffet we've been to here, staff start closing up 30 min. Before the buffet's scheduled end time! 7) Breakfast buffet is so mediocre. Rubber eggs. 8) Our kids got scrapes on their noses, arms & legs from rubbing against the rough walls & floors of the pools! 9) Ear infections -- all 3 kids got ear infections. Are they not using enough 'chlorine' (for a saltwater pool)? We were staying @ the Fairmont Kea Lani for 5 nights prior to coming here for a conference & the Fairmont room/ service/ food/ ambience was heaven. For only $396./ night, all 5 of us were very comfortable in a deluxe oceanview top floor, with only 1 luxurious extra large bath & 28 s.f. shower, double-sinks, fantastic housekeeping staff who vacuumed daily (even moving furniture to do so), cleaned bathroom thoroughly, helpful, personable staff all over armed with a "can-do" attitude, anticipating your needs before u have to ask (like true hosts would), impeccably manicured clean grounds, a very comfortable atmosphere. Here @ the Marriott we are paying 75% more & getting much less: minimal housekeeping service, no beach, only 1 mediocre restaurant, dirty floors even in the restaurant, live bugs in our room daily, self-clean your own room, insufficient fresh towels. It's no wonder my husband prefers staying @ Fairmont properties. If you want to be competitive, stay @ the competition's properties, then stay @ yours. Even our children have been asking to return to the Fairmont or switch to the Hyatt @ Kaanaapali beach for the rest of our stay in Maui. They saw & felt the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Courtyard On Maui. Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SterlingLatte
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Marriott for the first time 1/27-2/2/10. Absolutely awesome location. Didn't rent a car this time, just stayed at the hotel because we had points. Room was clean and we had a great view. The pools are nice and the 5 minute walk to the Shops At Wailea is the best. We had every intention to enjoy the restaurants at the hotel. However, upon our first morning walk to the little coffee shack for some Starbucks we got hit with a bowel moving $4.00 a cup drip coffee. Are you kidding? At the pool, we sat on a comfy wicker poolside lounge only to be told those are rented for $25.00. Uh Oh, the nickel and diming starts. We never ate at the restaurant or ordered room service. The bedding wasn't as good as the basic Marriott, Courtyard or Residence Inn. The Wicker furniture in the room isn't very comfortable. If you enjoy relaxing on the standard Courtyard or Residence Inn couch, don't expect that here. But hey, go out and enjoy the view, ocean, grassy areas and whale watching. Or walk to the Grand Wailea for a good dinner and great lobby. The rest of the hotel is very plain, nothing really special, which is why it feels like a Courtyard or Fairfield Inn. Parking valets are about the only staff you see. We called to get a few extra towels and got nothing. So I walked to the front desk and was told they were very busy and it will be there shortly. No smile and no "I'm sorry". 1 hour from the first phone call the towels arrived. Stay at the hotel for the location and view. You will love it, but don't expect much more. Plan to walk 5 minutes to the Shops At Wailea and enjoy happy hour at Tommy Bahama's. Stock up on food/drinks at the Whaler Market. Great sandwiches, breakfast, beer, wine, bottled water. Everything you need at a fraction of the price. Good large coffee for $1.50. Hotels should really carefully pick and choose how they nickel and dime the guests. $4.00 for a drip coffee is a really bad way to start out. That is in such poor taste that we never looked twice at the other food options at the hotel. Lord knows what lunch must cost. Ironically every other Marriott in the system has coffee in the lobby. And the biggest gripe of all: USE FITTED SHEETS!! For Pete's sake, the flat sheets on the bottom DON'T WORK. I stay in Marriott's all the time and they use fitted sheets which stay on the mattress. Every stinking' morning I woke up sleeping on the actual mattress. Does management with their hospitality degrees understand that a flat sheet on the bottom doesn't work? If it did, we would all have flat sheets at home. Sheet sets would come with two flat sheets. Martha Stewart would sell flat sheet sets at Macy's, it would be all the rage. But they don't and there's good reason for this. Stop! Please note we aren't cheap people. Last year we stayed at the Four Seasons Wailea and paid $400 a night. But meals were reasonable. Cabana's were free. Water sport equipment was free and while sitting in the cabana, they came around with ice water, cold slices of fruit and Evian mist. Had we not had the 100,000+ points, we would have gone back to the Four Seasons or Grand. So if your looking for a Fairfield Inn next to the beach with overpriced coffee, this is your place. Work it to your advantage, use the Shops At Wailea and enjoy the Marriott's beautiful location. We had a great time. The breaching whales were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!! We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Jovigirl73
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Marriott over Valentines day... what a WONDERFUL Resort! The views are breathtaking. We had ocean view and we sat on our balcony and watched the whales in the ocean as well as the Awesome sunsets!!! The room was very nice... clean, spacious and a large sunken tub in the bathroom. We will be back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: spennington1
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay. Absolutely beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Sterile Marriott in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: vamktpro
Reviews.Content: There is nothing bad about this property, it is an average hotel in a great environment.. However, after staying on two islands for two weeks and sleeping in four different places this property delivers you get a clean room one step above basic. But why do this when in Paradise? The senic views are amazing but the property lacks the theming that adjacent resorts deliver. The pools are basic, no with a little hot tub that seems to be popular with kids. Why not have the hot tub at the adults only pool? Also there is a need to have more shade. If you have young kids they will enjoy the kids area with two excellent water slides. The computer for printing airline boarding passes kept on breaking. IF ou ask the staff for help tp print one out they clearly show their distain for doing so. Well you can go to the Busnines Center and pay $.25 per minute for access. Guess we were spoiled by the great service and facilities by other reorts. From the outside the rooms look like condos and the grounds have sparse landscaping. We really enjoyed the paved walkway along the waters edge, As we passed by other resorts we found outself wishing we booked a room there. They aslo had booths to rent snorkeling equipment, kayaks etc. If the Marriott offered this we were unaware. The other reorts had lovely grounds and the hotels offered more than the basic feel you get in a maninland Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Jason_minnesota
Reviews.Content: There have been a lot of nay-sayers on this site about this property, but we give it two thumbs up! The property is absolutely beautiful. Beautiful grounds, beautiful pools, and fantastic staff. There were several beaches within a short walk from the resort, although we spent most of our time at the infinity pool. The rooms are spacious and comfortable - not that you spend much time in them anyway. Our room was oceanview, yet still overlooked where the luau took place several times a week. We had "happy hour" on the balcony and took in the sights and sounds of the luau for free.
