The location is great - just a few minute walk from the Shops, where you can grab an inexpensive and fast lunch at the deli or have your choice of several dinner restaurants. Mala, the restaurant at the resort, was one of the best places we had dinner all week - and not all that much more expensive than other places we visited. That said, we didn't have a bad dinner the entire time we were here (Buzz's Wharf, Cafe Ole and Mulligan's were a few of the places we ate). But be prepared to drop a minimum of $100 a dinner at almost any restaurant you go to (with a drink per person). Our only complaint about the resort were the drink prices at the pool. $13 for a strawberry daquiri seems a little extreme, but we realized that is just the price you pay on this side of the island. If you are looking for a cheaper, hipper experience, I would recommend Lahaina. The restaurants and hotels seem much more reasonable, but you trade off the peace and quiet that Wailea offers. The Grand Wailea next door does have a happy hour from 5-6 pm and has some reasonable drink specials. They also have what looks to be a fabulous spa. We ended up finding a local day spa in Kihei that had prices about 1/3 of the cost of massages at the resort and the experience was just as great (if you are okay with jumping the car to drive to your massage or facial). It was worth the $45/person savings for us. The clientel at the Marriott seemed to be a bit on the older side...if you are looking for people to throw back drinks with at the pool during the day, this is not the place to stay. I'm not sure anywhere in Wailea would give you that experience. All that said, we would still highly recommend this resort if you are looking for a high quality resort at a reasonable price on the side of the island that is a little more low key. We were hoping for something just a little more upbeat and will opt for Lahaina the next time we visit. (Review is from a 30 something couple).

Reviews.Title: “Great place, decent snorkelling and very relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Beancounter314
Reviews.Content: It is pretty tough to complain about much in Maui! And this hotel was no exception, we loved it. Decent snorkelling off the beach (we swam with a couple sea turtles), quiet location, long board walk that spans over multiple hotels, and lot's of places to just sit down and relax on the grass. We found all the staff to be very friendly and the on site Luau was worth it (there is better, but it is nice you can walk back to your room after it is over). Our room was very clean, unfortunately we didn't have a beach view, but that was fine because it forced us to leave the room and get out more! The beds were very comfortable so I could have stayed in the room all day! Decent on site restaurants with good drinks by the pool. There are multiple pools, which were all nice (adult pool was best, but kind of busy). ...now I want to go back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: st4rguitar
Reviews.Content: We bid for a resort on priceline and at the last minute got a room for $112/night. The resort was absolutely gorgeous, right on the water, and you got to watch the turtles swim up on the rocks. The balcony of the hotel room was the perfect place to have your morning coffee, sift through brochures, or just enjoy the sun with air conditioning near-by. The flowers were in bloom everywhere, the grounds were extremely well-kept, and the staff was courteous and helpful. The "adult pool" with the "endless" view is the place to be. The room was immaculate, dressed in white. The bathroom was nothing special. My only negative about this place is that they "nickel & dime" you for everything. For example, they did not have WiFi, only "wired" internet, and it cost $15/day. Additionally, parking your rental car cost $15/day. I ordered a pina colada at the pool and received my $14 bill. The breakfast buffet started at $18/person. I would definitely go back to this hotel if I could find another deal, but I would seek alternatives to a rental car and food/drink options.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, but...”
Reviews.Author: sspc
Reviews.Content: but there is no actual beach in front of this hotel, only rocks. you must walk to either side to get to sandy part. Also, you must pay for beach chairs/umbrellas. Our room is small, average, needs upgrading. no ipod hook up, only cd player. no flat screen, no double sinks. Oh, and the mattresses are very old and extremely soft. I had housekeeping come to put something under it, and it's not better, maybe even worse. Another annoying thing is internet is $14/day. but if you want to do use the wi-fi in the lobby they will charge you another $14/day AND that cost is not transferable when you go back to your room. Another annoying thing is they charge you a 'resort fee' which doesn't add up to much except you get to park without an extra charge and you get a bottle of water everyday, all for $28/day. the good thing is the staff is very friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: nancycliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Wailea in mid January of this year. We've been to Ka'anapali before and wanted to try a different locale. We loved the Wailea area although I must caution that it can be expensive. The hotel was a little hard to locate in the dark...we did need to phone to make sure we were headed in the right direction and finally found it. The check-in takes place in the open air...very nice touch but it takes an incredibly long time to complete checkin, perhaps because you do receive a more personal-type of service. I had written a letter to the hotel weeks prior to let them know we were celebrating our anniversary with them and I requested a nice room with a view. We were on a Costco pkg and that included a cheaper room. They were very accommodating and upgraded us to a room overlooking the Serenity pool. We were driven via golf cart to the room which was a fun touch! The room was quite large with what looked to be teak wood trim. My only complaint was the tile floor. I realize that it allows you to keep it much cleaner....especially when people are dragging in sand from the outside...but it's tough on the feet. That said, we loved our time in this hotel. Our pkg included the buffet breakfast which would be WAY too expensive to buy on your own each day. We searched for happy hours and found a good one at the Shoppes, next door to the hotel. It was across from Cheeseburger and it was called Longhi's. It has outdoor seating and the happy hour food is very reasonable. The individual pizzas were good as was the fish and chips. We also ate at Ruth's Chris because they have a Prime Time special...3 courses for $39 each if you come in before 6 pm. All that said and done, the serenity pool is gorgeous and the main reason we chose to stay here. The grounds are lovely and truly make you feel relaxed. If you need to hit a Walmart or Costco, they are right in Kahalui, about a 20 minute drive from Wailea...much more accessible than the Ka'anapali or Honokowai areas. Lahaina is as cute as ever but a driving and parking nightmare. Oh, btw, if you have a handicap plaque, you can use it at the hotel to park in their lot....much closer than you would without it. They give you a special card to get in the parking lot. In short, we would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wailea- hotels & Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: lauriebelle29
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was a nice setting. We stayed in the tower, luckily there were not many people staying at the time. The restaurants on the property were very good, although costly. We went to the shops at Wailea where there were places to pick up sandwiches, muffins, chips, etc. One of the best restaurants we found was Fred's mexican Restaurant in Kihei. Wok star had thai food that was very good. If you need a car and don't mind a used car, rent from Kihei car rentals. The people are nice, the cars are older and used (you look more like a local), and the price was half of national car companies. We rented a 2001 Sentra & it worked great. We brought it up & down the Haleakala crater. When you get a car the hotel will charge to park in their lot. Just park in the shopping center lot, there are signs that discourage parking there but if you don't mind walking a little, park there for free.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on a Shoestring”
Reviews.Author: tripstyler
Reviews.Content: We've been to Maui many times and now prefer to stay at the Marriott Wailea. This past year, we had the opportunity to stay at this property twice and each time had an excellent experience. We'll likely try and fit in another long weekend stay again this year. Location: Located a mere half hour from Kahalui Airport (OGG), the Wailea Marriott offers the BEST value for money in Wailea. I'm a fan of Fairmont, but cannot pass-up the price difference and value offered at the Wailea Marriott. Located on one of the nicest plots of land in Wailea, the Marriott has something for everyone. If you want a quiet experience head to the never-ending, Serenity pool (and make sure to taste a happy-hour drink) or cozy up on one of the dispersed beach chairs along the shoreline. Families can soak in some sun at the main pool or beaches flanking either side of the property, while young ones can splash in the shade at the kids play area and pool. Another huge plus of this hotel is its proximity to the Shops at Wailea--only 2-min walk away. If you don't always feel like eating out, you can grab a coffee and snack in the shops, or a bottle champagne at the ABC store for a sunset toast. Staff: Each time I've deal with housekeeping, concierge, front desk or wait staff, they are very courteous, friendly and helpful. The pool servers are genuine and try to get to know guests. Each time I requested something from housekeeping they would exceed my expectations by bringing 2-3 times what I'd asked for. Note some rooms don't automatically get slippers and dressing gowns, so you have to request these upon arrival. Rooms: The rooms were renovated in the past 3 years, so their design is fresh. One stand-out item is the rooms' size. They are large in comparison with other hotels. Most rooms have full or partial ocean views. The first time we stayed our room did not, but we got the hotel for such a good rate, we didn't even care. Booking the Marriott: Some Marriott hotels can be cheesy, but this one is not. The experience provided by the staff and location in Wailea is unmatched. The reno undertaken a few years helps too. We are not part of Marriott's loyalty program, so we booked the property via priceline. Both times we got an excellent rate which amounted to 1/4 - 1/3 what you'd pay at other hotels in Wailea. Note that if you book via priceline or hotwire, the font desk must ask you whether you want to pay the $20 daily resort fee. If you opt not to and have a car, then parking is $20/day. Restaurants: Getting to and from restaurants in Wailea is simple and most are in walking distance. The Fairmont, Four Seasons, Grand Wailea and Marriott each have nice restaurants. Our faves are humu humu at the Grand Wailea, Ferrero's at the Four Seasons and Seawatch at the Wailea Golf Club (try to crab cakes). Outside of Wailea we like the casual Hula Grill in Ka'anapali and the picturesque Mama's Fish House in Paia.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel123Usa
Reviews.Content: Awesome, A#1 time in Wailea and Marriott is gorgeous. If you're looking for quiet, R&R, great pool and beach areas, then Marriott is a good place to call home during your visit to Maui. Staff are truly superb and many times just made our day with their willingness to help with whatever we needed. Rent a car for a few days and explore the area. Plenty of great, lower-priced food options off resort, including the mall area within walking distance where there is a super general store with everything you need, including plenty of a la carte options for breakfast & lunch. Pros: Quiet, adults-only pool, location, overall quality of resort & rooms, service. Staff are incredibly friendly, gracious and helpful - true Aloha spirit. Food was very good but $$$. Cons: Parking can be pricey; more food options are needed - a cafe, marketplace or Starbucks would be a great addition.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was there right now”
Reviews.Author: dakine_wahine
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November 2008. Arrived the day after Thanksgiving for a week. I booked this hotel after bidding on Priceline when another reservation did not work out as expected. When I checked in I inquired about a complimentary upgrade and was offered a first-floor ocean view room with a patio. Resort fee was reasonable as it included self-parking, various discounts and 2 free Mai Tais. Since my reservation was actually booked for 2 time periods (the first couple days and then the remainder of the stay) I received 4 free Mai Tais. They also give each person checking in a towel card that you exchange for pool towels. I had a 3rd adult with me and was not charged an extra adult fee. Telephone calls back to the mainland were included with this fee. We were greeted with shell leis and then driven to our room on their golf-cart. Room was beautiful with rich Koa woods and platform beds. We were able to open the patio doors and walk right to the beach and take great scenic pictures. The gym was nice and even have complimentary apples for patrons. Hotel is right next to the Shops at Wailea which has great shopping, restaurants, and free entertainment. Hotel has a nice infinity pool and several hot tubs. We were even able to swim in the pool and watch whales spouting in the ocean from the pool. It was incredible! We did not eat breakfast here as it was quite expensive (expected at a resort) and instead went to the market and kept breakfast foods in the refrigerator. However, we did attend the Luau and had dinner at the hotel. The last evening of our stay we were returning from a tour just in time to see a beautiful sunset as we were walking down the stairs towards the ocean. Prettiest thing I have ever seen. Would definitely stay here again....as a matter of fact I wish I was there right now.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate”
Reviews.Author: ilovejamie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend picked his own price for this hotel on priceline, and the price they accepted was unbelievable! So maybe try that if you are looking for a deal. The hotel looks beautiful. Its right on the ocean, and there is a beautiful green belt walk way all around the property. Its a very nice walk in the morning and at sunset. Our room was nice. The food at the restaurant was very very good! We were a short walk to the Four Seasons, which also has an excellent restaurant, Spagos. It was a good location if you want to be a little removed from the more touristy stuff. I felt like we got to sleep in a serene paradise, and then we could drive to the touristy places and have adventures there.

Reviews.Title: “its ok”
Reviews.Author: rtbg
Reviews.Content: I came here for a conference and the room/bed etc was very nice. Around 70% of the staff are friendly. The bars and restaurants don't have a great service though. In a friday night the main bar closed at 10 pm.... Cocktails weren't good, No fresh juices and they charge for a special seat in the pool, just rude. It's ok. The whole atmosphere in the restaurants weren't the greatest, not surprising they were empty every day that I went in there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: puttaveerian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from Dec.21-24th. The open lobby concept, the front entrance has very resort-like feel to it. The views are amazing. I like the fact that the resort has an adult only pool which has beautiful views of the sunset. The shoreline path s an excellent place to take a morning jog! Next to the hotel is a nice mall and if you drive about 5-10 min drive you can find many good dining options. The rooms are very nice and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service - and worse its crowded”
Reviews.Author: QuickLearner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the hope that we can enjoy our honeymoon. Even though the location is nice it was so crowded that we were not even able to relax. We were made to wait till 4.00 pm to get our room but were expected to check out by 12.00. From our Oceanview terrace could see a sliver of the beach and that was it. To top it all there was centipede in our bed that freaked us out. To make matters worse we were advised that it was normal !!! Also getting a new room would not help as we might find some there as well - we were told!!!

Reviews.Title: “affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: WaterGirlFremontCA
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 10 nights at this resort. We were in the Haleakala Hale, which is essentially an 8 story hotel building. Although older, it is in fairly good condition. I thought the bed was very comfortable, complete with lots of pillows. We were using Marriott points acquired via business travel. This location was recently down-graded from level 7 to level 6, which means it requires 30K points per night. We had an excellent ocean view. The location of this resort is truly wonderful; it is between the Wailea and Ulua beaches, 2 of the best in Maui, and very close to other great beaches, accessible along a walking path. The snorkeling was great, and included numerous turtle sightings. The adult-only infinity pool was beautiful and relaxing. The excursions staff (Rick and Sarah) were terrific, very knowledgeable and helpful. We took excursions from Blue Water Rafting (excellent for active types), Atlantis submarines in Lahaina (pretty good), Valley Isle Excursions all-day Hana tour (the best way to see the island), Ekahi tours Sunrise at Haleakala (dress warmly and bring a blanket!). Of course food is expensive, but the on-site grill and restaurant are good, and for variety we went next-store to the 4 seasons (Duo and Ferraros) and the shops at Wailea (Longhi, Tommy Bahamas, Cheeseburgers, Ruth Chris). We didn't bother with a rental car, we just used cabs (Oli's) as necessary and that worked fine. We rented scooters from Island Riders; they are not recommended, in spite of Austin's attempts to salvage their business. Next time we would ask the hotel for a recommendation (we had contacted Island Riders directly). We also enjoyed the massages at the spa, and the on-site luau is pretty good if you're into that sort of thing. At this time of year we were fortunate to see many humpback whales, not too far off-shore.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon heaven”
Reviews.Author: CateT
Reviews.Content: changed it's name? awesome place we upgraded to right on beach had our own concierge best place i've ever been

Reviews.Title: “Worst beds I have ever attempted to sleep in, run down at best”
Reviews.Author: MCUtah
Reviews.Content: This place is very run down, the beds should have been replaced years ago. We only stayed two nights and left. The added fees for every little items are just rubbing salt into the wound. Great location but the Marriott executives forgot to budget to keep this place up.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel and Great Area”
Reviews.Author: HudsonGuy2001
Reviews.Content: The Wailea Marriott is a very nice hotel and a better alternative to Ka'anpali Beach area. It's newer and a lot less crowded. I read the hotel had gone thru a renovation a few years back and it still shows as relatively new. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. The hotel grounds were immaculate. There are a lot of shops and restaurants in the area that make it really convenient. Oh and my fiance really enjoyed her spa day. The cost was about average and was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “This resort was absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Kristin082
Reviews.Content: The actual grounds of the Marriott was beautiful. The beach is a short distance walk and you can snorkle by the reefs right there! The beach was clean and the water clear. The infinity pool is beyond amazing also. The Luau, the Marriott hosted, is a must see. The food was delicious and the show was incredible. My favorite part was the flame thrower! The rooms were decent, the only thing I didn't like was the air conditioner. It is motion sensored...so in the middle of the night I would wake up hot and sweaty.. and I already had the thermastat on the lowest setting. However, the bed was so soft and luxurious. I miss the bed already! Altogether, I enjoyed my stay and I would defitnitely come back again. My husband and I recieved an excellent deal on priceline that truly made staying here worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place....but extra fees are rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Optoko
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here while attending a conference (at the same location). Its a beautiful place with nice pools, beach, and amenities.....typical for a resort in Maui. The rooms were nice, clean and amply spacious. The conference facilities were average, and the food included with the conference was substantial. The RIP OFFS are: 1) parking for $15/day ($18 for valet), 2) a mandatory "porterage fee" of $9/person whether you rolled your own luggage or not, and 3) a bottle of drinking water set next to the complimentary coffees and teas (but not labeled that there is a charge if you drink it) in the room would have cost $6 unless you paid the optional $25/day for 2 bottles of water and 2 Mai Tai drinks (first day only). 4) Internet is $14/day 5) You may be charged a "mandatory" Resort Fee of $25/day unless you are at a certain level of Marriott membership. I suppose if you can afford to stay at a fancy resort like this, you'd be OK with all these extra charges because it's "standard" in the industry....but I just parked in the shopping area parking lot and walked an extra 50 yds; and got my own bottles of drinking water at the supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - just didn't do it for me especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: bc1_8
Reviews.Content: I had a hard time deciding whether to rate this a 3 or 4. Things I didn't like: 1) Although right by the ocean you have to walk quite a ways to get to a beach. Before arriving on Maui a 5-10 minute walk to the beach didnâ€™t seem like a big deal â€“ once we were there it seemed like a bigger deal â€“ we only went to the beach once the entire time we were there â€“ we went to lots of other beaches though. 2) The walk to the car was a good 5-10 minutes. This wouldnâ€™t seem like a big deal, but it got annoying by the time we/I walked to the car 4 or so times a day usually carrying something heavy and in a swimsuit and flip-flops. If we wouldâ€™ve just hung out at the resort this wouldnâ€™t be a problem, but we more used it as a pit-stop. (Note: We were in building 6 right by the ocean, our friends were in the tower â€“ they had a 30 second walk to the car but were really far from the ocean - the place is too big to get the best of both worlds.) 3) Spending that much for a hotel automatically makes me enjoy myself less. I just never felt truly at home and relaxed. Maybe part of it was that the white tile floors, etc. felt too hospital like. Maybe Iâ€™m just not into the fancy stuff. For me I was just never quite relaxed here, but that is just a personal preference - the place was just too big, too impersonal, too fancy-schmanzy for my style. 4) The rail on the balcony was just the wrong height so that it blocked the view of the ocean 5) The nickel & dime junk that Marriott and other hotels in that class do is annoying. I don't understand why $60 a night hotels can provide free internet, free parking & free breakfast while expensive charge $25 a day for parking/resort fee and $14 a day for Internet access, etc. I guess at least they lumped the resort fee and parking together into a single fee. Things I liked: But those are my only complaints - there was nothing really wrong with it. It really is a nice place. The ocean view was fantastic â€“ the balcony on our room was great. The lawn with chairs right by the ocean was great. The Wailea location was fantastic especially for snorkeling. The rooms were clean and nice. The bed was very comfortable - as long as you like a soft bed. You can bring sand into the room with reckless abandon and count on housekeeping to magically whisk it away every day. The grounds and building were great. The complimentary pineapple ice water was fantastic. The staff was friendly, it wasnâ€™t crowded. The pools and hot-tubs were awesome. The check-in/check-out service was great. Based on my experience you wouldn't go wrong here if this sort of hotel is your style - it just seems really expensive to me - I liked our condo that we paid 1/3 as much for night for way better.

Reviews.Title: “Waliea Beach Marriott Resort & Spa... Absolute Paradise, 150% Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ebonyyellow
Reviews.Content: The Wailea Beach Marriott was everything plus more than I expected. My beautiful daughter surprised me with a trip of a lifetime to beautiful Hawaii. As we drove onto the winding road that lead to the hotel check-in desk, which was outside I knew this was going to be the most incredible experience. The Banyan trees that intertwined, the beautiful plumeria trees, the landscaping the warm breeze against my face. The resort is spectacular, there are open spaces, so, as you walk out your room there are open walls that air is flowing, you see the beachfront, the lobby is open air, the greeters are all beautifully dressed, the rooms were always 100%, the ocean view room was magnificent. To end the trip you must go and see 'Uncle Willie K' who performs at Mulligan's on the Blue. Oh my gosh, this Native brother plays the Ukla like no other. He performed by himself and the show was great. If you can, get the buffet. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location, beautiful pool and grounds”
Reviews.Author: aprilgirl76
Reviews.Content: I used priceline to book this hotel and got a $150 rate which was fabulous. The front desk upgraded us to a partial ocean view which I think made all the difference, because these rooms are closer to the pool and easier to access. There are lots of high floor rooms that also face the ocean but our building was closer to the pool. The grounds are extremely beautiful, even for Maui which is completely beautiful all over the place, The lobby is really special. The staff was friendly and helpful. You can self park your car, but the fee is $15 per day unless you pay the resort fee of $25 (which is common in Maui). The fee seems to entitle you to park and get towels at the beach. The location of this hotel is great, right next to the Shops of Wailea, which has 4 good restaurants as well as many high end stores, as well as stores for ordinary shopping. There is a usable refrigerator in the room so you can keep some food around for breakfast or whatever. We like to eat breakfast in the room when we travel so we can start the day with an activity. My one complaint is you have to pay for internet access, which I do not appreciate. I would recommend this hotel if the price is right, for it's location, for its rooms and for its pool/beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TonterVancouver
Reviews.Content: We were shocked at how beautiful the hotel was when we arrived. The lobby/reception area is all outdoors and gorgeous - what a great welcome to new visitors. We were excited. We were told that they have 22 acres of land and they sure made good use of it. The grounds are landscaped with ponds, trees, flowers...you name it. It is beautiful to walk around and certainly made for weddings. Of course, taking a walk further south through the Grand Wailea or the Fairmont, you'll see they are all large hotels designed for weddings. The rooms/hales are all tied in together and you can get lost, but it's kind of fun. Our room was great - looked onto the adult serenity pool - and had all the amenities we could need. The bed was cozy, the washrooms were great and the help staff were great at keeping it all clean (ie. swept and mopped for the sand we kept bringing in). The only two issues I had was the random millipede that would show up especially since we were on the ground floor and the difficulty we had getting any of our clothes to dry on our patio. Of course both of those issues are due to the dampness that surrounds the area and it probably could have been appeased if we turned on the air conditioning (not something we wanted when the breeze from off the ocean was so refreshing). Even room service was great accommodating a random request of ours to order something off the children's menu even though we had no children. The pools are very pleasant and always staff coming by to wait on you to bring you another of their super strong drinks while you sunbathe. There's a lunch restaurant that is pretty good, a little pricey but should satisfy what you need. There's a dinner restaurant called Mala which was also very good, very pricey. They have a little coffee kiosk where you can get Starbucks coffee and pastries. My problem with the food was being locked into the hotel options because we had no car (and we were not aware of the shopping mall just next door until our last day there). We woke up one day late and wanted breakfast from room service because the coffee kiosk closed at 10:30am. We called room service at 11am and couldn't get anymore breakfast because they stopped that right at 11am. Starved, we still had to wait for the lunch restaurant by one of the pools to open because 11am was too early for us to get lunch-type food. It was truly frustrating so we grabbed a taxi that evening into Wailea town and picked up food from the Foodland store for our next few breakfasts/snacks. The gym was nice - completely up to par for what we needed (weight-lifting-wise, and we are heavy into weightlifting - it was far too hot for us to manage any cardio). The activities staff guys were great and helpful with tips we needed for snorkelling. The Marriott is located right in what they call Turtle Town. The coral reef right in front of the hotel is where many turtles come every morning to feed and snorkelling at 9am definitely gave us a great show of five turtles, lots of fish (the florescent kind), rays and sea snakes. There were a couple of hammocks on the property that I only took advantage of once, but nice that they are there. There is a luau on four nights a week, but it's a ghastly $94 per person ($104 if you want to reserve a seat!) to attend for all you can eat/drink plus show. Neither of us could possible consume enough food or drink to satisfy that price from our wallets - taking a cab into town and having dinner was less. The only thing that really bothered me with this hotel was the resort fee card. You have to pay a $25/day resort fee on top of your room and taxes. We received a message in our room from the concierge the first day that we had a package to pick up from them - a welcome package. Well, in all our enjoyment, we did not pick it up until halfway through our stay. There was a "passport" in there that would give us discounts on all kinds of things in the hotel plus restaurants in town. I was first annoyed that we had to go to the concierge to pick this up rather than the reception desk giving it to us right from the moment we checked in. Then I was annoyed that we could have received discounts from the hotel restaurants with this card - 20% off Mala, the very expensive restaurant and that would have been quite a discount if we had known. But what was the worst part, no one from the hotel staff ever mentioned it. They just handed you the bill and you signed for it - if we had ever remembered to show the "passport" we really could have saved a few bucks. All in all, the place is great. We would definitely return to this hotel remembering the little things that would make it just that much better. Having a car would be such a help as you really are locked into the hotel offerings without one.

Reviews.Title: “Best views on the island”
Reviews.Author: carobama
Reviews.Content: This was on of the mot beautiful locations we've ever stayed. The grounds of this hotel are truly an amzing sight, from the two infinity pools to the cabanas looking out to sea it couldn't not be more serene. We watched sea turtles basking in the sea, the most amzing sunsets and enjoyed every minute. But id you're looking for luxury rooms this isn't it. The rooms are nice and comfortable but very ordinary for a hotel anywhere. The Spa was wonderful, we had massages and facials. The Beauty shop inside the Spa was a disaster, but this all hinges on whose working when you go. The event planner, concierge, and bellmen well above average. If you're looking for something near shopping, restaurants or the beach this isn't it. If you're looking to enjoy the company of your loved ones this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag -- Great Value”
Reviews.Author: beeclean
Reviews.Content: My extended family of 6 (wife's parents / 5 and 3 year old children) just returned from a 5 night stay at the Wailea Marriott. We are Platinum members and used points for our rooms. Overall, the stay was a mixed bag. The Marriot is a mish mash of buildings on a beautiful waterfront piece of property. Each â€œhaleâ€� is at odd angles to the beach front. Therefore, the views are greatly varied WITHIN each building. In our case, from our ocean front units we were unable to see the actual sunset due to the next building jutting out, while the units down the hall had a clear view, yet a more limited view to the north. Also, keep in mind that the property has ocean front, and deluxe ocean front categories. With the deluxe version actually offering fully unobstructed views. Additionally, the property is quite spread out. Luckily we had small children, and were close to the kids pool. It would have been quite inconvenient had we been at the other end of the property. Although as a side note, there is no food service at this pool so you have to pack in snacks, or walk to the other pool to eat. Alternatively, those on a couples vacation might want to overlook the adults only serenity pool. It truly is spectacular, and is the only part of the property that feels five star. I would highly recommend giving the desk your preference on check in. Positives: Good value for the Wailea area Excellent expansive grounds Multiple pool options (segregated kids pool !!) Close walking distance to The Shops at Wailea Negatives: No food/beverage service at the kid pool Small rooms (for the area) No suites available close to the water. For some reason they are all in the tower building off the lobby, and offer limited views. Few food options on site No beach support. It boggles the mind that you have to sit on a towel, or rent beach chairs. Charging for self parking. The lot is adjacent, and laughably they donâ€™t ask to identify your car or supply a parking pass. No typical scheduled resort activities Daily charged WIRED internet. Unbelievable. Given that we used points for this trip, we took the negatives in stride. However, I would still recommend this property for those that want to stay in the Wailea area and are looking for value.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Experience”
Reviews.Author: WanderingApe
Reviews.Content: I'm a Platinum member and booked this stay with points. Overall, I was satisfied. If this is your first time at Maui, stay in the Kaanapali area in West Maui, rather than the South Maui area. West Maui is much much more full of life. If you have to stay in South Maui, I can recommend this hotel, with some caveats. Here are my good and bad points. The Good: The hotel grounds are beautiful. First class. There are 4 nice beaches within walking distance of the hotel. Wailea beach really is first class, and you won't be disappointed. The price of the cheapest room seems to be reasonable for Maui, although it seems the view from these rooms must suck. There are 4 pools..a kid pool, serenity pool, and 2 others. I liked the pools and found them clean, and generally empty. The housekeeping staff was great. The Bad: The hotel room was nice, but not comparable to other resorts in other locations. The room had some small bugs (nothing major, and understandable since I'm sure the previous guests left the balcony door open), and the balcony was dirty, with a white substance all over the place. The restaurant choices on site are extremely limited. Mala has good but limited food, arrogant staff, and insane prices. The poolside grill was insanely priced and had tasteless food. They need more restaurants. The hotel charges a resort fee of $25 for the privilege of parking there, getting some water each day, and a minor discount at the restaurant. Overall, the hotel lacked the energy and life that other hotels on Maui have. I found this place completely lifeless. You can't use the internet unless you pay 65 cents a minute. Some of the hotel staff at the desk and elsewhere are arrogant. At check in and out I had the same individual who I couldn't stand. Very arrogant guy, and remember I'm a Platinum member, so I can't imagine how he treats other guests. (Many of the staff were friendly though). The Bad: The hotel recommends using SpeediShuttle (which I also recommend), but then when Speedi Shuttle pulled up to take us to the airport, they had to pull off to the side in the parking lot, away from the other guests, making us feel second class. The driver told us that the head Bellman is arrogant (I don't disagree) and makes him do this. Not good.

Reviews.Title: “mostly good”
Reviews.Author: thefriendlytraveler
Reviews.Content: First, a note of thanks to other tripadvisors whose comments helped up know what to expect. Pros: --great ocean views from the lobby and swimming pools, grounds. Our room had a bit of ocean view if you stepped on to the lanai which was nice. --serenity pool is quiet (no cell phones or kids) and refreshing swim with ocean views. Nice choice of other pools including kid's pool with a water slide. --we found the staff friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was fine for us. --room is good size. Bathroom had one sink and not large, but clean and nice soaking tub. Towels were large and substantial. No name lotion, shampoo, conditioner were fine. --location near shopping which is a major plus. --we found the cards for beach towels swap (they give you 2 per person) worked well. --grounds are tropical. They are not as lush or landscaped as the nearby more expensive resorts. --walkway on the ocean front gets you to nearby beaches and other resorts. --TV was decent when we wanted to chill, not just 4 or 5 channels. --when iron didn't work, someone came right away and asked if there was anything else he could help with. Nice services. Minor negatives: --sound proofing is pretty rotten. You can pretty much hear the nearby rooms and hallway. Fortunately, our experience was that fellow guests were very quiet. --They have a gnat problem at the moment at the serenity pool. No doubt they will figure out how to correct it... --ocean walkway was pretty darn busy. Even in the off season. Not a deal breaker, just an FYI --tile floors are a bit of a pain. Come back from the ocean and floor is too dirty to walk around barefoot. Frankly, it feels a bit cheap. --down comforter on the bed (isn't it Hawaii? Memo to HDQ - a down comforter? would have appreciated a thin blanket instead, but maybe that's just us) --beaches are nearby, but carrying the snorkle gear, towels, water, sunblock, etc etc gets boring and by the end, you do wish the beach was at the hotel, rather than a walk. Again, not a deal breaker. Major negatives for us: --Foam beds. Front desk appears to think they are incredible, we found them sunken in where other guests have slept and awkwardly soft. --Motion detector thermostats. Lot of hotels have them, too bad they cause you to wake up hot every couple of hours, then you have cold air blowing on you (keeping you awake) until the room gets the right temperature. Between waking up sweating every two hours and the foam beds it is a poor sleep which is not much fun. Overall, we'll recommend, but with these caveats. We probably would go elsewhere, but if the rate was better than better alternatives we'd consider it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Tracy58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wailea Marriott for the last part of our honeymoon. First the positives: the hotel lobby and grounds are nice - open and attractive; the adult infinity pool (salt, no chlorine) at sunset is incredible; restaurant dinners were fantastic; room service was excellent the two meals we had; the price for our room was less expensive than the other hotels in Wailea. We enjoyed our stay! The rooms were pretty basic with tile floors, good bed and more spacious than other Hawaii Marriotts I've stayed in. The activities folks at the infinity pool were very helpful. The pool waitresses were very friendly but definitely understaffed and overworked - an extra waitress during peak hours is necessary. We were disappointed by the location of our room - we had requested and supposedly received an ocean front room. To me this usually means a full ocean view- not here. We were on the third floor in Hale 3 and our room essentially overlooked the family pool and had the typical noise associated with that location. Most vacations I wouldn't quibble but it was our honeymoon and we wanted more quiet. We were told that ocean front means you can see the ocean from the bed, which we could...but only a sliver. We asked for a different room not overlooking the family pool but none was available unless we wanted to upgrade to a deluxe ocean front for 75 more a night. We chose to stay. Note that if you have a lot of bags or if you have difficulty with stairs that this hotel is full of stairs - rooms are on lots of different levels. Spend the few dollars and use the bellmen - they were fast on checkin and checkout. Locations aren't marked real well and it can be confusing to get around...we had trouble finding the lobby the first day! They do nickel and dime you to death as many resorts in this price range do - $25 per day resort fee (covers 1 bottle of water per day, free self-parking). My biggest issue with the fee is that it doesn't cover internet access (extra fee) or pool towels. They give you 2 pool towel cards per person that you exchange for towels at the pool - if you don't give the cards back at checkout, you're charged extra - who wants to deal with keeping track of MORE electronic cards on vacation? Drinks and food are expensive, but hey it's a resort on Maui...they all are! The breakfast buffet was very expensive and not worth the extra money - there are several places close by to get a good and less expensive breakfast (Denny's is only 5 minutes away by car).

Reviews.Title: “Yes, Gracie there is a Heaven.”
Reviews.Author: Jeris505
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Marriott Wailea Hotel and Spa was the most relaxing, uneventful stay a couple could ever experience. the rooms are stunning. The views are extraordinary. The serenity pool is intoxicating. The walking path along miles of the Pacific is inviting. The location is central to southwestern Maui. The beaches are plentiful and all different. The restaurants in the area are fantastic. Add to all this the spectacular sunsets at the end of the day and yes, Gracie, there is a Heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I imagined.”
Reviews.Author: hawaiianholiday
Reviews.Content: From the minute we set foot on the property I was disappointed. If you are coming in from the airport - as most are - you can't see the sign! It faces the other direction. Once we made it to the front desk, after getting lost in the parking garage (no signs), the girl behind the desk was kind of snotty, never stopped smiling, but had an attitude. She asked if we wanted the bell hop to take our bags, I said no because we didn't have that much ( two wheeled bags), but she neglected to inform us that we would have to walk to the furthest end of the hotel and up and down 2 flights of steps! Once we found our building, Hale 7, there are no signs telling which direction your room is! There where signs that gave you the room ranges, but no direction. I got lost when I went out for ice! Once in our room, we found that we were on the ground level with no view at all, even though we paid extra for oceanfront. We were facing the ocean, but it might as well have been Lake Erie! The room was dark, damp and loud. The hallways outside the room were made of slate, and everything echoed. If anyone came down the hall speaking in a normal voice, it sounded like a party was going on. And the service carts sounded like trains coming down the hall. Needless to say after one night we asked that our room be switched, we were then placed in a very nice room overlooking the infinity pool. Great view, carpeted hallway (quiet), close to the front desk and workout room. I couldn't help but think that the girl who checked us in had a chip on her shoulder that afternoon and she stuck us out there on purpose! Other than that, the room was fairly clean and comfortable, but the room didn't match the grounds and lobby areas, which are breathtaking. I doubt I would stay there again. There are too many options out there.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star Resort in Five Star Zone”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Lving
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights on Marriott Points, and was rewarded with an ocean view room that overlooked the serenity pool. I am Marriott Platinum, and it was a great upgrade. Room was fine, after a week there, I like the soft bedding and now see why they tile their rooms....we tracked in quite a bit of sand and other stuff from the beach. We didn't spend much time in the room, there was too much else to do. The primary problem Marriott has with this resort is that it borders a Four Seasons, Grand Wailea, Fairmont, etc. All of these are considerably more expensive and the Marriott facility compares well with all of them (except perhaps the Grand Wailea, which is really over the top). The service at the pool was slow at times, and Marriott could do itself a favor by increasing the staffing. The staff seemed to work well, there just weren't enough of them. There is NO free internet access, I traveled with an air card and found it the only reliable service anywhere...you can rent them before you go. We only had one meal at the restaurant, which was outstanding. Great food a good service. We walked to the mall each day (about 10 minutes) to get water, food for the beach, etc. I don't understand the folks who bash the prices that the Marriott charges in Hawaii...it is expensive everywhere. You pay a price for paradise, and this isn't the island or the area to pinch pennies. The Marriott provides the greatest value in Wailea, I believe. The upgrades to the pools since our last visit are outstanding, and the children's play area is really great with two good waterslides. If you are traveling with you children (mine were 8 and 9 at the time) make sure you see the Luau from the Children's pool one evening (my kids still talk about the fire dancer) and head to Cheeseburger in paradise at the Mall. I enjoyed my week here, and don't regret booking at all. Travel safe!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, but that's all you get.......”
Reviews.Author: timlass
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Wailea Beach Marriot Resort & Spa for my honeymoon and must say that it was one of the worst experiences I could have imagined. First, I must say that the location is beautiful, the resort is set up perfectly and from appearances, you almost think that you have died and gone to heaven. However, that is where the wonder ends. First, the concierge desk staff was horrid. They tell you nothing about all the hidden fees, and then they hit you with it at the end of your stay. Perhaps this is something that is true of most hotels, but until now, I have not experienced it. The staff at the Marriot Wailea look at those people staying at their hotel not as guests, but as potential customers. Everything there is a possible sale, and if you do not purchase it (whatever little thing it may be) they do not treat you as even a person after. They don't talk with you, offer you anything; they don't even smile at you. To them, everything is a sale, and they will sell you anything that they can. There is no complimentary internet service, which is practically standard at any other hotel on the planet. The cleaning service forgets one important thing every day, and that is to actually clean the room. They are so busy trying to nail each guest on drinking bottled water or any other possible purchases, that for two days the staff actually DID NOT CLEAN THE ROOM. We didn't get fresh towels, even after asking the front desk to send some down for us. Also, if you don't want to be killing bugs every night in your room, you might not want to stay here. I spent every night killing one form of insect infestation after another. The Mala restaurant has wonderful food, but the staff is atrocious. They push the most expensive items on the menu, and if you don't order that item, they do not offer you any basic hospitality from then on out for the rest of the night. The food that we ordered was spectacular, but the waitress was so snotty, we actually did not want to dine there again. As I said, the location is beautiful, the resort looks great, and the Serenity pool is just that, serene. The idea of not allowing children into an adult pool was so nice, and watching the sunset from the Serenity pool is amazing. If the only thing that you are interested in is sitting in a beautiful location and spending money, then the Marriot Wailea is for you. However, if you want to be treated like a guest and not a dollar sign; if you want at least the basic hospitalilty that you would get elsewhere, if not better; and if you want to have a truly leisure filled experience, there are other places to stay. DO NOT STAY AT THE MARRIOT WAILEA!!!!! It's not worth the money. I recommend The Four Seasons Resort down the road. I wasn't even a guest there, just having dinner one night, and they treated me better in two hours than the Marriot did in three days. I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Wailea”
Reviews.Author: jepperson1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Setting and views were amazing. Not the best hotel for kids unless you want to just hang around the pools or beach. Awesome Golf within minutes. Sunset over the infinity pool at night. You can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: yellow1NewJersey
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay in Wailea. On beach, close to other resorts, great walking trail. Next to shopping mall with restaurants and cafes. Good golf across the street. Several good pools. Rooms were well sized.

Reviews.Title: “I paid for â€œAwesomeâ€� and got â€œAverageâ€�.”
Reviews.Author: ilovemaui109R
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip in 10 years to the Marriott Wailea. My wife and I were married there 10 years ago when it was the Outrigger Wailea. The fist trip was spectacular, with service that you would expect from a place that expensive. The second (5 yrs after being married there) was very good. The third (7 years after marriage) was not so great due to ongoing construction that was "suppose to have been finished". The hotel was just not up to par, but with the construction I felt that they were doing the best that they could. Now on to our recent trip October 09. We spent the first five days in Hawaii at a condo. No restaurant, no bars, no frills. It was fine but we were looking forward to the Marriott experience. After a day at the Marriott, we were wishing for the condo (at $99 a night!) The breakfast buffet that was so awesome in years past (included with room) was a HUGE disappointment. In the past it was something different every day and spectacular at that, this year was the same thing every day! How many days can you have pancakes? COME ON! The rooms had "boat anchorâ€� tube TV's, not even wall mounted flat screens you can get at the Best Western. The floors in the rooms are tile now, and NOT clean. After the first night walking around bare foot, we ended up wearing flip-flops because our feet were black. Even after twice requesting that they floors be cleaned, they were not. The "upgraded" ocean front room was nice, but we've had better rooms there. I think that the "upgrade" was a farce. We paid for oceanfront, and supposedly got "Deluxe Ocean Front". I question the upgrade, the pictures on the front desk of the deluxe room was not what we had. Still, a beautiful view of the spot that we were married right out our rooms sliding glass door. The serenity pool was nice, but a bit stuffy. The retable cabanas were more like displays for all to see. No privacy AT ALL. Poor design for sure. The nicest pool was above the water slide, there was almost no one ever there. The pools were very cold, no heating whatsoever. The poolside restaurant and workers were great, from the bar tenders to wait staff. These are the people and service that I remember. That being said, they close at 7:30 PM now. No drinks by the pool in to the night, which was always a great place to be after dark. Are you kidding me? The Marriott is missing a big money maker here. The restaurant upstairs is open but does not service the pool area and a swimsuit and t-shirt are not correct attire. This was a big disappointment. With the additional resort fees and parking charges I feel that we did not get our moneys worth. I may stay again because of the sentimental thing, but it will be for a few days, certainly not 8 like this time. With all the above being said, the bright spot at the hotel was an employee named Frank Hill. This man from New York now living on Maui exudes the â€œAloha Spiritâ€�. Some locals that work at the hotel could learn from this guy, he knows how to treat guests. This guy needs to be in charge of the hotel. Are you listening Marriott Wailea? Frank and the workers at the poolside bar saved this trip from being a â€œwashâ€� to being a decent trip. Nice area, average service. There are better places to stay with much more accommodating employees. Iâ€™ve had better service and paid much less.

Reviews.Title: “Wailea is sublime”
Reviews.Author: gljackson
Reviews.Content: Marriott service and accomodations were up to their usual high standards (we own 2 timeshares with them and have stayed at numerous Marriott hotels). We've never stayed here before but we found we really liked Wailea. It's beautiful, and while it's a bit removed from Kihei and Lahaina, there's plenty to do nearby - shopping, eating, recreation. If you're looking for a truly relaxing stay in Maui, you can do no better than this. We spent a lot of time in their infinity pool with it's view of the ocean. Their restaurants on-site were quite good, too, especially their famous Kobe cheeseburger (I know, but you have to try it to see why it's worth $17). And be sure to make the trek to the south to see the lava fields of the last volcano activity on the island (over 100 years ago - on a geological scale, that's like just yesterday). Incredible waves down there, too. That's why you find mostly locals there, and while it's only for serious surfers, it's beautiful and awesome for the rest of us to look at.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SolarEcoGeek
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Wailea Marriott. There was construction going on during our stay, and our room's beach view was obstructed a bit by the construction, but overall our stay was almost perfect. The bed/mattress was very comfortable and we had a nice Lanai overlooking the beach. The restaurants were nothing to write home about, but we don't frequent hotel restaurants anyway. Overall I enjoyed our stay thouroughly.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly average hotel but GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: beessarebest
Reviews.Content: I concur with reviewer jshayden. Stay at this Marriott if you can get a great deal through an online travel agency. You may choose to skip a hotel package that provides breakfast with the room since the buffet breakfast was exactly the same every morning. No attempt at varying the offerings. The serenity pool (for adults only) provided a great hangout every evening at sunset. Loved that. A couple of the waitresses poolside were friendly and our housekeeper was very nice. Arman at the front desk was very helpful as well. The rest of the staff was courteous but not overly friendly. The Shops of Wailea are located right behind the hotel with more eating choices, Longhis, Ruth's Chris, Charley's Cheesburgers and Tommy Bahama Cafe (great drinks at the bar). You can walk the beaches quite a distance starting from the beach just north of the property. There is a 3 mile paved walkway along the shore as well but look out for all the runners!! Another reviewer mentioned that the air conditioning cannot be set below 65 which made for a less than comfortable room at night. The other advantage of staying at this Marriott, you can easily walk onto the more elaborate properties south of the Marriott and enjoy their restaurants and spas. Recommending this hotel for location but look for a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware...”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveler52
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a beautiful location, but the poor service and hidden charges ruined the experience. When we checked in to our "ocean view" room, we were told that the $25 resort fee was a mandatory fee that could not be waived. We were also charged $3 per bag for bell service (a charge that was not disclosed until we received our bill upon checking out). When we got to our room in the tower (don't stay in the tower - request a room in one of the Hale buildings; trust me!), we found cockroaches and a view of the property next door. Within 30 minutes of being in the room we experienced several instances of vehicles beeping as they backed up. Upon checking further, we discovered that we were over a service/delivery entrance. When we spoke with the front desk about relocating we were told that we could not move until the next morning, and that there were no rooms available unless we wanted to upgrade for an additional $125/night. The front desk staff and evening manager were very rude through this entire process. In fact, the evening desk manager, Marissa, even stated disgustedly, "that's the room you get for the rate". We went ahead and paid the additional cost for the upgraded room (which was truly a beautiful ocean view), but later discovered that the hotel was filled to less than 60% capacity with plenty of rooms available. The Mala restaurant was also not up to par. We tried breakfast there one morning and were served moldy fruit - yuck! Not something that I would expect anywhere, particularly at $20+ per plate! The server at the poolside restaurant (Kumu?) was fantastic - very friendly, good service. The special event servers were also very good. This hotel is not up to Marriott standards - your money would be much better spent at the Grand Wailea Resort next door, which offers very comparable rates, gorgeous pools, an amazing beach and the type of service one would hope for at a vacation resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Honeymooners61
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research into Wailea hotels for our honeymoon and we definitely got it right! This hotel is in a fantastic location in the Wailea resort area with beautiful sandy beaches either side which were no where near crowded ( although we were there in October out of peak season). The Tranquility Pool over looking the ocean is the best pool with the most amazing view we've ever experienced. Even though the hotel restaurant was somewhat limited the beautiful beach walk allowed us to visit the other hotels in the area very easily to try their restaurants. With everything in such easy walking distance (no more than 5-10mins) we were able to explore and were not restricted to the hotel. Hotel Luau was a lot of fun, but go early to get a good seat and make the most of the food and dink on offer. Overall a wonderful stay and most memorable honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Redpare
Reviews.Content: This open-aired, huge hotel is extremely worth it. It is situated right up along the water, even though the nearest beach is about 5 miles away. It has 3 pools (including an adult pool), a restaurant, friendly staff, water slides and much much more! Definately worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: sedaghatlaw03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one week in October 2009. Our room (6110) was steps from the ocean. It was very peaceful and quiet. This is not a party hotel, which we were definitely not looking for. It is a place for people to chill out and just enjoy the wonderful view, amenities (the best pool was the infinity pool, which is the only one in the area), food (fresh fish every day), and many fun activities like snorkeling, boat rides, luau etc. My husband has his heart set on returning next year for at least two weeks. We fell in love with Hawaii and with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ricechex01
Reviews.Content: Can't complain too much as we got a killer deal on priceline. However, for those of you using points or Marriott site, here is the review: We had room 822 in the Tower, with an obstructed view of the ocean. We thought this was quite grand, until Tuesday morning, when trucks came through the loading dock 8 stories below us from about 8-10 AM. This continued daily, but less trucks after the first day following the holiday weekend. It may been less pleasant on the floors closer to ground level. The room is furnished and decorated in faux island style with bambooish wood and plastic rattan. The bed is comfy with nice sheets/comforter and pillows. The AC only goes to 65, which at times can still be a little warm. Room service is pricey, stock up at the store. Ulua Beach is visible from the end of the lanai and you can see if it's crowded or not. It was nice and only a stone's throw away, and the pools are as stated. Service was friendly and the bed was very comfortable. Four stars are an appropriate rating for this hotel. Recommend a stop to Safeway to make fresh sandwiches in the room, as even the food trucks are pricey in Maui. A mahi mahi burrito was $9. If you go into Kihei to eat, recommend Thailand Cuisine. Do not eat at Aroma D'Italia Ristorante! We had low expectations for Italian food in Maui, but when both our pasta dishes came served in a watery soup broth, we were disappointed. C'mon now, everyone knows to drain the pasta noodles before serving. It was completely careless and for the price, the cook should know better. The Big Beach is fabulous, and only a short drive away. Overall, we had a wonderful stay and would be back to this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Overall okay, nothing spectacular.”
Reviews.Author: jshayden
Reviews.Content: I would give it a 31/2, not quite a four. They do have a nice pool for 21 and over, kids pool and 2 other anybody pools. Wailea is a nice spot to be on Maui, almost always sunshine, nice view of Molokini, Lanai, and the other small private island. Food was fine, I always like to eat outside of resorts. I have stayed at Marriot on Kaui, like that one much better. Overall, okay place to stay (would stay there again, but may search other hotels in area to compare).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: JohnWayneTX
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and great kids pool. Location is great acces to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: jlagmay
Reviews.Content: This was part of a flight & hotel package deal through Triple-A and Pleasant Hawaiian Holildays. I was a little scared after reading a few poor reviews but we had a very pleasant stay at the Wailea Beach Marriott. The roomsitself was nothing extraordinary, but quite adequate. I did hate paying the $25/day add'l resort fee but I think many resort hotels in Wailea do the same. But the grounds are beautifully landscaped and we had a gorgeous ocean view, and all services were quite satisfactory. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is heaven if you have the right room!”
Reviews.Author: Waterloversc
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at this Marriott and were just delighted. However, the room choice is critical. The management first put us in a room overlooking the kiddie pools - great if you have young children, a bummer if you're alone with your spouse! They amenably moved us to a beautiful room in the tower with a gorgeous ocean view. We could see the humpback whales breaching from the comfort of our luxurious bed! We don't like large massive resorts and this hotel felt just right. The pools were a bit chilly but very inviting. We didn't spend much time at the pools because the weather was actually cool and windy. Grounds are lovely and the walk along the Wailea waterfront is always so enticing and relaxing. Service was excellent - our housekeeper made us feel so at home and she had a contagious smile for us every morning. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jodinmissouri
Reviews.Content: our 1st time on Maui & who could not love it !!!~ Marriott Wailea is a great location, somewhat secluded, not too much traffic, beautiful grounds but conveniently located right behind an upscale shopping area with many restaurants & nice shopping. appears to be a very safe upscale area. beautiful beaches on both sides of hotel, great walking path directly beachfront, nice workout room with bottled water, fresh fruit, prices for food onsite are average, you really spend about just as much going out to restaurants, kiddie pool is awesome, water slides, infinity pools are beautiful, very serene, Marriott beds are so comfy, wanted to take it home (they have an online store & you can actually purchase the same mattress/bedding ..but pretty expensive, I looked), our partial ocean view was slightly obstructed by foliage so we requested to move & we were upgraded to full ocean front room (no additional cost). There is an additional daily hotel fee ($25 I think ?) & fee not for anything specific except for staying there so as long as you know upfront that you will have to pay this on check-out, you wonâ€™t be upset. We rented a car the entire week which was so cheap & the island is fairly small so we drove ourselves around & easily found all the attractions without any tours or gps~ will defiantly go back, canâ€™t wait !!! loved it, loved it !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location next to the ocean”
Reviews.Author: SLSNM
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, this is the best location on Wailea beach with the closest proximity to the ocean. The infinity pool is absolutely beautiful with the most perfect sunsets every evening. A great place for relaxing and I thoroughly enjoyed the spa and the lomi lomi massage as well. I will definitely return to this Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - nice hotel, still a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: kkhart
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights broken in to two stays over the course of a week. My husband cashed in his points and booked us in an ocean front room. The hotel is on a bluff next to the ocean an in between two beaches. The room all look and appear to be furnished exactly the same (down to the artwork)- the difference is in room location. Floors are tile, the bathroom is a little small, plush towels, there is a mini fridge, furnishings are comfortable but sort of modern corporate hotel. Nice lanai with table and chairs. My husband hated the bed - it is a plush pillow top that is a little soft. The staff is efficient, but not what I would call friendly or attentive. After the initial ebullient greeting we received from the valet, I was told I had to move the car while my husband checked in since we were not going to valet park. Kind of negated the shell lei. Valet parking is $18 a night, self parking is $15. There is an optional $25 per night "resort fee" which includes parking and a bottle of water - we declined. We had a great view of the ocean and could hear the waves from our room if we left the lanai door open - which turns off the air conditioning and there is no ceiling fan. But we were on the third floor, so caught the breeze. The first room was pretty quiet and we had no issues. But the second visit we were in a room one floor down and over and we heard EVERYTHING in the rooms to ether side, above and below. It was very strange to have such a difference with such a small location change. The serenity pool is very nice, but it was impossible to get a chair with any shade in the afternoon unless you rented a cabana or camped out there all day. There are a total of four pools, including a kid's pool and one with a water slide. The little beach has amazing snorkeling and easy swimming. We had dinner in the restaurant, which was good, but not really an inspired menu. We attended the luau and it had surprisingly good food at the buffet and the show was quite good. I recommend it. Our last night of the first visit was marred by a party held on the lawn in front of our room with the WORST, LOUDEST cover band on the isle of Maui. Every crappy song ever stuck in your memory was hauled out and mangled. They had it cranked so you could hear it up at the shopping center. I was initially told by the front desk the amplified music would be over by 9 pm. When it was going strong (sweet home Alabama, anyone?) at 9:15 I was told security was going to head over there and it should end at 9:30. Finally, at 10, the band was unplugged. It was so loud that we could not talk to each other in the room with the doors closed and the curtains drawn. I fault the hotel for not managing the issue â€“ we have stayed at other hotels with similar situations and never had to deal with the volume level or missing time deadlines. I don't think I would stay here again unless it was on points - not worth it for the published rates.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: LPogo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing special. The one (1) restaurant that is open is very average at best. The service was consistently poor and not well trained. The massage service is very, very pricey ($181 for 50 minutes) and frankly was below average. After one massage here we found a local service up the road that was twice as good and half the cost. This was my fourth visit to Maui and very hard to give this the same marks as the Westin or Fairmont (both much better in my opinion). Although the hotel was not dated it just seemed like it was an old place that someone put some polish on. The ceiling were in the hallways (about 6 1/2 feet) and stairwells (less than 6 feet in some areas). Everything was the typical Hawaii expensive, but this property just didn't seem to be able to justify it. Adult infinity pool is very nice and relaxing

Reviews.Title: “Do not go to the Marriott Wailea Lau'a”
Reviews.Author: maplesugar120
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went to the Lau'a on 09/21/09 and the first problem we had was with their parking the slots were not big enough for our cars to fit and get out the door so many people were driving around to park. Then you walk down and to be seated you sit in the sun for dinner so everyone has sweat pooring off them. The food is least to be desired and you dont get to see the pig in the ground for which on the Big island they take you through a whole ritual. Then the entertainment was so poor that I got bored. There was not very many dancers and they were young and only seemed to know one dance basically. Save your money or go to the one on the Big island for this one is simply not worth the money you spend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, peaceful, serene, breathtaking views”
Reviews.Author: collegemom2-1
Reviews.Content: We wanted a relaxing, restful setting without a lot of hoopla - this was a great location. We were celebrating our 30th anniversary and even renewed our vows on the lawn by the ocean. Simply spectacular! The hotel accommodated our every need. Cindy, the hotel's event planner, did an outstanding job with recommendations and planning. We stayed in the deluxe ocean front room (3214) - definitely worth the upgrade. As others have stated, this hotel is so close to the ocean, the balcony of the room we were in was mere feet from the ocean with awesome views. Very romantic. The staff was very friendly and professional. The adults only infinity pool is not only beautiful, but very quiet and relaxing. There is a walking path in front of the hotel that is about 1.5 miles long and goes past the neighboring hotels with incredible vistas along the way. The beaches are a short walk a way, but the snorkeling around the reefs was full of colorful fish and coral. I would recommend a snorkeling trip to Turtle Town where you can see the green turtles up close and personal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tourist100007
Reviews.Content: Clean and perfectly located with an absolutely beautiful infinity pool. I stayed here two months ago and I'm still thinking fondly of it!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel to explore Maui - but good value only with a deal!”
Reviews.Author: jc11235
Reviews.Content: Bid on priceline and got an absolutely GREAT deal here. I am a Marriott Rewards member, and presumably because of that, we were given 2 Ocean View rooms. We were able to decline the resort fee, but took the valet parking for $18 (regular parking was $15) which seemed better value. I was disappointed the rooms were on the ground/1st floor, and the rooms were not communicating, but at least they were next to each other. We were offered a suite for $150/night extra, which with hindsight I wish I had taken. Otherwise I thought this a very nice hotel, but not really a â€œresortâ€�. The restaurants were disappointing â€“ little atmosphere, and the food was unexciting. The breakfast place was very unimpressive and poor value. The pools were great, and my children really enjoyed them and the slides. The hotel is closer to the beach than others, which means an Ocean View/front room really does put you close to the seafront. The adult pool was beautiful â€“ stunning view! We used the hotel as a base for touring, and it certainly suited us for that. The hotel is right next to the Shops at Wailea, where there were several very nice restaurants and plenty of shops. Rooms were comfortable and clean. The empty refrigerator was also convenient. I felt service generally to be indifferent with few exceptions â€“ I was disappointed that when we were booking an activity with the concierge, he interrupted us to deal with someone else, making us wait a considerable amount of time whilst he dealt with them having given the impression it would be quick. Also found him patronising rather than especially helpful/knowledgeable as one would expect. As a place to base oneself whilst exploring the island, this is a great place to stay. Wailea is conventient for exploring the island and the Marriott is comfortable and clean, and located next to the Shops at Wailea where you can grab snacks and meals. For the rack rate, you can probably do better elsewhere, but with a deal, this place becomes excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “excellent all-around choice for Wailea”
Reviews.Author: DiMe2
Reviews.Content: Bad reviews of this hotel freaked me out before my recent trip to Maui, so I thought I better add a good one to put your mind at ease. (Though those posted since my return are fairer and closer to the mark, for what it's worth.) Location: excellent. Ulua Beach is brilliant for snorkeling. For the "best" beach in Wailea, head in your car a few miles south to Big Beach (it's featured on the cover of many guide books). Far superior to any of those in front of the other big hotels. Speaking of hotels, if Trump/Disney/Vegas is your aesthetic, then, yes, you would be better off paying hundreds of dollars more to stay at the Grand Wailea. I say this because the bad reviews all tend to compare this to the other three properties in the area, all of which are, again, hundreds of dollars more. The Marriott is a Marriott, which means that you get comfort, cleanliness, good amenities in a vaguely corporate setting. You will be closer to the beach than at the other hotels (it was built before restrictions about distance from property to shoreline were implemented). Mala restaurant is quite good, especially for vegetarians. Refrigerator is big enough to hold breakfast and lunch food. Marriott offered a "parking only" fee ($15) or a "resort fee" ($25). This was hugely appreciated -- I think in a better economy you wouldn't get the option and would be stuck with the higher fee. Staff are all uniformly excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay - will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: SnowandSunbunny
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Marriott in Wailea for a wedding from September 13 - 16th and would definitely recommend it as a great destination for travelers. I should preface that we booked this hotel at an unbelievable rate through Priceline, and were able to stay for hundreds less per night than the neighboring Grand Wailea. The staff at the Marriott was very friendly, particularly Terri who worked at the pool-side bar/cafe! In September the hotel was not particularly crowded - the way we prefer to vacation, and as beach-sitting isn't our ideal, we weren't concerned about the lack of direct beach access. For those interested, the beach at the Grand Wailea is a very short stroll from the Marriott. The overall vibe of the Marriott is laid-back and low-key and not as blatantly grandiose as neighboring hotels. The nearby Shops at Wailea has a combination of ritzy high-end shops, an ABC convenience store and restaurants. We did frequent Cheesburger Island Style for breakfast as a much less expensive, and more varied breakfast, lunch or dinner option. Our room was clean, large, bright, and updated and the bed was very comfortable. We would easily be willing to pay double or triple the rate of last time to stay at the Marriott again. We have already begun planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Views, Dining, and Diving Instruction in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: chattyjenny
Reviews.Content: The Marriott has the best ocean views in Wailea (it was built before the other hotels, prior to rules against building so close to the beach). The restaurant - Malo - is fantastic. It was opened a year and a half ago, owned by Clint Eastwood. Better food / wine and less expensive than the restaurants at the Four Seasons. If you want to scuba dive, ask for Crawford. Best diving instructor ever. This hotel surpassed our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Passable, but you can do much better in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Aej007
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Marriott Sept. 4-11, 2009 with my parents and brother. In terms of locations in Maui, I greatly prefer Wailea. The setting is top notch, and the vibe is not quite so touristy. Discovered some excellent snorkeling too at Ulua Beach (to the right of the Marriott). As others have mentioned, the Marriott is an older property (think 1970s) and has no direct beach access. The adults-only infinity pool is the only notable highlight -- it has an excellent view, with a pretty decent pool-side menu and some capable servers.
