But it quickly grows frustrating not to have chair service on the beach. You're basically confined to the pool if you want to be able to sit on something other than a towel. I've stayed at the Fairmont as well and would not go back to the Marriott again over it, simply for the beach alone. Service was perfunctory for the most part. We had some issues with our keys not working at times and the housekeeping service wasn't as thorough as it could have been, but no other real complaints. The breakfast buffet at Mala was included in our room rate but was average and not something I'd shell out $25 for on my own. The Marriott is passable, and would be a stronger candidate if you were staying on points or got a really competitive deal. But otherwise I'd go elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Great location (no beach), Okay Hotel, Poor Service...”
Reviews.Author: danandthangy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Marriott 9/13/09-9/19/09 for our honeymoon. This is an older hotel and is not as nice as the surrounding properties in Wailea; although it is a bit cheaper. The adult pool was very nice and had a great view. We were in a bottom floor unit within a few steps of the adult pool and loved our location. The adult pool is definitely the highlight of this hotel. It is very romantic and has beautiful views of the walking path, and ocean. This hotel does not have a beach! We strolled on over to the Grand Wailea beach once and found allot of bodysurfers, as this water is very rough in comparison to Kaanapalli. Too rough to even snorkel during the time we were there. We found the staff there to be very rude! On our first night we took a romatic stroll on the beach front path with front the hotels in Wailea; upon returning we coudnt find our room as we were unfamiliar with the hotel. We asked the pool attendent if he knew where #1404 was, and his reply was that that hotel room "doesnt exist"! We were perplexed as we had just arrived and were unfamiliar with the hotel grounds. We finally found our room, and confirmed it was indeed #1404. I returned to the location of the pool attendant to inform him that we found our room, has was so sure that he again stated that there was no such room! He then checked a print out of all the guests and there rooms, only to confirm that there was such a room number. He appoligized to me, but again should had done his due dilligence and check his list before blurting out the wrong information! Wailea was a very laid back location with no nightlife, and overpriced shopping. We were okay with that as we were on our honeymoon and were there to relax; we did find there was a more upbeat vibe and much more activity at the nearby Grand Wailea and their pools. The Marriott was okay, definitely a very quite, older hotel, with a nice adult pool.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: jonesdc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort for 6 nights. After reading some of the reviews we were slightly concerned about the hotel especially since we were staying with points, but as soon as we walked onto the resort we got VIP treatment. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful with everything from service, island activities, and room service. The serenity pool is one of the best parts of the hotel. We rented the cabanas for $25 per day, the grounds are well kept, and the hotel is extremely clean. Our room was upgraded at check in and the room were cleaned by 11 am every morning. The bed is extremely soft but i was surprised that my back did not hurt by the end of the trip. The staff was helpful in finding activities, directions, and general making sure we had a good time. The food is slightly overpriced but worth the effort if you want to be lazy. The resort is not crowded so you feel like you are on vacation. Our experience here at the Marriott is wonderful.. we could not have asked for a better place to stay. ALso, celebrities stay here as well.... we saw a couple while we stayed here. Recommendations.. Rent a car, Do the Road to Hona, Fred's Mexican restaurant nearby is the best mexician food i have had a in a long time. Whaler's Village has the hula restaurant with a great hula pie for desert. Mamma's Fish HOuse is the best. IF you rent a car opt for the resort fee so daily parking will be included.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Beautiful Setting”
Reviews.Author: Igo57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on points last month for 7 nights, check in was very smooth. I read about the $25 resort fee and inquired about that - It's not mandatory, they said it was an option... you receive a couple of drinks, bottle of water, discounts to the spa, and daily parking. Or you can just pay the $15 nightly parking fee. We opted to just pay the daily parking fee... yet in the end we were never charged for parking which was a bonus. Had a nice gardenview room on the 4th floor which was very quite. The hotel setting is just beautiful. Very close to the shops at Wailea...went to the ABC store and purchased breakfast foods which we enjoyed on our balcony most mornings. Had lunch a couple of times at the poolside resturant and the food was very good. Yes, parking can be an issue in the covered garage - looked like everyone wanted to park under cover. We parked on the upper deck and never had a problem. The adult pool is nice - nothing special - We didn't really spend that much time at the resort. But it looked like you would need to get there early if you want a pool side lounge chair or you could pay for the cabana, since that was the only shade you would find at that pool. The exersice room room was very nice and never really crowded. Hubby played golf on the Emerald Course and Old Blue Course. Said he preferred the Old Blue Course. Would have went to the Spa but they wanted me to sign a wavier for my 16 year old daughter to have a facial, plus I would have had to sit in the room with her while she was having her facial. That sounded pretty ridiculous to me so we went to the spa next door at the Grand Wailea - What a bunch of hipe! I did not find that spa to be very relaxing at all. While getting my massage I heard the kids below jumping and playing in the pool - If that's what I wanted to hear I would have asked for a beach massage. Had dinner one night at Matteo's - 2 pizzas, antipasta, bottle of wine and dessert with tip was under $90. Had dinner at Mama's Fish House and Lahania Grill - both were nery nice. Also went to the Old Lahania Luau which was fun. Excursions we did were: Trilogy - Discover Lanai Sunset Sail - a great time!! Haleakala Bike Company - Awesome! Tim was our tour guide, very entertaining. Kai Kanani - Discover Molokini & Turtle Town - Better to go first thing in the morning. Road to Hana - We went all the way around, was a fun & thrilling day to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Not marriott quality”
Reviews.Author: gogolf53
Reviews.Content: Marriott should review this hotel ASAP. Nothing is Marriott quality...no flat screens, poor housekeeping, poor food, average quality employees, a health club that is anything but, and a spa that is fit for a one star hotel. I am a Platinum member and honestly, I felt like I was in a Holiday Inn. I paid for a room upgrade which gave a decent view but the room was in dire need of new bedding, cleaning, and appliances. MARRIOTT>>>>where are you??????????????

Reviews.Title: “MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: LEELEEMississippi
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, never have we had the service (lack there of), attitude and in general disconcern, at any hotel as we did here. My husband and I both travel 80% of the year for business and stay in Marriott and Hitlon hotels. This was a gift from my husband for a "girls week" in Maui. Supposedly upgraded since we are platinum elite memebers, not so ! Paid hefty for upgrade, unfortunately the room was not very nice but the view was great. Housekeeping never managed to leave more than 2 towels, regardless of request since there were 3 of us. Floors were not mopped, beds horrible and usually not cleaned before 3. Concierge had contacted us prior to arrival and we requested dinner reservations, lua, and 2 off shore excursions. Email confirmed this was handled. VERY disappointed to arrive and find NOTHING had been done as we were told. Scrambled to make arrangements on our own. Also, we had received request from hotel to choose amenities for room upon arrival. (elite privilege supposedly) I made fruit and wine selections as to surprise my traveling companions. HOW EMBARRASSING...when I called the concierge to request they be sent up, I was told "right away", I then received another call saying since Mr. Garner was not in the room, this was not available. HOW INCONSIDERATE !!! Especially since contact with the hotel had the room set up for me and my 2 guests by name and had been offered... The hotel was very outdated, paint peeling in outdoor hallways, landscape was only nice in the FRONT, dead foilage across the back and side, nothing plush or beautiful about this setting. Pictures were very decieving on website. For my guests' first visit to Maui expecting all of the wonderful resort pleasurers, it was a major disappointment. Imagine being told our room didnt qualify for Q-TIPS when I requested a pack (3) from the housekeeping cart. Oceanview rooms come at a steep price, cant imagine what it would take to qualify... It got worse upon departure. I had requested late check out since we had a late flight. Was told no problem, THEN, only until 1:00 or it would cost another $100. VERY LONG STORY SHORT, it went from 1 to 2 p.m., then had to change rooms ater 1:00, WHAT A DISASTER !!!! The staff was rude, inconsiderate and seemed to think they were doing us a favor by allowing us to stay there. THE BEST hotel service was valet !!!!!! DO YOURSELF A FAVOR...STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: msun4
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly 4 star hotel. The property is very beautiful and it's location is lovely along the coast of Wailea and right next to a high end mall. The convenience is good in that sense. BUT, the rooms are very average, with the bed being overly soft. It was like sleeping on a deflated air mattress with a sinking hole in the middle. Like I said, spot on for a 4 star, not an ounce more. Rooms are clean and spacious. Housekeeping is a bit lazy, they hardly clean or dust, daily maintenance includes stocking fresh towels and making of the bed. I suppose that's fine when everything is new. At least it looks clean until you realize they didn't even vacuum and there are still bits of small glass from a broken glass the night before! They were a bit stingy with the toiletries; cutting cotton swabs all together and things like adapters (for overseas guests) can't be requested anymore, you'd have to buy them if you forgot them. Generally, there is so much to do on Maui, you hardly spend any time in the room at all. So, in that sense, the prices are very expensive. However, the infinity pool and the pool-side menu offerings are worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Tear this place down!”
Reviews.Author: eekthetripsinaweek
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a quick weekend getaway. Our room category was their very highest, Oceanfront Suite, blah, blah, blah. To be brief, let me just say that the place supposedly already received a recent facelift, but I guess they should have gone for the entire shibang because it was still pretty sorry, dated and plain skanky. I'm never going back to this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Wailea . . . .”
Reviews.Author: NHfamilytravels
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in paradise. View is postcard perfect. Pool is incredible. Hotel does charge for internet and drinks at the pool are on the high side . . . . Rooms are spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good atmosphere, with some drawbacks...”
Reviews.Author: oxman78
Reviews.Content: My partner and I traveled here in early August 2009. We had an oceanfront deluxe room on the ground floor. WHAT WE LIKED... ROOM SIZE: The size of the room product worked quite well for us. We had a king size bed and a sofa with a pull out (probably about a double bed). There was a fridge in the room that was empty (no mini bar--which was perfect for us). The empty fridge allowed us to buy drinks and keep them cool without maneuvering around various minibar items. The closet was also a nice size. The vanity area was fine in size, but I have other concerns about that (see below). The lanais and balconies on the rooms are also a good size--perfect for a couple to do a meal facing the ocean. LOCATION: This is a great place in Wailea. It sits at the end of the coastal walking path that goes from the Marriott to the Fairmont Kei Lani, so it's great access to the other resorts but there aren't masses of people walking through the Marriott. It's also a great walking/running path for those who want to do a bit of exercise...the view up and down the path is great as well. ATMOSPHERE/RESTAURANT: Mala, the hotel's restaurant (operated by an outside restaurant company with a sister restaurant in Lahaina) was reasonable as resorts on Maui go. The full breakfast buffet was about $26 and the continental buffet was about $18. At home that would be outrageous, but on Maui that's not bad. They also have a la carte options for breakfast that are decently priced. Dinner there was satisfying, not "rave-able" but satisfying. The overall grounds of the hotel are also quite nice. It's not grandiose or over the top (a la Grand Wailea) and it's quieter than the other resorts in the area. It also seems to be quieter than the busy resorts in Kaanapali. WHAT COULD HAVE BEEN BETTER... LACK OF BEACH SERVICES: While the hotel has close access to two beaches, it is not precisely beachfront. Therefore, the hotel doesn't provide any beach services. They do not set up chairs or umbrellas like the Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons. This would have been a nice service to have given it is Hawaii. The beach services of the other hotels are only available to the guests of those hotels, so if you're at the Marriott, you bring your towel and expect no more. BEACH TOWEL RATIONING: Speaking of beach towels, the rationing system is inconvenient. While I understand the hotel wanting to keep account of their towels, every time we wanted a new towel we had to trek over to the pool and exchange them. There is a card system where you will be issued one card per person. You trade the cards for towels at the one and only towel station by the pool. Then you can trade the towels back in for new ones when necessary. This was not the best system for us as we were in a far Hale and we had to walk away from the beach to go get a towel. This won't be as much of an issue for pool users, but why would I go all the way to Hawaii to sit by a pool all the time? I can trek to Vegas for that and it will be a lot cheaper. ROOM BATHROOM: The bathroom area could use some improvements. The vanity, while a nice sized area, could have used a dual sink vanity instead of the single sink. The shower/toilet area was also quite small. Also, because the air conditioning is on the other side of the room pointing the opposite direction, the bathroom could get quite warm. NO CEILING FAN: Considering the rooms were recently redone, I think it is a huge miss that there was no ceiling fan in the room. Your choices were air conditioning or leave the sliding door open and pray for air movement. We would have loved to open our sliding door and had the ceiling fan on rather than living in the AC all night. Unfortunately, that was not an option. LIGHTING: While I do like to do my part to save mother earth, there are right and wrong places for CFL lights. Dimming lamps and light fixtures are not the right places for them. Our desk lamp sounded like it was going to bring Frankenstein back to life. The other "dimming" light fixtures didn't so much dim as just go out. I can understand the CFLs in the bathroom and in some of the light fixtures (e.g. floor lamp), but it wasn't working for me in the other lights in the room. Further, the lanais and balconies have no lighting at all. If you want to sit on your balcony/lanai in the evening to read and listen to the surf, or even for dinner, you have to pull your floor lamp from the room out onto the lanai. We didn't do this, but as we walked around the resort, we could see that several people did. Another miss on the lighting. OVERALL... While my criticisms above may seem harsh, I will say that this is a recommendable hotel. Service was good and things were clean, at the end of the day, when you're in Hawaii you don't really care about much more than that. NOTE: Many resorts charge a "resort fee" which, in most cases, is a bogus way of nickle-and-diming you for stuff you don't want or need. In Marriott Wailea's case; however, the resort fee is useful! Their fee includes parking fees (in and out privileges of course), daily liter of water, two complimentary cups of coffee from their little quick serve shack, 20% off dinner at Mala (which nearly pays for a day right there), and a percentage off the Mandara Spa services (which we didn't use). As resort fees go, I think this one is much easier to stomach than most.

Reviews.Title: “Extra fees add up!”
Reviews.Author: marco123
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of the Marriott. Watch out for extra charges on EVERYTHING. Internet - $17 a day extra, self parking $14 a day extra, valet parking $18 a day extra. Why not just tell us what the price really is up front instead of knocking us out with just about everything that you want to do once you get there? Felt like bait and switch. The hotel itself was a little aged and worn, but overall very nice. We rate it just average for the price. If it was really the rate they quoted, and extras were included it would be a good value for the money. Service was hit and miss. We did run into a problem with some of the staff being much more concerned with their personal business than servicing the guests. Rooms a little small. Infinity pool looks better in pictures than real life, and the view of the ocean, while awesome was blocked from the infinity pool (also kind of small) The location was good and attached to high end shops and restaurants. To have a better time look in Kehei which is just a mile or so north of Wailea. Much more choice and much better value. Access to beaches to the South about another mile or so was excellent. Crystal clear waters.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a quiet area”
Reviews.Author: je1014
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was great. In particular their service was fantastic! So friendly and quick to respond to any need. When we had an issue with noise during the night above our room (we were under the bar) they moved us to an even better room where we couldn't get any closer to the ocean! It was a very comfortable place to stay, and I don't believe it was any more expensive than other places of comprable quality. Our dinner at MALA was fantastic. The front desk and bell staff were very friendly and quick to offer suggestions and conversation. We had just stayed at the Westin Moana Surfrider on Waikiki Beach in Oahu, and the service was night and day different. While it's true that it's not immediately in front of a beach, the beach is so close it might as well be on the Marriott's property. My only slight criticism is that the tile floors in the guest room seemed like they were never washed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: travelman91560
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7-night stay from August 5th through 12 where we used our Marriott points for all 7 nights. We (2 adults, 2 teenage kids) arrived around 6pm and were upgraded due to my Platinum status to a suite on the 8th floor facing the beach. The suite was spectacular â€“ one room was a standard room with two queens, fridge, bath and lanai with the second room being an oversized living room. It had a pull out couch, another bathroom, 2nd fridge, a large dining room table with chairs and a second oversized lanai. Most suites are two standards rooms converted into a suite but this was like two and a half rooms equivalent. The two kids stayed on the sofa bed, which gave us adults our privacy. The staff was helpful and friendly 100% of the time. We did not eat in the restaurants, but did get a smoothie poolside and it was good. Thereâ€™s a Safeway about 5 miles from the hotel so we bought most of breakfast and lunch stuff there and used the two refrigerators to store everything. There is an ABC store and Whalerâ€™s next door at the shopping center but the Safeway had much better selection and prices. We also had dinner our first night at the Cheeseburger place in the mall next door and thought the food was both tasty and reasonably priced. Service was a bit slow but we were in no big hurry. For dinner, we went out each night to various places. I know that Lahaina gets all the press and is certainly worth a visit, but we found Kihei to have a nice selection of moderately priced restaurants and nice shopping to boot. Kihei is only about 10 minutes away vs. 35-40 minutes away for Lahaina and has no issue with parking and traffic like Lahaina. The best meal we had was Fredâ€™s Mexican in Kihei and also had a great time at Lifeâ€™s a Beach (Tuesdays has $1 tacos and live music too!!). We had great pizza at Shaka (much better than Matteos, which is very close to the hotel but very average food.) Hotel pools were OK, nothing spectacular, the best being the adult pool. Someone else compared the Marriottâ€™s pools to the Grand Wailea next door or the Four Seasons two hotels down â€“ give me a break! Those hotels are at least twice the cost per night! Another reviewed mentioned spotty internet service and I agree. It would work in the morning but not in the afternoon or visa versa. And they don't offer wireless in the rooms, just the lobby. At $14 a day, the internet service should be world class and it stunk. The location is outstanding â€“ the two beaches on either side of the property are superb â€“ if you like snorkeling at all, try it at either beach and you will pleased. If you go to the beach on your right, keep walking past the lava rocks and youâ€™ll find another quarter mile of beach that is mostly deserted. Yes, the parking spots on the first level are a joke as they are too small unless you have a Smartcar. But itâ€™s not a problem if you use the second level of parking. We had a Ford Escape SUV and never had a problem finding a spot on the second level where we fit. Didnâ€™t use the Spa but we did walk around the locker room and steam shower and was happy to know that we could use them for free on our last day of checkout when our flight left at 8pm. Turns out though, that when I asked for a late checkout (2pm) on our last day, they offered to move us to a standard room on the first floor for our use until 6pm â€“ nice! We moved out of our room at noon and left the second room at around 6pm for the airport. Having a shower after a day at beach is a must before a 9 hour treck home. Iâ€™m not sure if that was done because of our Platinum status but itâ€™s worth asking for it â€“ I think they called it a hospitality room. We went on the Zip line by Skyline Eco-Adventures and thought it was a blast. It is cooler at this elevation so bring a light jacket or long pants if youâ€™re there in the morning. Atlantis submarine was just OK (I think I would try the Reef Dancer instead next time.) Jet Skis in front of the Hyatt was also lots of fun. Overall, we were very happy with the property, pools, room, service and location. No, this isnâ€™t the Four Seasons but we were all delighted with our stay and look forward to returning some day.

Reviews.Title: “A Favorite Spot”
Reviews.Author: LesterB
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Marriott many times, even back in the old days when it was the Intercontinental and then the Outrigger. It lacks the bells and whistles of the glitzy nearby GW, Kea Lani, and Four Seasons and I guess that's why I like it so much--it doesn't seem Las Vegas-y. It is quiet, the grounds are beautifully expansive, and you dont have to hike from your room to the ocean. I have stayed in all types of rooms there, this time we were in a very large, immaculate room in the high-rise for $169 a night (gov't rate.) The adult serenity pool is so lovely, peaceful, and the seaview from it is glorious. (I wish I were there right now, sigh.) Close to the Shops at Wailea (grab a delicious sandwich from the deli at Whalers and take it to the beach!) Evening is so beautiful there with the tiki torches. Love walking the beautiful beach path past all the other hotels. I don't like the fee-for-parking (the garage used to be free.) I also abhor the new-ish $25/night mandatory "resort fee." Ridiculous and very aggravating. The room rates are very reasonable when compared to the neighboring hotels. Yes, the Marriott is less luxurious than the others (but it is still classy.) Always love returning tho this hotel and the Wailea area in general. Husband works in Hawaii so I am over there often, the Wailea Marriott is always wonderful, IMO.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Wailea Marriott Resort”
Reviews.Author: michettism
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 had a 5 day stay at Wailea Marriott, after 4 days at Ko Olina and prior to 5 days in Waikiki. Resort was beautiful and room was clean and relatively roomy. The bellman took our bags up and presented us each with a shell Lei. I was disappointed in my ocean view room and with some service issues, but a brief conversation with the manager resulted in my immediate and total satisfaction - that is great service. We had a full agenda in maui, so we did not get to enjoy the resort as much as we would have liked. The beach is beautiful and you can walk all along the resorts in Wailea. We met folks in Lahina that were coming to Wailea for some of the best snorkeling on Maui, but we never got to snorkel in Wailea. The Shops at Wailea are directly next to Marriott and had great restaurants and other shops. The Kobe burger at Cheesburger in Paradise was delicious and breakfast at Longhi's was great, especially the lobster benedict. The drive to Lahina was about 35 minutes and we did this often. In Lahaina, we did the old Lahaina Luau and the Trilogy sunset sail to Lanai'i - both were awesome. In comparison to the Polynesian Cultural Center Luau and night show, the setting at Lahaina Luau was much more beautiful and the food was great. Drinks at Lahaina were terrific - no alcohol at PCC. . The PCC Luau was ok in comparison but the night show at PCC was incredible, especially the fire show at the end. My son took surf lessons in Lahaina as well and we had dinner at Kimo's. We self parked at Wailea and it was very convenient. The staff at the resort, including the shops and restuarants, were all very friendly and helpful. On our last day, we had about 3 hours to kill after breakfast before our flight so we went to the Maui Ocean Center. I probably would not have lost a day to go here, but it was a nice way to spend this time before our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing & Enjoyable stay at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: MrRelaxing
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (aged 42 & 38) stayed at the Marriott from July 12-17. Resort Location: The r(esort is located in the 2nd largest tourist area on Maui. While the Lahina/Kanapalli area is more widely known if you are travelling to Maui to relax, without kids and have done the whole shopping thing and Maui before I would strongly recommend Wailea. If it is your first time to Maui and you like to get out and shop or have kids you may want to consider the Kanapalli area for more activity and location of supporting venues. Wailea offers a more relaxed atmosphere where one can go to relax and enjoy the Hawaiian warmth and sun. Resort Area: While Lahina is the main shopping area which is about 30-45 minutes away by car, Wailea has a beautiful shopping mall, great beaches and very nice golf courses with a couple of high end dinner locations. The shopping mall is about 400 yards away from the hotel and segregated by terrain to still remain quiet and private. It is very nice to walk to the shopping area and have a nice dinner and just relax and have an easy 5 min stroll back to the hotel. At the mall you can find restaurants: Tommy Bahama (very good, but pricey), Ruth Chris steak house (excellent & expensive), the burger shack and a lot of other smaller places to grab a more mid-day type of snack. There is a Safeway grocery store about 10 minutes drive down the road but you can usually buy a lot of hotel room items at the malls â€œWhaler Storesâ€� Marriott Resort: The resort is very nice and set into different sections. We had an ocean/pool view room and the room was very nice with a nice little balcony to have breakfast on in the morning and drinks in the afternoon. Inside the King bed room we also had seating for 4 with a nice table for afternoon snacks with the family. There are 2 main pool areas. The adult pool is very quiet with a beautiful infinity pool with lots of room to move around and is only for adults. You can even rent cosy futons for $35 per day or go all out and rent the on the pool cabanas for $100. Personally, the free open seating is fine, but with all American resorts you should go reserve a place early to get the view/place you want. The other pool area contains 2 pools for families and kids and while we stayed there twice (with no kids) it was fine. The kids enjoyed themselves without being a bother to others just relaxing around. Of course both locations offer full food and beverage service at your chairs. Finally, there are 2 beautiful beaches to walk down to (2 min) that you can play in the Ocean and relax. Marriott Mana Restaurant: We only ate at this restaurant and both nights we ate there we were happy with the quantity and quality of food compared to price. As the resort is slower due to the economy we had great outdoor seats and we were able to watch the sunset while eating some very fresh Hawaiian fish dishes. Overall, if you have been to Maui or are a Marriott member this is a very relaxing enjoyable place to stay and would highly recommend it. If this is your first time to Maui with family you may want to consider Kanapalli beach area as that is where a lot of the activities and fun shopping is located.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Daneburg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Wailea for 5 nights in mid July after a 3 day stay in Honolulu at the Waikiki Marriott. The Wailea Marriott is a great hotel and a much different feel than the Waikiki property. The Wailea Marriott in Maui is in a GREAT location. The Shops at Wailea are right next door where you can grab a quick lunch or groceries at the Whaler's General Store or the ABC Store. The Wailea Marriott sits right between 2 beaches which are just a short 2 minute walk from the Marriott in either direction from the back of the property. There are beach chairs and umbrellas for rent on Wailea beach, but they are expensive and not that comfortable. The beach is beautiful and the water is amazing. There are multiple pools at the Marriott. The adult infinity pool was great. There are covered chairs with blue cushions for $25 a day which we would recommend, they were very comfortable. There are also 2 water slides at the "kids" pool which we would highly recommend. The rooms are really nice. The bathrooms are a good size and the beds are very comfortable. We had the breakfast buffet one morning at MaLa. It was $26.95 per person. We've had better buffets for a cheaper price. We also had dinner at Ma La on our last night which is the main/feature resturant of the resort. However, it was just ok. The service wasn't the greatest., and the food was not overly impressive. If you want to go eat, we would suggest to go into the town of Kihei. It's about 15 mins down the street. We ate at Fred's which was a great mexican resturant. Plus you have a great view of the ocean! The staff at the Marriott was great! They were really helpful with everything. The activities desk was very helpful. They booked us our Sky Trek tour which was a helicopter ride, then the road to Hana back. It was a great tour, we HIGHLY recommed it.

Reviews.Title: “Wailea Marrriott Luau is ANYTHING but the FINEST”
Reviews.Author: luvbeachwfam
Reviews.Content: This luau was a complete ripoff. We bought the tickets for 90 dollars each adult and we barely got a full dinner show. The performers thought it was going to rain (it never did) and cut the show very short with the fire dancer show taking place before sunset. The food was alright but everything seemed rushed. We also got devoured by mosquitoes and are still dealing with the aftermath of that on our trip! There was zero audience participation and this was much to the disappointment of our 4 year old. Go to the Old Lahaina Luau and FORGET THIS ONE.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: mommy808
Reviews.Content: Our family just got back from a wonderful weekend at the Marriot Wailea Beach Resort. We were able to book this resort with our airline rate, as both my husband and I work for an airline. We've stayed at many different hotels during our careers so we've seen it all!! The grounds of the hotel are just beautiful, the landscaping, and exceptional views were stunning. We are actually from Oahu and went to Maui on a staycation, so we are all too familiar with our stunning island views, but the sunset and view of the other neighboring island from the grounds of the Marriot were just beautiful!! We traveled with our two boys, aged 5 and 20 months and they really enjoyed the pools, both the kiddie pool and the family pool. The service was great from the front desk, valet, housekeeping and bellmen. The only negative side was that we requested 2 double beds but were only able to get the 1 king and pull out sofa, which was very uncomfortable. In hindsight, getting the rollaway bed might have been a better option than the sofa bed. But, we didn't spend much time in the room, except to sleep. The hotel is close to the Wailea shops but there isn't much to eat there and the only really "affordable" option is the Cheeseburger Island Style restaurant which really stunk in my opinion. That's another review in intelf..in a nutshell, we got there at about 8pm, ordered and waited till about 9pm w/ no food...finally, we asked the manager what was going on, after checking, he told us our waitress "forgot" to put our order in!! How could she forget..when she came back to refill our sodas and brought my husband back 2 beers!! UGGHHH!! We were so irritated...mind you we also had our 2 young children with us..one nagging and whining, the other falling asleep on the table...it was AWFUL!! The manager put in our order right away which was on the house and we took it back to our room...NEVER AGAIN am I eating there. Burgers are not that great either....Anyway, there are much better eating options in Kihei which is a short drive from the hotel. All in all, this hotel was great...for families and singles alike.

Reviews.Title: “Great Snorkeling Spot”
Reviews.Author: DTailer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wailea Beach Marriott for five nights in mid July 2009. We had a AAA rate of 224.00 per night (parking lot view) but were offered to upgrade at check-in for $100 per night to an ocean-front room, which we did. What made the view so great was the fact that the room was very close to the ocean compared to two upscale hotels in Wailea (i.e. Grand Wailea, Four Seasons). The sunset views from the room were spectacular. I would say that the rooms, while newly renovated, were typical Marriott. The bed was too soft for my liking as other reviewers have said. This is due to the fact that they do not have a typical box spring and mattress combo but instead a very deep mattress on top of a platform. If you have a bad lower back, you should not stay here. My boyfriend and I love snorkeling and have snorkeled Hawaii many times. We have also been to Belize, Australia, and the Carribean to snorkel. I thought that I would be less than impressed with the snorkeling at the Marriott but to my surprise, it was impressive. You only have about 3 hours in the morning (8-10am) to snorkel in calm waters, but it is well worth it. We first tried Ulua beach (right side), which has lots of healthy coral and is simply beautiful. The problem with Ulua is that the reef gets very crowded since the beach is shared with other properties. Plus, it is a bit of a hike to the beach if you are on the other side of the resort. The left side of Ulua can be choppy and cloudy until you get out to the point and circle around toward the Marriott. You should actually go around the point closer to where the Marriott's outside massage tent is to see the most amount of coral. However, for the most spectacular snorkeling, you should enter in at the other beach (by the Starbucks shack at the Marriott) and snorkel right in front of the hotel. You will see very dense healthy coral...not a ton of fish but turtles do frequent that area. The best coral is about 25 feet from the rocky shore line, so you do not need to be that close to the rocks (or waves). It is SO much better than any snorkel trip we have ever taken on boats in Hawaii especially better than Molokini. Also, the Starbucks shack opens at 6:30am and serves egg mc muffin type sandwiches for $6.00. We would grab a sandwich before our snorkel every morning- very convenient. The Marriott is within walking distance to the Shoppes of Wailea, which feature several restaurants for dining out. We ate at Tommy Bahamas there and ordered the fixe price tasting menu where you get appetizer, entre, and dessert in smaller portions. The portions were not as small as I expected so we thought it was a good deal and the seafood quality was superb. We ate at Longhis for lunch, which was really good as well. One of the lady's at the Activity Warehouse recommended a place in Kihei called Cafe o Lei. It doesn't look that nice from the outside but inside it is a very nice place with excellent food. Prices are like US prices, very reasonable for Hawaii standards. Need reservations becuase it gets crowded. Also in Kihei is a 24-hour Denny's. Its a bit of a dump but if you have to be on a boat or other excursion real early, you can grab a very early breakfast there. Lastly, we were told by a waiter that the Marriott used to have a torch lighting/hula ceremony at dusk by the upper pool, which offered a Hawaiian feel, which is definitely missing at this resort. That alone, would add a nice touch and they certainly have the location and property to do this. Please check out my review in the activity section of Trip Advisor for our Lanai trip with Dolphin Safari and also our use of the Activity Warehouse.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location--Great Beach Access--Terrific Ambience”
Reviews.Author: missecho
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at this hotel (about 20+ years ago) it was an Intercontinental Hotel, way off all by itself in the middle of 7 glorious beaches. I have never forgotten how wonderful it was. It still is wonderful! Now the hotel is a Marriott, and it still has the terrific combination of glamorous open air architecture for the common areas, and many rooms in low rise structures, on a grassy lawn that drops directly down unto the water. The views are spectacular, the snorkeling is really good (used to be great, I think all the other hotel development in the past 20 years scared off some of the fish), and I would return in an instant. I agree with other reviews that there are a lot of "extra" charges, but I think that is par for the course for Maui. Be sure to ask where your room is--the rooms in the low-rise structures by the lawns are light years nicer than the ones in the high rise, at least IMHO. We were booked into a room in the high rise, and we changed rooms the next day. This hotel is one that combines fabulous access to nature with a lovely posh environment. I think it is the nicest hotel in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: konaflies
Reviews.Content: We are return customers to the Wailea Marriott. We stayed here for 8 nights last Dec 08 and came back this time around. We really enjoy the location-situated between the Grand Wailea (Resort) beach and Ulua Beach...two great beaches on Maui. It also fronts one of the best snorkel spots-put in a GWB and swim all the way over to Ulua Beach and exit...Lots of fish and many sea turtles. The adult serenity pool is absolutley the best on the island-quiet, no kids and soft hawaiian music playing-very tranquil and the view is unparallel. Plus-Mala Wailea is here--its been our favorite since opening in Lahaina---We love it here and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jet296
Reviews.Content: Firstly I wanted to address some of the criticism about the various "nickel & diming" fees. We researched various hotels in Maui and just about all resorts have some type of fees associated with their "amenities". Either you will pay it a la carte (i.e. parking, internet charges) or you will pay it all a resort fee which will be around $25-$35 per day. We stayed in the Wailea Marriot and the Sheraton in Kaanapali during our stay in Maui. I would say if you are a couple with no kids and looking for a peaceful and beautiful atmosphere, then the Marriott is for you. It is a gorgeous environment. They have an adult infinity pool overlooking the ocean that is gorgeous. The hotel is on the water, but not on the beach. It is a short walk in either direction to a private beach (which has good snorkeling) or Wailea beach. Neither beach will get nearly as crowded as the Kaanapali beaches. There are not too many food options especially if you do not want to opt for the $50 per person dinner. We think that this by design. Wailea is not, nor does it aspire to be Lahaina or Kaanapali. It has more of a country club type of feel. If you want more reasonable priced food you can go to the adjacent town of Kihei (5 mins) or take a trip to Lahaina (40 mins). We stayed away from the hotel food other than ordering wings on the poolside (delicious). The food and drinks and are overpriced on all resorts. The rooms were very clean and well decorated. We appreciated the tiled floors in lieu of carpet. Our ocean view room contained a real â€œocean viewâ€�. The workout room at the Marriott is mediocre, but there is a great walk/jog path along the water. You are a very short walk from the shops at Wailea which has high end shops (Gucci, Louis Vuitton) and typical stores such as the gap and Banana Republic. In summation, I believe that this hotel was perfect for my wife and I (30 something couple with no kids). We had very little complaints with resort that we would not have at any other resort in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “TRANQUIL YET FUN!”
Reviews.Author: phyzylizzy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed @ this beautiful resort during our 3 day trip and were told the area was the "Beverly Hills" of Maui! There is LOTS to do on the actual resort for EVERYONE! If you are in the mood for peace and quiet there are beaches and pools for that, but if you are looking for a little more excitement and fun, try taking a dip in the "kiddie pool" or sliding down the HUGE waterslide! The resort is conveniently located next to the Wailea Mall which is a PRETTY outdoor plaza which boasts lots of famous retail shops (high end and bargain) and the famous GENERAL STORE where you can stock up on all you neccessities, snacks and souvenirs! There are also great restarants in the plaza which are more pocket friendly than dining on the actual resort itself daily!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: shhsdm
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 days in Hawaii, including 5 nights at the Wailea Marriott. Overall it was a great location and property for my wife, our two kids (10 and 7) and I. We had booked a regular ocean view room using points, but then asked about available upgrades to a one-bedroom when we checked in. We decided to splurge on the additional $150 per night for the one-bedroom ocean facing room. I highly recommend room 7236 (or something on 3rd floor with similar layout/view). Our room was on the 2nd floor of the 3-story "7" building with lanais and ocean views on 3 sides. It also was just a few yards down one flight of stairs and across the walkway to the rocks/tide pools in front of the resort. My wife and I could sit on one of the lanais and watch the kids play in the rocks or on the hammock/lawn. Since we have kids we didn't spend time at the infinity pool, but we liked the set of pools right in front of the lunch cafe. We watched a couple of sunsets from the pool area over appetizers and drinks. We spent most of our time out of the room snorkeling, swimming, along with trips to Hana and Lahaina. Pros - Great room, views and just a few steps from the ocean. We listened to the surf every night. The kids slept on the fold-out sofa in the living area. - Except one tower, the hotel is comprised of low-slung buildings spread around the grounds --- gives a much more garden and open feel to the resort. We actually liked this better than the overpowering resort and tall towers feel of some of the other more famous Wailia properties. The Marriott seemed to fit better into the overall enviornment and it was more about the gardens, ponds, ocean than the structure. - The hotel in general sits much closer to the ocean than many of the other new resorts and you feel more connected to the surrounding ocean and rocks - Wailea and Ulua beaches - while right in front of the hotel are some rocks and tide pool areas (rather than a sand beach), there are two great beaches on both sides of the hotel - each only a 3 to 5 minute walk. We actually liked not having a crowd of beach goers right in front of the hotel -- this also makes it possible for the hotel to be that much closer to the ocean. - The kids pool and slides area, including the salt water pool that sits above the kid pool area. - The koi pond by the front desk - kids enjoyed feeding them and watching them every time we came down in the lobby area - The views from the main restaurant at sunset - Mala - The views from the pool area restaurant all day and at sunset - The overall grounds - The coffee, muffin and breakfast sandwich place right before Wailea Beach - an economical breakfast choice just a few hundred yeards away from our room. - Matteos across the street from the Wailea shops --- good food, decent prices, family friendly pizza and italian food. - Resort fee was optional - we didn't take it. Cons - Pool area restaurant closes at 7.30pm and only serves a few appetizers and sandwiches. Waitress said there is a non-compete with the fancier hotel restaurant (Mala). Would have been nice to have one more dinner option at the hotel, but we still enjoyed a nice meal of appetizers and sunset and swimming one evening at the pool area restaurant. - Lack of mid-priced eating options nearby -- except a few places and some chains in the Wailiea Shops area. As near as we could tell there was only upscale dining choices in any of the surrounding hotels. We had breakfast a Cheeseburger in Wailea Shops one day which was okay. We also ate at Mala, the more upscale hotel restaurant -- great views and the food was decent if a little pricey. - Parking spaces are small and it is $15 a day for self park. It was less than other places, but still

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: bfland12
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautiful grounds, nice adults only pool, very friendly staff, good Luau, cocktail service by the pool, clean rooms, maid staff was good. Cons: Everything is extra including internet and parking. My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon for 7 nights. We never got tired of the surroundings. There was plenty to do just at the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay! Solid 4 stars.”
Reviews.Author: jk1221
Reviews.Content: I highly recommned the Marriott Wailea. The property is beautifully landscaped from the moment you arrive at the open-air lobby. The pool areas overlooking the ocean are gorgeous (in my opinion better than the more expensive neighboring hotels), but we spent most of our time at the beaches :) There are tons of nooks and crannies with beach chairs and trails overlooking the ocean. The hotel seemed very family friendly with quite a few kids around. We were pleasantly surprised that our non-ocean view room actually had a nice view of the ocean from the balcony. The room was nice with a super soft bed, but overall wasn't spectacular. The bathroom was a bit cramped. In my opinion the location is one of the best in Maui. To the reviewer who said that the beach adjacent to the hotel sucked, I have no idea what planet they are from. Wailea beach is on one side of the property and has been rated as one of the best beaches in Maui. Since it is directly in front of the Wailea Grand and Four Seasons it may get a little crowded. We preferred Ulua beach on the other side of the property, which is smaller and has a more secluded feel, plus there is a HUGE reef with excellent snorkeling just a few feet offshore. I would rank Ulua beach as one of the nicest I have ever been to. And if that's not good enough, there are literally dozens of beaches within 5-10 minute driving distance (Big Beach, Kihei beaches, etc), none of which are as crowded as the ones in West Maui. We had lunch at the bar at an off-peak hour and the service was poor, but the service was generally good when getting drinks poolside. The $11 cocktails add up fast, but we found that to be the price pretty much everywhere on the island. I agree with the posts that felt the hotel nickel and dimed a lot for a luxury property. Charging for internet is silly in this day and age, and I was hoping for free snorkel gear. The snorkel rental rates are outrageous, so just drive 5 minutes into Kihei and pick up some gear from Snorkel Bob's for less than $10 a day. As noted in other posts, we were also slightly disappointed that we didn't receive flower leis upon arrival, though we didn't get them at the airport either... The restuarants were underwhelming compared to other options. We ended up heading into town to the Kihei Caffe every morning, and we had an amazing meal at Ferraro's at the Four Seasons on our last night. Overall, the property was beautiful, in a great location next to fantastic beaches. The pool areas directly overlooking the ocean are a highlight. The room was clean and very comfortable, but not spectacular. The choice of restaurants is limited, but the restaurants at the Shops of Wailea and the Four Seasons are a short walk away. Not quite 5 stars based on the quality of the room and restaurants, but the hotel doesn't charge 5 star rates. I would definitely stay here again. In fact I wish I was there right now :(

Reviews.Title: “Just a nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: disciple1315
Reviews.Content: We arrived on June 28th, 2009 for our "last trip" before baby comes in November. We arrived at the hotel around 9pm or so. Everything was nice. The room on the 7th floor was nice, nothing special. We quickly went to the restaurant and had a good meal. In the morning, we noticed we had a great partial view of the ocean, entrance area and top of the restaurant, etc. We did do room service twice and the meals came quickly and food was hot. Because of our itinerary, we didn't spend much time at the hotel, but we did noticed the beach sort of... sucks. It was very rocky, not wide therefore crowded. We drove down to Big Beach which was a nicer beach than the hotel beach. We also went to the spa. One of the best massages I ever had, but it was double what we typically pay. Was there anything wrong? No. Was there anything extraordinary or special? No. It was just a nice hotel. Would I stay again? Probably. Compared to a regular hotel, I would give this hotel 3 to 4 stars. Compared to something like the Secrets brand (mainly hotels in the Rivieria Maya, Mexico), I would give this hotel a 1 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: NCTraveler245
Reviews.Content: The hotel accomodations were nice and clean and the bed was very comfortable. We had a garden room on the 8th floor, but could still see the ocean from the corner of our balcony. The staff was friendly and helpful. The best part of the property is the adults only infinity pool, which was gorgeous. I highly recommend renting one of the pool side cabanas for $25 a day if you plan on spending most of your day at the pool, because they are extremely comfortable and provide some shade. The view of the sunset from the pool is breathtaking. The only downsides to the hotel were the coffee price - $3.50 for not a very large cup and the drinks/food, which were in line with everything else on Maui- expensive. My husband and I loved walking or running along the ocean trail in front of all of the Wailea hotels. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: drileyTexas
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to Kauai and Maui as we were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary and stayed at the Marriott while in Maui. As I stated in another review on Hanalei Bay, we would have liked to have stayed in Kaui the entire time even though the Marriott in Maui was nice. Our oceanfront room at the Marriott was very nice and yes, we could see the ocean well. Other reviews that I had read on the oceanfront rooms had complained that they couldn't see the ocean. We stayed in Section 7 and I believe the room was 7230. The infinity swimming pool was where we spent most of our time because it is an adult pool and has a great view of the ocean. I had a wonderful ahi tuna dish at the restaurant, but didn't care for the food in the bar. The massage that I received was very nice in the spa. We had difficulty getting someone to open the laundry room on a couple of occasions as did some other guests. The grounds are not filled with as many native flowers as I would have thought, after coming from such a gorgeous place as Hanalei Bay Resort in Kauai. They do have a pretty waterfall at the entrance. The staff was very helpful. They upgraded our room to a suite without extra charge. The beach is in walking distance and is a pretty good beach. We stayed mostly at the pool, relaxing and visiting with other guests. The fitness center had machines as well as free weights so my husband and I used it often. I would not recommend attending the luau after seeing much of it and attending the Old Luhuana Luau, which was excellent! They don't compare. Overall, our stay at the Marriott was very enjoyable and I would return if we go back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing that you donâ€™t get the room type that you requested months earlier”
Reviews.Author: PaulsReview
Reviews.Content: Booked a room six months in advance and requested an ocean front room with two queen beds as my Wife and I were travelling with children. I e-mailed Marriott and reaffirmed that we wanted a room with two queen beds five months before our check in date and was told that this was no problem. Guess what when we checked in we were given a room with only one king bed, our children had to sleep on the bed-sofa for the next 7 nights as I was told there were no rooms available with two queen beds, and that nothing could be done. We had a meal in Mala Wailea, which after all the hype thatâ€™s in the resort I found that â€œThe best kobe cheeseburger in the worldâ€� was nothing special. But the view is very nice. We also had a meal at Kumu Bar & Grill and found the waiter completely uninterested in either us or our placing of the food order. Though he was very prompt at producing the check to be signed. I think that itâ€™s greed to charge the resort fee and you are also charged for parking even if you park the car yourself. There is no free wireless internet access anywhere on the resort. The kidâ€™s play area is good and the staff there were helpful, unlike most of the other staff on the resort who appeared to think that working at the Marriott was beneath them. Generally this is a quiet place as most guests leave during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere for BEACH service and 5-star fitness”
Reviews.Author: want2go67
Reviews.Content: The good: 1. stayed free w/Marriott points & booked only a month out 2. outstanding views, clean rooms and well-kept grounds 3. laundry facility for guests, $4 washes/dries a large load 4. 2 large slides not pictured on site entertained my kids for hours 5. nice infinity pool with excellent service (Terry especially was so friendly) Decent food at the pool side grill but pricey 6. approx. 3 mile beach paved path for gorgeous morning strolls/runs 7. walking distance to shops and Matteo's Pizzeria which was a steal for dinner for 4 ($50 for 2 lg. pizzas & a small salad) 8. We were not charged a mandatory bell fee or resort fee as was mentioned in other reviews. The $25 daily resort fee was optional and we took it but it wasn't worth it. 9. The beaches are very close though the hotel is not "on the beach". 10. There is a coffee maker and tiny fridge in the room which was great to have. The bad: 1. NO "kids' club" though I had read there was one on another review or site 2. NO designated beach area for guests in spite of how close the hotel is. You are on your own to either help yourself to another resort's lounge chairs and hope you don't get kicked out, or rent a lame beach chair (not lounge) from the hotel for $10 a day. This was a big issue for me personally. 3. Being located next to the lovely Grand Wailea with all it's amenities makes the Marriott look very average. 4. The fitness center is. That's it, it just IS. Some okay cardio machines and 1 set of weights, one bench, one mat. NO classes, no trainers. But at least you CAN get a good workout if you get there early or late. 5. The breakfast buffet is outrageously over-priced. $3.50 for coffee, $28 for adult full buffet, $18 for continental, $10 for kids 12 and under. It isn't even a great buffet. Would I recommend this hotel? Yes if you don't care about a fitness center or want beach service, or can stay free on points.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and beautiful grounds!”
Reviews.Author: leinies5866
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here at the end of our 3 island trip to Hawaii. I had booked a room on points (I travel worldwide about 75% of the time for my job). I had told my wife about the poor reviews of the place on TA to keep her expectations low. Well, from the time we arrived until the time we (sadly) had to leave, we were delighted to be at this hotel. First, I had stopped at the reservation desk to check in (knowing we would not get a room since we arrived around 10:30 am on Friday). We had made plans to eat lunch at the shops at Wailea and then head to Makena beach for the afternoon. The bell captain had unloaded our bags and was getting ready to check them when the reservations person ran from in back of the desk, over to us, to say she had found us a room. The bell captain took us to our room and settled us in. The room had a great (partial) ocean view of Molokini and Koh'olawe. You could see the boats bobbing in the waves. After our beach outing, we went to the pool closet to our building (one of several), and talked with the people staying there. The restaurant on site was expensive, but the food and service was excellent. The servers had t-shirts which said "practice aloha" on the back. They lived up to that; I made a friend with the bartender and he sent me little samples of what he was mixing all night long. They had a band from UCLA there that was tremendous playing that night which was a great suprise. We stayed up late walking the grounds (normally we were in bed by 9!). The next day we spent shopping, scuba diving, and then went to the luau on the grounds. It was our first luau, and we really enjoyed the entertainment and the company at the table. They had a world champion fire dancer, and he was amazing! The last day, we spent the morning at the (adult) infinity pool which was relaxing, quiet, and had an amazing view. Valet parking made everything easy. I don't write reviews in general but I felt that I had to say that we had a great 4-star stay here during our visit, and we look forward to staying here again on our next trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing honeymoon...”
Reviews.Author: jcsmiles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Marriott for our honeymoon, and we couldn't have been happier. The hotel was immaculate: beautiful open lobby, extremely helpful staff, and the room was spacious and clean. They also have an adult only infinity pool which we LOVED and spent many an afternoon, sipping cocktails and enjoying the amazing sunset views. I also loved the little touches: when we called the front desk, they always addressed us by name. As an example of how helpful their staff is, we encountered a little mishap when we were at the beach, and my husband lost his glasses. I called the concierge for help, and they immediately gave me a few suggestions as well as a list of nearby places for us to go. Within 2 hours, my husband had his eye exam, a week's worth of contacts, and we were back enjoying the pool at the hotel. Thank you, Marriott. We will definitely stay with you again.

Reviews.Title: “One word describes this resort best... Tranquil”
Reviews.Author: stix11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from May 29th through June 5th. Check in went smoothly. We had booked an ocean view room and were given an ocean front room at no additional cost.. We contemplated for several months prior to our trip on where to stay. We were skeptical about this place because there were alot of reviews that weren't favorable towards this resort, and since this was going to be our first time in Maui and celebrating our 25th Anniversary we wanted it to be special. We are glad we chose the Marriott and this location (Wailea). The resorts in the Wailea area are more secluded and away from traffice and noise. I cannot say enough good things about this place. The staff is what makes this resort special. Terri one of the pool service waitresses is superb. Our room was in Hale 2 overlooking two of the pools and the ocean to our right. It is in the perfect location to access the pools, beaches, hotel restaurant and parking garage, or just to sit on your Lanai and watch the sunset. I know there are others who stated that it took forever and everything at this resort is so far away, but I can assure you, it is not that bad. The rooms and floors (no carpeting) were immaculate and kept that way our entire stay. The bedding was heaven. The pools were always clean and maitained continuously. With four pools, we never had a problem getting a chair at anytime of the day. Also the infinity pool is small but it is beautiful and for adults only. The resort has a walking/running path that runs between the high end resorts in this area and all the beaches, it is breathtaking.You can walk it for miles, visiting other hotels, restaurants, and beaches without ever taking your rental car out. The shops of Wailea (a mall complex) is down the end of the driveway from this hotel. (walking distance) It has a Whalers General Store which you can purchase deli sandwiches made while you continue shopping. This store sells everything and since every room has a fridge it allows you the convenience of storing your perishables, along with bottles of water and liquor. This mall also has an ice cream shop along with a Ruth Chris steak house, Tommy Bahama's, a coffee shop, Cheeseburger in Paradise which has some excellent buffalo wings. The resort fee of $25 includes self parking which normally costs $18 (which many of the high end resorts charge) a 1 liter bottle of water every day including other services. If you are looking for a list of services included in this fee, contact the hotel directly in Maui, and they will email you a list of what it is included. I will say and you will read in a lot of these reviews that food and drinks in this area are quite pricey. I would definitely stay at this resort again!!

Reviews.Title: “A decent resort in a great location”
Reviews.Author: nbk5276
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from June 6th through the 13th. Check in was a breeze, we had booked an ocean view room, and were offered a better room for an additional $ 75.00 a night which I politely declined. We were met with a shell lei greeting and offered cold water upon arrival which was a nice touch. It was obvious the resort had recently undergone a renovation. The room was pretty standard nothing particulary comes to mind as a standout other than the beds. The beds were very comfortable. Having a mini fridge in the room was great for storing snacks and beverages. The location of the resort is fantastic and is its biggest selling point in my opinion. On either side of the resort are two great beaches Wailea and Ulua. Next door to the resort is the "Shops at Wailea" which provides several food and shopping options. We did not eat at any of the restaraunts at the resort as we are frequent visitors to Maui and have our favorite places to eat at already planned out long before our arrival. The staff at the resort are very friendly and a big plus in my book. Great staff can make or break a resort in my opiniion. The pools were okay, I have stayed at resorts with better pools, we did not visit the new adults only inifinity pool as we were travelling with a 12 year old. It was nice to see a pool with a deep end which seems to be pretty rare these days. The biggest negative of this place has to be the parking. the $ 15.00 a day self parking charge is included in your $ 25.00 a day resort fee. If you want to valet it would be an additional $ 18.00 making valet $ 33.00 a day which is insane. The spaces in the self parking lot are miniscule. The best place to park is on the second level towards the back we never had an issue finding parking back there, granted it was the furthest from the resort. On the morning of checkout I was reviewing the bill and noted a charge to one of the restarraunts which we did not eat at. I promptly went down to the front desk with a receipt for the same day and approximate time of the charge to prove we did not eat at the resort. The charge was promptly removed and front desk person apologized for the inconvenience which I find to be pretty rare these days. I would stay at this resort again based on the location of the resort alone.

Reviews.Title: “A FABULOUS TRIP AT A GREAT RESORT...GREAT LOCATION!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tiger_pinky
Reviews.Content: We originally were going to stay at the Ritz in Kapalua...So glad we didn't (although I am sure the Ritz is very nice). Wailea was very close to the beautiful big and little beaches (little was out favorite) of Makena and the restaurants and limited nightlife of Kehei. The grounds at the Marriott were gorgeous and very well maintained...beautiful views and gardens (fragrant of flowers always)...infinity pool is awsome. Had a great view from the balcony of the ocean and bed was very comfortable...a great romantic location. My major complaints are that the self-parking garage is a nightmare...the spaces are so tight...Look for additional parking up the center lane in the lower level to the upper level where there is more parking that is more easily accessible. Also food at the resort is overpriced and mediocre at best...I reiterate with others...stop at Costco by the airport to stock up on snack, beer, liquor, etc. (small fridge in room) $50 Costco membership fee but worth it for the deals. In addition, wireless internet is not offered for free in the rooms despite a $25 dollar resort fee which is a bit ridiculous...don't pay for it!...I got a signal on the balcony of my hotel room from a nearby condo. I also was told to skip the Luau and that it was not worth the money. If you are on the DL you can sneak into the heated pool and larger hottubs and the Grand Waliea next door. We are a gay couple and felt a little out of place at times (mostly straight newly weds and some families) but felt more comfortable as our stay progressed. They even let us shower in the Hotel Spa after we checked out of our room but had gone to the beach before our flight. FOOD: -Go to Ferrera's at the Four Seasons near the Marriott...A bit pricey but great food and a beautiful and romantic location...get the tasting menu if you are on a budget -Go to Longhi's (in the Shops at Wailea right next door to the Marriott) for breakfast...try the Hawaiian style pancakes with coconut syrup.delicious -Sansei Sushi and Cafe O'Lei are both in Kihei and both rcok...get the braised shortribs at O'Lei and try the Crab Salad Mango hand roll and Sensei -Try Marimon's in Kapalua for an expensive dining experience with great outdoors (go for sunset) ambiance and pretty good food -Great locally made beer and the Milagros seafood Co. if you make it to Pa'ia on the way to Hana NightLife: Mostly in Kihei and Lahiana...check out Gion Don's on a Wed, Fri, or Sat night for a cool gay dance party and possibly a drag show Spa: The greatest spa experience I have had to date...Go to the Grand Spa at the Grand Weilea next door to the Marriott definately worth the $ if you feel like pampering yourself. Beach: Little beach was our favorite...a nude, gay, hippie beach...very welcoming and laid back...also rocking body surfing and boogie boarding...Also great snorkeling right around the beaches on either side of the Marriott (it is actually on a cliff...also beautiful). There is a party at little beach on sundays at sunset (get there early to park) with fire spinners and drumming...alot of fun. Adventure: My favorite was the Pride of Maui boat trip to Molokini Crater and Turtle Town...I thought it would suck, but it was great...friendly staff...great BBQ lunch ...and I had a really sublime sea turtle experience...saw four turtles really close up. Did Parasailing with UFO in Kanapalli...fun but not super-exciting...would only do once The Road to Hana was beautiful but also stressful driving and a bit disappointing since a lot of things we wanted to see we couldn't (like blue pool and seven sacred pools hike...road closed)...do some research and choose what you want to see or get a CD tour from the hotel consierge...found this out later.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in an almost 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ddb_toronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (in our early 40's - travelled quite a bit) were in Maui for 10 days - 1st time in Hawaii - decided on Wailea based on marvelous reviews about the area being quiet and somewhat secluded with reference to the beach and from other large resorts. We knew the Marriott Wailea was not a 5 star and we were also aware of the $25 / day resort fee - but weighed the pros and the cons and decided to book nonetheless - we were not sorry. First of all the resort is an almost 4 star - our standards are high - what makes it an almost 4 star are the minor minor issues we had with the resort which I will get into at the end of my positive notes. We had what they called an ocean front but advertised as a partial ocean front on Expedia (which we booked through) - we had no problems with our room - it was HUGE - king size bed, love seat, chair , desk, tv, fridge...... large bathroom - we loved the fact that there was no carpeting in the room - it was modern (looked nothing like the photo on tripadvisor). Our room overlooked a lawn and the hedge separating the resort from the private condos - our view was lush - and if you sat in the right half of the balcony you saw the ocean - heard the crashing waves - there was no noise from other guests - it was perfect! We also knew that the resort did not have a beach directly in front - that did not bother us - given the proximity of our room it was a 2 mins stroll to the beach - the beach is great - fantastic snorkeling - some of the best available - we took a catamaran sail to snorkle at Malokini (the boat that departs from Prince Hotel .... so glad we didn't book a room at the Prince - a dive!) the snorkling was far superior at the Marriott - however the sail was wonderful nonetheless. The beach was never 'packed' , it's always clean.... we thoroughly enjoyed it. We never ate in the hotel - we ate at Cheeseburgers in the Shops at Wailea when we first arrived because it was late and we were famished - it was HORRIBLE - worst burger we've ever had - the food is all processed - it's bad food for a lot of money - avoid it if you can. The General Store offers good food options - we bought a loaf of bread and a jar of PB for snacks - we bought bananas and pineapple from the farmers market and often had breakfast on our balcony - it was great. We ate in Kihei a lot - we liked Alexander's and Cafe Ole - great fresh food - Cafe Ole had some of the best sushi we have ever had! We enjoyed the organic grocers that are trickled throughout the Island - Mana foods in Paia was great - many others as well - Lonely Planet reviews many of them and they are all good. We often went to an organic grocer - purchased food to go and then ate in a park or by the shore - it was heaven. We packed a lot into a short trip - we did the drive to HANA - loved it - we did the crater - extreme wind that day made it a little uncomfortable but breathtaking nonetheless - we hiked for about 90mins into the crater - what an experience - although with the altitude, wind and 30 degree weather it took about 2.5 hours to hike back...... the crater is a photographers dream! Next time we will be sure to do the hike on horseback and go deeper into the crater. The time of year we travelled (May) was considered low season - however the locals told us tourism has been affected by the current economic climate and that it is slower than usual - we had no problems with that - we had a lot of things to ourselves - it was great. We decided on the Old Lahaina Luau - it was worth the money - it was packed - sold out - but very entertaining and well organized. Some of the things that weren't quite up to par - but didn't greatly impact our trip to put a damper on our time - was the housekeeping services - housekeeping wasn't quite at a standard we would have liked it to be - it was just average - they did what they had to do and that was that - never mopped or swept the floor - or not as often as we would have liked - forgot to leave our $25 bottle of water (that's how much the resort fee is and really , aside from parking you don't get anything more....) We left a tip for the housekeeping staff every 2 days - were only left a thank you note once and nothing xtra was ever done for leaving a tip. The $25 resort fee is highway robbery as far as we're concerned - the only way to wrap your head around it is to just tell yourself the room is $25 more per night than what you're quoted - don't look at it as a fee because that will only anger you - You get nothing for the $25 - they leave a bottle of water in your room every day - big deal, they don't charge you for parking - again, big deal - most of the other hotels don't charge (probably included in room rate), they say you get discounts and a free welcome drink - hardly justifies $25 / day - it's steep and it really burns..... oh well..... Staff isn't all that into their job - especially the women we dealt with at the activities counter - they were sour - not very excited - only offered info you asked for - didn't really give you more - maybe they were having bad days??? Check-in was easy - many reviews mentioned being offered free upgrades - we were offered an upgrade at $80 more per night - we had included in our booking that it was a special occasion (40th bday celebration) but this did not prompt an upgrade of any sort. Luggage service was never offered to us - not at check in or check out - we always had to deal with our own luggage. Didn't bother us - saved us tipping. Shell lei's are given at check - in , they forgot to give us ours.... again, no big deal --- really minor things. Little details that you don't expect from a 4 star. We were told (and it's written in the in-room literature) that towels can be exchanged at reception 24 hours / day. When I went at 7am (cabana services were closed) the person at reception told me "I'll get you them this one time but just so you know there is no one here until after 12 to get towels" - When I read that it's open 24 hours I called reception to confirm and the woman I spoke with infact confirmed that it's 24 hours - I told her I was told otherwise and she told me that 's not so - you can come anytime for fresh towels..... Staff friendliness was hit and miss - we didn't spend that much time at the hotel so we didn't really care that much.... We only swam in the adult only infinity pool once - it was really loud - I thought it was supposed to be the serenity pool - but clearly I was wrong - people were yelling and horsing around for the 2 hours we were there and no one asked them to be quiet.... The lounge chairs are always saved by 6:30 - 7am in the morning even though there are signs saying not to do so - no one monitors it so if you get to the pool by 8am you won't find a free lounge chair under an umbrella - they will all have towels on them - but no people.... go back at 9am and there's still no one on them - only the towel - not really fair for others - but the staff aren't enforcing their rules so that's the way it is.... it's really ok though - the pools were often cloudy by the evening..... like I said - we swam in one of the pools once. Our room keys became inactive - we arrived at around 8pm - exhausted from a day of day tripping and couldn't get into our room - we went to front desk (because the hall phone was not working) - they did something with the keys and said it would work - it didn't work - we had to go back - We went back 3 times - the 3rd time my husband became upset and refused to go back to the room without a staff in case it didn't work again - which it didn't - it's a long story - we had to leave the hotel for a bit so they could call engineering and get it fixed - no one ever called us or addressed this issue with us to offer their appologies - the least the manager could have done would have been to call us and say sorry for the technical problems..... again, the details. There is no attention to detail paid at the hotel - housekeeping is average - staff isn't very attentive - no extras - .... these are the things that make this a low 4 star hotel - We had a nice looking room and we were in a secluded part of the hotel - I couldn't imagine having a room overlooking the pools or being in the taller tower. I could see how someone could easily have a bad experience at this hotel - we were very, very fortunate. We've stayed in Marriotts before and have never had a problem - and really, we didn't have a problem at the Wailea Marriott..... We enjoyed it a lot - mostly because we knew what we were walking into and we didn't have high expectations. I would recommend this hotel to people providing they know what they are getting into. We loved Maui - we had the best time ever - we've been to many carribean destinations and Maui is by far the best tropical vacation we've ever taken - we would return to Hawaii in a heart beat - in fact we would return to the Marriott Wailea in a heartbeat as long as we knew we could have the same room in the same building.
