One last thing - separate from the hotel review - we rented a car when we booked with Expedia - our insurance (because we are Canadian) costed us an extra $500 on top of what we'd already paid for the rental - that was a lot and I wish I'd done more research before I left - although we used our car daily - $500 is a lot to pay for insurance - especially since it was a low end subaru - not even a convertable or jeep - they had sold out - so for all you canadians renting a car - check into the fees and additional insurance before hand.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, tired rooms/resort”
Reviews.Author: Goober818
Reviews.Content: I understand that this resort was updated not too long ago but there's little evidence of it. Sure the endless pool is nice but the rooms suck. The televisions are outdated (I know, silly with this being Hawaii but if you've been there enough you know nights are quiet on the islands), the rooms are a little musty and the ceilings are low. The best thing about the resort is by far the staff, incredibly friendly and eager to please. I also have to say you need to be part Billy Goat to stay at this resort, everything is a trek from one spot to the next (we were down in Hale 6) and getting to your car is like climbing a mountain. I always think a vacation should put you into a room that's a step up from home, a fun time away with a little luxury; this hotel in no way meets those expectations. It's clean but it's bland and definitely not luxurious. I'd advise people to look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this ex-Outrigger trap”
Reviews.Author: AQMRN
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell: this hotel is a joke not worth your time or money. (Moreover: it is not worthy the Marriott brand; oh, did we say that some of their signs still say "Wailea Beach Outrigger" reminding us all about it's unflattering ancestry?) We have traveled to Hawaii numerous times in the past. We have stayed at condominiums, 5-star resorts, B&Bs, and small town establishments. There is plenty to choose from to suit anyone's budget. While Wailea prides itself to be more class than the rest of Maui, Wailea Beach Marriott Resort & Spa does not belong there. We decided to summarize our experience below into several paragraphs. This is the worst review we have ever posted anywhere as most places with flaws at least try. This one does even fake trying and takes the guests for granted. We will see and wait if it survives these tough economic times. We think not as too much investment would be needed, in our opinion, to make it what it should be. Staff and Service: we found the front staff grumpy, tired and unhappy. Their willingness to help and assist was non-existent with exception of a few blindly dedicated individuals. Booking: we booked on line and found our Ocean Front in Hale 3 to be actually a total PARTIAL ocean view but Pool FRONT with the full view of the restaurant and the noisy pools. When we requested a true Ocean Front, we were told it would take an extra $80 per night. Only then could we be placed in their Ocean Front DELUXE (we should have known better, I suppose, as this is a common trick in Hawaii). Room: plainly, FILTHY. Nothing to add nothing to take away: no carpets, just tile with dust and sand. Dead bugs and spilled ice cream under the beds on day 1, filthy room corners, tired room appearance, noisy central A/C, noisy balcony door that slam with a good deal of fortitude. The room was cleaned 2.5 hours after our request for a room service. Bell service: they charged us an involuntary fee of $36 for the luggage delivery whether we like it or not, whether we used the service or not. So we used it... The bell boy still asked for a tip even though the front desk stated the $36 fee is the tip for using the service and is applied to all customers (we checked; it is in fact not applied to all customers). Pool: nearly always crowded and noisy. Water is cold. There is another pool which is quiet but for adults only. Also not heated and mostly cold. The slides for children are two, quite frankly, not worth mentioning either. We did not understand the need for a forearm band as it was not enforced anyway. Luau: we did not go but watched from a distance: totally ridiculous experience even compared to the indoor luau at the Kauai Hyatt. Skip this one (or actually, both). Did we say Marriott asks the luau guests to use smelly porta-potties we noticed were used by construction workers during the day? Food: skip it... Internet: in the room for $14 /24 hours I think. Wi-Fi at the lobby for $$$. Beach: you have to walk to one. The Marriott has only coral and rocks. There were turtles there to watch, probably the only positive and memorable experience. Overall: if you want a truly romantic (and clean) experience in Maui, skip Kihei and Wailea altogether and consider more â€œoff the beaten pathâ€� areas, or something closer to Lahaina. We will not be back to this one...

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the "resort fee"”
Reviews.Author: oneswifttrip
Reviews.Content: The wife and I booked a Travelocity package for air and hotel to Wailea Mariott, with a slight upgrade to an ocean view room. We were pleased with the hotel: clean, comfortable, good view, walking distance to the infinity pool, great snorkeling a 5 minute walk away. We were surprised by the addition of a "resort fee" (plus tax) to our bill (about $27 a night), when we were told by both travelocity and the woman checking us in that this was included. After the 2nd night, we checked our room charges, and this fee was on the bill. We got that adjusted without too much grief, but on checkout, the charge appeared for the next 5 nights of our 7 night stay. The woman at the desk was very reluctant to remove the charge, but after about a 5 minute heated exchange she did remove the charge, and comped us the other $60 in charges for our trouble. Not a great way to encourage repeat business. Other: internet access is wired, and $15 a day. The restaurant "Cheeseburgers" in the shops at wailea (5 minute walk) offers free wifi, fairly priced drinks, solid diner-food, friendly service, so we used them for internet access. Also, the general store in the shops at wailea has a good deli and OK prices on food / booze for when resort pricing gets old. I'd probably not recommend this hotel to a friend due to what we saw as duplicitous billing practices. It's a really nice place, but not that nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: GTGuy314
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property in late April and absolutely loved the stay. The grounds of the property are very nice! And although the hotel is not 'directly' on a beach, it is so close to two nice beaches...less than 5 mins walk. Ulua beach, which is one of the two has great snorkeling as well. Our room was fantastic, we were upgraded to a deluxe oceanfront room which was literally steps from the water...we left the sliding door open at night and listened to to waves. The property does not have any night time activity but plenty can be found within a short driving distance. And like everyone else has already said, the infinity pool is great! Yes, the parking deck can be a little crowded, but I was able to find a spot at any time, and this was even after returning to the hotel very late at night...which is not very common in Wailea. We found the service to be very nice. From before our stay when I contact the resort to during the stay, everyone was very friendly and extremely helpful. There was only one front desk employee that was a little rude, but considering how many people I came into contact with that is pretty impressive! Overall, the stay was great and I would highy recommend the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Infinity Pool”
Reviews.Author: b11811
Reviews.Content: Great location, steps from Wailea Beach. Without the Infinity Pool, I might rate this not as high, but the pool makes it for me. We spent most of the days site seeing so only got to take advantage of it around 5pm. The pool bar seems to stop serving around 7pm, but we enjoyed the sunset from the pool, which seemed to empty out around 5pm as soon as the sun worshipers had their fill. The check in area is quite inviting and it seemed to have a great kids pool. Only complaint for romantic couples, is that the beds are quite mobile on the tile floor...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: lizSiouxFalls_SD
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of this hotel I was cautiously optimistic, but am happy to say it was fabulous!! The parking garage does have small slots, but they're typical city sized so that wasn't a problem for me. Plus the upper lot always had tons of spaces. The lobby is open air and just breathtaking. All of the staff were filled to the brim with the aloha spirit (except two people). The room was very nice with beds so comfortable we didn't want to get out of them. We had a regular room with a lanai which looked over a dumpster but past the dumpster was a beautiful view of the island so I enjoyed it very much. The adult pool was nice but had that annoying tourist music playing. We spent most of our pool time at the lower pool by Kulu. Two days in a row we got beach chairs overlooking the ocean. It was great. Speaking of Kulu, their barbecue pork nachos with queso were super yummy. I had them the first night and one other time and thought about them the rest of the trip. The haupia drinks (order with chocolate syrup on the bottom) at Kulu and available poolside were delicious and refreshing. The sweet potato fries were pretty good, too. I did not like the build-your-own lettuce wraps, but my friend did. The gift shop was very nice and filled with pretty much everything I needed snackwise--get the Cookwees, tasty! The location is right next to the Shops at Wailea which has a Whaler's Village for deli type food plus groceries, and a good for breakfast place called Cheeseburger's with super friendly staff. Plus across and down the street from the Shops is a spectacular pizza joint--Matteo's. We used the guest laundry to wash some clothes the last night--$2 to wash and dry. It was nice to have the option of washing our own clothes. When we checked out, they held our bags for us. Then since the hospitality suite wasn't available for 45 minutes, we were able to use the spa locker room which was very nice. One morning they had a craft show with local artisans selling their wares. We bought lots of engraved rock magnets. Very cool.

Reviews.Title: “Felt so at home on our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Yabayee
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! It's absolutely beautiful! Loved: The banyan tree and the whole reception area Found the staff very friendly, loved the pool-side service The hotel-run Ukulele and Hula class The lilly-pad pond The Serenity pool The Ma La restaurant at breakfast and dinner The slides Close to 2 fabulous beaches The hotel hosts a really great Luau Felt very romantic there Disliked: The other guests!! I know this happens at every hotel, but I really hate it when people reserve sunbeds and don't show up for hours! What irritated me most is that the serenity pool is supposed to be child-free, mobile phone free and has a strict no sunbed reserve policy! But it seems the staff at that pool were a bit Lazy and didn't reinforce the rules.

Reviews.Title: “a nice resort ...”
Reviews.Author: svnaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in ocean view room right above the pool. The room was very comfortable and had a good view of the pacific. The adult infinity pool was great and I agree with the other reviewer - the onion rings are simply awesome! I was a bit prepared for not-so-pleasant reception by the staff after reading the reviews here but did find the staff very courteous and warm. Initially, the receptionist said the room was not ready (we arrived at 1 pm and check in is not until 4 pm) but she was able to find us a different room realizing that we have just landed after 12 hours of flying from DC! We enjoyed the location - the resort being away from all congested areas and kind of in a private location.. the trail along the beach is good.. a early morning walk/jog would make you feel great.. also provides a colorful scenery if you are into photography.. (so does the sunset and the lights by the pool during dusk).. It is just a 5-10 min drive to the small bustling town of Kihei - with lot of restaurants and carry out places. Only thing that bothered me was the noise from Mala restaurant right above our room... They are open till midnight and the roof isn't really sound proof!

Reviews.Title: “Mahalo Marriott Wailea!”
Reviews.Author: Kubikov
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our 11 month-old infant to maui for 7 night at the Marriott. I'm not a big fan of large resorts, but this was a fun experience. Our ocean view room had a clear view of Ulua beach. We enjoyed strolling with our little one every morning along the walking path. We would often stop at the other resorts to compare, and in the end we felt like the Marriott was the best choice for location and value. If you want the best on Wilea, I would recommend the Four Seasons. It is beautiful, and the service is superb. They offer free/included coffee and tea, flvored water, and sunscreen, sunglass cleaning, and other stuff I'm sure. The lobby and fitness center are beyond compare. If you like Vegas, you'll like the Grande Wailea. It's a circus over there. The Fairmont was also classy, and from what I understand, it's rooms are all suites. But it was a little harder to get a good view of the ocean from its public areas, including its pools. For breakfast I would brew Kona coffee in the room and eat papaya and pineapple. My wife got a bagel from Whaler's general store. We ate sandwiches at Whaler's general store for lunch, $6 for freshly made Boar's Head deli sandwiches. We would always go out for dinner. Longhi's was expensive - $120 for 2 for fish of the day and a shrimp dish with a glass of wine. Cheeseburger is alright. Sorrento's on the Beach near Kihei had good food, but was pretentious for being "on the beach". San Diego has better beach-side dining options that that. Our best dining experience was Cafe Ole in Kihei - highly recommended. It doesn't have a view, but the food is superb, I especially liked the Maui onion soup and grilled Mahi Mahi. We had one lunch at the Marriott and we were presently surprised to find the price was reasonable and the food was excellent. Nick's Fish Market at the Fairmont is suppose to be great too, but we never had a chance to try it. The pools are plenty at the Marriott. The serenity pool is so nice compared to everything else that it stands out like a sore thumb. It's made of beautifully laid lava stone and granite. The rest of the property looks like 1970s stucco. I think they will eventually have to to blend it in a bit better. But the serenity pool is unmatched by any of the other resorts, and it looks like that's where the bulk of the budget went. Snorkeling off the Ulua beach and swimming South in front of the Marriott is good. There are two turtles living there and plenty of fish. The kids pool was great, but the water was a little on the cool side. Overall, much nicer than Kanapali and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Wailea - what a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: lisilv
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were there for 7 nights. We checked out April 7 and we really liked the place. It's our second time in Maui and first time in Wailea. We stayed in the other side of the island (Kapalua) before. We both liked the hotel. Negatives: (only minor stuff) - This resort is huge. It was NOT easy finding our room. Especially after a looooong flight from Chicago. We were really tired, maybe that didn't help (finding our room a little more easily). - they have blocked the aux ports on the TV, so we couldn't watch the stuff we recorded.. (whales, luau, etc.. ). Even though it shows as active in the channels listing, it is blocked. But, who is going to Maui to watch movies anyways? ï�Š - Bed tends to slide/move quite easily. If you are in your honeymoon, youâ€™ll find out what Iâ€™m referring to. ï�Š - This is an ocean front resort, but there is no â€˜real sandy beachâ€™ right in front of the hotel. Not a big deal, since wailea and ulua beaches are right next to the hotel. We were in building 5, which is really close to the beach, third floor, room 5305. ï�Š We could see the Luau from our room. So, â€˜distanceâ€™ was not an issue for us, unfortunately we had to walk 30 seconds to go to the beach next door, bummer. Marriott does not have umbrellas, or cabanas at the beach. If you have an ocean front room, you will have a GREAT view of the ocean, you only wonâ€™t see the sandy beach right in front of your room, but I donâ€™t think itâ€™s a big deal. Buildings 4, 5, 6, 7 are closer to wailea beach. Haleakala hale, buildings 2 and 3 are closer to Ulua beach. Building 3 is right in the middle, so it is a little further from either beach, maybe instead of walking 30 seconds to the beach you will have to walk 45 seconds. Not too bad. ï�Š - The â€œPolinesyan Luauâ€� grounds do not look good during the day (not during luau). They leave all the chairs laying around, etc.. which kinds of take away the beauty of the place. Not a big deal either. Now the good stuff: - rooms are very spacious - clean. The first day, we left a note to the house cleaning lady, and she attended our request and we were very happy with how the room was being cleaned. - We got a renovated room, I really like the bathroom. - beds are VERY, VERY comfortable - the mini refrigerator is definitely a huge plus. - love the ocean front walking path. My wife and I took our morning walk every day. It was awesome!! - pools are EXCELLENT. The serenity pool is great, there are many other pools tool as well. - Concierge staff helpful. You can book any activity right at the hotel, and apply the charges to the room. - I liked the open lobby as well. - Check-in person (Moses) was VERY nice. He went above and beyond to get us an ungraded room. - LOTS of snorkeling places at Wailea beach, either on south or north sides. I took my own snorkel.. lots of fish, corals, turtles, all right there by the hotel. Didnâ€™t have to go on a boat for that. I even talked to someone who did the both and she said that there was NOT a big difference, not worth paying close to 100 bucks per person to be on a boat then do the Molokini snorkeling if youâ€™re willing to try different places around the area. Makena beach (by Prince hotel), wailea beach, etc.. - different shops and restaurants right at the hotel - I could keep on adding stuff here. Additional comments: Parking: I heard a LOT of BAD comments about poor parking etc.. I really didnâ€™t find that to be a big problem. Yes, parking is a little smaller than what we have here, but if the space I found was not big enough, I would simply look for a bigger space. I didnâ€™t have any problems with this â€“ AT ALL. Restaurants: Longhis and Cheesburger Paradise (next to the hotel in the mall) are both very good, a little pricey for dinner but so is EVERYTHING else in Maui. We went to Walmart and bought groceries which we used for at least 1 daily meal, usually breakfast. I was very surprised to see the price of groceries, in some cases more than double. There are other affordable restaurants in Kihei â€“ Greek Bistro, Fredys, Maui Tacos, and others. Beaches: There are plenty of beaches nearby. One morning I decided to jog all the way down to big beach and stopped by all the beaches on my way there. Very COOL experience. Polo beach park, Poolenalena, Makena, turtle town, little beach and Big beach. Big beach is fantastic, so is little beach. Wailea Mall: Very nice mall, everything there is very expensive though. My wife and I were simply walking by and enjoying our window shopping experience. Internet: Do not use the internet at the hotel. Waaay too much money. I used an internet cafÃ© at Kihei, for 1/3 of the price. Marriott business center charges 65 cents per minute, minimum of 15 minutes, we paid 20 cents in Kihei, 2 minute drive from the hotel. Kihei town: Kihei has a very different feel compared to Lahaina. I like both. But we wanted to use this vacation simply to RELAX, so, Wailea was the perfect place for us. J We drove to Lahaina twice. Very nice place, lots of activities, restaurants, shops. There is a LOT more going on in lahaina than Kihei. Conclusion: We definitely LOVED the hotel and location, and would definitely go back. Feel free to contact me if you have questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, but one suggestion.”
Reviews.Author: BCSundog
Reviews.Content: Got a Garden Suite upgrade which was awesome. Had a two baths, a parlour and a seperate bedroom with a pullout for the munchkin. Bed was great as were the amenities. Checkin and bellstaff were top notch. The adults infinity pool was spectacular. My ONLY qualms and they woudln't prevent me from staying there again is that the hotel is spread out and the kids pool can be a bit of a walk depending on what building you are in but any walk won't do you any harm. More importantly, the staff that serve drinks around the pool are very nice BUT they need way more of them. If you order a drink poolside, be prepared for a long wait. It's totally a management problem that could take this resort from really good to superb. Just hire a couple more poolside servers. Dont cheap out! Makes you load up a drink in your room to bring down. Other than that I would highly recommend this place. Location is awesome (didn't even cross my mind that we weren't "beach front" because they're right there. Highly recommended other than that one issue.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and simple luxury abound at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: rizabiz
Reviews.Content: We found the Marriott to be a perfect location for us on our trip to Maui. We spent a few days in the upcountry at a friends house and then wanted an additional 5 days by ourselves. Wailea is much more mellow than Lahaina and it was great to have the shops next door to get a morning coffee or buy a new bathing suit. We parked over by the mall instead of the hotel parking which we found more convenient and a short walk. The valet would be my only complaint about parking--when we were unloading they were vehement that we could not park there. My husband said how about a welcome or a hello rather than a you can't park here. We were unloading and had they been nicer, perhaps they could have gotten a tip. Walking over to the mall parking was peaceful and convenient. The pools abound at this Marriott. I was able to swim laps alone and mid-day in the upper main pool, it's cooler and I think that was why. The adult only pool was gorgeous! And you could whale watch while relaxing. We wondered why there were no adult only hot-tubs and are always amazing by hottubs riddled with young children. We were, however, able to enjoy the hottubs to ourselves much later in the day. I liked the sparceness of the front of the hotel with just a few loungers oceanside. It was more peaceful that way. We jogged the path down to the other hotels and found them to be circus-like with loungers, people, etc. We knew at this point, we had made the right choice. Our partial view room was large and comfortable. We bought yogurt, granola, fruit and juice and put it all in our little fridge so we could have breakfast on our lanai. We did not use the internet, at $12 for 24 hours, I found that pricey. The running path was nice, although it seemed a lot of people went to Kehei for a jog too. The fitness center was great for weights after an outdoor run or if the weather is bad. We had cocktails and appetizers on the balcony of the restaurant and found the food and service to be lovely. We also used the coin machines to do our laundry which was very easy and not inconvenient. Overall, a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Service is Lacking”
Reviews.Author: princess00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott in Wailea, which was located oceanfront between Wailea and Ulua Beach, for four nights. The hotel does not have a beachfront location, but there was a short walking path to both beaches located north and south of the property. The grounds were well maintained, but were almost â€˜sparseâ€™ by Hawaii standards with a well manicured grass lawn and tropical plants situated in beds around the property. It felt very clean and well cared for, but it was certainly not lush. My opinion of the hotel was that you could pick up the property and plop it down anywhere else in the U.S. and it would â€˜fitâ€™. Meaning that, to me, it did not feel like â€œHawaiiâ€� â€“ no lush tropical feel, no tiki wood, no tropical floral prints in the rooms. The only area that â€˜felt like Hawaiiâ€™ was around the open-aired lobby, where tall banyan trees shaded an open area with a small koi pond and waterfall. At night, the staff would light tiki torches around the property, including the lobby, creating a soft, calm glow. We booked a standard garden view room, but were upgraded at check-in to a partial ocean view next to their recently built serenity pool. The view from our room was lovely and â€˜partialâ€™ view from inside the room became a full ocean view when sitting outside on the lanai. Inside the room, the bathroom was well maintained, the shower was clean and the entire space looked to have been recently updated with white linens on the bed and soft down pillows. My husband did complain about the bed that it was too soft, but it didnâ€™t bother me. The only concern about our room amenities was the television, which was outdated and had a remote that barely worked, but it didnâ€™t bother us since we certainly didnâ€™t book a trip to Hawaii to sit in our room and watch tv. My one complaint about the hotel is the service, and after one full day at the property, we had to adjust our expectations on service to align with the level the hotel was offering. Once we did that, it was a nice stay. As follows, is what prompted us to adjust our expectations on service: You can decide for yourself, based upon what rate you are paying to stay at this property, whether this is acceptable to you or not. Our second full day in Maui, we visited Haleakala to watch the sunrise. Upon return, we noted that our room had been cleaned, but they had failed to provide us any washrags. We called the front desk to ask for someone to bring us some rags. The front desk answered â€œAloha, I am currently helping a guest, may I place you on hold?â€� upon which I replied â€œNo thank you, I will call back later.â€� We decided to forego trying to get some rags and headed out to Wailea beach. Upon return, I was very ready for a shower, so I called again, but this time I called using the At Your Service button on the phone. A lady picked up the phone and our conversation went as follows: â€œAt your service, how may I help you?â€� â€œYes, I would like to see if someone could deliver some rags to our room.â€� Accusatory tone â€“ â€œWhat do you need the rags for?â€� Response â€œWell, the staff cleaned our room this morning and there were no rags in the room for us to use.â€� â€œWhat are they for? Why do you need rags? Still accusatory. I politely responded â€œTo bathe with? I just returned from the beach and would like to take a shower and have no wash rags. If someone does not want to bring us any, I can use a handtowel, but I would prefer to use a wash rag to clean up.â€� At this point, her tone changed, â€œOh, I am so sorry maâ€™am, I thought you had spilled something in the room and were trying to clean it up on your own and wanted to offer our assistance in helping you clean. We will have those washrags to you immediately â€¦ How many do you need?â€� My response â€œtwo will be fine.â€� At your service: â€œWe will have them to you immediately.â€� Thirty minutes later, we still had no rags and I was ready to take my shower thinking we should have called before we went to the beach if it was going to take this long. At this point, I am covered in sand and suntan lotion and frustrated. So, I left the room and walked to the concierge desk at the lobby. Standing there, the concierge looked at me and asked how he could help. I replied that I called for some rags to be delivered 30 minutes ago and they had not yet been sent to my room and did he have any rags to give to me. The concierge then called someone, hung up, and told me that they would be delivered immediately. I gave him a skeptical look and he then frowned at me and replied â€œMaam, if I had rags at the desk, I would give them to you.â€� You can make your own opinions of whether my expectations were too high to expect at least an â€˜Iâ€™m sorryâ€™ from someone. Other than that, the stay was nice â€¦ if you are looking for a clean property in a good location in Maui where you can rest your head in the midst of enjoying everything this island has to offer, the Marriott is a good place to stay. If you are expecting to be treated with some level of service beyond just the normal check in and check out, this is not the place. The property is just too large with too few staff to accommodate a high level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Time, but a lil crowded”
Reviews.Author: DiverDown79
Reviews.Content: First off, very very efficient check-in staff. Can't complain about it too much, but the property is quite spread out and the bell desk will try to throw you in a golf cart & drive you to your room. The property is jagged and you can *and will* get lost in this place.. however, if you just walk to the ocean you'll find your way back easily. The pools were simply amazing, and the hotel did right by putting the kids pool in its own 'cove' of hotel rooms. The Serenity Pool was very relaxing & nice, and as other people have said, the lounge chairs go fast (the free ones, anyway). My bf and I just threw our towels & items down by the stairs and hopped in the pool, no complaints there. Restaurant service was very good, Marriott typical prices though. Mall across the street has a few decent options, but you are in tourist central so expect tourists mark-ups on the prices. The rooms were Marriott-standard - absolutely perfect. Very comfortable beds, nice linens, cloth headboards attached to wall, which leads to "other stuff" - and we heard the couple above us going on a marathon. Whats bad is we could hear the bed "tapping" on the floor as they did their thing, we had to turn on the tv to cover the noise and it still didn't work - so I'd advise you to try to get a room on one of the upper floors as this place is FULL of honeymooners -- we were the only gay couple for miles i think! I'd go back, and wouldn't hesitate to pay rack rate. My only real complaint is the pizza joints make you walk off property to pick up the food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/resort. Cant wait to get Back”
Reviews.Author: Alshasta
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott for 9 days. Went with my wife and and our best friends. We both had ocean front/view rooms located in the tower. We had great views of the beach and west Maui. We watched whales from our balcony. The rooms seemed a little dated but were very clean and comfortable. The resort is well maintained and layed out. It has two restaurants. We had lunch several times at the outdoor pool restaurant. The food was better than good. We also had breakfast in the main restaurant. Once again it was very good. Expect to pay resort prices for food though! The hotel had five swimming pools. One pool was adults only and that was a real plus. The two mains pools were practically at the oceans edge with spectacular views. The pool service was great. You had no problems getting a drink or food. Once again, resort prices! I really cant say enough about this resort. I will be back again and I hope very soon. One complaint I have is you are charged $15.00 daily for parking. This isnt a bargain hotel so paying for parking is a little annoying. Overall this was a great experience. Our friends share our sentiments.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: norcalnat
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay in Maui and at the Marriott. I got a great deal on Priceline and couldn't have been happier. My room even had a partial ocean view, which didn't really matter since we were only in it at night. The hotel is close to all the shops, which do have some restaurants as well, so you can walk over there to shop and eat. If you have kids, they will love the children's pool and waterslides. One has a steep drop into a 9 ft pool ( I didn't know this when my 7 year old and I went on it). She didn't go on it again and I wouldn't have let her if I had known prior to going on it. Don't recommend that one for anyone that is not a good swimmer or afraid to be dumped underwater. Older kids will love it though! Sometimes a female may feel worried at night being in a hotel and unfamiliar area, but I felt totally secure here. The only issues I had were with 2 things: 1) There was only 1 restaurant, which was pricey. But this is a resort, so what can you expect I guess. 2) Issue with check-in. I pulled up to unload the luggage and walk to the desk to check in, but they won't let you leave the car there. You have to go park it first before checking in (or use valet). Otherwise, my overall experience was great and I would recommend this hotel to friends & family. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Repeat visitors - lovely location”
Reviews.Author: tesdavis
Reviews.Content: We love Maui and Wailea in particular. We have stayed at the Marriott before, and also the Renaissance (managed by Marriott) mostly to use our points, and have also rented condos in the area. We vacationed as a family of four this time and got a small suite. The room worked out great as it had 1.5 baths and a separate bedroom. It was on the seventh floor above the service entrance and we still got plenty of noise from the workers coming and going. Overall our stay was comfortable and enjoyable, although I agree with other reviews that the hotel doesn't go out of their way to make you feel special or pampered. Little things like not providing free coffee in the lobby or bottled water was annoying. In fact, I noticed a major disconnect with the Marriott hotel and the MALA restaurant. The restaurant is not actually part of the hotel and I think it showed. The serenity pool is nice, the fitness center was great, and the grounds are lovely. We would return (especially to stay with points).

Reviews.Title: “Maui is beautiful, Wailea Marriott Resort is pretty good”
Reviews.Author: clrossi6510
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my 16 day stay at the Marriott but I didn't feel it was as nice a 4-star resort property as others I have stayed in while in Hawaii. I redeemed points for 7 nights and paid for the rest of the stay. The rooms have been updated and are fairly comfortable. The room size is spacious and so is the bathroom. I liked the little shelves/drawers under the sink vanity for your stuff and extra towels. The TVs are not flat screen but this didn't bother me as I'm not in Hawaii to watch TV. The first room I was given in the main building shared a wall with the elevator shaft. It was so noisy! I asked to be moved to another room and the front desk found another room without issue. I really appreciated this and it took only about 20 minutes to change rooms. The resort grounds are well kept. My favorite aspect of this resort was the adult-only infinity pool. It was a lovely pool that overlooked the ocean. I saw so many whales during my stay, it was incredible! What a fantastic experience. There were times it was hard to find two available lounge chairs so this could be a problem during peak travel times. We ate at the poolside restaurant/bar one time and one time we ordered food poolside. WeI thought the food was good. Of course, all prices in Hawaii are expensive but I thought the prices here were the same or a little bit less than other resort poolside restaurants. We ate breakfast on our last morning at Mala Restaurant. The food was okay but for the cost, $26.95 per person, it was completely overpriced. The breakfast food quality wasn't that great and there weren't as many food options as other breakfast buffets I've enjoyed. Not to mention, there are little birds that fly in/out of the open-air restaurant. This doesn't really bother me as it's a common thing in Hawaii and they had all the hot food covered with lids and the other things covered with plastic wrap. The problem was people didn't close the plastic wrap after they took some of whatever it was (toppings for the cereal, pastries, etc) and the birds had fun jumping into the bowls and snacking. Yuck! We found most of the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful. Unfortunately I had a less than friendly front desk person help me one time and one waiter at the poolside restaurant/bar who was completely rude. We had a soda explode in our fridge (our fault and we were sorry) but we had to call twice to have the fridge cleaned. We removed all our sodas and cleaned those ourselves but needed more towels/bucket for water so couldn't do the refridgerator ourselves. As other posters have stated, the parking situation is awful! There are not enough self-parking spaces for all hotel guests. Additionally, the parking spaces are so small. Most of the cars can barely fit in the spot so people use two spaces or infringe over the parking space line. It was frustrating because there were always so many empty valet spaces. I got LOCKED in my hotel room! Apparently Maintenance had changed the room lock while I was out -- there was no notification this would happen. I was able to enter the room without issue but upon exiting, the deadbolt had somehow locked even though I didn't touch it. After repeated attempts at opening the door, I called the front desk and asked them to send someone to the room. Unfortunately I was on my way to an ocean cruise and was running late, this delay really made me run late. No one from the hotel called me after the fact to apologize for the inconvenience. I was very disappointed by the lack of concern and that work had been done in my room and I was never given advance notice.

Reviews.Title: “For families on a budget, but not for romance.”
Reviews.Author: davidyoon
Reviews.Content: First time review. This resort is cheaper than the rest, but there are definite sacrifices. My wife & I: â€¢ Are 37 â€¢ Have no kids â€¢ Have also stayed at (and loved) the Hyatt & Grand Wailea Hotel pros: â€¢ Location â€¢ Value â€¢ Nice adult only pool â€¢ poolside service is great â€¢ walking access to nearby upscale shopping mall â€¢ Towel policy, while paranoid, isn't as irritating as everyone says it is â€¢ Great beachside walking path â€¢ Easy walking access to Grand Wailea & Four Seasons restaurants Cons: â€¢ Despite recent remodeling, walls are still thin due to dated construction. I knew when my neighbors' kids woke up, when they took showers, used the toilet, &c. It's not the people's fault; It's the cheap construction. â€¢ Arrived before their unusually late check in time (4pm) and was promised a phone call when the room was ready. Never got a call. Odd first impressions for a business that makes a business of first impressions. â€¢ Self-parking lot is oddly cramped. A simple redesign would help here. If you're a family on a budget wanting to stay in tony Wailea and are used to daily (& nightly) noise, definitely consider the Marriott. Couples looking for seclusion will be mildly disappointed--save your pennies and opt for the much nicer Grand or Four Seasons; there's a reason couples get married on those properties and not here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed with Their Service and Other Stuff”
Reviews.Author: CLHouston
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights at Wailea Marriott after our stay at Hyatt in Kaanapali. The quality of service at Hyatt was so above and beyond my expectation that I got a terrible culture shock when we moved to Marriott. I got my reservation of Marriott from priceline auction last Nov. Because it was last Nov, I basically prepaid a pre-recession price which was pretty much the same as what Marriott is currently offering as their special, if not more expensive. But I knew I took the risk and I knew I would get the most basic room. This, I cannot complain. What I could not believe was this particular Marriott's quality of service and some other stuff, from top to bottom. It is almost like a culture embedded in their property. Many thing were accomplished halfheartedly. Yes, the place was renovated, but only partially. It is like someone only renovated his/her highly trafficked area in the house while leave the rest untouched or poorly maintained. When I checked in at the front desk, I asked if I could pay an upgrade. The receptionist happily agreed and asked if I would pay extra 150 dollars a night (not including resort fee and tax) to be upgraded to a ocean front room. He assured me this was one of their best room on the property. Therefore, I agreed the upgrade. The bell boy took our luggage and drove us in a golf cart to our room. Stopped in front of my eyes was the most dumpy place I had ever seen in a resort such as Marriott. The hallway of this complex, in my opinion, was like a no star motel in a small town on the side of an interstate highway, where would normally be stayed by truck drivers. I was so surprised and not sure to proceed or not. (The pictures I attached are the entrance of the complex and the dim hallway.) The complex was dark in the day light and eerie. Some lights were broken. The cleaning staffs were cleaning other rooms. Dirty plates lying on the floor. Their linen room doors were wide open. It was not a pretty scene. It looked like a humid Chinese restaurant kitchen. Yes, our room had a good view. The interior was not bad. But compare with other resort in the same class, this interior was not superior or special. The surrounding was so horrible it offset the beautiful view so much that I could not stomach 500 dollars a night for this. I was shocked, my husband was mad. We turned around and told the bell boy that we were very sorry but we had to go back to the front desk. The bell boy had some attitude, his face dropped, shake his head and signed. He made us felt so bad that we assured him that we would take care of him. At the end, we gave him 10 dollars for tip, while we only had 2 big pieces of luggage. He, showed no particular appreciation. When we went back to the front desk, the manager was not impolite, but she was cold. She immediately assigned us to another dumpy place, and told me, "this was the original place you were supposed to stay." This was the first room on the right of the lobby with maximum amount of traffic you can imagine. The balcony faced another small dumpy dirt courtyard, beyond it was the main drive way where every car pulled into the lobby and every pedestrian who walked back and forth to the Shops at Wailea. At this point, I am sure you know how disappointed I was. And how biased when I say, I feel employee at this Marriott were so proud of their property and made me feel so low and not a worthy customer that I will not stay here another time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but only average experience”
Reviews.Author: IrishRoverIA
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I checked into this property in mid-March 2009 for an eight night stay. Our expectations were high since this property was in the very top tier of Marriott properties (prior to the award program changes in January). Upon arrival, we found that our room assignment did not match our guaranteed confirmation or my Marriott Rewards Platinum profile. After an extended period of time, the front desk found a room for us with a partial ocean view. The room was average in size with nice features such as a roomy refrigerator and decent drawer space. The queen sized beds unfortunately were extremely soft and left us all with back aches each morning. Housekeeping was generally good, but we were left without an adequate supply of bath towels twice and a similiar situation with toilet paper. Food in the two restaurants was expensive(as expected) with generally good quality but the service was very uneven. We quit using the breakfast buffet due to the poor service. The kitchen and wait staff for the poolside bar/restaurant was clearly understaffed as service was slow and food orders were often incorrect. The various restaurants in the nearby Shops at Wailea offered better experiences as well as the restaurants at the other Wailea beach hotels. The hotels location is excellent. Be aware that the hotel does not have a sandy beach directly in front of the property, but rather a very picturesque rocky ocean front. Do not dismay, because two excellent beaches are within a five minute walk either direction. The luau at the hotel was outstanding with great food and entertainment. Well worth the time and expense. The hotel has a beautiful lobby with a wonderful staircase that leads to the lower portion of the property. The ocean views from the top of the staircase are magnificent. That's the good news. The bad news is that the top of the staircase is a designated smoking area! Since this is the main route to/from the lobby and the rest of the property, we had to endure walking through groups of smokers. What was the management thinking when the made the decision to make this location a smoking area? Unbelievable. The resort charges guests a minimum of $15 per day to self park their cars in a nearby garage. This garage has the narrowest parking spaces I have ever seen including midtown Manhattan! Our midsize rental barely fit in a space. To top it off, the machine at the garage entrance was malfunctioning frequently throughout the week forcing you to go back to the front desk to get a new room key to open the gate. Personnel at the property were courteous but did not exhibit the welcoming aloha attitude I have experienced at other Hawaiian resorts. I have attached a layout of the property. Ocean front building offer fabulous views, but be aware that there is a public walking path as close as 20 feet to some of the buildings. A ground floor unit might not be the best choice if you have any concerns regarding security. Best buildings for ocean front views are 2,3,6 & 7. Overall, we enjoyed our vacation but were disappointed in the hotel experience. I would recommend it to a friend, but only with certain reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the infinty pool overlooking the sea”
Reviews.Author: chuckawala
Reviews.Content: The arrival was very friendly; with an ocean view room upgrade offered since I am a Marriott Rewards participant. The resort is quite spacious and one of the older properties on the isle but it had a recent remodel and was very appealing. There is a wonderful ocean front jogging/walk path running for a few miles in front of the hotel and nearby resorts. Sunsets were quite remarkable, Infinity pool was really nice and the weather superb in the low 80's. My wife and I dined at a sushi place in town and also at Tommy Bahama's at the shopping center within walking distance. Both were great choices. We did use the spa, which offered a relaxing experience and one of the nicer ones on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Sunsets, nice property, lots of pools(including adult only pool), very relaxing...”
Reviews.Author: JoeMCanada
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I had been to Hawaii, my friend and I arrived in the evening between 7 and 8pm after around 13 hours of travelling. We checked in without a problem and had a beautiful room with an ocean view as well as the Infinity Pool. We never had any problem with cleanliness, the maid would come as early as 9am or as late as 2 or 3pm, and then there was also a turn down service. The location is nice, located in between 2 beaches within a few minutes walk and 6 or 7 more beaches within a 5-20 minute walk along the coast. The room was very modern and the beds were very comfortable, some mornings I decided to stay in bed, since they were so comfortable. The beds provided lots of pillows 4 or 5 plus a body pillow. I always had nice friendly service within the resort, with a few exclusions I'll mention later. The resort also has a Spa on the premises, and each guest can use the steam room free with their stay - this is not advertised at all. The facilities are no where comparable to Cesears in Las Vegas, but were very nice, most of the female and all of the male attendants were very friendly. There is a kids area - only for kids and two waterslides available for everyone. I really enjoyed using the waterslides, it was a nice fun afternoon. There are a lot of activities to sign up, depending on if you want a relaxing holiday or action packed holiday. I recommend the Luao and the Hana tour all the way around the island. It's great. There are a lot more activities at a cost. Expensive to eat at the resort restaurants, less expensive to eat at the restaurants up the street, more reasonable to buy prepared meals at the deli at the general store up the street. I would recommend to check out the General Store on the main floor as well as on the 2nd floor of the Wailea Shops a 2 minute walk from the lobby. There are some great deals on food and souveniers. Some things are still expensive. I went to the restaurant on the property and didn't realize that you need to make reservations for dinner, so would have needed to wait 45 minutes or went to the bar style restaurant and are served right away. We decided to goto the bar style restaurant. The problem I had was that I asked for a grilled chicken sandwich on the menu, but it was served with a heavy topping of a local sauce that I didn't want. When I recieved the sandwich the topping was included on the sandwich and bun. I brought this to the attention of the server, she took the plate away and returned with the sandwich with the topping partially wiped off. I wiped off the rest of the topping, but spoke with the waitress and told her that if I am paying $20 for a chicken sandwich, it should be made the way that I ordered it, or I should have been offered a discount if they were not able to serve me what I had ordered. My experience using the Steam Room at the Spa was generally nice, there was one attendant at the front desk, she can come across as very unhappy sometimes. I found that when I was using the facilities for the free steam room she came across unhappy, but when I used the facilities for a paid massage she seemed more pleasant. Very little night life, not sure if its the time difference and everyone goes to bed early, but most nights i was bored and was in bed by 9pm, there were no fun things to do near the property at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - after a change of rooms.”
Reviews.Author: RandomScreenName7042
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fully booked when we arrived late in the night and we ended up in probably one of the worst located rooms in the hotel: immediately above the loading dock on the back side of the property. (In the Haleakula Hale). The near round-the-clock noise from this location made it impossible for us to get a full night of sleep. We changed rooms after a couple nights and ended up with something pool-side which was much nicer, and we were very happy with everything in the hotel from that point on. As per the consensus view here, the property is not in the same league as the other Wailea resorts, but the price isn't in the same league either. It is still very nice and located in a beatiful spot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: princessvontrapp_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott in Wailea for a week in early March, our first time in Wailea, fourth time in Maui. The hotel is in a lovely location, relatively quiet compared to the commotion around the Four Season (nice), Fairmont (architecture like in 1001 Nights and nightly Luau in front of beach rooms?) or Grand Wailea (think Hilton Waikoloa, Hawaii, or Disney Land). We had an ocean front room with a nice view on the beach to the right of the hotel, which itself sits on a cliff. But there are beautiful beaches very close to the right and the left. If you go to the right, you can walk for hours, very beautiful. The hotel decor is very modern and very well maintained. The Mala hotel, which is in the Marriott but run by a different company is pricey but very good; which cannot be said for the Marriott restaurant down by the pool. Unfortunately, the service at the Marriott was on average very poor. It started with cold fries by the pool, cocktails without alcohol and staff in the activities booth too busy to talk to us because they were on a private phone call, plus the "scam" of the $25 resort fee. Supposedly, the $25 resort fee covers things like a free glass of champagne at Mala's and your ability to print your boarding passes. Well, it was clear that nobody at Mala was excited about our request for the free champagne, particularly if we did not state when ordering that it should be free. They should expect everybody at the hotel to order the champagne that is "included in the resort fee", no? You also cannot print your own boarding pass, as the business center is also not run by the Marriott. When you go there, they tell you it's $6 an hour to use the Internet. They don't volunteer any other information. My husband managed to find out that the concierge can print boarding passes for free, but you cannot look at the screen, and it was very painful...the concierge ended up being unable to print our boarding passes (which might be Hawaiian Airlines' websites' fault, but it caused 20 minutes of annoyance). I read in many of the reviews here how great the beds are at this hotel. Yes, the bedding is great, but we found the mattress much too soft. We both woke up with back problems every morning. The Marriott was so kind to turn our mattress and add memory foam on top. Which helped and was proactive, but we still found the mattress painfully soft. While Wailea is very nice, and we saw many wales from the shore and boats, it's really busy with all those hotels next to each other. You are stuck with the expensive hotel restaurants or eating at the mall (no view) if you just want to walk. Kihei has a bunch of nice places in driving distance. We liked the food at the Pupu Lounge a lot; very nice peopel. Overall, I would rather stay in a condo next time, where you can make your own breakfast and hopefully be in a more private setting. The pools at the Marriott are nice, as are the hot tubs. We thought it was overpriced though, to pay $100 to lie under a cabana for a day, with no privacy. If you like lots of privacy and peace and quiet, the beaches up north and in Malakea were great, but that strip of big hotels from the Marriott to the Fairmont appeared too busy to us. It's good if you want to be seen :-). Our favorite hotel in Maui is the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua, unfortunately, that area can get very windy, so spring is not the time. Overall, we had a fabulous time, as Maui is simply a heavenly place, and the Marriott was clean, a very nice room and all ammenities. Just not as good as we've had.

Reviews.Title: “Great, convenient choice in Wailea - perfect if you use points or get a great deal”
Reviews.Author: blunistgirl
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here last week! Great option in Wailea. We stayed at the Fairmont here before and knew that the Marriott would not be that same experience & we kept our expectations in check. This is a more affordable resort option that will still be really nice & beautiful, but a different experience. The difference between the Marriott and the other resorts in Wailea (Grand Wailea, Four Seasons, Fairmont) is definitely "Service." Here, you aren't going to be welcomed with a lei and drink upon arrival, you might have to wait in line for 5 minutes at the front desk, there will only be one very busy server at the pool and you might have to wait 20 minutes to put in your order, and there isn't going to be turn-down service at night. Does that mean this is a bad property? Absolutely not. It just isn't a 5-star resort so don't expect it to be one. We received exactly what we expected and were still very pleased. We used points so things couldn't have been better than free, but I just had to look up the rates to see how it might compare to the Fairmont or Four Seasons. Right now the Marriott has an AMAZING package from $205-$255 per night including valet parking and $25 food credit. Now THAT is a deal. If the best deal you find for your dates makes the Marriott only $50-$75 less, then other Wailea properties going to be a FAR better experience. I'd definitely recommend the Marriott if you're using points or if you can get a great deal. The additional cost at one of the other resorts will not only provide that "service" element that makes you feel like someone just appointed you king or queen, but it usually includes other perks like free yoga classes on the beach, free cabana (at Four Seasons vs $100 per day at Marriott), wonderful treats brought to you at the pool like cold towels and pineapple slices, staff magically knowing your name where ever you go, etc. The FS even offers free childcare during the day! I reserved the lowest possible room because that was the only way we could truly have free nights. We were pleased to receive a complimentary upgrade to an oceanview room. This was truly oceanview too! I'd almost call it oceanFRONT. We were in Hale 4 overlooking the adult infinity pool with a front view of the ocean. Ahhh...No twisting of the neck or anything. Right there. We enjoyed drinks on the lanai each night (we bought offsite and stored in the empty fridge in the room - great perk) which was great & allowed us to save a lot of $ not needing to go to the hotel bar. We wouldn't have enjoyed that at our room if we didn't have that view! However, housekeeping gets 1 star. On our first day, they didn't try to make up the room until 4:30pm when we were coming back to shower up for dinner. We just asked for towels and didn't have them clean it. The rest of the week was more reasonable. We never received all the toiletries each day. Many times we received shampoo & conditioner (which we didn't even need), but no lotion....or no body wash, although they could see it was missing or gone. I had to call to have some delivered. We would sometimes get 4 bath towels, but usually only 2. We showered at least twice a day, so having 4 was handy, especially when they cleaned the room late. They also didn't CLEAN. Dirty feet marks in the shower from being barefoot at the pool all day? Still there after housecleaning visit. Same goes for makeup on the bathroom counter - there all week. We walked into the room one time while they were servicing it to get something and they wash the glasses in the room in the bathroom sink. You don't get "new" ones. We had the ironing board out on Day 2, and they never put it away all week. They also swept, but never really cleaned if you could see dirty shoe marks somewhere (the whole room is tiled, so this is easy). I didn't complain, but it was quite frustrating & we were happy it was free. Like I mentioned before, this would never happen at the Fairmont or FS. The property is really pretty and feels updated. It is nice & there are many loungers at the ocean to whale-watch, enjoy the sunset or just relax listening to the waves crash in. It is also extremely wonderful that it is immediately next door to the Shops at Wailea - general store, coffee, Lapperts Ice Cream, restaurants, etc. We also loved that it was along the beach path allowing an easy walk to the other resorts for dining and recreation. An affordable & convenient option in Wailea! We seriously may not have needed a rental car! Overall it was a good experience & I'd definitely go again with points or if I found a really good deal. The only thing that was lacking was service (I didn't expect over the top at a Marriott though) and housekeeping. If the price was comparable to FS or Fairmont, you know which I'd choose

Reviews.Title: “Two Years in a Row”
Reviews.Author: HowleyB
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed Wailea so much last year that we went back this year. Styaed 2 weeks using Marriott points. I'm a Premium Member so we got an ocean front room. The hotel was full which suprised me as I heard that tourism was down. They had some large meetings going on. but the hotel occupancy did lighten up later in our stay. It is a beautiful sight but the hotel is very spreaf out. I wouldn't want to get in the building to the far south. It is a hike to the main building. The only thing they need is a choice of restaurants in the hotel. They have a poolside restaurant for lunch but no real options at dinner. Most Marriotts have a less formal restaurant with more simple fare as an option but not this hotel. I think they are losing a lot of $ by guests walking to th eshops next door for treats and simple meals. I would still go back as there are lots of options and we don't typically eat in hotels when travelling on vacation. We like to dine around.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great resort”
Reviews.Author: Marri0ttPlatinum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently took our "babymoon" at the Wailea Beach Marriott Resort and Spa and we absolutely loved it. Here is our list of pros and cons and some suggestions: Pros: - Location: right along the beach path, directly overlooking the ocean and very close to the shops - Pools: secluded and well maintained, very friendly and helpful pool staff, kids pool, 18+ pool, not too noisy, lounge chairs readily available - Rooms: very clean and comfortable, nice balcony overlooking the ocean (room 7231), LCD TV, empty fridge to store food (not filled with bar stuff), efficient housecleaning - Concierge: Mike and Chris were more than helpful, made numerous reservations for us, advised us regarding restaurants, places to go, even called our room to confirm our plans. Cons: - Front desk service: as Marriott Platinum members, we are used to service that is above and beyond what is expected. We found the people at the front desk and even the manager to be less than accommodating/friendly compared to mainland Marriotts. We were both very disappointed. Even the concierge told us that Elite members don't get ANY special treatment at the resort. - Restaurant: The Marriott restaurant is definitely not as good as restaurants on other resorts nearby (try Spago, Humuhumu and Nick's Fish Market for great dinners) Suggestions: - The Luau is expensive for a dinner show. We watched it from our balcony for free before eating a much better dinner next door at the Grand Wailea. - We bought breakfast and lunches at Whaler's General Store in the shops next door and enjoyed them every day on our balcony while whale watching. This way we could splurge on dinners. - Don't miss Lappert's ice cream located in the shops, it is delicious! - Beach chairs are free and you can get them from the Grand Wailea next door

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place.....with one exception”
Reviews.Author: cdatraveler
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed one night here while on vacation in Maui with our extended family. We decided to leave the kids with grandma at the Maui Ocean Club and get away as a couple for the night. We arrived around 1:00 pm. Our room was not ready yet, but we were given towel cards and 30 minute access to a hospitality room to change and get ready for the pool. We took our 2 complementary mai tai vouchers to the pool bar and had a drink and lunch. The infinity pool did not have any available loungers yet, so we snagged 2 by the other pool and enjoyed our meal. The mahi mahi salads were fabulous and huge! After lunch my husband walked over to the infinity pool at exactly the right time, and we were able to score 2 prime loungers on the top level. We spent the next 2 hours in heaven- sipping margaritas, enjoying the sun, watching the whales perform. We finally checked in to our room around 4pm. Our partial ocean view was actually a sweeping view of the pool and ocean beyond. The room decor was upscale and gorgeous. We had a 6:30 dinner reservation at Spago and walked the beach path to the Four Seasons. After dinner, we returned to the hotel bar for a martini. We decided to splurge with room service breakfast on our gorgeous lanai and completed the menu choice prior to going to sleep that night. Our breakfast was scheduled to be delivered at 7:30 am, as we wanted to get a few hours by the pool prior to our massages at the Grand Wailea. Now the exception......at a little after 5:30 am we were awakened by moving furniture, clanging dishes, etc. Much to our disappointment our beautiful room was actually located directly below the hotel restaurant. We were not notified upon check-in. I was able to doze off and on until breakfast, but my husband was up for the day. We complained at check-out and received a $25 credit for our resort fee. For us it wasn't the end of the world, waking up 2 hrs ahead of schedule, but NEVER in a million years would I have spent another night in that specific room location. I would have compromised my view for a little relaxation....remember, this was our only night away from our 2 and 4 year olds. Otherwise I found this resort to be a good value with gorgeous pools and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location, Beautiful Landscaping, minor drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: adershak
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Hawaiian vacation and my wife, son and I stayed at the Wailea Marriott. I am rating it a 4 out of 5 because there are a few things that could be improved to make the hotel a perfect 5. The postives outweigh the negatives....the prime location (the proximity to the ocean, near a few nice beaches, Shops of Wailea and other restaurants nearby), the beautiful landscaping and spectacular view, overall cleanliness, the children's pool area (but probably not a fun as the pool at Grand Wailea!) and the recently renovated rooms. The negatives...the ho-hum dining choices and the priciness, the boring nightlife, the crappy parking garage with spots big enough for 3/4 of a typical car and the limited technology (no LCD tv in the room, no free internet access). Overall, an enjoyable stay and admittedly quite impressed with the cleanliness of the property. For most families, this would be quite a fun time! We had one.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value, awesome suite, good service, and totally comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: LoveGrandHotels
Reviews.Content: This was our third stop in a 3-island trip to Hawaii in Feb 2009 (stayed for 6 nights), and would rank the Marriott and Maui both #1. Stops 1 and 2 were at the Outrigger Reef on Oahu (also excellent) and Grand Hyatt on Kauai (very grand!! and expensive!! indeed, but showing it's age/wear in a fairly standalone and isolated location). The location of the Marriott is outstanding. Two beaches on either side of the property to choose from, very close to the water (since it's an older *but renovated* property, building codes allowed construction practically right on the water), and adjacent to the Shops at Wailea with a boatload of shopping and dining choices without having to drive anywhere. The service was great all-around: housekeeping, restaurants, pool service, activities (activities staff really excelled here - thanks Felicity!), spa etc. The rooms, all recently renovated, exceed expectations. Used points for a deluxe ocean-facing view, and with a modest upgrade charge per night, got an "Ocean Suite" (7336),one of only two such rooms on property. Three wrap-around balconies were about 50-75 feet from the water, 1.5 baths, separate dining/living/bedroom areas, flat screens - with whales gliding by and breaching in the water all clearly visible from the balconies with your naked eye. Simply amazing!!! All things considered (price/value/view/quality) - this was the best view I have ever had from any hotel room in the world, and I have stayed in some top-tier properties around the world from Peninsula's to Four Seasons. Checked out all of the close-by properties, many of which reminded me of "Vegas in Maui", especially the Grand Wailea. The Marriott had a quiet, understated air of calmness and tranquility about it without being over the top. Comforable rating is 100%! The adults-only Infinity Pool is truly excellent as others have noted. Yeah - no annoying screaming children. The view from the pool and and its design are 5-star. My only complaint with it were the plastic (credit-card like) towel cards you had to hand over when asking for a towel and then retrieving the cards when returing the towels. It reminded me of asking for a "hall pass" to go to the lavatory in junior high school. Drop this practice, Marriott. Feel free to email with any questions or for comments on the Outrigger Reef in Honolulu or the Grand Hyatt in Poipu on Kauai. THANK YOU TO THE MARRIOTT WAILEA AND ITS STAFF FOR AN AMAZING TIME! Already planning a return visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: vacationgoer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I literally stepped off the plane earlier today after a week long stay at the Marriott celebrating our anniversary. We are both Platinum preferred and were staying on Rewards points. Upon check-in, we were told we had the option of paying the standard $25/day fee, $18/day for valet, or $15/day for self-park (had the option because we were staying on points). Also, we had reserved a garden view room assuming that we would get an upgrade since we live at a Marriott throughout the year. The hotel was at 100% occupancy and was actually oversold (what about this economic downturn we keep hearing about?!) so the upgrade options were limited (had the same issue at Avis- demand outweighs supply at the moment). Anyway, we were upgraded to a partial oceanview (expecting to see a sliver of the ocean), instead we were pleasantly surprised with a FANTASTIC view of the infinity pool and ocean (Hale 1). We were thrilled! The rooms are nice/recently renovated. We loved the tile floor (I hate when there is carpet in a tropical location). The balconies are great and we enjoyed many mornings/evenings watching the whales. After reading many of the reviews, we were prepared to fight the other lounge chair sharks at the infinity pool and put our towels down by 8am (of course being newbies on the first day we didn't realize the chairs we chose were the last to receive sun!- these were the chairs on the main level in the middle). Word of advice....definitely reserve lounge chairs ASAP since they fill up very quickly. There is a sign that says they don't allow guests to reserve chairs and any inactivity after 30 min. will result in loss of the chair (never saw that policy followed!). They have other options such as cabanas ($100/day) and blue circular lounge sofas (only $25/day). We reserved a blue thing one day and it was well worth it (especially since we were able to sleep in knowing we had a reserved spot!). Terry is the main server in the infinity pool area and while she is extremely friendly, she is stretched too thin. She is the ONLY server for that entire pool area so you can imagine as drink/food orders pick up, she's hard to come by! We had some of the frozen cocktails throughout the week (pretty good, only $10, $8 during happy hour (3-5pm I think). The food was ok- basic salads, burgers, sandwiches but way over priced. An ahi ceasar salad was $22! We discovered the Whaler General Store at the Shops at Wailea which serves sandwiches, salads, sushi, hot plate, etc. (way cheaper). The beach path is great and extends throughout all the resorts. Lots of walkers/joggers/whale watchers throughout the day. The Marriott is close to two beaches but we ended up just staying at the pool most days. The staff was all very nice. Housekeeping was very friendly and efficient (nightly turndown service with a flower). The valet guys were great (helped my husband take off the top to our jeep) and even gave us recommendations for places to eat, things to do. The bellmen, front desk, and concierge were all great as well. We didn't use the spa at all (besides taking advantage of 50% off all Pureology products...unheard of!!!). The location is great- in between two beaches, right on the water, close to the Shops at Wailea, quick drive to Kihei (although not much to see), convienent trips to Paia (only 35 min.) and the airport, ~40 min. to Lahaina. Overall we had a great stay at the Marriott and would definitely return (especially using points!). Tips: -Stop at Costco near the airport and buy bottled water to store in your fridge -Reserve (or put your towels down) on lounge chairs EARLY (by 8am or so) -Go out for lunch (definitely dinner) -Skip roomservice for breakfast (fruit, coffee, and eggs benedict were ~$60)- go to Longhi's or the stand along the beach path Pros: -Great overall renovations (beautiful lobby/entrance) completed within the last 6 mo. -Nice rooms/bathrooms -Mini-fridges -Comfortable beds -Great balconies/views -Nice/helpful staff Cons: -Internet Service was weak (no wireless)- wish there was wireless access at the pool! -Slow service at the pool (not Terry's fault, she is just the only one!) -Overpriced food -Mala Bar closes at 10pm; where can you get a drink past 10pm at the resort??!!! -pool cards are a pain (really necessary?!)- need to exchange your cards for towels (can get multiple towels per card)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort; would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: KatieGJD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort on Marriott points and we were extremely pleased with your stay. Room/View From Room: We stayed in room 709 at the Haleakala building and had an excellent view of the volcano and nice view of the ocean if we looked from the right angle (we also had a bit of the parking lot/entrance in the view, but it wasn't too bad at all). Our view was not the direct ocean view we had hoped for and we were unable to be upgraded despite status - that being said our view was still good. The room was very clean and well decorated (in an updated tranquil look) and had a king size bed with at last six pillows. Pool/Beach: The resort was absolutely gorgeous. It does not have direct beach access but you can literally lay out and relax on the cliffs overlooking the ocean - it's amazing - frankly, I preferred it to the beach and I usually love the beach. We rented the covered cabana at the serenity infinity pool and that was great - $100 per day with towels, bottled water and a fruit tray - a little expensive but we enjoyed it and rented one more than once. The pool scene at the adult pool was quiet but still friendly - very relaxing. You could literally watch the whales jumping around in the water (it was whale season) from the pool. Drinks at the pool were hard to get - service friendly but slow. Not a big deal for us, but worth mentioning. The beach front walking path goes through the resort as it does through all the resorts so you're very connected to the other resorts and are next door to two beaches. Shopping: The resort is nearby Wailea shopping (as in a five minute walk away) - which is fantastic - it has everything from the Gap to Banana Republic to Coach, Fendi and Louis Vuitton to general convenience stores, swimsuit stores and restaurants and ice cream. If you don't have time to get everything you need for your stay, you can pick it up here (I wish I would have known that so I could have avoided overnight delivery charges for last minute items I ordered for the trip). You should note the very low sales tax but I did see that some Coach items were more expensive than usual. The Marriott resort shop had drinks, medicine type items, and some gift store items but was a little disappointing, but that was okay since the other shops were right there. The jewelry store at the Marriott was really great - they had a couple of sales while were there so ask about upcoming sales before you buy items. Marriott Spa: The spa was fine - just had a massage treatment and mani/pedi. They added some sort of service charge (20%) and the person could not explain that charge other than to say the service providers received a small percentage of it - we still tipped but did not understand this charge and it somewhat tainted our experience. They did not have OPI products but they were allegedly adding them to their nail salon. Comparison to other Resorts: We did a spa treatment at Grand Wailea and had dinner at the Four Seasons in Wailea. Both resorts were beautiful but there was something more tranquil and almost classier about the Marriott. That may sound surprising but the Marriott's (streamlined?) modesty seems more modern and relaxing than some of the more ornate grounds at Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons. I'd probably stay at the Marriott over these other resorts, but would try the other resorts if they cost less than the Marriott. You really can't go wrong. Wailea is great as is all of the hotels there. Minor Complaints (Service): we had problems with internet service in the room and the free wireless service in the common areas was extremely slow. Ultimately, there was an equipment problem in our room that wasn't discovered and resolved until the day before we left despite numerous calls. Overall service at the resort was good, but was not amazing (but nothing to complain about). Check in/out was quick and easy. We were unable to upgrade or get a late check out but they do have hospitality rooms to use if you have a late flight (that were not suggested to us when we were denied late check out, but that we learned about from someone else). Tips: Matteos Restarant is nearby and a good place for a (nice) pizza lunch. We did not eat at the resort as the lunch options weren't that great (but I am a picky eater) and dined at places we found in a book that reviewed all the best Maui restauarants. For nearby fine dining, we recommend Capische (LOVED it), Spago at Four Seasons, and Mama's Fish House (about 40 min. away). The ice cream at the Wailea shopping center is also good. We enjoyed doing the Hana highway and we also did powered hang gliding (I hate flying and felt totally safe in an open powered hang glide). Summary: loved Wailea, loved the Marriott, would recommend Marriott Wailea and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: SilverlakeJake
Reviews.Content: This location could not have been better. You are away from Kihei, (the area that the tour books describe as over commercialized), but close enough so that the drive to Safeway is easy. This property does not sit directly on the beach, but Wailea beach is an easy walk. Better yet, hop in your rental car and drive south to Makena Beach which is great for snorkeling and not crowded like Wailea. We arrived at 11PM and were greeted with smiles and great service. The open air welcome area is so beatiful and complete with tiki torches and comfy sofas. The rooms were clean and well appointed, but who's in Maui to sit in your room? The 'ocean view' room we had was on the sixth floor with views of the hotel grounds and ocean in the distance. Some people may want the ocean front room, but honestly didn't think it worth it considering the beach is right there within easy access. The pools were great and clean. Food is typical of Maui, expensive. My favorite was the burger joint at the shopping mall next door, cheap and delicious. I believe it's called Cheeseburgers in Paradise.
