This is your place if you're looking for a friendly, semi-upscale hotel for your vacation to Maui. If you prefer to spend more money on your holiday, there is a Four Seasons right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful resort - unfortunately the hotel knows that!”
Reviews.Author: HansNYC
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the positive about this hotel. Its location is absolutely georgeous. The Marriott Wailea Beach is one of the older resorts on Maui and is hence built very closely to the water. You have great water views from many of their rooms. The fact that there is no beach in front of the hotel did not matter to us. There is a beach on either side of the resort property, about 2-5 mins away, depending on the location of your room. The resort is big, but it maintains a certain cozyness through its widespread layout. There are numerous pools, including an adult-only serenity pool (ie it appears to extend into the ocean) and a kids pool with water slides. The rooms are spacious and must have been renovated not too long ago. While some people prefer carpet, I think tiled floors work quite well considering that you bring in sand from the beach. We had an ocean-view, which was actually almost like an ocean front as we had beautiful waterviews even from inside the room. Having said all this, you might ask why I only rated this hotel "Average". Well, while the staff was extremely friendly at all times, they did not seem to be willing to grant any guest requests. It felt a little bit like we were supposed to thank them for being able to stay at their resort on beautiful Maui. We certainly didn't ask for much during our stay as we spent a lot of time at the beach and exploring the island, but those few requests were not met. A few examples: 1. Arrival Coming from New York, we obviously had an extremely long trip behind us when we arrived at 11:00pm on Saturday night. We pulled up to the front of the hotel and unloaded the car. Because of the unreasonable valet charge of $25/day, we decided to self park. However, in order to get my fiancee (who is 6-month pregnant) and her 6 year old daughter up to the room as soon as possible, I asked if I could check in before parking the car. They denied, because they "need to keep the space open". Yet, there is space for 10+ cars and only one other car was parked there besides ours at the time. At 11pm at night, I'd consider this a minimum courtesy to the guest. 2. Parking This gets even worse due to the parking situation. The Marriott has layed out their parking situation to make people cough up the extra $$$ for valet parking. All the spots close to the hotel are "valet only" - plenty of open spots at all time. Regular guest parking is in the garage, which late at night is usually completely packed (small spots too so that lots of people occupy 2 spots at once) and it can take 10-15 mins until to park the car and get back to the hotel. 3. Marriott Rewards Benefits (Part 1) The recent changes in the Marriott Rewards Program (all members of the program will know what I'm referring to) have made hotel rewards a lot more costly and the program much less attractive compared to others like the Starwood Preferred Guest Program. During this stay, I tried to take advantage of two benefits that I should get as a silver member, yet none was granted by the Marriott Wailea Beach. 3a. Check cashing As a Silver/Gold/Platinum member, one is entitled to cash personal checks at the front desk. I tried so, but it was denied, because my street address was not printed on the check, only my full name. Once again, I do consider this just bad service. I have cashed the same checks multiple times at different Marriotts, so why not this time? Security concerns stated by the front desk manager are simply ridiculous, considering that as a silver member Marriott knows my personal details much better than many other vendors who gladly accept my checks. 3b. Late Checkout Our request for late checkout was also denied, citing that the hotel was fully booked. Once again, as a silver member I should get preferred late checkout. Even if the hotel is booked, there will be enough people checking in much later than 3pm, so an extension for an extra couple of hours to 2pm should be possible. Once again, while the staff was extremely friendly, it was obvious that they did not see the need of accomodating their guests. 4. Food I do not recommend eating at the Marriott, especially if you have a car to get around. We tried a couple of things at their poolside restaurant and they were only mediocre in quality, yet expensive. If your stuck to the Wailea resort area, you might have to do it, but otherwise there are plenty of more reasonable options in nearby Kihei. The shops at Weilea also have a couple of restaurants if you don't want to drive. The breakfast buffett at the Marriott is not bad, but again pretty expensive. If you do want to go for the full breakfast, pop over to the Four Seaons (15-20 mins walk along the beach path). Their buffet is only a few dollars more, but it is well worth it. Not only for their amazing buffet, but also to be reminded that excellent service does still exist - if you know where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnnykuta
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at the Marriott in December with my girlfriend. We had a room on the ground floor overlooking the walkway, grass lawn, and then the ocean. Room service was outstanding, so we actually had breakfast in our hotel room most mornings. The ocean walkway in front of the hotel is also a great place to go for a jog. Ulua beach near the hotel is great for snorkeling and spotting turtles. The Luau at the hotel was also great, so would recommend checking it out. The best part was drinking Mai Tais at the Infiniti pool watching whales go by. I would definitely go back to this hotel. It is expensive, but its a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise.”
Reviews.Author: rockgoddess309
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Wailea Beach Marriott Resort & Spa during our honeymoon. We enjoyed our stay so much! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were always clean and comfortable. The views from the resort are amazing and relaxing. They have a number of pools on the resort, as well as a number of restaurants. The restaurants were a tad pricey- but really no different from anywhere else on the island. The staff does everything they can to make sure your stay is a great one. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view from our balcony”
Reviews.Author: kstewart57
Reviews.Content: We spend 13 days at this hotel for our delayed honeymoon. We had the most fantastic time. The staff were absolulely the best. Our room was cleaned twice per day which was a pleasure since we like to take a second shower and or nap in the afternoon before heading out for dinner. We loved the staff at the adult pool, very friendly. As far as someone complaining about the parking, not sure what the big deal was....walk across the drive and park in the garage. We parked there for 13 days in and out most days and ALWAYS found a place to park. I rate this hotel very high.

Reviews.Title: “Conference in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: WAREAGLE92
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Wailea Marriott from Feb 2-6, 2009.Â  My husband came with me.Â  We took the 8 hour flight from Dallas to Maui on American Airlines.Â  It was an older plane without the individual "TV" screens unfortunately.Â  Also, the food was for purchase and they seemed to have run out by the time they got to us, but it was okay, because we had brought our own snacks.Â  We rented a car from the airport Hertz (FYI:Â  Hawaii is a "no fault" state), and then drove to the resort---no problems following the website directions.Â  When we got there, we dropped off the luggage with the porters and I "self-parked" the car.Â  The open air lobby was gorgeous!Â  The check-in staff was very kind and helpful.Â  There is a one-time porterage fee of $18.Â  This is so that the porter can take you and your luggage to the room via a golf cart because the resort is so large.Â  When you check out, you call the front desk and they will come pick you and your luggage up again for check out.Â  She also explained the $25 resort fee:Â  it gets you 2 free MaiTai drinks (and they are STRONG!), one glass of champagne with each dinner entree purchased in the Mala Restaurant, free daily self-parking, 2 bottles of water daily, and various other things.Â  Our room was very nice.Â  We had asked for a king, but all they had left were 2 queens---no problem.Â  The balcony overlooked the infinity pool.Â  The resort grounds were just beautiful---plenty of birds-of-paradise plants, palms, etc...Â  The beaches were nice, but I'm from the gulf coast, so I'm used to prettier beaches.Â  Anyway, it was still gorgeous and exotic, with the mountains in the background and the volcanic rock.Â Â  And, yes, you can see whales breaching off shore right from the hotel grounds---it is AMAZING!!!Â  The conference facilities were great.Â  We had fresh fruit, pastries, and Starbuck's coffee for breakfast every morning---I've never eaten so much pineapple in my life!Â  My husband and I liked the pool at the Kumu bar and grill the best.Â  The infinity pool was beautiful, but it does not have a lot of room.Â  We ate at the Mala restaurant at sunset our first night there---it is true what they say about Hawaiian sunsets:Â  they are spectacular!Â  The food was very good but we couldn't eat it all (big portions).Â  I also tried the burger at Kumu grill and it IS as delicious as previous reviewers had said.Â  The onion soup was also delicious.Â  Finally, I must comment on the Luau.Â  I paid the $97 after tax to get the real deal, and it was worth every penny.Â  The price includes open bar, a nice buffet and dessert table, and a wonderful show.Â  The show takes place at sunset, and it was just an amazing experience.Â  I highly recommend it.Â  Excursions:Â  We did a whale watching boat trip---very cool!Â  We drove half the way to Hana and then turned around, because we did not really want to go all the way;Â  just wanted to experience some of the rainforest and waterfalls and one lane bridges.Â  And, besides that, all we did was lay out in the sun by the pool! Places to eat:Â  Cheeseburger place in Wailea shops--average.Â  Ruth Chris' Steakhouse (also in Wailea)---excellent as usual, but now getting more affordable:Â  they have a deal now where you can choose a salad or gumbo, an entree, and a dessert for $39.99 or $49.99, depending on the entree.Â  Matteo's Italian Pizza in Wailea:Â  delicious and affordable. Flatbread Company in Paia:Â  organic flatbread pizza:Â  delicious (We obviously like pizza!) Unfortunately, did not make it to Humuhumu....but really wanted to; just ran out of time. Shopping:Â  the Shops at Wailea were great:Â  Not only had some typical shops like Gap & Cache, but also some specialty shops and art galleries.Â  I really wanted to do more shopping but did not have time.Â  Bought some souvenirs from ABC and Whalers General Store. In conclusion, my first trip to Hawaii was sensational, despite the fact that it was a "working holiday".Â  The Marriott was absolutely great:Â  beautifully maintained grounds, friendly staff, spacious rooms, and nice conference facilities.Â  I definitely would recommend it, as well as their Luau.Â

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place!”
Reviews.Author: WBSCOB
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here 2/9-2/11 for our anniversary. This place is amazing. It is along a quiet beach, and everything they do is first class. The pools are nice, the slides are fun, and the property is immaculate. From check-in to check-out, everyone was so friendly. The rooms look brand new too, which is a big plus for my wife and I. You are about 45 minutes from Lahaina, and 30 minutes from the airport, so the location is convenient too. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, and I don't say that too often!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location- great service”
Reviews.Author: senor_boom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Marriott for a conference and was very happy with our stay. First, the property itself is spectacular. Its tucked behind the Shops at Wailea and centered on a rocky point just north of Wailea beach. This location gives some spectacular panoramic views from Molokini to West Maui. The resort is spread out over a fair bit of the coastline, and divided into multiple small buildings, so you don't feel like you are staying at a mega-resort. Some of the other properties nearby are tucked into a bay behind Wailea beach and thus have a more crowded feel because their shorelines are shorter. The rooms are nicely appointed and comfortable. They've got a kind of tropical/pacific rim fusion theme going on and it works. I can vouch for the views from Hale 2, odd numbers and its quite nice- those rooms are on a quiet end of the resort and look out towards West Maui and a quiet little sandy cove. Very peaceful. The pools are all nice (although cold) and if Terri is the server, you'll get great poolside service.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, old hotel, stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: reviewer2009
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff are very unhelpful. They have major attitudes and are unfriendly. The bellman gave the incorrect prices for valeting the car (they inflated the price for self parking) and neglected to mention that the valet parking is in the same garage as the self parking. The air conditioner did not work half the time in the room, because the patio door had to be shut in a very particular way in order for the air conditioner to turn on. The elevator in the hotel was out for several hours, and we were provided glowsticks to light the staircase. Had laundry done through the hotel and it was given to another guest. Service by the infinity pool was extremely slow. The Grand Wailea Hyatt is a much friendlier option next door.

Reviews.Title: “Hale 5 Perfect Place for the Family”
Reviews.Author: propredicr
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed at the Wailea Marriott was during the renovations. Well, I'm pleased to say that they are outstanding! I was there for a week at the end of January for meetings. The Hale 5 is between the eternity pool and the kiddie pool. My room had a beautiful ocean view and was very peaceful at night, with the sliding door open. The service was friendly and prompt. The $25/day resort fee is a little steep, especially if you have anywhere cell phone service and you don't need to use a land line. I forgot that they charge a porter fee and ended up tipping anyway. Oh, well. The self park lot is built for mini Coopers, so if the rental is an SUV...good luck. The hotel food is about average and the cheeseburger is really good. I'd opt to take a cruise up the road to Kihei and Kahului for cheaper eats. The room has a small refrigerator, so you can visit the grocery store and keep some light items in the room. If you golf and are on a budget, the courses at Maui Dunes, Kahili, and Elleair are more modestly priced. I was able to catch a round at Wailea Gold. Unfortunately, it was during a torrential rainstorm, but, it didn't detract from the beauty of the course. For the money, it might be a better deal than the Grand Wailea, next door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: kgholtz
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Wailea Marriott for your stay on Maui whether it be for vacation, honeymoon etc. The hotel is in a great location, very clean, spacious, nice rooms, They also have a beautiful infinity pool. We got married on Maui and were there before and after the wedding and loved every minute of it as did our guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: brat41
Reviews.Content: We stayed in delux ocean view room and the view was grand and the sound of the surf at night was excellent. rarely turned ac on.The staff was out standing and always accommodating. the food was so so and would eat out often. Their breakfast was good. If you use the valet service its 18 per dayand ther was a 25 dollar a day for some kind of special fee in addition to the regular room tax etc..the beach was very nice and you could even do snorkeling. And yes out of your room you could catch glimpses of the whales and the sunsets are beautiful. The best food we ate was in kahului at an italian place called marco`s. There is also a fishhouse i heard about but cant remember..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: jksflyer
Reviews.Content: The Wailea Beach Marriott Resort and Spa is a great hotel location in upscale Wailea. The hotel is the oldest on the beach, but by far the best. The hotel has two wonderful beaches on each side of it for guest to access. The hotel is oceanfront, which is rare and provides a great setting. You can open your balcony doors early in the day and lay in a wonderful Marriott bed and sleep listening to the waves crash on to the rocks and beach. The hotel service was wonderful. I meet the Director of Human Resources during my visit and she was very warm and welcoming. I was very impressed with the poolside staff, especially Anita. I also was impressed by the bell team, these guys and gals were super. Some of the best I have seen in my travels. I did venture outside the resort and found its location close to the major areas. I would advise not trying the Hana Highway alone... very long. Also, the food was good at the hotel. I am a big fan of room service, and the food was very good too... I would recommend the Shrimp Ceaser Wrap , Maui Onion Rings and try the Asian Style Wings. I also enjoyed the good old fashioned Marriott Burger. I did find one negative, the front desk staff seemed a little shy/cold. This is hard for me to judge because I work at front desk myself. Wendy was the best during my departure from the hotel, she was warm and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to couples old or young who want to get away for a long week or weekend. Also, a nice place for a single traveler to get away from the world.

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: s-macNY
Reviews.Content: I rated this hotel neutral because it is not the fault of the hotel that it was not right for us. It is a beautiful hotel, large rooms, comfortable beds and thoroughly clean. The problem is with the people staying at the hotel. They have an attitude that is above and beyond anything I have ever experience. There is a "serenity" pool in the back that we had to walk past everyday. This pool was beautiful, overlooking the ocean but the only lounge chairs that were "free" were arranged side by side on a grass area or on the concrete with about 1 foot separating you from your neighbor. So you would think that with all that coziness, someone would be engaging in a lighthearted fun conversation. Not so. My husband and I called it the "dead" pool. There was not a single person talking, there was a sign that said "no cell phones" which I agree with but no talking??? It was really weird. It was like the people were more concerned with how they looked than actually having some fun. The double umbrella lounge chairs were for rent, $50 per day and the gazebo covered chairs were for rent $100 per day. No-one rented any of them so it was crowed on the"free" chairs. So naturally our room was directly behind this pool with the shower right across from our patio and the pathway to the rest rooms went directly past our patio. My husband and I went scuba diving everyday and had all of our scuba gear laid out on the lawn in front of our patio because there was no place to hang it to dry. I am not exhagerating when I say that 99% of the people that walked past us said not one word, made eye contact, nodded or even smiled. Only one guy said "yea that's the way to do it". Only because we decided to buy our own beers from the local store and drink them on our patio while we were drying out from diving. We decided to try the other pool by the bar to see if there was some life and conversation. We travel alot and enjoy meeting people. Well the only person that had a conversation with us was a little girl who told us she was rich and that she just sold her horse on e-bay. So that pool didn't do well with us either. We are beach people but when you are exhausted from diving and surfing, it's nice to relax by a pool for a little while and maybe have some fun conversation with people or even watch people having fun. Not here. So who cares right? We are there to celebrate our 20th anniversary, dive in the beautiful Molikini, surf and see the whales. We did all of this and enjoyed ourselves so much but we only wish that we stayed in South Kehei which is about 1 mile away, brimming with life and smiling faces. Our breakfast at the Marriott was $25.00 per day so naturally we went out and found the south Kehei Cafe that gave you so much food that you didn't need to eat for the entire day and the breakfast was $10.00 The coffee was good too. As a matter of fact, the Marriott charges you $25.00 per day plus tax on top of your bill just for "bed making, two bottles of water being left in your room per day, unlimited phone calls to the main land (so does my cell phone) and the right to park your own car instead of using valet. I thought that was just as abusive as the $25.00 breakfast but maybe I am just a low maintenance kind of person and don't really care about having my bed made or two bottles of water. So now onto the dinner. Two fat filled, not cooked right, rib eye dinners, no alcohol drinks and desert was $134.00 We went to Ruth's Chris the next day and for only $20.00 more we dined on perfectly prepared, lean and delicious, "cowboy steak", fillet mignon ,steamed veggies, augratin potatoes, stuffed baked clams appetizers, two alcohol drinks and desert. What a great place to spend your money! You can walk there from the Marriott. Diving was the best I've ever done. Dive with B&B. The concierge won't know who they are because they are in south Kehei and not huge like Maui Dive Shop. B&B was a small operation of local people that are friends with the curator of the Aquarium. The curator uses B&B when ever he needs to go out so you are in the best hands with them. They meet at 5:45am and you are going out to Molikini in the dark. By the time you get there, the sun is barely peeking over the mountain. When you descend, you get to see the sleeping sharks and watch all of the fish wake up and start eating. Another great dive was at a little boat wreck that was loaded with the biggest turtles I've ever seen. They even pose for your camera. So to end this very long rambling, if you are fun and low key, don't go to the Marriott Wailea. It's too depressing and expensive even though it is very pretty, clean and beautifully located. The whole island is beautiful. I can't wait to go back, but to South Kehei next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Klark
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed this hotel. Our room was 3216 and was right on the water. We could not have had a better room. We saw whales from our room and from the pool. The Mai Tais at the pool bar were the best that we found in Oahu and Maui. The adult infinity pool was great. We spent more time here than the beach. The restaurant at the hotel was not very good. It was WAY overpriced. We did like Tommy Bahamas, but the service was awful. Cafe Ole was delicious for dinner. The Kihei Cafe is a must for breakfast. Wailea is a less touristy area then Ka'anapali. I would highly recommend the hotel and location. Big Beach is a short drive from the hotel and is a beautiful beach. Also the beds are sooooo comfy. It was hard to get up everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: YCS_JAN
Reviews.Content: The room was not cleaned for one of the day during our stay. I complained to the front desk and the response that I got was because I had the do not disturb sign on the door knob. I only put it on for like 30 minutes, and they never came back to double check the room. Not a major issue, but definitely can be improved. Other than this, the overall experience at the resort was great. The room is very spacious and well maintained, but the bathroom can definitely be updated. The bathroom is some what small comparing to the overall size of the room. Outside the room, the resort is very well maintained. They have a children pool and a adult pool. The ocean view from the adult pool is amazing. There is also a beach trail which is about couple miles long, and it is great for morning walks. I really enjoyed going down to the rocky sections along the beaches. You can find interesting marine lifes. In my opinion, it is more fun than going to the Maui Ocean Center. The location of the resort is great if the goal of the trip is to relax at the beach and play golf. If planning on going to Hanna or west maui, then the drive can be tiresome. If going during the whale season, then you may be able to see the whales from the resort. Just remember to bring a pair of binoculars. Also, there is a Laua going on few times a week right at the resort. You can sit at the children pool and enjoy the free Laua which usually cost over $50/person. :) By the way, the resort charges $25/day service fee. It includes free self parking and 2 bottles of water. It did not bother me at all since it includes the parking. Just something to know so you don't get surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, Gorgeous - wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: KaraokeDiva
Reviews.Content: Since my fiancee and I are not in quite the same salary bracket as probably this resort's average patron, we loved our one-night stay here in October and wish we could have stayed another couple of nights. Our family had a timeshare in Ka'anapali where we spent most of our nine days on Maui, but needed a place to stay for our first day since the timeshare was only for seven nights. There were six of us (plus a toddler) in our group, and we had three rooms that were purchased with Marriott points, so we weren't exactly in the ocean-view suites. But the rooms were gorgeous and clean, each having a delightfully comfy King bed and a lanai (though overlooking the parking lot, my parents' room actually had a nice garden view) and though I normally prefer carpet, I absolutely loved the tile floors in each room for such a clean look. Our rooms were also very convenient to the lobby (I LOVE the outdoor lobby) and front desk, so that made for a really nice check-in. One TEENSY downside - check-in was made a much longer process than it should have been. The front desk clerk was super nice and competent, but he was kind of taking his sweet time with the whole process and we really ready for our rooms (and dinner), as we had just finished nearly 24 hours of travel from Ohio. After checking out our rooms, four of us went over to the bar and grill for a light dinner/snack and two stayed behind to order room service and deal with a very cranky toddler. The restaurant was pricey (as to be expected), but the food was delicious - their gourmet mac & cheese was different than anything I've ever had and worth a try! My sister, on the other hand, who had stayed behind to order room service, seemed underwhelmed by her food, and was slightly appalled at the $9 they paid for an ordinary hot dog for my nephew - when in Rome, I suppose. After a great night of sleep, we found ourselves lucky that our first daytime view of Maui was at this resort, as it's breathtaking. After muffins and bagels purchased from the nearby market, we all decided to take advantage of the Marriott's later-than-usual checkout time (noon) and spend a few hours enjoying their pools before we left. First we wandered over to the kiddie area, which was really nice - especially since there were two slightly larger slides that we adults enjoyed, too! After that, the toddler was taken back to the rooms for cleanup while the four remaining adults went to enjoy the Serenity Pool for a little while. I could have spent days on end enjoying that pool - it's GORGEOUS. Unfortunately, we didn't have much time there, but I've vowed to make it back one day soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tobysmom53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Wailea Resort and Spa because the Four Seasons was already booked. We were not disappointed. In fact, we went to the Four Seasons for lunch one day and the pool area was so crowded you barely had enough room to put your flip flops on the tiled pool area. Anyway,lets talk about the Marriott. It was open air and it was a very comfortable place to stay. Not over pretentious! Since we were all adults we especially enjoyed the Infinity Pool, for adults only. It was nice and quiet and Terry and Anita were the best waitresses! They even remembered our names and where we were from! They really made the day go by fast, at the pool! We ate breakfast in the hotel, most mornings and my husband and I shared it. The omelet and the lox and bagels were very good. We really never had any bad food, as we ate at the pool almost everyday. Pricey as every place in Hawaii, especially Maui. I did ask for recommendations for dinner, and was told to not miss Serento's or The Waterfront. Well we made Christmas Day dinner reservations at Serento's and we were very disappointed. The spaghetti and meatballs were awful, my husband and my friend's husband had them and they both hated it! My girlfriend and myself had the veal marsala and the pasta we had with it was barely cooked...talk about al dente!! We would not suggest this restaurant to anyone. Now about The Waterfront....the food was good, not great, the prices were slightly lower than other restaurants, the decor straight out of the 80's and we had a "visitor" almost at our table...yes it was the biggest palmetto bug we had ever seen. YuK!!!! I am glad we were done with our dinner at that point. My husband was taking a picture of it when our waiter just said oh it is just a palmetto bug, we have them here all the time, after all we are by the water!!! Not for me at those prices! We are not snobs, but we do fine dining all the time, so we were not impressed with these two recommendations. We did have a wonderful dinner at Mama's Fishouse! In face, the best dinner of our whole trip. The fish was outstanding and the service impecable. The dinner at Tommy Bahama's, next door at the Shops at Wailea was very good too. We enjoyed the chowder as well as our entrees. We also dined at Ruth's Chris, always good, was not disappointed here either. We had breakfast at Longi's and it was good but not as good as the hotel breakfast. We also had a wonderful dinner, at Pacifico's in Lahina. My husband and I ate there 5 years previously and it was good as always...I highley recommend them for dinner. The hotel room we had when I arrived was supposed to be an oceanfront room and It wasn't what I thought a oceanfront room should be, but I just went and asked if we could be moved and we were, without hassle, and were given room 4510 it was overlooking the infinity pool and the ocean. We had sunset on our lanai everynight. The staff at the hotel were always helpful and very courteous and I would given them all 5 stars. If you want to stay in Wailea do not hesitate to choose this hotel. It has something for everyone, fom kids to adults!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Wailea!”
Reviews.Author: Shoopdb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a week's vacation just before Christmas, 12/16-12/23. Upon arrival, we were happy to have been upgraded from a terrace view to an ocean front room. To be fair, I am a Marriot Rewards Silver Member, and this may have helped with the upgrade. Nonetheless, we were delighted to have such a wonderful room and beautiful view from our lanai. The rooms have been recently updated, along with the rest of the property. Bathroom was a bit small, but very nice touches of granite. Pros: The open air lobby is great. We had stayed at the Hapuna Prince on the Big Island, which also has an open air lobby. Everyone at the property was very friendly, with perhaps one exception. Specifically, I would say that Terry & Anita were the most incredible waitresses during our stay. They were the regular attendants at the Adults Only Infinity Pool (see pics). This is a brand new addition to the property and is not to be missed. What an incredible view of the ocean and mountains!! Most days, we had the breakfast buffet included and it was good, but not great. We splurged on breakfast at the Four Seasons (just a short walk down the path that lines the ocean) and it was incredible. There are two beaches nearby, and we preferred the smaller Ulua beach, just north of the property. We ate our dinners off property every night, except one night we did have room service. Can't miss restaurants are Mama's Fish House. By far, the most incredible seafood we've ever had and with it's own beach right in front of the property, it is absolutely beautiful. This is truly one of the best dining experiences my wife and I have ever had. Also, we took a very scenic drive late in the day up to Lahaina and ate at a delicious French Restaurant, Gerards. It is set in an old Victorian Era Home. We also had the opportunity to take a catamaran sail to Molikini. Many of these trips utilize very large boats and seem a bit overly touristy. We definitely recommend taking the catamaran that departs from the Maui Prince Hotel just south of Wailea. The catamaran had room for up to 80 guests, but we only had 15 plus 3 crewmembers. A pleasant experience indeed, as we snorkeled with many sea turtles and witnessed about half a dozen humback whales!! Cons: Maybe we're just not that picky, but I can't think of a specific con that really upset myself or my wife during our trip. Maybe that the ribs I ordered for room service were a bit overcooked!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: sosehaku
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the staff.....Fabulous. Lots of smiles, polite and always very helpful. The pools and landscaping are as nice if not nicer than any of the 5 stars. The food is a little pricey for the quality....although this is Maui so all the hotels are quite expensive. The rooms are definantly only 4 star at best. I changed rooms when I first arrived ( with no issues) because my original "ocean front deluxe" unit wasnt very deluxe. I was moved and it was much better ( but again it is only 4 star). If you can, request a side/corner unit as they are a fair bigger. It really is the only hotel where you can have a room very close to the water. All in all it was a very good holiday and if I chose to stay at a hotel versus a condo this would be the one I would stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort was top notch”
Reviews.Author: HulaGirl22
Reviews.Content: This resort is definitely top notch. The beds were so comfy we didn't want to ever get out of them. The resort is beautiful with it's endless pools. What we didn't like is that the room cost with the parking fee was already exorbitant and then you had to also pay for certain areas at the pools. We found that annoying and ridiculous. Seemed like this resort drew mostly snobby folks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: first_visit_Maui
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Marriot (11/26 - 12/2) and loved it & would return there for sure. Family is mom, dad, 9 yr old daughter & 5 year old daughter. - Open air lobby was very refreshing & unusual - We used self parking and the garage was the same as the valet parking so distance is the same. - We got room 5410 in Hale (builing) 5, 4th floor. Our lanai overlooked the infinity pool & the ocean beyond - great view. - We ate breakfast on the lanai every single morning :-) - Loved the kids pool (my kids would be happy there all day) and also the Wailea beach was great, boogie boarding was a new sport my girls discovered here. -Our family doesn't like to eat restaurant food too much so we had to keep it simple soups and sandwiches kind of fare - when we landed at the airport, we rented the car and drove straight to the Walmart by the airport and stocked up on all the snacks and breakfast foods we could find (that walmart was also great for buying souvenirs on our way out at half the price of Hilo stores and other touristy places) We then stopped at the Safeway in Kihei and got everything else fresh we needed. - We also loved the Whaler General Store & ABC store at the Shops @ Wailea which is next door to the Marriott. I mean next-door, walk over and the Whalers store has a nice little deli counter and hot soups daily. They also sell whatever you may have forgotten or not carried in your carry on baggage. - DO NOT rent the snorkel gear or boogie boards from the hotels along Wailea. There is a path that runs along the entire beach front: Ocean on one hand and the resorts on the other, and there are a couple of store fronts which work with the hotels to rent these things out but they are outrageous as it cost $8 an hour for the boogie board and $20 for the day. Next door, at the Whalers, you can BUY the boogie board for $20!!! - We did not use any of the restaurants on site but they all looked nice and were busy in the evenings. - We did watch the luau for free by hanging out by the kiddie pool at that time and had the same great view for free. - The sunsets were awesome, each and every evening, for Free :-) - We used all the pools at the Marriott and they are all very well maintained. - The staff at the hotel were courteous and we had a good experience over all. - My kids did all the complimentary kids activities they had going on in the lobby and under the banyan tree - hula dancing, lei making, postcard making. They will have the week's activities in your room when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: dusty1196
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights on points and was upgraded to oceanfront overlooking pool. Mala restaurant upstairs offers 25% discount from 5:30-6:30 which makes for a pretty good meal at a good rate for Wailea. Resort having multiple buildings can cause for some disjointed walks, but can also mean quicker access to elevators, etc. Beaches are 5 minute walks which could be an inconvenience for some, but shouldn't be. Pool water was ice cold. Was in an obviously renovated room as it was very roomy and nice. If we were in a non-renovated room then others on here must be expecting penthouse suites. Overall, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ExpatKate
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8-night stay at the Wailea Beach Marriott. And I want to go back!!! We booked an Ocean Front King Room on Expedia and got room 4618 which overlooked the ocean & the adult-only pool. GREAT VIEW! The room was spacious, and the bed was AMAZING. It was super soft and cozy. The bathroom was well-laid out and I am happy with the way Marriott updated these rooms. The mini-fridge was a huge bonus - we bought milk & cereal at Whaler's General Store in the mall next door and ate breakfast on the lanai! We were o.k. with the $25 resort fee since we were aware of it ahead of time - and we figured that covered our parking & the couple bottles of water we received each day. The 2 free drink tickets were great too. The location of the hotel is perfect. We walked the beach walk to see the other resorts, and to hit the beaches. Ulua beach was great for snorkeling - we saw a striped eel & a sea turtle! :) The resort is right next to the Shops at Wailea which was great for shopping and additional restaurants. The adult-only infinity pool is FANTASTIC. We spent a lot of time there, because it has a beautiful view of the ocean and the chairs were great. I know it seems weird to go to Hawaii and hang out by a pool - but this is one BEAUTIFUL POOL. And Marriott doesn't have chaises on the beaches, so it was more comfortable for us to hang out there. The Kumu Pool Bar & Grille was also great. We ate a lot of lunches by the pool, and ordered a lot of iced teas & Lava Flows. Anita & Terri were the best servers ever - they are both SO GOOD at their jobs - they remembered everyone!! Food & Drinks were pricey, but you are in Hawaii, what did you expect?? Oh and order the Pork Nachos - MMMmmmmm! Yummy - we are still dreaming about them! Overall it was a great stay! And I wouldn't hesitate to go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotterTraveler
Reviews.Content: We went to Wailea Beach Marriott Resort for our delayed honeymoon and we had the best time ever. Location, Rooms, View, Pool, Beach, Free Mai-Tais (included in daily hotel fee) were perfect. Given how amazing the hotel was, it was really hard to leave the hotel to go explore the Maui island but we did manage to drag ourselves. I'd go back here in a hearbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Would have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Meaganb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott in early September as part of a delayed honeymoon. We actually booked our two nights through Priceline the day before arrival and landed a great rate for the Wailea area. Although not as extravagant as the neighboring resorts, we had a wonderful stay - wished we could have stayed an extra night! The hotel staff was friendly and curteous, the infinity pool was very relaxing with amazing sunset views. The grounds were well taken care of and the pool staff were particularly attentive. Our room was spacious and comfortable with modern furnishings. The only down side is that there wasn't much to do at the resort at night - there is one small bar, but no entertainment. The fitness center was a plus- larger than I had expected with newer equipment and plent of TVs. If you're looking to snorkel, don't expect to see much off of the resort beach- like most resort snorkeling spots, most of the coral is dead. Plenty of snorkel spots right around the hotel though to venture to throughout the day. As for restaurants, we tend to avoid resort restaurants, taking advantage of more of the local fare. We did eat at Ray's in Kihei and it was delicious! I would definitely recommend the Marriott for those looking to save a little money - particularly for couples. The Grand Wailea may be a better bet for families (lazy river, several kid-oriented pools and play areas), but you won't go wrong anywhere- Wailea is truly beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a family”
Reviews.Author: MCHCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Resort and Spa in Wailea in July '07. At this point they were still in the process of renovating eventhough we had called ahead to make sure they were done..grrr. We returned to Wailea in Jan '08 (stayed somewhere else) and they were still renovating so it seems it is going slowly. Besides the renovating that was occurring we really enjoyed our stay. The location is great because it is so close to the shops at Wailea which give you plenty of entertainment (shopping, restaurants, and Wednesday art show nights). I liked the resort because it was not over the top luxury which is a relief when you have a child that comes in covered in sand. I wasn't a big fan of the white tile floors, it made the room feel cold but we had a beautiful view of the pool area and the beach. The little restaurant/bar down by the pool was great because it was very casual, you could easily stop in while still in your suit and order lunch. Also the breakfast in the morning was spectacular. We really enjoyed our stay. It was much nicer than just a regular Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cabanna59
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property on a beautiful island.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Noisy and Non-responsive”
Reviews.Author: canadiangalsandiego
Reviews.Content: We elected to stay 6 days, longer than our convention. Our room was situated on 4th floor, corner next to the maintenance dept,(no view once so ever there) They appear to run a 24 hr.shift. One could hear chatter and machinery at all hrs. We never had one good nights rest.Complained to Gary, concierge, waited for Customer Service Rep. to contact me.She never appeared nor has she returned my message or email and it is now5 days later. Have reported to our convention committee to reconsider destination for next convention.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: LA25GAL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five nights at the Marriott Wailea for our honeymoon and had a wonderful time! We booked hotel & rental car thru AAA (Pleasant Holidays). We did not attend the Pleasant Holidays breakfast b/c we ended up booking activities on our own and got great recommendations from the activities desk. We both agreed that Wailea is the best location on Maui - close to everything we wanted to do (road to Hana, drive up to Haleakala Crater, lunch in Lahaina). We arrived to a paradise - the open air lobby and grounds are gorgeous. We had an oceanfront room (#531 in the Haleakala tower) - the bed was incredibly comfortable and our view was fantastic. Would've liked a rug on the tile floor and a slightly larger tub, but other than that it was perfect. No complaints about service - everyone was friendly and professional, especially the guys at the valet in their kukui nut necklaces! We spent most of our time at the pool instead of the beach, and loved going in the jacuzzi at night when it wasn't crowded. The breakfast buffet was amazing - I've never eaten so much bacon in my life! Great way to start the day... We attended the luau, which was expensive and a bit cheesy, but we figured it's something you've got to do at least once. The food was very good quality, and I liked that it wasn't as crowded as some of the other luaus I've heard about on the island. Other local recommendations: -ABC store in the Shops at Wailea for souvenirs (love the dresses) -Tommy Bahamas at Shops at Wailea for dinner (we ordered lots of yummy appetizers) -Dinner at Sansei in Kihei -Massages at Lani Spa in Kihei (the hotel spa was ridiculously overpriced) -Dinner at Thai Chef in Lahaina (recommended by our guidebook) -Helicopter tour of the island via Captain Kirk at Air Maui ($270/pp for one hour tour) -Fresh banana bread & smoothies at fruit stand on Keanea Peninsula (halfway to Hana) -Walk south along the ocean in front of other Wailea resorts -Pineapple wine tasting at Tedeschi Vineyards -Kimo's for lunch in Lahaina (mango colada, mmm) I don't recommend: -Cheeseburger restaurant at Shops at Wailea - bad service and mediocre food -Drive to Haleakala Crater (it was beautiful but I'm scared of heights and there is no guard rail for the top half of the highway) -Maui Ocean Center - a bit underwhelming and definitely overpriced at $25/per person We love Maui and can't wait to go back! We definitely plan to return to the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “worst customer service I have ever experienced.”
Reviews.Author: onthego033
Reviews.Content: We purchased a package from Pleasant Holidays and several items, such as an room upgrade, were promised and not delivered when we reached the hotel. We called Pleasant Holiday and AAA for assistance, but they were indifferent to the situation and shifted blame to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couple of Bumps”
Reviews.Author: BAM-St_Louis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights beginning on 9/30/08. We found the location to be great and the hotel very attractive. The staff was warm and our room (#531) clean & comfortable. But we had two minor issues worthy of reporting. The first dealt with groundskeepers around the "Infinity Pool". Specifically the annoying sound of weedwackers. The groudskeepers worked in tandem and weed wacked for over an hour until several people at the pool complained. The second issue deals with "towel cards" At check - in you will be given towle cards to be used to get a beach towel. One card per person entitles you to one towel - no exceptions. Your towel card is taken once you are given a towel and noot returned until the towel is returned. This policy is strictly enforced and frankly a little petty considering the cost of the room and the meals etc. One afternoon I forgot my towel card in the room and learned a lesson on what Marriott service means. The lobby bar is mediocre and pricey but the breakfast buffet is good. Upn the drive are some shops & restaurants. I recommend Tommy Bahamas - order from the appetizer section to save money. Also Longhi's for Italian - order pastsa and they will split the order which is enough for two. Also ask for directions to Joe's, great food and service and only 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “best oceanfront resort”
Reviews.Author: TravelSmart007
Reviews.Content: Recently had to attend a meeting in Wailea, and my priority in choosing a hotel was to able to fall asleep to the sound of the ocean surf, and have spectacular oceanfront and sunset views from my room/lanai (balcony). The Marriott did not disappoint! In stark contrast to their neighbors (e.g. the Grand Wailean, Four Seasons, Fairmont) which have rooms at least a block or so back from the ocean, The Marriott is nicely perched on a rocky point jutting out into the ocean between Una and Wailea beaches. My room was about 40 feet from the ocean and the views were spectacular (and cost me a lot less than my last stay at the Grand Wailean). Other pros - all constuction appears to be finished and the infinity pool is beautiful; all staff were extremely pleasant and responsive to all requests; you and your bags are driven to your room on a golf cart which can also be requested at checkout; tried room service once and the food was fantastic, hot, and arrived within 30 minutes of ordering; the 2 level parking lot if you choose to self park is less than a 100 feet away from the lobby; each room has a mini-fridge and both the hotel shop as well as the Shops at Wailea (a mall just on the other side of the parking lot) sells milk, cereal, a variety of other take away foods and liquor should you want to eat in; they hold a luau Mon, Thur, Fri, Sat which as a guest you can watch the show/ fire dancers for free from the numerous paths that surround the stage and if you stay in Hale 7 - from your balcony (of note, runs only till about 8pm and thus won't disturb your sleep); the hotel is on the path that runs up and down the coast for a couple miles in each direction - was fun testing out all the various beaches although found the Wailea beach the nicest (surf not too rough, wide sandy beach, lots of chairs about, located just beyond the luau lawn); my room was clean, nice island decor with a deep soaking tub; tried out the spa once and found it to also be great (very soothing, relaxing ambiance with extremely pleasant staff). The property has 4 pools (one with childrens slides; water spouts, sandboxes) all with nice views of the ocean. Cons - none

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location at Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Ramatash
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Marriott Wailea 3 times and 1 time prior when it was the Outrigger. We've also stayed at the Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons at Wailea, and this is BY FAR the best propery on Wailea. A number of the hales (buildings) are about 20 feet from the ocean line and have awesome views of the other islands. The other properties may be a little fancier and have a little better service, but their rooms are 1/4 mile+ from the ocean. They're set way back from the beach. The rooms at the Marriott are fine, nicely done and the staff is very friendly. Their new serenity pool is very nice. They charge a nightly resort fee ($25 per night) and we can't really figure out what that covers. Carl and Joe make the best mai tais in the world. I'd suggest dining and using the spas at the other properities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: emanneercstaken
Reviews.Content: My husband, a friend, and I were planning a trip to Maui and were trying to decide between staying at the Marriott in Lahaina or Wailea. Although location-wise, we were happy w/ our decision (the property is absolutely beautiful!), we were surprised w/ the service we received. We've received better service at hotels we've paid less than half the price for! Pros: The location! The Infinity pool is fabulous! And the service at the restaurants and bars on site were good. Cons: Front desk/concierge/room service. Here are some examples - 1) We did not have enough towels in the room one evening. We called the front desk, and never received them. 2) We called to ask the front desk to inquire about why our TV was not working, and was rudely told it was throughout the entire hotel and there was nothing they could do about it. 3) We called front desk/concierge multiple times and was never answered. And these were not at odd hours either. 4) We are supposed to receive 2 bottles of water (included in our daily $25 fee), and were missing bottles of water some of the days.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ark_at_eeeee
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Marriott for two weeks for our Honeymoon. After an extremely long flight From London and finally reaching the hotel at 9.30pm we were very relieved to be greeted by the excellent staff at the Hotel. We were upgraded to an Ocean Front room overlooking the the main pool which in our opinion, was the best location. The view from the balcony was excellent and watching the sunset every night was heaven. The hotel is very well presented and the rooms are contemporary in design and well kitted out (TV, Fridge, CD player, safe etc.). Wailea is certainly the exclusive resort on the island with manicured lawns and pretty beaches. Fortunately, we had hired a car for the two weeks which enabled use to freely travel the island and I would recommend this as the choice of dining is very limited at wailea and very expensive. Indeed, our only complaint of the hotel is the dining. The on-site restaurant (ran seperately to the hotel) was expensive and only a limited menu. However, we made full use of Kihei (10-15 mins drive) which is a seaside town with many good options for takeaways (e.g. Thailand Cuisine, Chinese, Shangri-la Indian and the Outback steak house) which were all good value. We also made use of the Safeway supermarket to buy lunches etc. We visited Oahu (Honalulu) using the island hopper planes (good value) and booked a trip to the Big Island to see the volcanoes. Both of these I would recommend to anyone. Overall, I can summerize by saying the hotel is excellent, ensure you hire a car and if you can, go see the volcano. Anyone who enjoys, lazing by the pool, but also wants some adventure, Hawaii is the place, and Maui is ideal place to base yourself!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good time at the Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: smorrow66
Reviews.Content: We were married on the beach on July 4th and the Marriott Wailea was the first of our 4 hotels in Hawaii. Pros - Beautiful hotel, rooms were beautiful, but bed was too soft for me. The shoreline was beautiful, but no sand. Beautiful empty beach just to the north. We walked about 1 mile on this beach and saw about 5 people total. Pools were beautiful too, but we have one at home. Front desk staff, bell staff, wait staff were all polite and efficient. The luau was alot of fun. Exercise room was good too. Cons - everything is overpriced. We paid $25 a day for the "resort fee" which included a breakfast buffett and self parking. We loaded up on the buffet, snack for lunch and go into town for dinner. Internet was $12.95 a day, so we used the cell phone to check email, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Relaxing Vacation at the Wailea Marriott”
Reviews.Author: LovesKids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wailea Marriott for 8 nights this July. It was the perfect vacation for our family of 4. Our oceanview room was located in Haleakala Tower facing beautiful Ulua Beach. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful. The on-site restaurant, The Mala Wailea, had very good food and amazing views. They had an early bird dinner special of 25% off everything on the menu from 5:30 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. The Mahi-Mahi fish sandwich was one of the best we had during our stay on the island. I would recommend a stay at the Wailea Marriott. We can't wait to return! :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Welcome to Maui”
Reviews.Author: barne123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first couple of nights of our honeymoon there and we really enjoyed it. We had an ocean view room and it was FANTASTIC. the best part of the stay! we were RIGHT on the ocean, and loved listening to the waves at night (because we left the doors open.) Just wonderful! The serenity pool is beautiful. great view. very peaceful. It is easy to rent a car here - Hertz is right on site at the hotel and you pick up the car at the parking lot. incredibly convenient. and the Shops at Wailea are right next door. If you need help with activities - the concierge desk is VERY helpful. gave us lots of good advice and hooked us up with tours that matched just what we wanted to do. Make sure you see the Luau - the food is just ok, but the show is delightful and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Saved our trip!”
Reviews.Author: katinSanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very nice hotel for decent price (priceline) as compared to other luxury hotels in the area; fantastic restaurant with healthy foods; clean and new rooms; beautiful views and gorgeous lobby; nice pools, liked the three different pools with different ambience. Cons: Front dest staff was not quite unfriendly, but certainly terse. Made you feel like you were disturbing their work. Mixed up our room reservations, so our room service charges were billed to our friend's credit card, and vice versa. No beach front (but easy 3-minute walk to the beach), the front is rocky shoreline. Summary: This hotel saved our trip. We had booked a high-dollar condo via VRBO and ended up with a terribly dirty place with HUGE cockroaches, broken washer/dryer, and moldy A/C.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort in Most Beautiful Part of Maui”
Reviews.Author: Jeagan1999
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 days and 6 nights here in mid May, using our Marriott Rewards points to pay. In my opinion, Wailea is the most beautiful part of the island. Very green, beautiful homes and hotels, golf courses and gorgeous beaches!! The resort itself is located right next to The shops at Wailea (which has shops, restaurants, and a great General Store where my wife and I would walk to each morning for coffee and muffins!!). The lobby is open to the elements and very elegant yet tropical(the grounds in front of the lobby are beautiful and lit by tiki torch each night). Our room was looking directly down on the new infiniti edge pool and the beautiful Pacific beyond. The room itself was very comfy and tropical. Dark woods, white tile and soft linens on the bed. The bathroom had a big, deep tub and a frosted glass door. There was a nice size lanai with a table and chairs for enjoying the view. There was so much to do on the island (snorkeling at Molikini Crater, Lahaina, hiking the volcano, the road to Hana, Iao Valley, a sunset luau, etc...) that we didn't spend much time at the hotel, but we really enjoyed laying out by the pool and enjoying the beautifal views out over the ocean and other islands. There are several restaurants, bars and pools on the property, and you can easily walk to several great beaches, as well as the Grand Wailea and other hotels along the beach. The Marriott is a beautiful, open air, polynesian style hotel with great ammenities and in a lush, tropical setting. Taxes, resort & parking fees were a bit high, but my wife and I would definitely stay here again or reccomend it to our friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: LV2SLSA
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a family vacation at the Wailea Marriott. This was our first time to the Wailea area of Maui. The resort was nicely landscaped and the facilities were clean. We had no problems with check-in or check-out. All the staff we encountered were very polite to us. We had a terrace view room on the 6th floor. From it you could see the neighboring condo complex as well as the ocean and beach. The view was actually nicer than the view my parents had and they paid for an ocean view. There is a small refrigerator in the room which comes in handy for storing your own drinks or leftovers. The bed was very comfortable for my wife and me. The decor was clean and simple, not the usual tacky wallpaper and ugly floral print that you find in many other hotels. There is a small safe in the closet. There is an adult pool, a kids pool and a pool for anyone. The three pools are located in different parts of the complex. We stayed at the anybody pool. It was not crowded at all (everyone else was probably trying to find a chair at the adult pool). There was no competition for lounge chairs. This is where the bar and eating place is. We ate once, breakfast, at the hotel's restaurant Mala. Nothing special and very pricy - $26 but the food was good. Everything to eat and drink at the hotel, as in anywhere in a popular resort destination is going to be overpriced. My wife and I love to walk and we love to shop. There is a nice shopping center up the driveway from the hotel, about a 5 minute walk that has a couple of restaurants: Longhis and Cheeseburger in Paradise. There is also a general store where you can get deli sandwhiches and other food such as eggrolls, potato salad, etc. The beach is a short walk from the hotel grounds but for us this wasn't a huge deal. The neighboring hotels: Grand Wailea, Four Seasons, and Fairmont Kea Lani have their own beaches in front of the hotel grounds. All of the hotels were connected by a nice walking/jogging pathway. Overall a very nice stay. Would we go back there again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this property..”
Reviews.Author: JJBK2
Reviews.Content: We stayed the last week in May at the Wailea Marriott with our two teenaged daughters and loved it. It has a very relaxing feeling and beautiful views. Since the hotel is low buildings spread out over the property, it has a more tranquil feeling than the large hotels in Kaanapali and Kahana. We are Marriott platinumn members and have stayed at other properties in Hawaii and love the peaceful feeling here. You have two great snorkeling beaches to choose from. Ulua beach to the right of the property is great for all levels of snorkelers and at Marty's Reef, in front of the Four Seasons to the south, has turtles (this is where the boat tours stop, they call it Turlte Bay, but it is just off of the beach). If your love to walk or jog, there is a wonderful paved walkway that ambles along the beach for miles. If you want to save on food walk up to the Villages of Wailea next to the hotel. There are great lunch specials at Longhi's or quick self-serve items at the ABC store. You can also drive to the next town of Kihei (try the Hawaiian Ice with special topping in at the front of the flea market). It pays

Reviews.Title: “Not our cup of tea.”
Reviews.Author: Lombard955
Reviews.Content: Okay, I'll admit, it was my fault that we got trapped here for four nights. I purchased the room through Priceline for $160 a might after doing some research and figuring out that on Priceline you will either get the Maui Prince or the Marriott if you select "Resort." I saw enough decent reviews here that I figured we be okay either way and figured that we'd be spending most of our time away from the hotel anyway. I'll start by saying that we aren't really the big resort types. If you read my other Maui reviews, you'll see that we like small secluded places. That said, we needed to be in Wailea for the Maui Triathlon to watch a family member, so resorts seemed to be our only option. Check in went slowly. The bellman was nice enough but the woman at the desk wasn't particularly warm. She immediately tried to sell us a $75 upgrade to an "ocean view" room, or a $100 upgrade an "ocean front" room. If we'd wanted to pay more, do you think that we would have made our reservation through Priceline? Once we declined that she was kind enough to give us a room overlooking the traffic circle backing up on the elevator shafts. Okaym I git the rom through Priceline, but does that mean that you have to give me the worst room in the place. Even the bellman told us that it was bad. I'm a light sleeper and knew that listening to the elevators all night wasn't really going to work for me. So, back to the front desk where we acquiesced to an upgrade and got moved to a junior suite with a view of the loading dock. It was officially an "ocean view" room as you could see the ocean from the patio (while listening to the trucks idle). Oh, and don't forget the extra $25 dollar a night resort fee. The room: It was big, which is a plus, but had the most uncomfortable furniture known to man. The bed was so soft that we had to have them flip the mattress after the first night so that it would be a bit more firm. The couch, on the other hand, was rock hard and had a really straight back. I know because I slept on it the first night when the smooshy bed drove me crazy. (BTW - they told us that the bed is "standard issue" so this is NOT the place for you if you like a firm mattress.) As for the grounds, the pools and such were just okay. The adult pool is a nice concept but you really have to get there early to get a chair...or pay $100 to reserve one of the poolside cabanas. I did enjoy going early in the morning and swimming laps. Its nice and long! Did I mention that the Marriott doesn't have a beach? Its a short walk to the beaches but it would have been nice to have chairsand such to take there. Meals - don't eat here. Overpriced and average. Now the rub. Our friends were staying at the Four Seasons and we quickly realized that is a much better value. For just over $400 a night the mountain view rooms are pricier, but worth every penny. They had so many freebies - from lounge chairs and umbrellas at the beach to watermelon slices and otter pops at the pool. While our hotel seemed to be nickel and dime-ing us, the Four Seasons seems to make every effort to make sure you have an effortless vacation. We took the kayak/snorkel trip from the Four Seasons and it was great. Again, meals there are overpriced, but my breakfast at the Four Seasons beat the Marriott breakfast hands down. Good off site dining in Kihei - Sansei and Eskimo Candy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service...Not enough hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Small_Town_Boy
Reviews.Content: I've read a lot of reviews stating that it's not a Marriot standard hotel, etc., etc. etc. I guess that's because it's not a Marriot owned hotel. I was at the pool one day and was noticing that the server had to go back and forth to get our drinks a at bar that was across the property at the other pool. I didn't understand how such an amazing pool with such an incredible view didn't have it's own bar. So, me being me, I asked her what the deal was. She told me that apparently the hotel is owned by another company out of NYC and after financial troubles Marriot swooped in to "manage" the property. I guess there were plans to build a bar at the pool the the money ran out and that Marriot simply wouldn't invest any more money in to a property they didn't own until vacancy (ie, profits) picked up. Now for the review. My stay was extremely pleasant. The only thing I could complain about were the prices. But hey, welcome to Hawaii in the summer. Let's just say the breakfast buffet with nothing mind blowing costs $30 per person. Hawaii being Hawaii I think we all know that you're not gonna book a room at a resort property on the beach at any of the desirable islands and get a beer a burger for five bucks. You want the view...you pay for it. As a resort things were clean. Upon arrival I was upgraded to a suite by a woman who was very friendly. You should always ask to be upgraded. Worst thing they can do is say no which is what they're essentially saying if you don't ask. The room was great. And though it was considered and "ocean view" I thought it was great that she kindly pointed out that this room really only had a "sliver" of a view of the ocean. She was right. So....I was happy. Pools were great. and the gardens around the facility were beautiful In regards to food I recommend a little trick. Go up to the shopping plaza at the top end of their parking lot. There are several restaurants with better food for half the price and you still feel like you're at the resort since they're so close. All in all, resorts aren't really my thing but I certainly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Wailea Marriott”
Reviews.Author: SBRaman
Reviews.Content: We used marriott points for part of our stay and paid for the last night. The nice thing was, we got upgraded for our points stay but they let us keep our room for the extra night we paid for and did not make us switch. The hotel was very clean and when we complained because the tub didn't look like it had been cleaned when we checked in, they sent someone to clean it immediately. Our first room was Ocean Front but had a blocked view so they gave us a much better one (Ask for Ocean Front by the Adult Pool--that is the best view). They had an adult only pool which is great and it's slightly heated so you can even use it at night. There is a really nice walk path too. They have complimentary water by the pool as well. Our only complaint is the adult pool gets full fast so if you want a nice covered lounge chair, claim your spot early in the morning. The gym is also very nice at this hotel. We had the room service and it was good. They make you pay for parking but if you find a rate on the marriott website, you might get a "resort pass" which waives the parking charge and gets you two free drinks at the pool bar.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: peterpanGeorgia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Marriott May 30 - June 4th. We loved our stay here. The room was booked using Marriott points. My husband is Platinum Elite, and we were treated great. The room was a deluxe ocean front room which found us soooo close to the ocean. We were in room 2318. Perfect! Our favorite spot was the adult only Serenity Pool. Pool service was outstanding. We never had difficulty finding a lounge chair. The floating cabanas are $100/day so we decided the lounge chair with the umbrellas (FREE). There is a nice children's pool with slides which looked fun for kids. We never ate at the hotel full service restaurants. Maid service is twice a day. Leave a $1 a day and you'll get a little extra treatment. The Luau at the Marriott was ok. The drinks were plentiful, but the food is fair. However, the show is good with a champion fire dancer. We paid extra for the premimum seating which was probably not worth it. Our favorites: Trail Ride with Mendes Ranch. Excellent with beginners plus the views were incredible. These are real cowboys leading you and not some tourist trap. Express Snorkle Tour with Kai Kanani that leaves from the Maui Prince. This is a first class operation. Even though it leaves out at 6:30 AM, the water isn't too cold. Someone is in the water with you at all times if you are new at snorkling. Spa treatments at the Grand Wailea. Don't miss this. Not only do you get a treatment, you get to use the Terme baths with are an experience not to be missed. Favorite Restaurants: Cafe O'Lei Kihei Cafe for Breakfast (have cash) Tommy Bahamas Hula Grill Enjoy! You'll be pleased you chose the Wailea Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Facility, but soft beds and pillows”
Reviews.Author: NewMexicoTraveler1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful facility. Recent refurbishment is superb except for the beds and pillows which were for our comfort marsh mellow soft resulting in little support and aching backs in the morning. Other than this slight issue, the Wailea Marriott boasts a very accommodating staff and a newly constructed adults only pool. Small refrigerators in each room are a plus. The breakfast buffet is $60 for two and nothing extraordinary. We partook of the buffet only once for obvious reasons. We would most definitely return to this resort again, the bed/pillows notwithstanding.

Reviews.Title: “We Decided to Checked Out After Staying there for Three Hours”
Reviews.Author: napameritage
Reviews.Content: I booked four nights of stay at the Marriott Wailea resort by using more than 100K of Marriott points. My wife and I were extremely disappointed at this â€œcategory 7â€� Marriott property (the highest category in Marriott family). We made the decision to checkout the next day only three hours after we checked in. Here is a summary our my experiences; The valet parking attendant who helped us upon arrival was lazy and unfriendly. The self parking is very easy and close to the hotel main entrance. So really there is no need to valet is anyway. When I checked into the Westin Maui, there are friendly staffs at the door to greet and provide followers and ice water. None of that at the Marriott. Bottom line: you donâ€™t feel you have arrived at a nice resort. I was bit early for check in â€“ 2pm. They told me that donâ€™t have the room I booked until 4pm which is the official written check in time. Instead they offered me the upgrade rooms. Surprisingly, all those rooms are all available. Bottom line: I felt that I was dealing with snake oil sales women. Very very annoying. The front desk person told me the all the bellmen were busy, and it is an easy walk to our room. What she forgot to tell me was that there are no elevators at those hotel room buildings! We ended up get lost and have to drag the heavy suitcases up and down the stairs! The snack and drink bar by the kids pool area was closed. And the towel service station staff was not where to be found. I have to ask the security guy to get it for me. I later found out that the hotel cut down the services due to low occupancy. The kidâ€™s pool area was dirty, and not well maintained. The much talked about adult pool itself is nice looking. However, it is surrounded by the old hotel rooms, and not so nice landscape. Marriott did spend $70 million to upgrade the hotel. But it is not enough to cover up the aging of this property. The hallway of the hotel is dirty, and old, as if you are walking inside a cheap hotel. The room itself is good, but I donâ€™t like the tile flooring which gives you a very cold feeling. In summary, this hotel is old, and under maintained. It is ok if they call that a deluxe hotel. But no where it is close to a resort. The marriott resort in Kauai is also a category 7 hotel, but it is ten time nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Good value on Maui”
Reviews.Author: SarahASeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2003. I have visited Hawaii on several occasions and have stayed a variety of hotels/resorts. This is a solid value for the money. To be on Maui, in Wailea, I think this is the best value in that area. There are some very swanky places around it that are spectacular but you will pay for that. The Marriott has beautiful grounds, with winding pathways and that open air hawaiian feel. Walking in and out and between buildings not even realizing when you go inside because of the openness. The hotel is right on Wailea and easy access to its gorgeous quiet beach as well as a boardwalk that goes along that beach across a couple of different properties. There is a great poolside bar...a must in my paradise vacation checklist. They have good food and great service even coming around poolside to take your order and bring you your food/drinks. it was a very nice touch. Plus it is in walking distance to the Wailea shops! And a 10 minute drive into Kihei which is such a fun little place to hang out with some fun shops and a great breakfast place!! They did have a kid pool area and I would say it is very family friendly. The rooms were decent rooms, it's a Marriot, not incredibly spectacular but with the views and the paradise around you, it's easy to overlook and we just weren't in the room a lot. They were clean and well kept so certainly not a concern there and I am slightly fastidious with that type of thing... Overall we would stay here again, it is a good value for Wailea and Wailea is a bit quieter than the more busier and touristy parts of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Less than stellar”
Reviews.Author: bozoconnors
Reviews.Content: Clean, decent sized rooms, good location. Nice pool. During my honeymoon, the Marriott decided to completely replant the vegetation in the circular drive in the front of the hotel. They had no problem booking us in a room just above said "re-planting." Quite a ruckus for 7am. Backup warning beepers sound remarkably like an alarm clock when you're that close. After the 2nd day of this (we're talking fully grown palm re-planting scale), I politely inquired on when the construction would be finished and was told they would be done that day. The next morning, my bride paid the front desk a visit (after waking again to chainsaws / workers yelling / etc,) and was given a similar reply. No recompense was offered whatsoever, other than a passing apology. Also, just kind of a ripoff for the money they charge for a pretty average hotel imo. Had to walk out of the in house restaurant when I saw $3.50 for a cup of coffee. It's a CUP OF COFFEE. Not a cappulattefrappicano.... a plain cup of joe. Had much better bang for the buck (and a full condo) down in Kihei at the Aloha Pualani. Doubt I'll be visiting any other Marriott any time soon. Don't get me wrong, it's a gorgeous hotel/location and would be great.... for half the price (and we even had a nice discount) and twice the customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Wailea Marriot- gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Flipflopqueen12
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Wailea Marriot on our first trip to Maui in Feb 2008. My first impression upon arriving was that the grounds of the hotel were breathtaking! Not a cheap place, but worth a splurge for a few days :) Check-in was fine without any problems. We had a partial ocean view room which was beautiful. It also overlooked the overflowing adult-only pool with cabanas (only downside was that they were rented out for $50 per day!). The pools were great, and overlooked the ocean. The restaurant was fabulous but expensive for dinner. The breakfast buffet was very good as well-- find out if you can book a deal where you get it for free because otherwise it can get expensive. The rooms were spacious and tastefully decorated, and very clean. No problems with anything in the room or with hotel staff who were very helpful. Room service was great as well. The balcony was one of the favorite features of the room because of its wonderful view. The only downside to this hotel would be its confusing layout-- we got lost more than once trying to find the right building, the right hallway, and the right room! We also used the spa which was beautiful. One complaint about the spa- we had booked massages and manicures weeks ahead of time, and when we arrived at the spa the staff informed us that the manicure person was out sick that day and they would be unable to have anyone else do them. They did book us manicures at their sister salon which was inside the Wailea complex, but the manicures there were considerably more expensive. The rest of the Wailea complex is beautiful, with many other hotels, shops, and restaurants.
