There was some construction going on in February that was somewhat bothersome when driving in and out of the complex, but not noisy and could not be heard from the hotel rooms. We rented a car because most things to do on Maiu required transportation to get there and back, outside of the separate Wailea complex. However, some activities provided transportation to and from your hotel so definitely ask when booking any activities. All in all this was a gorgeous place to stay, expensive but definitely worth a splurge (you are on Maiu, after all!!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wailea.”
Reviews.Author: SJDB
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a very relaxing 8 day vacation at the Waliea Beach Marriott. Our family arrived on two different days, but check-in was a breeze. In order to keep our family close, and with connecting rooms, we were upgraded to oceanfront rooms free of charge. The rooms were nice. I think they could have splurged on upgrading the televisons to flat panels, the tube tv just dates the room. I guess they figure people are on vacation, so who really needs TV? Also, if I was decorating the guest rooms, I would have added throw rugs under the beds to warm it up. That said, you will not be disappointed, the Marriott did a fine job remodeling the rooms - and the rest of the property. We were vacationing with my 10 month old son, so we weren't able to use the adult pool, but it looks fantastic. One suggestion to the Marriott - People with children like cabanas too! The Marriott has 5 pools throughout their property, each one was nice, but we frequented the pool past the adult pool overlooking the ocean. It also has an infinity edge, but stll missing the pods like the adult pool. I'm still really bummed about that! The pool service was great! We never ran out of cocktails! The breakfast buffet was good, and we ate there almost every morning. It's about $26 per person. I must suggest going over to Longhi's at the Shops at Wailea. Ask for Lisa...she is a wonderful person, with great spunk and flair. LOVE HER. Also head over to Kihei and go to Aroma D'Italia Ristorante in the Foodland Shopping Center. The food is very good and reasonable. Our experience was very good, and we would return to this property again. The prices seemed to be just like every other place I have been too, so I can't really comment on that. Just a little note...another reviewer mentioned housekeeping problems, we experienced none of that during our stay. Cheers and happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed by service”
Reviews.Author: MattNY
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here for 3 nights on our two week honeymoon to Hawaii. As an elite member and someone who indicated that he was on his honeymoon, I feel that the treatment that I got from the hotel was lacking. When we checked in, we were not offered an upgrade, nor even congratulated for being on our honeymoon (in stark contrast to other properties that we stayed at). The box of 4 chocolate covered macadamia nuts was a special treat though. The rooms are recently renovated, though they put a tube tv in each room, instead of a flat panel tv. Also, it appears that they put the same old shower curtain rings (bent out of shape) back in the bathroom. Also, the shower head really needed to be descaled. My profile on marriott.com indicates that I like foam pillows, but that too "slipped" by their attention. Upon speaking to the manager on duty the night we checked in, after being told twice that there were no upgrades available, we were told that there was an oceanfront room available, better than the oceanview room (which is code for "partial ocean view"). The upgraded room only had a queen bed though (why?). Since we had unpacked already we declined it at that point. I give the manager credit because she wound up sending us a nice basket of goodies to make up for the lackluster treatment. Now the adult pool was a bright spot - it's a gorgeous infinity pool that just opened. There is a no cellphone use policy around the pool (but it's mostly ignored and unenforced). Also - Anita the waitress at the pool was fantastic. Overall, had this not been our honeymoon, everything would have been fine - but as an elite member and honeymooner, I felt like a number.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, Horrible Serivce!”
Reviews.Author: Cruisedave
Reviews.Content: I just returned from staying at this property and it had it's pluses and minuses. First let me talk about the pluses. The new adult pool is one of the nicest pools I've ever been too. Not to mention the servers at the pool knew your name and were extremely friendly, I can't see enough good things about that. Service: The reviewer who left a review on here from May 1st nailed it on the head. I received the same exact experience. When I pulled my car up, the bell hop was quick to great us. When I told him I can handle my lugguge myself, he said "that's not the way we do things here". I insisted and to say the bell hop was rude was an understatement. I then noticed when other people arrived, and used the service of the bell hop, they were greeted with shell necklaces that were put around their neck etc.... I've stayed at many hotels in Hawaii, shouldn't everyone get the same greeting, regardless if you use the bell hops or not? Leaving the property I encountered the same horrible service. I took my luggage down myself, pulled the car up and at this point, most high end hotels the bell hop will come to your car and at least offer to help you. Not here, there were three of them just looking at me and my wife and didn't want to move a muscle. I didn't need their help getting my luggage into the car but we did have a lot of stuff and for what they charge at this hotel, it should have at least been offered because we had some big suitcases. I thought them just standing there watching us put all this stuff in the car with out even coming over to see if we needed help was pretty poor. As far as check-in goes, I had the same exact situation, however I caught the front desk agent by surprise. I am a travel agent and I knew all the different rates going in there. He offered to uprade me for the $75 as they do everyone else. However there was a rate where I could have been upgraded for $24. When I asked about that rate it magically came up. Shouldn't the front desk agent say to the guest, "let me see if we have other rates available to get you into a better room". When I asked him why he wanted to charge me $75 when there was a rate that was only $24 more, he was like "ahh, ahha, ahhh" and just didn't know what to say. I could tell he was embarassed but that's fine with me because I'm sick and tired of places like that trying to rip you off and not tell you ALL your options. As far as the rooms, they were just o.k. if you ask me. Would I stay there again, just for the great pool I might. But they really need a lesson on service because I'm not that picky but some of the things I saw there was not up to par for the type of resort they try to promote.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: italybound01
Reviews.Content: I just came home after a lovely 4 night stay at the Wailea Marriott. I arrived first thing in the morning after taking a red eye flight on Hawaiian Airlines from Las Vegas that worked out really well. It was an easy drive from the airport and after reading the reviews here knew to choose self park instead of valet. Check in was easy but because it was still early, our room was not available yet although front desk did note my request for a high room and said she would find me a room in the tower. I was asked whether I wanted to upgrade for an additional fee but declined. We gave our luggage to the bell desk to store and headed to the pool. The serenity pool is just lovely, just as everyone else has said. They do not allow cell phone use and I have seen it enforced a couple of times, which is nice. Our room was ready about 2pm and I was given a room on the 5th floor with a partial view of the ocean. Room was spacious and nicely decorated and I found the bed SUPER comfortable!!! I loved it!!! The $25 mandatory resort fee included two mai tais during our stay, self parking, and two bottles of water per day as well as certain discounts. It would have been nice to include internet service as that was an additional $12.95/day. We had room service one night and it was pretty good and we had lunch at the pool grill twice and really enjoyed our lunches there. The one thing that was missing was a coffee shop as I like to just grab a coffee and pastry in the morning. Luckily the Shops at Wailea were so close we could just walk over there in the mornings. The staff said that a Starbucks is coming in July on the property so that will be a huge plus. All in all it was a wonderful and relaxing stay and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful vacation, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: talimoth
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Maui vacation (April 22 - April 29). We arrived around 4:00pm and check-in was easy. The staff was friendly and helpful throughout our entire stay. The infinity pool at Marriott is amazing. It is adults-only and we made sure to spend two full days there. The cabana rental was $50.00/day and it was worth the money. It is nice and relaxing to look into the beautiful ocean and sip a couple drinks pool-side. We ate at the restaurant on-site a total of three times. The breakfast buffet was great. It runs about $30.00/person. You can also order from the breakfast menu if you are not in the mood for a buffet. We tried dinner twice. One night it was very good and the other night it was awful. If I went back I would just stick to breakfast on-site. I like that Marriott is close to The Grand Wailea and The Four Seasons. It is a nice walk and both resorts are easily accessible. It seemed to us that The Grand Wailea would be great if you have kids and The Four Seasons would be ideal for couples. We went to the Lobby Lounge at the Four Seasons and it was a good place to have a drink and appetizers and enjoy some music. Just be aware that it is pretty pricey but you will get great service. After being there a short time I realized why they have the reputation that they do! The Grand Wailea has a fantastic Japanese restaurant named Kincha that offers a buffet at $52.00/person. I highly recommend going to Cheeseburger in Paradise at the Wailea Shops on one of your evenings or after noons on the island. They have the best drinks by far and they were resonably priced. I don't recommend the food, but the mixed drinks are the best! The Marriott was a nice place to stay. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. It is in a good location and the infinity pool was a major plus. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with horrible service!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahdawn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was newly renovated, rooms were spacious, decorated well but you could tell it was an older property by looking at the ceiling. They forgot to update the ceilings and you could tell because they were dirty and yellowing! The grounds were beautiful, the pools great, (the new adult pool area was very nice!), and the location was ideal. Shopping at the Wailea Village shops was wonderful and the beach access easy. BUT, I do not recommend it and I will not stay at this hotel again. The major draw back to this place was the service. The staff was horrible! I was shocked at how unfriendly the bell staff and the front desk staff were! Driving in to the hotel it was dark and the signage is really bad and nonexistent. We pulled up and asked the guys standing at the bell station where the front desk was located and where do we park. They immediate asked us if we wanted valet (and I read the many reviews on this site that talked about the ease of self parking), so we declined. Then asked if we wanted them to take our backs, again we declined. From that point forward, the bell staff was rude, not helpful and really disappointing. We made it to the front desk to check in and of course when we checked in we asked the typical question â€œroom with an ocean view and high floor pleaseâ€� and got the standard and very bothered response â€œfor $75 a night we can upgrade youâ€�. She (the front desk agent) said nothing more after I declined the upgrade. Other then to offer us the $25 a day or $15 a day options of resort fees. She did not tell us about the hotel, only to point us in the direction of our room. When we realized we had to go down several flights of stairs, we asked the again, rude bell person for an elevator. We were told they didnâ€™t have an elevator! Apparently, they wanted to see us struggle the â€˜grand staircaseâ€™, because they did not ask us if we wanted help only told us the stairs are â€˜over thereâ€™. I was very annoyed, being a weekly traveler, Marriott Rewards Gold member and former hotel manager; I was ready to check out before we even made it to the room. When we got to our room, it was on the bottom floor directly next to the older pool with no view. AND, they were using the room next to us as the bathroom for pool guest! I was appalled and laughing at this point, how could this be a Marriott? So, we called and spoke to a different agent who offered us a room on the second level. We took it and were pleased that it had a partial view to the ocean, and guess what? We didnâ€™t have to pay the $75 the first agent so nicely requested. The only friendly person we ran into was the pool server and the concierges. They were both professional and helpful. Oh, and by the way, they do have an elevator; we found it after wondering around the property on the 2nd day. In summary, there are some fabulous hotels in Wailea at a very similar cost of the Marriott! Stay at them! The 4 Seasons and the Wailea Beach resort, we walked and ate at both and the staff was very friendly, greeted everyone. The Wailea Marriott staff needs to be trained on how to treat guests, there are too many hotels out there to have to deal with rude people, we are on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: jettybetty
Reviews.Content: We had been to Maui several times, but never stayed in the Wailea area and decided it was time. We chose the Marriott and were thrilled with it. For us, it was the best choice, because we love to be close to the water. Our oceanfront room was extremely close and we loved relaxing to the sound of crashing waves. Although this hotel in not on a beach, it is oceanfont. Our room looked directly at Wailea beach. We could be on the beach in about 3 minutes. We could also walk to 3 other fantastic beaches. We didn't feel deprived at all because the property itself was not on a beach. Service at the hotel was great in every way. We would call housekeeping as we left each day and the room was always perfect when we got back. Our favorite part of the hotel grounds was the serenity pool. It's been mentioned on here a lot, but it was just so relaxing. The hotel has some great places to eat. With the path in front of the hotel you can walk easily to the Grand Wailea, and the Four Seasons. We also picked up lunch several days at the deli in the Whaler's General Store in the shopping center across the parking lot from the Marriott. We would love to return to this property!

Reviews.Title: “"A Work in Progress"”
Reviews.Author: knb
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 night stay at the Maui Marriott (April 15-25). From the time we check-in to the time we checked out, everyone from the front office staff, pool staff, and housekeeping staff were extremely nice. As a side note, we also stayed at this property in December 2007 for four nights and enjoyed it very much, hence, our return trip. We were placed on the fifth floor overlooking the lobby with a partial ocean view - absoulutely gorgeous. As some people have noted, the rooms have been renovated recently. There was plenty of storage room to unpack your clothes, as well as, a refrigerator to hold snacks and drinks. While some people found the beds comfortable, I am not one to like soft beds, hence, not the excellent rating (my only complaint). They do have a pull-out sofa in each room and I was tempted to use it, but did not. Maid service was excellent each day of our stay . In addition, they do have washers and dryers to do laundry. When we were at the Marriott in December, the infinity pool was still being constructed. Now, that it is is completed, all I can say is that it is beautiful. Being our first day at the pool, we decided to rent a cabana ($50.00/day) which includes water and magazines. Yes, I felt it was a little on the expensive side, but we didn't want to be burnt toast on our first day. They do have umbrellas at the older pool, but since the infinity pool is for adults only, we wanted the piece and quiet - not that we don't love children (we have four). Pool service was excellent - thanks to Teri for her cheerfulness and always being there when we needed that drink with the umbrella (LOL). There are a total of 4 pools and a kid's pool at the Marriott. On our last day, Friday, April 25th we sat by the infinity pool and were pleased to see that they were in the process of putting permanent umbrellas around the lounge chairs. As noted, the Marriott is an older property. It used to be the Outrigger Hotel and before that the Intercontinental. It is a "Work in Progress." They continue improving the property. The rooms are very nice, the open air lobby is inviting, and the pool area, especially the infinity pool, is very relaxing. During our stay, there was always some type of improvement being made, whether that be replacing the tile on the grand staircase, the light bulbs in the lobby, or working on the landscaping (it was not intrusive). The property has a lot of potential, and it was our feeling that the Marriott is trying to reach their full potential in this hotel. Just like anything, it takes time, but I have no doubt that they will achieve their goal. Though the hotel is not situated directly on a beach, but on a rocky point, there are beaches on both sides of the hotel within easy walking distance (just a few minutes). We did venture down to the rocks a few times and enjoyed watching the sea turtles bob their heads in and out of the water. As far as the restaurants are concerned, we did not try them. They have a restaurant off the main lobby for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Also, there is a pool side bar restaurant that is open from 10:30am to sunset. We had hoped this bar would be open later for watching basketball playoff games - perhaps in the summer they extend their hours? It would be nice if they had a coffee shop (think Starbucks) in the hotel, but there is one next door at the Wailea Shops. All in all, I have to say that we enjoyed our stay at the Marriott very much and would recommend it if you are looking for piece and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our week at the Marriott Wailea”
Reviews.Author: airtumbleweed
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write a short impression of our stay at the Marriott Wailea, since I use this web site to book our vacations. My wife was in the far east on business for a month and we wanted to meet half way for a relaxing 11 day vacation in paradise. After meeting my youngest daughter (and her boy friend) in Honolulu for her 21 birthday, we shot over to Maui for a week. We couldn't have picked a better location and hotel. The hotel is the old outrigger hotel, which was bought by Marriot some years ago. After a $68 million dollar renovation - it is a dream come true. We were most impressed with the open air lobby, infinity pool, the openess and helpfulness of the staff, good food and great location. Oh, and the bed is spectacular - you litterally sink into it. The front staff was nice enough to upgrade us to an ocean view room - which was a nice extra. Get Frank the supervisor of Security to tell you the story of how he wound up in Maui. It moved us. And the bartenders recommended "cafe Olah" as a favorite local hang for dinner. It was reasonable and very good. The area is quiet and serene. There is a paved walkway seperating the hotel from the ocean. We walked it every morning going thru the Fairmount, Four Seasons, a variety of condo's as well as Ullua and Wailia beach. Over by the Four Seasons you can rent all sorts of water sport rentals. The hotel is a very short walks to the shops at Wailea - which sports good shopping for the gals and a couple of nice restraunts. The scenery from our balcony and pool was breathtaken. We spend many an hour standing in the Infinity pool, with a drink in our hands, just staring at God's paradise. Also, I noticed no construction whatsoever. If you are looking for action and night life - this is not the place for you. If you want to get away from the mechanics of life and just eat, drink, explore and vegitate - I would recommend this hotel. As far as adventures - renting a convertible is a must. We have fond memories of snorkeling in the morning and hiking on a volocano top in the afternoon (bring food and drink as there is nothing on the top). A day in Lahania should also be on the agenda, and a stop at bubba gums for some good food and fun. We didn't do the road to Hanna, but as a write this review, wish I had. The trip was expensive, long travel and took some planning. But for all the trips I've takin in my life - this ranks up there as one of the best and memorible. Aloha and Maholo.

Reviews.Title: “liked the hotel, hated the housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: runes4lisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wailea Marriott for a week while on our honeymoon in April of 2008. The location of the hotel was spectacular and close to the shops at Wailea. From our hotel room, we could see whales breaching on a very regular basis. Fantastic view for sunset's each evening. Very quiet and peaceful. There is a 3 mile walk you can do which runs along the shoreline passing a slew of other hotels, this was great exercise! If you have young kids (under 10) they will love the waterpark area. It has a waterslide, a mock beach, sprinklers in the shape of palm trees, etc. The adult pool is also very peaceful. You can rent cabana's for $100.00 per day (personally, I think it is a waste of money... you are there for the sun right!). Although the location was beautiful, and the rooms were a nice size, I was not overly thrilled with the staff. Very few people said hello and they did not seem to go out of their way to make you feel welcome (with the exception of the valet staff). When we checked in, we mentioned that were on our honeymoon. Nothing was ever said or done. My husband is a preferred customer with Marriott, so I was pretty surprised by this lack of response. I also was very disappointed in the housekeeping. I had accidently spilled baby powder on the floor of out hotel room when we first arrived (no carpet in the rooms - all tiled flooring) , it wasn't cleaned up for 3 days. Our floors were never washed and the sweeping was not very thorough (i.e. missed corners and under the tables). There were also a few days when our bathtub was not cleaned or the bathroom counters were not wiped. Now, I am sure of this... because it couldn't be missed, I don't know how housekeeping did! I didn't complain to the hotel, as my husband didn't think it was a huge deal (his response.. it is a chain, what do you expect) and given that it was our honeymoon, I didn't want to deal with the headache of complaining. We had left a substancial tip the second day, hoping that things would improve; however, it didn't. I think my experience was unique, as other's at the pool said their housekeeping was great. The Marriott has also recently put in the memory foam beds...if you have a bad back, I don't recommend staying there. I don't mind a soft bed; however, I found it too soft...feels like you are sinking. I woke up everytime I went to roll over. After a few days you get used to it. I noticed a few other people around the pool complaining about the beds too. We had breakfast at the hotel only twice, as we have left early for our daily adventures. The food was quite good and not overly pricey. We had dinner a few nights at the Shops of Wailea (Tommy Bahama and Ruth Chris Steakhouse - were our top picks). We also had dinner one night at Roy's Restaurant (just a short 10 minute drive into Kihei) - this was very good. Hillo Hattie was a great spot to shop for souveniers, that was until we went to Lahaina (much better selection for the hawaiian shirts, etc). If you are looking at snorkling adventures, I would highly recommend Trilogy (by far the best company out there). Old Lahania Luau was also fabulous (far better than the one done by the Marriott), I would highly recommend this luau, but book as soon as possible as the best seats go quickly. Maui Downhill was great for biking down Halelaukala (it isn't a 61 kms bike ride downhill, you only ride down about 30 kms - no pedaling required)...smooth ride. Dress warmly, it was really cold on the top of the crater at 5:00 a.m. (I am not kidding...it was zero celsius). If you are going to Hana, eat at Charley's for breakfast...it is on the road to Hana in Paia (interesting fact... it is owned by Willie Nelson, who is a regular visitor). Go to the bathroom before you go (unless you are okay with outhouses or road side pitstops. Not much eating selections in Hana. Buy the CD about the road to Hana (driving tour) well worth the $20.00. We also stopped by the Garden of Eden at mile marker 10. It was really interesting seeing all the different types of plants, trees, flowers, etc. Great spot for a picnic lunch.

Reviews.Title: “We returned again a year later”
Reviews.Author: laroo906
Reviews.Content: We actually had booked a condo in Kihei, and upon arriving were really unhappy. The condo had a smell in the closet that was so strong we couldn't stand it. That and the pictures on the internet were a bit deceiving. So.... I got on priceline to try to get into the Marriot and got a great deal!! We were so happy to return. It is one of the nicest areas to stay. The beachwalk is fantastic. The pools have been redone and they now have an all adult endless pool that looks right out on the ocean. Great for whale watching and relaxing!! I would go back in a heart beat and hope we will be lucky enough to be able to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Maui and Marriott”
Reviews.Author: molokinisnorkler
Reviews.Content: We just came back after a week of springbreak at this resort. We had a package booking with expedia. Although we called them to book (rather than booking online), we got an ocean front rm instead of the ocean front room with breakfast for 2 option. After repeated arguments with them, they finally gave us $ 100 discount of the package (which is about 2 days worth of continental breakfast at the hotel). Except for this everything was done right by expedia. The hotel stay was great. The chekin time is 4 pm but the room was not done till 5pm. But they offered complimentary strawberry smoothies. The room was partially looking the ocean. It is very confusing whether u r getting ocean front versus ocean view (and there is a deluxe ocean front category too). When asked I was told that the room we got was an ocean front. May be I should have asked for other room options. They have a map of all the rooms showing different categories. They did show the map to me but it was difficult to decide the category from the map. To be on the safe side, I would choose the one that directly faces the ocean, rather than at an angle (although again the hotel is designed such that most rooms are at an angle to the ocean/beach, excpet for delux ocean front ). The room was clean and was serviced daily. The facility was clean and all the staff people were nice. There is an adult only pool too (18 and above). The kids had a blast. There are two pools and two spas in the main area near the Humu grill. Though the hotel overlooks the ocean, the beach - Mokapu and Ulua itself is little walk (3 min) from the hotel but access is easy. Ulua beach is closer to the hotel and there is great snorkeling site at the farther end. Basically the beaches are separated by a small rocky projection. This provides a good snorkeling site. There are additional pools and small rides, but these are slightly remote from the main tower (but may be close depending upon where u end up staying. Resort fee: Marriott charges $ 25 (plus tax)/day as resort fee. You get a small valet card at check in outlining the details. The details of this are also on their web site. If u choose to self park then u dont have to pay anything as the parking fee of $ 15/day is included in the resort fee. But if u choose valet then u pay $ 18/day over and above resort fee. Basically u loose the $ 15. You get 2 bottles of water per day in your room (if u dont than call them). This is included in resort fee. U get 2 complimentary Mai-Tai per stay, worth $ 9/drink (and not per day). There is some confusion about this as if u are sitting at the Humu grill near the pool, most waiters give u 2 free tropical drinks per day. But if u ask the front desk or the bar tenders they say that this only a one time thing. So try ur luck with the waiters daily till u run out of luck!!!!!! Pools and facility is clean overall. The breakfast was good. We did not try their restaurant or Luau. There are expensive restaurants in the nearby Shops at Wailea. There is a somewhat affordable pizerria (Matteo's pizzeria) right across from the shops. There are few restaurants in Kihei town which in 5-10 min drive. We liked Fred's Mexican place. Activities: Molokini Snorkel is a must and so is visit to Turtle town. The Lahaina cruise company charges $ 80 per adult with kids under 12 free (one per paying adult). Alex Air was the cheapest for the helicopter rides and honored their lower internet rates even if u booked on phone. We did not do road to Hana or Haleakala crater trip. Would certainly go back to Maui. May try a different resort next time, not because we had any complaints but just human nature. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fantastic Pool”
Reviews.Author: lucky94568
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided we needed a tropical getaway before the arrival of our baby in June. We chose the Wailea area of Maui because we've been before and love the slightly quieter atmosphere as compared to Kihei or Kaanapali. The Marriott was in our price range within this area, which also has a Four Seasons and the very expensive but beautiful Grand Wailea. The Marriott was terrific. We arrived on a Wednesday evening and departed on a Tuesday morning and were there during spring break so it was busy. Our room overlooked their brand new adults-only infinity edge "Serenity" pool. We spent part or all of every day at this pool. They had waitress service, it was quiet, overlooked the ocean, and they had cabanas you could rent for $50/day, which we did twice. The hotel had been purchased from the Outrigger a couple years prior and the Marriott was finishing up its remodeling. The inside of our room was great - completely redone with modern furnishings (not tacky tropical style), bathroom with marble, etc. The rest of the hotel still kind of looked like an older hotel on the outside but it didn't really bother us. Between the fantastic pool and our room, we were happy. The hotel really only had 2 restaurants: Mala, an upscale restaurant where you can have breakfast (I believe lunch), and dinner. Dinners are good but expensive and their selection is kind of limited. Breakfasts are the standard resort breakfast offering with either a la carte or buffet and in my opinion was very good but expensive ($28 for the buffet). The other restaurant was poolside and had a very limited menu. This where we' d order lunch from each day when we were at the pool. I'd say if you are looking for a hotel with a great variety of restaurants, the Marriott is not for you. Otherwise, we were happy. We chose to walk down the path to the nearby Grand Wailea and Four Seasons and had several meals at both because they had so many restaurants. Service at the Marriott was great and overall we really enjoyed our stay. We would stay here again when we are in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tolam
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week's stay at the Wailea Beach Marriott. The hotel is really lovely, a bit of construction going on but nothing that interferred with our trip. This part of Maui is quieter and the Marriott has the only infinity pool of the hotels in the area (No kids allowed) which was ideal for two girlfriends looking for a nice quiet week. We asked for a beach front room which I highly suggest...sunsets are amazing. We did tour the other hotels, Four Seasons, Grand Wailea, Fairmont (not so great) and we were quite happy with our choice. Whale watching from the pool will definetly make you relax along with the frozen pineapple and ice water they deliver. Great hotel, great service!

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Vacation @ The Wailea Marriott”
Reviews.Author: tymike
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 ( 2 adults & 2 kids ) just completed a 9 day stay at the Wailea Marriott Resort and had a great vacation. The renovations are complete and the property is amazing. Great open air lobby when you arrive. Nicely renovated rooms. All of the pools and slides are open and are a lot of fun. The hotel is beachfront and you can watch the whales playing in the water right from the swimming pool. There are two beach's - one to the left of the hotel ( much more crowded ) and one to the right of the hotel ( in my opinion much nicer ). Both beachs are their own little coves so they are not rough and are great for the kids and snorkling. The food at the hotel was very good and the service was amazing ! I would stay here again and I would recomment this hotel to anyone ! I am a seasoned road warrior and this hotel was one of the best I have stayed at !!! Scott

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad!”
Reviews.Author: blueskiesovertexas
Reviews.Content: The Wailea Marriott has its good and bad points. Unfortunately the bad really crossed out the good. THE GOOD 1. LOCATION was stunning. The hotel was beautiful and the view of the ocean was priceless. 2. STAFF - the staff was delightful and helpful at all times. You were greeted by everyone even the grounds crew. 3. ROOMS were nice and cool with ceramic flooring with great views. THE BAD 1. POOLS - the main pool had very few places to relax where you could see the ocean. Bushes needed to be trimmed so that you could enjoy the pool and the ocean at the same time. The new infinity pool was amazing but had no shade. You had to purchase a cabana to have any shade at all. 2. SPA HIDDEN FEES - After my massage I was shocked to see a $20 fee on my bill. When i asked if this was gratuity she said only 2 dollars went to gratuity and never explained the remaining 18. They had several chances to tell me about the fee when I called to make a reservation, when i signed in or when I was called for my massage. Then no explanation when I checked out. I was furious and the manager was called. They took off the fee but I was peeved that they would try and sneak 20 bucks out of customers without an explanation. 3. SPA was very small and didn't even have a hot tub or any hot water showers. Very dissapointed. 4. HOTEL HIDDEN FEES - After booking our hotel online we were shocked to arrive and have a $25.00 + tax PER DAY charge to the room that they call the Resort Activity Passport. Now this pays for self parking, local phone calls, 2 water bottles a day and a discount on laudry services but I was upset that they weren't upfront about the charges and I would rather pick and choose what I pay for instead of them forcing this Resort passport on us unwillingly. Started our trip off with a bad feeling about the resort. 5. PIPE PROBLEMS- We were woken up every morning around 5 or 6:00 am to the banging of pipes in the wall. There was nothing we could really call about since the pipes were in the wall and it would have taken a construction crew to tear down walls but I was the fact that so much noise woke us every morning we were trying to sleep in. 6. BATHROOM PROBLEMS - we had to call repairs to fix our bathtub twice in 5 days due to draining problems.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Maui - loved the Wailea Marriott”
Reviews.Author: KMme
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from our 10-day vacation in Oahu, Maui, and Kauai. It was our first trip to Hawaii for myself, husband, and 2 kids, ages 5 and 7. We stayed at the Wailea Marriott for 3 nights. The hotel is exceptionally beautiful. The pool areas are beautiful and the childrenâ€™s pool area was fantastic for the kids. Service was excellent, and people were very friendly. The only complaint I have was that there were ants in our room â€“ lots of them. I know it is an island and bugs are bugs, but they were really annoying and not what I expected from a Marriott. In fairness to the hotel, we did not complain about them, I am sure they would have relocated us if we had. But the first night we were there, we noticed only 1 or 2, so didnâ€™t think it was worth packing up and moving. But the 2nd night we were there, there were a lot. By the 3rd night, I could not wait to get out of the room, they were all over the place. When I found one on my pillow, that was it, I could not wait to check out. We did not go down to the beach area, as my kids were having too much fun at the pools, but it looked like a nice beach and was not a far walk. All in all, I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: bird49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wailea Marriott for one week in Feb. The hotel is magnificent, the service amazing and the area breathtaking. When you arrive a cold mango scented cloth is offered to welcome you. The bell captain is right there to assist with your baggage and familiarize you with your room. We stayed ground level pool side with great access to all areas of the hotel. Even though the hotel was full, the large pool areas never felt that way. It wasn't like larger hotels down the road where you have to run out early in the a.m. to throw down your towel to reserve your chair. The pool staff called us by name every day, Leslie and Lori as efficient and friendly as can be. Alex at the snorkel shack was more than accomodating often letting us keep equipment past our rental time. Always friendly and always giving suggestions and calling us by name. You certainly don't get that at the Grand Wailea or Fairmont or Four Seasons. The gym was great after a long run along the beautiful promenade everymorning. The whales jumping just in front of the Marriott were picture perfect. The hotel has service plus which always answered immediately. The conceirge gave us dinner and tour suggestions and even showed us menus of other resteraunts to help with decisions. This is a hotel that gives you a welcoming feeling. Its not full of pretense. I had the opportunity to speak with the sales office as I noticed conferences were taking place. Julie Pau was so friendly, a true assett to the Marriott family. We love strolling the shops at Wailea at night and thought this area of Maui was much more relaxing than Kanaapali. We visited Whalers village and area and could not wait to return to the peacefullness of Wailea. You are only minutes from Kihei and Makena with the beautiful "Big Beach". We thought this was the most relaxing vacation we have had and we will be back. We loved the pools and the fact that the beach was a short 2 minute walk gave us the best of both, ocean and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price, but not quite LUXURY...”
Reviews.Author: surf-snowboard
Reviews.Content: Considering where you are staying in Maui, surrounded by the Fairmont and Four Seasons, it's a nice hotel for a cheaper price. The service is great. The views from the open lobby and the restaurant are amazing. You do feel like you are in paradise, and while sitting in the restaurant you can watch humpback whales swim past no more than 100 yards from shore! But if you want real luxury i'd recommend going to the Four Seasons or Fairmont. The room was big, spacious and comfortable, but the bed was on the soft side for me. We had room service at 1am and had half a sandwich left over, and by the morning there was a trail of tiny ants all over the food. Also the hotel not having a beach kinda sucks. I don't enjoy spending time in a hotel pool on vacation so can't say much about it. Overall it was a good deal considering it cost me $200 less than staying at the other hotels, but you do get what you pay for in some respects.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cherc
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Hawaii and we had a great time at this hotel. Everyone was very friendly and it was very clean - and the beds were very comfortable. The only downside was that our room was over the service entrance so there was some occasional noise at night with delivery trucks. We had a blast at the kid's pool - they have great slides that adults can go down also. Our 3-year old that hasn't had swimming lessons yet had no problem (1 1/2 feet deep) in the pool or the longer slide. The beach was great, we were able to snorkel right there (and listened to the whales under water - great to just watch the whales while eating breakfast). The shopping mall is just a short walk (has a Maui Dive Shop right there to rent boogie boards & snorkel equipment). Overall we really liked this hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian paradise”
Reviews.Author: jdhillwv
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic vacation! The resort staff was friendly, accommodating, and very pleasant. There was nothing we asked for that was not taken care of immediately. The activities staff helped us plan our off-site activities, which was very helpful. Only downside was it had a small pool, but the beach was unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: tina031
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week vacation at the Wailea Beach Marriott. We had booked an ocean view room through expedia. The room we were given was in hale 6 with a view towards hale 7. There was only a partial ocean view from the balcony. We went back to the front desk to get a room with a better view and learned, that all ocean view rooms are in reality partial ocean view rooms, and even the ocean front are not ocean front, they face the ocean but you overlook the pools and if you are in first floor people can look directly in your room. The oceanfront rooms in the tower have a nice view, but you have to use the elevator, what is very old and has a bad smell and you have to wait for ever. So the only rooms what face the ocean are the deluxe ocean front and we decided to pay for the upgrade, since they did not want to give us a free upgrade, even after we told them that we came for my birthday and our anniversary and that my husband is a Marriott rewards member. They gave us a discount upgrade rate ($50 instead $100) plus tax per night. Still there was a bad feeling since we already paid much more fore this vacation since we ever paid for a vacation before. On top of that you have the $25 resort fee, what includes the parking fee and 2 Mai Tais for the whole stay. The rooms are renovated with brand new furniture. Nevertheless I was disappointed because the rooms are not cozy but businesslike. The floor is very cold. But besides this, the rooms are adequate a 4 star resort. We've been to Maui 4 times before and always stayed at Napili beach. Our favorite resort there is Napili Kai. I wished, we would have stayed there again. The only thing what might be better in Wailea is the weather. The Marriott is not located on a beach. There are two beaches in walking distance, but you don't have any shade there after noon. Ulua beach is less crowded than Wailea beach but there are no chairs. On Wailea beach we took chairs what belonged to the Grand Wailea resort and so did a lot of other Marriott guests. The umbrella had to be rented and paid for. Since it was not terribly hot we were fine without umbrellas but still, you pay $500 per night at the Marriott and have to take longchaires from a different resort and do not get umbrellas? I f you are a pool person than you are fine with the Marriott, since they offer a lot of long chaires at the pools, but if you are a beach person like me you would ask yourself, why did I pay so much money? On top of that the Wailea beach is extremely crowded and so is the Wailea resort. I asked myself, why do people pay $1000 per night? To be on a crowded pool or on a crowded beach? The Marriott was much quieter. The breakfast and dinner restaurant has a nice view overlooking the pools towards the ocean and the food there is expensive but also very good. We always had the continental breakfast buffet for $17 per adult, kids pay $9 (it used to be kids eat free with two adults paying but they changed that). I liked the variety of fresh fruits. Full breakfast buffet is $25 per person. The service was not good at all, dinner even worse than breakfast. The restaurant itself is not very cozy, it is loud and does not have a relaxed atmosphere. We spotted restaurants with a much nicer atmosphere at the Four Seasons. The pool restaurant was okay for lunch, but the poor food quality didn't justify the high prices. You better have lunch at the Grand Wailea pool restaurant, what has the same prices but much better quality. Overall we had a good vacation. Our daughter loved the kids pool. I was surprised how nice the weather was. Since it was February I expected rain and storm but it was nice and sunny every day. Even the ocean was warmer and calmer than I expected. The only downside was that I always compared the Marriott with the Napili Kai, what I liked sooooooo much more for far less money. The rooms in the Lahaina Building, where we always stayed, are much nicer and right at the beach. For over$100 less per night you have a bigger room with a kitchen in a much nicer location. When you have kids, a kitchen is great, because sometimes they are to tired to go to restaurants. And room service gets booring after the 3rd time. The Napili beach is more beautiful and much quieter than Wailea. The vegetation there is more tropical, you get the real Hawaiian feeling. For me Napili was paradise, Wailea was just okay. When you are a nature person, you will love Napili. If you want to spent most part of your trip inside the resort at the pools, when you like roomservice over the possiblity preparing you own meal once in an while, and if money is not an issue, you may be happy with the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZ2323
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Marriott in early January. We used points to pay for our room. The hotel and grounds are absolutely beautiful. It was our wedding anniversary so we asked for and received an upgrade from a standard room to a great ocean view over looking the main pools. We didn't eat any meals at the hotel so I can't comment on the food. The hotel sits on a rocky outcropping with very nice beaches just a short walk to the left or right. We walked through the Grand Wailea and both felt that the Marriott was superior. The must do food places are as follows...Kihei Cafe - awesome breakfast with huge servings. Gazebo - great breakfast with beautiful ocean views. Da Kitchen - inexpensive lunch with huge servings. We went scuba diving at Molokini Crater and 4 shore dives (to get our scuba certification) at Ulua Beach. We saw a small shark at Molokini and a bunch of turtles and eels on our shore dives. I would reccomend the shore dives at Ulua Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Wow !!”
Reviews.Author: gone2bigsur
Reviews.Content: When I walked into the room I said WOW! After reading some of the reviews I didn't know what to expect. The rooms are very nice (luxurious). We had a partial ocean view room on the 6th floor. We were using Marriott Rewards for our stay. If you were paying the $500 rack rate I am not sure how you would react. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The bell-men give you a great introduction to the hotel layout and facilities upon arrival. The front desk and activities desk personnel were very helpful and friendly. We ate breakfast at their buffet restaurant (Mala) every day and enjoyed watching for whales from the terrace. We enjoyed sitting in the lounge chairs around the pool and watching the sunset each evening. It did not bother me that there wasn't a beach on the Marriott property. You can walk to the property on either side via a paved walkway to get to a beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Still Being Renovated”
Reviews.Author: sunsurfandsand
Reviews.Content: Marriot Waleia is a beautiful hotel that is almost finished with their remolding. The beach is small and rocky. Their are different pool choices and a kiddy pool w/slide at on end of the property.There is a broadwalk that extends to Grand Waleia, Four SEasons and Kea Lani. The beach at Kea Lani is great. After being unhappy with 2 different rooms they gave us, the manager upgraded us to a great suite with 2 bathrooms and 2 terraces and 2 plasma televisions and refridge for the same price. The room was kept clean with housekeeping service twice a day. We mentioned it was a special anniversary and were given champagne.and other goodies. We stayed here with our Marriott points. We would have chosen a different place on the beach but the accomadations were deluxe.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Takemeaway79
Reviews.Content: Great, accomodating staff plus the beautiful location make this a great place to relax. We were able to watch whales pass by from the pool deck and our balcony. There was a pool area for children but it did not seem to get the use that the pool closest to the beach walk did (unfortunately). I booked a spa appt. about 10 days before we arrived only to have it canceled a half hour before. I would have had to pay if I canceled so the fact that I was never contacted to reschedule was annoying. (The spa phone was answered 2 days later when I called to inquire and I was told the spa was closed). The dining room was closed and we found that inconvenient. Ate several meals at the Shops of Wailea mall area because we could walk. But again, the Marriott staff was top rate.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity Pool Now”
Reviews.Author: alohabeckons
Reviews.Content: Cannot say enough about the new adults only pool. We've stayed here in the past, and enjoyed the hotel and it's relaxed attitude among what can be stuffy Wailea. But the new serenity pool takes it over the top. We enjoyed sunset everynight relaxing in the pool with cocktails, the view can't be beat. They are still working on the restaurants, so we missed the new one that will open after we leave. The staff is very friendly, overall great experience. And did I mention the pool?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Small Maui Resort”
Reviews.Author: MayaCA
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 10-day stay here. The small, private beach is a highlight--great sunning and snorkeling steps from the hotel. Rooms are comfortable and unpretentious. Sunset at the bar is beautiful. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Wailea Marriot is a favorite”
Reviews.Author: paraclyte
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel that is going through a renovation in excess of 60 million dollars. VERY NICE ROOMS. Roomy and clean. The valet/bell staff was kind and helpful; we loved them. The front desk was great to work with; amazingly accomodating. All of the employees on the site greet you with a smile. Grounds are immaculate. Great place to view the sunset. It would be hard to beat this hotel. The Wailea community is very upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wailea resort without the pretense of the larger hotels”
Reviews.Author: MauiMarkCT
Reviews.Content: We started visiting this resort in 1988 on our honeymoon. For the next 10 years we stayed at this resort through the ownership changes from intercontinental to Aston to Outrigger to managed by Marriott. As those years transpired the resort went through various half attempts at remodeling. None were complete and most were stopped before completion due to "cost". After staying at the Grand Wailea next store the last 5 years we returned to the Marriott (see review under GW for reason we left GW). We knew the hotel construction was not completed so we were prepared for the possible disruption. It turned out that except for the pool bar not being open there was not real disruption. The pool construction was not noisy and other than it being visible it's impact on visitors in negligable at the most. The bar at the pool was closed but was planing on opening on Dec. 15th. The only real impact is on sunday;s when you wanted to watch a football game while the family is at the pool. The staff is warm and always looking to make the guest happy. The resort fee includes 2 mai-tais, bottle water, spa discount. All the other resorts charge this fee and you don't get anything more than the pool for that fee. if your looking to impress your friends, this may not be the place, but looking for a great value, a resort as close to the ocean as possible then this is your place. The hotel is right on the ocean due to when it was built this was allowed, All the new resorts are off the ocean and feel like they are miles from the ocean compared to this property.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful resort!”
Reviews.Author: wisconsin30
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent 3 nights at this property and absolutely loved it! We were in what's called a terrace/garden room in the tower building. Our room faced the front drive and main desk area; however, there are trees that block your view and we rarely heard any noise. From reading other reviews, I wasn't sure if we would be required to pay a $20 resort fee per day or if this was optional. Turns out it was optional, but we chose to pay it. With paying the fee your self parking was included (don't bother with the valet, the self parking is very close) and runs normally $10/day. You also received two Mai Tai drinks daily from any restaurant or bar in the resort. The Mai Tai drinks are $8.50/drink. We spent every late afternoon down at the pool bar with our Mai Tai's and watching the sunset. It was just wonderful. Also, you received 10% off of services at the Mandra Spa on site. Between these three items the $20 resort fee more than paid for itself. The pool area is fantastic and there is a great walking path along the ocean that connects several resorts together including the Marriott which makes walking to restaurants at other hotels convenient. Also convenient was onsite guest laundry. The workout facility is large and has many elliptical machines, bikes, treadmills and weight machines. The resort is still under some renovation construction and they are in the process of building a "serenity" pool; however, noise was kept to a minimum and all guests are advised of this upon arriving.

Reviews.Title: “The postives and the negatives”
Reviews.Author: FloridaShell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a trip to Maui that put staying at the Marriott Wailea towards the end of our trip. We were greated with seashell lei's ( The sheraton Kanapalli gave us fresh ones). When we arrived at the desk, we had to wait in line for about 5 minutes because there were only 2 people working that day. When it was our turn, there was an issue with our reservation of an "ocean view room" made 5 months in advanced. We were upgraded to a suite but not quite the ocean view we really wanted. The housekeeping staff totally rocked- great service! The pool staff was short staffed and lacked the "service" aspect you expect from a resort with a $300+ per night room rate. We had rented a cabana and received no service for over 90 minutes. While I was in Maui, I sprained my ankle and required a wheel chair to get around. The hotel was less than happy to loan out their wheel chair to us and we had to constantly return it. I felt this was the most discouraging part of the experience. This resort requires a lot of walking to get from place to place, and their attitudes about loaning the chair out so i could still enjoy my stay was anything less but caring and accomodating. I just expected a little more from the Marriott team when I needed them most. The grounds are pretty and the room service was great. This is definately the upscale area of Maui and not much to keep you entertained in the evenings like in Lahaina or Kanapalli (excuse the misspelling). If you are younger and want more to do than shopping and pool time, definately spend some time up in Kanapalli and Lahaina. Wailea is definately more low key, relaxing and subdued. Hints and Tips: Dont forget to try a restaurant called Matteo's just across from the Shops of Wailea. Good food at a reasonable price. Also, make a stop at the Safe way before you get there for sodas, booze, and snacks...this will save you money on room service and drinks. If you are looking for a great snokel excursion, definately check out the Ali Nui. Great service, great value - great time! Maui ER- gets a B rating..I was in and out in 4 hours for my ankle :) Mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great town, Great Island!!”
Reviews.Author: ryanrhat
Reviews.Content: Let me start with this Island... Maui is unbelievable. Just unreal. It's like living in a postcard. Rent your own car and take the Road to Hana. Now to the town... Wailea is an upscale area on the SouthWest coast of Maui. Gorgeous scenery, beautiful beaches, and very friendly people. don't expect a rockin' nightlife, but that's not what you go to Hawaii for. The beaches in this area are phenomenal... Makena Beach, Wailea Beach Ula Beach, etc... all within a couple minutes. Now to the hotel... Absolutely beautiful. The grounds are gorgeous, the rooms are sublime, and the beds are to die for. Again, not much of a nightlife, but the pool scene is relaxing with waitress service and a convenient bar. Family friendly, but not overbearing. I was there on my honeymoon and I absolutely recommend this to newlyweds and families alike. Totally upscale and accommodating. you can't go wrong with the Marriott Waliea. Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Odie7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Wailea in early October. We had a great stay. We knew about the construction and ended up staying on the side the property with the construction. They were upfront about it and asked if I still wanted to go through with the reservation. It was not that big of a deal. If I did not want to deal with construction, I would have chosen another hotel. I will stay the property was spread out and it took a few days to find the shortest distances between our room and garage, pool or restaurant. Overall, I thought we received excellent service. My only real complaint was that they needed another pool side server. The one person they had was not enough and we waited awhile for our drinks. She worked her tail off so it was not like she was slow, but just had to serve a lot of people at the pool. I though the pool area was nice. We only used the one in front of the hotel. The view of the ocean was nice and we could always find two chaise lounges to sit on. The hotel food and drinks were expensive, but its Hawaii, everything is expensive. We went to the grocery store by the hotel to buy drink and snacks instead of going to the hotel gift shop. The location in Wailea was perfect. It is definitely more low key than Lahaina, which was great for us. The beaches are beautiful. Although the Marriott was not on the beach, there were two beaches on either side that are a very short walk - I think it took us only 2 minutes to get to Wailea beach. Overall, we had a good experience. Rooms were clean and in full working order. We plan to go back in 2009 and would stay there again. Hopefully all construction will be finished.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Time at the Marriott Wailea”
Reviews.Author: gertrudep
Reviews.Content: I had read all of the previous reviews about this hotel and I was skeptical. However, I am extremely happy that I booked this hotel. My husband and I were celebrating our 35th Anniversary and we wanted to make sure it was wonderful. The hotel was beautiful and peaceful. The hotel staff were extremely friendly, courteous and helpful with directions. There is some construction of the new infinity pool, but everything else is completed. There was some noise at the site of the new pool, but it did not go on all day and was not bothersome to us. I would highly recommend this hotel. Our experience was wonoderful.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel- Will try somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: French_McGuire
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon at the Marriott Wailea during the week of Oct 7th. We usually vacation at $100 B&B's, but decided to step it up a notch for our trip to Maui. The hotel was very nice- clean, friendly, on the water, but lacked charm. No major complaints- but no major kudos either. The entry drive is through a beautiful tree grove- straight out of Jurassic Park. We were met by a bell hop at the entry- he said that since we declined valet parking, I needed to park the car before we checked in- so my wife had to stand on the curb with our bags while I parked the car. This was our first contact with our luxury hotel, hmm. The pool scene could have used a bit of an upgrade. There were just a couple of very busy waitresses- and no bar to order your own drinks. It rained one afternoon, and they stopped all drink service. We paid for the $20/day activity pass- which got us a parking spot ($10 otherwise), a bottle of water, and 2 fruity drinks a day, plus some other stuff that we didn't use. We had an ocean view room that had a fridge, a safe, comfy bed, & a sideways view of the water. We were warned ahead of time that they were building a new pool- our room looked right out over the construction. They only worked during the day and were relatively quite. It appeared that there were lots of other vacant rooms- and the only mention of an upgrade was at the check-in desk when they asked if we wanted to pay more-but this was before we even saw the room. Again- no big deal, but not what I expected at a luxury hotel. The hotel location is decent. There are a few great beaches with good snorkling, free beach chairs and sunset views within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel is right on the ocean- but no immediate beach front. There is a high end shopping mall adjacent to the hotel property with a few decent restaurants (Loghi's & Cheesburger Island). We found no cute town, coffee shop, mom & pop eatery, or local flavor in Wailea. Maui was beautiful! But next time we will stay in Lahina, and not assume that $400+/night means top end accomadations.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but missing the mark during construction”
Reviews.Author: willboston
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from four nights at the Marriott Wailea. It's a beautiful resort, but overall, I'd say we were underwhelmed. I have a feeling that a lot of the issues with the hotel will be resolved once the construction is done, but as things stand, this resort did not measure up to other similarly-priced tropical resorts we've been to recently. The good: * The location: Maui is awesome and if you are willing to go just off the beaten path a little you can find good, local food and wonderful local beaches (Big Beach, for example). You'll need a car for sure. * First impression: The first impression when arriving at this resort is impressive. It is kind of a sprawling, open villa kind of view with open-air registration and fountains, etc. * The luau - it was fun and the food was good. We didn't pay for it ourselves so I'm not sure how the pricing is. The bad: * This resort is not on the beach - you have to walk or drive to the beach. The beach you walk to is okay - not bad, not great. Big Beach, which you can drive to, is fantastic. But if you want to be on the beach with hotel-provided chairs, this is not your resort * The bar - closes at 10, the restaurant doesn't serve breakfast down by the pool until 11am - there is nowhere to buy coffee in the hotel. Why wouldn't they put a Starbucks in the lobby? I have no idea. We didn't eat at the hotel but other than the luau, our friends also staying at the hotel said it was average * CONSTRUCTION: This hotel is undergoing major construction as of end-of-September 2007. They are building a "serenity pool". To give some perspective, this means that maybe 50% + of possible pool area is not open at this time. Combined with no beach, this means this resort is really limited. Also, there is a lot of obvious construction going on which takes away from the physical beauty of the place. * We had a very long wait in line to register. This was mitigated by the fact that they gave us juice and cool towels, but still. * $18 portage fee. There was an $18 "portage" fee on my bill. I've never seen this before. This is typical of this Marriott - you get the feeling they are trying to nickel and dime you whenever they have the chance. They charged me $8 to print out 4 pieces of paper in the business center (my boarding passes for my flight back home) * They rip you off at the spa. They charge you an 18% gratuity automatically, which is okay. But *then* when you're done with your spa treatment, they give you a guilt trip and tell you that almost none of that 18% goes to the person who did the treatment, and that you should give more if you want the person to get money. Marriott should be embarassed by this behavior. Overall, I would only recommend this hotel *after* construction is done and if you could get a good rate or use points. There are a lot of places to stay in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort.........Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: sceneisle
Reviews.Content: Nestled between two stunning beaches, we found the Wailea Marriott much to our liking. The resort has that "Hawaiian feeling", from the open-air lobby and front desk to the lush, well-manicured tropical trees and vegetation. The resort has all the amenities expected of a 4 or 5 star property: (Mandarin) Spa & beauty shop, fitness center, three swimming pools (one with a large slide), tour/activity desk, 24-hour business center, and retail shops. Self-parking is $10.00 per day while valet service is $13. Hula Moons Restaurant & Lounge is the resort's main restaurant and there is pool-side service at Kumu Bar & Grill. Due to the high cost of food/drinks, we did not dine at the resort; opting for more reasonably priced meals in the nearby town of Kihei. The resort sits on a 1.5 mile foot path that runs along the ocean; great for an early morning walk or jog. The Shops of Wailea mall is a short walk from the property. We spent one week at the resort (October, 2007), staying on Marriott Reward Points. We upgraded to an ocean-view room (#824) on the top floor of the Haleakala building. Our room afforded us a nice view of Ulua Beach, from the lanai (rooms in this building, with south-facing lanai's have great views of Molokini and the Island of Kaho'olawe). The room was spacious, well-maintained and nicely furnished. It was equipped with a small refrigerator, two telephones, iron & board, hair drier, safe and internet connection ($12.95 per day). Housekeeping was excellent; our room being satisfactorily serviced at the same time each day. The resort is currently undergoing remodeling in some of the buildings and a new Serenity pool is also under construction. The construction fences are a bit of an eye-sore but this drawback is expected to be remedied by December, 2007. Outside of high food & drink prices and a squeeky main elevator in the Haleakala building, I have nothing but good things to say about the Wailea Marriott. If you have any questions or would like to view additional photos of the resort and some of the nearby beaches, send a private message via Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott - Some issues”
Reviews.Author: sbharr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott from Sept 22 - Sept. 29, partly on points. Overall, the resort is in a beautiful location with newly remodeled rooms and great ocean views, but we did have some problems. Keep in mind it is not beachfront, but within easy walking distance on a paved beach path to either Wailea Beach or another smaller beach (Ulua?) After check-in to our room in Haleakala tower on the top floor, we had a problem with the deadbolt. First we could not get out of our room. They supposedly fixed the lock while we were at dinner, but then we couldn't get in. It ended up being a real headache, first waiting in the hallway as security and engineering worked on the problem, and then they let us wait in a nearby room for a while. We were exhausted and just wanted to go to sleep, so after waiting a total of almost 2 hours, we asked to be put in a final room while they worked on the door so we could get our belongings. While security and engineering personnel were great and very sympathetic, the night manager at the front desk was not. She acted like we were deliberately trying to annoy her and just wanted a free upgrade. All I wanted was my luggage and to get some sleep. She grudgingly moved us to a deluxe oceanfront room (we had booked an oceanview). She seemed mad when I asked her for some travel toothbrushes so we could just get ready for bed and get some sleep. we wandered around in the dark trying to find Hale 6 which is on the opposite side of the resort. FInally, we reached our new room and went to sleep. At 11:30pm, we were woken up by the front desk calling to say they had drilled a hole in the door of our original room to gain entrance to it and we had to come get our stuff as they could not secure the room! Long story short, with security's help, we moved our stuff and got to bed at 1:00 am. Next day, I open up the curtains in our new room. We have a marvelous view of the ocean AND a black dump truck. We are now smack dab in the middle of the construction zone for the new infinity pool. I had specifically requested to be away from the construction. After talking to the much nicer front desk manager during the day, Julie, she agreed to move us to a new room. She told us we had to wait until 2 pm for the room to be ready. So we had to wait around the hotel on our first day in Maui to get this settled. The room was not ready until after 3pm. We were happy with our final room in Hale 2, but I was disappointed that the hotel did nothing to acknowledge the aggravation and inconvenience. Breakfast buffet was included in our room rate which was good, because it would have cost $25 per person per day. Be careful, they have a real problem with bugs and birds getting at the open air buffet. Overall, the resort is pretty and in the nice area of Wailea. But front desk personnel need more training. Some were great, others not. I asked for late checkout on our last day and the first person I spoke to was obviously not having a good day. I told her to forget it, and went back a few hours later and spoke to a different person. Suddenly it was no problem. Even though I am a Marriott Silver Elite member, I would only stay here again if I got a REALLY good deal, and only after the construction was over. There are too many nice properties on Maui to deal with bad service. If you are staying during the construction (it is now scheduled to last to the end of this year), ask for the Haleakala Tower or Hale 2, you will not be bothered by the construction.

Reviews.Title: “Just awful aging property, stay away....”
Reviews.Author: dtsaisape
Reviews.Content: With the rates we paid per room, I expected a higher level of service from the Marriott. In fact, it doesn't even hold up to the Marriott standards in my previous stays at its properties. Here are some lowlights of our stay in room 612: 1. The Air Conditioning broke down 3 times during our stay. Each time we had a technician come out to "repair", they assured that it would be fixed. 2. After the A/C broke down the second time, we requested a room change. The new room they gave us wasn't really full ocean view we had in the first room. So we moved back after they repaired the A/C. 3. Below and above our room, we had restaurants setting up with at 5AM in the morning; disturbing our sleep at unreasonable hours. 4. The toilet handle broke off the toilet. 5. On two instances, there was construction on the roof below the breakfast lanai where sandblasting was happening. It was so loud that I couldn't hear myself think. The hotel management staff did move us to suites after our complaints. The move happened on the last night. To my wife and I, it was too little too late. All in all, the property's age and room quality clearly shows to all its guests. After my stay there, I find it very difficult to remain a Marriott customer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation”
Reviews.Author: travelhappyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wailea Marriott for the first week of our two week Hawaiian vacation. Very nervous going in after reading reviews on this site but in the end we were very pleased. The hotel is on a beautiful piece of property and the view is spectacular. The staff is friendly and the rooms are recently renovated. We stayed in the haleakala building and were not bothered by the construction at all. Our room was not ocean front but we did have an ocean view. The pool was never too crowded and the beach was very close by. Fine snorkeling for beginners. Highly reccomend Kai Kanani boat to Molakini, take the early morning cruise and beat the crowds at the crater! If you are there on a Sunday night check out Mulligans on the Blue. Great Irish pub with good food and awesome Irish music! For sushi check out Sushi Paradise in Kehei, a small locals spot short on atmosphere but the sushi is great! Don't miss Mamma's Fish House in Paia.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Member730
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our honeymoon, and the Marriott Wailea was our first stop. I had very low expectations of this hotel as I knew it is under constructions and had read some bad reviews on this site. I have to say, I was very pleasantly surprised by our stay! Check in was very easy and the front desk staff was always very friendly and accommodating to anything. The bellman was very friendly as was the pool staff (more on this later). Room was always cleaned very well. We did have an ant problem on our 4th night where somehow our room was invaded by about 1,000 small ants. As we didn't leave any food out or anything, I called the front desk and asked for a room switch because I didn't think it was us who caused the ants. After offering to spray the room (which i declined) the hotel offered to allow us to change rooms. Within 10 minutes we had a bellman there to help us with our things. The hotel was not crowded, which we loved. A nice thing is the kids pool is not located near the main pool, so the main pool stays pretty quiet. Food by the pool and service were fantastic. The pool staff, not employed by marriott, were friendly- but here is the catch. they are incented to sell maui jim sunglasses. Most of the staff is very tame about it and does not bother you unless you ask. One staff member, however, is so pushy and incredibly obnoxious i literally asked him not to speak to me for the rest of my trip. at one point he was coming up behind guests in their lounge chairs and putting sunglasses on their faces. We stayed on marriott points and paid for an upgrate, but received a double upgrade. I'd definitely recommend paying the $20 per day for the resort fee. parking is included as well as 2 drinks per day and the bottle of water in the room. That is more than your money back right there! We didn't eat breakfast or dinner at the hotel, only lunch by the pool. For breakfast we went to the Whaler's general store or the coffee shop in the wailea shops. The hotel is definitely still way under construction. We were not impacted too badly. Our room wasn't near the construction (hale 7) but we did have to walk by it every day to go over to the pool. happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Marriott I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: MarriottTraveler
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott timeshare owners and reward members and have stayed at many Marriotts. This one was categorized as a 6 or 7. I would have given it a 3. The rooms were old and musky. The slider doors were rusted and didn't open well. Sleeper sofa old and lumpy. Drapes stained and dirty. Bathroom so small you could hardly open the door when you are inside. We were charged $10/day for "complimentary" parking. I would not recommend this hotel or pay the posted rates. The only nice thing is the location, but even that didn't have a beach. There wasn't even a place of entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Grat stay at Marriott Wailea”
Reviews.Author: WDWgoofy
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Ocean-front room offered the best location. Rooms recently renovated and are very nice. The only minor issue was that the AC unit is under-sized and is unable to cool and dry the room sufficiently. Restaurants were always top-notch. Spa is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gibbow
Reviews.Content: - We stayed in four hotels during our Honeymoon and this was the worst, principally due to poor service and a penny pinching attitude at the resort. It is also in the middle of an upgrade programme so many rooms have a view of the ocean and a suite of Heavy Construction machinery just below. If you are paying for your room then stay somewhere else in Wailea. ---Service----- - We booked an Oceanview room on a high floor via the company's website and also notified them that we would be on our honeymoon. Cost $592 per night - On check-in we were first told that there was no room available yet (it was noon). We said we did not mind waiting for a good room and we would hang out by the pool. - We mentioned again that it was our honeymoon (hint hint!) and were a little insulted by the receptionists offer of an upgrade for an extra $120 per night! My reply was that surely $590 per night should be enough to secure a good room. That was the last mention of our honeymoon and we did not even receive so much as a complimentary drink. - When we arrived as well, despite the fact that the hotel was not busy, when I said I was self parking, the bell boy insisted that we had to park the car before we checked in. They then left us to carry our own bags to the check in desk. Poor - The resort fee is also another con at c$20 per day just for the right to park your car. Local phone calls are supposed to be free but they added them all to our bill and thought we wouldn't notice. - On check out, our bill was riddled with mistakes (all in the hotels favour) including the aforementioned local calls and our breakfast which was supposed to be included in the rate. ----Rooms----- - The hotel put us in room 420 which is supposed to be an Oceanview. We got there and to our dismay the only view was of the top of the palm trees! It would seem that this is the same for most of the rooms on the fourth floor.
