This struck me as a bit of a rip off as there is very clearly no view of the ocean and we were upset as we made it clear that we were happy to wait for a good room. - After much complaining the hotel moved us to a garden view room which was clean and modern although there were signs of a rush job on the fittings with screws loose on the door etc. - The bath and toilet are in a very small room and the double sinks are in a more open space. Well appointed but not terribly well designed or inviting - The rooms are somewhat spoiled by two issues. 1. The beds are extremely soft and offer no support. 2. there is no soundproofing so you can hear when you neighbours are showering or flushing their toilet. - Communal areas in the accommodation blocks are dark and extremely dirty, especially stairwells which really need attention. The ice rooms were generally filthy. ---Food ----- We only ate the breakfast but the buffet was quite limited and poor quality considering the price we paid. The orange juice was diluted to the point of being coloured water and was totally tasteless. A lot of food items were not replaced in the last 30 minutes and the omelette chef was in a miserable mood every day. I watched him constantly asking this supervisor what time it was and then at 5 minutes to 11 he would dump all his ingredients in a bin so he did not have to cook any more. ---Conclusion---- There were clearly a lot of guests here who were staying on reward points. For them you get a hotel in a good location, a sandy beach close by and modernised rooms. For cash paying customers you walk away feeling that this represents very poor value for money. We could have had a garden room at the four seasons for the same price. Service is just not good enough and staff look miserable. It would seem that due to the modernisation of the hotel, corners and costs are being cut to the bone everywhere else. This was clearly an under invested asset being modernised but it is very cosmetic. You are still left with the problem of wafer thin walls and poor service. We paid twice as much for a room at the four seasons on Big Island an thought it was fantastic. Service really matters.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: myvicisslow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott from July 14-18th. Service: We were greeted by a friendly staff and check-in was a breeze. Housekeeping was good. The rooms were cleaned daily and at the time we requested. We requested additional beach towels which were not an issue. Bellboys and parking attendants were friendly and helpful as well. Room: The rooms are nicely appointed with new furnishings. The beds are a bit soft but of course that's personal preference. Our first room was a garden view on the 7th floor of Haleakala Hale. We had a decent view of the Marriott water fountain but also partial parking lot view. We switched rooms due to an incident explained in the "Cons" section. Both rooms were in the same category. Our second room didn't have a screen on the sliding door to the lanai while our first room did. Also, the air from the central air vent smelled like the ocean in our second room. The air from our first room did not have an odor. Perhaps because our second room was on the 3rd floor while our first room was on the 7th? Pool: The main pool area has two pools and a few hot tubs. We went to the pools twice during our 4 night stay. Once in the morning and once in the early afternoon. On both occasions, there were plenty of lounge chairs available. Getting additional beach towels at the counter was never a problem. Servers were always available to get drinks. Cons: There was an unexpected third guest our room 702. We tried to catch it or squash it ourselves but that sucker was really fast. We decided to call housekeeping to take care of the problem. It was so fast we couldn't identify what it was. When housekeeping arrived, they couldn't find it either. He wasn't sure what it was but based on our description, he said it couldn't have been a bug and might have been a mouse. At that point we called the front desk to request a room change. This is when we were changed to a terrace/oceanview. I would use the term oceanview very loosely because you can only see a bit of the ocean in between the palm tress. I didn't realize this until the next morning since it was too dark out. The amenities in the room were the same. We stayed here the remaining three nights with no issues. We requested compensation for the inconvenience but were offered nothing except the fact that bugs and critters are out of their control... So a word of advice, make sure your luggage is zipped up when you're not using it! The other negative was the ice room on the third floor of our building. The wallpaper was torn down and you could see what looked like mold on the walls. Disgusting. The room was very damp as well. We got our ice on another floor. Everything else: Construction wasn't an issue for us because we stayed at the north end of the resort in the Haleakala Hale. From what I saw, construction may only be an issue if you have an oceanview or oceanfront room on the southern side of the resort. Despite the negatives, we still enjoyed our stay here. The resort is a short walk to both Ulua and Wailea Beach. The Shops at Wailea is also a short walk away with a few restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wailea Marriott was Incredible”
Reviews.Author: tvanhooz
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews....just read them, but since many of you helped me with your reviews, I only thought it was fair that I gave my opinion. This property is absolutely wonderful. I was very skeptical after hearing about all of the construction, but it didn't bother us one bit. They are currently working on the new check-in area and the new Serenity pool. ROOMS: I thought it was great with very comfortable beds and plenty of space for my family of four. We had an "Ocean Front" room and in that I come to one of my few gripes. This "Ocean Front" room was on the 7th floor and did face the ocean; however, I am not sure why that isn't just "Ocean View". Nonetheless, it was a spectacular view and a great room. LOCATION: As many mention, Wailea is a bit slower-paced which means it is much quieter than the Lahaina and Kapalua areas. We loved the location and you are only about a 5 minute drive from the town of Kihei which has many, many restaurants to help you save money from the hotel's prices. ACTIVITIES: Overall, the prices were up there a bit for a family of four; however, we went there on points for our hotel, car, and airfare, so we didn't mind spending a bit. There are MANY fliers out there that offer deals and I think you can save some good money...just make sure you call to confirm that you don't have to sit through a timeshare talk to get the discount. We did the following activities and I have given a quick synopsis. Snorkel tour aboard the Four Winds II. This was INCREDIBLE. We were supposed to go to Molokinin; however, the winds came early so they took us to the Coral Gardens. Some of the best snorkeling we have done (and we have snorkeled in the Caymans, Jamaica, St. Thomas, Mexico, etc.) and saw many fish, eels, turtles, and an octopus. They feed you breakfast on the way out, snorkel for about 2 1/2 hours, and they have lunch on the grill (burgers, dogs, and chicken) any time you want to swim back to the boat. We have small children (6 and 4), so they had life jackets, boogie boards, some small floats you could put then on with glass bottom viewers and pull them around while you snorkel, wet suits, etc. They even had a slide off of the boat into the water for kids and adults. A great trip. Maui Ocean Center Aquarium - Great with a lot to see and learn about the marine life in Hawaii. Maui Tropical Plantation Tour - nice for a couple of hours to learn about the agriculture in Hawaii and it includes a tram ride around through many types of flowers, trees, coffee, etc. Iao Valley State Park - Free to go and walk around yourself. A few walking paths and a nice refresher (much cooler up there) to catch a break from the heat. Snorkeling off of the beach - many sea turtles around every day. We went out around the rocky point from the beach and immediately see clearly and swam with many types of fish and the sea turtles. Atlantis Submarine - Cool for the kids, but I would rather snorkel. You do go down about 137 feet, so it is cool to see what is around the reef. We saw several Eagle Rays which were cool. Kids Pool at Hotel - A GREAT kids pool with a playground in the pool and two water slides. Great for kids and adults as we spent many hours and burned calories climbing and sliding...climbing and sliding. Golf - Played the Wailea Gold course and thought it was just an average value. The Plantation course at Kapalua had just been aerated and they said it was in ROUGH shape, so I just played Wailea. I play many courses in Florida, and other than the elevation changes..it was just mediocre. Luau - We did the one at the hotel and it was very nice. Not over the top...just enough to get a taste of Hawaii without having to travel too far. RESTAURANTS: Some we liked were Gian Don's, Fred's Mexican, and Cafe Olei in Kihei. Giong to Gian Don's was a much nicer atmosphere than the MArriott and prices were about half. The mile and a half path in front of the resorts is really nice for a morning walk and you meet many people along the way. The grounds of the hotel were very nicely kept and we are already looking to re-book for next year. Make sure to do any snorkeling or other trips early in the morning as the trade winds kick up around 11 a.m. and things get a bit choppy and rough. That being said, they also cool things off a bit. Overall, it was an EXCELLENT vacation spot with many, many things to do. We wanted to do the surf lessons, fishing trip, maybe a helicopter ride, and going up Haleakala...and didn't get to those activities. I HIGHLY recommend this trip and we weren't bothered one bit by the construction. I hope you have a GREAT trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnob5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 7 nights and loved every minute of it. The rooms and bathrooms are amazing - all tiled floors, huge bathtub, modern decor, down comforter, etc. The resort was very quiet. There is a nice breeze in the afternoon. This was our third visit to Maui and this was our favorite hotel (previously stayed at Hyatt in Kaanapali and Marriott in Kaanapali).

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Go Back”
Reviews.Author: sfm80
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Maui for the first time so my husband could go to a conference. The first 5 days of our stay were excellent as we rented a condo at the Koa Lagoon in Kihei. We then moved to the Marriott for the conference and the last 5 days of our trip. The room was nicely decorated, just remodeled. I was a little put off by no carpeting on the floor, and as soon as we went to bed that night, I knew we were not in for a great stay. Bed was horribly soft and very uncomfortable. We woke up around 4 am also to find that at some point in the night the air conditioning automatically turns down, so we were both very warm, sweaty and uncomfortable, not to mention backs cramped from the uncomfortable bed. My husband went to the front desk around 7am to ask for another room with a firmer bed. Well, should have gotten up sooner as there were about 10 people in line with the same request. To our dismay, the staff was not concerned and not helpful. No other rooms available, and anyway all beds the same. No bed boards, nothing to help and no suggestions, just Sorry ! Decided to have breakfast and go to the pool. Well forget the pool. All chairs and umbrellas taken, very small pool area for the amount of guests. Although there are signs posted that spots may not be "saved" there were approx 50 % of the chairs "saved". We did finally find 2 chairs. When we asked to have an umbrella that was not being used moved so we could have some shade from the blazing hot sun, the staff refused because there were towels on the chair. When we pointed out the sign, the pool supervisor just shrugged his shoulders. We then took a little walk and found cabana chairs with sun shades. GREAT !, NOT. When the pool supervisor saw us sit in the cabana he came over to tell us there was a $40.00 day charge for the use of the cabana. We asked if the fee could be waived as there was no shade at the pool, they would not move an umbrella for us, nor did they have any more umbrellas. Well, no good, ended up paying the $40.00. Again, staff must not have had any customer service training. This was our 3rd trip to Hawaii. We have stayed on the Big Island in the past. If you want paradise, 60 gorgeous acres, free umbrellas and free cabana use as well as staff that cater to your every need, ditch Wailea Marriott and stay at the Hilton Waikoloa on the Big Island you won't be disappointed. Marriott you have a lot to learn.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Experience”
Reviews.Author: skinsfan1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Hawaii and while we had a wonderful time overall, we had some trouble with the Marriott. We are big fans of Marriott and try to stay at their hotels whenever we travel. Upon our check-in to the hotel, we were prepared for the construction and that did not bother us, at least at first, because it was not an inconvenience until the next day. But our first night was problematic because our a/c was not working. It ran and ran all night but never cooled the room down. We slept miserably. That next morning my husband talked with the front desk about it and they sent a maintenance man right away. While he was there telling me that it would never get down to what I set it on (72 degrees), he got a radio call that immediately all power was to shut down in 3 buildings, ours included! Thus our power was off for 5 hours! At this point, I was starting to get upset--how could they give us no warning about the power outage? Hours later, I was forced to take a shower in the pitch dark bathroom and could not apply make-up, fix hair, etc. We went to the desk and complained again and asked to change rooms. While they gave us a nice gift basket for our trouble, we were still expected to pay full price for that night. I found this troublesome--no a/c and no power and construction everywhere? Our new room had a/c that worked quickly and efficiantly, accomodating whatever temp we set it on. In the end, my husband had to dicker with them about paying for the first night and they did eventually relinquish and gave the night to us. But I overall was not impressed with this hotel and probably would not choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “best value for Wailea area”
Reviews.Author: inSF
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights with a conference $275 and didnt' get upgraded from the terrace room :( but one of the best values. Construction isn't a problem, so close to the mall for ABC store and cheaper food. The restaurant food is subpar, but so many other places to visit. 2 free drinks/ day- get them from Cheryl at the bar upstairs. We were charged $18 "porterage" which was a huge surprise, but there wasn't a "resort" or parking fee. 2 boring round pools, didnt' try to get into the Grand Wailea pool, but the slide made for a fun time at the pool. Makena beach and LaPerouse bay are just down the street. Visit Mulligan's on the blue for good Irish music.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Surprise and Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: TrendyAsian
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for his 30th. We came across this "renovation deal" on expedia and were a little skeptical given the price for 8 nights and round trip non stop flights for a little over 1500. For the same price we were looking at condos in Kihei and opted to take a chance. Turned out to be one of the best decisions we made. When we arrived we thought we made it to the wrong hotel! It looked amazing at night with the open lobby all light up with torches. We were then upgraded to a partial ocean view room and stayed close to the kids pool. This hotel is in the hotel circle so a 2 minutes walk and you are at the beach. There didn't seem to be system of any sort... meaning you could just borrow chairs from neighboring hotels and use their bar services. Since you must get a car in Maui the free parking they offered was a plus. Room service was good and the tile floors were great because you get sand EVERYWHERE. The cooler in the room was great and cooled things just fine when left for a few hours. The location was a major advantage. Minutes walk to the mall where you can get cheap breakfast food/ lunches and last minute toiletries at the Whalers Store. Kihei is only a 5 minute drive away and there you can find a Kmart to buy snorkeling gear and boogey boards for ($10 thats a day's rental at the hotel). I highly recommend Roy's for dinner- it's not pretentious and has a great wine and food pairing menu for reasonable price. Only complaint was we got charged a mandatory daily fee of 15 dollars.. which was in addition to our vacation package. That did give us a discount to the laua though so i wasn't too irritated by that. Would highly reccomend this place - rennovation was occuring but mostly in the lobby and was not disruptive to our stay. Go in November because its not peak travel time and there's more free space at the beaches. And by the kids pool they were setting up a sandwich shop which would be nice when its available. Don't forget to take a quick slide down the kid pool! You are on vacation afer all no?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Fargofan
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort without going overboard. We stayed here for 10 nights and had a wonderful time. We only had one meal at the hotel which was adequate. With so many other options in the area, we chose to eat out. Hotel employees were more than accomodating and very pleasant. Some areas of the hotel are still under construction but did not effect our stay at all. Very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Overall enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: isoparr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for 5 nights. The property was undergoing a renovation which we knew in advance so there was some construction equipment to walk around. We were greated with a shell necklace and cold mango-sented towels to freshen up. The pools were very nice. One pool had an awsome slide and small water park for the kids. Our room faced the ocean so we could see the sunsets. The hotel had a complementary lei making class and one could also pay to make a beautiful shell bracelet. Other than that, there were not very many hotel activities but we went sightseeing, to the beach, or to the pool each day. The hotel does not have its own beach but there is a very nice sidewalk and one can walk a short distance to the beach in front of the hotel next door. Hotels do not own the beaches so this is permitted. The Wailea area is very pretty with huge trees and many flowers and golf courses. The Marriott is two doors down from the Grand Wailea hotel and shops which is really something to see. The Marriott does have a nice breakfast buffet and resturant but if you want to eat out, you will need to drive a few miles to "the strip" where there are many resturants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice. very”
Reviews.Author: JanRog
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Cabana . . great view. Concierge was excellent as was the front desk personnel. In-room wi-fi was limited to "safe" sites and thus limited using my Email package. Extra charge at Mariott hotels for internet is behind times. Good property and we enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, Marriott”
Reviews.Author: FlMauibound
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Everyone at the Marriott was friendly , accommodating, and went out of their way to make us happy. Maybe it was the military rate of $200 a night or the fact that they were way below full occupancy but whatever the reason we couldn't have been happier there. The rooms were nicely renovated, the grounds and view were beautiful. My son loved the kiddie pool which we asked to be positioned near. Not only did they give us a room right next to the kiddie pool but we also had a partial ocean view while paying for terrace view. I think the resort fee of $20 a day more than pays for itself. You get free parking, two free mai tais a day, a free liter of water a day, and kids eat free at breakfast. We left the wailea area to stay at Kbh afterward and were sad that we didn't stay at the marriott the whole time. The staff were friendlier, the rooms nicer, and the scenery was better!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra67
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 8 nights at the Wailea Beach Marriott. It was our first trip to Hawaii and we loved every minute. We used Marriott points and booked a Garden Terrace room. After arriving we were upgraded to an Oceanview room at no charge. The room was very nice and had recently been renovated. It had a mini fridge that was very convenient. The hotel property is large and sprawling with wonderful views. The property is flanked on both sides by beaches, which can be quite a walk but it is well worth the views. We often had the smaller adult pool all to ourselves. The staff is very cordial and helpful; true aloha spirit. The hotel restaurants were adequate, and the food was acceptable. We were concerned about the construction that was going on, but it was not a problem at all. Within a short walking distance of the hotel are upscale shops including Tiffany's, Coach, BCBG, etc. We questioned the resort fee of $20/day. We were then allowed to pay $10/day for self-parking (because we were Marriott Reward members). Everything is very expensive in Hawaii and gas is especially outrageous. So plan extra in your budget for excursions. We would love to return someday!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation...Great Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: queen7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort back in January 08. I had heard some negative reviews on this resort but I have to say that I don't know how picky some people can be but I thought that this place was wonderful!!! The rooms are spacious and newly furnished and the bathrooms are very nice. The beds are really comfortable!!! We had an ocean front room which was fantastic for watching the sunsets!!!!! Our room was a distance from the restaurant and pool (3 minute stroll) but no big deal beautiful walkways and surroundings. Some people thought the pool looked so so or out dated I disagree the pool area it really nice and there is an out door rest/bar right there. The water is cold though...Burr!!!!! The MW is located between to beaches both very nice. They are not as wide and long as some in the Carribean and not white sands more beige in colour but the water is spectacular so clear . The restaurant has a really nice buffet breakfast it was included in the price for us. If it isn't your paying around 25.00 each. Dinner is expensive there my husband and I went to the Mall (3minute walk) and ate mostly at Cheeseburgers. The prices are reasonable. Good selection on the menu...dinner for two around 40.00 to 50.00 dollars. Wailea is so so stunning and clean. I swear you could eat off the ground and it is hard to find a blade of grass out of place.. Rent a car and tour the island you won't be sorry. Breathtaking vistas!!!! Other resorts right near where we were staying like the Grand Wailea look amazing but they come with a high price tag. The staff were very friendly at the Marriott Wailea. I highly recommend the MW. Just one thing if you smoke there are very few places to light up. They are 100% smoke free!!!!! Bring your own booze. The drinks are very expensive. There is a small fridge in your room. There is an ABC Store in the mall to buy liquor and pop and snacks for your room. Have a great holiday!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed over Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Rhino2525
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews on this website for several years but have never contributed. After staying at the Marriott Wailea over Christmas, I felt that I needed to give back and submit a review. My wife and I decided to spend Christmas in Hawaii this past year but didnâ€™t start setting up arrangements until October. After getting our airfare reserved, I then set out trying to get room reservations for Oahu and Maui. I had no problem getting arrangements for Honolulu (we stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village on Waikiki Beach for four nights and enjoyed it also â€“ especially the corner room view from the 20th floor of the Rainbow Tower). Finding a decent hotel for Wailea was a lot harder due to every one being full except for the Marriot. After reading some of the reviews, I was worried but didnâ€™t have many choices so I made the reservations for 5 nights arriving on 12/27 and staying until after the New Years. I tried to down-play the accommodations with my wife so she wouldnâ€™t be disappointed. Wow, I worried for nothing. While there was construction going on, the hotel was very nice and the rooms were closer to water than the near by more expensive resorts (see pictures). The room was very nice and the bed and sheets were very comfortable (and my wife and I have a very expensive lush pillow top Simmons at home so we are picky about bedding). The room had a refrigerator (nice for cold drinks and snacks that we bought near by at the Safeway), large bathroom, and couch by the sliding glass door. We had a deluxe oceanfront room in Hale 7 on the 2nd floor and the view was breath taking! We are in Hawaii so we didnâ€™t really care about using the pool and instead used the adjacent Ulla Beach. We bought some straw mats, a cooler, and a boogie board at an ABC Store (think Walgreens) at Kiheiâ€¦they have a Safeway grocery store that we loaded up with beverages and snacksâ€¦ By the way, the resort fee of $15 was not mandatory as stated previously in other reviews. I told them that I was not interested in the service from the resort fee and they were happy not to add it on when we checked in. Another complaint was the restaurant. We never eat at the hotel restaurant. We enjoyed dinner at Ruth Chris at the Shops at Wailea (couple hundred yards from the property), Royâ€™s (about seven miles away in Kihei), in a Thai Restaurant (about seven miles away in Kihei), and the fabulous luau at the Old Lahaina Luâ€™au (make sure and make your reservations before leaving for Hawaii). For breakfast, we took advantage of a previous reviewerâ€™s advice to get the take-out breakfast at the Whalerâ€™s General Store at the Shops at Wailea [--] itâ€™s only couple hundred yards from the property and they have a $5 breakfast from their deli counter in Styrofoam take-out box full of eggs, bacon, and hash brownsâ€¦very filling â€¦these also have muffins, other breakfast sandwiches, fresh fruit, etc including liquorâ€¦you can sit in the courtyard outside the store and enjoy the breakfastâ€¦good store for a lot of thingsâ€¦. The Shops at Wailea had several expensive places to shop but my wife found several reasonably priced stores for shirts, etc. In summary, we really enjoyed our stay at the Marriot and it was a good value in comparison with some other more expensive resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: Caitlinsgranmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Wailea Apr 21-29 and had a wonderful time. This is not the place to go if you want a total resort experience, that is the Grand Wailea down the beach. The Marriott offers great rooms, good food and a quiet ambience that was just perfect. We were using a hotel reward so knew we would be in a "Garden View" room. Upon arrival we were offered a discounted rate for an ocean front room so took it. Our view was amazing overlooking a grassy knoll straight to the ocean, we could hear the waves crashing on the rocks, such a great sound. Staff was very helpful and friendly at all times, the renovations are almost complete and are being done so as not to be noticed. The rooms are great, love the tile floors and super beds. Our refrigerator worked just fine, I see others had a problem. We ate in the restaurant upstairs, great views and good food, try the Macadamia nut pancakes! The pool restaurant served a lovely shrimp salad for lunch, very tasty. The beach walkway is a great way to exercise in the morning and gives you a view of all the other hotels in Wailea. Not to be missed are the Blue cheese burgers at the Burger place in the Shops at Wailea, and Roy's restaurant in the Safeway shopping center for Dinner, just amazing. There is also a great coffee place at the Shops tucked away upstairs, they make a mean cup of coffee better than any chain coffee shop!! For Luxury go to the Four Seasons or Grand Wailea, the Marriott is all about easy comfort but that is not a bad thing. We will definitely return. Be sure to check internet rates especially for senior discounts.

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth it”
Reviews.Author: BeemerGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at this resort. 1st time was great. This time it was just ok. The amenities are not worth it. They don't have wireless access in the rooms so if you are expecting to do work by the pool forget it. They also charge $10+ a day to have wireless access that only works in the business center. Only have one pricey restaurant for breakfast. We only ate once at the hotel in the pool bar. Went snorkeling but it rained for 3 of the 5 days we were there. Staff was nice but not outstanding. For the price you expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Wailea Marriott”
Reviews.Author: ingrids3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Wailea Marriott to celebrate our 10th anniversary. We were in Maui from April 21-28. The only sign of the construction was the work, which was definitely winding down, for the new reception area. We were in Hale 2 on the pool level which I think was the second floor. We had an ocean view which was also a pool view. We were not bothered at any time by noise from the pool even though we were only about 75 feet from it. We did not eat at the hotel at all based on other peoples reviews. We found several very good restuarants which included Matteo's (returned more than once), Longhi's, Stella's and Mama's Fishhouse. We agree with the understatement about the refrigerators as we had beverages and fruit freeze in the "keep cold things cold" refrigerator. The bed and pillows were amazing! The room was comfortable and spacious. Housekeeping was efficient and we did like the tile floor as it was cool and we knew it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DREWWW
Reviews.Content: Location A bit out of the way, 45-60min to Haleakala, and Lahina but seculted. It has a smallish beach right there which has some GREAT snorkeling as long as you get there before noon when it starts to get choppy. Food Might as well order the room service (same price plus the service charge), I didn't think the restuarant was work the price, and I wasn't very thrilled with their selection. The lounge and the Hula Moons resturant both had a nice sunset view. Pool bar is only open til 5 so buy some booze at Safeway and watch the sunset from the grass. Also they said the pool bar would be closed May-June 2007 for renovations. Rooms Standard room with a fridge (they say its not ment to cool food from room temp, but I put in a room temp water before I went to bed and when I woke up it was frozen), when I was staying in Hale 2. The bathtub is pretty akward, as its about 2 feet deep. If you have a hip problem you might not be able to get in/out on your own. The room was clean the only complaint I had is if I walked around the room for a while my feet would have sand on the bottom so make sure you brush you feet off before you get into bed. Other The renovations weren't bad. I didn't hear anything and when they're done I'm sure it will be really nice. The Luau is definately worth it. We paid for the premium seating wich I think was worth it as the show and the food were great. They hit you up with a "resort fee" which give you free complementary parking, 2 mia tia's (yeah I spelled that wrong) some discounts and a bottle of water, so its not so bad. Over all it was a really nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Marriott”
Reviews.Author: JeanieAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the hotel March30-April8. I tried not to have high expectations after having read a few unflattering reviews. I was very impressed by this hotel. They are not the Four Seasons, and not trying to be in that league. (I think this may be the problem with some of the reviews that were posted.) Yes, they are still in the middle of a renovation, but it is barely noticeable. We were upgraded to an oceanfront room, which was recently renovated, clean, and modern looking. I would describe the room decor as Contemporary Island. The tile floors are nice, kept the room cool, and I imagine the hotel has eliminated the problem of musty smelling beach front rooms. The in-room safe and refrigerator were very handy. My only suggestion to the hotel would be to supply free, in-room coffee. We did not use the hotel restaurant. However, the bar has an amazing view of the ocean. There is a Safeway supermarket and a huge selection of restaurants in nearby Kihei. My 7 year old adored the children's pool and slides. My husband did not budge from the main pool overlooking the ocean. The hotel never felt crowded- the grounds being very spacious. No, they are not as elaborate as the Grand Wailea. But, after walking next door and seeing the VERY long line of people waiting to get towels and packed like sardines next to the pool, I was thrilled that we made the decision to stay at the Marriott. Also, all of the staff I met were very professional, helpful and kind. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wailea Beach Marriott Resort & Spa, Great Resort! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: ImpulsivePuppy
Reviews.Content: Wailea Beach Marriott Resort & Spa My wife (35) and I (34) went to Maui March 19-26. We stayed at the Wailea Beach Marriott Resort & Spa and were extremely pleased with the accommodations. It is true that there are some major reconstruction projects being done and this certainly was apparent during our stay. The main outdoor lobby was closed off as the floor retiling and the ceiling are being completed. The registration desk was relocated to the far left close to the Spa entrance. Though somewhat unsightly, this did not effect our stay at all except for our walk to our room being somewhat detoured around the construction. From our room we never heard any construction noise. According to one bell-hop there is no end in sight to the updates. Apparently they are still planning on adding a new swimming pool and restaurant to the property. Aside from the area under â€˜beautificationâ€™ (construction) the resort was lovely though oddly laid out. Partly because some areas were closed off it was somewhat difficult to get from point A to point B at the resort unless point A was in the very direct vicinity of point B. Our point A (our room) was absolutely amazing. Because I am platinum elite with Marriott (neener, neener, neener) we had a complimentary upgrade from the Terrace View reservation to a Deluxe Ocean Front room. I certainly wasnâ€™t expecting this as we were using points to stay here. After a long flight from Seattle (via Salt Lake City, we were using miles on the flights as well) it was incredible to walk into our very clean, open, newly refurbished room and slide open the door to the lanai to look out to the volcanic rocks and ocean not 20 feet from us. Simply amazing. Farther in the distance we saw Molokini crater and Kahoolawe beyond. This was the perfect room for a Hawaiian vacation. The hotel itself, as I mentioned before, is oddly laid out over its 22 acres. There are outdoor pathways that meander through the property but if you are staying on one side of the resort and you want to get to the other side, I would factor in 10 minutes for getting there and another 5 minutes for getting lost. It should be noted that despite its name the Wailea Beach Marriott is an ocean front resort and is not located on a beach but between two beaches, Wailea and Polo. However the walk to these beaches is so short it really didnâ€™t matter. The better of the two beaches is Wailea. It was never crowded, always clean, had amazing snorkeling, and was closer to our room location at the Marriott. The Marriott offers a fairly pricey champagne breakfast buffet. The food is good though the variety is a bit limited. For a $25 breakfast I was expecting to be wowed. It was unfortunate as well that after going to this breakfast buffet on three separate occasions during our stay that it was only at the end of the trip did we even realize that champagne was included in the price of the buffet. We were never told this or offered it even when the waiter came to offer coffee and tea. There are a few nice areas very clost to the Marriott as well. Since we were in Wailea we drove south down to the Makena area to check out some of the beaches mentioned in the Maui Revealed guide book. We first stopped at the Secret Cove. This isnâ€™t so much a beach as it is a rocky ledge at water level. And it doesnâ€™t feel so much like walking on a beach as it did walking on a rocky and sharp volcanic rocks. The snorkeling was pretty good but not worth the trouble, scrapes and scratches to get in to and out of the water in my opinion. We also stopped at Big Beach and loved it. This aptly named spot was not only a big beach but also had some big waves. The crowd was very sparse and I could have easily spent more time here. As far as I can tell there were no facilities here but I wasnâ€™t really looking for them. Overall I would highly recommend the Marriot despite the construction. The areas under construction can easily be avoided.The staff and service were great, the accomodations perfect, and the setting was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ash2007
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews about this property, I nearly asked my fiance to change our reservation to another hotel. It really quite nice. Not too far into resort country it is easy access in and out of Wailea. We tend to only sleep in our hotel rooms and spend the rest of the time exploring and this held true. I would say that the grounds are not nearly luxurious as the surrounding resorts, but they are definitely less crowded than the other resorts which is nice for children. We ate one average meal here and made sure to eat the rest at real restaurants, not hotel restaurants. All and all, I definitely think this a great place, very clean and nice staff, unless you are really high-end.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in customer service”
Reviews.Author: oboegirl
Reviews.Content: The Wailea Marriott is a beautiful hotel in a perfect location. The facilites and grounds are immaculate and well taken care of. The renovations are nearly complete and did not seem to pose a problem for us. Our major concern, however, was the complete lack of customer service. We waited for 15 minutes at the pool house for towels because the attendant was on his cell phone fighting with his girl friend. Everytime we went to the children's pool, the slide attendant had an ipod with head phones in and could not hear the kids who wanted to use the slide. We were told that we could not unload scuba gear in the loading zone in front of the hotel beacause the loading zone is is reserved for guests checking in. We told the them that we had already checked in, and that we were paying guests, but they made us move. We had to lug heavy scuba gear all the way from the parking garage to our room and not once did any of the bell staff offer to help. We called for towels for our room and it took 45 minutes to get them. Finally, we went to the desk to pick them up and they told us that only housekeeping could deliver them, so we had to wait for nearly an hour before we could shower. In addition, we were reprimanded for putting pool chairs on the grass. The children's pool area has a snack bar, but no service, so we had to stand in line and clean up after ousrselves when we were finished. At the hotel next door, the prices were lower and they served you in your pool chair and cleaned up for you. In addition, be aware that there is a $20.00 daily resort fee added to your bill. We were not aware of this until check in. When we asked what the resort fee was for, we were told it was for self parking and for a bottle of water in our room. It also got us 2 drinks at the bar at night. Since we were there with our children, we were not interested in the bar. Tthe resort fee is unnecessary, and a silly charge. We didn't need to pay $20.00 for a bottle of water. The Wailea Marriott charges Wailea prices, but does not deliver the level of service that other Wailea hotels offer. We expected better service. Next time we will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: T.B.Patriot
Reviews.Content: Located in a beautiful place. Much more quiet than the nearby high end hotels (ie. Grand Wilea, Fairmont). This doesn't have the glitz but the scenery is beautiful. Not having a beach right in front is not really a big problem because there is a long walkway along the costline of all Wilea Hotels. I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spot”
Reviews.Author: Trockie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the resort for the week of 3/13-3/20. I would recommend it. The grounds are nicely kept and the rooms are what you would expect at a Marriott- nice size, large bathroom, all the appropriate amenitites of a full-service hotel- fitness center, spa, activities, etc. Yes, as others have mentioned, the renovation of the lobby is taking place, but big deal... how much time do you anticipate spending in the lobby during your vacation? Our room was on the ground floor, right next to the lobby elevator and we never heard a thing. The grounds were very well kept and their were PLENTY of lounge chairs to use. The bellstaff were very accomodating, but the group running the front desk needs to realize that they are in the "service" industry. They acted like they were doing you a favor to assists with minimal requests. The concierge was great- use Kate as she is knowledgeable and doesn't seem to have any conflict of interests in her recommendations. Having been in hotel management previously, I'd say she is their standout employee. On the downside: I am a Platinum member of Marriott and was not pleased with my "upgraded" room, which overlooked the roof & a/c units, etc. I returned to the front desk and requested a move. They acted like it would take an act of Congress to make the change, so I finally inquired as to why they weren't like other Marriott properties, which always gave me the best room available. That got me my ground floor, oceanfront room, which was a handicapped equipped one. That was OK though, as it allowed us to rinse/hang our dive gear along the shower. I realize it wasn't the best they had available, as they were only about 60% occupied, but the location was good. As others have noted, the beds are soft, but it was OK for me. We didn't eat at the hotel, so I can't comment on that. However, they do not have an executive lounge, which is a drawback as there's no free breakfast or appetizers in the evening. They need to change that for sure. All in all I'd return and would encourage others to stay as well!

Reviews.Title: “ocean was steps away from room”
Reviews.Author: texasfamilyof3
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 night stay. Our room was ocean front and only about 100 feet from the ocean and right on the 3 mile walking path thru Wailea. We had a very comfortable king sized bed and a pull out sofa, so the space was adequate. Decor is minimalist. You don't need a ton of space or luxury in a room that is in Maui, for Pete's sake! There were lots of chairs scattered throughout the property - great for watching the whales as well as the sunset or just being alone. The infinity pool was very nice and had 2 hottubs. Pool chairs had ocean views. Our 5 year old loved the kids pool and slides. The staff was super friendly. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: kaslani
Reviews.Content: We had many problems during our stay. Staff that was not educated on the hotel itself. (where to get tennis gear), times places were open until. The main pool closed the second day of our stay to be reconstructed. This leaving only a small pool and tons of loud construction equipment to sit near. If you are going to close a major attraction of your resort maybe you sould let people know before the make reservations or at least when they check in . Last time I stay at a Marriott resort. Your money and time would be better spent next door at the Hilton. The only reason we stayed here in the first place was it it the closest to the sandy beach(public).

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: guidebook_junkie
Reviews.Content: I was nervous after reading reviews and debated between the Marriott, the Renaissance, and even ponying up the extra cash for the Four Seasons or another, more expensive place along the Wailea strip. I AM SO GLAD I STUCK WITH THE MARRIOTT!!! The rooms are immaculate, completely renovated. The grounds are beautiful, and it's the closest hotel to the actual water. My terrace view room was actually an ocean view. Don't worry about earlier reviews, even though this hotel is still technically being renovated, there is very little work left to be done (Basically, the driveway entrance). The rooms are complete, the Pool is amazing (one of those infinity pools that you can see directly into the ocean) and MUCH nicer and calmer than any of the disney-style pool areas at the other resorts (Grand Wailea), with fewer noisy children, etc. The spa is beautiful and not under construction anymore either. Resort fee of 20 bux includes 2 free drinks per day, parking, and other discounts. overall, i would HIGHLY recommend this hotel and am sad that the place will most likely be packed or have higher prices once the renov. is complete. trust me...this is the best value of any of the hotels in this area, and i would rather stay here even if it cost the same as the Grand Wailea. i would, however, pass on the buffet breakfast...but other than that...no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: Moonray1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wailea Marriott for 7 days in mid-February. We were originally booked into the Four Seasons Wailea in what was advertised as "partial ocean view." When we got to the room (at the Four Seasons) and saw the "view" we were infuriated (a far-away sliver of an ocean view), complained to the manager and then left. We showed up at the Marriott without a reservation. They were very accomodating and found us a deluxe ocean front room in a matter of 4 minutes for about $150/night less than the Four Seasons and with a view so close to the ocean that you could throw an apple and hit the water (Room 3314). While in Wailea, we checked out the other hotels and realized that the Marriott has the closest rooms to the ocean. All the other hotels (Fairmont, Four Seasons, Grand Wailea, etcc) have situated their rooms much further back, behind pools and gardens. Notwithstanding, there were bad points. As others have mentioned the hotel is under construction. It's not due to be finished till late 2007. It's a maze of a place and tricky to find your room and the restaurants. The food is below average. The external construction looks more like a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: shanghaimom
Reviews.Content: While the main lobby area is still under construction, we really enjoyed our stay at this Marriott, which was our first in the Wailea area (vs. Ka'anapali area). We had booked an ocean view room (we used Marriott points plus paid an upgrade fee) and when we saw the slice of ocean to be viewed, we asked for another room with a "real" view. Management complied and we actually got into an ocean front view for no additional charge. It was ground floor, which wasn't noisy at all. The whole Marriott property is very peaceful ,and quiet. We were close to the children's pool, which wasn't noisy. And the main pool was also peaceful. Our room had been totally renovated - i think all renovation of rooms is completed - and it was lovely. We had only two complaints: the new beds are too soft, and there are no rugs or carpeted areas - however, we know that's the case in lots of Hawaii properties, so no big deal. The ladies providing maid service were charming and kind. But the very best part of the Wailea Marriott is the gorgeous setting - huge lawns overlooking the ocean - we think its the best among all the Wailea properties - and we were very sad to leave, even tho we were going to Ka'anapali!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: jmkAlberta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 10 days @ the Marriott. we were actually there for a conference but stayed on an extra few days. Room: dispite ongoing reno's we were given a room right on the ocean and heard nothing other than the surf. We had a lovely king bed. but a warning , it (ours anyway ) was the softest bed i have ever slept on. pillows are down filled (allergies required us to ask if they had options which were in our room within the hour!) Rooms were clean. no problem with hot water no matter what time of day. Food: $$$ nothing is cheap here. We only had breakfast once here and it was OK. The best part was having an ocean view allowing us to watch the whales while we ate. We loved the tuna @ longi's. for breakfast we drove down the road a few miles to stella blue's. great breakfast from a very friendly bunch! Capiche had good food but was $$. if you are going, go early enough to enjoy the sunset....we were too late,but the servers were great. one of our party was suffering with a bad cough and our server actually went and found her some cough drops. A great quick lunch was Jaw Tacos in kihei. my husband is not a real fish guy, but loved these tacos...cheap too! Beach: swam with turtles on the little beach to the right of the resort. (name escapes me ..ula?..ask the guys @ the pool for directions) . Wailea beach was great for boogie boarding. Basically snorkelling/swimming should be done in the morning and boarding in the pm because of the trade winds/ huge waves. "maui revealed" decribes a few other beaches around and it is very accurate. Haleakala is worth the time it takes to get there. We drove up then hiked for an hour down. you can hike, bike , or horse back, but it is worth a look into the crater if you never seen one. bonus: we were there during whale season ( feb) and if you stand still for 5 min scanning the ocean you are sure to see one. One night fr our deck , they were so close we could hear them blowing! When snorkelling, if you are not in the surf, you can hear them calling each other. We will be heading back next year

Reviews.Title: “The Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Sunnandstars
Reviews.Content: Just this week we returned from our 10 day vacation to Maui. We stayed at The Marriott Wailea and had a nice time. We had no expectations as to what we might experience since we knew there was construction going on. It was alittle inconvenient to get to the "lobby" and front desk area. The noise was not a problem based on our location at the resort. My ONLY complaint is the housekeeping department. They were not friendly, less than courteous , cleaned at very odd hours and did just an ok job! (Never the right amt. of towels......no shampoo or conditioner, etc...little annoyances). Overall we had a great time............we enjoyed the friendiness of Joe at the outside bar...and Alex the pool manager........ Maui has alot to do and see............so we'll be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: LIBeachBum
Reviews.Content: I have so many awesome memories from this place that I don't know where to begin. We spent the 2nd part of our honeymoon here and it just blew away Waikiki Beach (the 1st part). It was exactly like how I had always pictured Hawaii. We spent a week in Wailea and the Marriott was the best place around. Other resorts seemed more crowded due to the lack of outside space but the Marriott had acres and acres of land to spread people out. The pathways along the ocean are right out of a movie. Beautiful scenery with gardens and extremely well kept grounds. The beach was amazing. There were many times during the day that we had the entire beach to ourselves. We'd pass the time drinking a few beers and watching the ghost crabs run from the water line back to their holes. The snorkeling was very good too! It was easy to get equipment, the hotel has everything you need right at the pool from masks, snorkels, flippers and even plastic cups for those drinks. When you start snorkeling, keep an eye out for things in the sand! I ended up finding 6 pairs of sunglasses down there, one of which I still wear today (the others were donated to some kids nearby). There were all kinds of fish to see and sea turtles were constantly around too. The one drawback is that the bar is not on the beach. You can walk up to it or just buy a cheap cooler and bring your own. Breakfast by the pool (which was included in our package) was the best way to start each morning. It was a decent sized buffet with the usual foods. The bar is in the same area and served the usual drinks (try the Kona Beer). We generally drove into Kihei for dinner where you'll find a large number of restaurants. There's everything from Mexican food to Thai and plenty of bars to check out too. Our room was facing the ocean and was amazing. It had the "wow" factor when you walked in. Very clean and simple with a deck overlooking the ocean for some great views of those Hawaiian sunsets. Speaking of sunsets... Make sure to go to the luau on the Marriott's property. Eating some great food and listening to some Hawaiian music is the perfect way to watch the sunset. I believe they only have the show twice a week so make sure to reserve your seats as soon as you check in. I can't wait to return to the Marriott Wailea. If it wasn't so expensive and time consuming to get there (we're from NY) I'd go every year. Have a great trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not a JW”
Reviews.Author: swan0299
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT hotel for families with young kids. We stayed at the Westin Resort in Kaanapali and much preferred the Marriott. We travelled with our 20 month old and had the time of our lives. That said, if you are going to splurge go to the Grand Waliea (we were VERY impressed when we walked over there); it makes the Marriott look like a category 3. On the other hand, if you get a deal (or stay for free as we did with points), you'll be very happy with the Marriott. Pros - BEAUTIFUL location!!!!!!!!!!!!!! True paradise in Wailea. Great kids' pool complete with sand and slides (zero depth entry fo even the tiniest kids) Uncrowded (even over Christmas). Upgraded to ocean view (again, for free!) Spacious, newly renovated rooms (enough space for our toddler's pack and play to be out of sight at night) Friendly and helpful staff Cons- This resort still has a LONG way to go if it's going to be a JW or compare to the Grand Waliea. The "little stuff" is missing. It needs paint touch-ups, better landscaping, etc. Not bad, until you see what true luxury looks like (Grand Wailea next door). Construction - Lots of construction is left; we were told by the staff that the entire pool area was going to be renovated (we were not told when this would happen). As of Jan 10, the only construction we observed was the complete remodel of the lobby. It looks like it'll be beautiful. Fitness Center - They ought to be ashamed! This "final product" does not even have a window. And, there are no mats to stretch on. Stay away from this room; run on the beautiful boardwalk instead (even in the rain it beats this room!). Bugs- I guess you can't do much about this, but we did have a few ants and what I believe were fruit flies in our room. I am sure they came in from the lanai. The staff volunteered to spray and reclean; we opted against this as we had the little one. Walking - This is not a con (in my opinion), but my dad didn't like how far he had to walk to get around. I say - bring your walking shoes (and stroller), there's no better place for a stroll! Wailea is BEAUTIFUL; have a great time in paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Rough around the Edges”
Reviews.Author: Phfaktr
Reviews.Content: This is a review from a Marriott Platinum member. I read a ton of reviews and have traveled and stayed at multiple Marriott sites. I do believe that whether or not someone likes/dislikes a particular resort is based on previous experiences and what one is looking to get out of a particular stay. My wife and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary in Hawaii. First in Oahu at the JW Marriott (see separate review) and then in Maui, at the Marriott Wailea Resort took our children (ages 10 to 21). Fortunately, the resort was not that crowded (we chose a good time to stay, Dec. 19-24). Unfortunately, we stayed here AFTER experiencing the luxurious JW Marriott in Ko Olina, Oahu. Granted, the hotel is still in the midst of its renovations (which really weren't that distracting), but this Marriott resort does not compare to the JW, even though it is the same category 7 â€“ this is really a mis-categorization. Check-in begins at 4pm â€“ we arrived at 5pm and there was only ONE person trying to check-in or service a short line of people â€“ unbelievable. The grounds are nice, especially near the entrance. However, as you move towards the back of the resort (towards the ocean), the resort has that 'motel' feelâ€¦one room after anotherâ€¦all the same. The renovation (as one might suspect) is taking longer than expected. In addition, I would say the 'workmanship' is just average. We had two renovated rooms (complimentary upgrade to ocean view), but on the ground floor. BIG mistake! If you like sleeping to the sounds of the oceans, then you are going to have to feel safe with the only thing between you and any perpetrator is a flimsy screen door (that doesn't lock â€“ not that that would make any difference!). Our room was just outside the nightly Lau, too. That gets old real fast. Inside, the rooms were clean. However, I am NOT a fan of just tile on the floor â€“ no area rugs or anything to absorb moisture or dirt. That means, if you get 'any' sand on the floor (imagine that), then whenever you walk around barefoot (say at night when you go to the bathroom), then sand sticks to your feet, and ends up in your bed â€“ be sure to use slippers (though I don't seem to remember any being provided). Since we did not feel comfortable sleeping with the screened door as our only means of security, we were forced to use a 'weak' A/C. I called the front desk to fix the A/C, but to no avail. The other room we had (for our children) had a great A/C, but needed additional repairs, which were taken care of promptly, except for the sliding glass door which would not lock. I appreciate a separate Shower and tub. Unfortunately, there was only a tub in our room. In addition, only the tub and toilet have a separate door. The vanity was not that isolated from the rest of the room â€“ hence hair drying can be obnoxious. On a positive note, their towels were oversized and fairly nice. My wife and I were not impressed with the beds â€“ we prefer more firm beds. Our kids, however, loved them. I hate feather pillows, too â€“ so had to request foam. The location is great, although the proximity to the Wailea shops is really no big deal since all the shops are high-end (e.g., Tiffany Co.!) You are really close to many other restaurants and shops, though. We spent a lot of time exploring Maui. Generally, I was underwhelmed with the resort. The breakfast buffet at $24/person was way over-priced. Fortunately, the only time we did the buffet were the days it was included in the price of our hotel room. We did not eat there for dinner â€“ too many other good places (e.g., Fred's, Humuhumuâ€¦, Polli's, etc.) Had it not been for using points, I'm fairly certain I'd be staying elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Beach, Great Service, OK resort”
Reviews.Author: kimlovestraveling
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (two girls ages 5 and 14) and my husband and I stayed at the Marriott Wailea for 3 nights on November 20-23. I have to admit, I was disappointed with the rooms and the look of the resort. We used 90,000 Marriott points for the 3 nights plus had to pay $75/night to upgrade to an ocean view. They did upgrade us to an ocean front room which was approximately 50 yards to the water. However, the water is not the beach but a cliff overlooking the ocean. When we checked in, they gave us a lei which was very nice. Then because our room was in Hale 7 (room 7400), we had to wait for a them to shuttle us there. Upon arriving at the room, I was very disappointed for a newly remodeled room. The decor was very basic and boring. The beds were low with white down comforters and pillows. Other reviews said the bed were the best, I find them extremely soft and uncomfortable. The floors were ceramic tiles and were not clean. Our room look out into a lawn area and the ocean. I got up early the next morning and walked grounds. A few steps to the left of our room was the Wailea beach. It's small but beautiful. The Grand Wailea sits right in front of the beach. I turned around and walked the other direction toward the Marriott toward Ulua beach which is only a few hundred yards from the Marriott. This is a bigger beach than Wailea beach and is very beautiful. It is great for snorkeling and I saw some great fishes there. The service at the hotel is excellent. The bell hops, concierge, and front desk were all very nice and attentive. However, if you ask for a deluxe ocean front room that is closer to the Wailea Beach, there is a $175/night upgrade fee. The resort is old and so the pool area looks worned down. The lobby is also worned down. If you are looking and an expecting a resort type hotel, you will be disappointed with the Marriott Wailea. For Maui, it's more of a category 4 hotel instead of a category 7. Since we only paid $75/night with our points, I am not as unhappy as if I was to pay the normal rate of $530 for the ocean front room. It's definitely not worth that rate. The resort grounds are nice but not up to resort quallity. Also there is a charge of $13/day for wired internet service. It's free at the Marriott Ocean Club. The plus of the location is it's near the Shops at Wailea and the two beaches. See my review of the Marriott Ocean Club for the next 5 nights of our trip. I would recommend staying there instead because the rooms and facilities are so much better.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST VIEWS”
Reviews.Author: ike7101
Reviews.Content: This resort is ABSOLUTELY beautiful! It has the most serene grounds with lounge chairs placed in excellent areas for afternoon naps or sunning or pure ocean view enjoyment. The pools are lovely. If you have kids, there is the BEST kid pool I have seen and the pool guy was even providing the Mommies with sunscreen! The grounds are HUGE and the hotel bell hops drive you and your luggage straight to your tower and then unload your luggage straight to your room! They even pick it and you up at checkout. This was a hassle free stay with us. The rooms were beautiful. The bed was a king and had enough pillows to satisfy a KING! The lanai was really large with both a table, two chairs AND a buffet that you could lay out breakfast on if you wanted. They offer their own Luau (we did not attend but it looked fantastic) and with the resort fee of $15 you could get discounts for it, your meals and the bottle of water that was in your room. Trust me, the complimentary water was worth it alone. Hawaii LOVES to charge you for a bottle of water. Like $4.50 for a regular one. And you will want it. Hawaii water is terrible to drink from the tap. BUT as a hint, you CAN melt ice in your ice bucket and it drinks a lot easier. Anyway, there are beautiful walking paths (concrete) that people would jog on in the morning or simply walk on. And you can go a long way! There is also a shopping mall walking distance with great shops and about 4 restaurants. The restaurants are spendy. Most average 25 - 50 dollars a person. But if you have a car, you can drive to Kehei and eat at all kinds of places for much cheaper. I recommend Freds. it is a mexican food restaurant that is a lot of fun! :) DEFENITELY would stay at this resort again. We paid a military rate of $150 per night and it was worth EVERY penny. Take good care of the bartender, Paula. She was really sweet.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Marriott Quality Resort”
Reviews.Author: PeeWee1
Reviews.Content: The location of this property is outstanding, however that is where the experience ends. We stayed 11 nights from November 2nd thru November 13th The morale of the staff is terrible. We were rarely greeted except when a tip was expected. Example when we were leaving the property with our bags, the walkways are wide enough for two to walk abreast, however when we were pulling our bags up the walkway, the path was blocked by a security person in their golf cart who was talking with another employee. Not only did he never look up, he did not move, when we asked him to move, the person he was speaking with moved closer to the cart, which still did not give us enough room to pass. At this point we had to ask again to please move the cart to give us room to pass, at which point he did, without ever even looking us in the face. This is typical of the employees at the Marriott. The price of 199.00 a night is just about what it is worth. Also, the room conversions are not done yet, while we did stay in a remodeled room (Hale 7) there are many in the area, which have not been completed. Tip.... They seemed to put almost everyone in the Tower. This is at the far end of the property near the hotel front desk, we did request, as well as others we spoke with, to be moved to something closer to the beach. They ended up giving us an ocean front room, overlooking the Luau. The only reason I can think of why they put their customers in the Tower is so that they do not need to shuttle the luggage to the other portions of the hotel. With the exception of Allen, the bell hops appear to be just going thru the motions, another bright spot was Steve at the pool. If your used to the "Customer is King" of other Marriott stays, you will need to lower your expectations

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Would go back in a heart beat!”
Reviews.Author: aliwnec10
Reviews.Content: Hi all! I recently got back from my honeymoon and i just wanted to fill you in on the Wailea Marriott. We stayed there Oct 9-15th and we LOVED IT!!!! The room was so nice (they just renovated) and the bed was the most comfortable thing i've ever been on. I wanted to take it home with me! Ha! I found the room to be extremely clean! They also provide you with a free refrigerator, safe in the room, and internet access for $12 for 24 hours. We absolutely loved this hotel. Yes it wasn't the Grand Wailea... but we liked that it wasn't. It was simply 4 stories high, their breakfast through room service was really good, and they're right on the ocean. Yes they are not directly on the beach. It is about a 2 minute walk to the beach on either side of the hotel but it's no big deal. The area is amazing and the marriott sits perfectly between the grand wailea and the marriott renaissance (4 seasons and fairmont right next to them). I will admit that the pool is nothing special, but when you're in maui... does that really matter all that much?!?! I would definitely go back to this hotel in a heart beat. It was perfect for our honeymoon and it was in a perfect spot!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel right by the sea”
Reviews.Author: Pointscollector
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights from 10th Oct. I was a bit concerned how much building work there would be but there was no need to worry. Check in was straight forward and we were allocated a room in Hale 3 and it was absolutely fantastic, newly renovated with brilliant view. Breakfast was not included but well worth the $22 approx that it cost. Would I stay here again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Don't forget you are in Wailea.”
Reviews.Author: miaent
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay starting 10/20/06. I was nervous about maintaining my honeymoon booking at the Wailea Marriott because of the negative reviews on Tripadvisor. My conclusion is different people will have different qualifications as to if the Hotel is good or not. It depends on what is important to you. Here is my wife's and I outlook: 1. You are in Wailea; An exclusive area unique to all of Hawaii. All the hotels are classy with the Four Seasons and Fairmont being part of the 5 hotels there. The Wailea Marriott is considered a Category 7 because it is in Wailea. It might not be rated as high if it was somewhere else. The employees are not top notch and the service is spotty. The pool is mediocre and there is sporatic construction you need to be aware of. Our first room was in direct line of jack hammer noise. I called the front desk and "politely" said it might be hard for us to relax. We immediately were changed to an ocean front remodeled room right on the boardwalk by the pool and ocean. The pool bar service is not classy at all and ends at 6pm (even though the bar is still open). The bartenders are mostly older and definately "working to live." I was very upset on the literal 3/4 shot measured $8 tropical drinks (not all poor as such). The bar, restaurant and pool service definately lack the employees that want to work up the hospitality ladder. They are nice, but not the type of nice and class you are going to get at the big city skyscraper Marriotts or the Grand Wailea. The spa's jacuzzi jets are often broken. 2. Our attitude is - Why would you work out in an indoor fitness center when you are in Hawaii? Get outdoors. That is why we didn't care about the make-shift fitness they have while they are doing rennovations. Also, we did not eat at the hotel restaurant one time during our trip. Get out! Goto Kihei, Lahaina or even the classy Wailea Shopping Center just above the hotel property. There are great stores and restaurants there. The hotel restaurant is definately not where you want to dine knowing all the great places around you. We didn't do any spa treatments during our visit, but our friends did. The Grand Wailea is a walk down the boardwalk and is a top 10 spa in the world. I am carrying on so let me cut to the chase. I would only stay at this hotel if you are using points or getting at least half off what you would pay at the Grand Wailea, Fairmont or Four Seasons. The renovated rooms are very nice. The hotel is in a great location right in the middle of two beaches (Wailea has 3 nice beaches that are public with the Wailea Beach in front of the Grand Wailea being the best). It is also right below the Wailea Shopping center that has everything from Tiffany's, Ritz Camera and convenience stores. If you are going to compare the service employees to the Fairmont, you are not going to enjoy yourself at all. If your attitude is that your hotel is just a staging place to have fun in the sun and enjoy everything Wailea and Hawaii have to offer, then this hotel is for you. It is a very nice property. Hopefully this review helps. Gosh knows I read enough of them prior to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott comparisons”
Reviews.Author: SoCal10
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights at three different resorts. The Wailea Marriott, the Westin and the Maui Prince. This was our first time at the Westin while we have stayed at the Marriott four times and the Prince twice. These are my comparisons on these resorts. Location: Westin is in the very busy Ka'anapali Beach area next to Whalers Village. Black Rock is only about 500 yards away. The Marriott is in Waliea, a quieter area, next door to the Shops of Wailea. The Prince is in Makena (couple of miles from Wailea) and is tranquil. Rooms: The Westin room is nice, but the smallest room I have ever stayed in (no closets). The beds are very comfortable. The Marriott rooms are being remodeled and are very nice and I thought their beds were better than the Westin. The Prince's rooms are a bit larger, but decor is old and the beds are hard. PS. (The best beds are still at the Westin Villas) Pools: The Westin has a giant pool complex with an adult only pool. Very nice. The Marriott has a separate kids pool area and a couple of pools overlooking the ocean. Okay. The Prince should be embarrassed with their pool. The pool in my backyard is almost as big. Beach: The Westin is on Ka'anapali Beach which is nice but the area by Black Rock in front of the Sheraton is better. The Marriott does not have a beach, but on one side you havve Wailea Beach and the other side you have Elua beach. The beach in front of the Prince is very nice with good snorkeling Service: Very happy with all three. Kids: The Westin had many families and there were lots of children. The Marriott had some children and the Prince had very few children

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners beware”
Reviews.Author: CTNYCTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days for our honeymoon. Here is a list of the issues: The hotel's gym/fitness center, if you could legitimately call it that, is horrendous. They have moved about 6 cardio machines into a guest room. No free weights or anything. The machines are old and make much noise. The room is small...very poor excuse for a fitness center. Spa was decent. I had an excellent aesthetician who worked very diligently and I had the best facial of my life. However, the Mandara Spa is not a spa. A number of guest rooms have been converted to spa service rooms. The service room I was in had a noisy inhabitant upstairs. Needless to say I wasn't fully relaxed. There is a LOT of jack hammering going on at the hotel. Mainly near the hotel pool and the hotel store. A number of routes to get to the lobby and hotel store were shut down and the elevators were temporarily out of service. So basically, you had to take the LONG way to get anywhere. The bathrooms are TINY. I wish I took a picture to show you. The toilet has about a one foot gap between it and the tub. If your looking for a resort with several food options, this is not the place for you. There is only ONE place open and it's the pool bar. The food was good, but still limited. Location was very good. Wailea shops right next door. This resort is not a beach front hotel, meaning you will have to walk a distance to get to the beach area. The pool was okay, but way too many kids, and I wasn't interested in that seeing as I was on my honeymoon. If you're okay with burning 5-8k on a room, seriously consider booking Grand Wailea or the Four Season. We regret not booking the Four Seasons, the resort is top notch. Yes, you'll pay through the nose, but they certainly go out of their way to accomodate your needs. The breakfast there is absolutely excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation spot ever”
Reviews.Author: SusannaP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 15th anniversary just last week. It was simply outstanding in every respect and we cannot wait to return. The rooms were very well appointed, great decor, and the best hotel bed I have encountered in my 50 years. (Is it a latex bed? It is not an innerspring mattress.) The views could not be more spectacular. BEST OF ALL, we could literally walk out of our lanai into the water to snorkel at our lesiure in just about the best coral reef on the island. That alone is worth the price of the rooms. The staff was invariably attentive and friendly. They are obviously well paid and well managed. The mai tais made by our bartender, Joe, were to die for. It would be hard to see how we could have found a better place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for $199 rate”
Reviews.Author: chrisallg
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay at Wailea Marriott. Great Hotel. This is our 3rd time staying here in 3 years. Booked the $199 terrace view rate and was upgraded to Ocean View at checkout. Everything thing was perfect. Very little noise.. normally only from like 10am til 2pm. Only drawback was the food selection as the restuarant open (pool one) basically only serves what is on the Room Service menu. Good food but selection is small. Best bet - Go to Shops of Wailea, there is a store called Wailers Village. They have a Breakfast deal that is $3.50. You get Bacon, scrambled eggs and either tater tots or toast. The amount of food you get is huge! Something like 8 pieces of Bacon and 30 tater tots and lots of eggs. Can easily be split by 2 people. This would cost you at least $15 at any resort. Another piece of advice. Beers at most resorts were at least $5.00. Go to Safeway and you can buy 30 beers for around $20. Saved $120 right there. Met lots of couples that had done this and bought a small cooler. We have stayed at the Kea Lani, Hyatt and the Wailea Marriott in the past on maui. We prefer the Marriott Wailea by far. Pools and restuarants aren't nearly as fancy as the others but the rooms and the grounds let you get so much closer to the ocean. Last part of our stay was in Lanai. I will try to post a report about this soon. All i can say is Lanai is the island we will be going to from now on for the majority of our stay. Loved the Four Seasons on Lanai, however the Wailea Marriott still has a better view as you can just take a bottle of wine(from Safeway) and sit right in the lounge chairs just 10 feet from the ocean and watch a fabulous sunset and the sea turtles playing in the waves. Try Mulligans, Mattaoes ( have to BYOB) but prices and atmosphere are great. Rented a Jeep Grand Cherokee from Dollar car rental for $238 for 7 days. Get out and explore the island. Drive 5 minutes south and you have Big Beach (1 of the best on the island). Drive around the the west Maui Mountains. Great drive and great scenery. Much shorter than rode to hana. Blow Hole was in action the day we went. If you have the time take the Ferry to Lanai even if just for the day. Spend $130 and rent a jeep from Eco Adventures and explore the island VIa 4x4 roads for hours. We went to a few beachs where we were the only people there. Literally saw maybe 10 other people on any of the 4x4 roads and we were exploring for over 8 hours. email me at it@boltonmga.com if you have any questions. Don't let any of the negative reviews about Wailea Marriott scare you away. Sure you can spend 2 or 3 times the amount per night but i would rather spend my money on activities or good dinners.

Reviews.Title: “not a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: steveed
Reviews.Content: We visited Maui in september 2006. The hotel is in a prime location with beautiful views and adjacent to the ritzy Shops at Wailea. The poolside restaurant serves a fine breakfast buffet and happily it was included in our stay since it would be quite expensive to dine there otherwise. There is a lovely Beach Walk that overlooks the ocean and leads to other resorts adjacent to the Marriott.
