There was a double sleeper bed sofa in the room, hot shower, cable TV, cold a/c (note most condos in Maui do not have a/c), small refrigerator and coffee maker (or tea) in bath area (this was a nice addition), granite countertops, marble floors in bath rooms (one roomy bath comprised of 2 rooms),in-room safe, lanai with table and chairs overlooking ocean, washer ($1.25) and dryer ($.75) in each building, daily (M-F)local paper delivered to the door. Breakfast at the Hula Moons Restaurant: buffet (w/waiter service) was included free in our package, the posted price:($22.95 pp). Champagne or Mimosa; HOT coffee or tea; made-to-order Belgian waffles (blueberry, macadamia and plain);chef cooked-to-order omelets; island and other fresh fruits; yogurt; breads, bagels, muffins, doughnuts and Danish; Fruit smoothies & 3 fresh juices; potatoes; bacon, sausage, eggs, cheese blitzes, pancakes, bread pudding, rice, several dry cereals, hot oatmeal and many other items too numerous to mention. All this seated at an open-air table overlooking the pools and picturesque Pacific Ocean. (or you can sit inside if you miss the city life). This breakfast was great, I think I gained 5 lbs from this alone! $15.00 per room Resort Fee: while no one likes to pay extra fees, this one didnâ€™t bother me considering the overall value. For $15/day + tax, you receive valet or self-parking (your choice), unlimited local calls, high-speed internet in central room (beats dial-up in the room) with 6 individual computers, free daily sunset appetizer, discounts on luau (very good show, but not worth the $74.95, we saw it from our lanai), snorkel/fin rental or scuba dive, access to fitness center. The WM Resort: Wonderful, sprawling, spacious and friendly. We visited the GW and the Four Seasons (â€œFSâ€�), just a few minutes stroll 2 and 3 doors down the coast from the WM, and they were nice and very polished at a â€œpriceâ€�. The lowest price at the GW or FS is at least double what I paid for a comparable room location. If you want to be really pampered and stay in high-rise buildings, next to lots of people with the closest hotel room multiple 100â€™s of feet from the ocean, then stay at the GW or the FS, we preferred the WM. . The WM is comprised of 3-story buildings Hale 1 thru 7, except for the one 8-story Haleakala Tower. It is nice that the WM has no sand beach immediately in front of the hotel. If you are familiar with Maui, the coast is mostly lava rock with short stretches of public sand beaches in-between. The GW and Four Seasons like most of the beachfront resorts are on PUBLIC beaches. So while you pay a price for location, you share it with the public and at most times in a crowded noisy way. There is a winding paved pathway connecting the Wailea sand beach (South of WM) to the Ulua sand beach (North of WM), guests jog and walk on this path. During our visits to GW and the FS we noted how crowded the beach and pool areas were, how many people were Nextelâ€™ing each other or talking loudly on their cell phones. We experienced none of this at the WM. You could carry your own chaise lounge, or plop onto one that is already there, to any spot on the 1000â€™+ grassy oceanfront overlook in front of the WM. We spent several mornings and afternoons on these lounges, after obtaining clean beach towels daily from the concession at any of the pool areas, with virtually no one within 50 feet of us. While lounging were entertained by a family of sea turtles (~2 feet in diameter) playing in the surf just in front of our room. A popular dive spot (known as â€œturtle townâ€�) is just off the hotelâ€™s coast, you can snorkel here just outside your room in the clear blue Pacific. The grounds are so spacious, you feel like the WM is almost your own private resort, figure thatâ€¦less price - more privacy. We guessed that most of the high-rise hotel occupants and public were at the crowded beaches, leaving the WM for just its residents that chose to stay there. We found each member of the resort staff to be helpful and very friendly, when you walked past an employee they always greeted you with a cheerful hello. Tips: Stock your refrigerator with your favorite beverages water from a local grocery. While on Maui, be sure to drive (best view from a convertible with the top down) the road to Hana to see: cliffs, waterfalls, beaches, towns, rainforests, and active pasture lands. Also visit the Haleakala Crater at sunrise or sunset, both are magnificent. Donâ€™t wait to enjoy the Wailea Marriot resort and itâ€™s true value, the deals wonâ€™t last long once the renovations are completed. We will be back even at the higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to Maui and found Wailea to be paradise. The area is surrounded by luxury hotels and the Marriott is by far the best deal. The lawns were lush and tropical, the jagged coastline mesmorizing, and the sunsets worth the flight over. We stayed 4 night at the Marriott and found the staff to be extremely helpful and friendly. As excited as we were to be there, they seemed to be as eager to tell us the highlights of Maui. We also stayed in Kapalua and found the staff to be much more pleasant in Wailea. The rooms are somewhat outdated but always clean. We didn't go to Maui for the rooms. The Wailea area is better than any of the pictures you see. The hotel strip is exceptionally clean and quiet. The shops located near the Marriott are upscale but also provide your typical chains. The Whaler General Store, located in the Shops, will provide you with a "to go" boxed lunch well under $10.00. The lunch's are similar to Einstein bagels or Panera Bread. We wished we had known about this sooner. The hotel food is expensive...especially for breakfast ($22.95/person). If you must pay this then eat late and skip lunch. The hotel is gracious to offer at least a complimentary breakfast during your stay. If you have rented a car there is a shopping area 5 minutes away that offer many American chain restaurants. We ate at the Outback 2 times just to save some money on food. The beach area is great for snorkeling. There are many trips to Molokini to see the turtles but we saw several of them when we went snorkeling at the Marriott beach. Same view and free. I would recommend a helicopter tour if budget allows. We traveled down the same waterfall that was filmed in Jurassic park. Also, the trip to Hana was beautiful. The tour group that we went with made my husband car sick with how fast she drove (621 curves to Hana). If you do it on your own, then you can stop and swim in the waterfall pools. A great memory to take home. As for the Marriott, it is by far the best deal in the Wailea area. The hotel was extremely quiet and caters to more of an adult crowd. Having the children area separate is nice for families with or without children. The infinity pool overlooks the jagged coastline. Not having a public beach directly in front of the hotel keeps the noise level down and the view undisturbed. Enjoy your stay at the Marriott... it won't always be the best deal in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “not pretentious, beautiful lawns, romantic ocean view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed At Marriott for 5 nights and the 6th night at the Grand Wailea Resort. My family of two teens and husband loved the down to earth welcome and feel of the resort. Grand Wailea was grand, cold, and larger than life but not a good feel for comfort. Grand Wailea was crowded, too many kids, and was not clean around water slides. Feces was found that would close down a Ymca anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Returned again this year, we Were Not disappointed! Stay May 22---29, 2005”
Reviews.Author: Bunky67
Reviews.Content: My husband, and I and our two children 9 and 2, just returned from a wonderful time at the Wailea Marriott. I was the one who just commented a few wks ago about the person who stated this was the 'worst condition' hotel. I stated then we were going to take a trip back, and we did. We just returned and we were NOT dissapointed. People who go to this hotel have to understand this is one of, if not the oldest resort in Wailea. It is going to be renovated (supposed to start June 05----July 06 I believe). And until then it is just fine. It doesn't have to be PERFECT paying the rates you pay to go to this resort. If you need perfect, go stay at the Four Seasons and pay 500 to 800 a night. But I won't pay those rates and would prefer to stay at a wonderful place where the staff are fabulous and things are very good. The beds really are the only thing I would complain about if there was anything I would complain about. They are taking all the beds out however and replacing them with really nice ones I have heard. And so, by next year there should be alot more 'comfort' when you stay at this resort. I have been told they are adding a childrens/tot area. And making the current pool that is for children, a 'teen' area. The adult pools I think will have changes as well. The renovations on the buildings I have been told will be starting with the 'tower' building. And also just so you know, the current 'restaurant' will also change. Half of the restaurant is to be the spa, which currently is just in part of one of the hotel room/buildings. So that will be nice for the spa to have a nice area for them. And the restaurant will expand over into where the bar area is now I was told. Not sure where the bar will be going. But I don't drink, so didn't ask about that. Just want whomever is contemplating to go over to Maui, this is a place where if you are looking for serenity, this is where you would find it. It never seems to be noisy whatsoever! We always stay in the Hale 2 building which is a low rise building.....only 2-3 stories. And is closest to the Ulua Beach which is really a great snorkeling spot. The rocky area out in front of the Hale 2 building is where a family of sea turtles reside. They are out there most anytime of the day you can spot one or two of them swimming around. Pay the extra money and get a 'deluxe oceanfront' room and you will see them from your balcony! My husband actually went out and saw a octopus and a turtle one day! Great place to snorkle! Now to address the 15.00/day resort fee which they have added since we last went to Maui last year. Actually this fee is GREAT! What we liked about it was that our childrens evening meals were INCLUDED---FREE in this fee. So they both ate supper completely free on the childrens menu. And it included a drink and a dessert! It was a wonderful thing! Also it includes valet/self parking. We used the valet as it was nice that my husband could just go with us instead of parking the car! Other things were included in the fee as well, like free appetizers in the evening. And other things we didn't use. But this fee was well used! And it was a bargain for us! This is a wonderful resort. Book a room and ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found the rooms, ground, and staff to be very nice. I would say that the rooms were not as nice as you would imagine when you drive in through the unbelievably beautiful grounds, but they were still very nice. I understand they will be rennovating soon. I think that is a good idea. Knowing that there are a few places in the area that have nicer rooms I would have to say that this hotel is above average to excellent, but not quite the cream of the crop. I think if the rennovations are top of the line, this will be a premiere resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “upgrades”
Reviews.Author: philllytraveler
Reviews.Content: After reading so many reviews about people being upgraded at no extra charge- it causes me to wonder...Stayed at Wailea Marriott last 5 days of our 15 day island hopping trip. On arrival because there was no upgrade offered we upgraded ourselves to what was supposed to have been a better room. It was rm700 end of the row with a pie shaped lawn ending at a wall with huge trees and no view at all. Went back to what we were suppose to get only to be given a room overlooking roofs of AC units. Had to settle for a room with two (2) double beds. We were told that the only other rooms with king size bed were in smoking. We specified nonsmoking, king size bed 6 months prior. This was our 2nd trip back to the Wailea hotel and we were celebrating our 40th wedding anniversay. I know they are going to have a 60 million dollar renovation, I am just hoping their prices won't be sky rocketing to the moon. Room service was excellent, breakfast buffet excellent with people friendly waiters and waitresses, registration and concierge services just ok, bellhop and valet services great. Had trouble at registration with room and mandatory $15 charge for valet parking, free internet service in a room with just 2 computers to work from unless your brought your own ,free daily appetizers which if you were not moving around and doing things would be appreciated. Reading reviews from people who have stayed there between Nov. 04 and Mar. 05 they make no mention of mandatory $15 fee. Hotel has good possibilities and a nice location. I will be keeping my eye on this hotel and hope they don't price themselves out of my desired price range for example their neighboring hotels. I wonder if their is anyone who agrees with anything I have written.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PatriceMy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of March, '05. Just loved this resort! The rooms were roomy and always kept clean. Loved the airy lobby. We didn't go in the pools much, but they looked great. The slide from the one pool to another was not in service though. Heard that this resort is renovating in April '05. I loved that the resort was not overcrowded. Ulua & Wailea beaches were both beautiful and just a short walk away from the resort. My husband did snorkeling here and just loved it! We really enjoyed the buffet breakfast every morning - fantastic!! We had dinner at Hula Moons once - very nice and romantic - good food. We had appetizers at Mele Mele lounge which were also good. I also loved the ocean view with the lava rocks - something you don't see every day. Also - there is a walkway along the beach to the other resorts (Renaissance, Grand Wailea, Fairmont Kea Lani, Four Seasons). It was great for strolls in the morning and evening. Staff was very attentive. No problems. Really enjoyed it - would definitely stay again!! Almost forgot - The Wailea Shops - they are a hop, skip and a jump away from the resort! It was just great to have such a short walk to shopping while my husband was golfing!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Hotel exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Anrmd
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a meeting held at the Wailea Marriott (held over spring break). Based on a number of reviews I had previously read I had significant doubts before arriving. Prior reviews had mentioned an old hotel, poor amenities, lizards, what have you. This hotel is in a fabulous location right next to the shops at Wailea. It has beautiful grounds, is well maintained (major renovations are starting in April), and offers stunning views of Maui, the ocean, and several neighboring islands. Classic outdoor lobby with a concourse of shops. This will be remodeled soon but is great even now. The pools are clean and well staffed but not opulent. If you must have free form pools with waterfalls, etc. try somewhere else. We liked to swim in the ocean and found the pools (including a kids pool with slides for our 8 year old) and jacuzzis to be just fine. The hotel is on a "lava beach" (with sea turtles visible in the water) but a very short walk puts you on the same beach that the Grand Wailea and Four Seasons use (it is public). For no charge you can take as many chairs as you need from a stack on the beach (you bring your beach towels down from the Marriott)- this is totally ok to do. For a fee you can rent an umbrella from a vendor at the beach. Our room was in the Haleakala tower (8 story building). We had a full ocean view. The room was clean, comfortable, very quiet, and everything worked. They will soon renovate this building (the rest of the hotel to follow) with new flooring, furniture, beds, etc. Our room was great even before the remodel. There are many ocean front rooms in two and three story buildings. These looked similar to our room and will also be remodeled in the near future. The restaurant only charged about $5 for the breakfast buffet for kids 8 an under- this is a very good deal and our daughter was very happy with the selections. We had dinner at the hotel on one night and we had fantastic lobster tails, a generous glass of wine, salads, and bananas foster- all very good. There are many great places to eat in the area. Mike W. was one of the concierge staff and he was fantastic. Friendly, enthusiastic, and was right on the mark with food and activity suggestions. I had a poor experience (our only glitch on this trip) with one other concierge but the hotel manager made things right. If you want to save some money on beachside food, order boxed lunces from the Whaler General Store in the shops at Wailea. You can call ahead. They have a full service deli. For about $10 you can get a sandwich, chips, small slaw, etc, giant cookie, and a soda in a nice box to go. My daughter enjoyed the kids club (twice). One of the activities was a nature walk to look for geccos (lizards). Despite what someone had written earlier about animals everywhere the kids only saw one lizard. I've seen more critters at upscale hotels in Palm Springs and Scottsdale. As for the two legged animals, I felt the hotel never seemed too crowded due to the nice, spatious lay out of the grounds. Anyway, I went from skeptic to fan of this property. I would definitely consider staying there again particularly after their pending upgrades. I don't know how much they will raise their rates but now they are a steal next to the adjacent properties mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Response to poster who said all rooms open to the outside”
Reviews.Author: Slinky1
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to respond to the person who posted that all rooms open to the outside. We stayed in the tower to the right of the lobby, about 5 or 6 floors up, and never once saw a lizard or bug. All the rooms open off of a hallway. The hallway is open-air, but none of the doors open directly to the outside. There are other 2-3 story units scattered around the property; perhaps that's what the poster was referring to. Although we didn't stay in one of those units, I could see how they might get lizards in the hallways there...they seemed more open. Also, it depends on your tolerance for things like that. My husband and I both love the outdoors and liked the "open-air" feeling of this property. If we saw a lizard, it wouldn't freak us out. We've seen lizards or geckos on trips to Florida and the Caribbean and just chalk it up to being in the tropics. We saw lizards on some of the walls in the hallway at the Hyatt in Kauai. (And these were not "hole-in-the wall" places either!) :)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: dionnam
Reviews.Content: My husband, 15 month old daughter and I stayed at the Wailea Marriott from 2.13.05 - 2.20.05. We relied on this site extensively when trying to decide where to stay in Maui and it was probably the best decision we made. Here are some of the highights: Location, Location, Location! There is no other resort in Wailea that is closer to the ocean than the Marriott, literally. As the oldest resort in Wailea, its developers definitely took advantage of the choice land available at that time. Our ocean front room was so close to the ocean that the sound of the waves lulled our 15 month old daughter to sleep every night while we sat on the balcony drinking mimosas under the moonlight. Shopping The brand new Shops at Wailea are a five minute walk away. Cuisine Breakfast buffet was great, we went every morning. The cost is $23.99pp so make sure to get this included in your package to save some money. Lunch was ok, menu was not very extensive. Drinks were verrry good. Service With a smile - all the time! Room service was never longer than 15 minutes. Housekeeping immaculate. Turn down service every night. Staff at the front desk, concierge and activities desk were extremely warm and friendly. Also, after you check in, depending on where your room is located you are transported via golf cart. Car Rental On site and five minutes away at the Shops at Wailea. We rented a car for three days of our trip. DEFINITELY RENT A CAR! Spa My husband had a oceanside massage which he didn't feel was that great. The spa itself was a bit lacking in the amenities but the menu was extensive. Of course there was no way that I was going to the Mandara Spa with the Grand Wailea Spa right next door. Girls, I don't care what you have to do to make it to the Grand Wailea Spa - just get there anyway that you can. The prices are about twice as much as everywhere else, but it is well worth it. You will definitely leave feeling like a new person. Beach There is no beach in front of the the resort. But both resorts on either side of the Marriott have decent beaches. We are not big beach fans so this was not a bummer for us. Kid Friendly Great kiddie pool with water slide for kids and adults. Wailea's Best Luau We had a blast! This is our first one so we don't have anything to compare it to. There were about 800 people and it was very well organized. The fire dancer was moving so fast that we got tired just watching him. The Luau is right on the premises and you can charge the cost to your room. Overall this is a great four star resort that in our opinion lived up to its billing.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mauisun
Reviews.Content: We just returned from ten days in Maui. Our last five nights we spent at the Wailea Marriott. We were greated warmly when we arrived and informed we had been upgraded from an ocean front room to a deluxe ocean front room. Upon arriving in our room the view was beautiful, but the room was a disappointment...very tired and the bathroom and dressing area were very small and dark. The plus side of this resort is the location and the grounds also the food is quite good. The minus side are the rooms, hallways, and the pool area. We had just spent five days at The Ritz Carlton at Kapalua so that may have caused some of our disapointment. The walkway in front of the hotels along the ocean is terrific at the Marriott. I understand the Marriott is going to do some renovating, if the rooms are improved, I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, lovely hotel, would stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: Slinky1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights on our honeymoon in November 2004. I can't say enough great things about this hotel. We chose Wailea, because we heard the beaches and snorkeling were excellent, and the weather in this part of Maui was always good. We were right! We pulled up to an open-air courtyard after driving down a banyan-tree-lined lane. The lobby is open-air, with views of Northern Maui from the veranda. The air was perfumed with fragrant tropical flowers. The staff was friendly and helpful...every staff member we encountered was smiling and relaxed. We were automatically upgraded to partial-ocean-view since we were on our honeymoon. We originally booked a garden-view room. The room was large and comfortable, the bathroom clean and sparkling. Partial ocean-view meant we could see the roof of one of the other buildings, but otherwise our balcony had a fantastic view. There are 2 or 3 pools on the property. One has a water slide and is popular with kids. The "adult" pools consist of an infinity pool (where we spent most of our time while not out sightseeing) and a regular pool. At the most, there might have been 40 people (total) around both pools. Not overcrowded or noisy or busy. Nothing lush or fancy like some of the hotels in Kanapali, but it suited our needs just fine. There is no beach in front of the hotel, just rocks, but there is a nice beach that the guests of this property can use right next door. We rented snorkel equipment from the guy by the pool, and drove to a few other beaches in Makena and Wailea for some excellent snorkeling. This hotel is not as "busy" as some of the other hotels which are popular with honeymooners. We visited some of the other hotels to see where we could've stayed, and it confirmed we made the right choice. I highly recommend it if you want a hotel which is a little "off the beaten honeymoon track" but lovely, quiet, and relaxed. We would definitely stay here again!! It was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Gillis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Feb 17 - 21 and loved this place. Had a Ocean Front room in Hale 2. Second floor - maybe 20 feet from the Ocean! Surf crashing all night was so relaxing. About 1 am the Full Moon would reflect on the water. WOW! Anyway details... The staff greated us nicely. Parking is $10 for Valet - $7 for self, I chose the Valet option. They checked us in, since my wife had some emails to send the next day, we opted for the $15/day fee to get the HighSpeed access and the free appitizers. Did not know about the open wireless network, will use that next time. We did not use all the other items as we bring our own snorkel gear and skipped the hotel show. They brought our bags to us, and gave us a bottle of Champaign. Nice standard Marriott room. Clean bath and linens. The sink area was nice, and an empty refrigerator to use to store snacks. Bed was Marriott standard - super rock hard. They had an announcement a couple weeks ago saying they are moving the way of the Westin and replacing all their beds, but until all Marriott hotels are updated, you know the kind of bed you get. The Bar was nice, the view of the sunset was fantastic. Breakfast buffet was ok, but I did not find it as good as some other $20+ hotel buffets. Dinner also tasted well the one night we ate there, but the price seemed a bit high for what you got. The drinks however were really good. Location is fantastic. The beaches were a stroll away, and the surf was great there. Grounds are beautiful. pool was clean, and the service was always top notch. The bell hops stopped to ask us about our day's travels and seemed genuinely interested. Even going so far as to compare their experiences with ours. Loved that touch. We will be coming back, and while it may not meet everyone's expectations, it sure met ours!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Maui and enjoyed our stay at the Wailea Marriott. The staff was great and very helpfull. We had a great room and easy access to both beaches. The wife liked just setting out in front of the hotel and watching the whales and the turtles right in front of the hotel. If you have a wireless device you can connect free at the east end of the reception area. There is a couch and table where the access is great. We will be going back to the Wailea Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but beware!”
Reviews.Author: Hankschu
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a part of Maui that is much quieter than Kaanapali. Overall, I would recommend the area and the hotel. Just a couple of caveats: This former Outrigger Hotel, we learned, is the oldest at the Wailea resort. The rooms and hallways and the like are a little tired. Don't expect to be wowed by the accommodations or, for that matter, the restaurants and bars. They're OK, but if you're used to some of the ritzier resorts at Kaanapali, well, this is just one cut below. Also, and this is CRUCIAL, there is a condo construction suite on the property just south of the Marriott. If you have a room anywhere near that part of the hotel, or even facing it, the view will be ugly and the noise unbearable. We had to move from the first room and taking a smoking room (fortunately, not too bad an odor) to get away from the construction. But I'm a Marriott platinum member; other folks might not be so accommodated. Ask for a room far, far away from the condo construction site. Also, they're supposed to start tearing this hotel apart and remodeling in April. Staff is great, grounds are pretty and clean. If you go, have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it”
Reviews.Author: bental80
Reviews.Content: On the surface, this is a fairly nice hotel, great location (right on the beach) and good value compared to nearby resorts. However, there are a number of problems. First, the entrances to all of the rooms are directly from outside with no doors. We frequently saw insects, rodents, lizards, etc., when going in and out of our room. Second, while some of the rooms have apparently been upgraded, others (like ours) are in bad shape. The mattress may as well have been cardboard and the sofa had stains from top to bottom. Just remember that you get what you're paying for with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: EZ_Pickins
Reviews.Content: I used the tripadvisor reviews to help select accomodations on Maui and have to say I am not disappointed with the information I gathered or the Wailea Marriot. My wife and I were there at the end of a fifteen day, three island visit last week. Our wants/needs are pretty basic; clean accomodations, everything in the room working correctly, helpful staff. To this end the Wailea Marriot excelled. When we arrived we were greeted by a bell person who unloaded our car and we were given the option of Valet or self park. When I asked they explained that I could do either at anytime. Check-in was quick and I was told that we had received a room upgrade to an ocean front room in the Hale Six building. The person checking us in explained that our room had been cleaned, but not verified, and we would have to wait while they sent someone to do that. We were there before the posted check-in time so this was not an issue with us but they were very appologetic for our delay. Ten minutes later our bell person was giving us a guided tour of the property on the way to our room from the oversized golf cart. He also provided good information on getting around the building in the rain. The room was spacious, clean, well appointed and everything worked as it should. The grounds were well maintained. The property is spread out over twenty+ acres and the buildings are built low so you don't have to wait for elevators or fight crowds. Very well designed layout with chairs and lounges distrbuted throughout the property for sun bating or Whale watching. There are shops, a fitness center and a spa on site for those who want them. There is shopping adjacent to the resort. The only dining we did at the Wailea Marriot was at the breakfast buffet in the Hula Moons restaurant. We were suprisingly pleased with the selection and freshness of the food and fruit they offered. Check-out was quick and before I was givin my bill the front desk attendant removed a local telephone charge that should not have been on there. As I said at the begining, our requirements are very basic. The Wailea Marriot exceeded those requirement without making us feel out of place. If I ever return to the Maui I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Luxurious, but nice”
Reviews.Author: NRT
Reviews.Content: This is a nice resort in a good location, with a friendly staff and some nice amenities. The rooms are updated and comfortable, but overall the resort is not luxurious like some of its neighbors. If you pay the rate for a garden view room (around $200) I think it is also a good value. On the plus side, the location in Wailea is good - right next to the Shops of Wailea and in between two of the better beaches. The food is good and reasonably priced (we had dinner poolside along with live entertainment a couple of nights - very nice). However, I think that some of the common areas (like the hallways, etc.) seem a bit dated and in need of fixing up. We had spent the first part of our vacation in Kapalua at the Ritz Carlton, and it was hard not to compare the two resorts. While the Marriott is nice, it simply is not in the same league as the Ritz for luxury and amenities. Also, Wailea seemed very crowded to me compared to Kapalua, which has a very relaxed and serene environment. Overall, we had a good experience at the Marriott and I would recommend it as an alternative to its higher priced neighbors if cost is a concern.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: During a week (Christmas), where it was hard to get a hotel room in Maui under $600/night and with no minimum stay requirements, the Marriott Wailea was a great value. Pros: - Nice/clean rooms, with refrigerators and porches. - Our room looked out over the pool and the ocean (some rooms are much closer to the ocean. - Nice entrance/lobby/grounds - 2 swimming pools, one water slide pool, 2 hot tubs. Nice poolside bar/restaurant. Pools look out onto the ocean - Well maintained lawns overlooking the ocean - Great location - Wailea is probably the nicest part of Maui - not too crowded, near an outdoor shopping center with very nice and high end shopping - Staff was very accommodating to some special needs Cons: - Not directly on the beach (need to walk a few minutes in either direction for a swimmable beach). - Some details weren't taken care of (we didn't have a room service menu in our room when we arrived, housekeeping only replaced toiletries when they were completely used up, porch furniture was dirty). - The hallways/corridors needed updating - While some of the concierges were very helful, some (one in particular) seemed to be more interested in selling guided tours than in the best interest of the guests (she tried to push 2 guided tours on us, we didn't take them and did the trips on our own - realized later that we would have completely different (worse) experiences on the guided tours). - Standing alone it's a very nice hotel, but compared to its neighbors, which are some of the nicest hotels in Hawaii (The Grand Wailea, Four Seasons, Fairmont), it doesn't look as great. But, overall we had a great time, didn't go into bankrupcy for this vacation, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing environment”
Reviews.Author: mknott
Reviews.Content: There are things about this property that are very nice. The location right off the beach is perfect. The nearby beaches are close and great with plenty of activities. The lobby and landscaping are beautifully "tropical Hawaii". But there are a number of drawbacks too. Their version of inroom internet access consisted of pluging in your laptop to their phones for dailup access. Their business center has 2 computers where they charge you $8 for 20 minutes. Parking is $7 for selfpark and $10 for valet. We had a room right next to the elevators and could hear them going up and down all night. Switched to another room which was better but the soundproofing of the rooms is very subpar for a 4 star hotel. Overall it was a very pleasant stay but I guess my expectations were a bit higher. I got 4 nights here through Priceline at $140 and some of those nights were peak season nights with little available occupancy.

Reviews.Title: “An Exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: BOWDY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wailea Marriott for our honeymoon November 18- 22, 2004. We were upgraded to a oceanview suite. This was far above our expectation since we had booked a standard room. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. Wine with cheese and cracker in our room upon our arrive. A champagne and fruit plate was send to us the next day. We had spent the previous 3 days in Ouah at the Waikki marriott and thought it was great until arrival at this property. This was definitely the best value for our money. The only disappointment was in the Laui. We went to the Laui on the property and it was not the greatest but the food was pretty good and the guest at our table made it very enjoyable. The property is within a reasonable driving distant from all the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Wailea Marriott”
Reviews.Author: sehar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wailea Marriott 11/27-12/4 for our honeymoon. I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in Maui. Upon arrival we were upgraded to an oceanview room and had a bottle of champagne waiting for us. We were also escorted to our room in a golf cart so we didn't have to carry our bags. I was very surprised we were upgraded considering we paid only $150/night through Priceline. The hotel is on a rocky coast with sandy beaches on both sides. The snorkeling right off of the resort is great and we saw turtles from the rocks. The Wailea Marriott is the oldest hotel in Wailea (about 30 years) but was renovated within the last couple of years (when it was an Outrigger). The buildings are low (3-4 stories comparied with the huge hotels nearby). While it isn't as luxurious as the Grand Wailea, we liked how the staff were very laid back and the resort was unpretentious. The one great thing about the Wailea Marriott is that the rooms are RIGHT by the ocean, whereas all the other hotels (Grand Wailea, Renaissance etc) are situated much further from the coast (the zoning bylaws changed after it was built), so you can actually hear the waves from your room. Staying in Wailea was also much better than in Lahaina/Kaanapali in my opinion. Much quieter and more laid back with a lot more privacy on the beaches. Also better snorkeling overall in the southern area. The Wailea Marriott will be undergoing a major renovation in 2005 and will be re-branded a JW Marriott (similar to the one on Oahu). This will bring the resort up to par with the other Wailea hotels. That will be a mixed blessing as we were very happy with the resort as it is now, and prices will be sure to increase. Overall a great trip and highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but not terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in in November. I would say compared to other hotels in this area, it is Average - nothing outstanding. It will alot nicer, though, than just about every other hotel outside Hawaii. I got this through priceline so I can't complain too much but I wish I got another hotel (Prince). PROS: (1) very nice location with great views of the Pacific (2) located next the to the Shops (3) hotel staff was nice CONS: (1) $7 self parking, (2) although this may be an isolated incident, the in-room high speed internet access was down periodically for 3 of the six days that I tried to log on. If I had a real business need to have internet access, this would have been unacceptable. (3) the filter in the A/C duct was filled with dust. It didn't look like it was cleaned for months. (4) "shared" beach

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at the Wailea Marriott”
Reviews.Author: SAS-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in November 2004 in a garden view room. We booked our room through Priceline for $150 a night and were very pleased with the room for that price. We found the service to be great and the staff was friendly. The room was a good size and clean. The pool area was nice and the service by the pool was very good. The grounds were very nice and the lobby area was better than I expected. The restaurant food was also better than expected and the service was fine. Would definitely recommend the hotel for the same price, but probably not if you had to pay the regular rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DT98
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 11/08/2004 - 11/11/04. We got our room via Priceline for $150/night. The room was a nice size with a sofa. We had a king size bed and overall it was clean and comfortable. The view was of the side of the hotel with lush trees but for the price, you can't complain. The pool area was nice with a great view of the setting sun in the infiniti pool. When we stayed, the Wailea area was very quiet compared to Kanapali. I really liked this area because it wasn't crowded and you had some small beaches you can go that wasn't crowed either. Wailea is also a good area to do the Snorkel in Molokini, Hana, and that HAke.... Vocano because they are closer from here.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Wailea Marriott Maui after a five nite stay. The resort is in a great location on South Maui. Located on a point of land overlooking the Pacific, with beaches within easy walking distance on either side. Stayed in Hale Two which is closest to the ocean. Had a nice partial oceanview from our room and a view of West Maui Mountains and nice gardens too. However, the room itself needs some upgrading. The carpet is dirty and worn and the furniture is quite old and worn too. Found that out after wearing white socks in the room. The bed itself was nice and comfy. This resort is very close to Shops at Wailea, basically within walking distance which is a real bonus. The hotel staff was very nice and accomodating. Parking used to be free at this hotel but changed to pay parking in October of 2004. Pools are somewhat small but never seemed crowded for some reason, even thought the hotel was totally full due to the Nissan Xterra World Championship being held during our stay. Pool furniture was dirty especially the small tables and chaise lounges. I would rate this hotel a 3.5 out of 5 for the fact that the room is in dire need of updating. I would say if you can get a rate of less than $200.00 per night I would recommend this resort. FYI This property is going to become a JW Marriott so renovations are definitely going to happen here in the near future which this hotel badly needs. That also means the price of the room will increase substantially. When compared to its neighbors i.e. Four Seasons, Grand Wailea and Renaissance this hotel is actually a bargain on South Maui. Also, rumor has it that the Renaissance is going to become a â€œWâ€� Hotel. Stay tuned.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Excellent! Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: yc999
Reviews.Content: bWe spent our honeymoon at this resort from 10/14/2004 - 10/22/2004, and it was a great experience. Upon arriaval, we got upgraded to an ocean view room right away, and received Champain and basket for being on our honeymoon. The service was very attentive, I had an awful experience of having my purse stolen, but the resort staff was very helpful, and helped me out with contacting police dept. e.t.c. we were able to put the bad experience behind us in a matter of couple hours, and we enjoyed our stay so much, I would recommend everyone for this resort. SO, DON'T leave anything valuble in the car at all. First of all, the location: Wailea, south maui. it is a bit quiet comparing to Lahaina. The resort sits between Renaissance Wailea Beach Resort and Grand Wailea. Although, there is no beach right in front of this resort, but it is 3 min walk to the 2 nice beaches on either side of the resort(Ulua and Wailea beach), depending which side of the resort you are on sice the resort covers a lot of ground. We stayed at Hale 6, it is closer to the Wailea beach, which is in front of Grand Wailea. It is walking distande to the Wailea Shopping center too. Another nice thing about this resort is that they don't nickle dime you at all. NO resort fees($15-$20 per day charged by other resorts). Although there is no lavish pool complex here, but they have a very nice infinit pool right next to the ocean, very nice for sun set. Food, expect the regular resort price, but it was very good. We usually make trip to Keihi, and there is a lot of variaty overthere, I like that Saisei Sea food and Sushi place. anyway, it is great place to stay, you won't regret it. Oh, I got my package through priceline, by booking a flight+Hotel package, which gives us around $150/pernight.... GREAT DEAL.

Reviews.Title: “Great! You won't be sorry!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Heaven on earth! We were treated royally - upgraded upon check-in to oceanfront, and then presented with a gift basket of goodies compliments of the General Manager. Rooms were spacious, clean and beautiful. The view was amazing. The various pools were great, especially the oceanside pool with a great sunset view. Also, the kiddie pool was a blast, even for the adults - all sorts of slides and waterworks. The property is huge, with the beach actually at the adjacent Grand Wailea next door (about a 3-minute walk). The on-premise restaurants were pretty good, although the wonderful buffet breakfast was somehow a little better at the Waikiki Beach Marriott. Also, the bedding was much more luxurious at the Waikiki Marriott. Still I would rather be at the Wailea Marriott for the more beautiful natural surroundings, and the relaxed atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited the hotel the first week of October. The staff are friendly and very talkative and the serive is excellent. The surrounding grounds are beautiful and our ocean room was very clean and quite large. I would recommend this hotel especially because there is a shopping centre nearby with good restaurants, but if you are looking for a busy vacation with loads to do, look elsewhere. The staff were saying it is being upgraded soon so check to make sure it is not going on while you are planning to visit. Wonderful place would go there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot- Esp compared to prices at neighbor hotels”
Reviews.Author: CapiCatalina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for a wedding in Wailea. We ended up going with this property because we are part of the Marriott Rewards program. The price was about $200 a night- which was a little more than if we rented a condo in Kihei. But, when we checked in early, they gave us an upgraded room that was ready & we were very happy with it. Also, we got a ton of points which ended up being about $30 off per night for the trip. We looked at the Grand Wailea & Four Seasons, too. The prices were too much for us, it didnt make sense to go there while the Marriott was right next door! Everyone goes to the same beach, same views. We were worried about a lot of kids running around - we are in our mid 30's, no kids- and we had no problems in that regard. It was a beautiful time. The property was so nice. The staff was really cool to us, we really really enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegan
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a stay at the Wailea Marriott. This was our second trip to Maui this year. On our previous trip, we had intended to stay here but were talked out of it by our travel agent, who said that the beach in front of the hotel was very dangerous for kids and not very nice. It's now obvious that she knew nothing of this property or the one she actually recommended where we stayed in April. We travel to a different island destination each year with our now 4 1/2 year old daughter. My husband loves to snorkel, and our daughter loves the beach and being in the pool. At the Wailea Marriott, we found something to make everyone happy. They have 2 fabulous beaches, one on each side of the resort. My husband enjoyed being able to snorkel without having to drive anywhere, and my daughter enjoyed the many pools on the resort grounds. The kiddie pool area is perfect for small children, and there are even 2 different water slides that can be enjoyed by both little kids and big kids (daddies). The staff at the hotel provided the friendliest service that we have experienced. Everyone was exceptionally pleasant, especially the restaurant staff, who learned our names by the 3rd day, along with my daughter's favorite foods. Everyone went out of their way to make our stay there enjoyable. The location of the hotel is ideal for a family. There's a beautiful, upscale shopping mall across the parking lot with many restaurants to choose from. The sunsets from the hotel lobby, with a view of several other islands and Molokini, were the best ones we've seen on Maui. The only thing keeping me from rating this resort "excellent" was the selection of food available through the hotel restaurants and room service. We expected the high prices, but were disappointed by the lack of variety on the menu. My daughter didn't enjoy any of the items on the kids menu, and their desserts were substandard. All in all, we would highly recommend this resort to anyone thinking of visiting Maui. This is one destination that we will return to again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved our vacation in Wailea. The Marriott staff were very friendly and helpful. Our "garden" room was upgraded to a suite with a view of the ocean at no charge. We can't wait to go back. The Marriott is in an excellent location - within walking distance to upscale shopping and a ten minute drive to grocery/strip malls if you need toiletries/souveniors, etc. The hotel has two beaches - one shared with the Four Seasons and Grand, and a less frequented one. You can almost choose how secluded/included you want to be. If you can't have a good time here... you're too spoiled!

Reviews.Title: “Not Marriott standard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: So unhappy, I moved to another hotel. Yes Maui and the grounds are pretty, but the place is run down, tired and honestly dirty. The staff was nice, and when I checked out early, the front desk clerk very politely understood and said to me that a 60 million dollar renovation is scheduled. Apparently Marriott recently took over this place-they should keep their name off until finished. The carpet was filthy and the sofa in the room was also a mess. And I had an oceanfront deluxe room and the price I was paying, it was inexcusable. Mini fridge not stocked with honor bar-room service slow and food terrible. Beware

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited Aug 24-31 2004. Service at this hotel was superb throughout! Grounds and rooms manicured and spotless. We were upgraded to Oceanfront (Hale 7 is the best building!) at no cost! The layout of this hotel was a nice change from the typical "high rise" style. Despite the reviews I had read...the beach was a one minute walk from our room. We watched the luau from our balcony nightly and also saw a great fireworks show above the ocean from our balcony on Sat night. Hula Moon's breakfast buffet was nice and a good value when compared to the prices on the menu (buffet $19/person). The resort was very serene and uncongested. Pools were not elaborate but nice. Everyone was extremely friendly and shared great recommendations for restaurants and activities all over Maui. I recommend the Kihei Cafe for breakfast (very casual). The best sushi can be found at Sensai (great prices/excellent service). Mama's Fish house was very good...but pricey. Best salad was at Cheeseburger's in the Wailea shopping mall. VERY casual, local spot for happy hour with great prices on drinks was a little shack on Kihei Blvd. called Lifes a Beach. BEST Italian Food/ huge portions is Marco's in Kahului.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: Liacelti
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an 8 day stay at Wailea Marriot and loved it! The property was beautiful and had a gorgeous view of the ocean. Everything was very spread out and it wasn't crowded at all. There was a fantastic beach two minutes away. We went all over the island and didn't really find a better beach for just wading and swimming-there are no big waves. The rooms were good for what we needed-we had a small fridge in our room, housekeeping service was excellent and we had a laundry room right near us which was handy. The ocean view was marvelous. We had to spend more time travelling to places since Wailea was a little out of the way but it's well worth the extra drive. For just winding down, if you just stayed at the Marriot every day and used their facilities that would be enough. Just a note-The town of Kihei has cheap places to eat and shopping centers where you can buy food and supplies at a reasonable price. The road to Hana is beautiful but a hairy drive and will take 11-12 hours. I would recommend a tour to Mt. Haleakala because you would have to get up very early to see the sunrise and the roads wind alot. Have fun:)

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: redsilk78
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent!!! My husband and I went for our honeymoon from July 26th through August 5th of 2004. We had a great time at the hotel. The staff is so helpful and friendly. This hotel gives you the ultimate hawaiian experience. We checked out the larger hotels in the area and were unimpressed with them. Sure they were glitsy but too big. If your like me reading through the mixed reviews, listen to mine and all the others that were positive and you will not go wrong. Others seem too pickie with their hotel stay. The parking is free, upgrades are free, if available, buffet breakfast was great. It saved us money. Go to Foodland in Kiehi and get groceries to stock your fridge with for lunches. That saves alot of money too. Ask them at foodland for a discount card. They will give you a temporary one so u can get the sale prices. The hotel is undergoing another renovation this fall and by next summer this place will be extra fabulous I'm sure. The views are breathtaking. Ask for a room on a high floor and you cannot go wrong. Dinner at the hotel restaurants during sunset were the best. I cannot say enough about this hotel. Its beautiful, and its staff is great. We hope to return for our 1 year anniversary. Please don't let the other little negative comments left in these reviews shy you away from this great resort. It is worth every penny and then some. Hope you all enjoy your fabulous vaction at this hotel in Maui cause we sure did. We miss it so much and cannot wait to go back. Enjoy every moment of it!!

Reviews.Title: “relaxing, beautiful setting..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent our anniversary at Wailea Marriott 8/21-28. This place is perfect for romance,relaxation. Terrific beaches within a 5 minute walk. If you're a couple wanting peace and quiet, great place. The kids pool is in a separate location of resort, from main pool area. The resort was close to full,and a conference was going on.....but we never felt like the resort was bustling or saw lots of traffic. The service was excellent from check-in to valet. Staff was friendly and helpful. And yes!! we were upgraded from garden to ocean view,plus received complimentary champagne. We did walk by the other resorts in Wailea while on the ocean side walking path (a terrific plus), yet what I noticed was that the other resorts were very busy/noisy. We loved the quiet , the beautiful grounds, lots of flowers and greenery, plus (I think) the best ocean views. We'll be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Maui. We stayed at the Marriott for 5 nights. The hotel is clean and well maintained. The staff were very helpful, reponsive and friendly.The hot tub is HOT, there is a nice swimming pool overlooking the ocean. Please note the property does not have its "own" beach but rather one has to walk to next door properties (a 45 second walk but I am sure some spoilt tourists will complain). There is a great spa on the property. Parking is FREE. We got a great package deal through Aloha airlines. If you want peace, quite and tranquility this is the place to be. I do not play golf but there are some great looking golf courses a short walking distance away.There are on site laundry services, there is a mall 1 min walk away with three great restaurants in addition to the hotels own eating places. The hustle and bustle of Kihei is a ten minute drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 days here with our two kids, aged 8 and 5. I had read all the Tripadvisor reviews before booking and it seemed like the most bang for the buck in Wailea. When all is said and done, I don't think I got that great a deal through expedia.com for air/hotel/car, but the Marriott experience was lovely. The grounds, as everyone has mentioned, are gorgeous. I requested an upgrade from the mountainview room I had booked and was told that the hotel was too full to accommodate the request, so I was bummed. However, when we awoke in the morning we were stunned to discover that, indeed, we had been given an oceanview room, and a lovely one at that! That immediately put me in a good mood. The kids loved the pools and the beaches. I would second the complaint about no shade around the pools. I can't understand why they wouldn't plan that better. The sun was brutal and there was really no escape at the pools. The other thing I found odd was that none of the beaches and none of the resorts had lifeguards. Our package came with the breakfast buffet at Hula Moons, which was a fine thing until my 5 year old son said, "Why do we have to go to the same place every day?" It did get a little old. The luau was horrible, as I expected it would be, but I suppose it's something you gotta do once. My kids were fairly traumatized by the sight of the dead pig, but enjoyed the dancers and the fire guy. The luau food was as appallingly bad as I had been prepared for. The pina coladas were good, however. I was a little jealous of those staying at the Grand Wailea, the Four Seasons and the Fairmont as we strolled the oceanfront walk, but on the whole we had no complaints about the Marriott. And the sunsets are gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wailea Marriott for 4 nights July 17. The hotel was pretty full, and we arrived at 8:30Am at the hotel after an early morning flight from HNL. We had three rooms. One was available right away (upgraded to an ocean view room), the second one was available at noon, and the third one at 2:30PM (upgraded to a partial oceanview). The hotel grounds are beautiful, th staff is exceptionally friendly and attentive, and the Wailea location is excellent. The children loved the slides in the children's pool. Despite the hotel being full, it did not feel that way. Hula Moons restaurent buffet breakfast is the typical hotel breakfast buffet. We had a dinner there. The food was alright, however the service was exceptional. One person from our group had indicated to the hostess that it was our wedding anniversary, and the entire staff seemed to know! The dessert bar was our children's favorite. The person at the dessert bar, Sam, was specially kid-friendly (each dessert is served on a personalized plate -- Aloha (your name)). The beach at Grand Wailea is nice. Overall, a great experience, we would no tmind reliving!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon In Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the outrigger marriot for our honeymoon... It was great!!! we we're upgraded to an ocean front room right away, and had chocolates on our bed everytime after room service. The Staff was very helpful and friendly, the grounds we're clean, and the food was great. If we had to sight a downside, it would have to be the hula moons restaurant, while the food and staff are excellent there, the have birds that fly in and out of the restaurant because the restaurant sits right at the water, so the birds tend to travel in and out at thier leisure, but strangely enough the don't bother you while eating unless you feed them. I thought it was cute and different, although my wife had other ideas. We've already booked our next vacation back at the same place for january to watch the whales. Great value... Very Satisfied!!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre "resort"”
Reviews.Author: txlonghorn95
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a decent hotel given the $155/night rate I obtained via priceline.com. I bid the category of "Resort", which the Marriott is not deserving of. It's hard not to have a pretty location in Maui, so the grounds were up to par. There is no beach immediately at the hotel but there are swimming beaches on both sides of the resort. Fairly good snorkeling at Elua Beach just to the right of the hotel's waterfront, although the sand kicking up made the water a bit cloudy. The bed was springy, pillows too fluffy, A/C did not dehumidify the air so it still felt hot even though it wasn't. Overall, the room was clean, spacious, and furniture was decent though not "resort" quality. It's what I'd expect at a Courtyard by Marriott, not a resort. Bathroom had a fridge and decent sized counter/sink area separate from the toilet/shower. Cable TV was about 25 channels, had all the basics you'd expect. Pool area was OK - although absolutely NO shaded areas to enjoy the fresh air and scenery without a sunburn. Pools were very small for the number of guests staying at the resort. Parking was FREE, which was a welcome treat. Local calls were $1 and food at hotel restaurants quite pricy, but we bought beer/water/snacks/sushi/cokes/bread/etc at the grocery store and utilized the local Quiznos and Maui Tacos down the road for cheaper alternatives. I think Hawaii is overpriced in general, but given the going rate, I was satisfied with my stay for the priceline bid of $155 a night. (I would be upset if I had paid the $290/night they wanted on marriott.com.) This doesn't mean I'd go back though - now that I've been, I'd rather spend my money going to an island in the Mediterranean or Caribbean over Hawaii. Bottom line - if you can get a good deal, it's decent and clean. If you expect a resort, stay somewhere else. I visited the Hyatt at Kaanapali - now that's a resort. The Marriott doesn't come close.

Reviews.Title: “I could not have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After weeks of researching our tropical vacation we passed up Aruba, Cancun, and Los Cabos for Maui. We decided to stay at the Wailea Marriott Outrigger and both our choices, Maui and the Outrigger, were perfect. My girlfriend and I went to celebrate my birthday and our aniversary. We let the staff know and we were upgraded to an ocean front/ocean view room. The room was clean and the fridge was very handy for drinks and snacks. The room was fine for our needs, afterall we were out on Maui most of the time, and if we were at the room it was either sleeping or enjoying a drink on the balcony. I could sit there for hours with the perfect view. The staff was very friendly and the onsite dining was the best we had on maui. The Luau is incredible, just ask the bartender to make your drink a little stiffer and they will. Wailea beach, one of the best in Hawaii, is a 2 minute walk. Maui is the perfect choice because you can just get a rental car and see everything, volvanos, cliffs, rainforests, waterfalls, and beaches without a worry. Best vacation ever.

Reviews.Title: “huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: aloha2004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were honeymooning and stayed there after reading such good reviews, but we were very disappointed. There was no upgrade, no basket of goodies, etc although it was not owed to us it would have been nice. They also kept calling my husband by my maiden name, since I booked the room. We asked for them to stop calling him that and it was never corrected, we were very upset. Our room faced the lobby where there was excess noise, although it was clean. But we felt like we were staying in a econo lodge instead of a 5 star resort. And to top it all off we were billed when we got home for a day of valet parking that we didn't use. It's $5 a day and after the 1st day we didn't want to pay. We left the most awesome resort on the big island where it was a true resort and free valet, so maybe we were a bit spoiled. I would never go back to this hotel, ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wailea Marriott for $125/night for the nights of 5/29/04 and 5/30/04. We booked it through Priceline. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. We received an ocean view upgrade upon check-in without asking. The hotel is beautiful. It's not on the scale of the Grand Wailea or Kea Lani, but it's also not as "overdone" as those places. The Marriott was just our style. It was clean and nicely maintained and the service was great. The food is good, but the location is such that one can have lower priced meals within a short walk or drive. The only complaint I have is that the pools are a bit small, especially when one is sometimes closed for various reasons. We wanted to come back from the beach one afternoon to lounge by the pool, only to find a crowd of drunken partiers there making a bunch of noise and taking up over half of the pool area. We couldn't go to the other pool because it was closed. We had two choices. 1 - stay and tolerate the riff-raff, or 2 - leave. We chose the latter. Other than our pool experience, the place was great. We would stay there again, especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 30th anniversary at the Wailea-Marriott. Travelplex in Louisville booked our entire trip and it was great. The Wailea-Marriott hotel is one of, if not the best, I have ever stayed at during our 2 visits to the islands. Our stay started out on an up note and didn't stop. We were upgraded from a ocean view room to a ocean front room, at no charge. Ocean front it was, as we were 30 feet from the lava rock shore/water, with a view of Lana'i, Molokini and the volcano. The sand beach was about 100 feet away and was one of the best beaches on Maui. We received a complimentary bottle of champagne, a canvas tote bag and coupon for 2 free Tee-shirts (no purchase necessary). Everything about the Wailea-Marriott was top class. The buffet breakfast was great along with the view. The shops were the best known everywhere and was a very short walk from the hotel. The hotel-services booked our anniversary dinner at our requested restaurant, the Sea Watch Rest. and gave us each a complimentary dessert. This wasn't a single dip of ice cream, but a brownie fudge cake with ice cream that was so large we could have split one. During our trips around the island we checked out some of the other hotels and I didn't see any in the same price range that I would have trade for. I highly recommend you stay at the Wailea-Marriott. Our stay on Maui was great. I thought I had everything planned out to a T, but somethings took a little longer than planned and others not as long. So feel free to email me (sdf1bxg@ups.com) if you need suggestions on where to go and how long it takes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: TMM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent to weeks in Maui. The first week we stayed at the Marriott Outrigger (April 23-30, 2004) and we found it to be quite nice. We got a nightly room rate of $135 on Priceline.com. (very cheap rate!) Upon our arrival we were very impressed with the exterior of the hotel and love the open air lobby. We were greeted with flower leis and appreciation for choosing the Marriott. At check in we were given free postcards and told if we returned them to the desk after writing them postage would be applied free of charge. After we were checked in we were whisked to our room in a golf-cart like carrier. We were upgraded from a standard garden view room to a partial ocean view because we were on our honeymoon. Our room was located on the ground floor and from our outdoor patio we could see the ocean which was nice. We were also given a nice bottle of champagne and a lovely gift basket filled with Hawaiian cookies, chips, etc. The room was quite big and well-appointed. The pool area was great and we loved the cocktail lodge which has a great view of the ocean. Self-parking is free and there is a laundry facility which was small, but useful. There is also a workout room which was always empty when I went and has very up-to-date modern equipment. We had a few disappointments, but nothing that would spoil our stay. Our fridge was often on the brink (nice to have as we bought lots of bottle water and snacks) and there were a few more bugs in our room than I would have expected. Though the room was nice, it was very standard and could use some The location of the hotel is excellent (right next door to the Shops At Wailea). I cannot recommend the food. We had the breakfast buffet once and was not worth the $19.95 per person. We ordered room service once and it was only okay (nice burger, but very cold fries). One thing worth mentioning (which we felt was a nice touch) was we were invited to a Manager's Reception. It lasted for an hour. We mingled with the manager of the hotel and other company VPs. They were very interested in how our stay was going and what we did and didn't like. Free cocktails, appetizers and lovely little bit size deserts were served. If you are looking for good value for money then the Marriott might be the right place for you.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME”
Reviews.Author: Jbuffett
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wailea Marriott from Oct 2-9 2003, and we loved it!!! Our 4 year old daughter got sick on the flight over (another story) and she again got sick just as we pulled into the valet area. One of the employees saw this and ran to get cold towels, and insisted on cleaning up her mess. We won't forget that kind gesture for a long time. The resort is gorgeous, with an aweome beach walk that is not crowded. There is an excellent night time entertainer, who sings beautiful Hawaiaan music. Shopping is nearby, and we fell in love with Cheesburger in Paradise which is a quick walk away. The pools are not crowded, and the kids area was great, as there was a sand bottom area for the real little guys. (our 2 year old could have stayed in there all day) There are a ton of sea turtles around the area, and we snorkled with a family of 3 for about 30 minutes. Plenty of watersports are a walk away. We are planning a return trip to the Wailea Marriott in March 04.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I found a great deal on the internet for this resort. We had an amazing time. The resort was beautiful. Much more then what we expected for the price. The pools were great and the beach is great too. You can snorkel out and see fish right off the beach. The grounds are beautifully kept the scenery and views are amazing. My dad is not one for just sitting around relaxing, but the atmosphere commands it. We spent one afternoon relaxing on the beachchairs on the ocean cliff watching whales and dolphins swim by the entire day. It was AMAZING. The room was perfect too, but who cares about the room when you're in Hawaii?

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: richp5
Reviews.Content: Visited Maui from March 27, 2004 thru April 5, 2004. Split stays at the Westin (1st half) and the Wailea Marriott Resort. Perhaps we enjoyed our stay more as we compaired it to the Westin. Positives: Nice size, clean, updated (and received an upgrade to oceanview) rooms. Quiet , relaxing atmosphere. GREAT seafood buffet. No resort fee. Boys (8 & 11 yrs) enjoyed the kids pools with two different waterslides - one long meandering kinda slow (picks up speed as you add the pounds) and one five second tunnel drop into a 9 ft pool (a rush for all). Typical Maui hotel prices for meals, drinks, etc. (vending machine sold can soda at $1.00 vs the Westin $2.50). Close walk to mall shopping. Two beaches on either side of hotel are great for boogie boarding but found a great snorkel spot on the hotel grounds between the two beaches (turtles!) that wasn't listed anywhere. The Grand Wailea next door appeared to have more slides/kid things to do but was booked therefore our stay here. Negatives: none really. This was our 11th trip to Maui - will be going again in October and will check out Kea Lani & Grand Wailea as we prefer south Maui (liked Embassy & Black Rock however).

Reviews.Title: “The Wailea Marriott Luau”
Reviews.Author: mom2thrie
Reviews.Content: We went to the luau during our stay at the Wailea Marriott, an Outrigger Resort. We were traveling with children aged 1 1/2, 4, and 5 1/2. This was our first luau, so we have no basis for comparison. It was definitely entertaining, and we all enjoyed the hula performers and the fire dancer. There is no charge for children under 6, so we appreciated the price break. However, we found the food to be poor. This was definitely the worst meal that we ate on the island. Buffets are common at the hotels on Maui, and are usually fairly good. At $69.95 per adult, we were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay (with twin 2 year olds)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Wailea Marriott. We were there for 2 weeks and just got back a few days ago. We loved the resort. The rooms were nice, clean standard hotel rooms and the in-room fridge was great to have. A little more storage room and a microwave would have been nice. The breakfast buffet was included in our package and was phenomenal -- we felt lucky to be able to eat at the buffet each morning. The staff treated us very well and always greeted our two-year olds wherever we were on the resort -- but especially at Hula Moons for breakfast. We ate in our room for lunch most days and went into Kihei for dinner most nights. We spent lots of time at the Wailele Waterpark and our girls loved the sandy tots pool. We also used the gym and found it handy and well equipped. It was a bit of a pain walking to Wailea Beach or Ulua Beach -- it would have been nice to have had a beach right out front but it was a good tradeoff to have the pool nearby. We booked an oceanfront room and ended up receiving what we considered to be an oceanVIEW (with two big palm trees in front of our lanai) with clearly audible construction noise next door. We asked to be upgraded and were put on a waiting list but when I went back 2 days later they moved us right away. We could see whales from our new lanai. The treats from the manager every 4 days or so was a nice touch: fruit, cheese, cookies. Our girls loved running around the resort grounds, especially the carp pool at the front and sitting in all of the chairs throughout the lobby. Highly recommend this resort for Maui -- Wailea was a great place to stay and this hotel was certainly the best bargain in Wailea.

HotelInfo.Name: Wailea Beach Marriott Resort & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 3700 Wailea Alanui Drive, Wailea, Maui, HI 96753
